Description: Made from 48% Tocai Friulano, 41% Ribolla Gialla and 11% Chardonnay, this is fresh and floral in tones of lemon rind, white flower and green apple. Fermented in both French oak and stainless steel, it is structured yet vibrant, gorgeously aromatic and remarkably long-lasting on the palate.
Name: Massican 2018 Annia White (Napa Valley)

Description: Gemina is 69% Pinot Grigio and 31% Greco, from two vineyards, one in St. Helena and the other in Santa Rosa. With the goal of showcasing both northern and southern Italian inspiration, it deals in fresh lemon peel, white flower and gravelly texture, while being well structured and enduringly fresh. This is a truly lovely, revelatory wine.
Name: Massican 2018 Gemina White (California)

Description: Hay flowers, a flinty whiff of reduction and fresh apple on the nose promise freshness. The concentrated palate honors this promise with lovely tart but ripe apple as well as ripe lemon framing delightful notes of stone fruit. Stony, earthy notions echo in the background, while tart apple takes center stage. The finish is dry, fresh and very appetizing.
Name: Wieninger 2018 Bisamberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Melted butter richness on the nose combines with purest notes of fresh apple and hints of dried orange peel. The same creamy intensity surrounds the palate, pervaded by intense green apple freshness. This is both rich and slender, unusual but beguiling with its dry, vivid finish.
Name: Gernot and Heike Heinrich 2017 Naked White White (Weinland Österreich)

Description: The beautiful aromatics of a freshly cut russet apple are pure and pristine on the nose. The palate is rounded with that juicy fruit but contoured with freshness. This is lovely, pure, juicy and moreish, with a lasting, appetizing finish.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2018 Gemischter Satz White (Niederösterreich)

Description: A touch of dried hay flowers and notions of ripe, red apple combine on the appetizing nose. The palate comes in with precise slenderness that highlights white apple and pear flesh and juiciness. There is something deeply zesty at the core that makes this utterly moreish and so fresh.
Name: Hajszan Neumann 2017 Ried Weisleiten White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Saffron and iron oxide hints on the nose have a notion of stone and orange peel. The palate comes with exquisite slenderness and stony, bright citrus, reminiscent of dried orange peel. A lovely phenolic web of tannins gives structure and fine poise, while the finish is resolutely dry and wonderfully fresh. A very elegant orange wine.
Name: Gernot and Heike Heinrich 2017 Graue Freyheit White (Weinland Österreich)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Floral aromas of tuberose and plumeria are crisp and not overbearing on the nose of this white blend, with additional hints of orange cream and lemongrass. The palate shows a prominent candied-honeydew flavor as well as lime peel and guava, all leveled by lively acid.
Name: Bushong 2018 Cold Roses White (Central Coast)

Description: Tight and mineral driven, this wine is full bodied and will be fruity as it develops further. For now, the texture is the thing, so wait a bit for flavors to ripen. Drink this André Lurton wine from 2020.
Name: Château Tour de Bonnet 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Fresh green apple, green pear and crushed yarrow on the nose promise vivid flavors. The palate obliges with slender, clean-cut freshness, assisted by some slight spritz and lots of yellow apple fruitiness. This is bright, easy, slender and entirely appetizing.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2018 Braitenpuechtorff Gemischter Satz White (Niederösterreich)

Description: Pineapple, grapefruit and floral aromas lead into juicy and mouthwatering flavors of tropical fruit on the palate. Brisk acidity and a citrus finish add to its elegant character.
Name: Nico Lazaridi 2016 Cavalieri White (Drama)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend offers notes of lees, fig, pineapple, flower, Mandarin orange and spice. Broad, textured-feeling flavors follow. Fig notes linger on the finish. Don't open until after 2022, and it has a future well beyond that.
Name: Buty 2017 66% Sémillon 18% Sauvignon 16% Muscadelle White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Made from a blend of Pinot Bianco, Pinot Grigio, Chardonnay, Kerner, Sauvignon and Müller Thurgau, this rounded, structured white offers aromas of white and yellow stone fruit, citrus and crushed stone. The full-bodied palate shows elegance and focus, delivering ripe apricot, creamy yellow apple and juicy grapefruit alongside crushed herbs and graphite.
Name: Cantina Produttori Cortaccia 2016 Amos White (Alto Adige)

Description: This is a steely, floral canned blend of Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay, the grapes from both Clarksburg and the Napa Valley. It refreshes and shows varietal complexity within a refreshingly bright, well-put-together package of green apple and grapefruit.
Name: Brick & Mortar 2018 Blanc White (California)

Description: A bright and fruity wine, this has a ripe character, with hints of yellow fruits as well as warm acidity. An attractive tangy character gives the wine lift. Drink now.
Name: Château Haut-Rian 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a balanced, fruity and fresh wine. All the elements are in place to give it a crisp character with plenty of bright white fruits. Drink this wine from Vignobles Ducourt now.
Name: Château La Rose du Pin 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Elderflower headiness on the nose suggests a good portion of aromatic varieties in this vivid, fresh and summery field blend. The palate is slender and carries its elderflower aromas all the way to the dry finish.
Name: Gebeshuber 2018 Querfeldein Gemischter Satz White (Thermenregion)

Description: Opulent kiwi and passionfruit aromas roll into mouthwatering flavors of citrus and honey in this intriguing pour. The wine offers ripe fruit with a zesty and savory backbone ending on a chalky finish.
Name: Lyrarakis 2017 White (Crete)

Description: Ripe apricot aromas set the warm character of this organic-vineyard wine. Spicy with a tangy texture and some herbal flavors, the wine is full in the mouth and ready to age. The estate belongs to members of the family that owns Hermès. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Château Fourcas Hosten 2018 Blanc de Fourcas Hosten  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: From the Dubourg family's home vineyard for more than 200 years, this blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Muscadelle is concentrated and densely textured. With a spicy bite as well as young green fruits, it needs time. Drink this ripe, full-bodied wine from 2020.
Name: Château Nicot 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This ripe, concentrated wine has a strong texture with a tangy, perfumed character. The bite of spice is a strong element in a wine that needs some aging. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Turcaud 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Pinot Gris makes up 65% of this wine, with the rest Gewürztraminer. The aromas announce themselves, with notes of ginger, mineral, white flowers, lychee and a whiff of smoke. Textured-feeling fruit flavors and light mesquite accents follow, with a warm finish. It captures the vintage exquisitely.
Name: Cor Cellars 2017 ALBA Pinot Gris-Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: What a gorgeous nose of creamy summer blossom. This is utterly appetizing in a light-footed, gentle way, suggesting all the ease of summer. Lightness in body and subtle aromatics are the chief virtues here on this quintessential summer wine. The finish is dry and fresh.
Name: Kohl 2018 Gemischter Satz White (Niederösterreich)

Description: A subtle nose gives only glimpses of ripe apple. The palate tells us much more. It speaks of tart apple freshness, lemony slenderness and a lovely, dry, refreshing finish. Lemon brightness echoes long.
Name: Martinshof 2018 Gemischter Satz White (Niederösterreich)

Description: This well-balanced wine with ripe citrus notes is immediately attractive. It offers tropical-fruit flavors plus a lemon-zest character that dominates. Drink now.
Designation: Domaine du Bourdieu Cuvée Sainte Anne
Name: Vignoble Boudon 2018 Domaine du Bourdieu Cuvée Sainte Anne  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: Made from 52% Pinot Noir and 48% Chardonnay the way the producer would ordinarily make a 100% Pinot Noir, this has a dark Gamay-like color, with tight carbonic structure and freshness. Cranberry, red apple and cherry mingle lightly across the palate without intrusion from oak or much tannin. Enjoy cold.
Name: Brick & Mortar 2018 Vin Rubis Pinot-Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Description: With a spicy nose that is followed through on the palate, this is a full-bodied, wood-aged wine. Nutmeg zing combines easily with the ripe yellow-fruit and lime flavors. Drink this still-developing wine from late 2019.
Name: Château Argadens 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This tangy, zesty wine is concentrated, with ripe citrus and apple flavors. The spicy edge and richness have blended well to give a wine that is full and ready to drink.
Name: Château de l'Aubrade 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Joël Duffau has produced a beautifully ripe wine in his final year of transferring the vineyard to certified organic. This 80/20 Sauvignon Blanc/Sémillon blend is rich but cut with freshness. Acidity also plays a role in this well-balanced wine, the apple and pineapple flavors right up front. Drink now.
Name: Château les Arromans 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Grapefruit and floral aromas are followed by flavors of mouthpuckering citrus zest, honey and tropical fruit. The wine has a linear quality but offers complexity of fruit mingled with the brisk acidity. Elegant and intriguing.
Name: Wine Art Estate 2017 Techni Alipias White (Drama)

Description: A light refreshing white wine, this is made by picking 52% Pinot Noir and 48% Chardonnay on the same day and then pressing and cofermenting them together. Structured and lightweight, it dazzles in tart high-toned acidity, adorned in flavors of fresh lemon, apple and melon with a flinty stony finish.
Name: Brick & Mortar 2018 Vin Clair Pinot-Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Description: Ripe apricot flavors characterize this full-bodied and warm wine. Weight and concentration show happily against just enough fresh acidity. This wine from Jean Meynard and Christelle Gauthier is ready to drink.
Name: Château Bois Malot 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Tangy lemon zest comes through strongly in this wine. Its acidity is reinforced by a mineral texture that adds complexity. This fifth-generation Fournier family wine has a full-bodied feel and is still young. Let it calm down a little and drink from late 2019.
Name: Château de Bonhoste 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Stéphane Defraine's full-bodied, ripe wine presents bold white-stone-fruit flavors that contrast with the layers of acidity and mineral texture. This rich wine should age, so drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Fontenille 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: A lightly toasty wine with a touch of wood aging, this still retains a strong herbal element. It is maturing well, with fruitiness in equilibrium with the wood. Drink now.
Name: Château Vermont 2017 Grande Cuvée  (Entre-deux-Mers Haut-Benauge)

Description: This is a rich wine, wood aged and spicy. Its concentration and ripe fruits are balanced by toastiness to give a wine that can age. Let the poised yellow fruits and acidity mature a few months more. Drink from late 2019.
Name: De Luze 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Delicate aromas evoking hay, apricot, tomato vine and citrus float above the glass. On the linear palate, tangy acidity lifts green melon, citrus and a hint of white almond.
Name: Markus Prackwieser 2017 Gump Hof Praelusis White (Alto Adige)

Description: This full, fruity wine has benefited from the warmth of the vintage. Soft apricot and crisper pineapple flavors abound as does attractive spiciness. Drink this wine now.
Name: VIgnobles Ducourt 2018 Le Blanc De Monsieur Ducourt  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Overt oak and waxy apple aromas introduce this barrel-fermented Viura-led blend. A full-bodied palate is resiny due to this having spent 18 months in barrel. Creamy woody flavors of melon and banana finish with minimal kick and acidity, so drink through 2021.
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2015 Óscar Tobía Blanco Reserva White (Rioja)

Description: With its intense fruitiness, this wine is ripe and full in the mouth. An attractive perfumed quality enhances the ripeness. Drink now.
Importer: New England Wine and Spirits Inc
Name: Caves de Rauzan 2018 Château Fontoy  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: A herbal wine, this is full of crisp ripe pear and apple flavors with concentration and definition. The wine is still a little young and will be better from late 2019.
Name: Château Haut-La-Péreyre 2018  Entre-deux-Mers Haut-Benauge

Description: Crisply herbal, this wine is tightly textured while also having layers of ripe fruit. With the texture in place, the wine can support the lemon and green-plum fruitiness. These elements are coming together and the wine will be better from late 2019.
Name: Château la France 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Subtle freshness that combines green apple, tart stone fruit and citrus on the nose promises freshness. The light and slender palate obliges but adds lovely Mirabelle plum to the citrus package. Slight spritz accentuates the inherent lightness and freshness.
Name: Neumeister 2018 Gemischter Satz White (Steiermark)

Description: This Claude Barthe wine is all about fruit and spice. The combination of the strongly mineral texture and the green and citrus fruit flavors gives a complex wine that should age. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Château Fondarzac 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Wood aging balances the ripe flavors of this wine, giving richness, plenty of spice and yellow-fruit flavors at the end. Drink now.
Name: Famille Rochet 2018 C'Est La Vie  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Ripe and concentrated, this wine presents a full structure of herbal character and tangy acidity. It is packed with citrus and green plums. Drink now.
Name: Château Roquefort 2018 Rives  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: This ripe wine is full of apple and pear flavors. Its crisper side offers a more lemon and tangy citrus character. These two elements are coming together in a balanced wine. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Château Vignol 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This wine has spice, ripe fruits and a warm character. Wood aging has filled it out, adding toast and clove flavors to the ripe white fruits. Drink this full-bodied wine now.
Name: VIgnobles Ducourt 2018 Ducourt Réserve de Famille  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vibrant aromas of lime zest, melon and freshly cut kiwi lead to plentiful, broad-feeling tropical fruit flavors. Pineapple notes linger on the finish. It gets a bit weighed down at times but still delivers plenty of enjoyment.
Name: Cadaretta 2018 SBS Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Crisp and clean, this wine is all about fruitiness. Its lemon and green-plum flavors are already delicious and refreshing, given a lift by the wine's tangy aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château d'Haurets 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Bright and with delicious fruit, this is an open, crisp wine. Its young fruitiness is ready to drink, with lively acidity and a fragrant aftertaste.
Name: Château La Rose Saint Germain 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a taut wine, filled with young, tangy textures and ripe white and yellow fruits. It needs to mature as it softens its intensity. Drink this Vignobles Baylet wine from 2020.
Name: Château Landereau 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: The Thema Assyrtiko/Sauvignon Blanc blend offers a combination of brisk focus and opulent expression. The fragrant aromas are driven by pineapple and banana as well as lemon rind, and flavors of sea salt, tropical fruit and citrus follow. A go-to food wine that bridges seasons and flavors.
Name: Ktima Pavlidis 2017 Thema White (Drama)

Description: This blend of Malvasia and Bombino opens with aromas of white spring flower, citrus and tropical fruit. The bright palate offers pear, juicy pineapple and white peach alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Tenuta di Pietra Porzia 2018 Saula Carta Nera  (Frascati)

Description: Aromas of lemon, tropical fruit and acacia flower emerge from the glass. The bright palate offers Bartlett pear, ginger and citrus alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Casata Mergè 2017 1960  (Frascati Superiore)

Description: This opens with aromas of acacia flower, tropical fruit and lemon. The lively, linear palate offers white peach, pineapple and a touch of ginger alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Casata Mergè 2017 Sesto 21 Riserva  (Frascati Superiore)

Description: Tangy and zesty, this is a ripe while also herbal wine. Strong Sauvignon Blanc flavors reveal a rich character balanced by intense acidity. Drink now.
Name: Château de l'Aubrade 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This herbal wine offers layers of fresh acidity and gooseberry flavors. The texture shows strong Sauvignon Blanc characteristics that give the wine distinctive minerality and cut-grass aromas. Drink now.
Name: Château des Antonins 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This herbal wine has ripe concentration as well as a touch of spice. Lemon and gooseberry flavors are tangy with pepper and a bite of acidity at the end. Drink now.
Name: Château Martinon 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This, tight, bright wine with good acidity and crisp lemon flavors has a light mineral element that adds texture. Its fruitiness is developing well but needs another few months. Drink this Despagne family wine from late 2019.
Name: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2018 Réserve  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: This full wine offers spice and warm yellow-fruit flavors. A creamy character emphasizes the toasty flavors. Give this wine a few months and drink from late 2019.
Name: Château Turcaud 2018 Cuvée Majeure  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Grapefruit and lemon aromas offer a fresh start to this friendly white from northern Greece. Lean lemon and grapefruit flavors and a touch of salinity keep the wine focused, but the overall character is accessible and fun.
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2018 Amethystos Blanc White (Drama)

Description: Full of crisp acidity, this wine has a full-bodied character that shows in the ripe gooseberry and greengage flavors. Its zesty texture underlines this fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2018 Légende  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This rounded, ripe wine moves the fruitiness in the direction of apricot and yellow-plum flavors. Reinforced by the warm acidity, the wine has a sunny character and is ready to drink.
Name: Château Ballan-Larquette 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a crisp, bright wine with plenty of acidity that contrasts with the green-apple flavors. The light texture and touch of minerality give a nervy edge to this buoyant wine. Drink now.
Name: Château Briot 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine's lively acidity is immediately attractive. The refreshing character brings out tangy apple and rhubarb fruitiness, finishing with great freshness. Drink this wine now.
Name: Château Lamothe 2018 Château Le Giron  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This crisp wine is bright, tangy and full of attractive lemon flavors. A riper side suggests red apples. Drink this balanced wine now.
Name: Château Lamothe de Haux 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This herbal wine has classic ripe Sauvignon characteristics. With good acidity that emphasizes the green and citrus-fruit flavors, the wine is poised, packed with freshness and ready to drink.
Name: Château Larroque 2018 88  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A ripe, softly textured wine, this comfortably combines spice and herbal flavors. The attractive fruitiness suggests lemon and gooseberry. Drink this wine from the Courselle sisters now.
Name: Château Thieuley 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A blend of Malvasia Puntinata, Greco and Bombino, this offers aromas of white spring flower, lemon zest and tropical fruit. The lively palate offers Granny Smith apple, grapefruit and yellow peach alongside bright acidity.
Name: Principe Pallavicini 2017 Poggio Verde  (Frascati Superiore)

Description: A simple, attractive, crisp and fruity wine, this is packed with baked-apple and pear flavors and the right acidity. Drink now.
Name: Cap Royal 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This herbal wine from the home of the André Lurton group is ripe with white-currant and sliced-apple flavors. It has the beginnings of a creamy character as it begins to mature. The style is full but with a good tang at the end. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Château Bonnet 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This soft wine is already attractive. Sliced apple and green-pear flavors give it a ripe character that doesn't lose sight of freshness. This bright wine is ready to drink now.
Name: Château de Ricaud 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Spicy with attractive clove accents, this is a ripe wine. Lemon and gooseberry acidity integrates into the tight texture and intense herbal character. A mineral edge suggests the wine will deepen in flavors over the next few months, so wait until late 2019.
Name: Cheval Quancard 2018 Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This wine is full of ripe apples, apricots and crisp citrus. It is concentrated, with a touch of pepper as well as good acidity. The wine's richness will allow it to age, so wait to drink until late 2019.
Name: Château Au Grand Paris 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: A tangy wine from a Despagne property with an illustrious history, this is packed with perfumed fruits that enhance the wine's fruitiness. The freshness is augmented by the tangy acidity and density that come through at the end. Drink now.
Name: Château Bel Air Perponcher 2018 Réserve  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: A rounded, smooth and spicy wine, this has a full-bodied character filled with tangy lemon zest and apricots happily in balance. This Boissonneau wine's ripeness gives a warm feel that reflects the vintage.
Name: Château de la Vieille Tour 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This fruity wine offers plenty of lemon-zest flavors enhanced by touches of ripe pineapple. It is ready to drink.
Name: Château Grand Jean 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: A touch of spice from wood aging gives extra richness to the creamed-apple flavors of this wine. Still developing it will be better from late 2019.
Name: Château Penin 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A ripe wine offering pineapple as well as apricot flavors, this is full bodied and rich. Its fruitiness is already delicious. Drink this wine now.
Name: Château Vermont 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Fruity with orange and lemon-peel flavors, this wine is already delicious. A more herbal element gives the wine texture as well as a full character. This ripe wine with a crisp edge is ready to drink now.
Name: Dourthe 2018 La Grande Cuvée Sauvignon Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A blend of Malvasia, Greco and Bombino, this opens with aromas of citrus, acacia flower and tropical fruit. The rather straightforward palate offers juicy pineapple and Golden Delicious apple alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Fontana Candida 2017 Luna Mater Riserva  (Frascati Superiore)

Description: Packed with fruit, this is a ripe and full-bodied wine. Its acidity is fully integrated into the richness, also balancing some herbal characteristics against generous yellow-fruit flavors. Drink now.
Name: Producta Vignobles 2018 Bordeaux Revolution  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Nutty and spicy, this wine is ripe and full bodied. Rich almond and apricot flavors are enhanced by the open texture that is rounded and soft at the end. Drink now.
Name: Château de la Rivière 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A simple, fruity wine with bright acidity and an herbal edge, this is attractive and refreshing to drink now. Tanginess adds interest to the fresh fruitiness.
Name: Château Grand Pascaud 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Ripe, perfumed and creamy, this wine has good acidity and a pure line in citrus and white fruits. It is open, fruity and ready to drink now.
Name: Château Haut Meyreau 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This smoothly textured wine is ripe and full of peppery white fruits, with apple flavors lightly cut with acidity. Drink this rich wine now.
Name: Château Malène 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This wine is crisp, fruity and intense with acidity. Its freshness is crispened by lemon, with a more mineral character that will drive the wine as it develops. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Château Pierrousselle 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This wine features aromas of green apple and coffee. Notes of almond blossom make their way through flavors of pink grapefruit, lemon and marzipan. A pervading sense of brightness lingers from first sip through the lively finish.
Name: Domaine du Castel 2017 La Vie Blanc du Castel White (Haut-Judeé)

Description: Crushed-almond aromas come from this ripe, creamy wine. Light on acidity and heavy on weight, this full-bodied wine needs a few more months. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Château du Claouset 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Bright, crisp and packed with fruit, this is a refreshing, simple wine. Its lively acidity has a fresh character that shows well against the apple flavors. Drink now.
Name: Château La Rame 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine is soft, with ripe white fruits that give it weight while keeping enough freshness. A touch of spice adds interest to the gentle fruitiness of this ready-to-drink wine.
Name: Château Recougne 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: With ripe white fruits that are lit by lemon acidity, this is a balanced, fresh wine. Its edge of minerality and smooth aftertaste make it immediately attractive. Drink now.
Name: Château Roquefort 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: With fruitiness right up front, this is an already attractive, refreshing wine. Crisply textured and also with a warm yellow-fruit character, the lightly spicy wine is well textured and ready to drink.
Name: Barrière Frères 2018 Grand Bateau  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A ripe wine with tropical-fruit flavors, this is bright with acidity, with a light touch of minerality. Its fruitiness and lemon-zest aftertaste are already attractive. Drink now.
Name: Caves de Rauzan 2018 Château Canteloudette  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: A taut, nervy wine with a strongly mineral texture, this offers a bite of pepper as well as crisp green fruits. Its acidity is still young, right up front. Wait to drink the wine from late 2019.
Name: Château Castenet 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: A smoothly textured wine, this is ripe with pear and green-plum flavors freshened by a lemon-zest and herbal edge. It is ready to drink.
Name: Château du Rival 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: A crisp, lemon-flavored wine, this is light and lively. Its freshness is reinforced by ripe grapefruit and acidity that creates a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château Grand Jean 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Toasty and ripe, this is a creamy-textured wine. With spice added to the generous fruitiness, the wine is warm and likely to age. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Château l' Oiseau 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This ripe wine from a small family vineyard has a warm feel to it, with rich apple and pear flavors. It offers some concentration as well, bringing a full-bodied feel as a contrast to the final acidity. Drink now.
Name: Château Le Bonalguet 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine's soft texture belies its ripeness as well as the fruitiness that will develop as it ages over the next few months. Its rich character is a product of the warm vintage and emphasizes apricot and yellow-plum flavors. Drink now.
Name: Château Roc Meynard 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Tense, tangy and still very young, this herbal wine offers plenty of ripe fruits. Its crisp texture is already attractive, but it needs some time, so wait until late 2019.
Name: Château Roques Mauriac 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This crisp, herbal wine is packed with gooseberry and grapefruit flavors. It is bright in style but offers concentration as well. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Château Sainte-Marie 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Attractively herbal, this is a perfumed, light and poised wine. Acidity gives a crisp edge that contrasts with the ripe apple flavors. Drink now.
Name: Château le Grand Verdus 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Fresh, crisp and fruity, this tangy wine offers lemon-zest and herbal flavors. Its texture shows a nervy character that gives it a lift. Drink the wine now although it will be better from late 2019.
Name: Château Roc de Minvielle 2018 Cuvée Les Tourelles  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Pear, pineapple and citrus give this summer white a great start. On the palate, flavors of citrus, pineapple and spice are balanced and refreshing. A patio wine with finesse.
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2017 Amethystos Blanc White (Drama)

Description: This is an attractive, fragrant wine, with white-flower perfumes and crisp acidity that gives a bright character. It has a light feel, making it attractive to drink now.
Name: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2018 Léo By Léo  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A bouquet of apples and spice sets the stage for flavors of lemon-lime, grapefruit and guava. This pale-straw-colored wine is bright in the mouth and offers a refreshing, citrus-filled finish.
Name: Recanati 2018 Yasmin White Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Description: Mild white-fruit aromas are clean, common and positive. A plump melony palate is in balance, while this Malvasia-Viura blend tastes of friendly melon across a round finish. If ever a wine was good to very good without making waves, this is it.
Name: Alonso López 2018 Malvasia-Viura (Rioja)

Description: This wine is fruity, with crisp apple and spice flavors that are lit by acidity. A taut, nervy edge keeps it on its toes but will calm a little as it matures. Drink now or wait until late 2019.
Name: Château des Arras 2018 Cuvée Gaïa  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This floral wine has an attractively perfumed character. Its freshness complements ripe apple flavors that are touched by spice. The wine is balanced and ready to drink.
Name: Château du Juge 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: With its bright herbal character and richness, this wine has a tangy character. It is full of ripe fruit that gives the wine generosity as well as a warm feel at the end. Drink now.
Name: Château Du Payre 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: An herbal wine, this is full, with a tangy character and concentrated green and citrus-fruit flavors. Its current edginess needs to calm down and the wine will be better from late 2019.
Name: Château la Freynelle 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Aromas of white spring flower and tropical fruit lead the nose. The straightforward palate offers notes of lemon zest and green pear together with fresh acidity.
Name: Tenuta di Pietra Porzia 2018 Saula Carta Bianca  (Frascati)

Description: Packed with fruitiness, this crisp wine is full of lemon and spice flavors. Its acidity is still right up front and the wine could do with a little more time to soften. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Vignobles Boissonneau 2018 Château Moulin de Ferrand  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: This crisp, fruity wine has a light herbal touch that contrasts with the attractive apple and lemon flavors. It offers a bright tang at the end. Drink now.
Name: Château la Verrière 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine is all about attractive, crisp fruit. Bright acidity and lemon flavors give it both ripeness and a fresh aftertaste. This lively wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château Montet 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Almond flavors balance with the ripe fruitiness of this wine. With its spice and buttery character, it is full bodied and generous. Drink now.
Name: Château Pertignas 2018 Cuvée Priolet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Up-front fruitiness makes this an attractive wine. Apple and lime flavors give the wine a ripe feel while acidity provides the necessary balance. Drink now.
Name: Château Suau 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine is all about bright fruits, crisp texture and balanced acidity. Delicious and refreshing it is ready to drink.
Name: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Balanced wood aging and ripe fruit give a full wine packed with yellow fruits and with just a touch of toastiness. Drink now.
Name: Château de L'Hoste Blanc 2017  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Lemon-zest and grapefruit flavors shoot through this intensely fruity wine. They also give the wine a texture that needs to soften. This wine will be best from late 2019.
Name: Château Haut Bessac 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This wine has a spicy side, offering touches of caraway seed and pepper. Its tangy character and herbal flavors need to soften a little. Wait to drink until late 2019.
Name: Château Marjosse 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Crisp fruits show strongly in this JM Cazes Sélection wine. With plenty of acidity, a mineral edge and zesty character, the wine is cool, full of fruit and ready to drink.
Name: Michel Lynch 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals citrus and saline. The aromas carry over to the simple palate along with a hint of bitter almond and a whisper of raw apricot.
Name: Principe Pallavicini 2018 Secco  (Frascati)

Description: A lively, bright wine with good minerality, this is crisp and packed with fruit. Its texture adds pepper and minerality to the mix. Drink now.
Name: Château de Bon Ami 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This is a juicy wine with ripe yellow fruits as well as plenty of acidity. Its freshness is balanced by ripe fruitiness, giving a wine that will be best with food.
Name: Château La Mothe du Barry 2018 Cuvée French Kiss  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: Lightly perfumed, this wine has fragrant white fruits that give it a floral character. With its fruitiness comes a tangy character that brings out more Sauvignon Blanc flavors. Drink the wine now.
Name: Château Reynier 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Packed with fruit, this is a ripe wine. Sliced apple flavors are lifted by the acidity of the wine while keeping the richness. It is ready to drink.
Name: Château Tour de Goupin 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Melon and lemon-lime aromas are clean and regular, while this feels lemony but with enough texture to support that racy style. Lime and persimmon flavors are steady on a balanced but basic finish.
Name: Navardia 2018 Organic Wine White (Rioja)

Description: This wine is taut and textured with crisp white-fruit flavors. The lemon acidity and bright character lift the wine and leave a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château de Marsan 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This strongly herbal wine is ripe, full in the mouth with intense tangy acidity. Its weight and concentration are considerable. Drink this perfumed wine now.
Name: Château Haut Mouleyre 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This Despagne family wine is fresh, packed with delicious lemon flavors and hints of a creamy texture. It is ready to drink.
Name: Château Rauzan Despagne 2018 Réserve  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: Crisp and herbal, this is a tight wine. The acidity and tangy texture are right up front, highlighted by green-fruit flavors. This wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château Toutigeac 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Ripe pineapple and yellow-fruit flavors give this wine a warm, full character. A touch of spice adds a soupçon of extra flavor to this pure, fruity wine's aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Les Vins de Lisenne 2018 Le Blanc de Lisennes  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: This blend of Malvasia Puntinata and Trebbiano has subdued aromas suggesting white flower and tropical fruit. On the simple, lean palate, you'll find yellow peach and pineapple.
Name: Casata Mergè 2017 Venere White (Lazio)

Description: A strongly herbal wine, this is full of grapefruit and gooseberry flavors. With its tight acidity and mineral edge, the wine is definitely on the crisp, cool side. Drink now.
Name: Château de Seguin 2018 Sauvignon de Seguin  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This herbal wine from the André Lurton group has a strong gooseberry character that comes from Sauvignon Blanc. Its minerality needs a few months to soften. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Château Guibon 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: A strongly herbal wine, this has a taut texture and considerable acidity. Its freshness is all there, surrounded by the tangy texture. Drink now.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2018 Intense  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Full bodied but with an attractive line of acidity, this is a ripe wine. The tangy texture underlines the green fruit and herbal flavors that give the wine density. Drink now.
Name: Château Pierrail 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This smooth, rounded wine from the André Lurton group is ready to drink. The spice and light texture are gentle, hinting at herbal flavors with a tangy, lemon aftertaste.
Name: Château Goumin 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: A nutmeg aroma confirms the spicy character of this wine. To contrast, green-fruit flavors add freshness. Drink this softly textured wine now.
Name: Château Mayne Vieil 2018 Buisson-Redon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This soft, full-bodied wine has ripe white-fruit flavors. It feels fat, more on the side of white fruits with a creamy texture. Drink now.
Name: Château de Castelneau 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This ripe, fruity wine offers pineapple and yellow-fruit flavors that are lifted by acidity, bringing freshness at the end. Drink now.
Name: Château La Croix de Queynac 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This soft wine has a ripe feel. Smooth texture and apple and pear flavors are gentle, with a rounded character that emphasizes the wine's openness. Drink now.
Name: Château La Gabarre 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This soft, open wine is gently fruity. Its acidity is fully integrated into the apple and lemon flavors. This attractive wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château Lauduc 2018 Classic  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This wine's yellow-fruit flavors emphasize its fat character and touch of oxidation. It is a rich wine, bringing out full-bodied fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Château Mondésir-Gazin 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A crisp and tangy wine from Vignobles Claude Barthe, this is bright with acidity. The lively character is balanced by a touch of citrus that brightens everything. Drink the wine now.
Name: Château Darzac 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This attractively fresh wine has bright acidity that complements the herbal flavors. The texture is soft, with a light zesty tang at the end. Drink now.
Name: Château Les Combes 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: There is a real tang to this attractive wine. Crisp and clean, its citrus flavors chime with the bright acidity and gooseberry freshness. Drink the wine now.
Name: Château les Pasquets 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine is bright, fruity and crisply textured. With tangy acidity, a touch of spice and peppered pear flavors, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château Bellevue 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This opens with subdued aromas evoking spring flower and citrus. The extremely simple, lean palate offers Bartlett pear and a hint of lemon zest alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Bellini 2018  Frascati

Description: This wine is light, spicy and has a gentle texture. It is soft and open, ready to drink now.
Name: Château de Parenchère 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Softly textured and fruity, this is a simple, bright wine. Its lemon character has a ripe feel, emphasized by the gently spicy aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château Guichot 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine has a bouquet of grapefruit and jasmine. Flavors of yellow cherry, grapefruit and bitter almond meld on the palate, dissipating into an orange blossom finish.
Name: Or Haganuz 2018 Amuka Blanc Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Galilee)

Description: This spicy wine conveys a almond and nutmeg perfume that adds to the yeasty character. It is softly textured and ready to drink.
Name: Château Moulin de Vignolle 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine has obviously been wood aged, and the wood is too much—even after nearly two years it still smothers the fruit.
Name: Château Ferran Saint Pierre 2017 Tradition  (Entre-deux-Mers Haut-Benauge)

Description: Although slightly oxidative, this wine also has ripe yellow fruits that are full as well as lightly yeasty. Drink the wine now.
Name: Château Ferran Saint Pierre 2018 Tradition  (Entre-deux-Mers Haut-Benauge)

Description: This wine has a nose of apples and crème brûlée. It is a tiny bit stiff at first sip, but the mouthfeel softens as flavors of slightly underripe pear, Granny Smith apple and white chocolate appear on the palate. There is a mild note of almond blossom on the finish.
Name: Segal's 2018 Fusion Dry White Wine Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc (Galilee)

Description: Aromas of hay, burnt grass and gritty white fruits are not great, while this feels chunky and oily on the palate. Salty melon and citrus flavors are basic and bland, while this feels yeasty and full on the finish.
Name: Trillón 2018 Vendimia Seleccionada White (Rioja)

Description: This ripe wine offers gentle green-fruit flavors and a simple fruitiness. It misses out on a crisper side with its fat aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château Pilet 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This earthy, yeasty wine full of herbal flavors is hard work. It could soften but the herbal character is probably too intense.
Name: Château de Beauregard-Ducourt 2018  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This yeasty, fat wine has nutmeg and yellow-fruit flavors. It seems a little oxidized and, with high alcohol, hot.
Name: Château Maison Noble 2018 Cuvée Maurice  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Terpenes and petrol control the nose on this gritty smelling Viura-led blend. A flat linear palate and yeasty white-fruit flavors are oxidized on a flatlining finish.
Name: Bodegas Paniza 2017 Campil Blanco Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)

Description: Enticing scents recalling white rose, citrus and wild herb aromas swirl around in the glass. It's savory and loaded with finesse, delivering creamy white stone fruit, juicy grapefruit, apricot and mineral. Delicious.
Name: Monte del Frà 2017 Cà del Magro  (Custoza Superiore)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This unique Santa Barbara-Paso Robles blend of the Solomon Hill and Parrish Family vineyards makes for a compelling sip, with aromas of guava bubblegum, jasmine and wisteria on the nose. The palate is crisp with guava skin and plumeria candy flavors, cut by an underlying acidity.
Name: Benom 2018 Contrast Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

Description: Slight reductive smokiness on the nose of this wine leads onto a light, still slightly spritzy palate that presents green pear, ripe lemon and grapefruit zestiness. The wine is dry, bright, slightly textured and utterly refreshing, with a moreish, lemony finish.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2017 Zind White (Alsace)

Description: Gentle notes of ripe Conference pear are pure on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with slender freshness and juicy pear flavors, edged by freshness and a pleasantly grippy phenolic touch. The finish is dry and lip-smacking.
Name: Frey-Sohler 2017 Rittersberg White (Alsace)

Description: Like previous vintages, this remains roughly half and half Riesling and Gewürztraminer, with small amounts of Muscat and other grapes. What's unique is the smorgasbord of AVAs, including grapes from Columbia Gorge, Elkton, Rogue Valley, Illinois Valley and Willamette Valley. Fleshy and nicely textured, floral orange aromas lead into a saline wine with a mix of cucumber, apple and green melon flavors.
Name: Ovum 2018 Big Salt White (Oregon)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This blend of Muscat and Chardonnay is a feast for the senses. Jasmine, honey and lychee practically explode from the glass before the palate gives lightly sweet and superconcentrated honey, marmalade and apricot flavors. This should be a fantastic picnic wine, and great to pair with mild cheeses and dried meats for an appetizer course.
Name: Wise Villa 2017 Midnight Delight White (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Smooth, fruity and buttery, this full-bodied wine is mouthfilling in texture and generous in flavor. Vanilla, pear and butter aromas carry over to the flavors, adding nuances of almond and hazelnut along with lots of lush fruit.
Name: Blindfold 2017 White (California)

Description: Savory and fresh, this fragrant white offers alluring scents of citrus, spring blossom, yellow stone fruit and wild herb. It's tangy and delicious, doling out ripe apricot, tangerine zest and a ginger note before an almond finish.
Name: Albino Piona 2018  Custoza

Description: Heady aromas of yellow wildflower, spring blossom and yellow stone fruit almost leap out of the glass. Tangy and savory, the round palate shows flavors of tart apple, lemon zest and honeydew alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Fontanafredda 2018 del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)

Appellation: Elkton Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This easy-drinking, vividly fresh white wine is a blend of 39% Gewürztraminer and smaller portions of Riesling, Pinot Gris and Sauvignon Blanc. Flavors of lemon drop, sweet pineapple and orange peel keep it lively and interesting. It's an all-purpose summer white that's a nice break from the usual suspects.
Name: Brandborg 2017 Coastal Cuvée White (Elkton Oregon)

Description: Enticing scents of Spanish broom, yellow orchard fruit and beeswax waft out of the glass on this elegant savory white. Made with organically grown Cortese grapes using certified biodynamic agricultural methods, the fresh tangy palate offers juicy yellow peach, honeydew melon and a hint of tangerine drop while wild herb and honeyed mineral notes signal the close.
Name: La Raia 2016 Vigna della Madonnina  (Gavi)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This blend of white Rhône grape varieties combines crisp appley acidity and a buttery vanillin first impression along with fruit flavors that are bone dry and a bit austere. With more sipping, a fine sense of nervy balance emerges and the good times begin to roll.
Name: Le Casque 2018 Calotte White (Sierra Foothills)

Description: A blend of 90% Turbiana and 10% other white grapes, this evokes aromas of toasted almond, citrus and a vegetal note. On the rounded palate, tangy acidity lifts ripe apricot, peach pit and orange rind.
Name: Pratello 2017 Il Rivale  (Lugana)

Description: This charming and refreshing wine is all crispness and verve, from the grassy, citrus aromas to the vivid lemony flavors and vibrant acidity. It's light bodied and refreshing, posing a great pairing with seafood or fresh cheeses.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2018 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Clarksburg)

Description: Aromas of pressed chamomile, chestnut honey, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of vanilla slowly appear in the glass along with a resin note. The rather lean, mature palate offers dried apricot, lemon drop and a hint of coffee before a roasted almond finish. Unusual and intriguing, it has definite complexity and would be best to accompany an entire meal as opposed to an apéritif.
Name: Monte del Frà 2015 Bonoma Sexaginta  (Custoza Superiore)

Description: Powdery aromas of melon and scented candle are about as easy as one could ask for. In the mouth, this blend of Treixadura, Albariño and Godello is full, creamy and tastes of melony white fruits. A fleshy finish shows only moderate acidity, thus this should be enjoyed right away.
Name: Viña Costeira 2018 Colección 68 Treixadura-Albariño-Godello White (Ribeiro)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound aromas of peach, guava, pineapple and a touch of honey butter show on the nose of this blend of 50% Roussanne, 17% Viognier, 17% Grenache Blanc, 8% Sauvignon Blanc and 8% Riesling. It tightens up further on the palate, where guava and pineapple flavors linger behind a slightly creamy texture.
Name: Kaena 2017 Hapa Blanc White (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Fruity aromas of yellow peach and citrus lift out of the glass along with a hint of wild herb. Reflecting the nose, the vibrant savory palate offers apricot and grapefruit alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Monte del Frà 2018  Custoza

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Big in flavors and body, this wine leads with vivid floral aromas and then brings peach skin, apricot and tart apple to the palate. It is medium bodied, dry and has a tangy refreshing balance.
Name: Andis 2018 Painted Fields Cuvée Blanc White (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Fruity in aroma, but bone dry and bracing on the palate, this medium-bodied wine is pleasing for its austerity. Apricot and orange-zest aromas meet lemon and grapefruit flavors on a lively, very crisp texture.
Name: Kivelstadt Cellars 2018 Mother of Invention Bonfiglio White (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pineapple custard and hazelnut aromas show on the nose of this rich white blend. It's very expressive on the palate with creamy texture and flavors of cashew cream, peach butter and caramel.
Name: McClain Cellars 2016 Poetic Vine White (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Simple aromas of apple and generic white fruits lead to a chunky palate with just enough vitality and acidity. Fleshy apple and peach flavors are modest in front of a short finish that lacks punch. Drink now.
Designation: Alma de Vino Mar y Montaña
Name: Montebaco 2017 Alma de Vino Mar y Montaña White (Ribeiro)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a blend of Viognier (50%), Chardonnay (20%), Sauvignon Blanc (20%) and Pinot Grigio, and it shows the best of each. The aromas intrigue, displaying notes of melon, lime, apricot and lemon balm. Rounded, fruit-filled flavors follow.
Name: Genoa 2017 Springline White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is quite yellow in the glass, likely already showing some age, and starts with aromas of nectarine, yellow apples and sandalwood. The blend of 50% Roussanne, 17% Viognier, 17% Sauvignon Blanc, 8% Grenache Blanc and 8% Riesling shows lemongrass, richer peach and more exotic flavors on the palate.
Name: Kaena 2016 Hapa Blanc White (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Made with organically grown grapes, this fragrant white has aromas of honeysuckle and tropical fruit. The fresh savory palate doles out ripe yellow pear, green melon and pineapple while tangy acidity gives it a crisp close.
Name: Gorgo 2018  Custoza

Description: Piercing tropical-fruit aromas are centered on pineapple. This white blend is what the Ribeiro region does best, and this is a full, melony wine made to drink now. Melon, papaya and apple flavors finish short due modest acidity.
Name: Pazo de Toubes 2018 Modus Vivendi Treixadura-Albariño-Loireira White (Ribeiro)

Description: This wine is flowery on the nose. A wide palate is lacking in acidic cut, while this tastes of melon and apple prior to a mild finish.
Name: Viña Costeira 2018 White (Ribeiro)

Description: Sherry-style aromas are spot on and would have you thinking you're in Andalucia, but no, this is a Rueda Verdejo-Palomino blend made in the solera style but without fortification. Malty and nutty on the nose and in flavors, this is grabby and finishes long and mellow. If it's lacking in anything, it's core acidity that allows a wine to sizzle but also sing.
Name: Cuatro Rayas NV 61 Dorado White (Rueda)

Description: White spring flower, white stone-fruit and citrus aromas lead the way. Mirroring the nose, the rounded palate offers white peach, apple and a hint of grapefruit. It's fresh, with tangy acidity.
Name: Delibori 2018  Custoza

Description: Generic white-fruit aromas are clean in front of a citrusy palate, with some body to it. Briny citrus and stone-fruit flavors are, as you might expect, mild, short and fresh on the finish. This is 85% Viura and 15% Tempranillo Blanco.
Name: Carlos Serres 2018 White (Rioja)

Description: This is a barrel-fermented Viura and thus the nose smells distinctly woody and resiny. Cleansing acidity lends clarity to an otherwise resiny palate, while this tastes of raw oak grain, white pepper and white peach prior to an oaky finish.
Name: Luis Cañas 2017 White (Rioja)

Description: Beeswax, yellow spring flower, hazelnut and citrus-rind aromas lead the way. The rounded palate offers dried pineapple and mature yellow apple before a bitter almond close.
Name: Menegotti 2016 Elianto  (Custoza Superiore)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light, with notes of lemon pith, candlewax and wet herb. Just off-dry, medium-bodied fruit flavors follow. It's not entirely harmonious.
Name: Maryhill 2017 Winemaker's White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This sweet dessert-style white wine has an aroma of honeydew melons and fresh herbs followed by a pillowy texture and relatively subdued but fruity flavors like peach and melon. It is soft in acidity.
Name: Boeger 2017 Blue Stocking Rebelde White (El Dorado)

Description: Aromas of green apple and banana carry over the bright refreshing palate. It's simple but well made.
Name: Giovanna Tantini 2018  Custoza

Description: Butter and bread dough aromas are followed by light butter, earth and subdued apple flavors in this medium-bodied wine.
Name: Anarchist Wine Co. 2017 The Anarchist White (Clarksburg)

Description: This has an unusual nose suggesting brimstone and hazelnut. The aromas carry over to the extremely simple but rather bitter palate along with a hint of peach pit.
Name: Menegotti 2018  Custoza

Description: Briny citrus aromas are a bit sweaty and pyrazinic. This 50–50 blend of Verdejo and Viura is plump, with modest citrusy zest to the palate. Green melon and carrot flavors finish without much drive or pop.
Name: Palma Real 2018 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: Aromas of apple cider and flavors of tart apples and honey form an unusual profile in this dry and medium-bodied wine that has no added sulfites. It has a nutty maderized character that's unorthodox in a traditional wine, but those who value the organic ethos may not see that as a fault.
Name: Frey NV Organic Agriculturist Blanc White (California)

Description: Tropical-fruit aromas lead this light-bodied blend of Viura and Sauvignon Blanc. It is lean in feel, with lime-like acidity. Tropical-fruit flavors finish mild and easy.
Name: Marqués del Turia 2018 Viura-Sauvignon Blanc (Valencia)

Description: A yellow color and aromas of prosciutto and melon set up a chunky palate that's more or less shapeless. Dull, bitter flavors of stale melon don't improve on the finish.
Name: Serca 2017 Single Vineyard Corte Blanc White (Uco Valley)

Description: This particular combination of creamy greenery and bright ripe Amalfi lemon is subtle but all the more enticing for that. The light fresh palate takes that theme and plays it to its delicious, creamy, green, fresh conclusion. This is light and subtle, with killer instinct.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2018 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Yeast, stone, earth, pear peel and lemon make for an intriguing nose. The palate is concentrated and firm with zesty freshness but it also comes with an aromatic hay flower vibe. It is lovely, complex, individual and fresh.
Name: Wieninger 2018 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Cream, lemon, yeast and greengage play on the fresh nose. The palate is light and dry and reprises the yeastiness with lovely texture but adds rounder riper pear fruit. Despite the lightness, this is layered and textured. You simply want more.
Name: Zull 2018 NeuLand White (Niederösterreich)

Description: Tender notes of ripe russet pear are subtle on the nose. The palate adds vivid bright zesty citrus as well as a yeasty texture. The dry finish has something of a bite into a fresh green apple—wonderful and lip-smacking.
Name: Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2018 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Gentle russet pear notes on the nose attain juicy precision on the palate. A yeasty savor adds spice around the edges while the palate stays vividly fresh and linear. The finish is dry, zesty and moreish.
Name: Zuschmann-Schöffmann 2018 Gemischter Satz Tradition Martinsdorf White (Niederösterreich)

Description: Aromas of grilled corn, haystack and dried apricot are far from fruity and peppy, and while this is a bit heavy on the palate, it finds its groove amid honeyed flavors of stone fruit and pineapple. By the time this finishes, mango and pineapple flavors are in full bloom. Drink now.
Name: Alta Alella 2016 Blanc de Neu Organic White (Alella)

Description: Both elderflower and the heady freshness of rhubarb tease the nose. The palate continues with this aromatic tease in the lightest, most weightless fashion but adds lovely texture and more roundness. Full flavored, but light, dry, refreshing and very moreish, this packs tons of oomph.
Name: Erich & Walter Polz 2018 Steirischer Spiegel White (Steiermark)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This refreshing and nicely balanced wine offers crisp apple aromas, light apple and citrus flavors and medium body. While relatively low in alcohol, the wine gains breadth and depth with each sip and reveals more complexity and richness in the glass.
Name: Las Positas 2017 Estate Verdigris White (Livermore Valley)

Description: At first, this is shy and reserved on the nose, with faint scents of white melon, lemon pith, honeysuckle and orange blossom. The palate offers a bit more expression, with ginger-orange tea, fresh hay and melon rind flavors that are braced up by tart, orange-laced acidity that invigorates the palate and carries through to the close. Best after 2021.
Name: Alheit 2017 Cartology Bush Vines White (Western Cape)

Description: Sold in three-pack of 250-ml cans, the wines for this new project are sourced by vintner Ron Penner-Ash from a variety of West Coast vineyards. The blend is half Pinot Gris and one-quarter each Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay, and it works very well. A juicy Asian pear flavor is enlivened by supporting acidity, and the freshness is impressive.
Name: Free Public NV White (America)

Description: A golden color and oily aromas of honey, walnut, lightly oxidized citrus and wood grain announce this chunky but sturdy Catalonian white blend. Oak is the lead flavor, backed by butter and roast pumpkin and/or squash. A warm, full finish closes out this barrel-aged number. Drink now.
Name: Alta Alella 2017 Lanius White (Alella)

Description: A seductive floral lift on the nose suggests honeysuckle but also reveals zesty citrus. The palate comes in with wonderful lightness, ease and almost weightless flavor. This dry and aromatic white blend is ideally paired with bright sunshine.
Name: Dürnberg 2018 Falko White (Niederösterreich)

Description: Hints of fern, greenery and citrus promise freshness on the nose. The light palate majors on bright lemon edged with a juicy, light, dry earthiness that welcomes food. It's ideal for the picnic basket.
Name: Schiefer & Domaines Kilger 2017 Globetrotter White (Weinland Österreich)

Description: Iced Granny Smith apple and citrus promise vigorous freshness. The light dry palate delivers with oodles of citrus and brightness. This is a wonderfully light, refreshing summer wine. Drink soon.
Name: Tinhof 2018 Blanc White (Burgenland)

Description: A very subtle nose places enticingly ripe yellow plum amidst bright citrus. The palate stays on the citrus theme with zesty freshness and a zingy dry finish. A slight midpalate texture makes the flavors stick. Lovely.
Name: Fuhrgassl-Huber 2018 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: This blend of 72% Riesling and 28% Petit Manseng is bursting with character. The nose offers chamomile, pineapple, lemon curd and wet stone. Racy acidity mixes with a creamy feel on the palate, yielding a lush and vibrant mouthfeel. The flavors echo the aromas and meld beautifully on the flinty finish.
Name: Lightwell Survey 2016 Hinterman White (Shenandoah Valley)

Description: High-toned and floral, this blend is bright and focused in acidity. It has an underlying intensity of tension and Sauvignon Blanc-like grapefruit pith at its core.
Name: Thirty-Seven 2017 Tolay Blanc White (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Faint aromas of lemon peel, white flowers and a stony mineral tone show on the nose. With time in the glass, apple aromas emerge. Bright and zippy acidity bolsters flavors of freshly sliced lemon, ripe Granny Smith apple and a crushed mineral tone. Grapefruit peel and white peach are light on the finish, matched with a chalky tone and final hit of spiced apple.
Name: Bel Lago 2017 Pinot Grigio-Chardonnay (Leelanau Peninsula)

Description: Combining equal parts Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc, this steely wine is aromatic in honeysuckle with strong flavors of pineapple and fig. It finishes without fanfare steeped in grass and herb.
Name: Ca' Momi 2017 Marley Rainbow Country White (Napa Valley)

Description: A touch of elderflower mingles with lime and lemon on the nose. The palate continues this fresh, spring-like theme and delivers a delicately scented, dry and refreshing summer wine. Drink soon.
Name: Hannes Sabathi 2018 MeinSatz White (Steiermark)

Description: This unusual blend of Riesling and Grüner has a very lactic nose, reminiscent of lemon yogurt. The palate adds vivid green-apple notes, creating a textured, light, and dry white.
Name: Arndorfer 2018 Vorgeschmack White (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tangy tangerine and yellow-grapefruit aromas meet with lemon blossom and wet clay on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very sweet and syrupy with honey and lemon-cake flavors.
Name: Sanan Redmond 2017 Sacred Nectar Late Harvest White (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This wine is a global blend, with Chardonnay and Viognier from Long Island, NY and Macabeu and Vermentino from the Languedoc in France. Spiced apple and lime zest notes offer some freshness on the nose, yet the palate is more broad and flabby in feel, with flavors of smashed apple, pear and melon.
Name: Maiden + Liberty NV French-American Blend White (Global)

Description: Punchy, sweaty aromas hint at passion fruit. In the mouth, this blend of 70% Sauvignon Blanc and 30% Semillon is racy but lean and simple. A core green flavor is pushed by pyrazines, while this tastes grassy and like green bell pepper on the finish.
Name: Calcu 2018 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Colchagua Valley)

Description: The honey and apricot notes of Jurançon are always balanced by intense acidity that brings freshness. This wine has these characters in abundance, ripe, sweet yet not in the slightest cloying. Drink the wine now.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2012 Clos Canacillaü Le Dernier Carré  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This estate, an oasis of calm, is one of the handful of vineyards situated within the urban sprawl of Bordeaux city. This wine exhibits the freshness of the vintage, with bright green and citrus fruits allied to a creamy, lightly toasty character. Already a delicious wine, it will be even better from 2021
Name: Château Picque Caillou 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Wood aging enhances the ripe apricot and apple flavors. A taut texture underlines the youth of the wine, which is going to age well. At the end the herbal element from the Sauvignon Blanc shines strongly. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2017 Cuvée Caroline  (Graves)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Principally Pinot Gris, the rest of this blended white is a mix of Pinot Blanc and Gewürztraminer, all fermented in stainless except one glass carboy. It's quite dry and has a lush, leesy mouthfeel, with loads of skin flavors more than fruit. The refreshing minerality, overall balance and exceptional length all place this in a category beyond most traditional Oregon Pinot Gris.
Name: Proteus 2015 Sirens White (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Never mind the slightly hazy appearance, this presumably unfiltered wine is big on body and flavors, bursting with apricot, orange blossom and honey, while a rich, almost thick texture and honeyed finish complete the experience.
Name: Sol Rouge 2016 White (Lake County)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: Two of the finest white grapes in southwest France come easily together in this honeyed wine. It is sweet with touches of orange marmalade, but it is also fresh with intense acidity to keep the wine lively and bright. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Berthoumieu 2017 Constance Moelleux  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is a blend of Gewürztraminer and Pinot Gris, with splashes of Riesling and Muscat. It's a lovely mix of aromatic tree fruits, both stone and citrus. Ripe, full and fleshy, it carries enough crisp acidity to keep the finish lively, adding notes of melon and mint as it fades.
Name: King Estate 2017 Four Nobles Cuvée Blanc White (Willamette Valley)

Description: This rich blend of Gros and Petit Manseng with some Petit Courbu was fermented and aged in wood, creating a delicious, smooth character. Flavors are just on the right side of toasty, filled with succulent grapefruit and ripe peach flavors. Give the wine a little longer and drink from 2020.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2016 Grande Cuvée Cirque Nord  (Saint-Mont)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is half Viognier, with the rest Roussanne (40%) and Riesling. The aromas pop, with notes of ripe peach, flower, orange rind and jasmine. A lovely sense of balance carries through the finish.
Name: Brian Carter 2017 Oriana White (Yakima Valley)

Description: Still young, this ripe but herbal wine is intense, hinting at wood aging while also showing strong minerality. Spice and the beginnings of yellow-fruit flavors are promising. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Roche-Lalande 2017 Les Hauts de Martillac  (Pessac-Léognan)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: It's always exciting to see what winemakers do with Sémillon, which remains uncommon in this part of the world. This bottling blends it 50-50 with its traditional partner, Sauvignon Blanc to produce aromas of lemon skins, apple rinds and earthy, hot sandstone. There is a slight oily and waxy character to the palate, where flavors of light almond and lemon skin arise.
Name: Velvet Bee 2017 Queen Bee Blanc White (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Located in Preignac, the closest of the Sauternes vineyards to the Garonne river, this estate produced a light style of Sauternes, with a good balance between acidity and rich orange-marmalade flavors. The botrytis is restrained, allowing room for a more citrus acidity to come through. Drink this young wine from 2022.
Name: Château Laribotte 2016  Sauternes

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: Ripe creamed apples and spice from wood aging combine in this rich wine. Fresh-squeezed lemon and acidity add lift to this generous wine that could do with another few months. Drink ideally from late 2019.
Name: Domaine Berthoumieu 2015 Pierre de Grès  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Description: This wine is unique: blended at a tasting chaired by journalists and sommeliers. It is wood aged, supremely rich and packed with yellow fruits and ripe acidity. Powerful and concentrated it has a touch of tangy freshness at the end. Drink from 2021.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2017 Le Faîte  (Saint-Mont)

Description: This deep-gold wine looks rich and ripe right off the bat, and the nose parallels that impression with slightly oxidized notes of toasted nuts, gingered orange peel, melon rind, spiced pear, grilled apple and pineapple upside-down cake. The mouthfeel is full and yet nicely textured, with a light tannic texture and subtle pithy bitterness that lends depth to the otherwise rich and ripe impression.
Name: Gérard Bertrand 2016 Cigalus White (Aude Hauterive)

Appellation: Côtes de Bordeaux Saint-Macaire, Bordeaux, France
Description: Perfumed, lightly toasty and ripe, this wine balances white-fruit flavors with spice and ripe acidity. The wine is still young, needs to age and will be ready from 2020.
Name: Château de Lagarde 2016 Cuvée Prestige  (Côtes de Bordeaux Saint-Macaire)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Floral aromas and vibrant ripe fruit components give this wine a lot of flavor impact. It is nicely rounded in texture but light in terms of alcohol while also balanced by good acidity.
Name: Holly's Hill 2017 Patriarche Blanc White (El Dorado)

Description: Pale straw in color, this opens with medium-intense aromas of yellow melon, apple and spiced pear. The palate is light in feel and bright in acidity, boasting citrus-dominant flavors alongside touches of white peach and currant. It's well balanced and refreshing, closing with a touch of fresh white flowers.
Name: Château de Lastours 2017 Arnaud de Berre White (Corbières)

Description: B.J. Fazeli gives a nod to his Persian roots with the semisweet but extremely fresh and vibrant bottling of 67% Muscat Canelli and 33% Viognier. Clean aromas of lemon peel, pear and orange blossom lead into a crisp palate that's tense and refreshing with ripe citrus and white-flower flavors.
Name: Fazeli Cellars 2017 Norooz White (Temecula)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: This white wine comes from the same area as red Madiran. Blending the two Mansengs, Petit and Gros, with Petit Courbu, the wine has an almost honeyed character, with yellow-fruit flavors that are cut with citrus acidity. Drink this attractive, full wine now.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2017 Vignobles Marie Maria Novel  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A soft blend that includes Gros Manseng to add apricot and perfumed character, this is light, bright wine. Its fresh acidity and crisp citrus fruits are ready to drink.
Name: Domaine d'Arton 2017 Les Hauts d'Arton White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This bright, lively wine blends perfumed Viognier with rich Chardonnay. Its ripe fruits and light structure combine with a tangy, mineral edge. Drink the wine now.
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2015 Clos Triguedina Viognier-Chardonnay (Comté Tolosan)

Description: With some rich botrytis flavors, this wine also conveys ripe, orange marmalade and lemons. It is still evolving and bringing out its reserves of floral honey. Drink this wine from 2021.
Name: Château Bélingard 2016 Réserve  (Monbazillac)

Description: This proprietary white blends together 44% Sauvignon Blanc, 42% Chardonnay and 14% Malvasia. Pungent in floral jasmine and woody cedar, it's robustly lush and full bodied.
Name: Flora Springs 2017 Soliloquy White (Napa Valley)

Description: Lightly touched with wood, this limited-edition wine offers cinnamon and nutmeg flavors while also keeping plenty of fruitiness. Quince and pear mingle with the acidity and spice. Drink the wine now.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2017 Mouton Cadet Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Citrus and herbal characteristics give this fruity wine a good texture that is enhanced by minerality. Crisp, tangy and bright with acidity, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2017 Mouton Cadet Réserve  (Graves)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a combination of orange rind, orange blossom and a touch of petrol on the nose of this blend. There is decent tension to the sip, where fairly rich and tropical leaning flavors of papaya and chilled melon soup are cut by lime pith.
Name: Skyline Wines 2016 Artisan White (Central Coast)

Description: An herbal blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon with some Muscadelle, this is a lightly toasted wine. Lemon and peppered pear flavors are fragrant, intensely crisp and freshened by mint. The wine will be ready from late 2019.
Name: Château Bélingard 2018 White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: This estate, owned by the same family since 1789, has made an attractive, openly fruity wine. With the Muscadelle in the blend, it is lightly perfumed and instantly refreshing. Drink now.
Name: Château la Freynelle 2018 Sauvignon-Sémillon-Muscadelle  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: This appellation, covering the same area as Madiran, produces dry and sweet wines, which are increasingly sweet as grapes dry from October through December. This blend brings out the combination of honey and intense acidity that is typical. A sweet wine that is deliciously fresh, it will make a great aperitif. Drink now.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2016 Vignobles Marie Maria Lutz  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Description: The freshness of Gros Manseng, with its lightly honeyed character, sings in this attractive, fruity wine. Its crisp character is enhanced by touches of sliced green apple and made warmer by apricot flavors. Drink now.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2017 Héritage  (Saint-Mont)

Description: A soft, lightly herbal wine with gooseberry and grapefruit flavors this is fruity and tangy. Refreshing and light, it is ready to drink.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2017 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Mainly Sauvignon Blanc but with a touch of Sémillon and Muscadelle to add spice and perfume, this herbal wine is bright with acidity and green apple and lemon flavors.
Name: Vignobles Despagne 2018 Eclat de Sauvignon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Half-and half Savignon Blanc and Sémillon, this wine has a crisp, citrus and yellow-fruit character. Tangy grapefruit and floral flavors are attractive and come with a mineral aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château Carignan 2018 L'Orangerie de Carignan  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a gentle wine blending Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc. The crisp edge already gives an attractive freshness to the soft texture of the wine. An herbal touch comes through in the aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château Léon 2018  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This wine is the original Colombelle, a typical blend from Gascony. Its fresh, herbal character is lifted by the lemon-juice acidity and hints of white peach. Drink this wine now.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2018 Colombelle Colombard-Sauvignon Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon, this wine is crisp, light and bright with acidity, with a fresh lift at the end. It is ready to drink.
Name: Château de Lagarde 2018 Les Hauts de Lagarde  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Vin Santo di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with dried Malvasia and Trebbiano grapes, this meditation wine offers aromas of chestnut honey, caramel and nutmeg. The spicy, balanced palate offers candied tangerine, dried fig and toasted almond alongside fresh acidity and a lingering finish.
Name: Avignonesi 2002  Vin Santo di Montepulciano

Description: Dominated by Sémillon, this rich, luscious wine has layers of ripe fruit and intense concentration. Wood aging has sustained the richness of the wine and not overshadowed the ripe honey, candied peel and hints of almonds. The wine will age for many years. Drink from 2025.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2016  Sauternes

Description: The sumptuous top wine from this estate, this is produced in tiny quantities. It is gorgeously ripe, with dried fruits, crystallized orange and supersmooth honey. Botrytis gives the dry edge to the wine that will let it age for so much time. Drink from 2025.
Name: Château Lapinesse 2016 Grand Vin  (Sauternes)

Description: This dense wine is full of rich honeyed flavors cut with acidity. Orange marmalade balances the dry botrytis while keeping plenty of room for freshness. It is a generous wine with great potential. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2016  Sauternes

Description: This fragrant wine is ripe with hazelnut and peach flavors. Crisply textured, the wine is balanced, taut, mineral and still young. Its tightness suggests the aging potential while also hinting at the wine's inherent fruitiness. Drink from 2020.
Name: Bouvet-Ladubay 2016 Saphir Brut Vintage  (Saumur)

Description: This is a mutt of a wine, and that's meant in the best possible sense. From New Zealand's Godfather of Biodynamics, James Millton, this Chardonnay-Viognier-Marsanne blend is a gold-hued cacophony of terroirs-driven goodness. The floral, honeyed, tropical and citrus notes sit beside something wilder and more herbal and mineral. The palate is rich and textured, but it's sliced through with crackling acidity, tangy fruit and a long, salty mineral finish. A wine that forces us to focus less on varietal and more on place.
Name: Millton 2017 Crazy By Nature Cosmo White (Gisborne)

Description: From the start, this oak-aged white blend is smooth and nicely knitted together, with peach, vanilla and tropical fruit aromas sticking out. A full-bodied palate is balanced by citrusy acidity, while this tastes explicitly of green apple and oak, with buttery notes rising up on the finish. Drink this elevated acid-driven mix of Chardonnay, Malvasia and Viura through 2025.
Name: Casa La Rad 2015 White (Rioja)

Description: Packed with ripe, honeyed Sémillon, this wine has richness while also keeping plenty of freshness. Acidity and a crisp edge are balanced with the intense orange marmalade and spice flavors that will make this wine develop well. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Rieussec 2016 Carmes de Rieussec  (Sauternes)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a vibrant, dry wine that combines crisp green-apple, fennel bulb and citrus flavors on a lively structure of good acidity and medium body. Blended from Arneis and Friulano grapes, it holds back just a bit on ripeness, which makes it appetizing and easy to keep sipping.
Name: Campovida 2017 Tavolo Bianco White (Mendocino County)

Description: Made according to the principles of biodynamic viticulture, this unfiltered blend of Chardonnay and Viognier has aromas of toast, bread crust, citrus rind and mature apricot.
