On the savory full-bodied palate, a saline note underscores juicy grapefruit, espresso and a hint of butterscotch. It's unusual and intriguing and would work well with an entire meal as opposed to an apéritif.
Name: Fattoria La Vialla 2017 Barricato White (Toscana)

Description: Hard-pounding woody aromas are dominant and border on chemical. This blend of Viura and Malvasia feels racy, with unavoidable oaky richness to the palate. Spicy oak-based flavors include lemon, orange and clove, while a smoky character steers a long-lasting finish. This was aged 28 months in oak, so strong barrel influences are out front. Drink through 2028.
Name: Valserrano 2013 Gran Reserva White (Rioja)

Description: This is a rich wine, lightly oak aged while keeping extreme freshness. A toasty edge suggests the bottle age as well as a touch of minerality. This perfumed wine will be ready to drink for late 2019.
Name: Bouvet-Ladubay 2015 Trésor Brut  (Saumur)

Description: The top dessert wine from this estate is luscious and ripe. Dense botrytis flavors are matched by intense acidity and spice, giving a wine with richness and an aromatic, lightly wooded aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Dauphiné Rondillon 2016 Cuvée d'Or  (Loupiac)

Description: Made with organically and sustainably cultivated Trebbiano and Vermentino, this deeply colored, earthy white wine is made with no added sulfites. It offers aromas of pressed wild flower, scorched earth, black olive, dried peach and Mediterranean scrub while the dry tangy palate delivers ripe apricot, orange rind, star anise and a salty mineral note. It's unusual and incredibly intriguing.
Name: Salcheto 2017 Obvius White (Toscana)

Description: Lightness, freshness and a richly honeyed botrytis are hallmarks of this wine. Floral and balanced, it is already attractive, giving both swathes of candied-fruit flavors and intense acidity. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château La Rame 2016  Saint-Croix-du-Mont

Description: A blend of Viognier and Chardonnay, this opens with delicate aromas of white flower and yellow stone fruit. Vinified and aged in oak for added complexity, the round elegant palate offers yellow apple, dried apricot and a salty note on the finish.
Name: Caiarossa 2016 Bianco White (Toscana)

Description: Toast, coffee, acacia and yellow stone-fruit aromas appear in the glass. The palate offers butterscotch, lemon zest and golden apple alongside tangy acidity while a salty note shows its Mediterranean origins.
Name: Fattoria Le Pupille 2017 Poggio Argentato White (Toscana)

Description: Made with Viognier and Chardonnay, this deeply hued white offers aromas of toast, mature yellow stone fruit and a balsamic whiff of eucalyptus. The smooth concentrated palate reflects the nose, offering ripe yellow apple, espresso, vanilla and a hint of butterscotch. A hint of saline lifts the rich flavors.
Name: La Regola 2015 Lauro White (Costa Toscana)

Description: Riesling and Muscat make up the majority of the wine. The aromas pop, with notes of ripe peach, flower and tangerine. Just off-dry stone fruit flavors follow, with lemon pith notes on the finish. It brings a pleasing sense of fruit intensity—a guaranteed crowd-pleaser.
Name: Huston 2017 Chicken Dinner White (Washington)

Description: This blend of 70% Vermentino and 30% Sauvignon offers aromas of acacia flower, yellow peach and apricot that carry over to the fresh juicy palate along with an almond note.
Name: Michele Satta 2017 Costa di Giulia White (Toscana)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: This is an atypical but bold and ultimately successful blend of 90% Chardonnay and 10% Albarino from San Diego. It's light in the glass and shows aromas of lemon peel, lime balm and butterscotch on the nose. The palate's rich, nearly sweet pome-fruit flavors are cut by key-lime-peel tension and a tense chalkiness.
Name: Hungry Hawk 2017 Chardorino White (San Diego County)

Description: Vineyards that back onto the walled town of Cadillac give a wine that is liquorous, packed with honey and yellow fruits. The unctuous texture is just balanced by the hints of acidity and orange peel. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Haut-Mouleyre 2017  Cadillac

Description: The second wine of Clos Haut-Peyraguey, this is light, perfumed and packed with fruit. It has a delicious honey and orange-peel character, with an attractive light step from the acidity and crisp aftertaste. Drink this wine from 2022.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2016 Symphonie de Haut-Peyraguey  (Sauternes)

Description: From one of the small appellations that face Sauternes across the Gironde river, this wine with 90% Sémillon has a freshness that lifts the ripe, honeyed character. Smoothly textured, the wine is almost ready to drink. Just wait until 2020.
Name: Château du Cros 2016  Loupiac

Description: More yellow in color, with just the faintest sensation of copper inflection, this opens with a light and fruity nose that offers notes of white apple flesh, melon and just a touch of white strawberry hull. With time, notes of peach and guava develop, and unfold with more intensity on the smooth, medium-weight palate alongside flavors of white currant and cherry. Medium acidity offers nice vibrancy and lift through the close.
Name: Longridge 2017 The Emily Chardonnay-Pinot Noir White (Western Cape)

Description: These two grapes make a balanced blend. The Chardonnay gives weight and a smooth texture, while the Arinto gives a crisp freshness. The wine has yellow fruit flavors as well as plenty of citrus. It is ready to drink.
Name: Sanguinhal 2016 White (Lisboa)

Description: Honeyed ripeness on the nose is offset by aromas of beeswax and carrot. A firm palate is braced by sharp acidity, while this tastes briny and dry, with bitterness, haystack notes and nectarine flavors. A balanced finish with punchy acidity tastes stalky and salty.
Name: CVNE 2015 Monopole Clásico White (Rioja)

Description: This wine is already attractive with honey and touches of dry botrytis. It is perfumed, with a floral character that gives it a lift. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2016 Nectar d'Or  (Sauternes)

Description: This poised, perfumed wine has plenty of acidity and a light, bright texture. Enjoy it as an aperitif but wait to drink until 2022.
Name: Château Lafleur Mallet 2016  Sauternes

Description: Made with 70% Trebbiano and 30% Malvasia that are vinified in amphora, this has subdued, unusual aromas of pressed Spanish broom, marzipan, brimstone and candied orange zest. The aromas carry on to the lean light-bodied palate along with yellow-apple skin, bitter almond and a mineral note.
Name: Il Peraccio 2017 Diva White (Toscana)

Description: The nose is quite shy but eventually reveals whiffs of orchard fruit and white spring flower. The light-bodied, rather diluted palate isn't very expressive, offering suggestions of peach and citrus before a slightly bitter finish.
Name: Il Palagio 2017 Bianco White (Toscana)

Description: This wine is a blend of Misket, Chardonnay, Viognier and Muscat Ottonel and has aromas of peach, apple, honeysuckle and chamomile. On the palate there are flavors of chamomile tea, apple juice and white peach nectar before the soft floral finish.
Name: Bulgariana 2017 White (Thracian Valley)

Description: Prickly aromas feature green scents of pine needle and celery. A citrusy palate offers flavors that follow the nose, mostly bell pepper and grass. Cactus pad flavors stick out on a pyrazinic finish.
Designation: Gran Reserva La Isla Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Viognier
Name: Estampa 2018 Gran Reserva La Isla Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Viognier White (Marchigue)

Description: 96–98. Barrel Sample. This well-rounded wine offers flavors of ripe yellow fruit, apple and pear, with bright acidity to balance. The texture, concentration and intensity linger on the finish. The wine will age well.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2018 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: This luscious wine from old-vine Sauvignon Blanc is filled out even further by the 30% Sémillon in the blend. It is rich in feel and intense in a white fruit flavor, with touches of spice from the wood aging. It is fresh and textured on the finish. Drink from 2024.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. This wine's ripeness is intense, just hinting at an impressive future. The dry core of botrytis balances the honey and the spice, along with fresh lemon curd. This is likely to be a very fine wine.
Name: Château Coutet 2018 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. Great concentration and power are the epitome of Sauternes, and this hits the nail on the head. The fresher side of the wine, with its crisp lemon zest, balances a dense superrich botrytis tone.
Name: Château de Fargues 2018 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. This wine has opulence and concentration, with crisp flavors of ripe yellow fruits. There is so much going on in this impressive wine. It has benefited from the hot summer, yielding a ripe wine that still manages to remain crisp and tight on the finish.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2018 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. This wine is full of ripe lemon and yellow fruits. A hint of wood aging gives great texture along with bits of spice and pepper. The wine is ripe, packed with fruit while also being firmly structured.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2018 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Beautifully wood aged, with subtle hints of spice, this is an elegant, textured wine, ripe with white fruit tones and layered with intense, fresh acidity. Its bright highlights are tempered by warm fruitiness and by the mineral texture that promises aging. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This concentrated wine is intense in botrytis and shows potential for aging. All this richness is balanced by a fresh streak and lemon zest acidity at the end.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2018 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Acidity shoots through the botrytis tone, giving freshness that lifts the dry, intense core of the wine. Showing good balance already, it will obviously age well.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2018 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. The wine is textured and tight, hinting at steeliness and showing a salty character that contrasts with the lemon flavor. These tones are joined by tropical elements, giving a ripe, fruity finish.
Name: Château Olivier 2018 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Low yields have given this wine great concentration. It has intense herbal and lemon flavors, as well as a tangy texture that will encourage this wine to age well. Its acidity and freshness are balanced by the texture to give it density and intensity on the finish.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2018 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Tautly textured, this wine has minerality and a good structure that complements the rich fruits. It is balanced, rich while fresh, structured while packed with fruits. The wine will age well, so wait until 2023.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This estate, owned by the Kressmann family, is particularly known for its white. Lightly wood aged, this wine is already delicious, boasting great citrus and white fruits, and sure to be delicious. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Plenty of ripe botrytis with a dry core is surrounded by flavors of sweet honey, ripe apricot and a touch of orange marmalade. The acidity keeps it fresh and vibrant.
Name: Château Rieussec 2018 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Densely structured, the wine has layers of botrytis that are concentrated and powerful. It is opulent, although to balance that, there is a light touch of freshness and a crisp final texture.
Name: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2018 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: Full of ripe fruit, this structured wine shows full-bodied citrus, melon and apple flavors along with intense acidity. A strong mineral streak balances the herbal Sauvignon Blanc and more creamy Sémillon. The wine needs to age. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Always a classic, this wine shows great potential for aging. It has a steely edge to the ripe white fruits and zesty acidity which adds intensity.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2018 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This is a perfumed wine, ripe with fragrant yellow fruits that are sliced with lemony acidity. It is a stylish, intense wine, while at the same time strongly textured and therefore sure to age well.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2018 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Low yields from a late harvest in Sauternes have produced a wine with an orange marmalade flavor, lined with citrus acidity and a core of rich botrytis. Made from 100% Sémillon, there is great acidic lift in this intensely rich wine.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2018 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Bright with acidity while at the same time having considerable honey and botrytis flavors, this is a rich wine. Its concentration is lifted by the freshness that brings in a lime marmalade flavor. The wine will age well.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2018 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: A perennial favorite at a screaming good price, this combines 40% Muscadelle, 38% Colombard, 21% Sémillon and 1% Palomino from various sites across the county. The Sémillon is newly from Rossi Ranch. Floral and candied in honey and lemon peel, it's exotic, grippy and focused in a tension of acidity.
Name: Carlisle 2016 The Derivative White (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A fascinatingly cofermented white wine, this blend of Chardonnay, Roussanne and Viognier by Matthias Pippig shows exuberant aromas of white peach essence, daffodil, lemon verbena and spring herbs on the nose. The palate is both oily and racy, with dried-peach and lemon-juice flavors that lead into a butterscotch touch on the finish.
Name: Sanguis 2015 See Through White (Central Coast)

Description: While herbal flavors are present, this wine is more about lush yellow fruits layered with wood and spice. The texture is generous and full-bodied, giving the wine spaciousness as well as a crisp texture. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Fully ripe with herbal flavors and a crisp texture, this wine shows the richness that come out of whites in the Médoc. It has a salty edge along with some minerality that gives this rich wine its texture. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Margaux 2016 Pavillon Blanc du Château Margaux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a ripe style of wine, rich with white fruits as well as having a more herbal character. Spice from wood aging shows lightly, contrasting with the generous fruitiness and mineral texture. Drink the wine from 2023.
Name: Château Olivier 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. The wine already has a delicious side that is both refreshing and tangy. Its tight texture is bright, shining with herbs and crisp fruitiness. It exudes freshness on the finish.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2018 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. There is a light herbal touch to this wine that comes from the Sauvignon Blanc. However, it also has concentration and weight, offering a texture that brings freshness to balance the ripe fruits. The wine will age well.
Name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2018 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This classic wine shows a concentrated botrytis tone balanced by orange zest and ripe honeyed flavors. Its fruitiness has great lift from acidity and offers a fresh aftertaste.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2018 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This wine is all about the lemon and apple fruit, with fresh acidity to maintain balance. That is not to say it does not also have texture, structure and a taut edge, all set for aging.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2018 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Lightly herbal, this is a crisp and bright wine. The strong structural element will allow the wine to age, with a textured character and perfumed acidity at the end. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Structured and textured, this wine has both crisp herbal fruits and a tight character that's enhanced by a hint of wood aging. A ripe apple flavor gives weight and extra dimension to the wine.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2018 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Lightly wood-aged, the wine is fragrant, fresh and fruity. It also has a light herbal character, along with great, tangy acidity. A wine to age.
Name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2018 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine has a texture that moves away from crispness to a more generous, rounded character. It offers a tangy edge that contrasts the ripe apple and pear flavors. The wood aging, still underway, is a subtle hint in the background.
Name: Château Picque Caillou 2018 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: A spicy, toasty aroma sets the scene for this wine that shows considerable wood-aging flavors. These tones give richness on the palate, while the white fruit flavor and intense acidity offer promise for future enjoyment. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a bright line of lime skin and grass on the nose of this blend of 74% Sauvignon Blanc and 26% Sémillon, but the latter grape makes its presence known with more unctuous aromas of dried apple, pineapple, daffodil and nuts on the nose. The palate shows good grip and a wide array on flavors, from apple blossom to Key lime, with flashes of tropical fruit.
Name: Lexington 2016 Alma Gist Ranch Estate White (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Botrytis is an important element in this wine. It gives dryness and also sustains the ripe fruits and lemon peel flavors. At the same time, the wine has great poise and freshness.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2018 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: This wine is is rich in oak tones that are accompanied by tangy citrus and minerality. The richness and the structure will allow this wine to age further, certainly for the medium term. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine has weight and opulence to contrast with the considerable acidity and lemon flavor. It is taut, nervy and shows considerable aging potential.
Name: Château Haut-Bergey 2018 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: A genre-bucking Santa Barbara County blend of 53% Sauvignon Blanc from McGinley Vineyard and 47% Chenin Blanc from Jurassic Park Vineyard, this bottling shows crisp green pear, bright sliced lime and ripe kiwi on the nose, but with a chalky edge. This palate offers pomelo pith, cucumber, lime and green-fleshed fruits.
Name: Monochrome 2017 Neither Here Nor There White (California)

Description: A buttery ripeness of pear fruit dominates the nose and promises generosity. The palate immediately captures this and cuts it with vivid freshness that gives tone to this powerful wine. It offers texture, body and concentration. Fresh and lovely, it will benefit from bottle age and make a great accompaniment to richer dishes. Drink now–2029.
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2017 Clos du Val d'Éléon White (Alsace)

Description: Dominated by Sémillon, this is a rich, creamy wine. Produced by the heirs of the late Denis Dubourdieu, who was the top Bordeaux exponent of white wines, the wine has the crisp texture as well as the ripe character that was his hallmark. Showing touches of wood, plenty of citrus and creamed apples the wine will be ready to drink from late 2019.
Name: Clos Floridène 2017  Graves

Description: Unusually for the appellation, this Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine holds a touch of Sauvignon Gris. That gives a charming, perfumed character to the crisp acidity and citrus flavors. The wine is developing quickly and easily, so drink from 2021.
Name: Château Couhins 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Pure Sauvignon Blanc, this is a crisp, herbal wine. Its acidity, green fruits and taut texture have created a wine that is fresh, packed with fruit and likely to age relatively quickly. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Couhins-Lurton 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: The latest vintage of this wine is showing a good amount of delicacy and freshness. The nose offers dainty aromas of grapefruit, passionfruit, lime blossom and a touch of grass. The palate is light in weight, with a chalky, grainy texture from the use of French oak. It closes on a mouthwatering orange rind and lime note.
Name: Clairault 2017 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: Oak and more oak is the greeting on this not so subtle barrel-fermented white Rioja. A full palate is lively under a resiny surface, with kicking acidity. A peppery spice flavor tops apple and stone fruit notes, while this is long, toasty, creamy and intense on the finish. Drink through 2030.
Designation: Alma Tobía Blanco Fermentado en Barrica
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2016 Alma Tobía Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)

Description: This wine displays lifted notes of honeyed red apples, limes, lemons and florals on the nose and the palate. Some barrel fermentation and lees contact broadens out the palate, with everything wrapping up on a juicy, limey zing. Drink now.
Name: Voyager Estate 2017 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: This is a second white for both Haut-Brion and La Mission Haut-Brion. With a high proportion of Sauvignon Blanc, the wine is fresh, lightly herbal and already fruity. Crisp citrus flavors are bright and attractive. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2016 La Clarté de Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Hints of sun-warmed stone and dried yarrow make for an intriguing nose. The palate has lots of earthy texture and a defining phenolic edge as well as a core of freshness. This unusual wine is more about texture than about fruit, but freshness and concentration are there. It's a wine for the table. The finish is dry and moreish.
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2017 Frauenberg White (Alsace)

Description: Creamy, with almost tropical flavors, this wine is also fresh with some gooseberry and herbal edges. The combination makes for a bright wine that also has weight and a touch of toastiness. Drink now.
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2016 Aile d'Argent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A hint of vanilla plays on the nose. The palate also benefits from that softer mellowness, with notions of fresh but ripe pears combining with nutty, rich overtones. There is a lot of warmth on the dry finish.
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2017 L'Aplomb White (Alsace)

Description: Waxy lemon, wet wool, apple blossoms, grass and dried herbs form on the nose. The medium-bodied palate offers a chalky texture, with a lemony zing that leads to a herbal and mineral finish. This is a food friendly wine that would be tasty with goat cheese.
Name: Cape Mentelle 2017 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: This wine evokes an earthy richness on the nose that brims with ripe, aromatic russet pear. The palate is rounded, with an underlying texture. It finishes dry and long, with wonderful warmth. The oak-aged blend holds Pinot Gris, Pinot Blanc and Auxerrois.
Name: Domaine Loew 2016 Pinot White (Alsace)

Description: A lemon-zest-inflected aroma rises from the glass and adds notions of mandarin. The palate keeps this ripe but tart citrus theme alive and presents ripeness and refreshing fruit. These notions continue all the way to the dry finish.
Name: Meyer-Fonné 2017 Gentil White (Alsace)

Description: This blend of 52% Chardonnay and 48% Chenin Blanc comes from two vineyards in Santa Barbara County, and shows aromas of yellow pear, lemon blossom and gardenia. There is a nice taut quality to the palate, where ripe peach flavors and a hint of oak arise.
Name: Monochrome 2017 Altered Images White (California)

Description: This attractive crisp wine with touches of wood aging is bright and fruity. The herbal character from Sauvignon Blanc in the blend is supplemented by a creamier yellow-fruit character from Sémillon. Drink this wine from 2020.
Name: Château Pont Saint-Martin 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Intense notes of ripe, juicy pear on the nose promise generosity. The palate duly delivers and presents that juicy pear balanced by vivid lemon freshness. Apple, apricot and lime also make an appearance. This wine is lively, light and dry but full of energy.
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2017 Grains de Génie White (Alsace)

Description: A touch of rose petal enhances ripe and aromatic peach notes. The palate majors on freshness but lets the subtly floral and peachy notes endure. They don't get center stage but inform the slender, textured dry and light palate nonetheless. It's an intriguing and successful combination.
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2017 L'Eclat White (Alsace)

Description: A subtle nose presents hints of lemon while the palate is fresh and light. This wine is taut, bright and almost bouncy with lemon zestiness. It's easy but very refreshing.
Name: Hugel 2017 Gentil White (Alsace)

Description: Juicy, ripe pear notes are evoked on the nose. The palate is slender but toned, showing some concentration and more pear helped along by zesty, lemony freshness. It's a light-bodied wine with a dry finish.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2017 Special White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Spicy grape and honeysuckle notes give this wine an aromatic bouquet. The light-bodied palate presents balanced freshness. It ends dry and with a sense of ease.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2017 One White (Alsace)

Description: With 30% Sauvignon Gris in the blend, this is a beautifully perfumed wine. Offering good acidity, it is full of citrus, tangy lemon peel and plenty of freshness. Touches of toast give it a final touch of spice.
Name: Château Monbousquet 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This vintage is dominated by Sauvignon Blanc, which makes up 81% of the blend. The nose starts with gentle wisps of pear, grapefruit, lemon-lime, flowers and touches of snow pea and grass. The palate then offers prickly acidity and slippery texture, finishing juicy and citrusy with a herbal lilt.
Name: Leeuwin Estate 2017 Siblings Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: This fruity blend dominated by Sauvignon Blanc also has some creamy Sémillon for richness. The wine is crisp and almost ready to drink. A fresh character lifts the fruitiness, adding a bright aftertaste. Drink from summer 2019.
Name: Château les Clauzots 2017  Graves

Description: Vivid lemon on the nose, along with some lemon-balm headiness, promises refreshment. The light and taut palate does just that, evoking freshly cut lemon with all its brightness but softens the acidic impact. The finish is dry. It's a perfect party wine.
Name: Domaine G. Metz 2017 Harmony White (Alsace)

Description: A shy nose gives nothing away. However the palate presents ripe, juicy red apple, with an interplay of freshness and fruit. The light body has a buttery, rounded edge, just cut by that apple freshness. It finishes dry.
Name: Domaine Pfister 2017 Cuvée 8 White (Alsace)

Description: A light color and pleasant but simple floral and white fruit aromas open this tangy Rioja that hums along with high-toned citrus flavors and snappy acidity. Grapefruit, orange and grape skin flavors take their time on a racy finish.
Name: Muga 2017 White (Rioja)

Description: Hints of tropical fruits give this wine richness as well as a contrast to the herbal edge of the Sauvignon Blanc. It is certainly tangy, mineral with a crisp, tight aftertaste. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Château Cos d'Estournel 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Lightly wood aged, this wine has perfumed acidity and a mineral texture that cuts through the white-fruit flavors. Hints of quince and orange peel balance with the acidity to give a wine that is both ripe and fresh. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Roche-Lalande 2017  Pessac-Léognan

Description: The name means “stony place” and the result is this lightly wood-aged, perfumed wine that's now delicious, crisp and full of fruitiness. Muscadelle in the blend gives a fragrance enhanced by the bright acidity and tang of young Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc. Drink this wine from summer 2019.
Name: La Peyrière 2017  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Damask rose and honeysuckle dominate the nose with their heady perfume. The off-dry palate adds juicy peach that enhances the floral, full fruitedness even more. This mellow wine is off dry and calls out for stinky, ripe washed-rind cheeses.
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2017 L'Arabesque White (Alsace)

Description: A touch of flinty reduction precedes citrus hints on the nose. The palate, is dry, fresh and full of ease, with just a hint of lemon and pear.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2017 Crustacés White (Alsace)

Description: Hints of green pear appear on the nose and remain on the light, easy palate. There is freshness and brightness on the slender body. It's refreshing and dry.
Name: Wolfberger 2017 Edelzwicker White (Alsace)

Description: The nose combines creamy, buttery hints with almost tropical fruit that suggests mango or pineapple. The palate tones this down, bringing a forthright note of freshness to a wine that has both mellowness and drive. The finish is dry and easy.
Name: Josmeyer NV Alsace Dream White (Alsace)

Description: With exposure to air the shy nose displays hints of lemon zest. The palate has body, freshness and an almost mellow core. This combination of Riesling and Pinot Gris works well, rounding out Riesling's inherent freshness with the body and texture of Pinot Gris. The finish is dry and fruity.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2017 Black Tie White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: This blend of 60% Greco and 40% Malvasia offers a mix of lemon and fennel frond on the nose. It's pithy and textural on the palate yet balanced by juicy acidity, with yellow apple and citrus flavors that give this a pleasing brightness.
Name: Botromagno 2017 White (Gravina)

Description: Subdued notes of ripe pear suggest mellowness. The palate adds fitting, bright freshness and provides a very balanced, if subdued picture. This immensely versatile wine has a dry, fresh finish.
Name: Willm 2017 Gentil Réserve White (Alsace)

Description: An intensely perfumed wine, this is rich and full bodied. Tropical fruits, ripe mango and apricot flavors are cut with acidity and a taut mineral edge. This wine will be best when the fruit is less intense, so wait until 2020.
Name: Château Valandraud 2016 Virginie de Valandraud  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A fresh bouquet of honeydew and geranium prepares the palate for flavors of lemon, pink grapefruit and jasmine. This wine is soft on the palate and winds up with a clean bright finish.
Name: Recanati 2017 Yasmin White (Galilee)

Description: The nose gives little away. The palate also plays a neutral game but one informed by clean pear fruit and citrus verve. This is easy, slender and refreshing.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2017 White (Alsace)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Produced by the Eymas family, this wine has an attractive touch of perfumed Muscadelle. This contrasts with the more herbal Sauvignon Blanc, giving the wine a ripe, lavender-inspired character. Drink now.
Name: Château la Fleur Bellevue 2017  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: The perfume of Damask rose and lychee is evoked on the nose. The off-dry palate adds plump, juicy and peachy sweetness as well as phenolic texture and liveliness. It's an easy, fruity blend, ideal for sunny late afternoons.
Name: Clément Klur 2016 Gentil White (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of lemon sorbet and clementine pave the way for flavors of Granny Smith apple, green pear, thyme and honeysuckle. This wine offers a nice balance of fruit and floral flavors and a bright, long-lasting finish.
Name: Flam 2017 Blanc Unoaked White (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is a nutty, oxidative quality on the nose of this bottling, with aromas of crushed cashew, olive oil, warm sandstone and baked yogurt. The palate is oily but cut by bright flavors of lemon peel.
Name: Skyline Wines 2015 Artisan White (Central Coast)

Description: The Despagne family, owners of this property, are well known in the Entre-deux-Mers for their white wines. This Sauvignon Blanc, with its herbal character and hints of tropical fruits, is both crisply fresh and ripe. Drink this wine now.
Name: Château Mezain 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Produced by the wine team of Château Giscours in Margaux, this wine is an attractive blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon. With acidity and a tangy texture, it is crisp and fruity, likely to be ready to drink from late 2019.
Name: Petite Sirène 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This 50–50 blend of Fiano and Chardonnay offers a nose of struck flint, white plum and lemon. The medium-bodied palate brings a light concentration of yellow apple and plum skin, with a delicate, stony finish.
Name: Madia 2017 Gjóje White (Puglia)

Description: The nose is almost neutral and gives nothing away. Although the palate continues in this mild vein, it shows clean pear fruit highlighted by lemon. It's just about dry, rather fruity and balanced.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2017 White Tie White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: This wine has a nose of Seckel pear and vanilla bean. It is smooth on entry, with flavors of guava and quince, with a touch of florality that increases into a jasmine finish.
Name: Tabor 2016 Zohar Adama II White (Galilee)

Description: Aromas of lemon oil and herbs offer a pleasing concentration on the nose. A rounded palate of yellow apple and citrus rind is balanced by honed acidity and delicate tannins.
Name: Forte Incanto 2017 White (Salice Salentino)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Herbal and crisp, this tangy wine is fresh with white-currant flavors and a mineral texture. All this zesty, nervy character means the wine needs to age a little, so wait to drink until late 2019.
Name: Château Barbé 2017  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: This is a rare beast in Bordeaux, a white wine with huge richness. It is almost certainly over the top with its creamy texture that only just hints at a more herbal, mineral character. Drink from 2020.
Name: Ets Thunevin 2016 Valandraud  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A mango aroma imparts an extravagantly exotic character to this wine. The tropical flavors are only just balanced by acidity. A mineral texture gives some shape at the end. Drink now.
Name: JCP Maltus 2016 Le Nardian  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A delicate nose of citrus and white blossoms moves to the light-bodied palate. This is citrusy and zesty, with grapefruit and orange flavors riding on a tangy current of acidity.
Name: Amastuola 2017 Organic White (Salento)

Description: Aromas of fruit salad are simplistic. On the palate, this feels citrusy and grabby. Short flavors of green melon and yeast turn mildly bitter and suggest grape skins on a plump finish.
Name: Hacienda Urbión 2016 Cuvée White (Rioja)

Description: A confected nose of bubble gum and orange carries to the medium-bodied palate, where a juicy white-plum flavor joins in. This is light in concentration, with a textural, tannic finish.
Name: Apollonio 2016 Mani del Sud White (Salice Salentino)

Description: Stale walnut and mealy white fruit scents lack freshness. This Chardonnay-led blend is rounded in feel, with flavors of salty and citrus that end bitter on the finish.
Name: Casa La Rad 2016 Solarce White (Rioja)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The wine's aromas are arresting in notes of lemon pith, herb, stone fruit, fig, spice, mineral and citrus. Full-bodied, layered and exquisitely balanced fruit flavors follow with a zing of electric, lemony acidity stitching it all together. The fig- and tropical fruit-filled finish seems near endless. It's showing beautifully now, but should only get better with some time in the cellar. Best 2020–2025.
Name: DeLille 2017 Chaleur Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Slightly cloudy but with an immensely aromatic nose, this suffuses with orange blossom, white pepper, bruised apple peel and jasmine. The palate rings with these aromatics while remaining utterly slender, utterly poised, utterly fresh. This clearly is skin-fermented and thus brings a deliciously bitter phenolic edge. Elderflower hovers. The aromatic purity and floral citrus poise are astonishing. Lovely.
Name: Gerhard Pittnauer 2017 Mashpitt White (Burgenland)

Description: Fully ripe, juicy peach and the richness of freshly turned wet earth combine on the aromatic nose. The palate takes these aromatics in a juicy sweep and whisks them away with lemon freshness, concentration and sheer juiciness. The finish is precise and focused on mouthwatering lemon freshness. Oh, Vienna! Drink 2020–2030.
Name: Wieninger 2017 Ried Ulm Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: A smoky, flinty reduction still hovers on the nose, but both floral overtones and an inherent savoriness shine through. The palate combines that same smokiness with a full-flavored palate that has a rich juiciness but at the same time a feel of richly infused tea. Smoke, texture, fleshy fruit and phenolics lead us in a merry, intriguing dance. This is complex and rich and will need some time in the bottle. Drink 2022–2032.
Name: Wieninger 2017 Ried Rosengartl Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: There is a lifted, savory and aromatic edge of crushed ivy and lemon balm on the nose that mingles pleasantly with lemon zest. It is the lemon that is most present on the zingy, concentrated palate. Both with its zesty freshness and its inherent, fruity ripeness. A bold and direct but utterly compelling white that needs food to shine. A kind of soy savoriness returns on the finish.
Name: Hajszan Neumann 2017 Nussberg Ried Weissleiten White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: The merest hint of Damask rose enriches subdued hints of peach and pear, while an edge of vanilla suggests further, sonorous richness. The palate is rich, rounded, and almost emollient in texture, brimming with fresh and baked apple and that calibrated tone of rich oakiness. A generous, rounded wine that needs equally rich food to shine.
Name: Kracher 2016 K White (Burgenland)

Description: Hay flower, wet earth, waxy quince peel and ripe melon combine into a powerful if earthy nose with a tropical overtone. The palate then presents unexpectedly slender lemon brightness that carries that same passion fruit hint as the nose. This is concentrated and live, urgent and vivid. Savor that phenolic richness and the long lemon finish.
Name: Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2017 Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: The slightest whiff of flint hovers over herbal fruitiness. There is apple peel, fresh Mirabelle plum, lemon balm and heady yarrow on the nose. The palate brims with freshness and presents all these aromatic notes with lemony zest and freshness. This is concentrated and original.
Name: Wieninger 2017 Bisamberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: A blend of Rondinella Bianca, Gold Traminer, Kerner and Incrocio Manzoni, this fragrant, savory white opens with aromas of lime zest, yellow stone fruit and aromatic herb. The succulent, delicious palate doles out honeydew melon, creamy peach and apricot alongside tangy citrus. A saline note marks the close.
Name: Zymè 2017 From Black to White White (Veneto)

Description: This proprietary white blends 95% Viognier with 5% Sauvignon Blanc. Together they're exotic in sea salt, wet stone and high-toned floral aromatics of jasmine. The palate is succulent and restrained, a study in white peach, green apple and lemon zest.
Name: Conclusion 2017 The Storyteller White (Sonoma County)

Description: Linden blossom and tender hints of citrus on the nose promise tenderness, but the palate surprises with vivid, concentrated lemon freshness. There is a pleasantly pithy texture and a pervasive, enlivening freshness. The finish is refreshing and lip-smacking as this stuffs a whole load of flavor into a slender package.
Name: Hajszan Neumann 2017 Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Appellation: Napa County-Sonoma County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is made from 60% Sauvignon Blanc, 35% Chardonnay and 5% Viognier, some of the wine stainless-steel fermented, some barrel or concrete-egg fermented. Together, they offer a lively hit of bright grapefruit, apricot and Meyer lemon squeeze. The texture is velvety smooth with a twist of grip.
Name: B Cellars 2017 Blend 23 White (Napa County-Sonoma County)

Description: This blends a majority of Viognier with 27% Chardonnay and 5% each of Roussanne and Marsanne. Inviting floral aromas of apple blossom are followed by textured tangy flavors of grapefruit, green apple and apricot in an integrated, complex package of vibrant elegance.
Name: Paraduxx 2017 Proprietary White (Napa Valley)

Description: Dark gold in color, this wine is showy in oak, with a nutty core of richness and full-bodied flavor. It offers a wealth of green apple, lemon and lime on the lengthy palate.
Name: Anderson Conn Valley 2017 Sarah's Cuvée White (Napa Valley)

Description: A blend of 80% Sauvignon and 20% Chardonnay, this is clean and pleasant right off the bat. Soft melon and pithy citrus tones are coupled with herbal hints of mâche and watercress, as well as a hint of feline essence. Green grass, lime leaf and plum abound on the fresh and zippy palate, with solid acidity and a brisk, mouthwatering finish.
Name: Ashbourne 2016 Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Walker Bay)

Description: This blends 84% Pinot Blanc and 16% Riesling into a waxy, viscous and floral expression of green apple, peach and jasmine. High in acidity, it offers a touch of weight within a light-bodied ripeness.
Name: Eponymous 2016 Proprietary White (Carneros)

Description: Thick, robust and full bodied, this white is intensely flavored in sweet peach, with a gritty texture that lingers in steely acidity.
Name: Gratus 2017 Estate Grown White (Napa Valley)

Description: Mildly oxidized, oily aromas are low on fruit and play up haystack and stalky notes. This unusual organic-grape blend is Sauvignon Blanc, Viognier and Chardonnay, and it's yellowish in color as well as full and almost creamy on the palate. Dry apple flavors turn bitter on a flat finish.
Designation: Inkarri Made With Organic Grapes Estate Bottled
Name: Chakana 2016 Inkarri Made With Organic Grapes Estate Bottled White (Mendoza)

Description: A rich, spicy wine with toasty flavors and a creamy texture, this will develop well. Ripe fruits are just a part of this complex wine that offers perfumed acidity and a fragrant aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château des Places 2017  Graves

Description: Ripe and rich, this full-bodied Sauvignon Blanc/Sémillon wine also shows freshness to balance the generous white fruits. Spice and good acidity give the wine extra complexity and an excellent future. Drink from 2020.
Name: Vieux Château Gaubert 2017  Graves

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: The current generation of the Bossuet-Hubert family went all out with certified biodynamic vines, indigenous yeasts and low sulfur. Crisp and lemon flavored, this vegan wine has attractive acidity and a zesty texture. It is full of mango and kiwi flavors. Drink this ripe, attractive wine now.
Name: Chateau Peybonhomme-les-Tours 2017  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: Bright, tangy and with good acidity, this Sémillon-dominant wine is refreshing and lightly structured. It has a crisp texture as well as a tangy aftertaste that needs to soften a little. Drink this organic wine from mid-2019.
Name: Château du Seuil 2017  Graves

Description: In this lovely and complex white from estate fruit, winemaker Elizabeth Vianna blends 79% Sauvignon Blanc with 21% Sauvignon Gris to offer an intense, ripe and thick-bodied wine that's lush and layered. The fruit is a mix of green apple and quince.
Name: Chimney Rock 2016 Elevage Blanc Estate Grown White (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A perfectly composed blend of 30% Riesling, 20% Pinot Blanc, 25% Muscat, 10% Gewürztraminer and 15% Pinot Gris, this nicely integrates the various aromatic, spicy and fruity components from the different grapes. Tart apple, orange, lemon and grapefruit flavors come in equal proportion, with a refreshing minerality underscoring the fruit.
Name: Brooks 2017 Amycas White (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This rich wine from Jean-Michel Baudet is packed with juicy green plum and yellow fruits. It has weight and a spicy edge that fills it out and enhances the ripe fruits. The wine is developing well, full of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon fruit that will broaden out over the next few months. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Monconseil-Gazin 2017 Blanc Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Spicy and fruity, this lightly toasty wine also has a tangy character that shows structure. The wine's texture suggests it needs to age, so drink from 2020.
Name: Château Moutin 2017  Graves

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Ripe tropical flavors dominate this rich Nicolas Thienpont wine, a full and fruity Sauvignon Blanc/Sauvignon Gris blend. Sure to develop impressively, it will be better from 2019. It's available in limited quantities only due to spring frost.
Name: Château Puygueraud 2017  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon is a savory feast of mineral, herb and consommé flavors on a firm structure of good acidity and medium to full body. It's hearty, mouthfilling, a bit boisterous and quite satisfying to sip.
Name: Concannon 2017 Reserve Assemblage Blanc White (Livermore Valley)

Description: Soft and fruity, with cinnamon flavors, this four-grape blend from a seven-acre parcel is smooth and rounded. It has hints of toast, a ripe structure and plenty of herbal, tangy acidity at the end. Drink from mid-2019.
Name: Château de Beau-Site 2017  Graves

Description: Spice, nutmeg and cinnamon from 50-50 Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon give this wine a warm character that is enhanced by the generous fruitiness. Bright citrus and red-apple flavors finish with a perfumed aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2020.
Name: Château Haut Bergeron 2017 Château La Fleur des Pins  (Graves)

Appellation: Isola dei Nuraghi, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: A blend of Vermentino and Nasco, this unusual, full-bodied white has aromas of mature yellow stone fruit, orange rind and yellow wild flower. Round and enveloping, it glides across the palate, offering dried apricot, grapefruit and a note of candied-tangerine drop.
Name: Ferruccio Deiana 2016 Pluminus White (Isola dei Nuraghi)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The balance here is tilted slightly toward Sémillon (54%). The nose offers notes of fig, lemon balm, spun cotton and citrus. Well-balanced, richly textured flavors follow, with tropical and citrus tones on the lingering finish. It needs some time to flesh out, but the stuffing is all there.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2017 Estate Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded aromas of yellow melon and orange cream make for a clean and plush nose in this blend of Grenache Blanc, Albariño, Loureiro and Viognier from the Estelle Vineyard. It's lush on the palate at first, and then tightens in structure, offering ripe but grippy flavors of creamy white peach and cherimoya.
Name: McClain Cellars 2016 Kiss of Life White (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Softly textured, this is a fresh and fruity wine. It has a tangy edge as well as bright acidity and herbal flavors. The mineral, taut texture will allow it to age, so drink from 2020.
Name: Château Perron 2017  Graves

Description: Soft, fruity and generous, this wine from Hélène et Amélie Durand will develop well. It offers weight, density and plenty of fruit. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Doms 2017  Graves

Description: This classic blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Muscadelle is crisp and layered, with bright acidity and spicy fruit. The wine does need time and will be better from 2020.
Name: Château du Mouret 2017  Graves

Description: Tangy and juicy, this attractive wine has a good future. Bright acidity and spice shine through the citrus zest and perfumed quince aftertaste. Drink this ageworthy wine from the Guinard brothers from mid 2019.
Name: Château d'Uza 2017  Graves

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This soft wine from Vignobles Denis Lafon is shy about showing its fruitiness. It suggests yellow fruits with a crisp, textured edge. Drink this ripe wine from 2019 when it will have revealed more of its attractive lemon flavors.
Name: Château Gardut Haut Cluzeau 2017  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Appellation: Isola dei Nuraghi, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Made with 50% Vermentino, 30% Chardonnay and 20% Malvasia, this big white has a shy nose that eventually shows aromas suggesting beeswax and tropical fruit. The aromas carry over to the soft full-bodied palate along with ripe peach, vanilla and a candied note.
Name: Pala 2016 Entemari White (Isola dei Nuraghi)

Description: A blend of ripe, unctuous Sémillon with some crisper Sauvignon Blanc has given a honeyed, candied-fruit-flavored wine. It is really rich while still having the essential acidity. Drink the wine now, but it will be better from 2020.
Name: Château Kalian 2015  Monbazillac

Description: This spicy, wood-aged wine offers flavors of nutmeg and warm white fruits. Its freshness is still developing, with plenty of time for the richness to come through. It will be best from 2020.
Name: Château de Castres 2017  Graves

Description: Fruity and ripe, but with considerable acidity, this wine is crisp and textured. Tangy fruits are still developing but prominent. Drink from mid 2019
Name: Château Haut Mayne 2017  Graves

Description: This perfumed wine has a smooth, oily texture. Ripe touches of lychee and a warm character are attractive features of this wine that will be ready from mid 2019.
Name: Château Puy Boyrein 2017  Graves

Description: This crisp wine from some of the highest vineyards in the Graves is tangy, fruity and almost ready to drink. Bright acidity and a touch of minerality don't detract from the fruitiness of this delicious wine. Drink from mid 2019.
Name: Château Ducasse 2017  Graves

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Aged in barrel for seven months, this wine is muted at this stage, just hinting at a fruity future. The spicy richness shows in the full texture and will open out over the next few months. Let the wine age and drink from 2019.
Name: Vignobles Arbo 2017 Château Puyanché  (Francs Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Spicy as well as fruity, this is an attractive, smooth wine. Underneath the acidity and crisp texture, the wine discloses a warmer, creamy character as well as delicious orange and citrus fruits. Drink from mid 2019
Name: Château d'Arricaud 2017  Graves

Description: Pure, clean and fruity, this is an immediately attractive wine. Light citrus and apple flavors are lively and bright. Drink now.
Name: Château Ferrande 2017  Graves

Description: The structure, acidity and green fruits are all in place in this wine that has a touch of spice. It is young and needs time; drink from 2020.
Name: Château Rahoul 2017  Graves

Description: This white blend consists of Chardonnay, Feteasca Regala, Sauvignon Blanc and Muscat Ottonel and has aromas of peach and pear. In the mouth it is balanced with flavors of honeydew melon, citrus juice and freshly sliced peach.
Name: Cramele Recas 2017 Wildflower Cuvée Blanc Reserva White (Recas)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This rich wine balances ripe apricot flavors against an attractive squeeze of lime. A hint of spice and zesty orange add complexity. Drink now.
Name: Château Bertinerie 2017 Château La Baronnerie Grand Vin  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: This crisp wine offers tangy acidity and a bright texture. Its fruitiness is still developing, highlighting the apple and citrus flavors. Wait to drink this wine until mid 2019.
Name: Château Simon 2017  Graves

Description: A grassy blend of Sémillon with a touch of Sauvignon Blanc, this is an intense wine. Its concentrated white and citrus fruits are still young and up front. As they settle down, the wine will be fruity and attractive. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Kalian 2017 White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: Bright and fruity, this is a tangy, zesty and crisp wine. Apple and pear flavors are enhanced by citrus to give a lively aftertaste. Drink from mid 2019.
Name: Château La Rose Sarron 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Light and with crisp fruit, this Guignard brothers' wine is bright and breezy. The apple and citrus flavors are delicious already and just need a few months for the tangy edge to soften. Drink from mid 2019.
Name: Château Roquetaillade la Grange 2017  Graves

Appellation: Isola dei Nuraghi, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: A fifty-fifty blend of Vermentino and Nuragus, this has subdued aromas of orchard fruit, spring flower and a whiff of white almond. The round palate has a glycerine-like texture, doling out mature yellow apple and tropical fruit. A bitter-almond note signals the close.
Name: Pala 2017 White (Isola dei Nuraghi)

Appellation: Sainte-Foy Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Hints of almonds and spice add to this wine's fruitiness. Bottled in July, it is still developing and its tangy texture and citrus flavors are coming through. So drink from 2019.
Name: Château Carbonneau 2017 Margot  (Sainte-Foy Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: This attractively fruity, no-oak wine is crisp, light and bright. Perfumed with green-apple and lemon flavors, the mostly Sémillon wine will be ready from mid 2019.
Name: Château Calvimont 2017  Graves

Description: This small-production Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon blend is all about bright fruits. Acidity and tangy citrus show well in this lightly herbal wine. Drink now.
Name: Château Brondelle 2017  Graves

Description: Lively acidity is prominent in this wine, along with crisp citrus fruits and herbal flavors that give it freshness and a bright lift. Drink the wine now.
Name: Château Jouvente 2017  Graves

Description: Dusty minerality and violet perfume elevate this plush, juicy Spätlese. Fleshy apricot and peach flavors are straightforward and juicy but balanced crisply with sweet-tart lemon acidity. Enjoy now.
Name: P.J. Valckenberg 2017 Madonna Spätlese White (Rheinhessen)

Description: Sun-kissed yellow peach and yellow cherry notes are veiled with a sugary sweetness in this fruity, forward Spätlese. It's medium-sweet and a touch candied in style but balanced by refreshing tangerine acidity and a hint of bitter lime pith. Enjoy now.
Name: Leonard Kreusch 2017 Spätlese White (Rheinhessen)

Description: This bears little resemblance to previous versions; though listed as a dessert wine, it is only passingly sweet. Perhaps orange wine is a better description, with some 21 grapes in the blend, principally various Muscat clones. It's an odd mix of grainy sugar and astringent phenolics, and will not readily accompany any desserts with the possible exception of bitter chocolate.
Name: Maragas 2016 Tootsie White (Oregon)

Description: This is a soft, lightly sweet wine with delicate peach and honeysuckle flavors. It's very smooth and creamy in mouthfeel.
Name: Reata 2017 Aurelius White (California)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Jean Lissague's Sauvignon and Muscadelle blend is soft, rounded with ripe spice and pear flavors. It is rich, lightly tangy while also softly textured. Drink now.
Name: Château Grand Secret 2017 Petit Secret  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: This wine is softly textured, with gentle acidity and a ripe, full-bodied richness. The fresh character comes through slowly. Drink from mid 2019.
Name: Château Haut Selve 2017  Graves

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A blend featuring four of the local Gascony grapes, this wine is typically light, herbal, crisp and refreshing. The Colombard and Ugni Blanc that dominate are the drivers of the white currant and acidity. Bright and fruity, it is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine la Taste 2017 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Oily aromas of citrus peel and apple are basic, as is a round palate with modest acidity. Mild citrus and stone fruit flavors roll onto a short finish before disappearing. This is 85% Viura and 15% Malvasia.
Name: Ramirez de la Piscina 2017 White (Rioja)

Description: This wine is still developing. It has plenty of fruit along with bright acidity, but these are still masked by the firm edge of tannins and structure. Wait until 2020.
Name: Château Magneau 2017  Graves

Description: Fresh acidity and apple flavors come through strongly in this wine. With attractive acidity and lively fruitiness, it is a wine to drink by mid 2019.
Name: Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons 2017  Graves
Winery: Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons

Description: Savory spice, pollen and earth tones accent sunny pineapple, peach and honey in this easy-drinking, semidry white. It's fruity, forward nature is straightforward yet juicy, balanced by fresh acidity. Enjoy now.
Name: Karl Josef 2017 Piesporter Michelsberg White (Mosel)

Description: This wine has strange petrol aromas, no oak, and a tight, textured character. The fruit still has to develop through the tanginess.
Name: Château de Cérons 2017  Graves

Description: This gently textured Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon blend offers soft fruit flavors and an easy texture. Drink now.
Name: Château le Bonnat 2017  Graves

Description: This is a blend of numerous disparate white varieties, but principally Muscat. The result is a generic white wine with jumbled tree fruit flavors and a hint of caramel. It finishes with a burst of alcoholic burn.
Name: Maragas 2016 Bianco White (Oregon)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Tropical fruit and melon aromas are straightforward in this blend of Macabeo and Chardonnay. The palate feels plump, with modest acidity and flavors of white fruits and grape skins.
Name: Borsao 2017 Macabeo-Chardonnay (Campo de Borja)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Fruity and ripe, this old-vines wine has a tangy character that gives it bite to balance the crisp citrus fruits. A bright aftertaste from the Sémillon gives the wine a fine lift. Drink now.
Name: Château Lacaussade Saint-Martin 2017 Trois Moulins  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Exotic tones of turmeric and saffron accent yellow peach and apple flavors in this spicy, savory white blend. It's sweet and light bodied in style with a slightly cloying fruitiness, but earthier, herbaceous tones and brisk acidity lend balance. Enjoy now.
Name: Leonard Kreusch 2017 Auslese White (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Simple and fruity, this is an immediately attractive wine. Its herbal character is balanced by great fruitiness and crispness from acidity. Drink now.
Name: Loubardère 2017 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This wine is pale yellow to the eye. A simple note of citrus prepares the palate for flavors of lime and nectarine with a note of bitter almond on the finish.
Name: Domaine Val D'Argan 2016 La Perle Blanche de Mogador White (Morocco)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A blend of four of the white grapes widely used in Gascony, this wine is herbal and light, with citrus and mango flavors. Drink it now for its fruitiness or wait a few months for it to soften.
Name: Vignobles Fontan 2017 Domaine de Maubet White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Oily white fruit flavors are generic and not all that fresh. A chunky palate with no snap to it offers mealy white fruit flavors that barely register. A finish with the texture of white grape skins is flavorless and low on acidity.
Name: Breca 2017 Zabrin White (Spain)

Description: This blend of Viura and Tempranillo Blanco offers a simple aroma of apple juice. The palate is low on acidity, with a flat tree-fruit flavor.
Name: Lágrimas de Maria 2017 Viura-Tempranillo Blanco White (Rioja)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This annual white blend by Jim Clendenen is always fascinating, and this vintage's 55% Pinot Gris, 35% Pinot Blanc and 10% Aligoté combination offers warm rich aromas of hazelnut and crème brûlée that are cut by crushed chalk and lemon rind. It lands on the palate with a baked pastry warmth but then proves quite textural and taut with lime spray and herb flavors.
Name: Au Bon Climat 2016 Hildegard White (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely fresh aromas of spring blossoms, lily and lemongrass show on the nose of this blend of 36% Chardonnay, 32% Pinot Blanc and 32% Pinot Gris. The palate is immensely textural and racy, delivering tingling flavors of yellow grapefruit, lime rind, yuzu an Asian pear.
Name: Barden 2017 Fonte White (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Plush but not fat, this subtle and complex wine combines peach and vanilla flavors with fig, crushed rock and bright acidity. The creamy mouthfeel stays well balanced as lemon and crisp apple notes come forward on the midpalate and linger through the finish.
Name: Skinner 2017 Seven Generations White (El Dorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: When looking for an affordable table wine with great packaging and unique flavors, opt for this blend of primarily Pinot Grigio and Falanghina, with touches of Vermentino and Verdelho. Aromas of light honey and Meyer lemon pith lead into a palate that is rich at the core with almond cream but surrounded by tangy grapefruit rinds.
Name: Giornata 2017 Bianco Il Campo White (Paso Robles)

Description: This wood-aged wine is ripe with spice as well as rich apricot and pear flavors. With a toasty character and perfume from the Muscadelle in the blend, the wine is generous but with a serious intent and the ability to age. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Léognan 2017 Le Blanc  (Graves)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate scents evoking yellow stone fruit, pressed flower, beeswax and crushed herb lift out of the glass. The bright, linear palate delivers mature apricot, tangerine zest and a hint of white almond alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: Barberani 2014 Luigi e Giovanna  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: A blend of 46% Sauvignon Blanc, 37% Riesling and 17% Gewürztraminer—all left to develop botrytis on the vines—this wine shows a petrol character that's intense on the nose. The palate is viscous and rich in flavors of hazelnut, pineapple and honey. It winds its way to lingering, balanced finish.
Name: Grgich Hills 2014 Violetta Late Harvest White (Napa Valley)

Description: A joint effort between Frescobaldi and inmates from a penal colony on the Gorgona island off the Tuscan coast, this blend of Vermentino and Ansonica offers aromas of yellow field flower, dried Mediterranean herb and a whiff of tropical fruit. The juicy palate delivers ripe Bosc pear, white peach and a touch of wild fennel that brightens the creamy finish.
Name: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2016 Gorgona White (Costa Toscana)

Description: Honeydew and lime aromas show a light note of sea brine and bell pepper on this blend of 90% Verdejo and 10% Viura. Round and healthy in feel, this Rueda has a fresh set of flavors that includes grapefruit, green banana and herb. Basa has had its ups and downs over the years; this vintage is all up. Drink now.
Name: Telmo Rodríguez 2017 Basa Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Bianco, this has a delicate fragrance of orchard fruit and white flower. The vibrant, savory palate delivers Golden Delicious apple, citrus and a touch of thyme, while fresh acidity provides the framework.
Name: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2016 Bianco White (Pomino)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of white spring flower and yellow stone fruit. The savory palate offers yellow peach, Bartlett pear and citrus while a bitter almond note signals the close.
Name: Castello Montauto 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Description: Rich and creamy, this offers a touch of spice and plenty of baked-apple and creamed-pear flavors. The wine is tangy, zesty with pepper and crisp fruits. It should be ready from 2019.
Designation: Blanc de Brûle Sécaille Grand Réserve
Name: Château Brûle Sécaille 2017 Blanc de Brûle Sécaille Grand Réserve  (Côtes de Bourg)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sémillon in California is an interesting play that's still finding its footing. This blend of 68% Sémillon and 32% Sauvignon Blanc plays to the lighter, rather than to the unctuous side of the grape, with zesty aromas of grass, pear flesh and gardenia on the nose. The palate offers tart green-apple, lime skin and honeysuckle flavors.
Name: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2016 Barrack Family Estate Blanc White (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Aromas of cedar, white flower and toasted hazelnut lead the nose. The savory, medium-bodied palate delivers Golden Delicious apple, grapefruit and a touch of papaya alongside bright acidity.
Name: Jermann 2015 Where Dreams Have No End White (Venezia Giulia)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Vibrant aromas of lime blossom, lemon balm and a wet stone minerality show on the nose of this unique blend of 56% Marsanne, 29% Albarino and 15% Grenache Blanc. It's very grippy on the palate, with crushed gravel and lemon glaze flavors.
Name: Wolff 2015 White Wolff White (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad aromas of orange, melon, apple and pear are quite ripe but very clean on the nose of this bottling, a blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier. Tangy green-apple rind flavors meet with jasmine on the unique palate.
Name: Clos LaChance 2017 Hadley's Cuvee White (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Soothing and creamy to sip, this medium-bodied blend of white Rhône grape varieties has subtle fruit flavors but a very appealing, rich texture that coats the mouth and lingers on the finish. It tastes lush, figgy and indulgent.
Name: Le Casque 2017 Adrian White (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Vino Bianco d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: This deeply golden colored wine opens with intense aromas of white rose, mature orange peel and dried apricot that carry through to the palate. Bright acidity lifts the unusual flavors, while a rather bitter note closes the finish.
Name: Marilena Barbera NV Ammàno Menfi White (Vino Bianco d'Italia)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A fun label great for seaside sipping, this bottling starts with wispy aromas of honeydew and lime-laced cream on the nose. It's crisp like Alpine river water on the palate, with lime and tropical hints of tuberose and plumeria arising toward the finish. Would pair with many foods, from spicy Asian to fresh shellfish.
Name: Jellyfish 2017 White (Central Coast)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fruit-forward and quite ripe in flavor, this medium-bodied wine offers dramatic apricot aromas, rich vanilla and butter flavors and a lingering finish.
Name: Skinner 2017 Smithereens White (El Dorado)

Description: This blend is, unusually, dominated by Sémillon. A rounded wine, it is rich and lightly spicy, with green fruits and ripe acidity. The wine is still at the most youthful stage but is delicious to drink now.
Name: Univitis 2017 Axel des Vignes  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A warm wine with ripe fruits and rich acidity, this is a blend of crisp Sauvignon Blanc with smoother Sémillon. This fruity wine is now ready to drink.
Name: Château l'Orangerie 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Spring blossom and orchard fruit aromas lead the nose. On the bright, linear palate, vibrant acidity offsets notes of white peach, pineapple and citrus.
Name: Argillae 2016  Orvieto

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Scents of wildflower and orchard fruit lift delicately out of the glass. On the palate, bright acidity accompanies yellow pear and citrus zest.
Name: Barberani 2016 Castagnolo  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: This wine is typical of Bordeaux whites in this vintage. It has ripe, almost tropical flavors of rich pear, pineapple and lime over a core of tangy, zesty fruit. The wine is lively, generous and ready to drink.
Name: Château Haut Dambert 2017 Cuvée Clémence  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a ripe style of wine with tropical fruits and nutmeg spiciness from the fourth matriarchal generation at this site with ancient origins. It is a generous wine, named for a daughter, with its toastiness and perfumes from the unusual 50% Sauvignon Gris in the blend. Drink the wine now.
Name: Château Lamothe de Haux 2017 Valentine par Valentine Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A blend of Procanico, Malvasia and Drupeggio, this opens with subtle aromas suggesting ripe orchard fruit and spring wildflower. The simple but juicy palate offers Bosc pear, candied lemon slice and a hint of raw almond.
Name: Bigi 2016 Secco  (Orvieto Classico)

Description: Light and fruity, this wine is dominated by fresh Sémillon flavors. Citrus and a hint of potential creamy richness balance the wine between a smooth texture and a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château Fonfroide 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This perfumed wine is full of fruit and with an attractive aromatic character from the Muscadelle in the blend. The dominant Sauvignon Blanc gives herbal crispness to the bright aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Vignobles André Lurton 2017 Chateau Goumin  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: This is the white wine in a trio of bottlings produced by the Miecaze family of Château Léognan. It is poised, fruity and crisply fresh. Citrus acidity and touches of apricot and green plum are balanced by a round, textured aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château Léognan 2017 Renaissance Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This unusual blend doesn't clearly showcase any of its three varieties: Pinot Gris, Riesling and Chardonnay. Rather, it is a fruity combo of ripe tropical and citrus fruits. There seems to be a good dose of sulfur as well, which is masking some of the more subtle aromas and flavors. The palate is oily in texture yet nicely balanced by zingy acidity, more plush fruit and a slightly herbal finish.
Name: Paddy Borthwick 2017 Paper Road CPR White (Wairarapa)

Description: Yellow peach and Mandarin orange peel are shy on the nose. The palate offers bright acidity and flavors of ripe yellow peach, pear, white flower and chalk. Lemon and orange flavors finish with a chalky texture.
Name: Grape Creek Vineyards 2016 Cuvée Blanc White (Texas)

Description: The Muscadelle in this wine makes it so attractive. It gives it a perfumed character, as well as enhancing the lively citrus fruits. Lightly herbal, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Univitis 2017 Château les Vergnes  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Minerally citrus aromas break down and veer off toward lanolin and sea-foam. This Sauvignon Blanc (with other white grapes) has grip, but that's fleeting. Briny, salty citrus flavors are crisp before fading fast on a dilute finish.
Designation: Fina Reserva La Isla Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Viognier
Name: Estampa 2017 Fina Reserva La Isla Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Viognier White (Marchigue)

Description: This wine comes from a 160-acre vineyard just east of Bordeaux city. Half-and-half Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc, it has a mineral edge as well as tightfruits. The herbal flavors, bright acidity and crisp aftertaste are attractive now.
Name: Château Carignan 2017 L'Orangerie de Carignan Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Dominated by 65% Sémillon, this wine is ripe, with a creamy texture and rounded fruits. It's all about green plums with touches of apricot, spice and balanced acidity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Grand Abord 2017  Graves

Description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Muscadelle, this easily combines herbal flavors with an attractive riper, perfumed character. The wine is crisp, full of acidity and ready to drink.
Name: Château Grand Métairie 2017  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This wine has a pink tinge in the color and strong floral and fruity aromas. It is peachy in flavor, light in body and slightly sweet, making it an aromatic, picnic-style wine.
Name: Farmhouse 2017 White (California)

Description: Fruit salad aromas of green melon, citrus and kiwi lead to a plump, chunky palate that's lacking in spine. Green, lightly vegetal flavors of melon and bell pepper are plodding through a slightly bitter finish.
Name: Palma Real 2017 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Appellation: Vino Bianco d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: This has aromas of overripe citrus zest and a whiff of saline. The aromas carry over to the extremely simple, dilute palate along with a candied orange slice note.
Name: Masseria Frattasi 2016 SVG 920 White (Vino Bianco d'Italia)

Appellation: Vino Bianco d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Aroma suggesting toast and orange rind follow over to the hollow, rather diluted palate along with a candied note.
Name: Masseria Frattasi 2016 White (Vino Bianco d'Italia)

Description: This blend of Gewürztraminer, Malvasia and Muscat is highly aromatic but not at ease, meaning the nose is soapy and smells unnatural. A flat palate with no edge holds dull flavors of lychee and little else. On the finish, this turns bitter and oily.
Name: Juvé & Camps 2017 Gregal D'Espiells White (Penedès)

Description: Light floral and lemon aromas are chemical and unconvincing. This odd blend of 90% Viognier with 10% Chardonnay is dilute in feel. Briny melon flavors have no depth, while this is flat on the finish due to low acidity.
Name: Estampa 2017 Reserva Viognier-Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Candied pineapple and candied lemon zest on the nose coalesce on the palate around a wonderfully tart core of purest passion fruit. This is rich and tense, taut but sweet, aromatic and heady. Each drop sends sweet ripples of aroma across the palate, while lovely citrus pulls the focus. The finish has a lovely herbaceous edge of bergamot and citrus foliage. Lovely tension. Drink until 2035.
Designation: Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Grande Cuvée Nummer 6
Name: Kracher 2015 Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Grande Cuvée Nummer 6 White (Burgenland)

Description: Barley sugar, dark fir honey and caramel aromas gush from the glass and across the tongue. Their mellow sweetness gives glimpses of tarte tatin, white pepper and melted butter on a very concentrated, unbelievably luscious body. The finish has a fine streak of lemon. Drink till 2030.
Name: Kracher 2015 Nummer 12 White (Burgenland)

Description: Caramelized lemon takes turns with candied lemon to entice the nose. The concentrations of both sweetness and acidity seem to potentiate each other, creating an increasing sense of joy, drama and thrill. The citrus and passion fruit flavors are of immense precision, and one drop on the tongue makes all the taste buds tingle with excitement. This is compact and impactful in all its sweet and tart glory.
Name: H.& C. Nittnaus 2015 Beerenauslese Exquisit White (Burgenland)

Description: Golden peach, blossom honey, candied lemon and ripe apricot already suggest the lusciousness that is to follow. The sweetness and concentration are immense, but a lively dash of orange and lemon freshness adds much needed zest and pulls this all into a lip-smacking finish. Drink until 2035.
Name: Steindorfer 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Grand Cuvée White (Burgenland)

Description: Dark fir honey, golden cane syrup, barley sugar and boiled lemon sweets are rolled into one enticing nose. That interplay of lemon sharpness and caramel is played out on the nose already and continues with its bright, lemony zestiness on the luscious palate, creating tension and tingling freshness at the very core of the sweetest richness.
Name: Kracher 2016 Beerenauslese Cuvée White (Burgenland)

Description: Notions of honeyed, candied richness reach the nose, spiked with a vivid dollop of citrus sharpness. This sweet Spätlese promises thrill and delivers it with notions of apple jelly, tart passion fruit and tropical hints of candied pineapple. Sharp acid counters the richness in the most delicious fashion. Follow the suggestions on the label and pair this with Szechuan pepper and red hot chilies to achieve Asian magic. Fruity, tropical desserts will also be elevated by this sexy and sharp little number.
Name: Heidi Schröck 2016 Spätlese White (Burgenland)

Description: Hints of creamiest vanilla and caramelized pear stream generously from the glass. The palate deepens these impressions with almost emollient force. All of this encompassing richness is countered by wonderfully sharp freshness and a tingling background of peppery, almost nettly spice. Such lovely balance and such lasting savor!
Name: Kracher 2017 Auslese Cuvée White (Burgenland)

Description: Made with 90% Carricante and 10% Catarratto. Aromas of Spanish broom, yellow apple, candied citrus zest and a whiff of Mediterranean herb follow through to the fresh, elegant palate along with a note of honeyed nut and a hint of exotic spice. An almost salty mineral note lingers on the finish.
Name: Biondi 2016 Pianta Bianco  (Etna)
