Description: This blend is a fruit bowl of flavors ranging from lemons and limes to green apples, with white pepper, green bell pepper, blossoms, warm stones and wet wool. The palate teeters on the full-bodied side—slippery and oily—with a long finish of citrus and spice tones.
Name: Leeuwin Estate 2016 Siblings Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Appellation: Malvasia delle Lipari, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Made with Malvasia delle Lipari and a drop of Corinto grapes, this opens with aromas of dried apricot, ripe fig and a whiff of jasmine. The aromas carry over to the palate along with tangerine zest and star anise. It's sweet but well balanced.
Name: Colosi 2014 Passito  (Malvasia delle Lipari)

Description: Intriguing scents of spring blossom, dried aromatic herb, wet stone and mature yellow stone fruit slowly unfold in the glass. On the enveloping palate, notes of honey and white almond wrap around mature orange rind while a tangy saline note wraps around the dry finish. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Pair this with herb-based risottos.
Name: I Carpini 2013 Rugiada del Mattino White (Colli Tortonesi)

Description: Aromas of acacia, chamomile and mature lemon zest slowly appear in the glass. The aromas carry through to the medium-bodied palate along with ripe yellow apple, hazelnut and a hint of flint. Tangy acidity lifts the dry finish.
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2017 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of Spanish broom, crushed rock, toasted nut and a whiff of oak follow over to the crisp, elegant palate, along with ripe yellow apple and citrus zest. Hints of butterscotch and mineral linger on the finish.
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2016 Santo Spirito Bianco  (Etna)

Description: A blend of organically farmed Carricante, Catarratto and Minnella, this radiant white opens with light scents of citrus, yellow wildflower, Mediterranean brush and saline. Vibrant and linear, the crisp palate delivers lemon zest, crushed herb and flinty minerality. It's understated and elegant. Drink through 2021.
Name: Terra Costantino 2016 de Aetna Bianco  (Etna)

Description: This wine is a complex—and a tad woody—combo of lemon verbena, pineapple cake, wet hay and lavender soap. Slightly slippery in texture and sitting firmly in the medium body spectrum, the integrated herbal and wet stone flavors finish with lick of toast and a salty tang.
Name: Cullen 2016 Ephraim Clarke Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: This expressive white opens with heady scents of apricot, rose and grapefruit that follow through to the savory palate along with peach, crushed herb and a mineral note suggesting sea salt. It closes crisp and clean.
Name: Planeta 2017 Noto Allemanda White (Sicilia)

Description: Citrus, Spanish broom and Mediterranean brush aromas lead the way on this tangy white. The juicy palate offers ripe yellow apple, green melon and a hint of saline alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Antichi Vinai 1877 2017 Petralava Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of white stone fruit, citrus and pistachio take center stage on this fresh white. The fruity aromas carry over to the savory, light-bodied palate along with yellow peach.
Name: Planeta 2017 La Segreta Bianco White (Sicilia)

Description: From the cool climes of Frankland River, this wine offers tones of wet wool, river rocks, flower stalks, stone fruit and green herbs all tightly wound around laser-like acidity and a stony, slippery mouthfeel. Rather austere on its own, this wine will come alive with food. Try with a summery pasta or grilled veggies.
Name: Alkoomi 2017 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Frankland River)

Description: Subtle scents of Spanish broom and yellow stone fruit slowly take shape. On the palate, fresh acidity lifts mature yellow apple and lemon zest, while a salty note marks the close.
Name: Calcaneus 2017 Ginestra Bianco  (Etna)

Description: This is an upfront, easy-going style of this classic Margaret River blend. Grass and stone fruit flavors mingle with waxy lemon, oregano and pressed yellow flower tones. The palate offers crisp, mouthwatering acidity tempered by a slightly waxy texture and a long grassy finish.
Name: Franklin Tate 2017 Tate Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Margaret River)

Description: Delicately scented, this offers subtle aromas of yellow wildflower, orchard fruit and wild herb. Mirroring the nose, the crisp, linear palate offers yellow apple, Bartlett pear and a light salty note alongside bright acidity.
Name: Nicosia 2017 Vulkà Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Spring flower, lemon zest and Mediterranean herb aromas follow over to the racy, rather lean palate along with green pear and wet stone. Brisk acidity gives it a crisp finish.
Name: Theresa Eccher 2016 Alizée Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Jasmine tea, honey and saffron perfume this intriguing value icewine. The palate is peachy and honeyed but marked by savory tones of earth and smoked herb. Fresh lemony acidity accentuates its delicate, lacy mouthfeel and lingering finish. Drink now–2023.
Name: Desire 2016 Eiswein White (Rheinhessen)

Description: This wine is ultra extroverted and bursting with aromas of green pepper, grass, lemon and white spice. On the palate is a mighty lick of acidity and a slightly chalky texture.
Name: Miles From Nowhere 2017 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: An almost even split of Sauvignon Blanc and Semillon, this wine is dominated by vegetal aromas at first, but peach and melon tones become apparent with time in the glass. The acidity is bright and crunchy, yet balanced by a waxy texture.
Name: Thompson Estate 2016 Four Chambers Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: The nose is quiet here, but fresh yellow apple, pineapple and tangerine flavors are juicy and sweet on the palate of this Kerner-Riesling blend. Medium-sweet in style, it's a fruity, uncomplicated wine with a honeyed disposition. A nectar-like finish lingers.
Name: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Madonna Auslese White (Rheinhessen)

Description: A blend of Carricante and Catarratto, this offers subtle aromas of yellow spring flower and citrus zest. Crisp and light bodied, the vibrant palate offers lemon and a hint of saline alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Gambino 2016 Tifeo Bianco  (Etna)

Description: A blend of 70% Insolia and 30% Chardonnay, this has aromas of ripe pear, acacia and a whiff of bread crust. The linear palate evokes yellow apple, citrus and bitter almond alongside fresh acidity. A salty note marks the close.
Name: Cusumano 2017 Angimbè Tenuta Ficuzza White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made with organically grown Carricante and Catarratto, this opens with delicate aromas of spring flower, citrus, white stone fruit and a whiff Mediterranean brush. The bright, linear palate evokes yellow apple, grapefruit and a hint of honeyed nut.
Designation: Fondo Filara Contrada Monte Gorna Bianco
Name: Nicosia 2017 Fondo Filara Contrada Monte Gorna Bianco  (Etna)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of 79% Sauvignon Blanc and 21% Sémillon. Light aromas of herb, citrus and grass are followed by medium-bodied, lemony fruit flavors with a tart finish. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.
Name: Three of Cups 2017 Stillwater Creek Vineyard White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of French oak, butterscotch and coconut carry over to the lean, linear palate along with hints of orange peel and mineral. It doesn't have enough fruit richness to stand up to the oak.
Name: Pietradolce 2015 Vigna Sant'Andrea White (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Quiet aromas of tonic and citrus open up to a light-bodied palate driven by flavors of lemon-lime and apple. This is an easygoing blend of 65% Albariño, 15% Chardonnay, 10% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Viognier.
Name: Bedell 2016 Taste White (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: While demure on the nose, sweet grapefruit and pear notes in this semisweet white are forward and slightly confected on the palate. A blend of Kerner, Silvaner and Riesling, it's a sweet-tart, easy-drinking sip with just a hint of smoky minerality. Enjoy now.
Name: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Madonna Spätlese White (Rheinhessen)

Description: Exquisitely pure and aromatic notes of baked pear gleam in the glass along with something heady and ethereal that is reminiscent of freshly cut citrus zest. The off-dry palate has a balm-like viscosity and brings out honeyed ripe Mirabelles, but it all happens at such a gentle clean pure level that this feels like sublimated ripe fruit framed by vivid citrus. Despite some residual sweetness this stays fresh. This is a wine that explains in one small sip and sniff what a good field blend can be all about. It is lovely now and only just starting to evolve. Drink until 2040.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2013 Schoenenbourg Grand Cru White (Alsace)

Description: A warm and sunny notion of ripe yellow pear and baked apple plays aromatically on the nose. The merest sniff of light blossom honey adds an edge of richness. The medium-sweet palate seems to be carried by ethereal lemon-spiked baked pear. This is fluid and almost viscous, but also fresh and concentrated. There is something rounded and balm-like about this and one is reminded almost of a fruitful caress. What a lovely expression of all that is special about Alsace.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2013 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru White (Alsace)

Description: The ethereal lift of dried lemon peel on the nose is followed by lemon-tempered mellowness of ripe pear, ripe peach and golden Mirabelles on the palate. This is honed and lifted, slightly sweet but balanced by the glistening freshness of that pervasive lemon. A field blend of Riesling and Gewurztraminer, this is a wonderful synthesis of sunshine, soil and grape. The finish is off dry and subtle. It is lovely now but sure to evolve.
Name: Julien Schaal 2017 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru White (Alsace)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Because the Bianco Gentile and Genovese grapes in this blend are not authorized for a Corsica appellation, this wine is a super Vin de France. Produced with natural yeasts in egg-shaped tanks, the wine is rich and warm with a lightly oxidative character that adds complexity. The wine is generous, full of ripe baked apple and apricot flavors. Drink this impressive wine now.
Name: Clos Venturi 2015 Chiesa Nera White (Vin de France)

Description: This blend of Petit Manseng, Gros Manseng and Petit Courbu is dry in style yet displays a rich honeyed character. Touches of toast, spice and tannins come from the wood aging. The palate is intense, packed with juicy acidity and ripe white and yellow fruits. Drink from 2020.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2016 Cirque Nord Grande Cuvée  (Saint-Mont)

Description: Ripe, sweet late-harvest fruits are the secret behind this poised wine. It is perfumed, packed with exotic fruits, honey and a touch of lemon marmalade. Acidity shoots through the wine, so it is not cloying. Rather it is well balanced, fresh and sweet at the same time. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Bellegarde 2016 Cuvée Tradition  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This is a field blend of Gewürztraminer, Trousseau Gris, Riesling and other mixed whites that invites in its perfumed aromas of green apple and lychee. With a grainy texture and lifted acidity, it refreshes in a lingering taste of lime zest with an oomph of body.
Name: Carlisle 2016 Compagni Portis White (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An intriguing an ultimately successful blend of 80% Albarino and 20% Chardonnay, this bottling starts with intriguing tangerine, freshly cut melon and light almond aromas on the nose. It's racy on the palate with both bright, lasting acid and a pithy texture, offering rounded nectarine flavors and a hint of lemon cream.
Name: Bodega de Edgar 2016 La Guera White (Central Coast)

Description: Honeyed and with the characteristic dry edge of botrytis, this orange-marmalade-flavored wine is sweet, intense and smoky. Its richness comes from the mature Sémillon and Muscadelle and the wood fermentation and aging. Drink this wine now, although it will age for many years, certainly until 2025.
Name: Vins et Vignobles Castaing 2014 Optimum de Moulin-Pouzy  (Monbazillac)

Description: Although it is dry, this wine is effectively a late harvest, with the grapes picked in early November. That gives the wine richness and concentration, offering ripe yellow fruits, rich acidity and spiciness. The wine is gently honeyed and lightly structured. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Bellegarde 2016 La Pierre Blanche  (Jurançon Sec)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is an elegant and beautifully balanced white wine made in an unusual way by combining the juice of Pinot Noir grapes that are pressed right after picking with Pinot Gris juice. It matches crispness with smoothness, has fresh apple and white peach flavors, light body and low alcohol.
Name: Lichen Estate 2017 Les Pinots Noir & Gris White (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: An intense blend of Colombard, Gros Manseng and Ugni Blanc, this is a rich white wine from this appellation. Kiwi and lychee are balanced by the taut, mineral texture and acidity. Crisply mineral at the end, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Joÿ 2017 Envie White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A unique blend of Chardonnay (62%), Roussanne (34%) and Orange Muscat, the aromas provide light notes of cream, apple, tangerine and spice. There's a pleasing sense of texture and freshness on the palate, followed by a clean orange-blossom-filled finish. It shows a pleasing sense of balance.
Name: Kontos 2017 Gossamer White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This poised blend between the two grapes has tropical fruits as well as greener acidity and herbal characteristics. Rich and crisp, this vibrant wine could do with some further aging. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2017 Côté Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: A blend of Arinto and Chardonnay, this wine is smooth, rich and well textured. Minerality adds an edge while the ripe apple and orange-zest flavors are already delicious. This wine could age longer, but it is so good now.
Name: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2017 Reserva White (Tejo)

Description: This blend of Vermentino and Bianco Gentile is smooth and creamy. Baked apple and nutmeg flavors are balanced by acidity. Extra aging in bottle has given the wine extra concentration as well as richness and density. Drink this ripe, full wine now.
Name: Clos Venturi 2016 Abrama White (Corse)

Description: This wood-aged wine is rich and well balanced. Touches of ginger add spice to the ripe white fruits that are cut with intense, youthful acidity. The wine is already all together but another few months would be beneficial, so drink from 2019.
Name: Quinta da Alorna 2017 Reserva White (Tejo)

Description: This wine is lean and a touch austere at this stage. At the same time a richer, apricot and honey potential comes from the six months the wine spent on its lees. Give the wine time and don't drink before 2019.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2015 Le Faîte Blanc  (Saint-Mont)

Appellation: Colli di Luni, Northwestern Italy, Italy
Description: Made with 70% Vermentino, 15% Albarola and 15% Greco, this boasts heady aromas of white peach, jasmine and zesty tangerine. The aromas carry over to the juicy balanced palate along with bright acidity and a saline finish.
Name: Lunae 2017 Fior di Luna Bianco White (Colli di Luni)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Hints of smoke and pressed pears accent this earthen, saline blend of Viognier and Roussane. It's full bodied and round on the palate but balanced by fresh, moderate acidity. Enjoy now through 2021.
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2016 La Redonne White (Côtes du Rhône)

Description: Apple and melon aromas are friendly and open. Tangy acidity straightens out an otherwise plump palate, while nectarines and slightly tropical flavors are ripe, round and flow nicely across the finish.
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2017 Conde Valdemar Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: This perfumed wine has delicious Muscadelle in the blend with Mauzac and Loin de l'Oeil. It is crisp while rich, with a direct line of fruitiness, acidity and spice. Smooth with gentle acidity and both yellow and citrus fruits, this attractive wine is ready to drink now.
Name: Château Clément Termes 2017 Blanc Sec White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Vibrant aromas of gooseberry, tart plum, pineapple and underripe mango are at the front of this wine's bouquet, with supporting hints of sweet grass and lime zest. The zippy, lightweight palate offers more of the same, while lively acidity lends a mouthwatering refreshment to the close.
Designation: Pyrène L'incontournable Cuvée Marie Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc-Gros Manseng
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2017 Pyrène L'incontournable Cuvée Marie Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc-Gros Manseng White (Vin de France)

Description: Celebrating the indigenous grapes that are so plentiful in the region, this ripe, tropical and white-fruit-flavored blend is beautifully perfumed and gently rich. Its acidity is balanced by its ripe texture and generous aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2016 Héritage  Gros Manseng-Petit Courbu-Arrufiac  (Saint-Mont)

Description: This smooth, creamy wine has a touch of nuttiness that spices the crisp acidity and apple flavors. Ripe and smoothly textured, it is ready to drink.
Name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)

Description: This blend of Gros Manseng and the rare Camarlet is crisp and cool. It comes from young vines that give the wine a lift and brightness. There is just a hint of honey, with apricots and a zingy, citrus texture. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Bellegarde 2016 Cuvée Tradition  (Jurançon Sec)

Description: A blend of Vermentino and Chardonnay, this wine is warm, rich and ripe. It is well balanced, with apple and spice flavors meeting a perfumed element. Drink this attractive wine now.
Name: Domaine Vetriccie 2017 White (Ile de Beauté)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: For a wine produced by a Bordeaux family, this is a daring blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Chardonnay. it is a spirited wine, lively and bright, full of great acidity and warm fruits. Drink now.
Name: Marie et Sylvie Courselle 2017 Le Petit Courselle Les Copines White (Vin de France)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Made from 75% Chenin Blanc, this wine reflects the style and character of that grape, offering almonds, acidity and a young, bitter edge that will soften. It will evolve into a smooth and creamy wine over the next few months, so wait until late 2018.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2017 Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a refreshing white blend, tightly wound although quite subtle. Light in the glass, it shows aromas of lime skin, peach, dried honeysuckle and white lily. The palate is tightly wound and bright with delicate pome-fruit flesh flavors.
Name: Folded Hills 2016 August White (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Aromas of golden pear, crisp apple and a light dusting of minerals carries the nose. Medium in weight, with a pleasing roundness on the palate, softer melon tones are brightened by a lemon-lime vein.
Name: Masciarelli 2017 Villa Gemma Bianco White (Colline Teatine)

Description: This blend of Gros Manseng, Petit Courbu and Arrufiac is ripe, lightly honeyed and spicy in character. Bright acidity on the palate is met with flavors of crisp apple and peach. Textured and mineral at the end, it is ready to drink.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2015 Les Vignes Retrouvées  (Saint-Mont)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A classic Gascon blend of Colombard, Ugni Blanc, Gros Manseng and Sauvignon Blanc, this is bright and crisp although with a softer core. Lychee and honey combine with acidity and citrus fruits. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine de Joÿ 2017 L'Eclat White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: One of a trio of wines celebrating the indigenous grapes of the region, this is crisp, fruity and perfumed. With its good acidity, mineral texture and green fruits, it is tight, steely and needs a few more months to open up. Drink from 2019.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2016 Le Passé Authentique  (Saint-Mont)

Description: Aromas of seashell and lime blend with notes of almond skins and overt oak. Following the nose, this barrel-fermented Viura feels resiny from lengthy exposure to oak. Apple, vanilla and wood resin make up the flavors on this balanced but lean Rioja with stand-out oak character throughout.
Name: Valserrano 2017 Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: A canned wine offering, this is a blend of Riesling, Gewürztraminer, Muscat and Pinot Gris. Aromas of lychee, muscat, orange peel and honeysuckle lead to very spritzy off-dry stone-fruit flavors. The spritz seems distracting but once it flattens out the wine behind it is quite nice. Stuff it in the backpack for the summit.
Name: Eufloria NV Aromatic White (Washington)

Appellation: Vi de la Terra Mallorca, Spanish Islands, Spain
Description: Citrus peel and saline-driven aromas of sea water and seashells lead to a plump but basic palate that weighs in on the soft side. Papaya and dull melon flavors turn slightly bitter on the finish. This is made from Callet (a red variety), Premsal and 10% other Mallorcan grapes.
Name: Ànima Negra 2017 Quíbia Falanis White (Vi de la Terra Mallorca)

Description: Vines to the south of the city of Bergerac gives this richly perfumed wine. It is ripe and creamy with spice and generous lychee and apple fruits lifted by acidity. The wine is ready to drink now, although it will be better from early 2019.
Name: Vins et Vignobles Castaing 2017 Château les Mailleries White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: The 21st edition (the edition numbers serve a similar function to a vintage date) of this popular blend uses eight varieties, mostly aromatic, with no oak influence. It's a lightly sweet, low-alcohol, all-purpose white wine, with fresh tree fruits, citrus and a soft, generous mouthfeel.
Name: Sokol Blosser NV Evolution Lucky No. 9 White (America)

Description: From vineyards located in the east of Corsica, this blend of Vermentino and Chardonnay is floral and crisp, with an attractive perfumed character. The wine is easy, soft and fruity and ready to drink now.
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2017 Terra Santa White (Ile de Beauté)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Description: Dusty yeasty aromas are more out front than any particular fruit scent. This Viura-Malvasia blend is linear feeling as it toes a single line. Narrow stony flavors of white pineapple and lime don't do much on a limited finish.
Name: Bodegas Bilbainas 2016 Viña Pomal White (Rioja)

Appellation: Côtes du Marmandais, Southwest France, France
Description: Crisp, herbal Sauvignon Blanc is given an attractive perfumed character by a small proportion of the fashionable Sauvignon Gris. It is a fruity wine full of squeezed citrus, with bright acidity at the end. Drink now.
Name: Cave du Marmandais 2016 Château la Bastide White (Côtes du Marmandais)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: From the largest privately owned vineyard in France, this wine is crisp, cool and delicious. It is light and bright, with citrus and refreshing lime and lemon flavors. Acidity cuts the wine, leaving a bright, clean aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2017 Classic White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Colombard, Gros Manseng and Ugni Blanc go into this bright, fruity and herbal wine. With its crisp citrus and gooseberry acidity and extreme freshness, the wine is light and delicious to drink now.
Name: Domaine Saint-Lannes 2017 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Delicate peony and pink sweet-pea florals lead the nose of this sweet wine, with supporting fruit tones of white peach and apple flesh on the nose and mouth. It's medium in weight, with abundant peach and apricot flavors that are balanced by just enough acidic lift.
Designation: Pyrène L'emoustillant Grains Dorés Gros Manseng-Sauvignon Blanc
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie NV Pyrène L'emoustillant Grains Dorés Gros Manseng-Sauvignon Blanc White (Vin de France)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a fresh blend of four local grapes, giving a bright, crisp texture and great acidity. It is an easy, fruity wine, lightly mineral and packed with juiciness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Rey 2017 4 Cépages White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a soft wine, light and gently fruity. Acidity, green fruits and a touch of herbal flavors give the wine a gentle, open character with a twist of honey. It is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine du Rey 2017 Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This wine epitomizes the crisp, herbal and grassy whites of Gascony. Cool with apricot and pineapple flavors, this blend is instantly refreshing and ready to drink now.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2017 Colombelle Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes du Tarn, Southwest France, France
Description: Crisp while also full of ripe fruit, this bright, lively wine is refreshing and zesty. Lemon, ripe apples and a touch of warmer tropical fruits all come together in this attractive wine. It's ready to drink now.
Name: Château Clément Termes 2017 Les Petits Clément Sauvignon-Mauzac White (Côtes du Tarn)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Six grape varieties go into this crisp and herbal wine. It is perfumed, packed with fruitiness that's fresh and cool at the end. Tangy, zesty and lightly textured, it is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Pellehaut 2017 Harmonie de Gascogne White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A blend of 55% Colombard and 45% Viognier, a pleasant floral character takes center stage on the nose, expressed in waves of jasmine, honeysuckle and orange blossom. The medium-weight mouth offers more fruity flavors of peach, melon and spiced orange, with soft acidity that tried to keep in all in check.
Name: Michel Gassier 2017 Les Piliers A Cappella White (Vin de France)

Description: Crisp flavors of lemon and lime run through the cool, bright character of this wine. Its acidity is refreshing and cuts through a tangy fruit flavor, giving the wine great lift. Drink now.
Name: Philippe Viallet 2017 Blanc White (Savoie)

Description: The medium-dry blend favors the Gewürztraminer portion, with a spicy character around fruit flavors of fresh peaches. The sweetness is moderate, but the wine falls a bit flat in the mouth. Drink up over the next year.
Name: Pillitteri 2016 Fusion Gewürztraminer-Riesling (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of dried orange peel and lime provide interest but seem a bit evolved. The concentration of the dry Nestea Iced Tea and lemon flavors seems extremely light.
Name: Maryhill 2016 Winemaker's White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A classic Gascon blend of Ugni Blanc, Colombard and Sauvignon Blanc, this is tight, fruity and intensely fresh. A young, bright, herbal character adds tang to the fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Letrinquer 2017 Aux Valses des Papillons White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A blend of Müller-Thurgau and Gewürztraminer, this aromatic elegant white wine offers Muscat-like aromas and flavors. Part of the blend was an orange wine, and it colors the final product, as well as adding candied apricot and orange flavors, supported with fresh, juicy acids. It's an unusual and quite charming wine.
Name: Chris James 2017 Cuvée Blanc White (Willamette Valley)

Description: A blend of Vidal Blanc and Traminette, this dessert wine has luxurious aromas of orange blossom, marmalade and hay. These are echoed on the palate which is rich and concentrated in feel. Although sweet and toothsome, this never feels cloying. The finish is long and luscious.
Name: CrossKeys 2015 Ali d'Oro White (Virginia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are vibrant, with notes of pineapple and other tropical fruit, along with herb, lemon balm and spice. The palate is light on its feet, bringing a pleasing sense of balance, with a lingering finish.
Name: Buty 2016 Sémillon-Sauvignon-Muscadelle White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Child's Play is a new label from Tendril. This is a blend of Chardonnay and 30% white Pinot Noir, which works rather well. The fleshy Pinot plumps up the Chardonnay, adding hints of baking spices and cocoa to its fairly standard apple and peach fruit. The wine was released after just six months in stainless steel.
Name: Tendril 2017 Child's Play Pinot-Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

Description: The nose is fairly intense in aromas of honeydew, apple acacia and ginger. The medium-weight palate boasts savory flavors of rosemary and thyme that linger on the finish.
Name: King Family 2017 Roseland Chardonnay-Viognier-Petit Manseng White (Monticello)

Appellation: Val di Neto, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Bright aromas of citrus peel, lemongrass and stone carry to the light-bodied palate. This blend of Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc is crisp and refreshing, yet well structured, with a fuzzy, textured finish.
Name: Librandi 2017 Critone White (Val di Neto)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Prominent aromas of pear, peach and flower are followed by sleek stone-fruit flavors. A zip of acidity on the finish heightens the interest. One wants more concentration but what is there impresses.
Name: Gård 2017 Freyja Lawrence Vineyards White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Really taut and tangy on the nose, this blend of 50% Tocai Friulano and 50% Arneis shows lime peels, sweetgrass, green apple and brine on the nose. The palate is zippy, showing more tangy citrus rinds and underripe orange flavors—altogether a unique flavor profile.
Name: Bella Luna 2017 Bella Bianca White (San Benito County)

Description: The aromas pop, with notes of tropical fruit, peach and flower. The palate brings just-off-dry peach and grapefruit flavors. There's value to be had.
Name: 14 Hands 2016 Hot to Trot White (Washington)

Description: Creamed pear, quince and dusty slate aromas carry to the medium-bodied palate. It's juicy in feel, with loads of stone-fruit flavors and a tangy limestone finish.
Name: Librandi 2017 Bianco  (Cirò)

Description: White tea, wintergreen, white peach and grass are pronounced on the nose and find themselves on the palate. This offers bright acidity but lacks concentration, with a short finish.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Petite Fleur White (Virginia)

Description: Citrus and crisp green aromas contain a minerally note of wet stone. A racy, lean palate also suggests stoniness, while this wine tastes of orange and green herbs prior to a finish that more than hints at bell pepper.
Designation: Gran Reserva La Isla Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Viognier
Name: Estampa 2017 Gran Reserva La Isla Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Viognier White (Marchigue)

Description: Aromas of pear and pineapple rind meld with an undercurrent of dried hay in this blend of Verdeca, Bianco d'Alessano and Fiano Minutolo. Medium in weight and with a healthy vein of acidity, the palate is textural in feel, boasting flavors of green melon and crunch pear.
Name: Miali 2016 Dolcimèlo White (Martina)

Description: Pear and apple-peel tones meld with fresh orchard blossoms on the nose and palate. This blend of Greco and Mantonico is soft in feel, with a juicy undercurrent of acidity.
Name: Statti 2016 White (Lamezia)

Description: This blend of Riesling and Vidal Blanc offers pleasant aromas of white peach, petrol and wintergreen. Flavors of sweet sage, lime curd, honeydew and more white peach are fresh on an off-dry palate, leading to a long finish with ample acidity.
Name: Veramar NV Riesling-Vidal Blanc White (Virginia)

Description: This blend of Petit Manseng, Seval Blanc and Riesling is shy on the nose, with just a whiff of lemon and pistachio. The palate is much more intense, boasting flavors of aloe vera, lychee and pear drop. Off dry and light in body, it's an easy-drinking wine perfect for a picnic.
Name: James Charles 2017 Cuvée de la Reine White (Virginia)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light and quite bubbly in the glass, this bottling offers lots of chalky, key lime and botanical aromas. The bubbles are also very present on the sip, with lime rind and flint flavors.
Name: Allan Hancock 2016 White (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This off-dry blend of Chardonnay and Seyval Blanc is lead by tropical fruit on the nose and palate. It's an easy drinker with a thin body and mild acidity.
Name: Bogati 2017 Tango Blu White (Virginia)

Description: Spice, honey and botrytis are the dominant characters of this full wine. The acidity comes later, with hints of citrus and lemon curd. It is still young and developing, but has excellent potential. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Rieussec 2015  Sauternes

Description: Wow, this is a beautiful wine. A blend of 77% Pinot Grigio from the Napa Valley's Chiles Valley and 23% Greco from Russian River Valley, winemaker Dan Petroski melds them both together into a floral and fresh explosion of vivid flavor. Tart apricot and peach meet freshly squeezed lemon as balanced acidity lingers masterfully on the finish.
Name: Massican 2017 Gemina White (California)

Description: This wine from Alexandre de Lur Saluces shows exemplary balance. It is crisply poised, bringing together plenty of rich fruit and honey along with intense acidity. The wine is developing quickly and will be ready to drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Fargues 2014  Sauternes

Description: This luscious wine from Olivier Casteja is full of ripe fruit, apricots and honey. It comes from vineyards on the highest plateau in Barsac. Cut with lively acidity, and showing a light touch, it has both elegance and richness, and will age well over many years. Drink this wine from 2023.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2015  Sauternes

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: The Bee is made of 50% of Muscat Canelli, which is blended with 47% Arneis and 3% Cortese. It refreshes and intrigues, offering pure pleasure and a challenge to the palate in its tension of acidity and stony earth. It indeed evokes honeycomb and wildflowers, with a salty brininess that keeps it in the brain long after it's gone.
Name: Idlewild 2017 The Bee Flora and Fauna White (North Coast)

Description: A blend of 40% Friulano, 40% Sauvignon and 20% Riesling, this structured white opens with aromas of toast, crushed stone, grilled herb and a whiff of yellow stone fruit. It's full bodied, delivering baked apple, dried apricot, citrus zest, vanilla and butterscotch flavors. A hint of toasted almond and a savory, almost salty mineral note linger on the finish. Drink now or hold for even more complexity.
Name: Borgo del Tiglio 2016 Studio di Bianco White (Collio)

Description: Enticing scents of field flower, white stone fruit, citrus zest and a whiff of tomato leaf leap from the glass. A blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon, Pinot Grigio and Friulano, the savory succulent palate delivers apple, juicy pink grapefruit, white peach and a hint of mineral. Tangy acidity keeps it light on its feet while an almond note wraps up the finish.
Name: Zuani 2016 Vigne White (Collio)

Description: Poised between crispness and richness, this is a well-balanced wine. With touches of spice as well as fragrant honey and orange-marmalade flavors, the wine is already delicious. It also will age well, with a ripe, generous future. Drink the wine from 2023.
Name: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2015  Sauternes

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Winemaker Bret Urness isn't afraid to break with Old World traditions, and this atypical blend of 41% Chardonnay, 41% Roussanne and 18% Grenache Blanc shows why. The complex but seamless nose combines aromas of lemon, plum flesh, mango and a brush of almond. There is a toasty quality to the palate but also crisp lemony acidity, offering full flavors yet a tight texture.
Name: Levo 2017 E-99 No. 2 White (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This wine from Barsac vines 50 years and older is only produced in exceptional vintages. It is luscious and rich, full of ripe apricot and mango flavors. It has acacia-honey sweetness, a dry core of botrytis and a rich backdrop. It's still developing; drink from 2022.
Name: Château Simon 2015 Cuvée Exceptionnelle  (Sauternes)

Description: Rich and dense, this wine is full, generous and intense. It is not quite mature, although it is already delicious with spice, layers of botrytis and aromatic honey. Remember that 2013 was a fine Sauternes vintage and the wine will age further. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2013 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend of 68% Sauvignon Blanc and 32% Sémillon pops on the nose, with white grapefruit, guava, toast, fig, pineapple and herb notes. The flavors are rich and fruit-filled yet exquisitely balanced, with a knee-buckling texture and a warm finish. It's a standout.
Name: DeLille 2016 Chaleur Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A blend of 50% Friulano, 25% Ribolla Gialla and 25% Malvasia Istriana, this understated but compelling white offers aromas of yellow stone fruit, hazelnut, nutmeg and graphite. The elegantly structured, medium-bodied palate offers dried apricot, toasted almond and lemon zest while a flinty mineral note backs up the finish. It also boasts impressive freshness for the scorching vintage.
Name: Muzic 2015 Stare Brajde White (Collio)

Description: A blend of Garganega, Fernanda, Trebbiano Toscana and Trebbianello, this boasts enticing scents of Spanish broom, hawthorn and ripe orchard fruit. The elegant savory palate delivers ripe golden apple, creamy peach and tangy citrus alongside bright acidity. A hint of almond closes the finish.
Name: Cavalchina 2016 Amedeo  (Custoza Superiore)

Description: The richness of the vintage is very apparent in this luscious, still-young wine. A dry core of botrytis rests on flavors of bitter-orange marmalade, apricot, acidity and spice from wood aging. This wine needs to age further, so drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Cérons 2009  Cérons

Description: This generous and opulent wine is full and ripe, with well intergrated fruit. It offers spice and layers of rich honey and is ready to drink.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2012 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

Description: This wine's nettle and flint touches lead to a beautifully fruity, espressive and aromatic palate. Its savory herb and lemon notes provide lots of interest—as do its textured earthiness and slender but concentrated body. The finish is lip-smacking and totally moreish.
Name: Zahel 2017 Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Subtle notes of ripe yellow pear entice on the nose of this wine. The palate adds citrus freshness and lovely notions of apple and russet pear. The ripe freshness of Amalfi lemons that tingles on the finish makes you long for more.
Name: Bernhard Ott 2017 Gemischter Satz White (Niederösterreich)

Description: Already developing well, this rich wine is balanced by acidity. It offers spice, generous apricot and wildflower-honey flavors and a core of botrytis. This wine from Anne-Laure Dufour is still young and will develop further. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Simon 2015  Sauternes

Description: This is a blend of 33% Ribolla, 27% Arneis, 22% Friulano and 18% Albariño, all grown on the producer's vast Carneros ranch. Nutty and floral, it tastes and smells of white flowers, peach, melon and apricot, refreshing in its delightful lightness and lemony finish.
Name: Hudson Vineyards 2017 White Study Estate Grown White (Carneros)

Description: Inviting aromas of toast, spring blossom, ripe yellow stone fruit and a whiff of graphite mingle in the glass. The tangy palate delivers mature golden apple, ripe peach and a citrus note while a hint of white almond wraps up the finish.
Name: Borgo del Tiglio 2016 Bianco White (Collio)

Description: A year in wood has given this wine great richness as well as ripe spice flavors. It is smooth textured, hinting at toast but much more about ripe lemon, apricot and youthful acidity. This Domaines Rodrigues-Lalande wine, like all the whites from this appellation, needs to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Pont Saint-Martin 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This is a luscious sweet wine from a small appellation just next to Sauternes. It is rounded, full of marmalade and spice flavors, rich with honey as well as having a dry botrytis core. The wine has aged well and is ready to drink.
Name: Château de Cérons 2008  Cérons

Description: A touch of elderflower plays on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with easy, friendly lemon notes and an earthy texture reminiscent of ripe russet pear peel. Its lemon and ripe pear flavors harmonize, but the flicker of clean zestiness makes you long for more. Lovely.
Name: Mehofer 2017 Alter Weingarten Gemischter Satz White (Wagram)

Description: This is what Anne-Laure Dufour considers to be her best wine: from the best vines and best grapes. Almost mature, certainly luscious, the wine is balanced, crisp and rich with honeyed botrytis. It is richly intense, with spicy, apricot and bitter-orange flavors that go well together. The wine could be drunk now, but will be even better from 2020.
Name: Château Simon 2012 Cuvée Jean  (Sauternes)

Description: This wine is ripe and offers plenty of dry botrytis to give density and longevity. With 95% Sémillon, the apricot, orange and crisp acidity are coming together well. Full but not cloying, it will be delicious from 2021.
Name: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2015 Symphonie de Haut-Peyraguey  (Sauternes)

Description: Aromas of grapefruit, tomato vine and a whiff of exotic fruit lead the nose. The tangy palate offers passion fruit, green apple and white peach alongside bright acidity.
Name: Pratello 2016 Rivale 90 + 10  (Lugana)

Description: From a 17th century estate, this wine is rich and generous in its ripe yellow fruits and balanced acidity. Hints of wood aging, spice, white fruits and a structured texture will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Cérons 2016  Graves

Description: Aromas of orchard fruit, bread crust and spring flower take shape in the glass. The savory medium-bodied palate delivers juicy citrus, pistachio, mineral and a hint of ginger alongside bright acidity. Drink through 2020.
Name: Cusumano 2017 Shamaris White (Sicilia)

Description: Spring flower, crushed aromatic herb and white stone-fruit aromas lift out of the glass. On the savory medium-bodied palate, fresh acidity accompanies juicy yellow apple, lemon zest, apricot and bitter almond. Drink through 2022.
Name: Monte del Frà 2016 Cà del Magro  (Custoza Superiore)

Description: Aromas of oak-driven spice, toasted nut and mature exotic fruit take shape in the glass. The aromas glide over to the round full-bodied palate along with baked yellow apple, candied orange zest and dried herb. A hint of coffee lingers on the close.
Name: Primosic 2012 Klin White (Collio)

Description: A touch of banana, loads of ripe pear and red-cheeked apple, some lemony zing: this field blend makes most of its varietal mix. With its peppery verve and dry but beautifully textured palate, it belongs on the table.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2017 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Full of balanced fruit, this wine is rich with plenty of underlying dry botrytis. Apricot, white peach and spice flavors partner with a warm, generous structure. The wine will develop well and will be ready from 2021.
Name: Château Bastor Lamontagne 2015  Sauternes

Description: From the young vines of this Graves classed-growth property, this wine shares some of the impressive structure and aging potential as the Grand Vin of the estate. It is ripe, juicy with grapefruit and tropical flavors balanced with spice from wood aging. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2016 Lacroix-Martillac  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: This blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon, Picolit and Moscato Giallo opens with aromas of toasted oak, orchard fruit and a hint of saffron. The structured balanced palate doles out Fuji apple, dried apricot and a touch of ginger alongside tangy acidity. Enjoy through 2022.
Name: Livon 2016 Braide Alte White (Collio)

Description: Enticing scents of white spring flower and yellow stone fruit float out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the tangy, savory palate offers mature apricot and ripe yellow apple while a white-almond note carries the finish.
Name: Cavalchina 2017  Custoza

Description: Fragrant spring flower, tropical fruit and white peach aromas practically jump out of the glass. Fresh and savory, the medium-bodied palate doles out apricot, green apple, citrus and a hint of white almond alongside bright acidity.
Name: Albino Piona 2017  Custoza

Description: Made with 40% Pinot Bianco, 35% Friulano, 15% Sauvignon and 10% Ribolla Gialla, this has aromas of yellow stone fruit, white flower, wild herb and a whiff of crushed tomato vine. The ripe tangy palate shows grapefruit, pineapple and a touch of ginger while a note of toasted hazelnut closes the finish.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2015 Col Disore White (Collio)

Description: The hints of sun-dried hay, russet pear and bright lemon that mark the nose of this wine combine into zesty freshness on the palate. It's ripe and concentrated, with a dry, lemony zing that lingers until the very last echo.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2017 Braitenpuechtorff Gemischter Satz White (Niederösterreich)

Description: A blend of whole cluster-pressed Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay sourced from Clarksburg and Napa Valley, this can is stainless steel and barrel-fermented and lovely in crisp, high-toned acidity. Apple, melon and citrus combine with aplomb, refreshing in focus and light style.
Name: Brick & Mortar 2017 White (California)

Description: Dense and rich, this is a full, ripe 95% Sémillon wine. It has a good balance between honeyed sweetness and acidity while the apricot and bitter-orange flavors bring fruit and richness. The wine will develop further. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château La Rame 2015  Saint-Croix-du-Mont

Description: This wine is almost mature, gold in color and rich with toffee and spiced apricot flavors. It has preserved some acidity to keep it fresh, offering a luscious aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
Name: Château Biac 2011 Secret de Chateau Biac  (Cadillac)

Description: This is a generous wine, its acidity counterbalancing the ripe caramel and toffee flavors. Botrytis shows through, giving the wine a dry core. It finishes fruity but rich. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château la Caussade 2016  Saint-Croix-du-Mont

Description: This wine is full, rich and opulent. It has light acidity, concentrating more on richness. Apricot jam and wildflower honey are dominant flavors, lightly touched with acidity. This generous wine from the estate will be ready from 2019.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2012 Lions de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

Description: Aromas of spring blossom, ripe pear and citrus zest lead the way. The fresh, linear palate delivers creamy white peach, mature yellow apple and a hint of lemon alongside fresh acidity. It closes on a saline note.
Name: Stemmari 2016 Dalila Riserva White (Sicilia)

Description: A touch of grass, a hint of moss and lots of tangy citrus perfume this light summer wine. It's dry, zingy, transparent and refreshing, with shimmering hints of green and yellow fruit. Drink soon.
Name: Tement 2017 Tement Blanc White (Südsteiermark)

Description: Delicately enticing scents of white spring flower and yellow stone fruit lead the nose. Bright and tangy, the palate offers ripe peach, tangerine and a mineral note alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Cantina Ronca 2016 Tera  (Custoza)

Description: A blend of Garganega, Cortese and Riesling, this offers enticing aromas of yellow stone fruit, citrus and a note of honeysuckle. The enveloping, medium-bodied palate doles out juicy apricot, nectarine, bitter almond a dried herb note while lively acidity brightens the rich flavors.
Name: Gorgo 2016 San Michelin  (Custoza)

Description: Made with Grillo and Insolia, this offers aromas of spring blossom, yellow stone fruit and bread crust. The bright savory palate offers apricot, tangerine and sea salt alongside fresh acidity. It closes crisp and clean.
Name: Baglio del Cristo di Campobello 2016 Adènzia White (Sicilia)

Description: Citrus, yellow stone fruit and crushed herb aromas flow over to the light-bodied tangy palate along with ripe yellow peach, apricot and orange rind. It has a clean zesty finish.
Name: Monte del Frà 2017  Custoza

Description: Mossy savoriness plays amid citrus freshness on the nose of this wine. The palate is light, dry and fresh, with pleasant grapefruit-like tanginess. This offers summery, weightless refreshment.
Name: Tinhof 2017 Blanc White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Heady aromas of yellow stone fruit, grapefruit and crushed herb glide over to the linear palate along with a hint of lemon zest. Tangy acidity lifts the juicy flavors.
Name: Franz Haas 2016 Manna White (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Subtle aromas of acacia flower, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of honey lead the way. On the round medium-bodied palate, tangy acidity lifts yellow apple, dried apricot and citrus rind while a bitter almond note announces the close.
Name: Cavalchina 2015 Amedeo  (Custoza Superiore)

Description: A blend of 50% Friulano, 30% Pinot Bianco and 20% Chardonnay, this opens with aromas of pressed white flower, graphite, toast and white stone fruit. Partially fermented in oak, the linear palate offers dried apricot, baked yellow apple, candied citrus zest and coffee notes.
Name: Fantinel 2015 Tenuta Sant'Helena Frontiere White (Collio)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This kitchen-sink white blend works quite well, with tightly woven aromas of cherimoya and crushed gravel. The palate is zesty with lime-rind and pear-skin flavors, proving refreshing and flavorful at once.
Name: Graveyard NV Paso Tombstone White (Paso Robles)

Description: This Ribeiro's focused citrus and peach aromas are clean and nice. Its citrusy palate offers lean tangerine and apple flavors, with round edges and a dry finish marked by salt and distant bitter notes.
Name: Carlos Moro 2017 Finca San Cibrao White (Ribeiro)

Description: This wine has a luscious backdrop while the foreground is crisp with white peach, ripe apple and honey. It is balanced, full of both fruit and sweetness. This Boyer wine will be ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Château Haut Mayne 2015  Graves Superiéures

Description: Inviting if unusual aromas of grilled herb, wet stone and Mediterranean scrub lead the nose while the medium-bodied palate offers lemon drop, mature apricot and a saline note. It closes on a note of toasted almond.
Name: Cusumano 2014 Cubia Tenuta Ficuzza White (Sicilia)

Description: The 80% Sauvignon Blanc in this blend with Chardonnay dominates at this young stage. The wine has a strongly herbal character as well as green fruits, just gently mitigated by a more creamy backdrop. Bright and intense, the wine will be ready to drink from late 2018.
Name: Benoît Daridan 2017 Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Cheverny)

Description: Ripe apricot and creamed-apple flavors give this wine a crisp edge. Underneath plenty of ripe honey and spice is cut with acidity, giving balance to the wine. It is bright at the end and never cloying. Drink from 2020.
Name: Calvet 2016 Réserve Du Ciron  (Sauternes)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This blend seems to include most of the white grapes found in the western Loire—Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, Folle Blanche, Melon de Bourgogne—and is none the worse for it. This combination keeps the cool crispness of the region, with its Atlantic influence, offering bright green fruits and intense perfumed acidity. Find seafood and drink the wine now.
Designation: Domaine de la Fruitière Vignes Blanches
Name: Lieubeau 2017 Domaine de la Fruitière Vignes Blanches White (Val de Loire)

Description: Crisp acidity, sliced apples and a touch of spice come together in this light, bright wine. It has a perfumed character along with its attractive acidity and light touches of honey. Drink this wine from 2020.
Name: Château Simon 2014 Cuvée Jean  (Sauternes)

Description: Subtle aromas of mature yellow stone fruit and pressed Spanish broom lift out of the glass. The ripe rounded palate offers apricot, yellow apple and a hint of bitter nut.
Name: Collavini 2015 Broy White (Collio)

Description: This wine's apple and citrus aromas are lean and dusty. Like most Txakoli wines, it's sharp and tangy on the palate, with spritz. Its briny gooseberry and lime flavors are salty, which again is typical for this style of Basque white wine.
Name: Gaintza 2017 White (Getariako Txakolina)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend of 55% Sauvignon Blanc and 45% Sémillon leads with fig, herb and toast aromas, followed by broad-feeling fruit flavors that linger on the (quite) warm finish. It delivers a lot of appeal.
Name: Swiftwater Cellars 2016 Proprietary White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Spanish broom, acacia and yellow stone-fruit aromas float from the glass. The rounded palate offers dried apricot, peach and tangerine drop alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Tamburino Sardo 2015 La Guglia  (Custoza Superiore)

Description: The nose of this Assyrtiko is heady with tropical fruit and floral notes. On the palate, it offers pretty lemon, apple, peach and passionfruit flavors in a medium-bodied package. A clean but classy pour at a good price.
Name: Alpha Estate 2015 Axis White (Macedonia)

Description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit and wild flower fill the glass. Reflecting the nose, the bright savory palate offers peach, apricot and orange zest framed in tangy acidity. A hint of white almond fills in the finish.
Name: Tamburino Sardo 2016  Custoza

Description: Young, bright and fruity this is a fresh wine. Its herbal character is balanced by the ripe texture from the Sémillon that dominates the blend. It will be a rich wine as it ages, but wait until 2020.
Name: Château de Cérons 2017 Château Calvimont  (Graves)

Description: This Guignard family wine has a toffee aroma and rich texture. Acidity comes through the sweetness, but only slowly. The main impression is of intense richness, honey and sweet marmalade flavors. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château d'Uza 2015  Graves Superiéures

Description: Spicy, ripe with honey flavors, this full-bodied wine is ready to drink. It concentrates more on richness than acidity. Drink this wine now.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2011 Lions de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

Description: A subtle aromatic streak of citrus zest characterizes the nose of this wine. There's lemon and grapefruit on the palate, too, and exquisite weightlessness. This is fresh and versatile—the ideal glass of tangy dry white.
Name: Höpler 2017 Pannonica White (Weinland Österreich)

Description: This wine is rich and well balanced. Yellow fruits, honey and acidity have come together to give both richness and crispness. The wine is floral and delicately textured, finishing with a mineral aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Rolland 2015  Sauternes

Description: Marie-Pierre Lacoste, the latest generation at this family estate since 1779, plows vineyards with a Belgian draft horse and makes the wine. It is in a crisp style, concentrating on baked-apple and bitter-orange flavors. Bright acidity shows strongly, dominating the honey and botrytis. It needs time to balance, so drink from 2022.
Name: Château La Clotte-Cazalis 2015  Sauternes

Description: Aromas of oak-driven spice, yellow stone fruit, toast and coconut follow over to the medium-bodied palate along with a bitter almond note. A coffee taste signals the close.
Name: Zuani 2015 Zuani Riserva White (Collio)

Description: A blend of Friulano and Ribolla Gialla, this opens with aromas of French oak, coconut, pressed yellow flower and yellow stone fruit. The medium-bodied palate offers candied orange rind, dried apricot and oak-driven spice. Hints of bitter walnut and powdered sage mark the finish.
Name: Livon 2016 Bianco Solarco White (Collio)

Description: A spicy wine, this has flavors of ripe baked apple, toffee and bitter marmalade, wrapped into a texture that has touches of dry botrytis. It's a balanced wine from Gonfrier Frères that will develop. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Tanesse 2016  Cadillac

Description: Citrus, orchard fruit and wild herb aromas practically jump out of the glass. The fresh, savory palate doles out honeydew melon, white peach and grapefruit alongside a hint of saline.
Name: Donnafugata 2017 White (Sicilia)

Description: Dried apricot, pressed peach blossom and mature orange-rind aromas take shape on this. The aromas follow over the concentrated but fleeting palate along with a note of acacia honey.
Name: Monte Tondo 2014 2014  (Soave Classico Superiore)

Description: Aromas of spring blossom and apple fill the glass. On the easy-drinking light-bodied palate, tangy acidity accompanies Granny Smith apple, green melon and citrus.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2017 White (Sicilia)

Description: Zesty lemon and slate aromas start this elegant white blend. On the palate, tropical fruit, citrus and savory herb notes give it weight and complexity. Fresh and fruity and able to age.
Name: Wine Art Estate 2016 Techni Alipias White (Drama)

Description: This has subdued aromas suggesting toasted nut, orchard fruit and a whiff dried aromatic herb. The aromas follow through to the fresh tangy palate along with yellow-apple notes.
Name: Cantina di Custoza 2016 Custodia  (Custoza Superiore)

Description: This wine's nectarine and pineapple aromas pave the way for a strong fruit profile of peach, guava and orange blossom, with a touch of hazelnut. The fruit diminishes as notes of toasted nuts take over on the finish.
Name: Dalton 2017 Canaan White (Galilee)

Description: Made with organic grapes, this vibrant white offers delicate floral and citrus aromas. On the bright palate, crisp acidity underscores yellow pear and hints of white grapefruit and lemon. It finishes refreshing and clean.
Name: Le Tende 2016  Custoza

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Peach, jasmine, pear and honeysuckle aromas lead to off-dry stone fruit flavors in this wine. It goes down easy.
Name: Waterbrook 2017 Mélange Founder's White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Made with Inzolia and Catarratto, this offers delicate scents of citrus and Mediterranean brush. The aromas carry over to the tangy palate along with ripe apple, crushed herb and a hint of steely mineral.
Name: Cantine Grasso 2016 Capobianco White (Sicilia)

Description: While this wine is crisp, it has some attractive honeyed sweetness. It offers both freshness and rich apricot with a smoother, more opulent texture. Drink the wine from 2020.
Name: Château Manos 2016  Cadillac

Description: Aromas of Golden Delicious apple, papaya and a hint of sage appear in the glass. The forward palate offers ripe lime, yellow peach and a hint of roasted almond.
Name: Tenuta di Angoris 2016 Giulio Locatelli Riserva White (Collio)

Description: Crisp and fruity, this wine has a light touch of sweetness while showing a fresh, lively character. Orange and lemon brightness give way to lemon-curd and honey flavors. Drink this wine from 2020.
Name: Yvon Mau 2016 Château Menate  (Sauternes)

Description: Spice, honey and botrytis are the dominant characteristics of this full wine. The acidity comes later, hints of citrus and lemon curd. It is still young and developing but has good potential. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Rieussec 2015 Carmes de Riessec  (Sauternes)

Description: This wine is young, muted for the moment but with the potential for apricot and ripe apple flavors. Its crisp texture and spice will develop well alongside the fruit. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Château Rousset-Caillau 2017  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This is a sophisticated wine, fresh with citrus flavors and delicious with lively acidity and spice. It is a ripe wine while still full of crisp texture. The wine, with its bright herbal notes, is ready to drink.
Name: Cap Royal 2017 Sauvignon Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Waxy aromas of honeyed apples, petrol and lanolin introduce this blend of Garnacha Blanca, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier. Its fleshy palate is cut by acidity, recalling tart apple and pineapple.
Name: Celler Piñol 2016 Portal White (Terra Alta)

Description: Aromas of oak, coconut and dried stone fruit follow over to the palate along with orange peel, vanilla and roasted coffee bean. The palate is on the lean side, offering oak-driven spice but not much fruit richness.
Name: La Rajade 2015 Caprizi Riserva White (Collio)

Description: A blend of Grillo and Carricante, this delicately scented wine offers aromas of white spring wild flower, pear and a whiff of Mediterranean brush. On the tangy palate, fresh acidity and a hint of saline accompany lemon zest and a suggestion of green apple.
Name: Le Casematte 2017 Peloro White (Sicilia)

Description: Intense aromas of grapefruit, orange rind and citrus blossom jump over to the light-bodied palate along with dried apricot. Crisp acidity gives it a zesty close.
Name: Gorghi Tondi 2017 Rajah Vino Biologico White (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit, citrus and a whiff of jasmine lead the nose. The fruity palate delivers ripe peach, pear and a hint of pineapple alongside bright acidity. An almond note on the close adds interest.
Name: Gorgo 2016  Custoza

Description: Aromas of green apple and white spring flower lead the nose on this light-bodied white. The bright simple palate offers Anjou pear and citrus alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Massimo Ronca 2017  Custoza

Description: From vines on the slopes above the Garonne river, this herbal, fruity wine is dominated by Sauvignon Blanc. Its acidity is balanced by the yellow fruits as well as citrus. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château La Maroutine 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This has aromas of fragrant wild flower and white stone fruit, while the simple palate offers baked apple and candied citrus. It closes on a slightly bitter almond note.
Name: Villabella 2017  Lugana

Description: With maturity, this wine has filled out, giving toffee, honey and rich marmalade flavors. It still has some freshness that leaves a bright aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
Name: Château Dauphine Rondillon 2009 Cuvée d'Or  (Loupiac)

Description: Fruity apricot flavors give this Olivier Fleury wine a crisp, perfumed character. Plenty of acidity balances the attractive sweetness and bright aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château du Pavillon 2016  Saint-Croix-du-Mont

Description: Honey and lemon are cut with acidity and spice in this attractive wine. A crisp edge balances the full, sweet flavors and gives a final lightness to the wine. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Haut Bergeron 2016  Sauternes

Description: This wine is a soft, light blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc. It has a nutty as well as brightly fruity character, soft and lively. Not a wine for aging, it is ready to drink now.
Name: Château la Tuilerie 2016  Graves

Description: Fresh aromas of green apple and spring blossom take center stage on this light-bodied refreshing white. The green-apple aroma crosses over to the simple tangy palate along with hints of green melon and citrus.
Name: Cantina di Custoza 2017 Val dei Molini  (Custoza)

Description: Delicate scents of hawthorn and banana lead the nose. Bright and linear, the light-bodied palate offers Granny Smith apple and a hint of green melon alongside bright acidity.
Name: Giovanna Tantini 2017  Custoza

Description: This has subdued aromas suggesting wild flower and yellow stone fruit. The fleeting simple palate shows suggestions of yellow apple, bitter almond and a hint of nectarine.
Name: Villa Erbice 2014 Panvino  (Soave Superiore)

Description: This wine is perfumed and ripe, with touches of honey and toffee to go with the citrus flavors. There is a juicy quality to this tangy, zesty wine. Drink now.
Name: Château du Cros 2014  Loupiac

Description: This Olivier Fleury wine is bright and lively, full of fresh apples and spice. It has a crisp texture, with just hints of sweetness and honey. Drink this fruity wine from 2019.
Name: Château les Roques 2016  Loupiac

Description: This light straw-colored wine offers a nose of peach and lemon pith. Soft in the mouth, it has apricot, passion fruit and honeysuckle flavors, with a floral finish.
Name: Vitkin 2016 Israeli Journey White (Israel)

Appellation: Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This wine is attractive with apple and bitter-orange tones, making it fresh and crisp yet balanced by sweetness. It has good acidity as well as a light touch of residual sugar (50 g/L). Drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Marsan 2016  Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: The generic white fruit and petrol aromas in this blend of Chardonnay, Xarello and Sauvignon Blanc are closed. It's angular on the palate, with lemon and sour apple flavors and a tart, puckering finish.
Name: Albet I Noya 2016 Lignum! White (Penedès)

Description: A blend of Carricante and Catarratto, this informal white has subdued aromas that evoke acacia and white stone fruit. The lean, somewhat diluted palate suggests citrus and a hint of nut set against brisk acidity.
Name: Fazio 2017 Brusìo Bianco White (Sicilia)

Description: This yellow-colored wine has oaky, chemical aromas that lend an impression of tire rubber. Its wayward palate has oxidized apple and butter flavors that finish with notes of popcorn and brined kumquat.
Name: La Antigua 2014 Clásico Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: Corn and apple aromas together smell like wheat in this uninteresting blend of Viura and Tempranillo Blanco. Its underripe citrus flavors are tart and slightly bitter, with a lightly oxidized finish.
Name: Carlos Serres 2017 White (Rioja)

Description: This gold-tinted blend of Viura and Garnacha Blanca smells cold and distant, with little fruit and a whiff of something spoiled. The palate is harshly acidic, with curry and oxidized white fruit flavors that wind down on the charmless finish.
Name: Alberto Orte 2015 Sierra de la Demanda White (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of Mediterranean brush, yellow apple, crushed rock and juicy citrus flow over to the bright savory palate along with pear and savory mineral notes. Bright acidity imparts a refreshing finish.
Name: Pietradolce 2017 Archineri  (Etna)

Description: Savory aromas of dried apricot, tangerine zest, date and jasmine carry over to the creamy palate alongside fresh acidity. Notes of pistachio and vanilla linger on the persistent finish.
Name: Planeta 2016 Passito di Noto White (Sicilia)

Description: Enticingly delicate, this has alluring scents of Spanish broom, citrus blossom, Mediterranean scrub and white stone fruit. It's ethereal yet savory, with pear, white-peach and lemon zest flavors balanced by vibrant acidity. A tangy saline note marks the close.
Name: Le Vigne di Eli 2015 Bianco Moganazzi Volta Sciara  (Etna)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The second release of this unusual blend is principally Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay, with smaller additions of Muscat and Viognier. Tones of orange, lemon and melon combine gracefully on the aromas and flavors of this wine. It's complex, aromatic, detailed and quite lovely.
Name: 2Hawk NV Plume Blanc v.2 White (Rogue Valley)

Description: This is an exuberant but well-balanced medium-bodied wine, with fresh apple and lime aromas and a tangy yet layered texture. The two varieties weave together nicely, presenting the rich aspect of Viognier and the crisp, lively aspect of Chenin Blanc.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2017 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is bold, full-bodied and balanced, combining the richness of 65% Sémillon with the citrus tang of 35% Sauvignon Blanc. Aromas of honey, vanilla and toast lead to ripe grapefruit and melon flavors and a texture that's creamy and mouth coating.
Designation: Micro-Lot Reserve Ghielmetti Vineyard BDX Blanc
Name: Nottingham Cellars 2017 Micro-Lot Reserve Ghielmetti Vineyard BDX Blanc White (Livermore Valley)

Description: Hints of exotic spice, lavender and pear are accented by fresh lime and lemon acidity in this blend of Riesling and Gewürztraminer. Made from biodynamically farmed grapes, it's a restrained, slightly earthen wine with subtle complexity. The finish lingers long on a pleasantly bitter mineral tone.
Name: Pflüger 2016 Biodynamite White (Pfalz)

Description: Heady aromas of citrus and apricot carry over to the bright savory palate along with yellow Bartlett pear and nectarine drop. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Planeta 2016 Segreta Bianco White (Sicilia)

Description: This wine's gardenia, honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas are the hallmarks of Moscatel. The palate is narrow yet refined, with lychee and pineapple flavors. The finish is short and marked by bell pepper notes.
Name: Victoria Ordóñez 2016 Monticara White (Sierras de Málaga)

Description: A 50-50 blend of Chardonnay and Roussanne, this is a light and bright pour. It opens with clean aromas of fresh apple, pear and underripe peach that carry through to the vibrant, well-balanced palate. The medium-length finish is brisk and refreshing. Drink now.
Name: Blanville 2016 Château Haut-Blanville Grande Réserve White (Pays d'Oc)

Description: A blend of Viognier and Catarratto, this fragrant white offers intense aromas of perfumed wild flower, yellow stone fruit and Mediterranean scrub. The tangy palate offers apricot, nectarine zest, floral notes and chopped herb alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Cottanera 2015 Barbazzale White (Sicilia)

Description: Made with Carricante and Chardonnay this has delicate aromas of white stone fruit, wild flower and a whiff of beeswax. The fresh linear palate offers yellow apple, dried herb, fennel and a hint of mineral.
Name: Vivera 2014 A'mami White (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: White wines are a rarity in Walla Walla Valley. This blend of 65% Sauvignon Blanc and 35% Semillion has fascinating sweet herb, lemon zest, wildflower and stone fruit aromas. It's full bodied, with dry fruit flavors.
Name: Adamant Cellars 2016 Bijoux White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Spanish broom, citrus and yellow stone fruit aromas almost leap from the glass. Round and juicy, the tangy palate offers ripe peach, green apple and tangerine slice.
Name: Vivera 2017 Altrove White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This floral- and tropical fruit-scented wine is 70% Pedro Ximénez and 30% Moscatel. It's round and oily in texture, with simple orange, lychee and green melon flavors and a nice, steady, citrus-laced finish.
Name: Victoria Ordóñez 2016 La Ola Del Melillero White (Sierras de Málaga)

Description: This blends 57% Sauvignon Blanc and 43% Gewürztraminer with no barrel aging, is ready to go with its exuberantly floral nose and sparkling acidity. Steely on the palate, it's easy to enjoy and light on its feet, with a fleeting intensity on the finish.
Name: Pedroncelli 2017 Friends White (Sonoma County)

Description: Acacia, beeswax, citrus zest and Mediterranean scrub aromas delicately fold together. It's light bodied and fresh, with yellow-apple, lemon and thyme flavors set against bright acidity.
Name: Cantine Russo 2016 Rampante Contrada Crasà  (Etna)

Description: Made with Inzolia and Catarratto grown in volcanic soils, this has aromas suggesting fragrant wild flower, tropical fruit and a whiff of almond. The savory palate doles out green apple, white peach and a hint of sea brine alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Colosi 2017 White (Salina)

Description: Aromas of apricot, citrus zest and a whiff of white rose take center stage. The fresh rounded palate mirrors the nose, offering yellow peach and candied lemon drop.
Name: Stemmari 2015 Dalila Riserva White (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of honeycomb, peach and apricot are found in this oxidative style of wine. In the mouth, there are flavors of canned peach and mushroom.
Name: Edi Simcic 2013 Tokata White (Goriska Brda)

Description: Aromas of pressed acacia, mature orchard fruit and a whiff of toasted nut lead the nose. Reflecting the nose, the medium-bodied yet lean palate offers mature yellow-apple skin, lemon rind and bitter almond alongside a salty mineral note.
Name: Firriato 2015 Bianco Cavanera Ripa di Scorciavacca  (Etna)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound aromas of lemon blossom, chalk and the slightest show of a guava tropicality arise on the nose of this atypical blend of 72% Viognier and 28% Pinot Gris. It's a tad vinous on the sip, with candied melon and wet stone flavors.
Name: Hungry Hawk 2017 Mélange Blanc White (San Diego County)

Description: A blend of Catarratto and Chardonnay, this opens with pretty aromas of citrus blossom and ripe orchard fruit. Reflecting the nose, the fresh palate suggests green apple, lemon rind and a hint of pear.
Name: Firriato 2017 Santagostino Baglio Soria White (Sicilia)

Description: Pale straw in color, this wine has a bouquet of apricot and geranium leaf. Flavors of white peach, guava and bitter almond make the mouth pucker just a bit. The finish is marked by notes of flint and saline.
Importer: Georgian House of Greater Washington, LLC
Name: Teliani Valley 2015 Tsinandali White (Kakheti)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Yeasty pear and citrus peel aromas introduce this crisp, quaffable white. Its saline and stone fruit flavors hold steady through the finish.
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2017 Protocolo Made With Organic Grapes White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This delivers fresh but generic apple, pear and stone fruit aromas. It's soft on the palate, with saline-rich flavors of apple and lettuce that finish steady.
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2017 Protocolo White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Aromas suggesting medicinal herb, adhesive bandage, lime zest and Mediterranean scrub appear in the glass. The aromas follow over to the palate along with tangy acidity.
Name: Firriato 2017 Le Sabbie dell'  (Etna)

Description: A 50-50 blend of Inzolia and Catarratto, this simple white has intense floral aromas evoking jasmine and hawthorn. The floral aromas carry through to the fresh palate along with green apple, ripe white peach and a citrus note.
Name: Colosi 2017 White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This blend of 60% Merseguera, 20% Sauvignon Blanc and 20% Verdejo features pleasant floral aromas and a racy palate with some inherent creaminess. Its briny citrus, lime and salt flavors don't waver on the finish.
Name: Vicente Gandia 2017 Hoya de Cadenas 130 Anniversary White (Valencia)

Description: Pretty, light aromas of green melon rind, lime leaf, thyme, clover and just-dried grass dance on the nose of this white blend. The palate offers even less intensity, with a faint green-melon flavor and a thin yet clean mouthfeel. Drink now.
Name: Château Belles Eaux 2015 Les Coteaux White (Languedoc)

Description: This is one quarter each Sauvignon Blanc, Muscat, Verdejo and Chardonnay—a blend you're not likely to find elsewhere. Its mix of tropical and floral aromas comes with a cheesy-smelling overlay. In the mouth, it's highly acidic, with sour and salty flavors.
Name: Angosto 2017 Parcelas De Familia White (Valencia)

Description: This wine's generic white fruit aromas are indicative of neither the Sauvignon Blanc nor the Chardonnay in this blend. It's chunky on the palate, with cactus, tarragon and green citrus notes. A texturally solid finish ensures that this leaves a mostly positive final impression.
Name: Príncipe de Viana 2017 Edición Blanca Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc (Navarra)

Description: This wine's cidery nose and watery, spritzy palate announce a generic white wine with sea brine and lemon water flavors. It has a short but tangy finish.
Name: Marqués de Vizhoja 2016 White (Spain)

Description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Macabeo offers yeasty nectarine and vanilla cookie aromas. It has high acidity but low overall quality., with lightly oxidized, salty citrus flavors.
Name: Aranleón 2017 Sólo Organic White (Utiel-Requena)

Description: This wine's odd, yeasty aromas are the result of a mismatched blend of Chardonnay, Viura and Moscatel. The palate is flabby, with cured ham flavors. A grape skin-like bitterness takes over on the finish.
Name: Ochoa 2017 Calendas White (Navarra)

Description: This wine's generic melon and white fruit aromas are backed by a green note of pyrazine. It's equally basic on the palate, with stalky, oxidized white fruit flavors.
Name: Vallobera 2017 Famillia San Pedro White (Rioja)

Description: A mild nose marked by tropical and citrus aromas is a high point for this Sauvignon Blanc and Verdejo blend. The palate feels oily and pinched; its mix of tropical fruit and vegetal flavors leads to a briny finish with green notes.
Name: Bodega Andrés Iniesta 2017 Corazón Loco White (Manchuela)

Description: This leads with sweaty hay and bath oil aromas. The palate is heavy, lacking vivacity. Its salty melon flavors are short and a touch sour.
Name: Berberana 2014 Dragon Reserva White (Catalunya)
