Description: This wine's waxy, petrol-like aromas are more suggestive of Riesling than Rioja. With only modest acidity and a high level of residual sugar, it's cloying on the palate. Its sweet mango and melon flavors finish flat and slightly bitter.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2016 Satinela Semi Dulce White (Rioja)

Description: This wine's oxidized aromas bring Cream of Wheat to mind. Its spritzy palate is green and clipped, with bready, oxidized flavors. Whatever citrus fruit it has is green and turns bitter on the finish.
Name: Perelada NV Blanc Pescador White (Catalonia)

Description: A yellow color and astringent aromas of grape skins, petrol and pyrazines set this blend of Airen, Macabeo and Sauvignon Blanc off on the wrong foot. Its stale fruit and yeast flavors seem oxidized.
Name: Manuel Manzaneque Suárez 2016 Fatum White (La Mancha)

Description: This wine's tomato vine, passion fruit, white stone fruit and herb aromas jump out of the glass. The delicious, elegantly restrained palate delivers grapefruit, white peach, apple and mineral flavors alongside fresh acidity. A tangy lemon-drop note backs up the long, lingering finish. Drink now–2025.
Name: Jermann 2015 Vintage Tunina White (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Heady aromas of honeysuckle and yellow stone fruit leap out of the glass. A blend of Grechetto (a small percentage of which is grown in volcanic soils), Procanico, Pinot Bianco and Viognier, the juicy, delicious palate delivers peach, apricot, orange zest and a hint of pineapple. It's savory and balanced, with tangy acidity.
Designation: Castello della Sala San Giovanni della Sala
Name: Marchesi Antinori 2016 Castello della Sala San Giovanni della Sala  (Orvieto Classico)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's ripe apricot, vanilla and maple syrup aromas follow through to the rich palate, along with marzipan and acacia honey notes. It's enveloping and well balanced, with a long finish.
Name: Volpaia 2012  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rather wondrous aromas of pear peels, nectarine flesh, gardenias and crushed chalk become almost like a wearable perfume on this blend of 36% Chardonnay, 32% Pinot Blanc and 32% Pinot Gris. The palate is tightly woven and strongly acidic, offering flavors of Anjou pear, lime juice and more chalk.
Name: Barden 2016 Fonte White (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This complex and structured wine opens with intense ripe orchard fruit, tropical fruit, herb and balsamic aromas. The round, full-bodied palate delivers ripe yellow apple, yellow peach, almond, honey and mineral notes. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors. Truly delicious. Drink through 2023.
Name: Palazzone 2015 Campo del Guardiano  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: This is made like a white wine using 52% Pinot Noir and 48% Chardonnay grapes, intended as a bright, white summer wine that's highly drinkable and served chilled. It is indeed quaffable, white in color with a citrus-led nose of crisp, focused and fresh flavor, marked especially by green apple and a hint of cherry. Light in ripeness, it's a perfect picnic wine.
Name: Brick & Mortar 2017 Vin Clair White (Napa Valley)

Description: White spring blossom, apple and aromatic herb scents lead the way in this lovely white. The round, medium-bodied palate doles out ripe pear, citrus and white peach notes. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors while a tangy saline note lifts the finish.
Name: Decugnano dei Barbi 2016 Villa Barbi  (Orvieto Classico)

Description: Lychee, citrus blossom, white stone fruit and a yeasty whiff of bread dough are some of the aromas you'll find in this intriguing blend of Sauvignon, Friulano, Ribolla Gialla and Pinot Grigio. The enveloping, structured palate is elegant and savory, delivering white peach, apple, citrus zest and bitter almond hints.
Name: Raccaro 2016 Bianco White (Collio)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's nose is rather shy, but its juicy palate offers baked apple, candied orange zest and tropical fruit notes. Tangy acidity brightens the rich flavors. It closes on a toasted almond note.
Name: La Lastra 2016 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: The peel of russet pear, the flesh of ripe red apple, the herbal tang of pimpernel. All of these notions meet in the nose of this expressive wine. The dry palate is light but has a lovely, slightly funky element of earthiness that also lends texture as a counterweight to the bright zesty freshness. The finish is clean, dry and deliciously bracing.
Name: Wieninger 2017 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made from equal parts dried Trebbiano and Malvasia grapes, this has inviting maple syrup, toasted hazelnut and ginger aromas. The concentrated palate delivers chestnut honey, candied fig and white almond notes.
Name: Losi Querciavalle 2001  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Dried fig, orange zest, candied apricot and almond aromas emerge from this wine. They carry over to the concentrated, velvety palate, along with walnut and acacia honey notes.
Name: Castello di Cacchiano 2004  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made from 80% Trebbiano and 20% Malvasia, this opens with dried fig and orange jam aromas. The warm, concentrated palate delivers toasted hazelnut, chestnut honey and apricot jam notes. Drink through 2025.
Name: Cantagallo 2010 Montalbano Millarium Riserva  (Vin Santo del Chianti)

Description: Bright, ripe and fruity, this is a rich wine. Full of apple and warm pear flavors, it is concentrated and intense. Touches of spice and pepper add to the poise of the Courselle sisters' stylish, full wine. Drink now.
Name: Château Thieuley 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Aromas like green apple slices precede flavors like Anjou pears, butter and almonds in this medium- to full-bodied wine that blends the unorthodox Verdelho grape variety with Chardonnay, Riesling and Sémillon. Crisp acidity matches a certain richness for good balance, and helps create a lingering attractive finish.
Name: Fenestra 2016 True White (California)

Description: Lemony oak is the lead aroma on a round powerful nose with strong barrel influences. Substantive, round and deep, this barrel-fermented Viura is classic in style. Flavors of buttery oak, wood grain, spiced apple and nutmeg finish long, with the lasting impact of nine months spent in French oak. Drink through 2024.
Name: Finca Allende 2016 Martires Single Vineyard Estate Bottled White (Rioja)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This structured blend of dried Malvasia, Trebbiano and Sangiovese grapes boasts toasted hazelnut, ripe apricot and peach jam aromas. The warm, enveloping palate offers chestnut honey and mature fig notes while a touch of pistachio wraps up the finish.
Name: I Veroni 2008  Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's alluring, delicate scents of white stone fruit, pressed wildflowers and almonds float out of the glass. The savory, linear palate offers mature yellow apple, Bartlett pear, chopped herb and hazelnut notes. Bright acidity gives it a crisp, pristine finish.
Name: Palazzone 2016 Terre Vineate  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: Both green and red apple, earth and orange zest play on the nose. The light but expressive palate echoes these notions and backs them with a lightly phenolic texture and zesty freshness. This is a vivid, fresh and utterly versatile white, with a clean dry finish.
Name: Zahel 2017 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Appellation: Isonzo del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's intense dried apricot, graphite and bitter almond aromas follow through to the savory, structured palate, along with a note of candied nectarine drop. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Ronco del Gelso 2015 Latimis White (Isonzo del Friuli)

Description: This ripe wine with its red baked-apple and cream flavors is full, juicy and packed with fruit flavors with a touch of nutmeg. It is ready to drink but will mature even more over the next few months.
Name: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2017 Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Full ripeness and a rich texture promise much for this delicious wine. Its acidity plays a good supporting role for the ripe apricot and pear fruits with their touch of tangy edge. This well-made wine twill age. Drink ideally from late 2018.
Name: Château Toutigeac 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This blend of organically farmed Procanico, Verdello, Grechetto and Rupeccio opens with acacia flower, orchard fruit, flint and thyme aromas. The structured, savory palate delivers Williams pear, lemon zest and mint touches alongside fresh acidity. A pleasant mineral note signals the close.
Name: Sergio Mottura 2016 Tragugnano  (Orvieto)

Description: This perfumed wine from the Fronsac's Gabard family is well balanced, with a warmth that is immediately enticing. The spice and ripe lychee flavors give it richness as well as adding complexity. Drink this well-structured, lightly mineral wine now.
Name: Château La Croix de Queynac 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Strong notes of apricot and tropical fruits dominate this Sauvignon Blanc, sourced from a nine-acre vineyard. It has a rich core that is juicy, while the fresher lemon and lime flavors give it an exotic perfumed character. This full, ripe wine is delicious and ready to drink now.
Name: Château La Rame 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A blend of Riesling and Petit Manseng, this wine is anything but ordinary. A gorgeous bouquet of orange peel, geranium, white peach and petrol lead the way to flavors that echo the aromas, as well as additional notes of apple peel, button mushroom and oyster. The umami element is really engaging to the senses and adds a creamy dimension the the mouthfeel. Despite the lovely acidity, the finish is won over by a creaminess.
Name: Lightwell Survey 2015 Hintermen White (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made from organically farmed, dried Trebbiano, Malvasia and San Colombano grapes, this offers walnut, candied nectarine and caramel aromas. The rich but balanced palate delivers mature apricot, toasted almond and fig flavors.
Name: Mannucci Droandi 2008 Ceppeto  (Vin Santo del Chianti Classico)

Description: This rounded wine is ripe, full and offers clean, perfumed green and white stone fruits. It has plenty of acidity as well as riper apricot and pear flavors. With its richness, it is suitable for food.
Name: Château Ballan-Larquette 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This blend of Pinot Grigio, Chardonnay and Sauvignon opens with tropical fruit, tomato vine and pink grapefruit aromas. The ripe, round palate shows juicy apricot, yellow apple and tangy lemon drop flavors accompanied by a toasted almond note. Just enough freshness lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Lis Neris 2013 Lis White (Venezia Giulia)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of stone fruit and field flower lift out of the glass. Round and creamy, the fresh palate offers juicy white peach, Rennet apple and lemon zest flavors. A salty mineral note closes the finish.
Name: Decugnano dei Barbi 2016 Mare Antico  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: Fragrant notes of ripe crunchy red apple on the nose carry their vivid freshness and scent over to the light but zesty, fresh palate. The idea of zestiness also informs the lip-smacking texture of the wine and lasts long on the dry zippy finish.
Name: Gebeshuber 2017 Querfeldein. in weiß White (Thermenregion)

Description: Tropical fruit, tomato vine and hay aromas lead the nose of this wine. The savory palate doles out white peach, grapefruit and lemon drop hints alongside tangy acidity. It closes on an almond note.
Name: Colmello di Grotta 2015 Sanfilip White (Collio)

Description: Crunchy red and green apple and lifted Amalfi lemon notes rise from the glass. The palate is light, juicy and bright and carries these apple and lemon hints to a fresh clean dry finish.
Name: Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2017 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Subtle red-apple notes on the nose lead onto an equally subtle, light but slightly fragrant palate. The body is slender, dry and comes with a far fruitier finish than expected. Apple fruit dominates the dry finish.
Name: Gebeshuber 2017 Spaetrot Klassik White (Thermenregion)

Description: This bright, ripe wine offers a backdrop of ripe apples. Its mineral texture is now softening to broaden out into rich spice, pear and crisp lemon. Drink the wine from late 2018.
Name: Producta Vignobles 2017 Mission St Vincent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Barrel-heavy aromas of raw oak and vanilla dominate the nose on this blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca. Lively acidity gives life and balance to a full resiny palate, while this tastes much like it smells: oaky and briny, with citrusy undertones. A mild finish that's nutty and salty is lasting.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2016 Organza White (Rioja)

Description: This wine is ripe with flavors of spice, pear and Meyer lemon. Fragrant and refreshing, it is lively, full and packed with fruitiness. Drink this wine now.
Name: Château Lary 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Toasted nut, mature yellow stone fruit and butter aromas emerge from this blend of Friulano, Malvasia Istriana and Ribolla Gialla. They carry over to the medium-bodied palate, along with nectarine notes. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.
Name: Muzic 2015 White (Collio)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with dried apricot and flaky pastry crust aromas. The sweet, rather fresh palate offers apricot jam, clover honey and toasted pine nut hints.
Name: Travignoli 2010 Riserva  (Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina)

Description: This bright, fruity wine is crisp with delicious acidity and ripe with rich apricot and pear flavors. It is a full-bodied wine but one that is balanced with lively aftertaste and touches of spice. Drink now.
Name: Chai de Bordes 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Fruity aromas are followed through by ripe apple and apricot flavors. These make for a rich, smooth wine, packed with dense fruitiness and final acidity. The aftertaste is ripe and full. Drink now.
Name: Château de Seguin 2017 Sauvignon de Seguin  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This wine is packed with ripe apple, quince and hints of apricot. Spice flavors give it a fine bite at the end. Drink this balanced, full and fruity wine now.
Name: Château La Rose Saint Germain 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This rich wine has a crisp edge to balance its generous apple and green-pear flavors. The creamy texture is full, leavened by crisp herbaceousness. The two elements give a rich, intense wine that will benefit from aging. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Château Lauduc 2017 Classic  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Ripe, soft and well balanced, this wine is already delicious. Layers of apricot, white peach and quince come with just the right amount of acidity and lemon zest. Drink now.
Name: Château Rauzan Despagne 2017 Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This full-bodied, dry wine has vivid apple and butter aromas. The palate is ripe and mouthfilling, with a baked-apple flavor and a generous, broad texture. It offers the appeal of ripe fruit alongside a luscious mouthfeel.
Name: Blindfold 2016 White (California)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This blend of Procanico, Grechetto, Chardonnay and Sauvignon has candied fruit, marzipan and chestnut honey aromas. The forward palate offers orange zest, peach jam and vanilla flavors while a sweet almond note closes the finish.
Name: Salviano 2016 Vendemmia Tardiva  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: Yellow stone fruit, toasted oak and bread crust aromas lead the nose of this blend of Friulano and Ribolla Gialla. The medium-bodied palate offers Golden Delicious apple, exotic fruit and bitter almond hints.
Name: Livon 2015 Solarco White (Collio)

Description: This spicy, lightly smoky wine is rich and full of fruit. A touch of pepper goes with the rich pear and apricot flavors. The wine is full in the mouth, intensely fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Château des Mille Anges 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Crisp sliced-apple flavors give this wine a distinctive and delicious character. It has a touch of spice along with plenty of acidity, giving a ripe wine that has a good burst of freshness at the end. Drink now.
Name: Château Haut-Rian 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This unusual blend of Pinot Grigio, Gewürztraminer and Riesling opens with heady aromas of dried apricot and white rose. Those aromas carry over to the syrupy palate, along with mature yellow peach, Golden Delicious apple, candied nectarine and bitter almond hints. Fresh acidity gives the rich flavors a much-needed boost.
Name: Lis Neris 2013 Confini White (Venezia Giulia)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Fragrant spring flower and white stone fruit aromas lead the nose of this blend of organically farmed Vernaccia (90%) and Chardonnay (10%). On the rounded palate, bitter almond accents back up juicy white peach and citrus rind flavors.
Name: Poderi Arcangelo 2016 Terra del Lago  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: Tense and mineral driven, this is a young wine. With its fruit-driven acidity, it is fresh while also having richness and concentration. This dense wine will be better from late 2018.
Name: Château du Cros 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine is ripe, soft with rich apple and pear fruits. With balanced acidity and a youthful zesty character, it is full, rounded and will pair well with food. The aftertaste adds a perfumed character. Drink this wine now.
Name: Caves de Rauzan 2017 Augey  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Appley floral aromas meet rich ripe apple and pear flavors in this generous mouthfilling and smooth-textured wine. It is medium bodied, fragrant and easy to enjoy, especially with an appetizer like smoked trout.
Name: Naggiar 2017 Mamma Mia Estate White (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Smooth and ripe, this rounded wine has a rich character as well as crisper acidity. It is softly textured, full of great fruit and ready to drink.
Name: Château des Antonins 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Tangy and mineral driven, this bright, crisp and fruity wine holds 70% Sémillon. Its texture is dominant at this stage, emphasizing a herbal character and intense acidity needs to soften. Wait for this Dulon family wine until the end of 2018.
Name: Château Grand Jean 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This refreshing, bright wine from the Rochet family is full of acidity and delicious apple and spice flavors. Its balance is just right, hinting at an herbal edge while preserving the pure direct of fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Chateau Malbat 2017 L'Authentique  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Juicy, crisp and fruity, this is an immediately refreshing wine. It has an herbal edge although the wine is really more about apple and pear flavors. Drink now.
Name: Château Merlet 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A touch of honeysuckle, a hint of crushed citrus foliage and grass are hinted at. They also shimmer on the light palate where vivid freshness leads onto a fragrant dry finish.
Name: Der Pollerhof 2017 vom Löss White (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Producer Jean-Bernard Larrieu describes this unfiltered wine from organically grown grapes bottled without sulfur as libre or natural. It has a certain oxidative character with a touch of honey and smooth yellow fruit. Drink now.
Name: Lapeyre 2016 Evidéncia White (Vin de France)

Description: Juicy, fruity and with a good balance between acidity and crisp apple flavors, this wine is ripe and full of fruitiness. It has a zesty tang as well as some minerality that balances the great fruit. Drink now.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2017 Petite Nancy Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Fruity, crisp and with a tight texture, this is a concentrated wine. Piles of acidity, crisp grapefruit and lemon, and a strongly zesty character join in this delicious wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Château Gabaron 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas reminiscent of toasted oak, tomato vines and yellow wildflowers take shape in the glass. The full-bodied palate doles out candied citrus zest, grapefruit, vanilla and pineapple notes set against fresh acidity. A bitter almond note lingers on the close, as does some alcoholic warmth.
Name: Poderi del Paradiso 2016 Biscondola  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: This is a crisp, fruity wine with lively acidity. Its bright texture and lemon and grapefruit purity are delicious and ready to drink.
Name: Château Terres Douces 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Orange zest and fresh apples make for a most appetizing and fragrant nose. The palate is just as vivid, fruit-forward and fresh. This may be easy and totally driven by fruit but is carries bags of charm despite its lightness. It's the quintessential party wine.
Name: Dürnberg 2017 Falko Cool Climate White (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a mineral-driven wine, still young and very textured. It has a tight character, more structure and texture than fruit at this stage, but it's sure to open up as it matures. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Château Bois Malot 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This well-balanced, ripe wine has an herbal edge that contrasts comfortably with the grapefruit and apple flavors. It has a tangy texture, hinting at minerality as well as fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Château la France 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Attractively perfumed, this wine is ripe with kiwi and pink-grapefruit flavors. Its zesty acidity and mineral edge suggest that it will age well, certainly over the next several months. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Château Larroque 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Siblings Florence and Philippe Giraud reserve 10% of their red vineyards for white wine. This is ripe, with soft, smooth creamed-pear flavors. Acidity and crispness give the wine balance. The crisp juicy fresh character is refreshing and the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château Timberlay 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's tropical fruit and peach aromas carry over to the bright, fruity palate, along with green apple, banana and citrus suggestions. A hint of bitter almond marks the close.
Name: Salviano 2017  Orvieto Classico Superiore

Description: This wine has concentration, with ripe baked-apple and creamy flavors. Its acidity balances with the lively white fruits and taut mineral texture. Drink now.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2017 Légende  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Crisp and perfumed as well as herbaceous, this is a fruity wine with lively acidity and a clean, bright aftertaste. Grapefruit and lemon flavors dominate this ready-to-drink wine.
Name: Maison Ginestet 2017 Le Bordeaux de Larrivet Haut-Brion  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: The Barthe family vineyard, under the same ownership since 1789, is in an ideal place for white wines. Spice, ripe white fruits and acidity all come into play. The lively texture and fruitiness enhance this lightly perfumed wine. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Château la Freynelle 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Lychee aromas give this wine a perfumed character that follows through to the palate, which is full of great fruit and spice. This warm wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château Les Combes 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Spicy, rounded and with attractive acidity to match, this wine is rich and full in the mouth. Green-fruit flavors are balanced by the ripe apricot, nutmeg and vanilla richness. Drink now.
Name: Château la Verrière 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine is intense with pear flavors that gives it a delicious, ripe character. Add in the pepper, spice and acidity, and the wine is balanced, fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Château Le Bonalguet 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Oxidized aromas of waxy white fruits lack freshness and suggest murk and age. While this blend of Garnacha Blanca and Macabeo is holding onto its solid mouthfeel, it tastes mostly of old wood and spiced melon. On the finish, notes of raw wood and buttered popcorn are out front.
Name: Mas d'en Gil 2013 Coma Blanca White (Priorat)

Description: While the aromas and flavors are very faint, there is a complexity imparted by lees. Lemon and orange peel are met with notes of pilsner and mealy apple. Texturally, this is really nice—creamy and sprightly all at once. The finish is long and leesy.
Name: Rosemont NV White (Virginia)

Description: This combines 65% Sémillon and 35% Sauvignon Blanc into a fleshy floral expression of textured green apple and melon that's considerably weighty in body and ripeness.
Name: Shadybrook 2015 Platiné Blanc Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Taut and crisp, this is a lively, bright wine with intense acidity and a tangy, mineral texture that accompanies layers of pear, lemon and gooseberry. Drink now.
Name: Château Reynon 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Full, ripe and fruity, this is a rounded wine from the Cadillac estate. Packed with apple, lemon and spice flavors, it is mouth-filling, rich and ready to drink.
Name: Château de Birot 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A ripe wine, this has rich apricot and pear flavors. Acidity adds a fresh bite and gives the wine an extra depth of flavor. Drink now.
Name: Château Haut Pougnan 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This easygoing blend has a rather earthy nose suggesting almost overripe pear fruit. The palate is pliable, soft, fruity and fresh: an easy summery Austrian white with a dry finish.
Name: Der Pollerhof 2017 Apoll White (Weinland Österreich)

Description: Recognizable for its bulldog mascot in sunglasses on the label, this is a rich, intensely fruity Sauvignon Blanc. Great acidity is balanced with rich apple and ripe Bartlett pear flavors that lead to a refreshing tang at the end. Drink the wine now.
Name: Vignerons de Tutiac 2017 Flair  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Crisp and herbal, this wine also has plenty of acidity that enhances the zesty orange-peel flavors. Along with its mineral texture, the wine is intensely fruity, refreshing and ready to drink.
Name: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Immediately perfumed, this wine is crisp, spicy and with great acidity. Its ripe character is enhanced by lemon and gooseberry flavors as well as nutmeg and a rich aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château de Marsan 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Oxidized stone-fruit aromas blend with vanilla and rubbery notes on this blend of mostly Garnacha Blanca and Viognier. In the mouth, this feels resiny and creamy, and ultimately rather monotone. Vanilla and wood-resin flavors are prominent prior to an oaky finish that's low on fruit.
Name: Marco Abella 2015 Òlbia White (Priorat)

Description: This herbal, crisp wine is taut with mineral-driven acidity. It is still young, still tight and with a lively aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Michel Lynch 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Ripe apricot and quince flavors give this wine a rich, full-bodied character. It is intense and packed with fruit, giving the wine a warm character. Drink now.
Name: Château de Parenchère 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Crisp and fruity, this wine is light and bright. Its poise and refreshing apple and grapefruit flavors are lively, with a mineral edge. Drink this attractive wine now.
Name: Château Recougne 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Instant is a great name for this wine, because with its great fruit it can be drunk immediately. It has a herbal edge from the Sauvignon Blanc while also conveying ripe yellow fruits, apple and pear. The aftertaste is crisp with lemon zest.
Name: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2017 L'Instant  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Dry and attractively reserved, this light-bodied small-production wine smells like flint and white pepper, tastes clean and minerally and feels crisp on the palate.
Name: American House Wine 2016 White (California)

Description: This is a light, bright wine with tangy fruit, spice and herbal hints. The mineral texture gives the wine a bite to go with its intense fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Château du Claouset 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine is light in texture and flavor. It has crisp herbal acidity but it needs a few more months to bring out the grapefruit and orange-zest flavors. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Château le Grand Verdus 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Nutmeg and cinnamon flavors give this wine an exotic edge that masks the fruit at this stage in its development. That will change, so wait to drink this wine until late 2018.
Name: Château Turcaud 2017 Cuvée Majeure  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: With a tan color and murky aromas of rubber and stale fruits, this aging Viura (with 5% Malvasia) appears past its prime. High citric acidity lends zest to a palate that's losing clarity. Sour briny woody flavors are mostly salty and low on fruit. On the finish, this displays a pickled note of sauerkraut along with dry almond skins.
Name: Finca Allende 2014 White (Rioja)

Description: Light peach and apple aromas lead to ripe sweet melon and peach flavors and a soft smooth texture. It's an easygoing fruit-forward off-dry wine.
Name: Apothic 2016 White (California)

Description: A light wine, this is tight with fruit, acidity and a mineral edge. The wine also has perfume and a touch of spice that gives it extra interest and balance. Drink now.
Name: Château Borie de Noaillan 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Bright and fruity, this light, fresh wine is ready to drink. It has an easy character, light fruit and refreshing crispness.
Name: Château d'Haurets 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Rich pear flavors dominate this ripe, full wine. It has touches of spice as well as the rich fruit, perfumed and generous. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A heavy coating of oak aromas gives this midlevel white blend a resiny outlook. In the mouth, this is medium in body but flabby due to low acidity. A flavor profile based mostly on oak includes notes of popcorn and butter, while this is woody and less than precise on the finish.
Name: Alta Alella 2016 Lanius Organic White (Alella)

Description: Herbal and spicy, this ripe wine is full of apple and crisp lemon and lime flavors. Its fruitiness is balanced by acidity and a tangy aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château de Cazenove 2017 La Blanc de Cazenove  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Bright, tight and crisp, this balanced, spicy wine offers plenty of grapefruit and lemon-zest flavors. Light in texture and packed with fruit, it is ready to drink.
Name: Château Haut Mouleyre 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This easygoing wine has ripe yellow and white-stone fruits all balanced with generous acidity. It's a rich wine that is also full of freshness. Drink this lightly perfumed wine now.
Name: Château La Gabarre 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine is tight and herbal. With its green fruits and intense acidity it is crisp, concentrated and has a strong mineral edge. Drink the wine from later in 2018.
Name: Château Pilet 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This quince and rhubarb-flavored wine is a crisp, with an herbal edge as well as ripe fruitiness. With a lively aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château de l'Aubrade 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: While this wine is perfumed, it is also rather unfocused, the fruit and acidity at odds with the spicy character. Drink now.
Name: Château de la Vieille Tour 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This perfumed wine is almost too much. With its candy-shop fruitiness and lychee and kiwi flavors it perhaps misses out on crispness, certainly hardly typical white Bordeaux. Drink now.
Name: Château de L'Hoste Blanc 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A ripe wine with some fruitiness, this is softly textured. A bitter edge needs to blow off before the wine is ready to drink, so wait until late 2018.
Name: Château Petit Moulin 2017  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This white Rhône-style blend has a bright gold color, a bit of haziness and some harmless tartrate crystals, so it's easy to guess there was little intervention by the winemaker. It has vivid fig and almond aromas and a honey-like flavor along with a rich texture and a late-harvest character.
Name: Sol Rouge 2015 Gypsy Blanc White (Lake County)

Description: Spicy, rich and now fully mature this is a fascinating wine from Jean-Bernard Larrieu. Rich in almond and smoky flavors, it has intense acidity and great concentration. Blending Petit Manseng, Petit Courbu and the rare, nearly extinct, Camaralet, this great wine is ready to drink.
Name: Lapeyre 2012 Mantoulan  (Jurançon Sec)

Description: Mature Jurançon is a wonderful thing. It never loses that crisp edge of acidity while showing richness from candied orange, spice and honey flavors. This is a ripe, full wine although with poise and a restrained intensity. Drink this delicious wine now.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2011 Clos Cancaillau Le Dernier Carré  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A blend of Fiano and Greco, this offers enticing scents of Spanish broom, yellow stone fruit and wild herb. Elegant and savory, the bright palate delivers juicy white grapefruit, yellow pear and flinty mineral alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2016 Campanaro  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: One of several single-parcel wines produced by the De Conti family, this Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine is packed with dense tropical-fruit flavors, ripe spice and caramel, all balanced with acidity. It has the weight of clay and chalk soil behind it and plenty of concentration. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2016 Moulin des Dames White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: This wine has a gold color and delicious, lightly oxidative character. Although dry, it has a honeyed character, with tight minerality and intense acidity as a contrast. Jean-Bernard Larrieu is a proponent of the local culture so this wine, in the ancient Béarn dialect, means old vintage.
Name: Lapeyre 2013 Vitatge Vielh  (Jurançon Sec)

Description: A blend of Fiano and Greco, this offers enticing scents of white spring flower, citrus, sea breeze and orchard fruit. The savory elegant palate offers white peach, yellow pear and juicy lemon drop alongside bright acidity. Saline and a hint of hazelnut grace the finish.
Name: Montevetrano 2016 Core White (Campania)

Description: Paraffin, crushed rock, crushed Mediterranean herb and citrus aromas come to the forefront. Linear and savory, the bright, elegant palate offers citrus zest, apricot and nectarine alongside tangy acidity. A saline note lifts the finish.
Name: La Sibilla 2015 Cruna del Lago White (Campi Flegrei)

Description: Intense aromas of white rose, grapefruit and Mediterranean brush lead the nose on this intriguing wine. Made with 100% Caprettone, the bright, enveloping palate delivers pineapple, candied orange zest, dried apricot and bitter almond. A flinty mineral note energizes the finish while fresh acidity provides the backbone.
Name: Bosco de' Medici 2016 Pompeii White (Pompeiano)

Description: The striking nose offers sea breeze, tropical fruit, toasted nuts and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. The elegant palate doles out pineapple, ripe yellow apple, peach and citrus alongside bright crisp acidity and a hint of saline. A coffee note lingers on the close.
Name: San Salvatore 1988 2015 Elea White (Paestum)

Description: Saussignac is a small appellation in the Bergerac region noted for its sweet wines. This honeyed wine, with its layers of dry botrytis as well as rich sweetness, is a fine example from a top producer. Made from organically grown grapes, it is full of marmalade, orange and spice, rich while still having crisp acidity to balance. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2015 Le Saussignac White (Saussignac)

Description: This is a blend of 65% Viognier, 28% Chardonnay and smaller amounts of Rousanne and Marsanne. Aromatic in jasmine, it's medium bodied with fresh, vibrant layers of fresh acidity built around strong flavors of apricot and apple.
Name: Paraduxx 2016 Proprietary White (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Honey, pear crushed stone and nut aromas follow over to the crisp structured palate along with a tangy saline note. Savory and elegant, it has good body and nice length.
Name: Casa Setaro 2015 Munazei White (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: This white wine, which comes from the same vineyard region as Madiran's red Tannat, is crisp while ripe. Its blend of the two Manseng grapes offers hints of apricot and honey, even though the wine is dry. Weight at the end gives final dense richness. Drink the wine now.
Name: Famille Laplace 2016 Odé d'Aydie  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Spanish broom, mature yellow stone fruit and a whiff of oak rise out of the glass. The concentrated palate offers candied citrus zest, dried apricot, vanilla and toast while a coffee note backs up the finish.
Name: Marisa Cuomo 2016 Furore Bianco Fiorduva White (Costa d'Amalfi)

Appellation: Falerno del Massico, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Alluring scents of honeysuckle and tropical fruit lead the nose while the round palate doles out honeydew melon, creamy white peach and juicy citrus. Bright acidity lifts the ripe flavors.
Name: Villa Matilde 2017 White (Falerno del Massico)

Description: Even in dry Jurançon wine, a hint of honey comes from the two Manseng grapes in the blend. Here the honey taste adds to the wine's weight and richness. Yellow fruits, spice and pepper give ripeness and a tight edge. Drink from 2019.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 Cami Salié  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This blend of Petit and Gros Manseng has both the intense freshness of Jurançon and its great sweetness. Apricot and honey contrast with acidity and a zingy bite. Drink this wine from 2020.
Name: Château de Jurque 2016 Tendresse  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: This luscious wine with its blend of the two Manseng grapes is full of ripe peach and apricot flavors laced with honey. As with all the wines from this region, it has intense acidity that keeps it fresh, almost crisp, certainly not heavy. The wine could age further, so drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Berthoumieu 2016 Charles de Batz Vendange d'Octobre  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: A rich wine, this is full of spicy apricot, kiwi and honey flavors. The delicious combination offers a pepper edge along with great acidity. Richness and weight are balanced by the intensely crisp aftertaste. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Domaine Berthoumieu 2016 Les Pierres des Grès  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral in aromatics—think lemongrass and jasmine—this estate-grown wine is creamy yet light in feel. The palate brings distinct flavors of crisp green apple, apricot, lime and wet stone.
Designation: Don Miguel Vineyard Estate Grown & Bottled
Name: Marimar Estate 2016 Don Miguel Vineyard Estate Grown & Bottled Chardonnay-Albariño (Russian River Valley)

Description: A blend of Falanghina, Fiano and Greco, this opens with heady aromas of Spanish broom, tropical fruit, citrus and a whiff of honey. Full bodied and savory, the palate offers pineapple, mature yellow apple and toasted hazelnut alongside bright acidity.
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2015 Sogno di Rivolta White (Beneventano)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A blend of 85% Caprettone and 15% Falanghina, this offers delicately enticing aromas of beeswax, acacia, orchard fruit and Mediterranean scrub. Reflecting the nose, the palate offers honey, yellow apple and a note of bitter almond while a saline note caps off the finish.
Name: Bosco de' Medici 2016 Lavaflava White (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is principally Sauvignon Blanc, but the 20% Moscato Giallo lends the predominant aroma. Fermented in neutral oak barrels and finished totally dry, it's a leesy, creamy, richly-textured white with a strong flavor of wet stone, citrus rind and fresh-squeezed lemon. A distinctive and refreshing style that complements the winery's other whites.
Name: Viola 2016 Bianco d'Allegre White (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: This sweet wine brings out flavors of honey, rich apricot jam and spice. While intensely fruity, the palate is well-balanced by driving acidity. The wine is a blend of Loin de l'Oeil and Sauvignon Blanc. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine Rotier 2016 Les Gravels White (Gaillac Doux)

Description: This wine is so fresh that its sweetness is almost refreshing. It's a delightful, poised wine with bright acidity and a light touch of honey, perfumed and crisp. It is ready to drink.
Name: Château Jolys 2016  Jurançon
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Falerno del Massico, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Falanghina, this has delicately enticing scents suggesting white and yellow spring wild flower, citrus and orchard fruit. The bright palate doles out ripe yellow apple, tangerine and wild herb framed in zesty acidity. It closes on a savory sea salt note.
Name: Vitis Aurunca 2016 Agnese White (Falerno del Massico)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of wild spring flower and orchard fruit delicately lift out of the glass. On the round palate, you'll find mature yellow stone fruit, citrus and white almond on the close.
Name: Alois 2015 Caiatì Bianco White (Terre del Volturno)

Description: A blend of 85% Fiano and 15% Greco, this opens with delicate scents evoking Spanish broom, honey and a whiff of cake spice. On the vibrant, linear palate, crisp acidity boosts Golden Delicious apple and a citrus zest note.
Name: San Giovanni 2016 White (Paestum)

Description: Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon nurture the botrytis and honey in this wine. It has a dry edge to the apricot and bitter marmalade flavors, with just a hint of acidity. Drink this ripe, sweet wine from 2019.
Name: Château Bélingard 2015 Réserve  (Monbazillac)

Description: This is a rich wine, made from the same grapes that make the sweet Jurançon. It has weight as well as crisp citrus flavors, rounded but with a zesty edge that gives the wine a final lift. Drink now.
Name: Château Jolys 2016  Jurançon Sec
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is an attractive wine, well poised between perfumed honey flavors and soft acidity. It is still fruity, even after three years, with a crisp and tangy edge. The wine is just right to drink now.
Name: Villa Dria 2015 Chardonnay-Gros Manseng White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Attractive pear, apple, peach and guava notes are backed by a wet stone quality on the nose. The mouthfeel is tight and refreshing, with a medium body and a long, fruity mouthwatering finish.
Name: Settlers Rise 2016 White (South Eastern Australia)

Description: An unusual blend of 80% Verdelho with some Riesling and Chardonnay, this is an aromatic, floral wine, with plenty of ripe stone fruit tones. The palate is oily in texture, with decent acidity and a copper penny tang on the finish.
Name: Red Heads Studio 2016 Yard Dog White (McLaren Vale)

Description: A nose of melon and orange zest makes way for flavors of pineapple, guava and almond blossom. This wine is round on the palate, with a bright finish that has a floral note.
Name: Domaine du Castel 2016 La Vie Blanc du Castel White (Haut-Judeé)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: This smooth, opulent blend of Petit Courbu and Petit Manseng is rich with yellow and white stone fruits along with a touch of spice. It is ready to drink.
Name: Vignobles Brumont 2015 Château Bouscassé Les Jardins  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Appellation: Falerno del Massico, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of toasted oak, dried aromatic herb and a whiff of petrol follow over to the lean palate along with suggestions of dried pineapple and citrus. A hazelnut note backs up the finish.
Name: Villa Matilde 2014 Vigna Caricci White (Falerno del Massico)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This wine is sweet while light, delicate and freshly textured. Touches of honey are perfumed with white spring flowers, baked apple and pear, with a touch of spice at the end.
Name: Domaine Chiroulet 2017 Soleil d'Automne White (Côtes de Gascogne)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Colombard, Ugni Blanc and Gros Manseng has created the typical fresh, crisp wine from Gascony. Light and fruity, with a bright texture and plenty of refreshing acidity, this is a wine to drink easily as an aperitif or with shellfish.
Name: Domaine de Pajot 2016 Les 4 Cépages White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Crisp and refreshing, this young wine is dominated by the native Loin de l'Oeil grape known for its fruit notes. White stone fruits are cut with lively acidity and citrus flavors, giving a balance between tight minerality and brightness. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine des Terrisses 2017 Sec White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Just off dry, this blend of Petit Manseng and Gros Manseng is intensely herbal while the obviously ripe fruits give a honey edge to the acidity and the zesty character. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2016 Prestige White (Côtes de Gascogne)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Acacia, beeswax, saline and brimstone aromas delicately lift out of the glass. It's light bodied and rather lean, offering hints of lemon, tangerine zest and a salty note of saline set against vibrant acidity.
Name: Cantine Astroni 2015 Vigna Astroni White (Campi Flegrei)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This blend of Colombard and Sauvignon Blanc merges herbal flavors, giving bright, tangy and zesty acidity. The wine, with its gooseberry and green-fruit flavors is so intense that it needs to soften for a few months. Wait until late 2018.
Name: Villa Dria 2017 Côte Sauvage Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: An unusual blend of 60% Riesling, 20% Sauvignon Blanc, with a little Marsanne and Roussanne, this wine offers bright, zippy notes of lemony and white pepper. The acidity on the palate is rather searing and is mildly balanced by some sweetness, but the sugar sticks on out the finish. Nevertheless, there's a bight, citrusy quality that is appealing.
Name: D'Arenberg 2016 The Stump Jump White (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A perfumed blend of Colombard, Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng, this balanced wine is immediately attractive. It has lively acidity along with bright white and citrus fruits that contrast comfortably with spicy texture at the end. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine d'Arton 2016 Les Hauts d'Arton White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Blending Colombard, Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng, this wine, with its name that evokes the not-far-distant Atlantic Ocean, is fruity, ripe with green and citrus fruits and a touch of honey. It is refreshing, tangy and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2017 Cuvée Marine White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The classic Côtes de Gascogne blend of Gros Manseng, Sauvignon Blanc and Colombard gives a bright, breezy, lightly salty wine. It's full of zest, crisp acidity and delicious fruitiness. Drink this wine now.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 L'Incontournable Cuvée Marine White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The simple fruity blend that has made this region so popular appears here as a bright, light and crisp wine. Its herbal character adds to refreshing citrus and green-fruit flavors. Drink this wine now.
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2017 Colombard-Ugni Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This wine is light, with perfumed acidity and a crisp, bright texture. It is just off dry, cut with acidity, melon and gooseberry flavors. The aftertaste is all fruit.
Name: Villa Dria 2017 Villa Club Nacré White (Gers)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Lightly mineral in character, this a floral blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng. At the moment, herbal flavors predominate, but give the wine a few months and the riper fruits of the Gros Manseng will come through and give a deliciously aromatic wine.
Name: Domaine Chiroulet 2017 Terres Blanches White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Situated in the heart of Armagnac country, this estate produces a range of crisp, fruity wines. The green fruits and herbal character of this typical local blend are refreshing, light and bright. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2017 Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This informal white has subdued aromas of white spring flower and citrus. The simple light-bodied palate offers suggestions of lemon zest and yellow apple alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Cantina del Vesuvio 2016 Bianco White (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Description: This blend has a dominance of Sauvignon Blanc with a perfumed input from Muscadelle. It is full of pear, quince and green apple flavors, with a tight edge that needs to soften.
Name: Château Bélingard 2017 White (Bergerac)

Description: This wine has aromas of grapefruit and freshly chopped green herbs. It is soft on the palate, with flavors of lemon, pear, pink grapefruit and eucalyptus. The eucalyptus note is strong towards the finish, but is then replaced with a splash of citrus brightness.
Name: Flam 2016 Blanc Unoaked White (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A blend of Falanghina and Caprettone, this opens with subtle whiffs suggesting yellow wild flower, pear and a hint of almond. The light-bodied simple palate offers lemon and a hint of sea brine alongside racy acidity.
Name: Cantine Astroni 2016 Cratere Bianco White (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This versatile blend of 60% Pinot Gris, 20% Chardonnay and 20% Riesling was fermented in stainless steel. It shows a light tawny hue from the Pinot Gris, as well as some CO2 bubbles. It's a simple, fruity white with a touch of residual sugar.
Name: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2016 Mingle White (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: This has a dusty, neutral nose and a lively but highly basic palate. Orange and ripe grapefruit flavors give way to mild bitterness on the finish. It was made from 90% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Carmenère, a red grape.
Name: Oveja Negra 2017 Reserva White (Maule Valley)

Description: With a nose of apple and bitter almond, this wine offers flavors of green apple, lime and mint that never quite come together. Fruit drops off after a few seconds, before a minty finish.
Name: Or Haganuz 2016 Amuka Blanc Blend Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Galilee)

Description: A soft and fruity aperitif style of wine, this offers plenty of acidity at the end. Drink this light, bright wine now.
Name: Villa Dria 2016 Villa Club Doré White (Gers)

Description: A blend of Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc with a touch of Fiano, this winer is aromatic in tones of candied banana and peach. The creamy, rich palate doesn't quite follow through and feels disjointed from searing acidity.
Name: Pinupti 9 2016 The White (McLaren Vale)

Description: This tan, cloudy Mexican Chardonnay is oxidized and stale but not bad. Its chunky, melony palate has some preserving acidity, but its creamy melon and vanilla flavors are spent.
Name: Santos Brujos 2015 White (Valle de Guadalupe)

Description: This is divinely sweet without ever becoming cloying. A blend of 89% Sémillon and 11% Sauvignon Blanc from grapes grown in Coombsville, it offers a clean, creamy palate of peat, caramel, vanilla wafer, nuts and honey. If a finishing touch of sweetness is needed at the end of any meal, this is your wine.
Name: Dolce 2012 Late Harvest Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Brilliant amber in the glass, this elegant Tokaji Aszú has bright aromas of citrus blossom and candied lemon peel. On the palate there are flavors of fresh apricot, honeycomb and canned peaches. The finish is smooth and has just the right amount of acidity to balance the sweetness.
Name: Oremus 2008 Aszú 5 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

Appellation: Vino da Tavola, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Made with 95% Verduzzo and 5% Riesling, this heady dessert wine opens with intense aromas of dried peach, butterscotch and caramel. The velvety palate offers orange blossom honey, toasted almond and dried apricot. A hint of tangerine zest closes the lingering finish.
Name: Lis Neris NV Tal Lùc Cuvéè Speciale White (Vino da Tavola)

Description: Grassy and floral aromas give a big initial impact to this medium-bodied wine and lead to flavors that have a little more ripeness and richness, like honeydew melon, Bosc pear and a touch of butter. Made from 75% old-vine French Colombard and 25% Sauvignon Blanc, it has a good foundattion of acidity to keep it lively on the palate and finish.
Name: Tank Garage 2016 Liquid Light Show White (California)

Description: This blend of 87% Furmint and 13% Yellow Muscat offers aromas of vanilla, lemon zest and white flowers. On the palate there are flavors of lemon pith, honeycomb and more vanilla. Perfectly balanced, with just a touch of residual sugar shining through on the finish.
Name: Chateau Dereszla 2015 Semi-Dry  (Tokaji)

Description: This late harvest, sweet wine has a brilliant straw color and aromas of pineapple and freshly grated lemon zest. On the palate there are flavors of ripe sliced pineapple and white peaches. The finish is sweet and elegant.
Name: Oremus 2016 Late Harvest  (Tokaji)

Description: A small parcel at this estate, close to Château Bouscaut, is dedicated to white wines. This wine, rich in broad green and white fruit and with layers of wood aging, is lush, perfumed with tangy citrus. While it would be possible to drink soon, that would be a shame, so wait until 2020.
Name: Château Lamothe-Bouscaut 2016  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This is the second white from Latour-Martillac. It follows the style of the top white—crisp and dominated by the citrus of Sauvignon Blanc—with its strongly herbal character, perfumed acidity and zesty aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2016 Lagrave-Martillac  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Unlike for the red wines, this was an excellent vintage for the sweet wines of Bordeaux. Richly textured, full of dried fruits, marmalade and honey, this has great botrytis intensity that gives a dry core. It is starting to age well, so drink from 2021.
Name: Château Laribotte 2013  Sauternes

Description: Made with dried Trebbiano, Malvasia and San Colombano grapes, this opens with inviting aromas of candied apricot, chamomile, vanilla and a whiff of nutmeg. The juicy palate offers chestnut honey, toasted hazelnut and dried fig. It nicely balanced and has good length.
Name: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2008 Vin Santo White (Pomino)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a jazzy wine with vibrant aromas and great acidity that is crisp and appetizing to sip. Orange zest, apple skin and almond flavors come out on the palate for a lean but satisfying midpalate and finish.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2016 Reserve Estate Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Fair Play)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is an excellent dry and light-bodied wine from a relatively new grape variety that is often made sweet. Honey and orange zest waft up from the glass, while crisp white peach and white pepper highlight the flavors. This will be a fun wine to serve blind and stump your friends.
Name: Theopolis 2015 Symphony White (Yorkville Highlands)

Description: A blend of Riesling, Muscat Blanc and Roussanne, this shows aromas of sliced yellow and green apple, with floral and spice notes. The palate is bright and fresh, full of mango, pineapple and citrus flavors. It brings a lot of fruit forward appeal—a very fun wine.
Name: Huston 2016 Chicken Dinner White (Idaho)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Blossomy and fresh, Jean Luc Colombo's entry-level bottling offers a bang-for-your-buck introduction to the Rhône region's uniquely silken, textural white wines. Made primarily from Clairette, it's chock-full of easy drinking apple and lemon flavors touched by hints of bitter almond and smoke. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2016 Les Abeilles de Colombo White (Côtes du Rhône)

Description: This straw colored blend consists of 70% Chardonnay and 30% Viognier. It offers aromas of honeysuckle, jasmine, green apple and a touch of perfumed talc. On the palate there are flavors of honeydew, cantaloupe and more green apple. It is well balanced and has a smooth finish, with just a touch of lingering ripe fruit.
Name: Bulgariana 2016 Thracian Delight White (Thracian Valley)

Description: This Tokaji has an amber gold-brown color, with carmalized aromas of apricots and pineapple upside down cake. On the palate there are flavors of dried apricot and honeycomb.
Name: Fanni Kertje 2001 Aszú Five Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

Description: Zesty white grapefruit and crushed mineral tones reverberate from nose to finish in this dry, crystalline white. A blend of Rolle (better known as Vermentino) and Viognier, it's a delicately concentrated but invigorating sip. Drink now through 2020.
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2016 Les Collines de Laure White (Mediterranée)

Description: This straw colored wine is a blend of 55% Sauvignon Blanc and 45% Aligote. The nose opens with aromas of lemon grass, lime and lychee. The palate offers more tropical flavores, leading to a crisp finish.
Name: Fautor 2016 310 Altitudine Sauvignon Blanc-Aligote White (Moldova)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of Viognier, Roussanne and Riesling. The aromas bring a lot of appeal, with notes of tangerine peel, white flower and ripe peach. The flavors are broad, fruity and thoroughly charming, with stone-fruit flavors on the finish.
Name: Brian Carter 2016 Oriana White (Yakima Valley)

Description: Pretty white blossom and lemon zest abound in this sprightly dry blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Grenache Blanc and Ugni Blanc. While moderate in concentration, savory hints of oyster shell, smoke and pollen lend complexity. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Vignerons Ardéchois 2016 Fonvène White (Ardèche)

Description: Aged in new wood and with a high percentage of Sémillon in the blend, this is an attractive citrus- and pineapple-flavored wine. With its balance between crispness and ripe fruit, it offers a crisp texture and a fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Haut Selve 2016  Graves

Description: Hence the acronym, this is a blend of Pinot Gris, Gewürztraminer and Riesling. All three varieties show their true colors in the form of a fruit basket of highly perfumed aromas: ripe pear, watermelon, lychee, and apple. Texturally it's a bit weighty but is balanced by a decent lick of acidity and a long mouthwatering finish that makes you go for another sip.
Name: Yealands 2016 P.G.R. White (Marlborough)

Description: Close to the village of Sauternes, this vineyard is dominated by Sémillon. This dry wine is crisp, with a honey edge that contrasts with the crisp citrus. It is zesty and tangy against a richer backdrop. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Peyrat 2016  Graves

Description: A blend of Feteasca Alba, Sauvignon Blanc and Riesling Italico, this offers lemon zest and lychee on the nose. The palate brings flavors of lemon zest, green apple and lemongrass.
Name: Davino 2016 Domaine Ceptura Blanc White (Dealu Mare)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: From a multiple-parcel blend that includes old Sémillon, this wine comes from vineyards in the Entre-deux-Mers of Bordeaux. With a good balance between acidity, crisp fruit and much riper quince and pear, the wine is young but already delicious. Drink now.
Name: Vignobles Despagne 2016 Biface White (Vin de France)

Description: A wood-aged blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon, this has a touch of Muscadelle that adds perfumed character. With hints of toast and smooth apricot and apple flavors, it is rounded and ripe, with a crisp edge. Drink now.
Name: Cheval Quancard 2016 Cuvée Hortense Prestige  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: Apple and pear aromas are clean and easy, with a hint of white corn. This is Tempranillo Blanco blended with Viura and Maturana Blanca; it feels generic but fresh, with simple lime and orange flavors. A steady finish shows little change from the palate.
Name: Nivarius 2016 White (Rioja)

Description: This brilliant gold blend has aromas of lemon peel and white flowers, with flavors of green apple and just a hint of honey.
Name: Bostavan 2016 Dor Traminer-Chardonnay White (Moldova)

Description: A deliciously fruit and refreshing wine, this is crisp with citrus and herbal flavors. The wood aging has softened the intense fruit and broadened out this very drinkable wine. It is ready now.
Name: Château Argadens 2016 Sauvignon-Sémillon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This late harvest Tokaji is made in an oxidized style and offers aromas of apricots and peach. On the palate there are flavors of dried stone fruits leading to a tart, dry finish.
Name: Fanni Kertje 1999 Szamorodni  (Tokaji)

Appellation: Côtes de Bordeaux Saint-Macaire, Bordeaux, France
Description: This bright and dry wine comes from a small appellation with vines on the slopes above the river Garonne. A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon, it is perfumed, ripe with citrus and with yellow fruits. The wine is crisp and ready to drink now.
Name: Château de Lagarde 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Côtes de Bordeaux Saint-Macaire)

Description: Aromas of citrus blossom, grapefruit pith and river rock lead to flavors of lemon curd and lime zest. The finish is crisp and clean in this blend of Chardonnay and Feteasca Regalã.
Name: Fautor 2016 310 Altitudine Chardonnay-Feteasca Regalã White (Moldova)

Description: This wine is nice and dry, tipping toward acidity in terms of balance and tastes fresh and citrusy. Its flavors are pretty subtle but it has a good quenching factor and no distractions.
Name: Boston Winery 2015 The Black Dog Great White (California)

Description: There's almost no color to this blend of Viura and Chardonnay, nor does it smell like much. On the palate, it is plump but lacking in acidic kick. Creamy flavors of banana and melon turn slightly bitter on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Paniza 2016 Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)

Description: Aromas of lime and generic greenness include hints of vanilla and yeast. This blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Gris and Sauvignon Blanc is citric and cutting in feel. Briny, somewhat sour flavors of green fruits end with tart, salty green-apple notes.
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2017 Gaia Made With Organic Grapes White (Tupungato)

Description: This colorless blend of Viura and Chardonnay smells tropical and sweet, like lychee fruit. A palate lacking in acidic edge is round but flat. Sugary papaya flavors precede a soft finish.
Name: Bodegas Paniza 2016 Agostón White (Cariñena)

Description: Oxidized aromas dull down papaya and pumpkin notes. This Viura-Verdejo blend shows mostly acid on the palate, and it both smells and tastes oxidized. The finish is bland.
Name: Bodegas Valdemar 2016 Conde Valdemar Viura-Verdejo White (Rioja)

Description: Always one of the great white wines of the world, this vintage continues that reputation. With its richness, density and layers of fruit and acidity, this wine is powerful and beautifully ripe. The wood aging is just a hint in background. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2015  Pessac-Léognan

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. This wine shows great balance and poised elegance. Its botrytis fruit gives it rich intensity, with a ripe orange-marmalade flavor and layers of tight acidity. This will be a wine for serious aging and not ready to drink before 2024.
Name: Château Coutet 2017 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. This impressive wine is rich and full of ripe fruit tones. It is also beautiful, with pineapple and crisp apple notes that are integrated into the wood and spice flavors. It's a great wine that will age over many years. Don't drink before 2022.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. Hugely rich, this wine has great intensity. Ripe mango and peach flavors boast a strong botrytis flavor, giving it full-bodied concentration. With its larger-than-life richness, it needs many years to calm down. Drink from 2025.
Name: Château Rieussec 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. This is an impressively textured, mineral-driven wine that is lightly toasty at this stage, with rich flavors of white stone fruit and green apple. It has great ripeness balanced by intense acidity and spice. This is a great wine with a good future. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. This is a full and rich wine that is also stylish and balanced. It has acidity, layers of spice and ripe botrytis fruit. It is a powerful wine that will need time, so drink from 2024.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. Hugely rich, this wine has great intensity. Ripe mango and peach flavors boast a strong botrytis flavor, giving it full-bodied concentration. With its larger-than-life richness, it needs many years to calm down. Drink from 2025.
Name: Château Rieussec 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Very concentrated, this is a great wine with rich intensity and balancing acidity. Honey and lemon flavors with a dry core of botrytis give the wine great balance as well as great potential for aging. Drink from 2025.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: Concentrated and with tight, mineral fruitiness, this wine is potentially ripe and rich, with citrus and orange peel crispness. The wine will be rich, rounded and packed with fruit, but it will take time. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2015  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Spice and ripe fruit aromas lead into a wine that has both richness and a crisp, fruity herbal character. Acidity shines through, giving the wine a tangy, mineral edginess. It will be a delicious fruity wine. Drink from 2023.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2015  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This is a rich style of white, in keeping with the rich vintage. Its acidity and tight texture are paired off with the apricot and ripe pear fruitiness. Spice from wood aging adds an attractive background. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Couhins 2015  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Ripe and spicy, this is a smoothly textured wine. Its wood aging and creamy texture are rich, opulent and generous. With tangy acidity in the background, this dense wine is already impressive. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2015  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Rich, already attractive, this wine sums up the whites in this vintage. With its opulent character and great fruit, it is rich, tangy and lightly herbal. It is a very complete wine and will be delicious from 2023.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2015  Pessac-Léognan

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This indulgent wine is rich, opulent and concentrated. At the same time, the core of botrytis and rich fruit will allow the wine to age well. The finish boasts an acidic lift and a touch of ginger flavor. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Ripe, botrytized fruit currently dominates this wine with its rich concentration. It is a full and liquorous wine that will age for many years. Drink from 2025.
Name: Château Guiraud 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Rich and warm, this generous wine balances a strongly mineral texture and acidity with ripe quince, apple and pear flavors. It is a wine for aging, likely to be ready to drink from 2023.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. A fine wine, with great richness and botrytis flavor, this is opulent and full-bodied, with flavors of ripe apricot and bitter orange marmalade that's hit by ample acidity. All these elements produce a fine structure that will let it age for many years. Drink from 2025.
Name: Château de Fargues 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Still tight and firmly closed, this has the potential to age for many years. With its concentration, rich apricot and spice flavors, it is rounded while also full of minerality. Drink from 2023.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Great acidity gives this wine a really fresh character. Ripe yellow fruits complement the wine's freshness, with a lingering spice note on the close. It is complex, with considerable aging potential. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Rich, opulent and full-bodied, this wine has great concentration and is packed with notes of apricot, spice, lemon and toast. Its texture brings in minerality as well as a tangy edge. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château Rabaud-Promis 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: The nose is intense and heady, combining unlikely but harmonized elements of white currant, fresh white mushroom, honey, pear and lemon zest. The palate then majors on fresh, pure and fluid pear juiciness. There is a textural element and overtones of beeswax reinforced by more lemon zestiness. A very complex, very alive and facinating wine. This is mouthfilling, long and intense, utterly full-flavored but resolutely dry.
Name: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2013 Harmonie R White (Alsace)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Creamy tropical-fruit flavors and a hint of toast give this wine an opulent character, with a pleasant herbal streak for added depth. From a great white-wine vintage, it has enormous potential for aging.
Name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Intensely herbal, this is a concentrated, green wine. Its texture and richness come from the grassy Sauvignon Blanc. It should calm down and develop slowly, so hold until 2023.
Name: Château Olivier 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Spice, toastiness and tight acidity mark this young wine. It is edgy at the moment, dominated by a strong minerality that will soften with age. This promises to be a rich, concentrated wine as it matures. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2015  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Deliciously aromatic, this wine is tight and structured but holds great promise. Acidity and citrus flavors balance with the perfumed character of the richer fruits and the touch of wood from the barrel aging. Drink this structured wine from 2023.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2015  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Tight and firm, this young wine has great potential. The richness, good acidity and minerality promise a great future. Densely textured, it is powerful and very rich. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2015  Pessac-Léognan

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. The fruit's botrytized character shows strongly in this rich wine, which will need many years before bring properly mature. For now, ginger and nutmeg go with citrusy crispness and a rich finish. Drink from 2025.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: This rich, ripe wine has a tropical-fruit character as well as touches of herbal acidity. It is tangy and strongly mineral, with great fruitiness and structure. This is a wine for aging, so don't drink before 2023.
Name: Château Olivier 2015  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Spice and citrus aromas make this wine immediately attractive. It offers ripe fruit and intense acidity along with layers of toast and spice. Its richness will carry through as it ages, and it will be best drunk from 2023.
Name: Château Couhins-Lurton 2015  Pessac-Léognan

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Spice and toast give this wine attractive complexity as well as ripeness. It shows abundant, concentrated yellow-fruit notes as well as a fine texture. It is still very young and will be better from 2021.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This wine is a rich, toasty and spicy pour. With generous and well-concentrated yellow fruits as well as intense minerality, it is set for long-term aging; don't drink before 2023.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Ripe and creamy, this white wine from the Margaux vineyards is full of apple, grapefruit and tangy orange fruit. It also has a good structure with its touch of toast and spice. The wine is clean, clear, very pure and with great balance. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Margaux 2015 Pavillon Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This is a classic wine, lightly herbal, textured, crisp in acidity and with an undertow of ripe yellow fruits. It will age well. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Generous and rich, this spicy wine has intense toffee and ripe caramel characteristics. It boasts bright acidity, layered with flavors of lemon juice and apricot. It will be a fine wine as it develops. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine is soft and rounded, with gentle acidity and citrus flavors. It has touches of spice, quince and ripe peach, while the finish showcases its minerality.
Name: Château Couhins 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Soft and ripe, this wine is full-bodied and richly concentrated. With zesty citrus flavors and a touch of spice from wood aging, it is well-balanced and should be ready to drink from 2021.
Name: Château de Rochemorin 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Soft and rounded, this wine is open and layered with flavors of ripe yellow fruits and navel oranges. It is cut with spice and a dry core. The wine will age well, so drink from 2023.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2017 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Full and rich, flavors of apricot, orange and spice are coupled with a dry core and fine acidity. Everything is in balance in this rich, ageworthy wine, with a fresh and crisp finish.
Name: Château Filhot 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Ripe and honeyed, this is a dense, opulent wine. Layers of botrytis combine with rich orange marmalade and apricot. It will age well; drink from 2023.
Name: Château Raymond-Lafon 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. With delicious crispness, this wine is tense and nervy, with a strong mineral texture. It is already well balanced, with citrus fruits that are hit with spice as well as a hint of wood. Drink from 2020.
Designation: Pavillon Blanc du Château Margaux Barrel Sample
Name: Château Margaux 2017 Pavillon Blanc du Château Margaux Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. The ripe fruit tones in this rich wine balance with hints of toast and a full, mineral texture. There is a juicy character to this zingy, textured wine. Acidity at the end gives it a final lift.
Designation: Barrel Sample Le Petit Haut Lafitte
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2017 Barrel Sample Le Petit Haut Lafitte  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This is a finely perfumed wine, with a creamy texture of ripe yellow-stone and pineapple fruits. It is also crisply imbued with tight citrus flavors and a mineral character. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Brown 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Layers of apricots and fresh oranges give this wine a crisp aspect as well as richness. A touch of spice graces the ripe, honeyed fruits, while great acidity keeps the palate refreshed.
Name: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This is a bright, crisp wine, with intense citrus acidity as well as rich apricot and quince flavors. It is textured and full of minerality, with a crisp finish. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Couhins-Lurton 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Fresh and crisp, this wine has wonderful spice, citrus and minerality as well as a tightly textured finish. It will age well over the medium-term, meaning it should be ready to drink from 2022.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. There is an attractive spicy character at the back of this wine, which brings out the richness of the tropical-fruit flavors and the balance with the wood aging. It should age well, and be ready to drink from 2021.
Name: Clos Floridène 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
