Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Intense acidity marks this crisp wine, with a tight lime flavor. Balancing that is the poise and richness of the core apricot and botrytis flavors that give the wine a fine future. It will be ready to drink from 2023.
Name: Château de Myrat 2017 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. A fine mix of herbal and tropical flavors give this wine both attractive acidity and some richness. It is bright yet ripe, balancing tangy citrus and pineapple fruits. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château de Cruzeau 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. There is a lightly herbal character to this perfumed wine. With its zingy, tense character, the wine is bright and fruity while also having a rich aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
Designation: Barrel Sample Les Hauts de Smith
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2017 Barrel Sample Les Hauts de Smith  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: A blend of 29% Roussanne, 23% Chardonnay, 22% Chenin Blanc, 18% Grenache Blanc and 8% Viognier, this opens with delicate aromas of pink apple, orange blossom, strawberry hull and white melon. The medium-weight palate offers just enough fruity weight to ground the precise cut of the vibrant acidity. Harmonious and well-balanced, this is one to enjoy now–2022.
Name: DeMorgenzon 2015 Maestro White (Stellenbosch)

Description: Pure and very appetizing notes of baked pear and fresh, yellow apple play on the nose. The palate reprises these flavors with juicy, fruity abundance and balances them with vibrant freshness. There is concentration and depth of pear and apple flavors. The finish is just off dry but full of that glorious fruit.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2016 Black Tie White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine shows an herbal element blended with ripe tropical flavors on the nose. The crispness of the palate contrasts with richer apple and apricot flavors. The finish is open and perfumed. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Cantelys 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is soft and ripe. Tropical fruit flavors are balanced by zesty citrus, resulting in a crisp and perfumed character. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Cos d'Estournel 2017 Cos d'Estournel Blanc Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Ripe and honeyed, this is already delicious. It's light as a vintage but has fine marmalade and apricot flavors which make it accessible for short-term enjoyment.
Name: Château Rieussec 2017 Carmes de Rieussec Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This delicious, fruity wine is crisp while also rounded. Like many dry whites from Sauternes, it has a hint of honey as well as delicious citrus flavors. It will be ready to drink soon.
Name: Château Rieussec 2017 R de Rieussec Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Pineapple and ripe apricot flavors give this wine a tropical character. It has a mineral structure, tangy with pink grapefruit. This delicious, ripe wine is ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2015 Aile d'Argent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A very gentle touch of summer blossom is joined by fresh, bright lemon on the nose. The palate has a creamy element that enriches the bright lemon palate without adding heaviness. This is sprightly and light, but also creamy and mellow. A dry, fresh and totally convincing wine with a clean, long finish.
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 L'éclat Ad Quadratum White (Alsace)

Description: Made primarily with Vermentino, this opens with delicate scents of white spring flower, yellow stone fruit, citrus and a whiff of honey. Mirroring the nose, the fresh enveloping palate doles out dried apricot, juicy nectarine drop and a honeyed mineral note alongside tangy acidity. Hold for even more complexity. Drink through 2021.
Name: Guado al Melo 2016 Criseo White (Bolgheri)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This boasts rich and ripe tropical-fruit tones that are partnered with great acidity and a zingy texture. Already a beautiful wine, it's packed with fruit, crisp and deliciously refreshing.
Designation: Le Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2017 Le Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: This Chenin Blanc-based wine, with 14% Sémillon, is complex, layered and evolving, expressing different waves of flavor and texture with each sip. Initial scents of lanolin and waxy pink apple transition into earthy notes of dried yellow flowers and grass, while the medium-weight palate evokes tart, refreshing flavors of lime leaf, lemon peel and white melon rind. It's zippy and bright in feel, with lively, briny acidity, and the finish shows fantastic evolution that ends on a earthy, forest-foliage note. Drink now–2025.
Name: Alheit 2015 Cartology White (Western Cape)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Opulent and rich, this densely textured wine is full in weight, with honey, sweet spice, rich peach and mango flavors. It is a fine wine, not for long-term aging and ready to drink from 2021.
Name: Château d'Arche 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Rich while also intensely structured, this wine is already showing a delicious, open character. The acidity shines through the wine's sweetness, giving lift to the decadent spiced fruit tones. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château de Malle 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. With a lovely citrus character and a touch of melon, this is a delicious wine. It is fresh, just hinting at tropical fruit. With its tangy edge, it will be delicious from the end of 2018.
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2017 Aile d'Argent Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. A warm, ripe and fruity wine, this is rich in white stone-fruit flavors but also cut by minerality and taut acidity. It is likely to take some time to mature, so try after 2020.
Name: Vieux Château Gaubert 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: A blend of 35% Chenin Blanc, 23% Roussanne, 15% Clairette, 19% Viognier and 8% Sémillon, this is dense and softly toasty upfront, with seductive notes of baked apple, pressed yellow flowers, dried orange peel, straw and lanolin. The palate is similarly lush and decadent, though with an ample seam of acidity to keep it all in check. Drink now–2022.
Name: David & Nadia 2015 David Aristargos White (Swartland)

Description: The merest touch of honeysuckle plays on the fresh apple nose. The slender palate offers lemon freshness and a pithy texture. The finish is clean and combines ripe pear with vivid lemon.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2016 White (Alsace)

Description: A nicely oaked bouquet includes aromas of tropical fruits, melon and green banana. This has a full, creamy palate, with oak resin and acidity balancing each other out. Salty melon and banana flavors are oaky, while this is texturally pleasing on the finish.
Name: Valserrano 2016 Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Fresh and crisp, this is a light wine, shining with acidity, citrus and spice. Lemon juice and crisp quince flavors are backed by light botrytis character. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2017 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: Fruity, herbal and with crisp acidity, this bright wine is full of grapefruit, apples and green plums. The mineral tang will give this wine shape as it matures. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Cos d'Estournel 2015 Cos d'Estournel Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Rose petals and ripe, yellow Mirabelle plums create an inviting, appetizing nose. The palate is light, fruity and fresh, with just a dash of gentle, fruit-enhancing sweetness. This is a gentle, easy but aromatic wine, with an off-dry finish.
Name: Meyer-Fonné 2016 Gentil White (Alsace)

Description: Lemon and earth aromas on the nose lead onto a dry and gently pear-fruited palate. There is an element of softness, a creamy touch radiating from a ripe, concentrated core of subdued Mirabelle and pear fruit. The finish is rich, resonant and dry.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2015 Zind White (Alsace)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Rich and ripe, this wine has a dense texture and fine spice notes from the oak aging. It is a generous wine, packed with green fruits, citrus and warm apricot flavors. It will age well and be ready to drink from 2021.
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2017 Cuvée Caroline Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine has fine acidity, generous ripe-yellow fruits and a toffee character, with a dry core to balance. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Lamothe Guignard 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: This second wine comes from both La Mission Haut-Brion and Haut-Brion vineyards. It has great fruit, crisp acidity and a lemon and grapefruit fruitiness. A tang to the texture lifts the wine into crispness as well as acidity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2015 Le Clarté  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Produced from a small parcel of vines on the Valandraud estate, this wine is crisp and fruity, with attractive acidity. Ripe lime and lemon flavors are given extra richness by the tangy mineral texture. Drink this wine from late 2018.
Name: Château Valandraud 2015 Virginie  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A wonderful hint of Mandarin peel on the nose translates onto zesty, juicy freshness on the palate. This shows ripe pear and juicy citrus, with intense echoes of tangerine peel. A highly appetizing, fruity but light and dry wine. This will get any party going.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2015 Métiss White (Alsace)

Description: This unusual blend mixes Riesling with rarely-seen Huxelrebe, a high-yielding early-ripening grape with scents similar to Muscat. The Starthistle is off dry, with honeyed fruits mixing peach, apricot and papaya. More palate weight than Riesling alone, yet it maintains Riesling's precision and elegance.
Name: Helioterra 2015 Starthistle Cuvée White (Oregon)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Soft, already open and generous, this is a lightly textured and crisp wine. It has a bright character along with some tangy spice and pepper flavors. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Suau 2017 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: Perfumed Muscadelle gives a great lift to this wine with its smooth texture and crisp lemon and apple flavors. Touches of toast add spice. It is a wine with great fruitiness just hinting at minerality. Drink from late 2018.
Name: JCP Maltus 2015 Le Nardian  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: An earthy, mellow and ripe notion of pear is foremost on the nose, joined by pleasantly spiky lemon zestiness. It is the lemon freshness that takes the lead on the slender, dry palate. This is clean, vivid and moreish.
Name: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2016 Côtes d'Ammerschwihr White (Alsace)

Description: Bright, clean aromas of apple flesh, green melon, quinine, lanolin and straw lead the charge on the nose of this precise wine. Medium in weight, vibrant acidity and a slightly pithy texture frame the ripe citrus and apple tones, while the finish returns to a pleasantly herbal, grassy impression. Drink now–2022.
Name: Momento 2015 White (Western Cape)

Description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Crisp fruit with a strong herbal edge gives this small production wine a lively, citrus character. Ample acidity lingers through a vibrant finish layered in notes of mineral and zest.
Name: Château Valandraud 2017 Valandraud Blanc Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)

Description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Crisp fruit and a strong herbal edge give this small-production wine a lively character. It has great acidity and a fresh, citrusy flavor as well as minerality on the zesty finish.
Name: Château Valandraud 2017 Valandraud Blanc Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Kiwi, tropical fruit and intense citrus flavors give this wine a rich and full impression. It has a floral character, which provides a fragrant lift.
Name: Le Nardian 2017 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Crisp herbal and lemon flavors are balanced by ripe tropical-fruit tones. It's a refreshing, lively and fruity wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Château Brondelle 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: A blend of 90% Vermentino and 10% Viognier, this opens with aromas of beeswax, acacia flower and citrus. The juicy palate offers up apricot, yellow peach and dried herb alongside bright acidity.
Name: Villa Pinciana 2016 Airali White (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Gentle notes of red apple appear on the nose. The palate has the same apple fruit that combines tart freshness with ripe fruit. This is easy and fresh, with a slight floral streak on its slender, dry body.
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2016 Maru White (Alsace)

Description: Fresh, ripe apple, lemon and pear are on full display on the open nose. The palate balances this abundance with a pleasantly bitter, tangy note. This is dry, slender and refreshing, with a layered, stony core.
Name: Hugel 2016 Gentil White (Alsace)

Description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Rich in flavors of toffee and spice, this is already soft and smooth. It does seem to miss out on acidity, which results in a fat texture. It is full, ripe and likely to develop quickly. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Broustet 2017 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: This single-vineyard blend of 60% Greco and 40% Malvasia shows spiced aromas of orchard fruit on the nose. Edgy flavors of apple and pear rinds meet almond skin on the medium-bodied palate, balanced by a persistent vein of acidity and a dusting of earthy stone.
Name: Botromagno 2015 Poggio al Bosco White (Gravina)

Description: Heady rose petal notes are framed by lots of earthiness on the nose. The off-dry palate has the same contrast of heady perfume and earthy core on a very fluid, almost oily palate. The finish has a pleasantly bitter freshness.
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2013 Clos du Zahnacker White (Alsace)

Description: Very gentle hints of ripe orchard fruit lay on the nose while the palate has the richness of juicy, ripe pear. Easy and harmonious, fresh and lively. Drink soon.
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 L'aplomb Ad Quadratum White (Alsace)

Description: One sniff announces that this Viura-Malvasia-Garnacha Blanca blend is fully oaked, while good acidity cuts some of the wine's resiny weight. While barrel-based flavors are firmly in charge, this offers apple and stone-fruit notes prior to a finish that tastes slightly buttery.
Name: Fernández Gómez 2016 Selección Familia White (Rioja)

Description: A blend of 70% Vermentino and 30% Sauvignon, this opens with aromas of white peach, acacia flower and apricot. The aromas follow through to the ripe palate along with an almond note.
Name: Michele Satta 2016 Costa di Giulia White (Bolgheri)

Description: Just a hint of rose petal blends in with lemon on the nose. The palate shows the same flavors but lacks a little direction. Nonetheless, there is freshness in the rose and lemon flavors. Drink soon.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2016 One White (Alsace)

Description: A touch of honey joins the fresh lemon notes on the nose. The fruity, easy and light palate also has that honey-lemon combo. The finish is lip-smacking, easy and fresh.
Name: Domaine Pfister 2016 Cuvée 8 White (Alsace)

Description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. A ripe wine, this is full of yellow fruits that are happily cut by citrusy acidity. The balance is just right, the acidity giving lift to the palate's richness and promising some more aging. Drink from 2021.
Designation: Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons Barrel Sample
Name: Château de Cérons 2017 Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: Made from 33% Roussanne, 23% Sémillon, 20% Chardonnay, 18% Chenin Blanc and 6% Clairette, this is broad and full right from the start, with notes of vanilla bean, creamed melon and orange preserves on the nose and mouth. There's just enough acidity to prevent it from feeling totally flat and flabby, while the finish is clean and medium in length. Drink now.
Designation: Rocking Horse Cape of Good Hope
Name: Thorne & Daughters 2015 Rocking Horse Cape of Good Hope White (Western Cape)

Description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Perfumed and ripe, this smooth wine has apricot and pear flavors as well as a cut of citrus. It is rounded and rich, full of fruit, and will be ready to drink from the end of 2018.
Name: Château Valandraud 2017 Virginie de Valandraud Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Pale straw to the eye, this wine has aromas of pear and vanilla. It is bright from first sip through the grapefruit finish, while also offering a sense of creaminess on the palate among flavors of green apple and peach, with a touch of vanilla custard.
Name: Dalton 2016 Alma Ivory White (Galilee)

Description: An earthy, almost savory hint of soy plays amidst the lemon freshness on the nose. The light, dry palate has a soft, creamy aspect and adds a notion of pear fruit. There is some alcoholic heat on the finish.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2015 Points Cardinaux Métiss White (Alsace)

Description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Taut, nervy and mineral, this is a tight wine. It has tension that lies under crisp grapefruit and gooseberry fruit. It will need a few years to come together, and should be ready to drink from 2020.
Name: Château d'Uza 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: Principally Riesling, with 8% Muscat blended in, this touches the borders of off dry, but has enough acid to keep it food-friendly. Ripe lemon and pink grapefruit, peaches and apples come through most pleasantly. It's well made and well balanced.
Name: Rock Point NV River Riesling-Muscat (Oregon)

Description: A mix of 60% Chardonnay, 15% Moscatello Selvatico, 15% Minutolo and 10% Passulara, this unusual white blend is perfumed in grapefruit, tangerine zest, papaya and lemon balm aromas. Medium in weight, with a pleasing roundness, rich melon and exuberant floral flavors are lifted by clementine acidity and a light mineral dusting.
Name: San Marzano 2016 Edda Lei White (Salento)

Description: A gold color and resiny aromas of nutty oak and oxidized white fruits capture the essence of aged white Rioja. A round, oily palate is dominated by oak, tasting of spiced apple, almond skins and woodspice. Flavors of peanut, dried apricot and stone-fruit pits provide for a good finish.
Name: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2007 200 Monges Selección Especial Reserva Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. While the wood is strongly dominant at this stage, there is plenty of fruit to promise balance in the future for this ripe and full wine. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Portets 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: This wine comes from a sector of the Entre-deux-Mers that is particularly suited to white wines. It shows in this ripe, lightly mineral-textured wine with apple, citrus and touches of spice. Drink this attractive wine from mid-2018.
Name: Château la Rose de Vitrac 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A luscious bouquet of rose petal and ripe peach on the nose is very convincing and not overblown. The fluid palate shows and edge of pleasant bitterness, countered by an off-dry finish. A lovely aperitif style. Drink soon.
Name: Martin Schaetzel 2016 Trio White (Alsace)

Description: Nectarine aromas come with a briny note of citrus fruits. A stony, citric palate is tight but not sharp, while this Godello-based white tastes of apple and minerals. Stoniness carries over to the finish. Drink now.
Name: Peza do Rei 2016 White (Ribeira Sacra)

Description: Aromas of white flower, beeswax and stone fruit mingle in the glass. The lively palate delivers Bartlett pear, white peach and a touch of ginger alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Rocca di Montemassi 2016 Calasole White (Maremma Toscana)

Description: This blend of three local grapes including Albariño opens with briny core aromas surrounded by white-fruit notes. The palate hits with a piercing shot of acidity but then turns thicker and more syrupy. Flavors of passion fruit and nectarine are slightly briny and finish plump.
Name: Altos de Torona 2016 Rosal Caiño Albariño-Loureiro White (Rías Baixas)

Description: A perfumed cloud of rose petals hovers over the glass and beneath that is a touch of earthiness. The palate is surprisingly light and translucent but utterly rose-scented. This is off-dry but finishes a little short.
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 L'arabesque Ad Quadratum White (Alsace)

Description: 86–88. Barrel Sample. Ripe lime, apricot and pear flavors give this wine its rich, fruity character. Lightly textured, it has spice as well as generous fruits. It is developing quickly and should be ready from 2019.
Name: Château de la Brède 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: 86–88. Barrel Sample. This wine is soft and gently fruity, with some attractive acidity to lift the almond and spice flavors. It is rounded and will age quickly; drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Landiras 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: A blend of 60% Verdeca, 35% Bianco d'Alessano and 5% Minutolo, this is a snappy, enjoyable wine, with aromas of ripe apple, pear and dried hay that echo on the palate. This shows a waxy feel that is cut by lively acidity on the midpalate. Enjoy with white fish or ceviche.
Name: I Pastini 2016 Antico White (Locorotondo)

Description: Briny apple aromas with woody notes open this barrel-fermented Viura. In the mouth, this shows good acidity and a fairly full body. Salty, lightly oxidized apple flavors finish round, with lingering salty barrel notes.
Name: Valenciso 2016 Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)

Description: Sauvignon Gris may be only 10% of the blend but it gives a delicious perfumed character to this wine. Grapefruit and apricot flavors combine with the mineral texture to give a rich while still taut wine. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Château les Clauzots 2016  Graves

Description: This wine is rich with sweetness although it shows only a light botrytis character. It has a touch of spice from the wood aging as well as honey and lemon to balance the sweetness and acidity. Even though young, it is ready to drink.
Name: Château Villefranche 2015  Sauternes

Description: A nose of honeydew melon and vanilla bean set the stage for flavors of apple, nectarine and hazelnut. This wine is full on the palate, with closing notes of citrus fruit and a hint of toasted nuts.
Name: Gva'ot 2016 Dances In White White (Shomron)

Description: This blend of Riesling, Vidal Blanc and Seyval Blanc has soft aromas of elderflower, lemon, wet stone and dried apple. Zippy acidity tingles on the palate and lends itself to a long finish full of minerality.
Name: James Charles 2016 Cuvée de la Reine White (Virginia)

Description: 86–88. Barrel Sample. Juicy, soft and fruity, this is an easy wine, full of great fruitiness and crisp acidity. Drink early to enjoy its refreshment.
Name: Château Roquetaillade la Grange 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: A neutral nose offers a quiet, lemony streak. The palate is equally neutral, almost dilute, but fresh and clean. Some apple and pear notes appear on the refreshing finish. Drink soon.
Name: Bott Frères 2016 Edelzwicker White (Alsace)

Description: This wine offers a bouquet of grapefruit and lime zest followed by flavors of chirimoya and guava. Grapefruit flavors return to the palate just in time for a zippy finish.
Name: Jerusalem Wineries 2016 3400 Premium Dry White (Samson)

Description: Just a touch of fresh apple appears on the almost mute nose. The palate follows with easy, clean apple and ripe pear notes on a slender, light body. The finish is dry and refreshing. Drink soon.
Name: Wolfberger 2016 Edelzwicker White (Alsace)

Description: Dusty aromas of white fruits are equaled by barrel-based vanilla scents. A round, easy palate gives off a powdery sense, while this barrel-fermented Viura-Tempranillo blend tastes yeasty and of green banana. Latent acidity on the finish creates mild sourness.
Name: Viña Otano 2016 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and a whiff of tropical fruit lift from the glass while the soft round palate offers yellow peach and a confectionary note. It's simple but well made.
Name: Delibori 2016  Lugana

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A mix of five different Pinot relatives (not clones), this seems a bit overworked. It's flat in the mouth, and the mix of grapes, some white, some red, simply blends into a rather generic tasting white wine. If it resembles anything, it's a Pinot Noir Blanc, and it's already drying out, so drink up.
Name: Minimus 2016 #22 Pinot White (Willamette Valley)

Description: Delicate hints of candied red apple and honeydew extend from nose to palate in this easy-going white blend. Off dry and soft in acidity, it's an approachable everyday sip. Drink now.
Name: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Madonna Kabinett White (Rheinhessen)

Description: The nose on this 85% Vermentino and 15% Viognier blend reveals delicate aromas of candied citrus and almond. The palate is straightforward, offering white peach and bitter almond notes.
Name: Bruni 2016 Plinio White (Maremma Toscana)

Description: 85–87. Barrel Sample. Very herbal, this Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine is taut and nervy, with a grassy character and cool gooseberry and grapefruit flavors. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Rahoul 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: While quiet on the nose, hints of fresh apple and blossoms are a pleasant introduction to this brisk, uncomplicated white blend. Off dry and light in body, it's an easy quaffing wine, with a fresh grapefruit finish.
Name: Karl Josef 2016 Piesporter Michelsberg White (Mosel)

Description: Mild fruit aromas are crowded by peanut and burnt-wood notes. This Viura-led blend is full and round on the palate, with forceful flavors of nutty stone fruits, sea brine and wood resin. A lean, acidic palate is better in feel than weak flavors.
Designation: Cueva del Monge Fermentado en Barrica
Name: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2014 Cueva del Monge Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)

Description: While the nose is earthen and mineral, the palate of this light-bodied blend of Silvaner and Riesling offers pleasant lemon and green melon refreshment. It's a juicy, uncomplicated sip, with subtle sweetness and a brisk finish. Drink now.
Name: Peter Mertes 2016 Platinum Dream Stone Liebfraumilch White (Rheinhessen)

Description: Citrusy aromas show mild pyrazine notes. This has an oily but citrusy mouthfeel along with flavors of orange peel and pulp as well as scallion. A lingering citric finish is moderately zesty.
Name: Palma Real 2016 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc (61%), Sémillon (23%), Riesling (12%) and Albariño. The aromas are a bit faint, with notes of herb, fig, pear and soda water that don't seem entirely in sync. The palate brings broad, dry flavors that come up short.
Name: Three of Cups 2016 White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Intensely savory notes of crushed earth and pollen juxtapose prettier red apple and tangerine. While rustic in style, its light body and subtle tangerine sweetness offers approachable refreshment.
Name: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Madonna Liebfraumilch White (Rheinhessen)

Description: This 50-50 blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Malvasia is a bit closed on the nose. The palate offers more in its juicy melon and apple flavors, with a hint of florals in the background. This is light in weight and intensity, yet perfect for the price.
Name: San Marzano 2016 Il Pumo Sauvignon-Malvasia White (Salento)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is already past its prime. The blend of Müller-Thurgau, Viognier and Moscato is interesting, but the fruit is fading into a simple, lightly peachy syrup, with a hint of plastic. Drink now.
Name: Whitetail Ridge 2014 Valo White (Umpqua Valley)

Description: A light color and yeasty aromas of sourdough and dusty white fruits are the greeting on this modest white made from Chardonnay, Viura and Moscatel. Flavors of lime are yeasty and finish bitter.
Name: Ochoa 2016 Calendas White (Navarra)

Description: This is yet another stellar vintage of this unique blend, a mix of Muscadelle, Sémillon, Colombard and Palomino. Floral as a garden brimming in gardenia, it's dry and gravelly, with distinct flavors of quince and melon. Light on its feet, it's well worth seeking.
Name: Carlisle 2015 The Derivative White (Sonoma County)

Description: This delicious white combines 87% Sauvignon Blanc, 8.5% Viognier and 4.5% Sémillon. Together, they are as compelling as a garden in jasmine and gardenia aromas. Smooth and sublime on the palate, it offers a succulence of peach and pear within a refreshing core of medium-bodied fleshiness.
Name: Blue Rock 2016 Baby Blue Blanc White (Sonoma Coast)

Description: This Chenin Blanc-based blend, with additional portions of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier, is delicate in nature, though complex and layered beneath it's reserved surface. It boasts notes of apple flesh, melon rind, yellow flower, fynbos and beeswax on the nose and mouth, with final impressions of orange pith and lemon zest on the enduing finish. Harmonouos and well-balanced, it offers a pleasant, softly astringent texture that lends structure to the medium-weight palate and length to the close. Drink now–2023.
Name: Keermont 2015 Terrasse White (Stellenbosch)

Description: This wine's ripe mirabelle plum and fragrant lemon notes stream from the glass. The palate has the same appetizing contrast between rounded ripeness and fragrant freshness. The lemon tone creates a zesty, lively and textured palate. Very fresh and delicious right now, it's sure to develop. Drink 2018–2025.
Name: Wieninger 2016 Ried Rosengartl White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: A mere whisper of rose flashes on the nose before herbal, yeasty fruitiness takes over. This field blend is intriguing and layered, made from several varieties. The palate has a salty edge and a rich mouthfeel that veers from creamy to pithy and back again. It lets its yeasty pear, apple and citrus flavors ripple across the tongue. Lovely now but sure to evolve. Drink 2018–2025.
Name: Wieninger 2016 Ried Ulm-Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: A blend of 48% Roussanne, 27% Chenin Blanc, 22% Chardonnay and 3% Verdelho, herbal aromas of dried fynbos, hay and pressed yellow flowers are partnered with rich notes of yellow apple, citrus oil and beeswax. The medium-weight palate offers great acidity that enlivens the ripe fruit flavors, while a saline impression provides further lift and lingers long on the close. Drink now–2021.
Name: Alheit 2015 Hemelrand Vine Garden White (Hemel en Aarde)

Description: This wine's nose is still a little closed, but the palate shows a zesty freshness that features fresh lemon, summer blossom and white currant tartness. It's light in body, with a slightly pithy texture that underlines the refreshing element even more. The finish is tangy and very refreshing.
Name: Wieninger 2016 Bisamberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: This Chenin Blanc-based blend, with 12% Clairette, 6% Viognier, 4% Grenache Blanc and 4% Sémillon, opens with medium-intense aromas of apple skin, melon rind, honeysuckle, strawberry hull and orange pith. The full, medium-weight palate boasts ample acidity to complement the rich beeswax, orange oil and pressed flower tones, with a softly pithy texture that lends structure and length to the enduring finish. It's drinkable now, but should benefit from some additional maturity. Drink 2020–2024.
Name: Mullineux 2015 Old Vines White (Swartland)

Description: This is a blend of equal parts Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc, barrel-fermented and aged in 40% new French oak for one year. It's fresh and alive in orange blossom aromatics and strong impressions of peach, pear and green apple. A bold streak of minerality gives it a hint of gravel and rock.
Name: Ashes & Diamonds 2015 Blanc No. 1 White (Napa Valley)

Description: A tropical suggestion of passion fruit plays with the pear notes on the nose of this zesty Viennese field blend. Freshness and texture are key, imbuing the slender body with zesty, aromatic tangerine-laden depth This is enlivening, aromatic and bold, with a refreshing dry finish.
Name: Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2016 Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: An abundance of floral and savory flavors drives this full-bodied, dry and mouth-filling wine. It's not fruity per se, but has a good core of white peach along with almond and white-tea notes. This 50-50 blend of Albariño and Verdelho will bring a welcome change of pace to the table.
Name: Rock Wall 2016 Alverd White (Yolo County)

Description: A blend of 33% Chenin Blanc, 33% Sémillon, 25% Sauvignon Blanc and 9% viognier, this is ripe and forward in fruit tones. Toasted apple, melon rind, orange oil and yellow flowers abound, framed by just enough acidity to counter the palate's opulence. Drink now.
Name: Black Elephant 2015 Timothy White (Franschhoek)

Description: This Colombard-based white, with 14% Chenin Blanc, is rich and opulent upfront, offering assertive scents of toasted apple, grilled peach, straw and woodspice that are hit by accents of orange blossom, rose and a drizzle of honey. The palate is round and mouthfilling, with opulent, ripe fruit flavors of lemon custard and apple pie. Drink now–2020.
Name: Boschkloof 2015 Patatsblanc White (South Africa)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of Marsanne, Chardonnay and Roussanne is hard it pin down. Aromas of salty nuts, honey mustard, dried apples, hay and orange rind are fairly shy. Unique flavors of popcorn, fermented tropical fruits, citrus peel and sandalwood show on the sip.
Name: Sanguis 2014 The Hat-trick White (Central Coast)

Description: This unusual blend of Riesling, Chardonnay and Torontel smells much like a Moscato or Vermentino, with aromas of cured ham and lychee. Low acidity creates a fleshy palate, while flavors of lychee, honeydew melon and lime finish with green banana notes. Drink now; this probably will not age well.
Name: Vistalago 2017 Mezcla Blanca White (Maule Valley)

Description: This is made from 50% Sauvignon Blanc, 25% Chardonnay and 25% Malvasia. The trio work well together, offering jasmine aromas around medium-bodied well-integrated flavors of peach and green apple.
Name: Jon Nathaniel 2016 Honest Bucker White (Napa Valley)

Description: Hints of smoked nuts, crushed mineral and blossom accent muted apple and pear in this delicately structured white blend. While restrained in concentration, it's a dry, refreshing wine with a soft lemon-peel note that lingers on the finish.
Name: Marrenon 2016 Grande Toque White (Luberon)

Description: This is basically Sauvignon Blanc, with 10% Carmenère added in for body. As a result, the nose is chunky and smells lightly of pumpkin and squash. A tangy palate is oily in feel, with green-fruit flavors. Popping acidity pushes a salty tasting finish.
Name: Oveja Negra 2016 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc-Carmenère White (Maule Valley)

Description: Waxy white-fruit aromas are mild and simple. On the palate, this blend of 60% Chardonnay and 40% Viognier is wide, oily and grainy in feel. Savory salty green melon and banana flavors are lightly oxidized on the finish.
Name: Oveja Negra 2016 Reserva Chardonnay-Viognier (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Elkton Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: In this blend, Gewürztraminer owns the aromatics and Riesling fleshes out the palate with rich citrus and stone fruit. In spite of the relatively low alcohol, the flavors are fully ripe, densely packed, intense and compelling. It's hard to imagine a better Oregon white at this price.
Name: Ovum 2016 Big Salt White (Elkton Oregon)

Description: Captivating aromas of Mediterranean brush, crushed herb, Spanish broom, orchard fruit and a hint of hazelnut lead the way on this elegant white. The silky, linear palate doles out tangerine, yellow apple and pear balanced by bright acidity. A mineral note energizes the finish.
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2016 Bianco  (Etna)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This atypical blend of Chardonnay and Marsanne presents a very smoky nose reminiscent of roasted poultry but cut by rosemary, yuzu, green tea, pomelo pith and fortune cookie aromas. Sandalwood, pluot, yellow melon and saffron flavors show on the exotic palate, which is tense with acidity and tannins and utterly distinctive.
Name: Sanguis 2014 The Eighth Veil White (Central Coast)

Description: Radiant and refined, this white opens on aromas of Spanish broom, white flowers and Mediterranean brush. It's savory and racy, offering apple, pear and orange flavors alongside bright acidity. A salty mineral note lingers on the finish.
Name: Planeta 2016 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Savory and fresh, this opens on alluring aromas of white flower, orchard fruit, citrus and a whiff of crushed rock while the palate offers creamy white peach, apple and lemon drop. A saline mineral note lingers on the finish.
Name: Pieropan 2016  Soave Classico

Description: Complex and alluring, this offers aromas of dried apricot, exotic fruit, pressed yellow flower and crushed rock. Mirroring the nose, the elegant, structured palate doles out mature yellow peach, tangerine zest and a note of toasted almond alongside bright acidity. An energizing mineral note accents the finish. Drink through 2026.
Name: Prà 2016 Monte Grande  (Soave Classico)

Description: Delicate scents of Spanish broom, citrus blossom and white stone fruit waft out of the glass. The elegant, medium-bodied palate delivers ripe pear, creamy white peach and tangy lemon. Bright acidity provides impeccable balance while a pronounced mineral note graces the lingering finish.
Name: Tornatore 2016 Pietrarizzo Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Creamy, fresh and crisp, this opens with aromas of dried wildflower and ripe orchard fruit. The rounded palate delivers pastry dough, white peach and yellow apple with fresh acidity. A lemon drop closes the lingering finish.
Name: Prà 2015 Staforte  (Soave Classico)

Description: Enticing scents of mature orchard fruit, bread crust and toasted almond take center stage while the linear, focused palate doles out Barlett pear, yellow apple and lemon set against crisp acidity. A mineral note lifts the lingering finish.
Name: Vivera 2013 Salisire Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Dry, tangy and appetizing, this wine has lightly floral, appley aromas and flavors, great acidity to cleanse the palate and a sense of brightness and clarity that's refreshing to taste.
Name: Peltier 2016 Prééminence White (Lodi)

Description: This is a complex and delicious drop from the cool climes of the Adelaide Hills, offering up notes of pineapple, ground ginger, grapefruit and lime blossoms. The mouthfeel is lovely and long, with a slippery texture, balanced acidity and a zingy, white-pepper finish.
Name: Bird in Hand 2016 Two in the Bush Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A numeric score on this wine is almost silly, as it's about as bizarre as wine gets. A shade of yellowish orange in the glass, this bottling shows aromas of vermouth, wood varnish, cherry and, yes, blood orange on the nose. The palate combines iron, sour peach, walnut oil and pine much like a Sherry. Fascinating, though not for the mainstream.
Name: Central Coast Group Project 2013 Blood Orange White (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Malvasia delle Lipari, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Made with dried Malvasia and a touch of Corinto Nero, this dessert wine opens with aromas of dried apricot, crushed almond and jasmine. The savory, structured palate offers chestnut honey, dried fig and a hint of Mediterranean brush.
Name: Colosi 2012 Passito di Salina  (Malvasia delle Lipari)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Gorgeous ripe fruit flavors blend with baking spices in this high-toned but full-bodied and opulent wine. Nuances of peach, honeydew melon, honey and flowers are carried by a mouthfilling, nicely viscous texture.
Name: Concannon 2016 Reserve Assemblage Blanc White (Livermore Valley)

Description: This golden-hued wine opens with aromas suggesting beeswax, Spanish broom and orchard fruit. The subdued, refined palate offers creamy yellow apple, pear, citrus and a hint of paraffin. A mineral note accents the finish.
Name: Al-Cantàra 2014 Luci Luci Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Subdued aromas suggest toasted nut, crushed stone and a whiff of pressed yellow flower. The linear palate offers yellow apple, ripe pear, tangerine zest and mineral, while a note of bitter almond closes the finish.
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2015 Calderara Sottana Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Punchy aromas of citrus and cactus are not outright green but do show pyranize scents. A palate with honest body, grip and lemony acidity tastes of tangy lemon-lime and tangerine, while this is angular but not scouring on the finish.
Name: Lasalde Elkartea 2016 Aitzalde White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: Aromas of toasted nut, brimstone and a whiff of pressed acacia lift out of the glass. The linear palate offers yellow apple, citrus zest and a hint of dried herb alongside vibrant acidity. A light saline note marks the close.
Name: Le Vigne di Eli 2016 Bianco  (Etna)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Roussanne makes up half of this wine, the balance in Marsanne and just 10% Viognier. Its light peach, straw, almond butter and lees aromas are followed by bone-dry flavors. It has pleasing acidity and balance and is a unique interpretation of these three varieties.
Name: Seven Falls 2016 GPS Jones Vineyard Roussanne-Marsanne-Viognier White (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Oak and spice notes are out front on the nose but not overpowering. This blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca is medium in body, with a shot of bracing acidity. Wood-dominant flavors of spiced apple and resin carry the finish.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2015 Organza White (Rioja)

Description: This wine tastes like a late-harvest dessert wine, and a very good one. A deep gold color and assertive nutty aromas start it off with a bang, while flavors of honey, toasted almond and caramel follow on the palate. Its texture is plush and mouthfilling and the finish lingers nicely.
Name: It Is What It Is! NV White (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of 55% Viognier, 23% Grenache Blanc and 22% Roussanne. Its light apple, vanilla, citrus and spice aromas are followed by creamy, thick-feeling fruit flavors that persist on the spice-filled finish. It comes off quite heavy.
Name: Goose Ridge 2015 GRV White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine bursts with mango, peach and passionfruit, with a touch of cut grass. There's plenty of tongue-tingling acidity on the palate and some textural weight, likely from the Sémillon.
Name: Xanadu 2017 DJL Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: Delicate aromas of apple skin, spring blossoms and lime zest carry the nose of this wine. The palate is a different beast all together, with far less fruitiness and far more minerality—tightly wound and chalky in texture. It's drinking well now, but would also be interesting to see it in a few years' time. Drink now–2020.
Name: Wirra Wirra 2016 Scrubby Rise Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Adelaide)

Description: Medium gold in color, this wine has aromas of pear and talc. It is slightly off-dry, offering flavors of pear, gala apple, toffee and apricot, with a soft mouthfeel and a light, floral finish.
Name: Kavaklidere 2013 Côtes d'Avanos White (Cappadocia)

Description: Savory earthy accents complement ripe melon flavors and a generous texture in this pale-colored, medium-bodied wine. It has good heft on the palate, and is rich enough to keep the flavors lingering.
Name: Ca' Momi 2016 Bianco White (California)

Description: Subdued aromas suggest Spanish broom and chamomile flower. Reflecting the nose, the lean, linear palate is also restrained, offering citrus, lemon zest and a hint of beeswax.
Name: Cusumano 2016 Alta Mora Bianco  (Etna)

Description: The Sémillon really takes the fore in this SBS blend. Wet wool, bruised citrus fruit and white pepper lead into a restrained, almost austere palate. The acidity is in check but the fruit is lacking. It all ends with an intriguing salty, copper-penny finish.
Name: Mad Fish 2016 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Western Australia)

Description: Pleasant fig and pear flavors fill out this medium-bodied and rather subtly flavored wine. It tastes ripe enough, but not overly rich, has good concentration and an earthy component
Name: Church & State 2014 Lost Inhibitions White (California)

Description: Hints of clay and spice lend savoriness to sweet-tart apple and pear in this value icewine made from a blend of Ortega and Optima grapes. It's slightly cloying in sweetness but a straightforward dessert option. Drink now.
Name: Schmitt Söhne 2016 Icewine White (Rheinhessen)

Description: Briny, funky aromas of cured ham, stone fruits and salt water are unique for the area. This blend of Viura and Garnacha Blanca is linear and acidic, with lightly oxidized, barrel-driven flavors of boiled ham and dried apricot.
Designation: Sierra de la Demanda Viura-Garnacha Blanca
Name: Compañia de Vinos del Atlántico 2013 Sierra de la Demanda Viura-Garnacha Blanca White (Rioja)

Description: Situated in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers, this estate, one of several owned by the Ducourt family, has made an easy, crisp blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon. Acidity and touch of herbal flavors are balanced by the tropical edge that comes from the vintage. Drink the wine now.
Name: Château La Rose Saint Germain 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Aromas of fresh pumpkin and dusty peach are clean but bland on the nose. This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Airen shows briny melon flavors, with notes of spent yeast and wheat on a low-acid finish.
Name: Campos Reales 2016 Sauvignon Blanc-Airen White (La Mancha)

Description: Aromas of stone fruit, apple and pumpkin announce a palate that's dilute but holding onto some punch. Briny citrus flavors suggest orange peel, while this blend of Palomino and Torrontés tastes slightly bitter on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Alanís 2015 Las Híades White (Ribeiro)

Description: This blend of Garhacha Blanca and Viognier is round in feel. Briny nectarine and citrus flavors are sharp on the palate and turn green on the finish.
Name: Edetària 2016 Via Edetana White (Terra Alta)

Description: A neutral nose shows a briny streak, while this feels acidic on the palate. This blend of Treixadura and Godello shows white-fruit flavors, with a wheaty tasting finish.
Name: Bodegas Alanís 2015 Elara Treixadura-Godello White (Ribeiro)

Description: This wine feels alive due to typical Txakoli acidity, but there isn't much body or structure to it. Tart green-apple flavors are waxy and inexact.
Name: Inazio Urruzola 2016 Ernio White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: This is beautully concentrated and full of great richness yet seems closed at the moment. Its apricot jelly and dried fruit flavors, acidity and botrytis are in perfect balance, developing intensity as it opens. A full, generous wine with a great future. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Climens 2014  Barsac

Description: This impressive wine has great intensity and superb apricot and orange flavors. Acidity mingles with its botrytis core and rich, concentrated fruit, striking a fine balance. It will become delicious as it matures. Drink from 2024.
Name: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2014  Sauternes

Description: With its apricot and bitter orange flavors, this wine has great concentration, botrytis character and richness. Acidity lends balance to all its beautiful honey notes and intensity. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2014  Sauternes

Description: With its apricot and honeyed flavors, this is a rich wine. It has intense, ripe fruit and layers of spice and botrytis. A dry core gives it its great richness and aging potential. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château Filhot 2014  Sauternes

Description: This wine is still so young but shows considerable potential. Its concentration and acidity are balanced by rich honey, dried fruit and bitter orange flavors that need time to come into balance, so wait until 2025 to open.
Name: Château Nairac 2014  Barsac

Description: This wine has great richness. Along with its spice and honey notes, there are orange and lemon fruit flavors that give it lift. Beautifully balanced and ripe, it has the potential to be a superb wine. The botrytis core is what gives it its great aging potential. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2014  Sauternes

Description: Intense and ripe, this is a superb wine from a top Sauternes estate. It has all the expected elements, including concentrated botrytis and honeyed flavors. Seville orange and lemon notes provide contrast, as does its acidity, which is just as intense as the honey character. It will age well, so drink from 2025.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2014  Sauternes

Description: Intense with botrytis and concentrated dried apricot and fig flavors, this is a finely balanced wine. It's ripe and opulent, certainly, but it also has the potential to age very well. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2014  Barsac

Description: Straw colored with gold reflections, this delightful sweet wine has aromas of dried pear, fresh apricot and yellow peach. Flavors of fresh Bartlett pear, acacia honey and tinned apricots unfold on the palate. The finish is sweet, with just the right amount of acidity.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2013 5 Puttonyos Aszú Red Label  (Tokaji)

Description: This powerful, dense and hugely rich wine has swathes of ripe yellow and citrus fruits. These are balanced with beautiful botrytis, honey and spice notes. Although tempting, it would be a mistake to drink it now. Much better to wait until 2024.
Name: Château Lamothe Guignard 2014  Sauternes

Description: Rich and firm, with great concentration, this wine is powered by botrytis, honey and the ripest yellow fruit and bitter orange flavors. It promises a great future, with power and richness balanced by acidity. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2014  Barsac

Description: Beautifully poised, this wine strikes a balance between crisp lemon-curd acidity and intense honey and botrytis. Along with its nutmeg and marmalade flavors, it has the potential to be a powerful, wine. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château Rabaud-Promis 2014  Sauternes

Description: This floral wine shows geranium and white fruit notes. These are in relief against a background of great acidity and generous honey flavors. All these elements need time to come together but show great potential. Drink from 2025.
Name: Château de Myrat 2014  Barsac

Description: Already beautifully balanced, this wine is intense, rich and full of layered acidity and concentrated honey flavors. It's ripe, opulent and dense, with spice notes and acidity highlighting its rich core. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château Guiraud 2014  Sauternes

Description: This is ripe and floral, with intense acidity under the sweet, honeyed surface. Its dry core of botrytis is controlled by acidity and citrus flavors. Still developing and still young, it needs to age for many years. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château de Malle 2014  Sauternes

Description: This late harvest wine from Hungary is comprised of Furmint, Hárslevelu and Muscat. It has aromas of acacia flower and pear, with flavors of apricot, pear juice and dried rosemary. The finish is pleasantly sweet without being too cloying.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2016 Late Harvest  (Tokaji)

Description: This wine is already balanced and developing quickly. It has fine acidity and crisp citrus and floral honey flavors. With its light touch, it's likely to be ready to enjoy. Drink now–2021.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2014  Sauternes

Description: This wine has rich, intense yellow fruit, orange marmalade and concentrated botrytis flavors. With all the elements in place, it is well poised to mature slowly and gently into a very fine wine. Its concentration is balanced by fresh fruit and and honey notes. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château d'Arche 2014  Sauternes

Description: From a Barsac-based producer who prefers to use the Sauternes appellation, this rich, intense wine has weight, opulence and layers of honey and botrytis flavors. While still young, it shows impressive apricot and liquorous flavors. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Caillou 2014  Sauternes

Description: Packed with dry botrytis and delicious ripe fruit, this is a rich wine. It's full of fruitiness and has a great core of sweet honey and balanced acidity. Dense and ripe, it's just beginning its journey. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2014 Lions de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

Description: A gold color and honey aromas set the scene for this rich, opulent wine. It has a great layer of botrytis as well as plenty of spice and delicious apricot and orange fruit flavors, finishing with a tang of crisp acidity. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Simon 2011 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Sauternes)

Description: This rich, impressive wine is full of ripe fruit and balanced acidity. It has intensity, sweetness and botrytis rich enough to lend a dry core. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Rieussec 2014 Carmes  (Sauternes)

Description: Illogically, there are two second wines at this estate. This is the richer of the two (the other is Lions). It has intensity, spice, ripe apricot fruit and a smooth, dense texture. Its honey and botrytis notes are just right while the thread of acidity keeps it all in place. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2011 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

Description: This is already a beautiful wine. An intense flavor of dried apricot fruit is balanced by a serious core of botrytis. With its underlying acidity, this is concentrated, ripe and sure to age well. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2014 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

Description: This rich wine is dominated by concentrated botrytis tones, yet its acidity and lemon flavors are still very much at the fore. With its firm structure, spice notes and crisp lemon fruit still coming together, it suggests a fine future. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Lamothe Despujols 2014  Sauternes

Description: This rich wine is full of intense botrytis. It has fine poise, balancing its concentrated apricot and lemon flavors with botrytis notes. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2014 Madame de Rayne  (Sauternes)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Old forgotten Corsican varieties have been revived for this imaginative blend. Vinified and aged in cement eggs, it has extra richness and concentration. Ripe melon, yellow fruit and spice notes mingle with its crisp acidity. Drink now.
Name: Clos Venturi 2014 Chiesa Nera White (Vin de France)

Description: On the bank opposite the Sauternes region, Cadillac, with its fortified castle, is home to some richly liquorous wines. This 2010 is honeyed and opulent, with a smooth texture and just a bite of botrytis. Drink this peach- and bitter orange-flavored wine now.
Name: Château Biac 2010 Secret de Château Biac  (Cadillac)

Description: The lighter of the two second wines of classed-growth Suduiraut, this is a more accessible reflection of the richness of the grand vin. At four years old, it's still young, its acidity and crisp lemon flavors contrasting its core of botrytis and delicious fruit. Drink this balanced wine from 2020.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2013 Lions de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

Description: Balanced and fruity, this ripe, sweet wine delivers both botrytis and generous fruit. It has fine acidity to cut through the richness, giving intense sweetness and a dry core. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2014 La Chapelle  (Sauternes)

Description: Luscious ripe fruit flavors are balanced by great acidity in this rich but vibrant wine that's blended from Marsanne and Chardonnay. Honeydew melon and white-peach flavors fan out on the palate as the wine's generous texture coats the palate. Subtle spices like vanilla, white pepper and ginger add complexity.
Name: Monochrome 2016 Analog In A Digital Age White (California)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: Produced in the small white-wine enclave within the Madiran appellation, this wine is a blend of the two emblematic grapes of the region. It's rich and full bodied, hinting at the ripeness of the sweet wines that are also made here. It has style, along with intense acidity, apricot and pear flavors and smooth fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Famille Laplace 2015 Odé d'Aydie  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Rich and dense, this generous wine has considerable botrytis as well as perfumed apricot and bitter orange flavors. It's ripe and full of fruit and honey. Drink from 2020.
Name: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2014 Symphonie  (Sauternes)

Description: Maturity comes slowly to a Sauternes, but this wine is almost there. Its fine sweetness is balanced by a lemon curd-like acidity while its rich botrytis is finely integrated with the opulent texture. Drink now.
Name: Château Simon 2010 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Sauternes)

Description: Although based in Barsac, this producer has vines in Sauternes, which form the backbone of this wine. Still young, it's ripe and lightly yeasty yet rich with honeyed botrytis. Full and dense, it brings in just the right amount of acidity at the end. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Simon 2011  Sauternes

Description: Strong, concentrated honey flavors dominate this wine that is maturing well. It has a firm edge of dry botrytis to accentuate its rich orange and spice notes. Hints of acidity lend balance, although more would be welcome to provide relief from the richness. Drink now.
Name: Château Dauphiné Rondillon 2009 Cuvée d'Exception  (Loupiac)

Description: Subtle savory mineral flavors and an impressive mouth-filling texture give a unique personality to this medium-bodied wine. An unusual blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Marsanne, it has tangy acidity offset by hints of richness while lemon and crisp apple flavors light up the palate.
Name: Monochrome 2016 Variations on a Theme White (California)

Description: The sweetness of this wine is well contained by acidity, with spice, lemon and honey flavors. It has fine fruit, a crisp texture and a feeling of lightness. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2014 Petit Védrines  (Barsac)

Description: From a great sweet wine vintage, this beautifully balanced wine walks easily between ripe, honeyed botrytis flavors and delicious crisp apricot and bitter orange fruit. While it's still young and will age well, it's tempting to drink now for its delicious balance. Best from 2019.
Name: Château du Cros 2013  Loupiac

Description: This wine is opulent with rich orange marmalade flavors and generous sweetness. Acidity balances it all, lifting the richness and giving it life. Ripe from the first sip, it finishes with apricot and orange notes. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Climens 2014 Cyprès  (Barsac)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is an unusually substantive and aromatic white wine made from a blend of Pinot Noir and Pinot Gris that's also light in alcohol. A winemaker would say it has lots of phenolics, meaning the flavor and texture characteristics that come from the grape skins. The aromas are like apple skin and mild spices and the flavors mimic apricot and white peach. It feels full on the palate and well balanced by acidity.
Name: Lichen Estate 2015 Les Pinots Noir & Gris White (Anderson Valley)

Description: This rich, wood-aged blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc is packed with botrytis and ripe, concentrated fruit. It's opulent, with bitter orange and yellow fruit flavors and a fine cut of acidity to keep it all in shape. Drink now.
Name: Château Kalian 2014  Monbazillac

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This tradition-bucking blend of 40% Sauvignon Blanc, 20% Viognier, 20% Sémillon and 20% Roussanne from three different vineyards is very subtle and clean on the nose with aromas of yellow apple, crisp pear, ripe grapefruit skins and the lightest hint of honey. The crisp palate is very grippy in texture, with pear and light lemon spray flavors. It will likely age well, due to strong acidity.
Name: Luna Hart 2016 Aurora White (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This spicy wine is full of botrytis, giving a dry edge to its rich, honeyed flavors. It has an intense character, hovering between very sweet and dry. Structured with strong acidity, it will be ready to drink from 2018.
Name: Château Lamourette 2010  Sauternes

Description: With considerable botrytis, this wine is intense and rich. It's still tight at this stage, structured with layers of spice and fruit. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Coutet 2014 Chartreuse  (Barsac)

Description: Now perfectly mature, this ripe, spicy wine is delicious. It shows a fine balance between botrytis, fruit and acidity, keeping it at once crisp and richly sweet. Ready to drink.
Name: Château Dauphiné Rondillon 2008 Cuvée d'Or  (Loupiac)

Description: This perfumed wine, with its lychee aromas, is full and rich. That aromatic character continues on the palate, giving rich spice and lychee flavors that are cut with just enough acidity. It's full bodied and ripe and will be ready to drink from 2018.
Name: Clos Venturi 2016 White (Corse)

Description: This poised late-harvest blend of Loin de l'Oeil and Sauvignon Blanc tastes lightly honeyed, with an edge of dry botrytis. Perhaps more prominent are the dried apricot and spice notes, along with balanced acidity. Intense and in need of more aging, it will be best from late 2018.
Name: Domaine Rotier 2016 Les Gravels White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of fig and spice lead to well-balanced fruit flavors that draw out on the finish. Some additional time in the bottle should serve it well. Give it until late 2018.
Designation: Estate Grown Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2016 Estate Grown Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Château de Cérons, which also produces sweet wines, uses the same grape varieties for this dry white. It has an almost honeyed character that fills out its crisp acidity and citrusy orange flavors. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Château de Cérons 2015  Graves

Description: This soft wine is still waiting for its intensity to come through. The acidity is there, as is ripe, honeyed fruit. Wait until 2022 to open it.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2014 Charmilles  (Sauternes)

Description: Apricot and orange flavors are still right up front in this rich wine. Its acidity and poise show a balance that is delicious now. The aftertaste is crisp, cool and stylish.
Name: Château Simon 2009 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Sauternes)

Description: Aromas of toasted bread and vanilla echo in the rich, buttery flavors of this full-bodied and lavishly textured white Rhône-style blend. The oaky spices make it serious and complex while mild pear and almond flavors take a second seat.
Name: Rock Wall 2015 Mama's Reserve White (California)

Description: This passito-style blend of Muscat Ottonel and Vidal Blanc is layered with amber honey, marmalade, apricot in the fruit camp, and hazelnut, mushroom,toast and ginger for complexity. The palate is equally stimulating and leads to a gorgeous earthiness at the end. In feel this is silky smooth, with ample acidity to carry the plushness. The finish is long and harmonious.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2014 Passito White (Virginia)

Description: With its pale gold color, this wine has acacia honey aromas and a great balance between acidity and rich yellow and mango fruit flavors. It's developing quickly, maintaining its acidity and crispness while bringing out rich apricot and botrytis notes. Drink from 2020.
Name: Chateau la Rame 2014  Saint-Croix-du-Mont

Description: From the owners of Château de Cérons, this wine is rich with tropical fruit flavors and toasty from wood-aging. It's warm and ripe, its smoothly textured Sémillon lifted by Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now.
Name: Château Calvimont 2015  Graves

Description: Crisp and tangy, this light-bodied wine has a (pardon the pun) piny green-apple aroma, vivid apple and lime flavors and lively acidity. It will be especially good as an apéritif to whet the appetite.
Name: Pine Ridge 2016 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (California)

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Apricot and ripe yellow and white stone fruit flavors mark this wine as warm and soft, with a generous texture. It's rounded and finishes with almond and spice notes. Drink now.
Name: Château Puyanché 2016  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: This generous, herbal wine from the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region has attractive spice and great fruitiness. In addition to its citrus character, there is mango flavor and richness to broaden it. Drink now.
Name: Château Turcaud 2015 Cuvée Majeure  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This blend of the two Manseng white grapes is full of late-harvest richness and intense acidity. It has a touch of honey, lemon curd sweetness and a light texture. It will be ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Jurque 2015 Tendresse  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This wine has intense acidity and a tight texture that will obviously need time to open up, but ripe apricot and honey flavors are present now. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Rabaud-Promis 2014 Raymond Louis  (Sauternes)

Description: This wine is closed at this young stage but hints at an underlying richness. That leaves acidity and fragrant lemongrass-like crispness at the fore. It needs time to fill out, so drink from 2021.
Name: Château Guiraud 2014 Petit Guiraud  (Sauternes)

Description: This honeyed white wine made from late-harvest grapes is both intensely rich and so fresh and crisp. Its acidity cuts through the ripe apricot and candied orange flavors, creating a balance that will allow it to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Jolys 2015  Jurançon
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Apricot and peach aromas lead the way in this still-tight, mineral wine. Its richness is drawn up at this stage, showing crisp acidity as well as honey and pineapple flavors. It's likely to age well, so drink from 2019.
Name: Clos Dady 2014  Sauternes

Description: This young wine with its edge of dry botrytis is just starting out. Apricot aromas are a sign of what is to come, as its fine balance between honey and fruit comes into play. Acidity keeps everything crisp. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Tanesse 2015  Cadillac

Description: Fresh apple and honey aromas give this fruity wine a great start. With its acidity, spice, touch of honey and crisp white fruit, it's delicious, perfumed and ripe. A full-bodied wine that's a pleasure to drink now, with food.
Name: Château Jolys 2015  Jurançon Sec
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Unctuous Sémillon and touches of wood mark this second wine from Château du Cros. It's honeyed and rich yet has plenty of acidity and crispness. It shows poise as well as indications that it will age quickly. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château du Cros 2015 Ségur du Cros  (Loupiac)

Description: From one of the region's leading producers and biodynamic rockstars, this wine stands out from the crowd. It offers apple tart, lemon rind and wild mint, with some floral soap notes. The acidity is present but not overpowering, balanced by some textural weight and an attractive citrus and spice finish.
Name: Cullen 2015 Ephraim Clarke Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: Amber honey and peach jam aromas are in the forefront of this passito-style wine. Marmalade, praline and African honeybush tea fold into button mushroom notes in the background. These translate onto the palate effortlessly. The acidity feels sprightly and lifts this lucious wine. The finish is long and luxurious.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2013 Passito White (Virginia)

Description: This rich blend gets its ripe texture and warm pear and citrus flavors from 50% Sémillon. It has an attractive perfumed edge, with kiwi-like acidity and a peppery aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2016 Cuvée des Conti White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: Crisp with acidity and ripe with apricot flavors, this is a finely perfumed wine. A core of botrytis hints at future richness. Now, it boasts bitter orange notes and a bright finish.
Name: Château d'Arche 2014 Perle  (Sauternes)

Description: This blend of Petit Manseng, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier is intense on the nose, offering heady notes of pear drop, geranium and savory herbs. The palate boasts mango, pear, citrus rind and a bouquet of wildflowers. The acidity dances in your mouth and gives it a long finish that is tangy, zippy and lasting with fruit.
Name: Early Mountain 2016 Five Forks White (Virginia)

Description: Though not labeled as such, this wine is all Gewürztraminer. It's aromatic with aromas of lychee, rose petal and spice. The flavors are light and dry, almost delicate, with abundant floral accents.
Name: Indian Creek 2014 Dry White Mountain Syringa White

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a unique blend of Viognier, Sauvignon Blanc, Grenache Blanc, Sémillon and Marsanne. Light aromas of melon and citrus lead to dry full-feeling fruit flavors that bring a rounded feel. It's an intriguing wine.
Name: Telaya 2016 Anam White (Yakima Valley)

Description: This soft, fruity wine delivers honey and apricot aromas. With touches of botrytis, it has a dry, spicy edge. At the same time, it's full of bitter orange and yellow fruit. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Dauphiné Rondillon 2011  Loupiac

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: With a touch of toast and plenty of spice, this is a wine in which crisp fruit is just one of many flavors. Typical of the vintage, it's warm, rich and ready to drink.
Name: Château Haut Grelot 2016 Cuvée Sélection  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Clean and crisp aromas of Asian pear, lemongrass, honeysuckle, passion fruit and green plum show on the nose of this blend of 64% Sémillon and 36% Sauvignon Blanc. The palate would go down very easy on a hot day, with just a touch of acid-carrying flavors of gardenia, guava, mango and kaffir lime leaf.
Name: Bonny Doon 2015 De Propio Gravitas White (North Coast)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This opens with crisp and attractive spice and almond flavors. They go with the acidity, lemon and apple notes to give a balanced, complex wine. Drink from mid-2018.
Name: Château Dubraud 2016  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: From vines situated in the best part of the Entre-deux-Mers for white wines, this strikes a balance between herbal notes and ripe yellow fruit. Lightly perfumed and with a honeyed edge from the Muscadelle in the blend, it finishes crisp. Drink now.
Name: Château Landereau 2016  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This wine is young—full of acidity and rich yellow fruit. A blend of Petit and Gros Manseng, it has the typical honeyed edge yet is bone dry. It will take time for its intense acidity to calm down, so drink from late 2018.
Name: Château de Jurque 2016 Fantaisie  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a lot of tropicality on the nose of this blend of 82% Roussanne, 10% Viognier and 8% Sauvignon Blanc, including mango, guava, coconut and banana chips. Those elements also show on the palate, but are honed in by a grippy texture and crisp acidity.
Name: ONX 2016 L'Autre Femme White (Paso Robles)

Description: From a fine vintage for sweet wines in Bordeaux, this is fruity and ready to drink. Good acidity is the key here, balancing the apricot and bitter orange sweetness. Drink now.
Name: Château du Pavillon 2013  Saint-Croix-du-Mont

Description: A blend of 80% Trebbiano and 20% Malvasia partially fermented in barriques, this has subtle aromas of orchard fruit and a hint of pressed flower. The bright medium-bodied palate offers suggestions of ripe Golden Delicious apple, lemon peel and a hint of oak-driven spice.
Name: Olivi 2015 Le Buche Coreno White (Orcia)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a floral, perfumed and smooth wine. Its blend—a classic for Gascony—gives a ripe character as well as herbal and citrus flavors. It's ready to drink.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2016 Blandine le Blanc Ugni Blanc-Colombard (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: This crisp blend of Chardonnay and Viognier is bright, with lively fruit and a smooth texture behind its crisp facade. It's ready to drink now but will soften over the next few months and be richer from mid-2018.
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2016 Monplaisir Chardonnay-Viognier (Côtes du Lot)

Description: Perfumed, floral and bright, this blend of Petit and Gros Manseng is packed with crisp fruit and refreshing acidity. It has a touch of pepper from its richness that balances its mineral texture and final fruitiness.
Name: Château de Jurque 2015 Fantaisie  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This combines 85% Pinot Blanc with 15% Viognier. Together, they offer a full, fleshy and fruit-forward expression of peach and pineapple that's fresh in uplifting acidity.
Name: Valley of the Moon 2015 White (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Baked apple aromas and crisp green fruit flavors set up this bright, fruity wine. With its lively character and juicy citrus notes, it could age a few more months. Save it for summer 2018.
Importer: Bad Boys' Wines, LLC (Les Gamins Malins)
Name: Château des Tourtes 2016 Cuvée Classique  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Medium yellow in color, this wine has aromas of tangerine and Turkish delight. It is soft on the palate, with flavors of pineapple, lemon and flint that lead to a lime zest finish.
Name: Ouled Thaleb 2016 Moroccan White (Zenata)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Bright citrus aromas lead the way in this warm, rich and perfumed wine. I's smooth, ripe and rich, with citrus and apple flavors. Drink now.
Name: Château Haut Bertinerie 2016 Grand Vin  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Light and fruity, with hints of botrytis and nutmeg spiciness, this wine is ripe, balanced and ready to drink. Its apricot fruit and acidity are well integrated.
Name: Château La Caussade 2015  Saint-Croix-du-Mont

Description: Orange and tangerine aromas include notes of lime and Mr. Clean. This blend of Gewürztraminer, Chardonnay and Moscato feels healthy and properly acidic. Flavors of pineapple, doughnut peach and honey finish with just enough zest and cut. Drink now.
Name: Viñedo de los Vientos 2016 Estival White (Atlantida)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Crisp with bright fruit recalling sliced apples, this wine is fruity and fresh. Acidity cuts easily through it and lends an herbal edge. Drink now.
Name: Château Barbé 2016  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: This wine ultrarich—perhaps too much so. With intense apricot and spice flavors, it's a dense powerhouse of bitter botrytis that lacks elegance. Although it will soften with time, the superripe character will remain.
Name: Château les Roques 2013  Loupiac

Description: On the synthetic side to start, the lime, lemon and tropical fruits eventually reveal themselves, with blossoms, grass, and herbal spice in the background. The palate is tightly wound and mouth-puckering, giving way to a slightly bitter-herbed finish.
Name: Voyager Estate 2015 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: This blend, dominated by Sémillon and Sauvignon Gris, gives a rich, perfumed and ripe-tasting wine. Acidity balances its full apricot and pear fruit flavors. With its creamy texture, it's ready to drink.
Name: Château La Fleur Ribeyrolles 2016  Entre-Deux-Mers

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This wine is perfumed, ripe and soft. It shows the richness of the vintage with plenty of warm fruit. Lemon flavors lend a final lift to richer apricot and pear notes. Drink now.
Name: Château Gardut Haut Cluzeau 2016  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: On the riper spectrum rather than youthful and fresh, this shows wet wool, ripe lemons and stone fruit, with a hint of green beans and florals. The palate is backed by searing acidity and a slightly woolly texture. Rather simple in style but it clearly shows the characters of both the Sauvignon Blanc and the Sémillon.
Name: Clairault 2016 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a strongly herbal wine. Its acidity and crisp texture give it great lift, bringing out lively fruitiness and a green fruit aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Château les Jouberts Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a perfumed wine with yellow fruit and baked apple flavors. Attractive and with delicious acidity, it's ready to drink now.
Name: Château Les Bertrands 2016 Cuvée Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This late harvest wine is soft with delicious creamed apple and light honey flavors. It's spicy and attractive to drink as an apéritif.
Name: Château de Marsan 2015 Moelleux  (Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Honey and quince aromas and apricot and spice flavors bring out the medium sweetness of this finely balanced wine. There's plenty of acidity to balance its great fruitiness and honeyed succulence. Drink now.
Name: Famille Laplace 2016 Aramis Petit Manseng-Sauvignon White (Vin de France)

Description: It's no wonder this wine is called Kaleidoscope: a blend of Viognier, Gewürztraminer, Riesling and Muscat, it's unique and multifaceted. The varieties have come together very satisfactorily, giving perfumed and plenty of ripe fruitiness. With its touches of lychee, apricot and spice and crisp, tight acidity, it's ready to drink now.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 San de Guilhem Kaléidoscope White (Comté Tolosan)
