Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2016 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This wine is intense and concentrated, ripe in generous tropical and citrus fruits. There is plenty of lemon as well as grapefruit in the tight, mineral texture. It is likely to age well, and should be best from 2020.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: An incredibly pure and piercing note of lemon oil hits the nose. The medium-sweet palate impresses with both fresh and dried notes of fruit: plum, white sultana, white currant and the ripest pear and apple you can imagine. This is full-on and big but balanced by tingling, fresh and precise acidity. A field blend of polar opposites, Riesling and Gewurztraminer, this unites their virtues of aromatic textured richness and poised finesse. Again, this is not a wine that is easily categorized with its medium-sweet, soil- and fruit-driven profile, but it is a joy to experience and savor. The finish lasts and lasts. Drink 2017–2035.
Name: Biecher & Schaal 2015 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru White (Alsace)

Description: The wine shows the success of white wines in the 2014 vintage. Initially it has lively acidity and a crisp texture. Then the palate fills out with complex citrus, pineapple and apricot flavors. The aftertaste—juicy and tangy—is already delicious. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Olivier 2014  Pessac-Léognan

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This wine is hugely rich while having wonderful acidity at its end. Dense botrytis and a powerful structure go along with the honey and marmalade flavors. It will certainly age well and long.
Name: Château Guiraud 2016 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. A perfectly balanced wine, this boasts a beautiful harmony between bright acidity and ripe, sweet fruit. It is rich, but balanced by great acidity as well as lingering spicy notes. It is suited for long-term aging.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2016 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: Hints of sultana and cooked quince reach the nose suggesting richness. The palate, however, responds with streamlined freshness, ripe fruit and depth and gives us concentration rather than richness. Tangy citrus zest frames notions of ripe apple and quince while shadows of dried fruit still haunt aromatically. The finish is clean, totally satisfying and dry. This is soaring but hearty stuff.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2014 Langenberg White (Alsace)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Tightly crisp, this coiled, nervy wine is likely to age well. It has a refreshing, crisp undertone that gives it freshness while just hinting at the warmth of the vintage.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. While this wine is crisp, it is also full of ripe apricot and spice tones as well as pink grapefruit and intense acidity. The balance is great, setting the wine up for some excellent aging.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This dense wine is poised between rich botrytized fruit and fresh acidity. The structure of the wine and the dry core certainly suggest the potential for it to age well.
Name: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2016 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. As with its red, the white wine from this chateau continues to improve. Balanced and ripe, with bright, forward fruit, this wine has so much freshness while at the same time fruity generosity. With notes of spice, a pleasant mineral texture and final burst of acidity, this is a wine for aging.
Name: Château Olivier 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Intense citrus is overlaid by the ripe pineapple and tropical fruit. This delicious complex wine, with its tangy acidity, tightly coiled texture and touches of wood aging, is packed with great fruit. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2014  Pessac-Léognan

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This is an impressive wine, dominated by botrytis and rich honeyed flavors. It is concentrated, rip and dense, with a great future.
Name: Château de Fargues 2016 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. One of the great Sauternes estates, Rayne Vigneau has produced here a rich wine that is beautifully structured and concentrated. Its edge of botrytis and fine acidity are all in balance.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2016 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This is a beautiful wine, ripe in swathes of rich apple and peach that is cut by bright, lemony acidity. It is exuberant, putting its fruit on a pedestal, and should age well. Hold until 2020.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This is full of ripe fruit notes, with layers of botrytis giving it a dry core. The acidity balances the generous honey and apricot flavors, resulting in a delicious experience.
Name: Château Raymond-Lafon 2016 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: Layered botrytis that gives the wine both its richness and dense texture. It is sweet but with a dry core and crisp acidity, it will age well. It is going to be a beautiful wine, with tropical fruits, apricots and wonderful final acidity. Drink from 2025.
Name: Château Rieussec 2014  Sauternes

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This almost dry wine is full of botrytized fruit tones. Well balanced, it is likely to turn into a rich, dense wine as it matures, with ample acidity that shines on the finish.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2016 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: The nose needs air but as it wakes up, subtle notes of fragrant baked peach rise. On the palate a streak of lemon freshness provides both frame and direction, alongside a lovely apple-skin texture. Made from a blend of Riesling, Pinot Gris and Gewürztraminer this unites the virtues of each variety. This is full of life and impresses with its great precision and freshness. The finish is bone dry. Lovely now but will age. Drink now through 2025.
Name: Clément Klur 2013 Win.ck White (Alsace)

Description: With swathes of delicious herbal and green Sauvignon Blanc fruit just delicately underpinned by the wood aging, this is a wine that is rich while remaining so crisp. It is the tangy grapefruit and crisp texture that will allow this wine to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Margaux 2014 Pavillon Blanc du Château Margaux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Brilliant golden color promises richness. The nose obliges with a seamless scent of apples: fresh and ripe, baked and mellow. The palate shows soaring freshness, but countless notions swirl on the dry palate of this traditional field blend: citrus and apple, pear and blossom. There is so much fruit, so much expression, this is pure exuberance, but in a rather grown-up way. A very apt expression of both the freshness and the richness of Alsace.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2015 Alsace White (Alsace)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine is rich with a smooth texture, featuring tropical fruits and great tangy acidity to balance. There is a touch of spice, nutmeg and orange zest. Drink after 2020.
Designation: Le Petit Haut Lafitte Barrel Sample
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2016 Le Petit Haut Lafitte Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine is richly endowed with a white fruit core that's graced by hints of lemon and wood spice. It is a finely structured wine, hinting at a ripe, full future.
Name: Château la Garde 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This is spicy and fruity, with tropical elements balanced by crisp lemon flavors in this ripe, opulent wine. The finish is bright and tight, with a strong mineral element.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Touched by toast, this is a lovely wine, its acidity deliciously filled out by lemon, apple and apricot tones. The texture is lively and bright, leading into a refreshing finish.
Name: Château Couhins-Lurton 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: This second wine of whites from both Haut-Brion and La Mission Haut-Brion is both rich and intensely crisp. It has a fine blend between great acidity and grapefruit fruit and a more tropical element. The tangy texture is taut with a mineral edge. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2014 La Clarté de Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This 100% Sauvignon Blanc offering is the second white by Smith Haut Lafitte. With excellent acidity and a fine herbal character, expect a wine that is tight, crisp and deliciously fresh.
Designation: Les Hauts de Smith Barrel Sample
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2016 Les Hauts de Smith Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: This wine, which is dominated by Sauvignon Blanc, is from a small plot in the vineyard of La Garde. It is wood aged, giving spice as well as ripe, smooth fruit. There is a young herbal edge that will certainly soften as it ages. This is an aromatic crisp wine that will be ready to drink from 2021.
Name: Château la Garde 2014  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This is a bright wine—still a little closed but promising fine fruitiness for the future. With herbal acidity, lemon and grapefruit flavors and a zesty tang at the end, it will develop relatively quickly. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Couhins 2014  Pessac-Léognan

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This historic estate, with its magnificent chateau, has made an elegant wine in 2016. Without great richness, but with fine acidity and honeyed flavors, it will age well for the medium term.
Name: Château de Malle 2016 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: Peach and rose-focused potpourri scent the nose. The palate has great direction and freshness and a rich textured core that almost comes across as oily. The result is a perfect contrast between tangy freshness and rich fruit. Bursting fruit and perfume are countered by zesty citrus. The flavors last and last and the finish is dry.
Name: Clément Klur 2015 Gentil de Katz White (Alsace)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This wine has sweetness and a honeyed character, but it is the rich botrytized fruit that allows it to have depth and density. The ample acidity lends balance to the palate and refreshment to the finish.
Name: Château Bastor Lamontagne 2016 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This wine is rounded and ripe, although with a tight mineral texture that masks the inherent fruitiness of lemon and white fruit flavors. Hints of wood aging are already there. The wine, crisp at the end, will age well.
Name: Château Brown 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. There is a touch of herbal character in this wine that contrasts with richer apple and apricot flavors. The wine is balanced and fruity with a zesty tang that gives it aging potential. Drink after 2022.
Name: Château Cantelys 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: This is all citrus and herbal flavors from an estate noted for its pure white wines. It makes for a tight zesty wine with a chalky mineral texture. The fruits are developing to give a crisp wine that's full of fruit along with intense acidity. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2014  Pessac-Léognan

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This blend of 60% Malvasia and 40% Trebbiano boasts caramel, candied ginger and pine nut aromas. The concentrated, polished palate doles out candied apricot, maple syrup and toasted almond flavors, with a touch of carob.
Name: Castello di Selvole 1996  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

Description: This is a ripe and tropical wine, complex with wood aging. It is warm, intensely rich and piled with mango and pineapple flavors. The acidity and crispness are well behind this smooth, creamy wine. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2014  Pessac-Léognan

Description: The nose is shy but subtly hints at citrus zest. The palate comes alive with subtle, fresh and very pure fruit: exquisitely accurate notions of mirabelle plum and beautifully aromatic tangerine. This is pure, streamlined and richly fruited, but done in a subtle grown-up way. A real joy to savor and drink. Finishes dry.
Name: Domaine Pfister 2015 Cuvée 8 White (Alsace)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made of 60% Trebbiano and 40% Malvasia, this opens with acacia honey, ripe Annurca apple and hazelnut aromas that carry over to the vanilla-inflected palate. Don't dip your cookies in this one; it's more of a vino da meditazione.
Name: Volpaia 2011  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is balanced, light and fragrant. Flavors of honey and sweet apricot harmonize with plenty of acidity. This is already an approachable, attractive wine.
Name: Château Rabaud-Promis 2016 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. The 76% of high-yield Sémillon in this wine is unusual from Domaine Clarence Dillon's top estates. The blend (with 24% Sauvignon Blanc) is drawn from the second wine vats of Haut-Brion and La Mission Haut-Brion. Concentrated and lightly perfumed, it is likely to age quickly.
Designation: Le Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2016 Le Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. From a clay- and limestone-based parcel at la Tour Carnet, this ripe wine is dominated by tropical fruit-flavored Sauvignon Blanc. It has concentration as well as a warm, ripe character, and should be suited to early enjoyment.
Name: Chateau La Tour Carnet 2016 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made of equal parts dried Trebbiano and Malvasia grapes, this dessert wine has intense toasted almond, maple syrup and caramel aromas. The dense, structured palate delivers acacia honey, dried fig and toasted hazelnut flavors.
Name: Losi Querciavalle 2000  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

Description: Made of 70% Trebbiano, 15% San Colombano and 15% Sangiovese, this savory dessert wine opens with fig, maple syrup and caramel aromas. The complex palate delivers chestnut honey, toasted almond and candied date flavors, while a hint of dried tangerine accents the lingering finish.
Name: Sangervasio 2005 Recinaio White (Colli Etruria Centrale)

Description: This is Cape Mentelle's biggest selling wine in the U.S., and one taste makes it clear why. It's got some of the herbal and passion fruit notes of Sauvignon Blanc, balanced by the strong citrus of Semillon. It's clean, crisp and long on the finish, with a lightly silky texture that lingers. Drink now.
Name: Cape Mentelle 2016 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: Ripe tropical fruits along with intense sweet lemon give this wine its fine acidity and ripe character. It is pure, clear and clean with lively acidity and a tangy zingy aftertaste that also brings in some minerality. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2014 Aigle d'Argent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This is a creamy wine, with a touch of perfumed Muscadelle. It shows touches of tropical fruits as well as citrus, spice and a lively, bright aftertaste. It will be ready to drink from 2020.
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2016 Aile d'Argent Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This soft, light wine is likely to be attractively drinkable by 2020. It's a forward, fruity wine, with final touches of citrus and spice.
Name: Château Couhins 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This is a well-balanced wine that has ripe tropical-fruit and citrus flavors. Despite the warm, dry summer, it is so bright and lively, packed with fruitiness and crisp acidity.
Name: Château Cos d'Estournel 2016 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. A rich wine from a rich year for whites, this has notes of tropical fruit, lemon and lime. The wood aging will surely give it extra richness. To contrast, the mineral edge will allow it to age.
Name: Château de France 2016 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine has delicious citrus and ripe green-apple flavors, as well as a crisp, lightly mineral texture. It is already showing its refreshing, crisp side that will develop.
Name: Château Rahoul 2016 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This blend contains a high proportion of Sémillon alongside Sauvignon Gris. It is a tangy, orange zest-flavored wine, with ample acidity as well as ripe apricot and spice flavors. It's a wine to drink from 2019.
Name: Château Magrez Fombrauge 2016 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is smooth and ripe. Great fruits shine through along with acidity, with attractive notes of honey and spice.
Name: Château d'Arche 2016 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This is a lively, fruity wine with a background of dry botrytis. It has a tangy, lemon zest edge that gives it a crisp character, finishing with a light touch.
Name: Château Suau 2016 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: The rosy floral overtones of Muscat are very evident on the fragrant nose. The palate, on the other hand, gives us the texture of Pinot Gris and the freshness of Riesling while floral nuances hover and swirl. This is a lovely blend of all that Alsace does well. Friendly and fresh with a dry finish.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2015 One White (Alsace)

Description: This blend of Trebbiano, Malvasia, and San Colombano seduces with dried fig, raisin and vanilla aromas. The plush palate delivers toasted walnut, acacia honey and confectionary notes, while a coffee flavor closes the finish. Bright acidity tempers the richness.
Name: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2008 Vinsanto White (Pomino)

Description: Roughly equal percentages of Gewürztraminer, Pinot Blanc, Riesling and Pinot Gris (with a splash of Muscat) create a wine that transcends the mutt wine moniker and belongs in a category all its own. Just slightly off dry, it's like taking a bite out of a just-picked pear-apple (if such a thing existed). This crunchy luscious white wine is juicy and alive with flavor. Don't wait—drink it now for a big burst of summer no matter how cold it may be outside.
Name: Jezebel 2015 White (Oregon)

Description: This nonvintage blend is best identified by its edtion number—this latest being #20. It's a runaway success, cleverly incorporating up to eight different varieties. Mixing aromatic whites and fruit-powered grapes such as Chardonnay and Pinot Gris, it captures the best of both. Here the citrusy aromatics are principally from Muscat, while a touch of Sémillon adds a lick of lanolin to the tangy, juicy fruit.
Name: Sokol Blosser NV Evolution Lucky No. 9 White (America)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made of 60% Malvasia, 30% Trebbiano and 10% Sangiovese, this opens with apricot and orange jam aromas. The warm, structured palate delivers toasted almond, chestnut honey and dried fig flavors. Drink through 2025.
Name: I Veroni 2007  Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This is a sumptuous wine, full of ripe tropical fruits, with just enough acidity to balance. Juicy apricots, peaches and spice from the wood aging mingle together harmoniously.
Name: Le Nardian 2016 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: The ripe 65% of Sémillon is the secret behind this rich wine. While at the young stage it has a herbal character that is going to fill out impressively to give a creamy wine with a touch of vanilla and fine crisp, juicy acidity. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Rahoul 2014  Graves

Description: Wonderfully pure apple freshness creates a totally fruity and appetizing nose. The palate is fruity and really fresh. This is full of life and primary aromas, backed by a lovely apple-peel texture. The finish is dry, whistle-clean and perfectly fresh. Drink soon.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2015 Crustacés White (Alsace)

Description: The nose is both supple and rich with its suggestion of ripe pear. The palate exemplifies the freshness of Riesling with its citrus overtones and is grounded by the textural richness of Pinot Gris. This is a rather successful blend of these two varieties, bringing ample freshness, texture and fruit. The finish is clean and dry.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2015 Black Tie White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This wine is fresh and crisp as much as sweet. It has attractive acidity and light a botrytis character. It is suited for medium-term enjoyment.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2016 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: This is pungent, showing some sweaty, boxwood notes alongside lemony citrus fruit. It's light on its feet, with moderately intense lemon flavors that fade on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Howard Park 2016 Miamup Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: Sourced from an experimental vineyard planted in the early 1970s, this blends eight different varieties, all picked on the same day and co-fermented. At least one red grape (Cabernet Sauvignon), adds a touch of amber to the wine. It could be called rosé, though it's listed as a white wine. In any event, it's unique, with concentrated flavors of tree fruits, citrus peel and anise. Try it with charcuterie.
Name: Love & Squalor 2014 Field Blend Wings of Desire White (Yamhill-Carlton)

Description: Australia used to make more blends like this, using the acids of Semillon to balance the ripeness of Chardonnay. In this case, they come together to offer toasty, honeyed notes backed by a strong lemony spine. It's crisp and tart on the finish at first, then relaxes rapidly with airing, so drink it over the next year or so.
Name: Maverick 2012 Breechens Chardonnay-Semillon (Barossa)

Description: Just a touch of subtle rose gives a hint of fragrance to the nose. The palate is concentrated and almost oily in its texture, there is also freshness. This is a successful blend of Muscat, Auxerrois and sprightly Sylvaner which makes a very versatile and eminently food friendly wine.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2015 Alsace White (Alsace)

Appellation: Vin Santo di Carmignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: The nose of this 90% Trebbiano and 10% San Colombano wine suggests dried apricot, chestnut honey and marzipan. Its rich flavors carry over to a sweet, luscious finish.
Name: Capezzana 2009 Riserva  (Vin Santo di Carmignano)

Description: Friendly appetizing hints of Golden Delicious apple and pear make for an inviting but subtle nose. The palate is fresh and balanced, with a backbone of gentle but firm texture. The finish is clean and aromatic on this very successful blend of Riesling and Pinot Gris.
Name: Willm 2015 Cuvée Méli-Mélo White (Alsace)

Description: This blend of 60% Chardonnay with 40% Viognier opens with buttery popcorn aromas that lead into lithe, silky apple and apricot flavors. Restrained in its oak use, just hinting at vanilla, it has a tangy finish.
Name: Spann Vineyards 2014 Yin-Yang Chardonnay-Viognier (Sonoma County)

Description: Made predominantly from Chardonnay and Pinot Bianco, this opens with delicate white flower and orchard fruit aromas. The bright palate offers yellow apple, lemon and rosemary flavors, set against fresh acidity.
Name: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2015 Bianco White (Pomino)

Description: This blend of Verdejo and Viura opens with citrusy aromas that include tropical notes and a hint of minerality. A juicy citric palate holds orange and lemon-lime flavors, while this tastes citrusy on the finish.
Name: Emina 2016 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: A spicy, wood-aged wine with a fine combination of pineapple and citrus fruit. With the spice from the wood, the wine is rich while keeping a line of pure bright acidity. Drink the wine from late 2017.
Name: Le Nardian 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The wine has a honeyed bouquet which leads to a ripe pineapple and lemon-flavored wine. Wood aging has given a smoothness and richness. There is a fine lift of acidity at the end. Drink from 2018.
Name: Goulée 2014 Goulée de Cos d'Estournel  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Produced by the winemaking team of Château Giscours in Margaux, this is finely ripe blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc. With rich tropical fruits and lime flavors, it is balanced and already delicious. Drink now.
Name: Petite Sirène 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The so-called Northern Whites are Gewürztraminer, Müller-Thurgau, Pinot Gris and Riesling. They make a comfortable blend, with floral aromas and plump peach and apple fruit. Though finished dry, it has appealing fruit sweetness.
Name: Montinore 2015 Borealis The Northern Whites White (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: For a basic Spanish white, this rises above the norm. Lightly candied white-fruit aromas and a medium-bodied palate help this Macabeo (Viura) and Chardonnay blend get going. Flavors of green banana and pithy lime end with tropical overtones and controlled pyrazine-based pepper notes.
Name: Borsao 2015 Macabeo-Chardonnay (Campo de Borja)

Description: Stone-fruit aromas of peach and nectarine include a hint of gardenia and bath soap, which is likely attributable to the 40% Muscat that leads Viura, Chardonnay and Verdejo. With a grabby oily texture and flavors of green melon and lychee, this is pleasant and easy to sip.
Name: Vicente Gandia 2015 Hoya de Cadenas Night Harvest White (Valencia)

Description: There's no denying the intensity of this 60-40 blend, but could we dial up the ripeness just a little bit? This is tart almost to the point of sourness, with lemony flavors that last a good long time. Pair it with raw shellfish for best effect.
Name: Voyager Estate 2014 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: A barely ripe blend of Pinot Gris, Pinot Blanc, Riesling and Gewürztraminer, this has strong scents and flavors that combine in a rather strange way. Perfume, breath mint and tanned leather elements pile on, without really melding or enhancing one another. Whatever it is, it's not dull.
Name: Vercingetorix VX 2014 Auzriel Melody En Blanc White (Oregon)

Description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Verdejo opens with aromas of bath soap and apple juice. Plump and standard in feel, this tastes of stone fruits and salt. On the finish, which is steady but basic, this tastes bready and leesy.
Name: Vicente Gandia 2015 Hoya de Cadenas 130 Anniversary White (Valencia)

Description: Aromas of corn silk, toast and stone fruit are followed by dry, somewhat lean seeming fruit flavors. Floral notes persist on the finish.
Name: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2014 Proprietary Blend Vivacious White (America)

Description: The nose seems to be dampened by notes of earth. The palate, however, is fresh and sprightly with friendly pear notes but with slightly bitter edges. Drink soon.
Name: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2015 Côtes d'Ammerschwihr White (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of apple and dried melon are basic and clean. This Viura-Chardonnay has juicy outsized acidity to go with a chunky body. Generic slightly sweet apple flavors finish fresh, with a hint of lime.
Name: Bodegas Paniza 2015 Sleever Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Faint aromas of Anjou pear and Gala apple are shy to rise off this bottling. Baked apple and pear notes also come through on the palate, with a hint of honey and a noticeably grippy texture.
Name: EOS 2014 Reserve White (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This is an interesting blend—the proportions are 46% Riesling, 34% Sauvignon Blanc and 20% Marsanne. Passion fruit and white currants notes dominate, with hints of tomato stalk. It does taste slightly off dry, fading quickly on the finish.
Name: D'Arenberg 2015 The Stump Jump Riesling-Sauvignon Blanc-Marsanne White (Adelaide)

Description: This is so light in color it almost looks like water. Oily aromas suggest tropical fruits, while this feels lean and somewhat dilute. Pithy citrus is the key flavor, while an acidic finish shows a note of papaya.
Name: El Coto 2015 White (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of stone-fruit pit and citrus peel are punchy. This blend of Viura and Tempranillo Blanco feels solid. Pithy grapefruit and salty flavors carry over to the finish of this everyday white.
Name: Carlos Serres 2015 White (Rioja)

Description: White-fruit aromas are generic but satisfactory. This mix of Viura and Chardonnay is plump to the point of being slightly cloying. Candied melon and lime flavors finish short, with residual sweetness.
Name: Bodegas Paniza 2015 Agostón Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)

Description: Yeasty white-fruit aromas lead to a light-bodied affable palate. This blend of Viura and Chardonnay tastes as expected, meaning simple lemon-lime. A mild lees character surfaces on a standard finish.
Name: Las Valles 2015 Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)

Description: A soft and ripe wine, its Sauvignon Blanc component is well into the tropical fruit spectrum. Pineapple and white fruits give the wine its full, spicy and peppery character. There is just enough acidity to keep it crisp.
Name: Château Landonnet 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a soft wine from the warm white vintage of 2015. It is a touch herbal and much more tropical and white fruits. The balance is just right, so drink now.
Name: Saveur des Vins de France 2015 Les Portes de Bordeaux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: The nose suggests damp earth while the palate manages fresh clean apple fruit. The body is light and juicy and the finish dry. Drink soon.
Name: André Kientzler NV Edelzwicker White (Alsace)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Yeasty aromas are low on fruit and specifics. This Viura-Chardonnay blend is lazy in feel, with modest acidic cut. Sweet bland flavors quickly fall off and taste of powdered sugar on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Aragonesas NV Viura-Chardonnay (Campo de Borja)

Description: Intense aromas of peach and lemon-lime are softened by notes of concrete and flint. On the palate, there is a muskiness that is eventually overpowered by guava, peach and sour apple, finishing tart.
Name: Narmada 2015 Virginia Mom White (Virginia)

Description: On the nose, this wine offers muted banana, lychee and pineapple. Flavors are tropical and overripe, coating the mouth with plump papaya, passion fruit and guava. It's a little heavy, needing a bit more acidic lift.
Name: Veramar NV Riesling-Vidal Blanc White (Virginia)

Description: Tropical aromas of lychee are about all that stand out on the nose of this unusual Moscatel-Garnacha Blanca blend. Neither dry nor sweet, this seems caught in no man's land. A dilute mouthfeel and bitter pyrazine notes on the finish don't help this along.
Name: Ignacio Marín 2015 Wine Wings Moscatel-Garnacha White (Cariñena)

Description: This unfiltered, cloudy wine offers aromas of lime and yeast. A blend of Chardonnay (80%) and Viognier (20%), it's grown according to the principles of biodynamic viticulture. The juicy palate doles out white peach, vanilla and lemon, closing on a toasted hazelnut note.
Name: Fattoria La Vialla 2015 Barricato Bianco White (Toscana)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of 42% Viognier, 42% Roussanne, 8% Sémillon and 8% Riesling from Edna Valley and Paso Robles would be great to sip on the porch during a sunny afternoon. Chamomile, poached Asian pear, white peach and light honey aromas show on the nose. The palate tightens up a bit, with hints of honey, pear and baked apple set against a pithy structure.
Name: Wolff 2014 White Wolff White (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This very appealing wine smells like a Danish pastry but then turns nicely dry on the palate, gushing with crisp apple, ripe Bosc pear and toasted-baguette flavors. Made from Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc grapes, it's medium bodied, complex and well balanced.
Name: Concannon 2015 Reserve Assemblage Blanc White (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: Generous aromas of rose petal and lemon zest meet dry but fruity flavors recalling crisp kiwi and apricot in this dramatic, flavorful wine made from the Symphony grape variety. The texture is crisp and tangy, and the flavors are vivid.
Name: Theopolis 2014 Symphony White (Yorkville Highlands)

Description: This proprietary blend combines 63% Pinot Grigio from Carneros, 22% Traminer from Carneros and a small percentage of Moscato Giallo from Lodi. Together they harmonize in a light, crisp and floral bouquet of apricot, ginger and lemon, never becoming overly fussy and instead focusing entirely on refined refreshment.
Name: Uvaggio 2015 Zelo Bianco White (Carneros)

Description: On the one hand, this wine seems almost honeyed, broad and rather lush. On the other, it shows hints of green vegetables reminiscent of tinned peas. Together, the blend of 70% Sauvignon and 30% Sémillon works reasonably well, ending with the sensation of sun-warmed ripe stone fruit.
Name: Pegasus Bay 2013 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Waipara Valley)

Description: Made in collaboration between Frescobaldi and prisoners of the Gorgona penal colony, this offers delicate aromas of ripe orchard fruit, white flower and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. The round palate offers dried apricot and citrus before a savory finish.
Name: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2015 Gorgona White (Costa Toscana)

Description: This wine lives up to its name with generous aromas of lychee, jasmine, apricot, and honeysuckle. It drinks off dry, with mouthful of stone-fruit flavors that are easygoing and immensely enjoyable.
Name: Eufloria NV Aromatic Blend White (Washington)

Description: A blend of Sauvignon and Chardonnay, this has subdued aromas of toast and orchard fruit. The linear palate is on the lean side, offering yellow apple skin, oak and a hint of citrus. It closes on a bitter-almond note.
Name: Le Macchiole 2014 Paleo Bianco White (Toscana)

Description: Made with 85% Vermentino, 10% Viognier and 5% Sauvignon, this has aromas of Mediterranean scrub and yellow peach that carry on to the round fresh palate. It closes with white almond.
Name: Rascioni e Cecconello 2015 Osa White (Toscana)

Description: A blend of white grapes Vermentino and Colombana, this opens with aromas yellow flower, stone fruit, and a whiff of citrus. The fresh palate offers yellow peach and tangerine that lead to a clean finish.
Name: Fattoria Fibbiano 2015 Fonte delle Donne White (Toscana)

Description: Made predominantly with Trebbiano and Malvasia, along with Pinot Bianco, Pinot Grigio and Riesling Renano, this has inviting aromas of ripe orchard fruit and citrus. The round fruity palate doles out ripe apricot, orange zest and juicy pineapple.
Name: Marchesi Antinori 2015 Villa Antinori White (Toscana)

Description: Made with Vermentino, Malvasia di Candia Aromatica and Petit Manseng, this easy-drinking white has aromas of fragrant white wild flower, citrus and white stone fruit. The ripe round palate offers apricot, lime and a hint of saline.
Name: Poggioventoso 2015 Poetico White (Toscana)

Description: Made with late-ripened grapes (85% Vermentino and 15% Viognier), this has aromas suggesting beeswax, pressed yellow flower and a whiff of honey. The aromas carry over to the round palate along with suggestions of apricot and nectarine.
Name: Vignaioli del Morellino di Scansano 2015 Vigna Fiorini Vendemmia Tardiva White (Toscana)

Description: This Chardonnay-Viognier blend is a touch viscous in feel but honest as a whole, with floral and melon aromas. Mild flavors of white flowers, orange and green herbs are light in intensity, but are coupled with a sense of roundness on the palate.
Name: Oveja Negra 2015 Reserva Estate Bottled Chardonnay-Viognier (Maule Valley)

Description: Light aromas of herb, toasted grapenuts, peach and orange peel lead to off-dry stone-fruit flavors. It shows a touch of reduction but otherwise goes down easy.
Name: Laissez Faire 2015 Sauvignon Blanc-Chenin Blanc

Description: A blend of Riesling, Muscat and Viognier, this wine offers aromas of white flowers, orange peel and citrus. It drinks off dry, with abundant mandarin flavors that linger.
Name: Huston 2014 Chicken Dinner White

Description: Made with organically grown 90% Vermentino and 10% Sauvignon grapes, this has subtle aromas of spring wild flower and ripe orchard fruit. The bright simple palate offers suggestions of yellow peach, pear and a citrusy note.
Name: Pagani de Marchi 2015 Blumea White (Toscana)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light white peach, apple blossoms, jasmine and intriguing green-tea aromas show on the nose of this widely available blend of various white varieties. It's a tad sweet on the sip, with poached apples, nectarine, honey, lemon curd and baked-orange flavors.
Name: Smashberry 2014 White (Central Coast)

Description: A blend of organically farmed Vermentino (60%) and Ansonica (40%), this enjoyable white has aromas of pressed wild flower and ripe orchard fruit. The round juicy palate offers ripe yellow apple, apricot and a note of candied-nectarine zest.
Name: Poggiotondo 2015 Vermentino-Ansonica White (Toscana)

Description: Oak, honey, toasted nut and lime aromas carry over to the firm palate along with mature yellow-apple skin. Lacking fruit richness, you'll detect evident alcohol while a note of bitter walnut closes the finish.
Name: Campo alla Sughera 2015 Achenio White (Bolgheri)

Description: Basic white-fruit aromas are pleasant and uncomplicated. A solid,pithy mouthfeel and flavors of peach, green banana and green herbs conclude with a detectable note of grape skins and citrus pith. This is 85% Viognier and 15% Chardonnay.
Name: Estampa 2015 Estate Viognier-Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

Description: The floral aromas seem somewhat wilted, with peach notes lurking in the background. It's full in feel, drinking dry.
Name: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2014 Vivacious Viognier 76%/Roussanne 24% White

Description: Oily aromas of petrol are almost akin to certain Rieslings. This Viognier-Sauvignon Blanc mix feels round and mildly citrusy. Bready wheaty flavors of melon and papaya suggest that it's losing sizzle, so drink now.
Name: Junta 2014 Reserve Momentos Viogner Sauvignon Blanc White (Central Valley)

Description: Grapefruit and passion fruit aromas are muddled and not bright. This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and the juice of Carmenère feels wide but amorphous. Pink grapefruit and generic tang make for a simple but unexciting flavor profile.
Name: Oveja Negra 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc-Carmenère White (Maule Valley)

Description: This yellow-tinted blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay smells more like freshly waxed floorboards and wood resin than fruit. In the mouth, this is resiny and plump, with mild acidity. A weird set of woody, waxy flavors falls flat on the finish.
Name: François Lurton 2015 Hacienda Araucano Clos de Lolol White (Lolol Valley)

Description: Produced with advice from the late Denis Dubourdieu who was instrumental in revolutionizing Bordeaux white wines, this is impressive. The wood aging is just right, giving toast and allowing the ripe fruits to blossom and smooth out. The wine will age well, so don't drink before 2020.
Name: Château Picque Caillou 2015  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This blend of two-thirds Sauvignon Blanc and one-third Semillon gets a touch of barrel aging, reflected in its silky texture more than any overt aromas or flavors. The palate is fruit-forward, offering hints of citrus, underripe nectarine, wet stone and green apple, finishing long and mouthwatering.
Name: Leeuwin Estate 2015 Siblings Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: From a small portion of the Fonréaud vineyard, this blend of 65% Sauvignon Blanc with Sémillon and Muscadelle is delicately wood aged to give a ripe fruity wine with added spice. It is perfumed and aromatic with a smooth creamy texture. With its intense acidity, it is a delicious and refreshing wine. Drink now.
Name: Château Fonréaud 2014 Le Cygne  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Roughly half and half Marsanne and Roussanne, this dry white wine carries a distinctive scent and flavor of honey. It's round and ripe, with lemony fruit. Full-bodied and delicious, this should be enjoyed now through 2018.
Name: South Stage 2014 Romeo and Juliet White (Rogue Valley)

Description: This is an elegant, intricate wine that's fresh and lively while layered with attractive green apple, white pepper and thyme flavors. Light bodied, it makes a great apéritif or pairing with fish and fowl.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2015 Chenin Blanc-Viognier White (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Edelzwicker is an Alsatian term meaning noble blend, and is applied to any blend of white wine grapes. Here it includes Gewürztraminer, Pinot Gris and Riesling. This white is substantial and fruit-driven more than floral in this new vintage. Apple, pear and nectarine flavors carry a light touch of mint. It's very refreshing, well balanced and distinctive.
Name: Big Table Farm 2015 Wirtz Vineyard Edelzwicker (Willamette Valley)

Description: Peach and apricot aromas give way to vanilla and resiny oak notes. This blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca is full in body and has taken well to oak. Melon, green banana and wood spice flavors are dry and elegant on the finish. Drink through 2021.
Name: Fernández Gómez 2015 Selección Familia White (Rioja)

Description: Rich and full bodied but not sweet, this fruity-floral wine blends vanilla and pistachio flavors with ripe pear and apricot. It has nice flavor complexity, a soothing texture and lingering finish.
Name: Vinum 2014 White Elephant White (California)

Description: Apple, melon and other white-fruit aromas lead to a citrusy pulpy palate with good balance. Flavors of pithy citrus and green apple finish with a racy feel and notes of stone fruits and citrus peel. This is Verdejo with 10% Viura.
Name: Telmo Rodríguez 2015 Basa White (Rueda)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon share equal parts of this blend. Aromas of corn silk, tropical fruit and herb give way to full-bodied fruit flavors. It shows a hint of warmth on the finish but largely carries it.
Designation: Estate Grown Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2015 Estate Grown Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Stone-fruit and melon aromas are minerally. This feels linear and tight due to racy acidity. Flavors of white fruits, lime and stones are slightly tart, while this is short but firm on the finish. For barrel-fermented Viura, this is not oaky in any overt way.
Name: Muga 2015 Barrel Fermented White (Rioja)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc (61%) and Sémillon, with the latter a new addition to this typically varietally designated wine, it opens with aromas of herbs, lemon verbana, white flowers, nut oil and yellow apple. The palate is lean in style, with a lightly creamy feel backed by racy acidity that leads to a white grapefruit, kiwi and pineapple-filled finish.
Name: Efeste 2015 Sauvage Boushey Vineyard White (Yakima Valley)

Description: Inviting apple, citrus and stony aromas precede a racy, citrusy palate with bracing acidity. Quick-hitting green melon, nectarine and lime flavors end with a persistent note of green apple. This is the best version of this Verdejo-Viura-Sauvignon Blanc blend in several years. Drink now.
Name: Naia 2015 Las Brisas White (Rueda)

Description: This gold-tinted, barrel-fermented Viura-Verdejo blend shows aromas of dry apple, fino Sherry and bready yeast. The palate feels plump and balanced, while baked apple flavors come with a salty note that adds complexity. A firm dry lightly oaked finish keeps this on course.
Name: Bodegas Perica 2014 6 cepas 6 Viura-Verdejo Viura-Verdejo (Rioja)

Description: A parcel of limestone soil on this estate allows it to produce a small quantity of white wine. Vinified and aged in barrels, this is a soft ripe wine with light toast and lemon flavors. Textured and still young, this will age over the next few years. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Fourcas Dupré 2015 Grand Vin Blanc Sec  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This small estate is outside the main classified growth areas of Sauternes, close to the river Garonne. That makes it a wine that is accessible earlier, with plenty of honey and botrytis. It is already balancing out into a fine orange-marmalade-flavored wine with just the right acidity. Drink now.
Name: Château Laribotte 2011  Sauternes

Description: Toasty melon and peach aromas are oaky but elegant, sort of like nice Burgundy. A round balanced palate definitely suggests quality Chardonnay, but this is 95% Viura and the rest Malvasia. Oak and spice flavors render white-fruit notes secondary, and the finish is more of the same. Drink through 2020.
Name: Valserrano 2015 Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)

Description: Nuances of vanilla and toasted baguette add flair to this full-bodied and textural wine. It has straightforward crisp apple and grapefruit flavors, a dry balance, and a taut, almost astringent finish.
Name: Spann Vineyards 2015 Betsy's Backacher White (California)

Description: Melon, nectarine and mild citrus aromas are clean and direct. This basic white is firm and balanced, while stone fruit, melon and white-pepper flavors end easy and fresh.
Name: Palma Real 2015 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: An innovative blend of Sauvignon Blanc (53%), Semillon (37%) and Viognier (10%), this medium-bodied wine delivers a mix of figs and melons, underscored by a silky texture. Ready to drink.
Name: Wirra Wirra 2015 Scrubby Rise White (Adelaide)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sauvignon Blanc makes up a full 89% of this blend. It offers light aromas of melon, grass, tropical fruit and citrus that are followed by tart zingy flavors, with the concentration seeming a bit light.
Name: Cadaretta 2015 SBS Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There are lots of intriguing elements to this creative blend of 69% Viognier, 16% Chardonnay, 12% Sauvignon Blanc and 3% Sémillon, with honey, baked pear, hazelnut, melon and seared apple on the rich yet fresh nose. Caramelized pear, vanilla and honeysuckle show strongly on the palate, where a strong acidity carries into a deep finish.
Name: Heaven's Coast 2014 White (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Dry waxy white-fruit aromas are mild but clean. This blend of Viura and other white grapes feels plump but a touch soft, with only modest acidity. Dry bready flavors of melon and papaya finish a touch flat. Drink now.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2015 Otoman White (Rioja)

Description: The 49% of Sémillon in this rich wine gives it a full, ripe character. It is backed up by the more herbal Sauvignon Blanc to add the freshness. The wine is fruity with citrus and white stone fruits, ready to drink from 2017.
Name: Clarendelle 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: A light wood-aging flavor gives this wine its richness along with its fine ripe yellow fruits. Ripe and fruity from an excellent year for white Bordeaux, the wine is smooth and ready to drink.
Name: Château Haut Bertinerie 2014 Elegance  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Blending 90% Sauvignon Blanc with 10% Sémillon, this white is perfumed in jasmine and apricot honey. On the palate it becomes somewhat fleshier and less expressive, allowing for just a hint of peach.
Name: Blackbird Vineyards 2015 Dissonance Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Napa Valley)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine has light wood aging to smooth out its herbal character and bring out the richer Sémillon. Spice, toast and crisp acidity are filled out with the ripeness of the vintage. Drink this from early 2017.
Name: Cheval Quancard 2015 Cuvée Clémence  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: This tasty, medium-bodied blend is about half Sauvignon Blanc, with the balance split almost evenly between Chardonnay and Semillon. Struck flint marks the nose, while the flavors suggest hints of asparagus and fig. Drink now.
Name: Frank 2015 Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Semillon White (Limestone Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This is a dry, crisp, forward, well-aged wine that blends five aromatic white grapes, principally Gruner Veltliner and Pinot Gris. Already showing signs of oxidation, it's a pleasant, though nondescript white wine that should be consumed by 2018.
Name: Cerulean 2013 Acadia Vineyards White Space Blend White (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: This is a fresh and fruity wine with lively acidity and spice from wood aging. Dominated by Sauvignon Blanc, it is herbal and still young, needing time to develop. Drink this crisp wine from late 2017.
Name: Château Haut Selve 2015  Graves

Description: Aromas of mango and scented potpourri set up a dry solid palate. This blend of Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay is not something you see a lot of. Flavors of white pepper and nectarine finish juicy, with notes of peach pit and orange peel.
Name: Alfredo Roca 2015 Roca Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Mendoza)

Description: Stony fresh aromas of lime and grapefruit are light and clean. This blend of Garnacha Blanca, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc is steady on the palate. Flavors of dry lime and wet stones are slightly pithy, while this finishes firm and dry.
Name: Altavins 2015 Almodí Petit White (Terra Alta)

Description: Initial briny citrus aromas give way to white grapefruit scents. Like the nose, this feels bracing and citric. Tangy flavors of lime and tangerine finish short but with tingling acidity.
Name: Loriñon 2014 White (Rioja)

Description: Sémillon dominates this rich wine. Spice and honey are balanced by ripe peach and apricot flavors. The acidity cuts right through to give an almost crisp character to this sweet wine. It will develop quickly, so drink from late 2017.
Name: Cheval Quancard 2015 Lafleur Mallet  (Sauternes)

Description: It is the high proportion of perfumed Sauvignon Gris in this wine that creates its ripe, smooth and rich character. It brings in a calming, rounding influence to the more herbal Sauvignon Blanc and will allow it to develop a creamy character as it develops. Drink from summer 2017.
Name: La Fleur Ribeyrolles 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This is a ripe wine that has a high proportion of Sémillon in the blend. That makes it rich: revealing yellow fruits as well as greener herbal characters. It is fruity, tangy and refreshing. Drink from spring 2017.
Name: Château Saint-Florin 2015 Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine that is crisp while also having some weight and fatness from the Sémillon in the blend. It is full of fruit, with lemon and crisp apple flavors. The aftertaste is tight and tangy with lemon zest.
Name: Exem 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A blend of 65% Sauvignon Blanc and 35% Sémillon, this is a crisp fruity wine with attractive acidity and lemon flavors that have been given some time to soften out. It has a touch of barrel aging, but the wine is really all about fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Château de Birot 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a mature, wood-aged wine. It is rich in yellow fruits and toast flavors. It does retain a crisper, citrus side that keeps it fruity. The wines are vegan (no animal products in production). It is ready to drink.
Name: Chateau Haut Rian 2013 Excellence  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Dusty apple aromas are plain and simple. This has a heavy disposition on the palate despite spritz. Flavors of mango, nectarine and green herbs come with a touch of bell pepper prior to a bulky finish with apple notes.
Name: Txomín Etxaníz 2015 Getaria White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: This shows some pungent, boxwood-like scents up front, followed by modest passion fruit and a bit of citrus, falling away on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Xanadu 2015 Exmoor Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: This is a crisp and fruity wine that's perfumed and full of citrus and green fruits. It has a lively character that is filled out with the ripe fruitiness of the vintage. The aftertaste, bright and fresh, suggests it will benefit from another few months. Drink from summer 2016.
Name: Château Vrai Caillou 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Oily aromas of citrus peel and lychee set up a lemony palate with pyrazine-influenced citrus flavors. Lychee is the lead flavor on a finish that's mildly bitter.
Name: Amalaya 2015 Esperanza Por Un Milagro White (Salta)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Wet stone and graphite scents up front give way to hints of honey and Earl Grey tea (bergamot). It's medium bodied and fades quickly on the finish, but it's a solid buy for under $10.
Name: Half Mile Creek 2014 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (South Eastern Australia)

Description: The Birot estate is in Cadillac, the fortress town on the banks of the Garonne. This classic Sauvignon and Sémillon blend is herbal, green and grassy. It is bright with acidity and lemon fruit and with a lightly tangy texture. Drink now.
Name: Château de Birot 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a crisp herbal wine, bright with acidity and marked with lemon and grapefruit tastes. It is light and bright with a mineral edge that gives it a fine texture. Drink now.
Name: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2015 Château Tuilerie Pagès  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Appellation: Txakoli de Álava, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Cidery aromas are, at best, sturdy. This has shearing acidity along with an oily round mouthfeel. Sour stone-fruit and citrus flavors finish with lasting notes of tart green apple. This is a still Txakoli: don't expect spritz or bubbles.
Name: Luzia de Ripa 2015  Txakoli de Álava

Description: Chunky briny aromas are simply not that fresh. This mix of Viura, Tempranillo Blanco and Maturana Blanca is wide and shapeless. Pyrazinic flavors on this novelty blend suggest certain Sauvignon Blancs or Verdejo.
Name: Vivanco 2015 White (Rioja)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Made from Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc, this wine is luxurious and sweet, while maintaining great balance to keep from being too unctuous. It has a brilliant deep-gold color, generous aromas like toasted peanuts and marmalade, and flavors that are honeyed and floral. It feels nicely viscous, coating the sides of the mouth and helping the flavors linger for long moments on the finish.
Name: Castello di Amorosa 2010 Il Passito Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (North Coast)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A gorgeous mélange of botrytized Riesling and Chardonnay, every sip of this honey-kissed wine is an explosion of blossom and fruit. It's intensely concentrated, rippling with tropical tones of mango, melon and pineapple, yet featherlight on the palate. The finish is languorous, alternating sweet layers of honey and marmalade marked by hints of salt and crushed mineral. Delicious now but should only improve with age, well beyond 2025.
Name: Wölffer 2015 Descencia Botrytis Late Harvest White (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This Chenin Blanc-based blend, with 13% Clairette, 10% Viognier and 4% Sémillon, starts off with notes of fresh herbs and verbena, supported by notes of lightly toasted-apple skin, white peach and melon. There's a pleasant roundness to the body, though ample acidity and a lingering clove accent pick up the midpalate and carry through to the lingering finish. Drink now–2020.
Name: Mullineux 2014 Old Vines White (Swartland)

Description: A delightfully memorable blend of 76% Sémillon and 24% Sauvignon Blanc, this is a lithe, crisp and medium-bodied experience. The grapes were organically grown, whole-cluster pressed and fermented in stainless steel. It shines in Meyer lemon and wet stone, just a hint of creamy tropical fervor bubbling beneath the surface.
Name: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2014 Gemini Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a beautiful botrytised wine, made from a field blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Riesling and Gewürztraminer. Light on its feet and reined-in in terms of sweetness, it's golden hay-colored and has a touch of reduction, allowing the Riesling nose to dominate. Decadent yet restrained, it's also lengthy and complex, with highlights of orange and pear.
Name: Grgich Hills 2013 Violetta Estate Late Harvest White (Napa Valley)

Description: Estate-grown Roussanne (63%), Viognier (32%) and Chardonnay (5%) are blended together in a medium-bodied coming-together of floral, light aromatics and supportive acidity. Fruity highlights run the gamut of apricot, peach and lime, with a tiny touch of sweetness on the finish.
Name: Westwood 2015 Annadel Gap Vineyard White (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Dominated by Vermentinu, this is a rich while crisp wine. With its fresh apple flavors and good acidity, it is deliciously perfumed, ripe and poised with a strong line in minerality. Drink from 2017.
Name: Yves Leccia 2015 YL Blanc White (Ile de Beauté)

Description: This ripe wine offers yellow fruit and a generous texture. A touch of pepper accompanies the acidity, fruits and full-bodied structure. Drink this rich wine from 2017.
Name: Domaine d'Alzipratu 2015 Pumonte White (Corse Calvi)

Appellation: Napa County-Sonoma County, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: A collaboration between Winemakers Elizabeth Vianna (Chimney Rock), Bryan Parker (Terlato Vineyards) and Steve Fennell (Sanford), this is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc from Napa, Chardonnay from Carneros and Viognier from Sta. Rita Hills. Golden in color, it's buttery in style, with subversive fruit that leans lemony crisp and tart on the palate.
Name: Galaxy 2014 Blanc White (Napa County-Sonoma County)

Description: A blend of two indigenous Georgian grapes, this wine offers aromas of citrus zest and rose petal. It is soft in the mouth, with flavors of apple, white peach, lemon and rose, capped by a smooth apricot finish.
Name: Marani 2014 Kondoli Single Vineyard Mtsvane-Kisi White (Kakheti)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A unique blend of Viognier (50%), Roussanne (41%) and Riesling, this wine offers light notes of peach and pear. The palate is full of stone-fruit flavors backed by vibrant acidity that piques the interest.
Name: Brian Carter 2014 Oriana White (Yakima Valley)

Description: This dry, layered and rich-textured wine smells like fresh-cut canteloupe, tastes like peach and melon, and has a generous, mouthfilling feel.
Name: Passaggio 2014 Passion Blend White (California)

Description: This blend of 46% Sauvignon Blanc, 39% Sémillon and 15% Viognier pleases in a light-bodied frame. Lychee meets lemon, lime and a lengthy complexity of wet stone on the finish.
Name: Blue Rock 2015 Baby Blue Blanc Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is two-thirds Sémillon and one-third Sauvignon Blanc. Aromas of toasted grapenuts, lemon and spice are followed by broad-feeling fruit flavors that show a lightly creamy feel.
Name: Swiftwater Cellars 2015 Proprietary White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Nectarine, apricot and botrytis aromas are sound but familiar. Round, full but not quite sticky, this tastes like toffee, honey and pear, with baking spice flavors, nutmeg in particular, on the finish.
Designation: Toro de Piedra Grand Reserve Late Harvest
Name: Viña Requingua 2013 Toro de Piedra Grand Reserve Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Curicó Valley)

Description: Produced from Niellucciu, this wine is ripe, perfumed and packed with crisp acidity. Fresh raspberry, citrus and a touch of caramel are brought together by the acidity and zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Clos Alivu 2015 White (Patrimonio)

Description: This is a ripe, orange and apricot-flavored wine. With a crisper citrus edge it is full, creamy and juicy. A mineral edge adds interest, bringing out the perfumed fruit. Drink this wine from 2017.
Name: Clos Teddi 2015 White (Patrimonio)

Description: Vines close to the east coast of Corsica give this bright, light and fruity wine. Crisp acidity is fleshed out with creamed apple and pear fruit. The wine is delicious to drink now.
Name: Domaine de Terra Vecchia 2015 Vermentinu-Chardonnay White (Ile de Beauté)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is equal parts Viognier and Roussanne. It offers light aromas of peach and apricot that are followed by full-bodied flavors that show some warmth and bitterness on the finish.
Name: Market Vineyards 2014 Liquidity White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a crisp blend, fresh with citrus and ripe with apples. Hints of the warmth of the region show with the concentration that lies in the background. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Petroni 2015 White (Corse)

Description: Pale straw to the eye, this wine offers a bouquet of lemon with a pleasant whiff of petrol. It is equal parts creamy and bright on the palate, with flavors of Granny Smith apple, apricot and lavender.
Name: Marani 2014 Tsinandali White (Kakheti)

Description: Medium straw in color, this white blend offers the unexpected fragrance of toast and espresso. It is an easy-drinking wine with flavors of apple, lemon curd, peach preserves and toast. Soft floral notes are present on the palate, and the finish is marked by white peach.
Name: Clos de Gat 2015 Chanson Blanc White (Judean Hills)

Description: This wine is made from 50% Sémillon, 29% Sauvignon Blanc and 21% Sauvignon Blanc Musqué clone, the fruit sourced from both the Monte Rosso and Leveroni vineyards. It's fleshy and full of fig flavor, laced in mild lemon, quince and oaky vanilla.
Name: Lasseter 2014 Voilà Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Sonoma Valley)

Description: This is a blend of local grapes including Jacquère and Altesse. It is a ripe style of wine that is full of pear, melon and sweet orange fruit. It is ready to drink, fruity and deliciously bright.
Name: Philippe Viallet 2015 White (Savoie)

Description: Pale straw to the eye, this blend of native grapes from Georgia has a nose of lemon-lime sorbet and apricot. It has a slightly effervescent feeling on the tongue, with flavors of lemon curd and lime backed by a soft fruit sweetness that continues into the zesty finish.
Name: Wine Man 2014 Tsinandali White (Kakheti)

Description: A lightly perfumed wine, this is fruity with peppered lemon and melon flavors. It has a crisp edge and finishes with bright acidity.
Name: Domaine Maestracci 2015 E Prove White (Corse Calvi)

Description: Pithy white-fruit aromas smell a bit like compost. Stony and citric on the palate, this tastes briny and like sour peach.
Name: Godelia 2015 Godello-Doña Blanca White (Bierzo)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A soft and just off-dry blend of Chardonnay, Aligoté and Colombard, this wine is tangy with citrus and green plums. An herbal edge from the Colombard brings out a crisp texture and acidity. Drink now.
Name: L. Tramier & Fils NV Roncier White (Vin de France)

Description: The heady, pure perfume of fig rind and foliage streams from the glass. A more tart and tropical note of passion fruit pitches in as well, along with green grapefruit spice. The aromatic spectrum is a sublimation of exotic fruit on nose and palate. The palate sustains this high-pitched balance by the purest lightening strike of zesty acidity. Even the tiniest drop of this amber liquid has the power to perfume the entire palate for minutes. The concentration is immense, the flavors are mind-boggling. This is high-octane stuff guaranteed to blow your mind. Drink now or cellar it through 2040 at least.
Designation: Grande Cuvée Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 6 Nouvelle Vague
Name: Kracher 2013 Grande Cuvée Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 6 Nouvelle Vague White (Burgenland)

Description: The scent of apricot jam is exquisitely pure on the nose, with an added glimpse of orange zest. The palate plays out all its luscious apricot richness, countering it with fresh lemon purity. Perfectly pitched balance between apricot richness and lemon zestiness makes this a delicious but balanced high-wire act. How can anyone resist?
Name: Kracher 2013 Auslese Cuvée White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Dunnigan Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Made from a single vineyard, this wine is both tasty and complex enough to stimulate the imagination. It smells like butter and cream, and tastes like ripe pear, toasted almonds and vanilla bean. Luscious yet a bit crisp, the texture feels great on the palate. Grenache Blanc, Piquepoul Blanc, Roussanne and Viognier all contributed.
Name: The Girls in the Vineyard 2014 The Field Blend Windmill Vineyard White (Dunnigan Hills)

Description: Fragrant notes of candied pear and lifted hints of orange blossom are tempered by exuberant lemon freshness. The palate is of tender, enveloping but not overbearing sweetness, carrying aloft an exquisite, honeyed tableau of pear and quince, mirabelle plum and apricot, balanced by pure lemon freshness. The finish is soft, moreish and mellow.
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2015 Spätlese Cuvée White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This 50-50 Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon is a rich wine that is full of lightly peppered ripe apple and pear flavors. It feels generous while being full in the mouth with good concentration and crisp acidity. Drink now.
Name: Vignobles Carreau Selection 2015 Château l'Escadre  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is one of those kitchen sink blends that is better than it has a right to be. Riesling, Pinot Blanc, Muscat, Gewürztraminer and Pinot Gris are all in the mix, and the wine is both aromatic and packed with fresh flavors of bubble gum and tropical fruit candy. It's finished dry, yielding a multipurpose, unique white wine that you may try with just about any food you'd put in front of any of the component grapes.
Name: Brooks 2015 Amycas White (Willamette Valley)

Description: Refermented in the bottle, this opens with inviting scents of ripe orchard fruit, citrus, bread crust, Alpine herb and a whiff of crushed stone. The refreshing frothy palate delivers lime, tangerine zest, green apple and a hint of lemon drop alongside bright acidity. A mineral note backs up the finish.
Name: Ca' dei Zago 2015 Col Fondo  (Prosecco)

Description: Wild flower, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of aromatic herb are some of the scents you'll find on this. The foaming linear palate doles out apple, pear, lime and a hint of lemon drop alongside fresh acidity and a soft mousse.
Name: Bisol 2015 Crede  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a balanced wine: its acidity and fruit combining well. Together they give a complex wine that could well age. Almonds as well as apples and pears make the wine rich and concentrated. Drink now.
Importer: Bad Boys' Wines, LLC (Les Gamins Malins)
Name: Château des Tourtes 2015 Classique  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An unusual and inviting lemongrass aroma and flavor go well with a buttery and vibrant texture in this medium-bodied and almost sweet wine. Blended from Sémillon, Chardonnay and four other grapes, it makes a nice change of pace.
Name: Murrieta's Well 2014 The Whip White (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This 60-40 blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sauvignon Gris is a tightly textured wine with hints of minerality as well as citrus and grapefruit. The wine is crisp, bright in the mouth and packed with attractive final acidity. This estate is the home of Bordeaux producer Nicolas Thienpont.
Name: Château Puygueraud 2015  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: The wine is tight and tangy with a strong mineral edge. It has a ripe feel to it, full of spice and rich pears. It is concentrated and will be better from 2017.
Name: Château Lacaussade Saint-Martin 2015 Trois Moulins  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Pithy citrus and an oily aromatic note give this white blend some funk on the nose. The palate is in good shape but typical in terms of feel and weight. Flavors of orange, papaya and mango finish with citrusy notes of lime as well as chalky minerality. This wine holds Parellada, Macabeo and Chardonnay.
Name: Huguet de Can Feixes 2015 Blanc Selecció White (Penedès)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: A crisp herbal wine, this is bright with acidity and citrus and gooseberries. It is lively, tangy and packed with fruitiness from its 50-50 blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon. Drink this refreshing wine now.
Name: Vignobles Carreau Selection 2015 Château les Petits Arnauds Excellence  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: There is a tantalizing hint of perfume in this 85% Sauvignon Blanc and 15% Muscadelle blend that makes the wine both ripe and textured. With a touch of pepper as well as crisp apple, the wine is rich and ready to drink.
Name: Château les Bertrands 2015 Cuvée Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Wood aging has added an extra dimension to this ripe wine. Spice comes from the toastiness while the yellow fruits add richness. Age this wine and drink from 2017.
Name: Château Puyanché 2015  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: Rich texture, full body and ripe, mellow flavors of pear, almond and fig make this wine a mouthful. It also has freshness and smooth acidity that last through the finish.
Name: Ca' Momi 2014 Bianco di Ca' Momi White (California)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A blend of four varieties, this is a full-bodied, plush-textured wine with easy-to-like fruit and spice flavors and a lingering finish.
Designation: Mamma Mia Estate Grown, Produced and Bottled
Name: Naggiar 2015 Mamma Mia Estate Grown, Produced and Bottled White (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Jean Lissague's blend of 90% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Muscadelle is soft and full in the mouth with just enough acidity to keep it crisp. Melon and spiced-lemon create a tangy touch that gives the wine an edginess. Drink now.
Name: Château Grand Secret 2015 Petit Secret  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: This wine has a dual nature, displaying both herbal and citrus characteristics. A crisp texture and some spiciness indicate its youth. It will be better with some age, so drink from 2017.
Name: Château les Clauzots 2015  Graves

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This 50/50 mix of Pinot Blanc and Pinot Gris was fermented in a mix of stainless steel and French oak, with a portion aged in barrel as well. It's a pleasant drinking white wine, with neither grape providing a defining varietal note. It finishes with an aromatic whiff of barnyard.
Name: Winter's Hill 2015 Pearly Everlasting White (Dundee Hills)

Description: This is a lively crisp wine with a creamy texture and a perfumed character. It is ripe and full with just enough acidity to give freshness.
Name: Château Jeanguillon 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a crisp and herbal wine that is both fruity and finely textured. With layers of acidity and green fruit flavors, it is bright, fresh and ready to drink.
Name: Château Barbé 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a perfumed fruity wine. With its bright acidity and citrus and lychee flavors, it is both crisp and ripe. Ready to drink now.
Name: Château Berthenon 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Crisp with herbal acidity as well a white stone fruits, this is a fresh wine vinified in 500-liter oak barrels. It has a tight texture and tangy aftertaste. This attractive wine from Nicolas Thienpont and his son Cyrille is ready now.
Name: Château Les Charmes Godard 2015  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: There is some ripe melon fruitiness that gives the wine richness. By contrast, there is little structure or crisp acidity to give it life.
Designation: Château la Croix Saint-Pierre Blanc de la Croix Saint-Pierre
Name: Vignobles Carreau Selection 2015 Château la Croix Saint-Pierre Blanc de la Croix Saint-Pierre  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a soft wine. It is lightly fruity while tasting dilute and unfocussed. Drink now.
Name: Château la Bretonnière 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: This medium-bodied wine has modest fruit and herb aromas and similarly subdued flavors. It is clean and straightforward.
Name: Honor Winery 2013 Serve White (California)

Description: This uncommon blend of Chardonnay, Gerwurztraminer and Pinot Noir smells a lot like cider, with a hint of vinegar thrown in. A high-acid palate is not welcoming, while sour citrus flavors end with underripe tangerine and citrus peel.
Name: Glárima 2015 de Sommos White (Somontano)

Description: This is an unusual blend of 55% Sauvignon Blanc, 39% Chardonnay and 6% Viognier from a selection of fine vineyard sites, including Maldonado. Baked pineapple, mango, anise and lemongrass ride along tightly grained texture and a tension of acidity, finding a manageable weight of viscosity on the finish.
Name: B Cellars 2013 Blend 23 White (Napa Valley)

Description: Don't let the age fool you—this beautiful Ambré still has plenty of vibrancy and life ahead of it. Rich aromas of candied orange, dried mango, apricot and creamy, honeyed melon are hit by toasted oak and wood spice accents. The attack is bright and powerful, with ample orange-like acidity that keeps the stone fruit, toasted nut and rancio flavors lifted through the long, lingering finish.
Name: Arnaud de Villeneuve 1985 Ambré White (Rivesaltes)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: Although this wine is dry, it does have hints of the honeyed character that comes out of the Petit Manseng. With apple and fragrant acidity it has this edge of apricots and spice. Drink the wine now.
Name: Famille Laplace 2014 Odé d'Aydie  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: A wood-aged wine, this blend of Loin de l'Oeil and Sauvignon Blanc is rich and lightly toasty. There are also fine yellow fruit and honeyed flavors that give the wine a ripe complexity and that leave with crisp acidity. It's is ready to drink now and until 2022.
Name: Domaine Rotier 2014 Renaissance White (Gaillac)

Description: Still young, this is a structured wine with the dark botrytis flavors giving as much richness as sweetness at this stage. Yellow fruits are integrated into a tight, mineral texture that will open up over the next few months. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Jurque 2014 Tendresse  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Floral and exotic fruit aromas are followed by an elegant balance of white peach and citrus fruit flavors in this layered white. The wine is complex but lifted with refreshing acidity. The finish is a combination of lush fruit and spice.
Name: Tsantali 2015 Kanenas White (Greece)

Appellation: Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a fun, complex wine, a blend of 79% Sauvignon Blanc, 18% Muscat Canelli and 3% Viognier, all mountain-grown. Orange blossom and jasmine permeate the inviting entry before waves of creamy tangerine and peach play on the palate, lifted by lively acidity.
Name: Imagery 2015 Wow Oui White (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)

Description: This wine is dense and structured, showing it this is still a work in progress. It has richness rather than huge sweetness with a dry core of botrytis. Bitter honey and spice go with the ripe yellow fruit flavors. Drink from 2018.
Name: Domaine Rotier 2014 Les Gravels White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: Alain Brumont likes to throw challenges at himself and this is one of them. Made from two really local grapes, Petit Courbu and Petit Manseng, this wine is dry and strongly oxidative. It has fascinating touches of honey, of yellow fruit, of spice and hints of toast from the wood aging in large barrels. The wine is now very mature and very ready to drink.
Name: Vignobles Brumont 2012 Château Montus Blanc  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Description: This wine has a banana and lemon character on the nose, followed by complex layers of vanilla, citrus and pineapple. Good mineral balance gives tis fuller bodied wine balance. A pretty white with gravitas?pair with poultry and cheese.
Name: Santo Wines 2015 Nykteri White (Santorini)

Description: Half-and-half Petit and Gros Manseng, this is a classic dry Jurançon blend. Soft and rich, it is a wine that is dry while demonstrating fine fresh fruitiness. The structure and strongly mineral texture both suggest the need for aging, so drink from 2018.
Name: Château Jolys 2014  Jurançon Sec
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Moschofilero offers floral aromas of rose, lemon blossom and a touch of spice. On the palate, the wine is focused with a floral flair. Tropical fruit, citrus and rose are layered but the wine finishes clean and with pep.
Name: Semeli 2015 Mountain Sun White (Peloponnese)

Description: The medium-intense nose opens with scents of ripe stone fruit, caramel apple and candied walnut. Medium in weight, there's good lift to the rich, spicy fruit core, with lasting notes of baking spice and peppery warmth on the close.
Name: Diví Elegància NV Ambré White (Rivesaltes)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tropical-fruit aromas and lavish flavors go well with the richness and full body of this creamy-textured wine blended from Chardonnay, Sémillon and Verdelho grapes. Toasted almond, nutmeg and vanilla all come out on the palate and linger on the finish.
Name: Fenestra 2014 Semonnay White (Livermore Valley)
