Description: A light touch is conveyed by aromas of honeysuckle, while the off-dry palate is balanced by fresh, citric verve. This wine has a dancing, easygoing nature marked by freshness and lightness in equal measure. Asian food flavors suggest themselves for this super-balanced, playful white.
Name: Hugel 2015 Gentil White (Alsace)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of 60% Pinot Grigio and 40% Viognier offers sharp green-apple candy, lemongrass, candied lime and yellow lily on the fresh and attention-grabbing nose. Grassy tension on the palate highlights lime blossoms, kiwi and apple skins. The interplay between racy Pinot Grigio and riper Viognier is intriguing.
Name: Robert Renzoni 2015 Cantata White (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A unique but quite successful blend of 75% Chardonnay, 14% Viognier, 8% Roussanne and 3% Marsanne, this bottling offers light pear cream, cantaloupe and daffodil on the pretty nose. The palate shows honeydew ripeness but with plenty of restraint thanks to lime zest and clean green fruits, wiping up with a tense texture on the finish.
Name: Chronic Cellars 2015 Eunice White (Central Coast)

Description: The nose tells of the crisp green freshness of tart apples, the palate counters this with more generous, riper but still very fresh fruit and a wonderfully balm-like creaminess. It all comes together on the midpalate: rounded but unobtrusive autolysis embraces the tart briskness and rounds it all out. Totally refreshing, and does not take itself too seriously.
Name: Bolney Wine Estate NV Bolney Bubbly White (England)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The two varieties show themselves in turn, with notes of fig complemented by herb, citrus and tropical fruit. The palate has tart, juicy grapefruit-like acidity and a stretched-out finish.
Name: Cadaretta 2014 SBS Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A blend of 60% Chardonnay, 30% Chenin Blanc and 10% Mauzac, this is a bright and lively white, with attractive aromas of white flower, clover, pear flesh and lightly grilled peach. The medium-weight palate is remarkably balanced, with ample acidity to lift the ripe apple, pear and citrus flavors, finishing with a kiss of sweet spice.
Name: Château Rives-Blanques 2015 Le Limoux White (Limoux)

Description: A flinty aroma, racy texture and delicate apple and white-peach flavors make this light-bodied wine seem agile like a dancer. It has great balance and a welcome refreshing quality.
Name: Fenestra NV True White Lot 4 White (California)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This cleverly named wine by Joey Tensley and Alex Guarachi indeed packs tension into the nose, with fairly ripe peach, creamy apple and tropical-fruit aromas cut back by clean and steely restraint. The palate shows apple custard, mango and banana tones set against a grippy structure.
Name: Tenshen 2015 White (Central Coast)

Description: Loin de l'Oeil with Sauvignon Blanc gives a ripe, soft and deliciously fruity wine. Finely balanced with tangy acidity over melon and rich red-apple flavors, the wine has a touch of minerality from the gravel soil. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine Rotier 2015 Les Gravels White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a sweet ripe wine, a blend of Gros and Petit Manseng. It has lychee and peach flavors and a layer of acidity, all given richness by the botrytis and honey flavors. The wine is ready to drink, soft and with a touch of ginger spice at the end.
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2014 Prestige White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is 65% Roussanne and 35% Viognier. It opens with aromas of stone fruit, lime and flowers. The ale and apricot flavors are tart and spritely, showing a sense of poise.
Name: Gård 2015 Freyja White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this wine leans a tad sweet on the nose, with exuberant apple blossoms, jasmine and banana-chip aromas. There is a chalky tension and pithy grip to the palate, where apple, pear and white-peach flavors trend toward ripe guava.
Name: MCV 2015 TMZ White (Paso Robles)

Appellation: The Hamptons, Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Sun-drenched and concentrated, this silken-textured dessert wine showcases a bounty of apricot, yellow-peach and orange-peel flavors. A Chardonnay-based blend augmented with Pinot Gris, Vignoles and Gewürztraminer, it's deliciously honeyed yet vibrantly balanced. A tinge of sweet corn on the finish lends to its summery, harvest feel.
Name: Wölffer 2013 Diosa Late Harvest White (The Hamptons, Long Island)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vibrant aromas of honeysuckle, orange peel, peach, jasmine and citrus lead to off-dry stone-fruit flavors. It provides a lot of appeal.
Name: Waterbrook 2015 Melange Founder's White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A blend of Loin de l'Oeil and Sauvignon Blanc has produced a ripe and soft but balanced wine from a vineyard owned by the Wine Museum of Paris. It has refreshing melon and white-plum fruits, and an aromatic character that is rich and full bodied. Drink now.
Name: Château Labastidié 2014 White (Gaillac)

Description: The wine is ripe and bone dry. It has a tight structure, mineral texture and intense acidity. There is a bitter edge in this young wine that will blow away as the ripe white fruit asserts itself. At the end, there is a touch of honey.
Name: Château de Jurque 2014 Fantaisie  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This is a wine for a patient person, because its many positive attributes need time to register on the palate. The appearance is slightly hazy, while aromas and flavors suggesr subtle almond, apple skin and apricot, with a chewy texture.
Name: Donkey & Goat 2015 The Gadabout White (California)

Description: Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc, with a touch of perfume from Muscadelle give a wine that, while still young, is ripe and shows a touch of spice from wood aging. It is a rounded wine that has pepper as well as just enough acidity. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2015 Cuvée des Conti White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: The wine is intensely rich and fresh at the same time. Still young and from super-ripe almost shriveled grapes, this is a wine to age. It needs time to develop, so wait until 2019.
Name: Château Jolys 2014  Jurançon
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This innovative Cretan producer hits the mark with this pretty, fragrant white blend including the island's hallmark white, Vidiano. The nose is full of flowers, white peach fruit and rip citrus, while on the palate, an interplay of exotic fruit and minerality keep the wine focused but friendly. A great wine for spicy Indian cuisine or sushi.
Name: Rhous 2015 White (Crete)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc, Malagousia and Robola blend is feminine and refined from start to finish. The nose offers white flowers and citrus, while on the palate, the fuller-bodied fruit character finishes with a perky brightness. The wine has a fruit-forward style that will appeal to an international market, but exhibits lovely Greek character.
Name: Hatzimichalis 2015 Lefkos White (Atalanti Valley)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: While predominantly Chardonnay, this zany blend of Finger Lakes and North Fork fruit incorporates proportions of everything from Riesling to Vidal Blanc and Viognier. Dry in style with a brisk lemony backbone, it offers loads of mineral vitality and refreshment. Drink now through 2018.
Name: Brooklyn Oenology 2014 Social Club White (New York)

Description: This lively wine starts with aromas of white fruit, citrus and flowers. Ion the palate, exotic guava and pineapple and lemon mingle. An easygoing wine great for everyday enjoyment.
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2015 Amethystos Blanc White (Drama)

Description: On the nose, this exotic white offers banana, lemon and vanilla aromas. On the palate, it has a lush pineapple and banana character edged by vanilla toast. Pretty and approachable, this is a very good go-to white for varied wine lovers.
Name: Hatzimichalis 2014 Kapinas White (Atalanti Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a bright, lively blend of Ugni Blanc and Colombard. It has tangy acidity and a refreshing lemon-peel texture. With its herbal green-fruit character and refreshing aftertaste it is ready to drink now.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2015 Blandine le Blanc Ugni Blanc-Colombard (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is an aromatic blend of Colombard, Gros Manseng and Sauvignon Blanc. Fresh, crisp and fruity, it is the ideal apéritif wine with its mineral texture and bright acidity. It is a lively wine, with just a hint of yellow fruit to go with the intense citrus. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2015 Cuvée Marine White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Light vanilla, macadamia and crisp apple flavors make this dry, medium-bodied wine a good blend of rich and lively.
Name: Monte Volpe 2014 Vesuvius White (Potter Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Attractively aromatic, this is a crisp blend of Colombard and Sauvignon Blanc from the same area as many of the Armagnac vineyards. It is fruity with a zesty lemon texture and so light and perfumed. It is ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2015 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: he nose on this Assyrtiko blend is feisty and spicy, followed a combination of tropical fruit, citrus and vanilla spice on the palate. The wine is fuller bodied but brisk on the finish. Appealing overall and a very nice week-day white.
Name: Estate Biblia Chora 2015 White (Pangeon)

Description: Guava/tropical fruit and spice lead the nose on this Cretan white. On the palate, it's direct and fruit-forward with a spicy oak edge. This is an easy introduction into Greek whites and a good everyday quaffer for myriad meals and flavors.
Name: Kourtaki 2014 Vin de Crete White (Crete)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The wine is bright and fruity. It has crisp acidity and a light touch of citrus to go with the lively acidity. Its blend brings out the herbal flavor of Colombard with just a touch of honey from Gros Manseng. Drink now.
Name: Domaine la Taste 2015 Colombard-Ugni Blanc-Gros Manseng-Sauvignon White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This wine has a pronounced nose of flowers and bright tropical fruit, followed by fruit-forward flavors of nectarine and lemon. The wine is a bit showy but a mineral finish gives it poise.
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2015 Oenodea Malagouzia-Moscato-Sauvignon Blanc White (Drama)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This blend of two herbal grapes gives a tangy zesty wine. Lemon peel and crisp acidity are dominant, with tight fruitiness and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine d'Arton 2015 Les Hauts d'Arton Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The herbal aromas leap from the glass in this crisp, green-fruit and citrus-flavored wine. It is tangy, herbal and grassy in character with a zesty texture and a tight mineral aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2015 Colombard-Ugni Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A blend that includes Gros Manseng along with Colombard and Sauvignon Blanc, this wine is light as a feather—crisp and with just an edge of honey. It is lively with a herbal character that is refreshing and lightly perfumed.
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2015 Haut-Marin Cuvée Marine White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Fruity, soft and rather sweet, this wine smells and tastes like apple and pear juice. It has low acidity, medium body and a sugary finish.
Name: Dancing Coyote 2015 White (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A blend of Ugni Blanc and Colombard from Gascony, the wine has crisp herbaceous flavors and a tight zesty texture. It is light, refreshing and ready to drink.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2015 Cedrus le Blanc White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Medium-pink in color, apple and berry aromas are followed by spritzy, moderately sweet fruit flavors. It goes down easy.
Name: Latah Creek NV Huckleberry D'Latah White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A classic local blend that is dominated by Ugni Blanc and Colombard, this is a deliciously crisp, lively wine. It has juicy kiwi fruit as well as citrus giving a refreshingly zesty wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Vignobles Fontan 2015 Domaine de Maubet White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: An unusual blend of old varieties such as Biancu Gentile and Genovese, this is a beautiful wine. It has exotic perfumed fruits, ripe tangy acidity and a full, rich character. Pepper and herbs add complexity at the end. Drink now.
Name: Clos Venturi 2013 Chiesa Nera White (Vin de France)

Description: Matured in 70% new French oak for six months, this is quite different from most Margaret River versions of this blend. It's more like a white Graves, with a silky mouthfeel and ripe, restrained fruit notes of fig and melon that linger on the finish.
Name: Cullen 2014 Ephraim Clarke Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A blend of 58% Albariño and 42% Viognier, this dense and unctuous wine has 160 g/L residual sugar (16% for those who have misplaced their calculator). So? quite sweet, with flavors of Grand Marnier, lemon custard and coconut oil.
Name: Abacela 2015 Blanco Dulce White (Umpqua Valley)

Description: This is the best example of this wine I can remember, as it manages to toe the fine line between being boldly aromatic and going over the top. Nettles and grapefruit, hints of white currants and passion fruit, it has something to offer any Sauvignon Blanc lover, finishing long and fresh.
Name: Leeuwin Estate 2014 Siblings Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: A blend of 65% Furmint and 35% Hárslevelu, this Hungarian white has aromas of apricot, peach and pear. In the mouth, there are flavors of canned peaches, fresh white peach and pear with a crisp finish.
Name: Holdvölgy 2012 Hold and Hollo White (Tokaj)

Description: This amber-colored wine has a perfumed nose of apricot marmalade and marzipan. It is bright on entry, followed by a sophisticated sense of chalkiness with intense flavors of peach, nectarine, brioche, guava and honeysuckle. Flashes of brightness on the finish dissipate the firm tannins on the palate.
Name: Kindzmarauli Marani 2013 Kakhetian Royal White (Kakheti)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This lower alcohol blend of 75% Viognier and 25% Grenache Blanc is expectedly racy and taut, with mineral-dominant aromas of wet cement, apple cider and baking soda. Tight and pithy on the palate, this is wound up super tight with a steely structure, allowing green fruit and more rocky flavors to carry the weight.
Name: Shale Oak 2014 Sui White (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This chewy, tangy white wine is an engaging blend of 42% Viognier, 33% Marsanne, 23% Roussanne and a splash of Grenache Blanc. Fresh flavors of citrus, apples and pineapple abound. If you're looking for an unoaked alternative to Chardonnay, this is a good option.
Name: Quady North 2015 Pistoleta White (Rogue Valley)

Description: Most of this skin-fermented blend of 64% Semillon and 36% Sauvignon Blanc spent four months in new oak. The result is aromatically restrained, but full-bodied and a bit oily in texture. Hints of marmalade and white pepper appear on the palate, lingering through the long, dusty-with-tannins finish.
Name: Cullen 2014 Amber Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Margaret River)

Description: This Moldovan white blend has aromas of cut grass, apricot and peach. In the mouth there are flavors of honeysuckle, canned peaches and fresh apricot before the crisp and clean finish.
Name: Château Vartely 2015 D'Or White (Codru Region)

Description: This blend of 79% Sauvignon Blanc and 21% Semillon is pungent and sweaty, with an almost Collio-like pungency. It's a bold, in-your-face passion-fruit monster that fades quickly on the finish.
Name: Howard Park 2015 Miamup Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: This is clean, refreshing white blend at a realistic price. Grapefruit and fig aromas lead the way, followed by a plump mouthfeel and flavors of ripe fruit. Drink now.
Name: St Hallett 2014 Poacher's Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc-Riesling White (Barossa)

Description: This blend of Viognier, Chardonnay and Riesling is challenging but rewarding. Funky, pickled stone-fruit aromas are not textbook and pure. In the mouth, this is firm and stout for a white wine, while salty, briny nectarine and apricot flavors finish full and serious.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2014 Gala 3 Viognier-Chardonnay-Riesling White (Mendoza)

Description: A blend of Rkatsiteli and Mtsvane, this light-straw-colored wine has aromas of peach and freesia. It is very soft on the palate, with refreshing flavors of melon, clementine and passion fruit. The citrus finish offers a surprising touch of white chocolate.
Name: Shumi Winery 2013 Tsinandali White (Kakheti)

Description: This Furmint, grown in marl soils, has aromas of brioche, apple tart and caramelized pear and flavors of lemon-lime juice, green apple and lime blossom before a crisp clean finish.
Name: St. Donat 2013 Márga White (Balaton)

Description: This Hungarian white has aromas of peach, apricot, citrus blossom and vanilla bean. In the mouth, there are flavors of caramelized apple and wet river rock.
Name: Basilicus 2012 Once Upon a Time White (Tokaj)

Description: A blend of 65% Furmint, 25% Hárslevelu and 10% Kabar, this Hungarian white has aromas of white peach and fresh apricot juice. There are flavors of yellow peach, green apple and crisp clean minerality in the mouth.
Name: Holdvölgy 2013 Vision  (Tokaji)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: The wine is just off dry, with a soft tropical-fruit character. It has pineapple as well as lemon fruit, crisp acidity and dried apricot flavors. The wine is crisp at the end, and ready to drink.
Name: Famille Laplace 2015 Aramis Petit Manseng-Sauvignon White (Vin de France)

Description: This nearly 50-50 blend is restrained and grassy, reflecting the French ownership and philosophy well. Grapefruit and cut grass will marry well with food or be pleasant on its own, even picking up a hint of stoniness on the fully dry finish.
Name: Cape Mentelle 2015 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: Aromas of almond and apple don't show much sizzle or snap. This blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Gris and Sauvignon Blanc is round and soft in feel, with slightly cidery flavors of apricot and apple. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2015 Gaia White (Tupungato)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This unusual blend, all co-fermented, includes roughly equal proportions of Vermentino, Viognier and Marsanne, with a splash of Roussanne. It's perfumed with the intensity of Gewürztraminer, a mix of baby powder and candied citrus, and those flavors carry through the palate. Though listed as just 12.5% abv, it tastes and feels much riper, showing some heat in the aftertaste.
Name: Troon 2014 Longue Carabine White (Applegate Valley)

Description: Light straw in color, this wine has a soft nose of apricot and clementine. It offers refreshing flavors of honeydew melon, peach and lemon, and it is bright from the first sip through the tangerine and lemon curd finish.
Importer: Georgian House of Greater Washington, LLC
Name: Teliani Valley 2013 Tsinandali White (Kakheti)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: In the style of a Côtes de Gascogne white blend, this is a crisp, herbal and citrusy wine. It has considerable acidity along with pink grapefruit and lime flavors. Drink this light, bright wine now.
Name: Famille Laplace 2015 Aramis Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

Description: Light-gold in color, this blend of three indigenous grapes and a small amount of Chardonnay has a gentle aroma of citrus fruits and white flowers. On the palate there is also a nice interplay of citrus and flowers, with flavors of lemon, lime and orange blossom. The finish is marked with a note of salinity.
Name: Turasan 2014 Selda White (Cappadocia)

Description: Pineapple rind, steely lemon and white flowers carry the notes of this blend of Roussanne, Chardonnay and Viognier. The palate is broad and buttery in feel, with a string of acids that cut the finish short.
Name: Llano Estacado 2014 1836 White (Texas)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Aromas of yellow melon and flowers form the core of the bouquet, with additional hints of straw and grapefruit peel in the background. The light-weight palate offers good balance, with rich tropical-fruit tones of pineapple and mango that finish clean and mouthwatering.
Name: Louis de Camponac 2015 White (Vin de France)

Description: This unusual blend, occasionally found in Alsace, gives a wine that is full and perfumed. It offers almond and spice flavors along with a tight texture. The wine, with its warm acidity, is ready to drink.
Name: Simonnet-Febvre 2014 Saveurs de Lyre  (Coteaux de l'Auxois)

Description: Tropical fruit aromas are hanging in, while this blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Torrontés feels drawn in. Slightly salty melon and apple flavors are showing a hint of oxidation. This finishes a bit dried out.
Name: Alba Roja 2014 White (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Muddled, oily aromas are funky for certain. This blend of Riesling, Albariño and Savagnin feels round and melony, but ultimately soft. Floral, pickled melon flavors come in front of a briny, tropical-leaning finish.
Name: Viña Alicia 2014 Tiara White (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: While the nose is slow to express itself, the palate immediately bursts with crisp, tart apple, with fresh, green pear, with ripe but zesty citrus. There is an innate lightness and lovely depth in this unforced, honest and utterly refreshing wine. It comes on light feet and draws you in with its fresh-faced authenticity. More please.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2015 Braitenpuechtorff Gemischter Satz White (Niederösterreich)

Description: The aromas pop on this blend of Alder Ridge Roussanne (57%) and Antoine Creek Viognier, with perfumed notes of flowers, pear and peach, along with light herb and spice grace notes. Palate coating, it brings a sense of gravitas and delight. It's fruitful and flavorful, offering richness while retaining its deftness, with a sense of texture that is knee buckling.
Name: Waters 2015 Prelude White (Washington)

Description: Pretty and floral, this is a field blend of Gewürztraminer, Trousseau Gris, Riesling and other mixed whites, all farmed by organic guru Phil Coturri. Full-figured and lithe, it lingers in fruit sweetness, the right call as an apéritif with spicy nuts, but especially with chips and guacamole or any other piquant fare.
Name: Carlisle 2014 Compagni Portis White (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Floral, citrus aromas, honeylike flavors and an unctuous texture make this white Rhône-style blend almost a dessert in a glass—without being sweet. The wine is full bodied, mouthfilling, complex and gushing with great pastry-like flavors.
Name: Elyse 2013 L'Ingenue White (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Heady aromas of citrus blossom, tropical fruit and yellow stone fruit lead the way. The fresh, enjoyable palate doles out apricot, pineapple, nectarine and a hint of chopped herb alongside lively acidity.
Name: Castello della Sala 2014 San Giovanni della Sala  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: Tempting vanilla and nutmeg aromas and ripe pear and pineapple flavors animate this full-bodied, smooth and delicious wine made with 75% Chardonnay plus Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier. The generous fruit and oak components are layered and creamy in texture.
Name: Peirano 2014 The Other White (Lodi)

Description: Winemaker: Johan Malan. A blend of 66% Roussanne, 28% Grenache Blanc and 6% Verdelho, this opens with pretty scents of tangy orange zest, crisp pear and melon rind, all framed by hints of fresh hay, savory herbs and a chalky minerality. The medium-weight palate is round and soft, yet enlivened by bright acidity that carries through to the finish, alongside notes of clove-spiked orange and toasted oak. Drink now–2020.
Name: Simonsig 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild Mediterraneo White (Stellenbosch)

Description: Crisp, crunchy apple and pear fruit appears first. This is followed by both more generous apple juice and tarter citrus notes. The midpalate shows concentration and some gentle but determined power. Texture and acidity lend structure to a wine that feels weightier than it is. Wonderfully balanced and dangerously moreish.
Name: Weingut Christ 2015 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: A blend of 50% Grechetto, 20% Sauvignon Blanc, 20% Vermentino and 10% Procanico, this opens with delicate scents of white spring flower, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of hay. The bright, delicious palate doles out creamy white peach, juicy grapefruit, nectarine zest and mineral alongside crisp acidity. It closes clean and refreshing.
Name: Decugnano dei Barbi 2015 Villa Barbi  (Orvieto Classico)

Description: Isabelle and Michel Dietrich brought their wine talents from Alsace, Champagne, and Adelaide to this estate. The result is a wine that is deliciously crisp and perfumed. With its bright acidity, grapefruit and orange flavors and hint of minerality, it is balanced and ready to drink. The fresh aftertaste continues the immediately accessible character of the wine.
Name: Château Haut-Rian 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A wine with spicy aromas, touches of toastiness and rich yellow-fruit flavors. It is full in the mouth with a caramel and cream character that is balanced with the more herbal acidity. The wine could do with a few more months, so drink from late 2016.
Name: Château Bois de Rolland 2015 Ermitage  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a ripe and tangy wine from the Bellanger family. Its green, citrus and apricot fruits are all singing together in an attractive, balanced way. It has richness that gives a full-bodied wine without detracting from the fresher, white currant and spice side. Drink now.
Name: Château Roquefort 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine opens with aromas of apricot and pear. The flavors coat the palate while showing a lot of restraint and exquisite balance.
Designation: Estate Grown and Bottled Le Blanc
Name: Hedges 2015 Estate Grown and Bottled Le Blanc White (Red Mountain)

Description: Made with 60% Sauvignon Blanc and 40% Sémillon, this vibrant wine offers aromas of pressed white flower and white stone fruit. The lively, elegant palate delivers white peach, grapefruit, nectarine and chopped herb alongside racy acidity. A mineral note closes the clean, crisp finish.
Name: Castello della Sala 2014 Conte della Vipera White (Umbria)

Description: This is a delicious, ripe wine that is packed with apricot, apple and pear fruits. It is tangy and freshly fruity. The bright, rich fruit continues right through this wine that is ready to drink now.
Name: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2015 Made From Organically Grown Grapes  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A hint of fresh mango and passion fruit shimmers between grassy hints and citrus. The palate packs an uncommon depth of fruit and makes you want to plumb these dimensions of fresh fruitiness. There is a lot going on in this vivacious field blend. The body is light, the acidity fresh and bright, but the really convincing thing is the innate drive and joy at its core. Bravo.
Name: Neumeister 2015 Gemischter Satz White (Vulkanland Steiermark)

Description: A Rochet property since 1865, now Joëlle, Daniel and Fabienne Rochet manage the 210 acres. Bright, light and textured, this is a crisp and refreshing wine. Attractive lemon and green apple flavors lift the mineral texture and give a juicy, spicy character. The wine is still developing and will be better from late 2016.
Name: Château Malbat 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a light, bright, nearly clear bringing together of 51% Pinot Noir and 49% Chardonnay, just barely pink in color. It accentuates the beauty of both varieties, from Pinot's mix of cherry and watermelon to the Chardonnay's ability to bring out notions of crisp green apple.
Name: Brick & Mortar 2015 Vin Clair Pinot-Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

Description: Legend has it that those who listen closely to the well of Château Côte Montpezat can hear the pilgrims on the way to Compostella who drank here. Drinking the wine today offers light spice and wood aromas that give it an extra dimension. Initially, they seem to dominate the fruit, although this passes over as the herbal and green-fruit character of the wine shows through. It does mean that the wine should age a little in bottle, so wait until early 2017.
Name: Château Côte Montpezat 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: While the nose is shy, the palate is full of texture and focus: citrus freshness has an edge of pleasantly bitter pear peel while grapefruit zestiness pulls no punches with its brightening focus. This packs a punch and needs a good meal to counter its power.
Name: Wieninger 2015 Bisamberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of apple, crushed stone and thyme come together on this vibrant white. The medium-bodied palate offers green pear, juicy nectarine, dried herb and flinty mineral alongside lively acidity. A note of bitter almond fills in the finish.
Name: Decugnano dei Barbi 2014  Orvieto Classico Superiore

Description: Philippe and Florence Giraud reserve 27 acres of 270 vine acres for white wines. With a crisp edge, this is a clean, clear and attractively fruity wine. It has lemon and herbal flavors that are filled out with ripe apple and pear. The balance between the crispness and the richness are just right. Drink now.
Name: Robert Giraud 2015 Château Timberlay  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Melon and apricot aromas are solid and clean. A juicy, stony, fresh palate with mixed citrus and mineral-like flavors finishes with a riot of citrusy acidity, which creates extended length.
Name: Terra do Castelo 2014 Sensación White (Ribeiro)

Description: This Mottet family wine is a blend of 44% Sémillon, 46% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Sauvignon Gris. Soft, rounded and perfumed, this is a full fragrant wine. Its acidity is just right for the smooth texture and green-plum flavored fruits. The background is more tightly coiled with minerality and zesty lemon flavors.
Name: Château la France 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Jean-Christophe Yung is driving this family property with a crisp and refreshing wine. The wine is light, bright and lively with plenty of citrus flavors topped by spice and zesty orange, this is a mineral textured wine. Its fruit is right up front, full of acidity and rich apple flavors. Drink from late 2016.
Name: Château Les Hauts de Palette 2015 Château du Barail  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: The wine is crisp and lightly herbal. It has a good citrus edge that is filled out with warmer peach and currant flavors. There is a good tangy texture as well that gives an attractive bite. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Vignerons de Tutiac 2015 Château Lalande Bellevue  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is adorned with one of the prettiest and most interesting label designs on the market right now. Tropical aromas of pineapple, jasmine and ripe white peach are leveled by squeezed tangerine and orange-blossom scents. Lime juice shows first on the sip, followed by waves of kiwi, green papaya and a touch of mango.
Name: Sea Monster 2014 White (Central Coast)

Description: The 19th edition (the edition numbers serve a similar function to a vintage date) of this popular blend uses eight varieties, mostly aromatic, with no oak influence. The result is just a touch off dry (10 g/L residual sugar), low alcohol, and loaded with scents and flavors of flowers and fruits. A whiff of body powder moves into a midpalate nicely focused on peach and citrus flavors.
Name: Sokol Blosser NV Evolution Lucky No. 9 White (America)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend Viognier (60%) and Roussanne. Aromas of almond butter, lees and spice are followed by a broad palate with a creamy feel. The finish lingers.
Name: Bunnell 2013 Helène White (Yakima Valley)

Description: This wine is dry and rather full bodied, starting with fruity aromas like banana and coconut then seguing to more nutty, oaky, complex flavors and a rich texture. It's a serious dinner wine with heft and substance.
Name: Las Positas 2014 Verdigris White (California)

Description: A blend of 90% Chardonnay and 10% Grechetto, this opens with aromas of oak, toasted nut and a hint of citrus. The dominant oak aroma carries over to the palate together with suggestions of yellow apple and lemon zest. Lively acidity provides the framework while a hint of butterscotch fills in the crisp finish.
Name: Castello della Sala 2014 Cervaro della Sala White (Umbria)

Description: Jean-Christophe Icard is the keeper of the winery which has been in the family since 1799. Attractive herbal fruits and lively acidity make a wine that is refreshing and crisp. Apple and apricot flavors are lifted by the strong citrus streak that cuts right through. Give this wine a few more months, so drink from late 2016.
Name: Château l'Orangerie 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is the first of 15 estates the Gonfrier family owns throughout Bordeaux. There are strong wood influences here, although the fruit is enough to match up. So ripe pear and apricot flavors go with those toasty characters to give a rich, full-bodied wine. It will be better from late 2016.
Name: Château de Marsan 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The wine has just the right freshness with its crisp apple fruits and zesty lime. Tight, lightly mineral and concentrated, it is attractive, showing the richness of the vintage without losing freshness. Drink now.
Name: F. Thienpont 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Bonnet was this family's winery in 1744. André Lurton took over in 1953 and in 2015, the third warmest year since 1900, his team created a wine with tropical fruits, mango and pineapple. This give this wine its ripe, perfumed character. It does have a crisp side as well, fresh with apple and citrus. The balance is just right, giving a refreshing, ready-to-drink wine.
Name: Château Bonnet 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: From tiny production of 2.5 acres, there is a spicy, lightly toasty wine that brings out a richness in the Sauvignon Blanc and gives the apricot and pear fruit roundness. The wine is ripe, full in the mouth, tangy and zesty with a more refreshing herbal aftertaste. Drink from late 2016.
Name: Château Maison Noble 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Waxy papaya and melon aromas maintain freshness despite this getting on in age. A lean, snappy palate is par for the variety and origin, while tangy tangerine and lemon flavors finish sharp and whispy. Drink now.
Name: Aidura 2014 White (Getariako Txakolina)

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A blend dominated by Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay produces a crisp, herbal wine that has the background of a more creamy texture. From 20-year-old vines planted on granite soil, it has a tight, mineral edge as well as concentrated apple, citrus and fresh melon fruits. Drink now.
Name: Lieubeau 2015 La Fruitière Vignes Blanches White (Val de Loire)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This unique blend of Chardonnay, Viognier and Marsanne by Bob Lindquist is priced to sell. Fragrant Gravenstein apple, pink-grapefruit pith and a touch of honeysuckle show on the nose, followed by flavors of apple blossoms, lemon and lime zest on the light and easy palate that sizzles with a cider-like acidity.
Name: Qupé 2015 A Modern White (Central Coast)

Description: The Sichel family delivers a ripe, tropical-fruit flavored wine that is full bodied while also balanced. It has weight, with its apricot and mango flavors right up-front. The aftertaste continues the rich theme, a medley and yellow fruits with enough acidity to balance.
Importer: Vinum Wine Importing and Distributing LLC
Name: Maison Sichel 2015 Château Argadens  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: The wine has a straight line of fresh green and citrus fruits that cut right through the ripe apple flavors. It is tangy while rich and intense, the grapefruit and lime flavors right up front. Drink from late 2016 for best effect.
Name: Château Toutigeac 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Situated on the ridge in the center of Entre-deux-Mers that produces fine white wines, this vineyard has produced a wine that is rich and full. Apricot and ripe pear fruits have a perfumed touch along with almond and spice flavors. It could do with a few more months and will be best from 2017.
Name: Château Landereau 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Dourthe's 100% Sauvignon Blanc is lively and crisp—a light, bright wine. With its strong citrus flavors, lemon and tangerine, touched by spice, it is balanced and fruity. The texture gives a herbal edge that is attractive and refreshing.
Name: Dourthe 2015 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Subtle but friendly hints of yellow plum and lemon are very appetizing on this unusual blend of Grüner Veltliner, Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc. There is satisfying midpalate texture and a lovely fruit expression that combines tart and ripe pear with Mirabelle plum and fresh citrus. All is packaged in a light, easy-drinking, dry body. An ideal summer wine.
Name: Höpler 2015 Pannonica White (Austria)

Description: Dominated by Sémillon, this crisp wine could well become more rich and smooth as it develops. There are hints of yellow fruits as well as bright citrus. It comes from 33-year-old vines that surround a 17th century château. The wine, fresh now, will develop and fill out. So drink from 2017.
Name: Château de Respide 2015  Graves

Description: A strongly mineral driven wine, this is tight, nervy and with a steely backbone. The acidity goes right through this crisp, fruity wine that is all ready to drink now. The aftertaste continues this fruity, fresh theme.
Name: Château Loumelat 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Owned by Jean-François Ménard since 1985, the shift to organic vineyards began in 2012. This wine is lively and crisp, full of herbal acidity and lemon fruits. It has a riper side as well, with its apricot and rich pear flavors. The wine is open, bright and ready to drink.
Name: Château Mémoires 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: In 2001, Aliénor and Alexandre de Malet Roquefort bought this property which is 15 minutes southeast of their Château La Gaffelière. From 8.5 acres of Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Muscadelle, this is a rounded, soft wine that promises well. It is going towards the tropical fruit area with its apricot and pineapple flavors. Behind, the acidity is tangy and crisp with a tight, nervy aftertaste.
Name: Château Chapelle d'Aliénor 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Vincent Lataste's organic wine is light, bright and immediately refreshing. This is a wine that shows a strongly herbal side. It has citrus and green apple flavors that are crisp and tight. With perfumed acidity at the end, the wine is delicious to drink now. It won 2016 Best of Wine Tourism award for B&B in giant wine barrels.
Name: Château de Lardiley 2015 Sauvignon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: From the family estate of Bordeaux wine gurus Denis and Florence Dubourdieu, this is a crisp, refreshing Sauvignon Blanc/Sémillon blend that appeals immediately. Bright acidity, freshly squeezed lemon and a herbal, green edge all make for a wine that is drinkable now as an apéritif as well as with food.
Name: Château Reynon 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a unique blend of Roussanne (59%), Sauvignon Blanc (26%) and Marsanne. The aromas are perfumed with notes of flowers, citrus, peach and lees. The flavors are sweet, with Sauvignon's herbal streak running throughout. It provides intrigue.
Name: Nefarious 2014 Consequence White (Lake Chelan)

Description: Crisp and fruity, this is an immediately attractive win from the fourth generation of the Bonhur family. It has bright acidity, a herbal edge and perfumed apple and lemon flavors. The wine is totally ready to drink.
Name: Vignobles Bonhur 2015 Château Terres Douces  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a crisp, really fruity wine with a light touch of wood from the six months of barrel aging. It is ripe, lightly herbal balancing citrus flavors with riper yellow fruits. Drink now.
Name: Cheval Quancard 2015 Réserve Sauvignon-Sémillon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This aromatic wine has floral, grapefruity aromas, generous citrus flavors, light body, a dry profile and a slightly soft, smooth texture.
Name: Rock Wall 2014 Rock Hound White (California)

Description: This is an attractive blend that includes a good proportion of ripe Sémillon and perfumed Muscadelle. They soften and deliciously fill out the herbal edge of the wine. That gives it a rich feel, full and fruity with a fragrant aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château Tour le Pin 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Subdued stone-fruit, jasmine and white-flower aromas lead to off-dry fruit flavors. It goes down easy.
Name: Dusty Cellars NV Lilly Mae White Table Wine White (Washington)

Description: There is a lightly toasty character in this wine that gives it a round, full texture. Spice goes along with the green and white-fruit flavors to make an intensely fruity wine that hints at a New World style. Drink now. This is one of 15 Bordeaux chateaus by Crus and Domaines de France.
Name: Château Haut Mouleyre 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: With vineyards located in the far southeast of the Bordeaux appellation, this wine is very crisp and clean, this is a fruity wine, packed with green plum, citrus and sliced apple flavors. It is ready to drink now with its bright acidity and lightly perfumed aftertaste.
Name: Château Lary 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This is a light, fruity, apple-flavored wine. It has a really crisp character with a classic tangy texture from the 85% Chenin Blanc in the blend. The wine is fresh, fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Caves de la Loire NV Diamant de Loire Cristal Brut Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Crémant de Loire)

Description: There are attractive, herbal flavors in this wine. It has a fresh, fruity character that is bright and crisp. Lemon zest flavors cut through the warmer apricot and apple. It is an attractive wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Château la Verrière 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This ripe wine from the Siozard family has a smooth texture. It has some spice, rich apple and apricot fruits and touches of more tropical fruits. While the wine is full in the mouth, it still guards some attractive freshness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Claouset 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This luminous white opens with aromas of honeysuckle, tropical fruit and a whiff of tomato leaf. The racy palate offers grapefruit, bitter almond and a mineral note alongside lively acidity.
Name: Argillae 2015  Orvieto

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This interesting blend of 73% Sauvignon Blanc, 20% Viognier and 7% Grenache Blanc shows passionfruit, jasmine, cherimoya and green pluot aromas on the nose. The palate offers riper yellow fruit and a graphite minerality, but not much complexity beyond that.
Name: ONX 2015 Field Day White (Templeton Gap District)

Description: Winemaker Jérémy Ducourt brings attractive grassy, herbal aromas that are followed by a crisp wine. It has tropical fruits as well as lime and lemon flavors. The texture is tight, perfumed and elegant. Drink now.
Name: Château Briot 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A tangy, bright and crisp wine, this is fresh, fruity with green fruits and lime flavors and full of zesty orange and lime. It is a wine that is all fruit, lively and showing a refreshing aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château la Moulinière 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Anne Néel and her children, Maria and Damien Chombart, manage the clay-limestone family property, The result is a fresh, bright and crisp wine that is ready to drink. It has zingy orange and pink-grapefruit flavors that are already well integrated into the bright, tight, mineral texture.
Name: Château Lamothe de Haux 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: In family since 18th century, Stéphane et Paola Gabard took over in 1999. Their wine is promising plenty though it is still opening up. The apple, perfumed pear and peach flavors are all coming through to give a lively, refreshing wine that is also full bodied. Drink from late 2016. La Croix De Queynac is a French monument amidst the vines.
Name: Château La Croix de Queynac 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: On the eastern end of the Bordeaux appellation, this Gazaniol property reserves 10 of 161 acres for its white blend. This is a ripe, soft wine that is rounded with peach and red-apple fruit flavors. Crisp acidity gives it some tightness to balance the full, fruity character of the wine. Drink now.
Name: Château de Parenchère 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Largely neutral lime and generic citrus aromas lead to the type of crisp, fresh palate Txakoli is known for. Tart, snappy lemon and orange flavors are lasting on a cutting finish.
Name: Finca Jakue 2015 White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: The wine is perfumed with a crisp edge of acidity that is brightly attractive. There is a good mix of green fruits, citrus and riper apricot flavors. It's a refreshing, tangy wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2015 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Delicate aromas of spring flower and ripe orchard fruit lead the nose. The simple but well-made palate offers mature apple, white peach, lime and a suggestion of bitter almond.
Name: Bigi 2015  Orvieto Classico

Description: Currant and green-plum fruits give this wine a rich character that is then cut with orange acidity. The result is a wine that is full bodied, lightly spicy and perfumed. It can be drunk now.
Name: Château Roc de Minvielle 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The Courselle sisters, Marie and Sylvie, continue to boost their white style with the lovely blend of 50% Sémillon, 35% Sauvignon Blanc and 15% Sauvignon Gris. The wine is still developing, although it is already giving hints of its spice and ripe apple future. It is a full-bodied wine, only lightly textured. As it develops, it will add to its rich character.
Name: Château Thieuley 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a crisp wine, dominated by rounded Sémillon and perfumed with Muscadelle. It has the bright freshness of the 2013 vintage with citrus and red apple flavors. There is a light mineral aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château Ducasse 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: From its origin in 1789, the Barthe family vineyards were in the hands of sons. In 1991, Véronique Barthe took over and is now developing sustainable vineyards. This vintage is perfumed with touches of fruit candies that will probably integrate better as the wine settles down. Behind this confected front, there is good fruit, crisp acidity and a lively, bright aftertaste. Wait until late 2016 to drink.
Name: Château la Freynelle 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: There is plenty of acidity in Sylvaine and Yannick Fournier's wine as well as ripe red-currant and spice flavors. The streak of crispness goes right through, lively and tight with a tangy, almost New World aftertaste. Drink from late 2016.
Name: Château de Bonhoste 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The Lobre family created a herbal wine that is crisp with green fruits, green herbs and tangy acidity. It is fresh, lightly perfumed and with touches of more tropical flavors. The wine could do with a few more months, so drink from late 2016.
Name: Château de l'Aubrade 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The wine is all green fruit, crisp and with a strong citrus element. Its light tangy texture lifts it easily and gives a bright character to an attractive wine. Drink now. This is one of 15 Bordeaux chateaus by Crus and Domaines de France.
Name: Château Laubès 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The wine from Vignobles Chatelier is ripe, smooth and well balanced. With its green fruits balanced by apricot, it is a wine that has both tangy acidity and a soft, rounded texture. It is ready to drink.
Name: Château d'Arveyres 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A spectacular B&B château is the backdrop for this 100% Sauvignon (Blanc and Gris). The wine has a strongly herbal character with its tense acidity and citrus flavors. It is still developing its even more fruity side, bringing out apple and green-plum flavors. Drink from late 2016. Owned by Groupe Bolian since 2013.
Name: Château de la Rivière 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Attractively herbaceous, this is a crisp, light and bright wine. Tight green fruits and plenty of acidity give it a juicy character that makes it refreshing. Drink now. This is one of 15 Bordeaux chateaus by Crus and Domaines de France.
Name: Château Mezain 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Spicy with touches of nutmeg, this is a balanced, young and fruity wine. It has a fresh, citrus edge to go with the richer pear and peach fruit flavors. The aftertaste is crisp and tangy.
Name: Château l'Espérance 2015 Instinct  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Bright and fruity, this wine has all the richness of whites in this vintage. It has yellow fruits, citrus and a warm, rounded texture. There is just a touch of herbal acidity at the end to keep it fresh.
Name: Château de Cranne 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A blend of 58% Sauvignon Blanc and 42% Gewürztraminer, this wine was given no oak aging and has a slight percentage of residual sugar. Peach colored, it's also flavorful in peach and apricot, simple and easy to like, with a slight spritz to the end.
Name: Pedroncelli 2015 Friends White (Sonoma County)

Description: This Bonhur family wine is perfumed although it seems to lack definition. The fruit is still coming through—this wine has the potential for crisp apples and citrus flavors as it develops. Wait until late 2016.
Name: Vignobles Bonhur 2015 Château Merlet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a superripe wine. With its apricot and mango fruit flavors it is exotic and far removed from traditional white Bordeaux. A blend of Sauvignons Blanc and Gris, it has light signs of wood aging that add some spice to the very rich character of the wine. Drink from the end of 2016.
Name: Château Alta Gaïa 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is dry and full bodied, with a light smoky aroma and modest, unusual flavors like fennel and green peach.
Name: The Winery SF 2013 Peoples Blend White (North Coast)

Description: The wine has mango aromas that set the scene for a tropical, richly fruity wine. Spice gives an extra frisson to this ripe wine. It has an exotic character that is unusual in this style of wine although it doesn't seem out of place or context. Drink now.
Name: Château des Tourtes 2015 Duo Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: The wine is tight and mineral in character. It is textured, steely with the citrus fruits giving the wine a bite as well as intense acidity. Think of this wine with seafood.
Name: Château du Seuil 2015 Domaine du Seuil  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A simple, rounded and soft wine that has light acidity and more in the way of ripe fruit. It is lightly textured, bright with fruitiness with a squeeze of lemon at the end. Drink now.
Name: Château Gandoy Perrinat 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a very ripe wine with lots of tropical fruits, from banana to cherimoya, as well as tuberose and bubblegum scents on the nose. Made from an atypical blend of 36% Marsanne, 33% Roussanne, 25% Chardonnay and 6% Viognier, it has a palate that is a tad cloying in its tropicality, with baked bananas and baked apples showing most prominently.
Name: Ascension Cellars 2015 Silver White (Paso Robles)

Description: Christophe and Fabien Vincent are focused on picking the right soils for their grapes. It takes a while. In this vintage, initially this wine is not showing much. It then opens with a tight, herbal character. It is refreshing, tangy and textured with its green plum and green-herb flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2015 Intense  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: With its 10% Muscadelle, the wine has an attractive perfumed edge that lifts the citrus fruit. The wine is floral, fruity and crisply ready to drink.
Name: Château Naudeau 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: With its soft texture and rounded character, this is a generous wine. Acidity and crispness are some way behind the ripe green and white-stone fruits. The wine, though, is certainly balanced and ready to drink.
Name: Château des Antonins 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The classic Bordeaux white blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon has produced a light and fruity wine. It has some attractive green plum and currant flavors that are lined with clean, pure acidity. Drink the wine now.
Name: Clos des Menuts 2014 Menuts Fruité  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A hearty 80% Sauvignon Blanc finds companionship in 20% Sémillon, barrel-fermented sur lie and left light in the glass. Lean hints of lemon and quince ride dry, simple waves that come off as slightly diluted.
Name: Vellum 2014 White Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Napa Valley)

Description: A soft, ripe and rounded wine that is full of fruit. It has a generous feel to it that is balanced by a more tangy citrus edge. Apricots show as the wine opens up to reveal its ripe side. Drink now.
Name: Château de la Vieille Tour 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: There are ripe yellow fruits here in this generous, full wine. Touches of spice add to the general feeling of richness. There is enough concentration to give a wine that is dense and with a pepper aftertaste.
Name: Château Gantonnet 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Small production from five acres with biodynamic techniques, the wine is perfumed, full of candied flavors. It has acidity and a zesty texture with a juicy, green plum character. The aftertaste is ripe and full-bodied. Stéphane Derenoncourt consults for owner Pascal Collotte.
Name: Château Jean Faux 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Pierre Lurton runs Cheval Blanc and d'Yquem and this winery, his home château. This is a smooth wine, full-bodied and with a soft texture. It is ripe with apricot and pear flavors, cut with sliced apple. A touch of spice adds interest. With its ripe, full aftertaste the wine shows the plumper side of the vintage. It is ready to drink.
Name: Château Marjosse 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Bruno Mottet's 2013 purchase of Right Bank Château Seguin now delivers a ripe, smooth and soft wine. There is plenty of fruitiness, citrus, green plum and apple, all integrated into the rich texture and final acidity. Drink now.
Name: Château Seguin 2015 Sauvignon de Seguin  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Modest citrus, green-herb and feline aromas set up a pinched, zesty palate with vague passion fruit and citrus flavors that are a bit sour. Nettle and citrus notes drive a snappy finish. This is 50% Airén, with Macabeo and Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Manuel Manzaneque Suárez 2015 Fatum White (La Mancha)

Description: The wine has ripe yellow fruit flavors that are soft and full. Spice and a generous texture give a rounded wine that is full bodied and ready to drink.
Name: Château Suau 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A gentle wine, soft and with attractive green fruits. It is light and tangy although the flavors are muted at the moment. Give it a few months for an easy apéritif style.
Name: Château L'Oiseau 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A light wine that seems rather dilute. It has simple, green and citrus fruit flavors that are gentle and refreshing. Drink now.
Name: Michel Lynch 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine has soft apple and ripe pear flavors. It has a smooth texture that means it is ready to drink. The aftertaste, with its crisper acidity, suggests a wine that will be a good apéritif.
Name: Château Fonfroide 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The Sèze family's white vineyard is enclosed by their Fronsec red vines. This wine is soft, ripe and rounded. It has gentle acidity along with a tangy edge of orange zest. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Château Buisson-Redon 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Candied aromas lead to a bland, confected wine that is flat and missing fruit. It is clean with a hint of perfumed lime. There is little of interest here.
Name: Vignobles Grandeau 2015 Château Lauduc Classic Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: The wine is very soft, probably too much so. With a smooth texture, it lacks definition or great fruit. Drink now.
Name: Château Lamothe Barrau 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Light and fruity, the wine is dilute and gently textured. It is ready to drink.
Name: Producta Vignobles 2015 Mission St. Vincent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A high-toned pitch of ripe pear and tart apple is like a clarion call. Residual sweetness on the palate mollifies that distinct, primal acidity, lending life to notes of dried peach and fresh apricot. Layers of flavor shimmer and shift, with apple notes that last and last.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2011 Rotenberg White (Alsace)

Description: The ethereal, aromatic lift of this wine is addictive. It appears like the sublimation of fresh, ripe apple. The dry, brisk palate adds streaks of lanolin and earthiness to that profound, glistening freshness and the distinctly phenolic texture. Drink and think. The wine will shine until at least 2025.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2012 Langenberg White (Alsace)

Description: Dried hayflowers and dried orange peel send a lifted scent. The palate is richer and rounder than the nose suggests, full of ample apple and pear fruit, but guided and held by fresh, clean acidity. A certain earthiness shimmers with almost tropical hints of mango. The finish is dry, briskly clean but very lingering.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2013 Engelgarten White (Alsace)

Description: Made with 70% Carricante and 30% Catarratto, this elegantly structured wine has enticing aromas of Mediterranean herb, fragrant yellow flower, citrus and a whiff of acacia. The fresh, savory palate shows juicy lime, ripe pear, chopped herb and mineral alongside tangy acidity. The lingering finish closes crisp and clean.
Name: Graci 2015 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Ripe, red apple and freshly baked apple are the chief flavors. Slight residual sweetness accentuates them all the more, making for a richly spiced, tart, generous but structured wine. The apple fruit is so plump, rich and ample that it fills the entire palate and continues to linger long after the last sip.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2011 Grasberg White (Alsace)

Description: Bruised apple and dried-hay flavors precede a fresh, lanolin and quince-scented palate. There is freshness and verve, dryness and a softer, richer core of fruit that shines through the structure built of acidity and phenolic texture. This has a playful rusticity and an ample yet focused generosity. There also is alcoholic heat and something of deep, chalky soil. It's a very original wine, as field blends are meant to be.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2011 Schoffweg White (Alsace)

Description: Hints of peach and blossom tell of aromatic varieties in this field blend. The palate confirms this with the rich, almost oily texture of rose oil. This is off dry but balanced: the richness seems to be contained in a cloud that bursts into aromatic atoms the moment you swallow. This makes you long for more and want to delve into the earthy, chalky depths.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2012 Burg White (Alsace)

Description: A very soft but distinctly pure nose of ripe, yellow-pear flesh perfumes everything. The palate enters with far more texture than expected and girdles the fruit with phenolic grip, brightened by fresh acidity. The faintest slick of residual sugar boosts the fruit notes towards the dry finish. The pear notes linger beautifully.
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2012 Clos du Zahnacker White (Alsace)

Description: A blend of 65% Grillo and 35% Carricante, this offers subtle aromas of ripe orchard fruit, wild flower and a whiff of almond. The vibrant, savory palate boasts green apple, creamy white peach, citrus and aromatic herb alongside an energizing mineral vein. It finishes crisp and clean.
Name: Le Casematte 2015 Peloro Bianco White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This stylish blend of two traditional Greek varieties starts with a nose of lemon, white peach and mint followed by fruit-forward flavors of citrus and tropical fruit. The wine has a good cut of acidity that gives it poise and purpose. An elegant pour, with ability to age, pair this with delicate fish or sushi.
Name: Porto Carras 2013 Melissanthi White (Côtes de Meliton)

Description: With a bit of air, ripe and mellow apple notes appear. These seem to be burgeoning and rich, ready to spill and splash along with notes of peach and dried pear. A phenolic, rich texture and fresh acidity keep them all in check. There is lots of interesting conflict in this glass. Let the drama play out on your tongue.
Name: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2012 Harmonie R White (Alsace)

Description: This blend starts with panache, offering aromas of vanilla cream, lemon, banana and crushed herbs. On the palate, it balances brisk acidity with alluring citrus and melon fruit flavors. The wine has a spicy spin that gives it extra spunk.
Name: Ktima Pavlidis 2015 Thema White (Drama)

Description: The flinty but utterly promising scent of reduction still hovers above this wine: clearly this is not meant to be drunk now. The palate underneath already tells of the freshest apple fruit, of depth and purity plus a woody roundness. Let this sleep in your cellar until 2017–2023.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2014 Zind White (Alsace)

Description: This mouthwatering blend starts with a nose of fresh mint, pineapple and mango, followed by flavors of orange peel, peach and lemon. Fresh and fruity with a mineral backbone, the wine finishes on an earthy spin. Pair with grilled sardines or poultry dishes.
Name: Tsililis 2015 Theopetra Malagouzia-Assyrtiko White (Meteora)

Description: Intense aromas of white spring flower, aromatic herb, exotic fruit and citrus seamlessly come together on this. The radiant, precise palate offers nectarine zest, lime, sage and white peach while a tangy saline note closes the lingering finish. Enjoy now or hold another few years for more complexity. Drink through 2020.
Name: Biondi 2015 Outis Bianco  (Etna)

Description: A blend of Grecanico and Insolia and fermented with wild yeasts in concrete tanks, this unusual white offers intriguing aromas of dried Mediterranean herb, sea breeze, candied citrus zest and wild flower. The savory, mineral-driven palate offers nectarine, dried apricot, saline, sage and baking spice while a honey note wraps around the finish.
Name: COS 2014 Rami White (Sicilia)

Description: Soft ctirus notes appear first. The palate follows with gentle but focused mandarin peel and a bright, luminous core of citrus freshness and weightlessness. Nonetheless, this wine offers a depth of citrus fruit with clear focus and precision. This is lovely, pure and lasting.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2014 Points Cardinaux Métiss White (Alsace)

Description: A gently floral nose gives rise to a charming and soft palate. Fresh pear buried in mounds of white petals on the nose leads to a distinct, ultraclean and dry palate. Despite its alluring, aromatic softness it has complete focus. The finish offers pure lemon.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2014 Métiss White (Alsace)

Description: A pure rendition of honeysuckle blossom rises from this wine along with notes of ripe pear. The palate has something both crystalline and stony, pure and distinct. Beyond its central seam of freshness the wine shimmers with rich, earthy nuance of ripe pear on one side, of brisk zestiness on the other. Drink now and until 2020.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2014 White (Alsace)

Description: Plump, waxy aromas of baked apple and lanolin are complex and proprietary to Garnacha Blanca. This feels full and creamy, with moderate but present acidity. Slightly bitter, peppery stone-fruit flavors fold in a note of papaya and vanilla. A steady finish is healthy and balanced.
Name: Portal del Montsant 2012 Santbru White (Montsant)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, nut, acacia flower and orchard fruit come together in the glass. The firm palate offers mature yellow apple, candied nectarine zest, toasted hazelnut and flinty mineral. Bright acidity provides balance.
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2014 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: This offers heady aromas of honeysuckle, white stone fruit, dill, hay and a vegetal note that recalls tomato leaf. The tangy palate offers juicy grapefruit, white peach and honeydew melon while mouthwatering salinity provides depth.
Name: Baglio del Cristo di Campobello 2015 Laluci White (Sicilia)

Description: This delicate Hungarian white wine is a blend of 86% Furmint, 9% Yellow Muscat and 5% Kabar. It has enticing aromas of white flowers, botrytis, gardenia, apple blossom and apricot that prepare your palate for flavors of peach juice, citrus zest, grapefruit juice, caramelized pineapple and a crisp clean finish.
Name: Chateau Dereszla 2014 Dry  (Tokaji)

Description: Alluring scents of spring blossom, Spanish broom, crushed stone and ripe orchard fruit meld together in the glass. The medium-bodied palate is a bit rounder and juicer than previous vintages although it still retains elegance, offering white peach, green apple and juicy lemon drop alongside energizing mineral. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors.
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2015 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: The nose is like pear juice spilled onto warm earth, while the palate is more citrus-focused. A seam of almost tropical acidity links lemon to notes of pineapple, lifted by joyful freshness.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2013 Zind White (Alsace)

Description: Scents of Spanish broom, pineapple, orchard fruit and a saline note meld together in the glass. The focused palate offers mature apple, peach, botanical herb and mineral alongside firm acidity.
Name: Biondi 2014 Chianta Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Subtle hints of ripe, winter-stored apple on the nose lead to an equally apple-dominated palate that shows soft pepper spice. A wonderful midpalate texture and baked-apple richness are countered by lemon freshness. This is very appetizing and cries out for soft cheeses.
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2014 L'Aplomb White (Alsace)

Description: Made with 60% Moscato di Alessandria and 40% Albanello, this earthy, intriguing white offers penetrating aromas of pressed wild flower, vineyard dust, orchard fruit and dried aromatic herb. The pervasive floral scent follows through to the mineral-driven palate along with dried peach, candied nectarine zest and chopped sage. Quality has improved immensely since the producer transferred to her spacious new cellars.
Name: Occhipinti 2015 SP68 Bianco White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Enticing scents of spring flower, beeswax and orchard fruit come together in the glass. The elegant, linear palate shows juicy lemon, nectarine, hazelnut and a saline note framed in firm acidity. It closes crisp and clean.
Name: Baglio del Cristo di Campobello 2015 Adènzia White (Sicilia)

Description: The aroma recalls ripe, juicy pear peel. Likewise, the palate sings with ripe pear notes, framed by a phenolic texture and countered by lively freshness. This wine is brisk, clean and fruity.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2014 Gentil White (Alsace)

Description: This blend of 40% Ribolla Gialla, 30% Chardonnay and 30% Sauvignonasse has aromas of freshly cut grass, lemon grass and white peach. It is clean and bright in the mouth with flavors of peach, apple, pear and apricot.
Name: Colliano 2013 Cuvée White (Goriska Brda)

Description: The nose hints at the soft, crips yellow pear fruit that abounds on the palate, countered by brisk, clean freshness. This wine has an enlivening palate with a juicy, lip-smacking finish.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2014 Black Tie White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Enticing aromas of freshly cut Cox Orange Pippin apples reach every corner of this easy, fruity wine. The palate is crisp yet full flavored, light-bodied and dry. The finish is lasting and superclean.
Name: Josmeyer NV Alsace Dream White (Alsace)

Description: Star anise and vibrant floral aromas give this Robola-Assyrtiko blend an elegant character. On the palate, the wine offers fresh fruit and clean, refreshing acidity. This wine will appeal to many and has a versatile pairing profile.
Name: Mercouri Estate 2015 Kallisto Assyrtiko-Robola White (Ilia)

Description: Ripe notes of juicy yellow-pear waft from the glass The palate is equally full-fruited but comes with a dry, crisp and refreshing palate and a clean finish.
Name: Wolfberger 2015 W3 White (Alsace)

Description: Made with Zibibbo and Moscato grapes, this fortified wine offers heady aromas of mature apricot, candied lemon drop and a hint of thyme. The round, one-dimensional palate shows acacia honey and dried figs.
Name: Florio NV Grecale White (Sicilia)

Description: Beeswax and acacia aromas lift out of the glass while the bright palate offers ripe pear, nectarine and grilled herb. Mineral and almond notes add interest.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2015 Mozia White (Sicilia)

Description: Made with 70% Grecanico, 15% Grillo and 15% Sauvignon Blanc, this offers enticing scents of fragrant yellow flower, honeydew melon and citrus. The creamy, enveloping palate offers grapefruit, peach, tropical fruit and note of chopped Mediterranean herb.
Name: Planeta 2015 Alastro White (Sicilia)

Description: Tropical fruit, spice and honey on the nose give this Malagousia and Assyrtiko blend an opulent, exotic start. Balance is struck with its citrus and melon fruit backed by a clean acidity. Clean but full of character.
Name: Zacharias 2014 White Squared White (Corinth)

Description: A blend of 80% Carricante and 20% Catarratto, this offers heady aromas of Spanish Broom, linden blossom and white stone fruit. The bright palate offers yellow apple, unripe peach, lemon zest and mineral alongside refreshing acidity.
Name: Antichi Vinai 1877 2012 Pietralava Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Made with 70% Inzolia and 30% Chardonnay, this opens with scents of white flower, Mediterranean herb and a hint of orchard fruit. The linear palate offers lime and yellow apple accompanied by bright acidity.
Name: Cusumano 2015 Angimbé White (Sicilia)

Description: This white blend offers aromas of melon, vanilla and mango, followed by a rich array of creamy white fruit and pineapple flavors. Balanced by a pronounced minerality and a touch of spice, it's a wine that will pair well with richer poultry and fish dishes.
Name: Stelios Kechris 2015 The Fourth Dimension White (Macedonia)

Description: Aromas of hay, orchard fruit and a whiff of hazelnut lead the nose while the straightforward palate offers lime, chamomile and peach. A saline note closes the finish.
Name: Tenuta di Fessina 2014 Erse Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Round and juicy, this offers enticing scents of white flower, mature apple, citrus and pear that carry over to the palate along with honeydew melon and a hint of aromatic herb. Fresh acidity balances the ripe fruit flavors.
Name: Donnafugata 2015 Anthilia White (Sicilia)

Description: Slight notes of green pear hint at a fresh, lively and fruity palate. This is a light, easy summer wine of feather weight. Lemony freshness makes it ideal for a summer afternoon, with its freshly fruited finish.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2014 Double Impact White (Alsace)

Description: Made with 70% Catarratto and 30% Viognier, this has aromas suggesting honeysuckle, yellow stone fruit and a savory whiff of tarragon. The soft, round palate shows pear, citrus and a hint of apricot while a note of bitter almond closes the finish.
Name: Gregorio De Gregorio 2015 White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Faint pear notes on the nose lead to a savory, earthy but crisp palate. The finish is very clean, even cleansing. This will shine with food.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2014 White (Alsace)

Description: A soft and subdued nose leads to a very gently but freshly fruited palate. Cut pear and apple abound, as does their brisk, friendly freshness. This has the same tart and juicy feel as a perfectly ripe apple. The finish is dry and clean.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2014 Gentil White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Can't-miss aromas of petrol, wet stones and lime will have you thinking this is Riesling, but the blend is two-thirds Garnacha Blanca and the rest Macabeo. Tight and well cut on the palate, this tastes of melon, lime and peach pit. A quick, lean finish works.
Name: Celler Cooperatiu de Gandesa 2014 Somdinou White (Terra Alta)

Description: Slightly muddled pear and earth flavors appear on the nose. The palate is far more defined, with fresh pear notes and distant hints of pineapple. This is dry, full-fruited and fresh.
Name: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2014 Côtes d'Ammerschwihr White (Alsace)

Description: Alluring aromas of grilled herb, spring blossom, citrus and crushed stone lift out of the glass. The palate is understated but refined, offering lime, tangerine zest, sage and a hint of saline alongside bright acidity.
Name: Terre di Giurfo 2015 Suliccenti White (Vittoria)

Description: At one moment there is a whiff of fresh apple, the next a hint of wet earth and orange peel. Brisk and dry, the palate also veers from rounded fruit to earthier, funkier notes. It finishes clean and refreshing.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2013 White (Alsace)

Description: Earthy notes of pear peel promise texture and the very crisp, bright palate delivers, but with edges of bitterness. The finish is wonderfully brisk. This wine will do so much better with food.
Name: Domaine Pfister 2013 Cuvée 8 White (Alsace)

Description: Here's a straightforward, crisp white that opens with aromas of orange blossom and citrus. The bright palate shows apricot, lime and lemon zest alongside refreshing acidity.
Name: Cantine Rallo 2015 Al Qasar White (Sicilia)

Description: Delicate scents of white flower, flint and white stone fruit slowly emerge on this crisp white. The linear, refreshing palate offers unripe peach, citrus and mineral alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: Cantine Valenti 2015 Enrico IV Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Soft and spicy honeysuckle notes hover pleasantly. The palate shows the same aromatic overtones and has a sprightly freshness. The finish is dry and lively. Drink soon.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2014 One White (Alsace)

Description: A blend of 70% Inzolia and 30% Viognier, this bright wine offers aromas of yellow stone fruit and citrus. The straightforward palate shows peach, unripe apricot and lime alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Baglio di Pianetto 2015 Ficiligno White (Sicilia)

Description: This blend of native grapes boasts an aromatic nose of fragrant white flower and yellow stone fruit. The crisp palate offers apricot, lemon zest and hint of nut alongside bright acidity.
Name: Cantine Europa 2015 Eughenes Grillo-Zibibbo White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Slightly high-toned hints precede nuances of pear and lemon. The palate is light, dry and crisp, finishing with a fresh, clean lemon note.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2014 Crustacés White (Alsace)

Description: This offers subdued aromas suggesting orchard fruit and pressed yellow flower. The straightforward, rather lean palate offers citrus, saline and a hint of green pear alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Duca di Salaparuta 2015 Colomba Palatino White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: A 50-50 blend of Catarratto and Chardonnay, this opens with aromas that recall Spanish broom and ripe orchard fruit. The bright, simple palate offers yellow apple and citrus alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Principe di Corleone 2015 Pollara White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: A blend of native grapes Rucignola, Catarratto and Malvasia, this has aromas suggesting pressed yellow flower and dried herb. The palate is somewhat lean, offering citrus, dried Mediterranean herb and a hint of nut.
Name: Barone di Villagrande 2015 Salina Bianco White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: A distinctly aromatic nose tells of honeysuckle while the dry, light palate is sherbety and less defined. Drink this easygoing wine soon, while aromas are fresh.
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2014 Grains de Génie White (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of orange zest, apple cider and yeast come in front of a plump, slightly wayward palate with citric acidity. Generic citrus flavors finish lemony but with acidic scour.
Name: Esperanza 2015 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: A 50-50 blend of Inzolia and Chardonnay, this has pleasant aromas of yellow flower and a whiff of tropical fruit. The fresh, simple palate shows white peach and citrus while bright acidity gives it a clean finish.
Name: Principe di Corleone 2015 Bianca di Corte White (Sicilia)

Description: The nose gives away as little as the palate. This is a rather neutral, dry white wine with fresh acidity and some bitter edges, almost bare of fruit apart from some citrus freshness, yet the wine is very clean. It will work for a thirsty crowd at a summer party.
Name: Famille Hauller 2015 Edelzwicker White (Alsace)

Description: This offers aromas and flavors suggesting unripe apricot, peach and lime. The simple palate is a bit raw, but crisp acidity gives it clean, bright finish.
