Name: Marchesi De Gregorio 2015 Vermentino del marchese White (Sicilia)

Description: This semisweet Viura-Malvasia blend is neutral on the nose, then sweet as expected on the palate, with upfront residual sugar driving a flavor profile that includes mango, banana and apple juice. Sugary and bit cloying from start to finish, but good acidity keeps it in balance.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2015 Satinela Semi Dulce White (Rioja)

Description: Bruised apple notes precede a friendly, easy, soft, apple-scented wine with a light and dry body. Drink soon while aromas last.
Name: Willm 2015 Gentil White (Alsace)

Description: Smoky, sulfuric aromas put you on alert. This strange Catalonian blend of Garnacha Blanca, Albariño and Moscatel feels solid and centered, while salty papaya flavors are a touch bitter. A finish with little flavor but good texture close this out.
Name: Clos Pons 2013 Sisquella White (Costers del Segre)

Description: This blend of Inzolia and Chardonnay has subdued aromas of orchard fruit and nut. The extremely simple palate offers suggestions of lime and citrus zest alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Case del Feudo 2015 Barone Beneventano del Bosco White (Sicilia)

Description: This blend of Inzolia and Chardonnay has subdued aromas of orchard fruit and nut. The simple palate offers lime and citrus zest alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Case Bianche 2015 Barone Beneventano del Bosco White (Sicilia)

Description: This Riesling-led blend smells pithy and bitter. It's generic and blocky on the palate, with flavors of white mushroom and bitter citrus fruits. Grapefruit pith and orange rind flavors drive the finish. Tasted twice with similar findings.
Name: Santa Rita 2014 Secret Reserve White (Central Valley)

Description: This dazzling white is a lesson in finesse and balance. It opens with alluring, delicate scents of white wild flowers, chopped herbs, almonds and orchard fruits. The elegant palate offers layers of crisp apple and creamy pear, and radiant acidity brightens the intense flavors while a mineral note closes the lingering finish. Drink through 2023.
Name: Pieropan 2013 Calvarino  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: It's fun to rattle off a few of the numerous aromas and flavors in this exotic but subtle wine: tangerine, pastry cream, blanched almonds and a touch of honey. The wine is refreshing, dry and nicely braced with acidity, but at the same time rather broad and soothing in texture. In other words, beautifully balanced and wonderfully complex.
Name: Terre Rouge 2014 Enigma White (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Delicate scents of spring blossom, exotic fruit, hazelnut and a whiff of oak emerge on this radiant white. The linear, elegant palate offers tangerine zest, yellow apple, mineral and bitter almond accompanied by vibrant acidity. It's loaded with finesse.
Name: Pieropan 2013 La Rocca  (Soave Classico)

Description: Lemon and pear take center stage on the nose while the palate presents zesty freshness and wonderful texture. While these Viennese field blends are wonderfully varied, they always are fresh and textured, joyful and food friendly. This wine will lend energy to any repast with its clarion calls of freshness and verve.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2015 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Rich notes of ripe peach and plum hover over more homely, ripe apple fruit. This enticing nose announces yet another Viennese field blend of immense and immediate charm. The idea here is of an easy-drinking but never facile wine of total local character that expresses typicity, freshness and joy. The verve of fresh lemon zestiness carries from the first sip to the last crisp echo of aftertaste. This is lip smacking and moreish.
Name: Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2015 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Hints of aromatic orange peel and white summer blossom add a certain exotic headiness to an earthy white blend from Burgenland. The palate is slender but laden with appetizing fruit flavours on surprisingly light, delicate feet—the result of sunny summer days and cool nights. Drink this soon to make most of those enticing, primary fruit notes and lasting aromas.
Name: Meinklang 2015 Burgenlandweiß White (Burgenland)

Description: This wine is delicately perfumed with scents of pressed white flower, pear, white stone fruit and crushed rock. Crisp acidity carries the yellow apple, citrus zest and pineapple flavors while a light mineral vein backs up the finish.
Name: Pieropan 2014  Soave Classico

Description: Green and yellow apples mingle with yeasty savoriness. The slender palate rings with an earthy tang and lemon overtones. A central thread of lemony freshness sets a bright, friendly tone. This is aromatic, fresh and utterly gluggable. Nothing less than Vienna in a glass.
Name: Wieninger 2015 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Freshly cut green and red apples vie for attention. Burgeoning fruit on the nose leads to an ultracrisp, lip-smacking palate of lemon peel flavours. This is a wine to provide refreshment on a hot summer day—mouthwatering and light-footed as it is. The textured palate offers a backbone and is an ideal canvas for all manner of food.
Name: Zahel 2015 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Assertive and delicious, this light-bodied and dry wine has dramatic aromas of wood smoke, wet stones and even diesel. Those are classic for the German grape varieties from which it was made, as are the light peach and white pepper flavors that ride an elegant texture and slightly sweet balance.
Name: Markus Wine Co 2014 Nativo White (Lodi)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made with 60% Grechetto and Procanico, 35% Sauvignon and 5% Sémillon, this offers heady aromas of dried peach and sweet almond. On the enveloping palate, notes of acacia honey and orange peel add depth to dried apricot.
Name: Decugnano dei Barbi 2013 Pourriture Noble  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: Slight spritz enhances the green, crunchy apples of this fresh, friendly blend of Neubuger and Grüner Veltliner. Grüner's earthiness and Neuburger's nuttiness shine through but the overall tone is one of lightness and joy.
Name: Tinhof 2015 Blanc White (Burgenland)

Description: Creamy, lemon-scented apples offer a harmonious, easy to enjoy and friendly palate on this aromatic, bright and fruity white. With a slender, scented silhouette, this is designed for easy, lightweight summer sipping. Drink soon while flavors are in their prime.
Name: Dürnberg 2015 Falko Cuvée White (Niederösterreich)

Description: White spring flower and citrus aromas lead the way on this juicy, savory wine. On the bright palate, a touch of cake spice accents succulent grapefruit, lemon drop and green apple alongside fresh acidity. A white almond note fills in the finish.
Name: Cesari 2015 Cento Filari  (Lugana)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This jazzy wine has enticing floral aromas and ripe, almost sweet flavors like a lemon tart. Light to medium-bodied, it offers a refreshing balance, smooth texture and absolutely fresh fruits and spices.
Name: Boeger 2015 Hangtown Gold Lot #16 White (El Dorado)

Description: Mellow oak aromas work nicely with core apple and melon scents. This blend of Tempranillo Blanco and Viura feels tight and acidic, but also highly energetic. Flavors of light oak and generic citrus run long on the finish.
Name: Nivarius 2014 Edición Limitada White (Rioja)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Beatrice Cointreau is a 20th generation winemaker who moved to Malibu, where she makes this blend of 98% Viognier and 2% Chardonnay. It shows delicate lemon wedges, ripe nectarine and melon, lime zest and tangerine juice on the nose. The palate combines lime peels with riper peach and pineapple notes in the midpalate.
Name: Admirable Family Vineyard 2014 Blanc & Blanc Viognier-Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Red apple, savory yeast and zesty lemon unite in this white field blend from lower Austria. Nimble on its feet with freshness and a zippy, crunchy but light body, this calls for a sunny, hot day where refreshment should come in as light a package as possible.
Name: Martinshof 2015 Gemischter Satz White (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend of Chardonnay (44%), Viognier (39%) and Roussanne (17%) has surprisingly light aromas of melon, peach and straw leading to full-feeling, tingly stone-fruit flavors. It wants more aromatically but the palate delivers the enjoyment.
Name: Patterson 2015 Melange Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of toasted oak, butterscotch and hazelnut lead the nose on this brawny white. The flamboyant, full-bodied palate offers dried citrus fruit, candied ginger, vanilla, honey and a confectionary note. The rich flavors have a certain appeal but the heat of evident alcohol throws it off balance.
Name: Fattoria Coroncino 2012 Gaiospino Fumé  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Peach blossom and dusty melon aromas set up a snappy palate with a mix of salty, melony flavors along with hints of nut skins and papaya. On the finish, a yeasty flavor softens juicy, nervy acidity and related citrus notes.
Name: Finca Manzanos 2014 Blanco Viura-Chardonnay (Rioja)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: An off-dry blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng, this comes from the French southwest. Named after a sandy beach in the Basque Country, the wine has that cool feel of ocean breezes. Honey and lemon flavors are right up front to give a wine that is both fresh and beautifully fragrant.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2015 Villa Chambre d'Amour White (Vin de France)

Description: Clean, snappy aromas of apple and citrus are sharp but appealing. This fresh, healthy white offers tangerine, nectarine and stony flavors before a crisp, refreshing finish.
Name: Nivarius 2015 Nivei White (Rioja)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of seven varieties with Riesling, Pinot Gris, Viognier, Chardonnay and Gewürztraminer making up the bulk. It starts out reduced before opening to reveal aromas of white flowers, jasmine, lychee and peach. The palate drinks off dry, with a panoply of fruit flavors that provide plenty of easy-drinking pleasure.
Name: Waterbrook 2014 Melange Founder's White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This unusual, deeply golden colored wine doesn't have a very expressive nose but the round, full-bodied palate offers candied lemon drop and white peach. An almond note closes the finish.
Name: Fattoria Coroncino 2013 Gaiospino  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A true wine from southwest France, this brings together grapes from Gascony and Gaillac. It is delicate and fruity. The freshest green-fruit flavors come together with intense acidity and a tang that is poised and crisp.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2015 Villa Grand Cap White (Vin de France)

Description: Somewhat subdued white flower, lime and peach aromas are followed by medium-sweet stone-fruit flavors. It goes down easy.
Name: Dunham 2014 Four Legged White (Washington)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This wine, a blend of Chardonnay and Gros Manning, forms a pair with a Sauvignon Blanc and Muscat blend from the same producer. Here, the style hails from the cooler southwest of France. Bright and crisp, it offers a hint of honey as well as good acidity cutting through to give a refreshing, lively aftertaste.
Name: Gabriel Meffre 2015 Gabriel Chardonnay-Gros Manseng White (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Since this wine comes from a big Rhône producer, it's no surprise the blend is 50% Grenache Blanc. The other 50% is Sauvignon Blanc. It is an effective, balanced medley, with the fat Grenache given a burst of freshness by the Sauvignon. The wine is light, lively and fruity. Drink now.
Name: Gabriel Meffre 2015 La Châsse Sauvignon-Grenache White (Vin de France)

Description: Piercing woody aromas are about all you get on the nose of this barrel-fermented blend of Viura and Tempranillo Blanco. The palate is crisp, tight and resiny, while overtly woody flavors outweigh background white-fruit notes. A resiny flavor is front and center on a barrel-driven finish.
Name: Viña Otano 2014 White (Rioja)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: this full-bodied white wine stresses complexity, weight and viscosity. It smells like blanched almonds and candle wax, and tastes rich, almost heavy.
Name: Naggiar 2014 Vino Bianco White (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Muscat, not often found although working well here. The perfumed Muscat nicely softens the herbal Sauvignon to give a wine that is almost honeyed, certainly attractive as an apéritif.
Name: Gabriel Meffre 2015 Gabriel Sauvignon Blanc-Muscat White (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A blend of Grenache Blanc and Viognier, this is attractive, fruity and perfumed. Touches of apricot balance with the green fruits and herbal edge. It's an easy wine to drink, best as an apéritif.
Name: Cuvée Lion d'Or 2015 White (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Grenache Blanc is light and fresh. Gently fruity, hinting at herbs and citrus and with an easy, open texture, it is a soft quaffing wine. The aftertaste is lightly sweet.
Name: Belle Made For You NV White (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A blend of Colombard and Viognier, this has the lightness and crispness of a wine from the cool southwest vineyards of France. It is herbal, flavored with gooseberries and with tight, mineral acidity. The wine, with its light touch, is ready to drink.
Name: Michel Gassier 2015 A Capella White (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Faint aromas of melon rind, yellow flower and honeycomb lead into the ripe palate of yellow apple and mealy peach. Pithy citrus notes unfold on the surprisingly bitter finish.
Name: Paul Bouchard & Cie NV White (Vin de France)

Description: With light touches of wood aging, this delicate, honeyed wine has all the poise and style of Jurançon, in the foothills of the Pyrénées mountains. Lightly stepping between freshness and rich, ripe, sweet fruitiness, the wine is full of apricot, sweet apple and lime acidity. It is delicious, but it would be a shame for the taste Sébastien and Isabelle Bordenave-Coustarret created not to age it, so drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Coustarret 2012 Le Barou  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This is a rich and luscious wine dominated by Petit Manseng, a small berry/small-yield grape from Gascony, the home of unusual grapes. It's aromatic, ripe and honeyed with ripe peach cut by the pineapple freshness. It's a gorgeous wine now but it really should be aged so drink from 2020.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2011 Foehn  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: While Jurançon wines are sweet, it is the freshness that is beautiful. So there are honey and orange marmalade flavors to give the sweetness and hint at botrytis. Against that is a poised, ethereal acidity and citrus tang. Together they make a beautiful wine that can age. Drink now, but better from 2018.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2011 La Sauvagère  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Situated on 12 acres in the Pyrénées foothills, Sébastien and Isabelle Bordenave-Coustarret could mimic their wine: still young and will age well. With a dominance of Petit Manseng in the blend, this is a lightly honeyed wine even if it is dry. Mangos and apricots are lifted by such fresh acidity and beautiful orange zest tanginess. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Coustarret 2013 Renaissance  (Jurançon Sec)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Yellow rose, honeysuckle and fresh-cut mango scents fly on the nose of this pretty-smelling wine, which is a blend of Chardonnay, Marsanne, Roussanne and Viognier. It is soft and slowly reveals itself on the palate, with honey, spun sugar and an apple-oil edge, showing lots of buttery length and a marzipan finish.
Name: Sanguis 2012 Chinese Fortunes White (Central Coast)

Description: This is principally Pinot Gris, blended with 7% Viognier and 12% other white grapes. Those other grapes are quite aromatic and send up pretty floral aromas immediately. When tasted this also offers a compelling streak of honey, with fruit flavors suggesting orange marmalade. It's not sweet, just fruity, round and quite delicious.
Name: R. Stuart & Co. 2014 Love Oregon White Sky White (Oregon)

Description: Lemon, orange rind and spice lead on the nose of this crisp and poised white blend. The wine offer brisk lemon peel and bright fruit flavors on the palate, tied up with a clean acid finish. This would be delicious with grilled fish or roasted poultry, as well as salty cheeses.
Name: Estate Biblia Chora 2014 White (Pangeon)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: A fascinating blend of Petit Courbu and Petit Manseng this dry wine delivers honey, spice and ripe fruits. Apricots and freshly sliced pears give the wine a rich, generous feel. It comes from a parcel in the Château Bouscassé estate better known for its Madiran red wine. Drink this beautiful wine now.
Name: Alain Brumont 2011 Les Jardins de Bouscassé  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Description: The producer's proprietary blend of 89% Sauvignon Blanc, 10% Chardonnay and 1% Muscat, this wine is fresh and fiery, bright on the palate in apple, Asian pear and jicama, with a dusting of dried herb and ginger as it goes down.
Name: Bennett Lane 2014 Maximus White Feasting Wine White (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a young, gold-colored wine that is more rich than really sweet. It has acidity, ripe apricot and sweet apple flavors that give the wine fresh acidity. The wine is still developing, pushing the ripe fruits through the texture, so don't drink until 2019.
Name: Château Jolys 2014  Jurançon
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Somebody obviously went to Alsace to come up with this blend of Riesling and Gewürztraminer. It does have some botrytis which gives a honeyed character to the wine. It also has wonderful freshness that gives it such a lift and brings out the apricot fruit flavors. Drink now.
Name: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2014 Late Harvest White (Tejo)

Description: When this wine was launched in 1987, it was the first in the region to be fermented in wood. That wood aging has continued. This latest release (Sauvignon Blanc, Mauzac and Muscadelle) by Jean-Marc Balaran gives a beautiful wine that is finely balanced between tightly crisp fruit and smoother, creamy spice and wood flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine d'Escausses 2012 La Vigne de l'Oubli White (Gaillac)

Description: This is a full, spicy and rich wine from the foothills of the Pyrénées mountains, ripe with apricot and plum fruits. There is freshness as well, along with a toasty character that adds complexity. This full-bodied wine can be aged for several years, so drink from 2019.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2014 Cami Salié  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Fresh aromas of citrus, white flowers and exotic fruit are followed by ripe and round flavors of pineapple and preserved lemon. The wine is balanced by good acidity and a clean finish. A dependable everyday wine.
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2014 Amethystos White (Drama)

Description: This well-crafted blend is principally Gewürztraminer, Riesling and Pinot Gris, with a dash of Muscat. It's aromatically inviting, an explosion of citrus fruit and blossom. What follows is a tasty jumble of Meyer lemon, nectarine and pineapple, full, fruity and just plain fun.
Name: Jezebel 2014 White (Oregon)

Description: This is a dry wine that wants to become sweet. It has that edge of honey and apricots typical of dry Jurançon along with the freshest, tangy acidity. With its bright fruit, fine texture and hint of toastiness, it will age and will be better from 2017.
Name: Château Jolys 2014  Jurançon Sec
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: A fresh and ripe blend that brings the richness of Chardonnay and the perfumed Viognier well into focus. It is rich, full of apricot and green plum fruits that are cut by acidity. The name Vin de Lune (moon wine) is a reminder of the time when grapes were harvested at night to avoid detection by the local lord and so escape taxes.
Designation: Clos Triguedina Blanc Sec Vin de Lune
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2014 Clos Triguedina Blanc Sec Vin de Lune Viognier-Chardonnay (Comté Tolosan)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This flavorful blend of Müller-Thurgau, Muscat and Riesling is lightly fizzy, and off dry, with residual sugar listed at 22.5g/L. Citrus fruits are limned with ginger, and it is a thoroughly refreshing and low-alcohol delight.
Name: Season 2014 Transparency White (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: It is the small amount of Chardonnay in the blend that makes this wine. It gives it a smooth, creamy character that is only lightly cut by the more herbal Colombard flavors. The wine is light and refreshingly fruity. It is ready to drink this summer.
Name: Domaine Guillaman 2015 Les Pierres Blanches White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Refreshing lemon and fragrant floral aromas with a touch of mint distinguish this fuller-bodied white from an excellent producer. Softer on the palate with complex and integrated flavors of citrus and mineral, the wine is a good choice for fans of Chardonnay.
Name: Gerovassiliou 2014 White (Epanomi)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: From a single vineyard, this blend of Gros Manseng and Colombard is crisp, lightly herbal and also honeyed. It has apricot fruits that are sliced through with citrus acidity and tangy lemon zest. The wine is still fresh, ready to drink, although it could age until 2020.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2014 Domaine de Cassaigne White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This comes from a complicated blend of Muscadelle, Loin de l'Oeil and Sauvignon Blanc: a touch from both the Mediterranean and the Atlantic. Grapefruit and peach flavors bring out the best of the grapes, giving a wine that is both fresh and ripe. It is bright and tangy at the end. Drink from late 2017.
Name: Domaine d'Escausses 2014 L'Ombre Fraîche White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: It's the lightly honeyed Gros Manseng in the blend with Sauvignon Blanc that works well for this Fezes family wine from northern Gascony. It rounds out the citrus flavors and adds apricot and green plums. The result is an attractive fruity wine that will be better from the end of 2016.
Name: Domaine Chiroulet 2015 Terres Blanches White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Sierra de Salamanca, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This white blend from the Salamanca area relies on local grapes like Palomino and Rufete Blanco. It's almost fruitless on the nose, while the palate feels chunky. High acidity bolsters citrus flavors, while the finish exhibits mild oxidation and a leesy quality. Drink now.
Name: La Zorra 2013 Teso Blanco White (Sierra de Salamanca)

Description: This is a typical blend in Gaillac, combining the broad character of the Loin de l'Oeil with the crisper Sauvignon. It's a fine, ripe wine that is perfumed with white stone fruit and touches of apricot. The wine's full in the mouth although lightly textured. Drink now.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2014 Gouleyant White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a tight, mineral wine from the Tariquet family vineyards that also has a richer side. The blend brings both aspects to a wine that is both fresh and fruity and rounded. Ideally, it should age a few more months until the end of 2016, although it will also be fine to drink this summer.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2015 Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This Basque Country white is quite particular and will not be to everyone's taste. Simple but fresh apple and apricot aromas are clean, while the palate is high in acidity, which is typical for the region. Flavors of blood orange and tangerine finish tart, bracing and angular.
Name: Gorka Izagirre 2014 White (Bizkaiko Txakolina)

Description: A smooth, deliciously drinkable blend of Mauzac and Loin de l'Oeil gives crisp acidity, green fruits and tangy acidity. It's a wine that's fresh and ripe at the same time, a very dry wine that will certainly be best with food. Drink from late 2016.
Name: Domaine des Terrisses 2015 Grande Tradition White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of Chardonnay, Viognier and Marsanne from Rhône grape pioneer Bob Lindquist and partner Charles Banks is a new project focused on entry-level offerings. Steely aromas of lemon oil and pear give way to a plate of buttered apple slices and tart yellow-grapefruit peel, mixing warmth with tang.
Name: Qupé 2014 A Modern White (Central Coast)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This classic blend from the Gascony region is crisply fresh and light, the sort of wine that just dances in the glass. It has a herbal character that is balanced by lemon and grapefruit fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2014 Pigmentum Ugni Blanc-Colombard (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: A ripe, soft wine that has touches of wood from its four months aging in barrel. There is a spicy, perfumed character with apricot and ripe pear flavors. The acidity is well in balance. Drink this attractive wine now.
Name: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2014 Terras do Pó Chardonnay-Viognier (Península de Setúbal)

Description: With some wood aging in French oak, the wine seems to have smoothed out the fruitiness. It is soft with a light spice and hints of green apple. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Scancio Branco Reserva Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This blend of half Gros Manseng and half Sauvignon Blanc is crisp, lightly herbal and with a touch of honeyed pear to give it a ripe taste. It has a refreshing, cool character that's bright and tangy at the end.
Name: Alain Brumont 2015 Brumont White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Pellehaut likes blends and this wine has seven varieties. The result brings out more of the cool herbal character of Colombard and Sauvignon Blanc and less of the riper flavors of Chardonnay. That makes for a surprisingly attractive spice and asparagus flavored wine that has lines of acidity and tightly crisp citrus fruit flavors. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Pellehaut 2015 Harmonie de Gascogne White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A fresh, lightly herbal blend of most of the grapes of Gascony. It is crisp, lemon, currant and grapefruit flavored and bright as a button. The wine is made to be drunk young.
Name: Domaine de Joÿ 2015 L'Eclat White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Produced at the largest family-owned vineyard in France, this is a simple, fruity, immediately attractive wine. There are both citrus and more tropical fruit flavors in the wine, alongside a herbal, grassy touch from the Sauvignon Blanc and Colombard in the blend. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2015 Classic White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A classic blend for Gascony of Colombard and Ugni Blanc produces a bright, fruity wine that is light and crisply fresh. It has white currant and citrus flavors with a herbal edge that gives the wine a tangy texture. Drink now.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2015 Colombelle L'Original White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Eye-watering acidity and an intensely herbal character mark this as a real cool climate wine from some of the highest vineyards in Gascony. It is crisp and so fruity with citrus and apple and tangy with orange zest. Drink now. The Fezas family also makes Armagnac.
Name: Domaine Chiroulet 2015 Java by Chiroulet White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The blend is 60-40, but the grassy, herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc dominates. The Sémillon adds a bit of flesh, and the alcohol burns through the quick finish.
Name: Agate Ridge 2013 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Ribera del Guadiana, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Unusual aromas of mustard, rubbing alcohol, white flowers and lychee are all over the map and unconvincing. This is mostly Viura, and it feels chunky and a bit awkward while tasting cidery and citrusy.
Name: Bodegas Luis Gurpegui Muga 2013 5 Viñas White (Ribera del Guadiana)

Description: Opulent aromas of Stargazer lily, toasted oak and fresh fruit lead this oak-aged white blend. On the palate, spicebox and toasted flavors mingle with citrus in this unique and full-bodied wine.
Name: Stelios Kechris 2014 The Fourth Dimension White (Macedonia)

Description: The blend is 70% Pinot Blanc, with Riesling and Pinot Noir splitting the rest. The winery calls it a “red-style white” and it has some tawny color from five days fermenting on the skins. But it's simply odd, flat and lifeless, with dusty generic fruit.
Name: Copper Belt 2014 Rancher's White (Oregon)

Description: For this critic, this blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay isn't working. For starters, it's severely oaked, such that the palate feels creamy, sticky and heavy. Flavors of oak resin and mushy melon end flat, sticky and cloying.
Name: François Lurton 2014 Hacienda Araucano Clos de Lolol White (Lolol Valley)

Description: Not many white Riojas reach these heights. This youthful Garnacha Blanca opens with tropical aromas of papaya, melon and honey. The palate is whole and fleshy, with welcoming balance. Flavors of spicy oak, lees, vanilla, white peach and melon end long, leesy and with complexity. Drink through 2018.
Name: Contino 2012 Blanco White (Rioja)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with dried Malvasia and Trebbiano grapes, this offers intense aromas of candied fruit and maple syrup. The concentrated palate doles out dried apricot, caramel, pine nut and lavender honey. Fresh acidity brightens the sweet flavors and lends balance.
Name: I Sodi 2008  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sauvignon Blanc makes up three-quarters of this blend with the balance Sémillon. The aromas offer notes of herb, toast, nut oil and star fruit. The elegantly styled flavors of kiwi and spice are creamy in feel with a lingering finish.
Name: DeLille 2014 Chaleur Estate White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: What Baumard describes as a “secret blend” from its vineyards, this wine is both sweet and fresh. Honey and intense acidity are filled out with baked apple and lemon-marmalade flavors. It is ready to drink in all its fresh glory.
Name: Domaine des Baumard NV Le Petit Paon White (Vin de France)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this creative blend of 52% Gewürztraminer, 25% Sauvignon Blanc and 23% Chenin Blanc is quite showy with peach, baked orange, apple blossom and honeysuckle notes. But the real star is the palate that is racy with sizzling energy and flavors of cut grass, lemongrass and sour-apple peels.
Name: Carlson 2014 Trois Fleurs White (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Aromas of lemon custard and pineapple are well-balanced in this blend of 50% Chardonnay, 45% Pinot Gris and 5% Pinot Blanc and the desert-them doesn't stop, as this white offers the palate a medley of crème brûlée, vanilla bean and lemon meringue pie.
Name: Purcari 2013 Alb de Purcari White (Moldova)

Description: The first thing that leaps at you on this oddball blend of Albillo, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier is toasty oak, which overrides spice and apple aromas. In the mouth, this is full, resiny and grabby. Oak-driven flavors of vanilla, lees, peach and white pepper finish long, with elegance and a woody aftertaste.
Name: Valquejigoso 2012 Mirlo Blanco White (Spain)

Description: Tan in color and in the early stages of fading, this smells reserved, with aromas of turpentine, popcorn and bread. Rubbery and slightly pinched in feel, this tastes briny, nutty and melony, with plenty of oak in support. A lighlty oaked finish is short in length and complexity. Drink now.
Name: Clos Mogador 2011 Nelin White (Priorat)

Description: This blend of 40% Furmint, 40% Pinot Gris and 20% Riesling has aromas of pineapple, lychee fruit and fresh herbs. It's thin and racy in the mouth with flavors of mango, apple and guava.
Name: Dveri-Pax 2014 Yanez White (Štajerska)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Supple white-fleshed fruits, from pear to cherimoya, touch the nose, as do aromas of lemon rind, struck match and dried apple on this blend of 90% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Viognier. A gravelly, pencil lead minerality on the palate is boosted by sliced lemon wedges, cut grass and gooseberry notes.
Name: Westerly 2014 Fletcher's White (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: This Icewine is a blend of Muscat, Ottonel and Traminer. It presents the nose with caramelized pineapple, lemon curd and lemon meringue pie. It is fairly sweet on the palate with a mixture of lemon grass, sweet lime rind and lemon curd.
Name: Purcari 2014 Premium Musct Ottonel-Traminer Icewine White (Moldova)

Description: Lemon grass, underripe pineapple and freshly mowed lawn lead to tastes of grapefruit pith and white flowers. It has a strong backbone of minerality and a very slight sweetness on the finish.
Name: Purcari 2014 Vinohora Feteasca Alba-Chardonnay White (Moldova)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Chestnut honey, dried apricot and toasted almond aromas unfold in the glass and carry over to the palate along with hints of baking spice and hazelnut. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on the close.
Name: Fattoria Lavacchio 2009 Riserva  (Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina)

Description: Made from 35% Obeidi, an indigenous grape usually reserved for Arak production, 35% Clairette, 15% Sauvignon Blanc and 15% Chardonnay, this wine is medium straw in the glass and has a nose of peach, Turkish delight and lilac. It is full in the mouth, offering flavors of ripe summer peach, rose petal and eucalyptus. The final moments are punctuated by a delightful blend of soft peach and strong mint flavors.
Name: Massaya 2014 White (Bekaa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sémillon (60%) makes up the majority of this blend followed by Sauvignon Blanc (22%) and Muscadelle. The aromas of wet stone, lees, orange rind and fresh flowers are light and elusive. The palate brings a sense of elegance and balance.
Name: Buty 2014 Sémillon-Sauvignon-Muscadelle White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of citrus, especially white grapefruit and lime, are spunky and sweaty like Sauvignon Blanc or Verdejo. A solid, fleshy palate is home to a mix of citric and tropical flavors, while the finish reverts back to grapefruit, with a monotone feel. This is Macabeo, Garnacha Blanca and Pedro Ximénez.
Name: Marco Abella 2014 Òlbia White (Priorat)

Description: Deep straw to the eye, this wine has a bouquet of lemon curd and apricot. Slightly savory flavors of pear, apricot, lavender and thyme are joined in the finish by the faintest hint of sweetness and a floral note.
Name: Ouled Thaleb 2014 White (Zenata)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Mild aromas of dried stone fruit and maple syrup come together on this full-bodied dessert wine. The sweet, one-dimensional palate delivers dried apricot, acacia honey and a hint of toasted walnut.
Name: Bibbiano 2010 San Lorenzo a Bibbiano  (Vin Santo del Chianti Classico)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intensely fruity, this sun-kissed blend of Chardonnay, Viognier and Sauvignon Blanc bursts of yellow peach and tangerine flavors. It's ripe and weighty on the palate, but finishes brightly on a zesty lemonade streak. Enjoy soon for its youthful exuberance.
Name: Brooklyn Oenology 2014 As If Serendipity White (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Easygoing apple, pear and citrus aromas precede a mild palate that's a touch dilute. Melon, papaya and tropical flavors finish with a sense of lightness. This is 70% Treixadura with Torrontés and other white grapes.
Name: Viña Costeira 2013 White (Ribeiro)

Description: sweet-tart candy, vanilla, and pineapple scent this Traminer and Chardonnay blend. It's zesty in the mouth, tasting of grapefruit and lemon zest.
Name: Bostavan 2014 Dor Traminer-Chardonnay White (Moldova)

Description: This unusual five-grape blend includes Chardonnay, Sémillon, Sauvignon Blanc, Viognier and Muscat. It maintains a sense of focus, with the grassy, herbal character of Sauv Blanc and Sémillon commanding most of the attention. It's stiff, woody (rather than oaky) and herbal. Try it with fresh goat cheese.
Name: Tinhorn Creek 2014 Oldfield Series 2Bench White (Okanagan Valley)

Description: This charming and refreshing wine has aromas like green apples. Richer flavors that suggest white peach accompany a tangy but smooth texture. Light to medium bodied, it is perfect for lunch or pre-dinner drinking.
Name: The White Doe 2013 White (California)

Description: Apple and peach aromas are basic but clean and fresh. So is the palate on this Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc blend. Flavors of nectarine and apple don't stray far from basic, while green apple and citrus flavors are propped up on the finish by racy acidity.
Name: Vicente Gandia 2015 El Miracle 120 Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc (Valencia)

Description: Light, almost neutral aromas are like stream water touched up with lime. This is basic on the palate, but easy to process. Flavors of papaya and melon are a bit leesy, while this Treixadura-Torrontés blend is short on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Campante 2014 White (Ribeiro)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Grass and apple-flesh notes are wrapped in a slightly reductive, oily frame on this blend of 55% Sauvignon Blanc, 18% Loureiro, 15% Verdelho, 7% Grenache Blanc and 5% Chardonnay. The flavors are also a tad tarry, with green-apple peels, lime zest, candied pear and dried grapefruit.
Name: Marianello 2012 Estelle Bianco White (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Sauvignon (64%) comes from Bacchus with the Sémillon from neighboring Dionysus. After starting out slightly reduced, fig and spice aromas lead to tart, lemon and tropical fruit flavors that need more cohesion and concentration to keep them together.
Name: Cloudlift Cellars 2014 Updraft White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Minerally white-fruit aromas lack specificity. This is fresh but standard in feel, with briny flavors of nectarine, apple, citrus pith and nut skins. A dilute finish is fresh but thin. Why this blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Airén and Verdejo costs what it does is beyond comprehension because it smells, tastes and feels generic.
Name: Alcardet 2015 Sommelier Sauvignon Blanc-Airén-Verdejo White (La Mancha)

Description: This three-grape blend includes Sauvignon Blanc, Verdejo and Merseguera. It's gold in color, while heavy and cidery on the nose. A chunky, citrusy palate is globular and tastes of grapefruit, tangerine and salt, while an oily feeling, round finish lacks complexity.
Name: Vicente Gandia 2014 Hoya de Cadenas 130 Anniversary White (Valencia)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This creative blend of 74% Viognier, 19% Chardonnay, 4% Grenache Blanc and 3% Albariño delivers a juicy nose of squeezed orange and peach with tangerine-rind edge and yellow-cake warmth. There's a flash of acidity at first sip, then the flavors dive toward green apples, guava and banana, altogether both ripe and sour.
Name: Quadrant 2013 White (Paso Robles)

Description: Nearing brown in color, this blend of 60% Viognier and 40% Chardonnay is reminiscent of a Old Fashioned cocktail, with orange rind and bourbon notes as well as walnut oil and quinine aromas. A strong hazelnut-oil character shows on the rougher palate, which is thick and oily with dried apricot and more orange peel.
Name: 2Plank 2013 Cold Smoke Viognier-Chardonnay (California)

Description: This wine's peach, melon and flowers aromas are bright. The palate is dry and fleshy with a bitter note that distracts.
Name: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2014 Vivacious White

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. Naturally rich, but with fine acidity and a lift of freshness, this is a ripe and perfumed wine. The honey and orange marmalade flavors are there along with lemon jelly and a sense of structure. It is a balanced, poised wine from a fine vintage.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. This is a magnificent wine with its tight acidity and beautiful citric character. The ripeness of the Sauvignon Blanc is remarkable while, for now, the texture of the wine is all minerality.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. The wine is ripe yet stylish and pure. It has a great balance between bright acidity and rich fruitiness. It is a very fine wine with great aging potential, as it hints at the more opulent future to come.
Name: Château Coutet 2015 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This wine is beautifully ripe yet does not losing the mineral side that is so characteristic of this wine. Pure citrus flavors are forward, cut with tense acidity and an impressive nervy texture.
Name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This wine is packed with dry botrytis flavor, but also a bright freshness. Together they give an obviously sweet wine good structure as well as ripeness. The tension between the fruit and the mineral texture will allow this wine to age for many years.
Name: Château Guiraud 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Rich and opulent, these grapes basked in the ripeness of the year. It is balanced and beautifully perfumed, with citrus and crisp apple acidity, just hinting at wood at the end.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This is opulent and rich, with wonderful gingery spice and layers of acidity and orange zest. The wine is full of pure, clean and ripe fruit flavors.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2015 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: This marks another stunning vintage for this blend of 55% Sémillon, 25% Muscadelle, 10% Palomino and 10% Colombard, made by Zin master Mike Officer. Pungent in pear and pineapple, it has cutting-edge minerality, a taste of slate, and remains at turns creamy and crisp on the palate. This wine is unusual in all the right ways yet triumphantly delicious.
Name: Carlisle 2013 The Derivative White (Sonoma County)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Ripe and full, this wine is also finely balanced. Its generous yellow and white stone fruits are cut with tight acidity and an intense fragrance. It will age well.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This rich wine is opulent, spicy and full of the richest orange jelly and marmalade flavors. The acidity that shows so well this year is what sets this wine on track to a beautiful future.
Name: Château de Fargues 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. The wood is showing strongly here, giving a layer of spice to the generous perfumed fruit. It is going to be a rich, full wine, packed with fruit.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This wine is just beginning to show its possibilities. It has a dry botrytis character along with lemon and other citrus fruits. They are packed in a sweet dried-apricot and lemon-jelly flavored texture. The wine will age impressively.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. While it is a little subdued at this stage, it is obvious that this will be an opulent, rich and generous wine. Hints of pear and yellow fruits are cut with tight citrus at the end.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. There is a beautiful straight line of crispness in this wine. It cuts right through the wood and ripe yellow fruits to leave a wine with great clarity.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. There is a great balance between the spicy wood and the rich fruits that show off the ripe vintage. This is a wine that is poised, concentrated and ready to age.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This wine is light, bright and floral in character. It is full of wonderful lemon-jelly flavors that are cut by delicious acidity. It is a balanced, fresh and crisp selection that finishes with a fine pairing of acidity and sweetness.
Name: Château Nairac 2015 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This is a fragrant, fruity wine. It has dried apricot and bitter orange flavors along with plenty of acidity. The texture is tangy, hinting at minerality, while the aftertaste is what brings out the sweetness and final richness of the wine.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This wine is pure Sémillon, with gorgeous hints of orange as well as riper yellow fruits. It is a precise wine, pointed beautifully with highlights of crisp apple and acidity.
Designation: Pavillon Blanc de Château Margaux Barrel Sample
Name: Château Margaux 2015 Pavillon Blanc de Château Margaux Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Luscious while still showing great balance, this is a fine wine. It has ripe orange and lemon flavors that are never too sweet. Acidity cuts through the texture, lifting the wine and giving it a brilliant, elegant aftertaste.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: Stone, earth and hay are about to merge into notions of lanolin and chamomile: clearly this is a maturing wine at an early point of its evolution. The palate is fluid and has the texture of drenched chalky, stone. The fruit is hiding in the wings, only to appear as orange oil here or as apple scent there. The dryness shows every nuance of this earthy, wine from a historic, co-planed vineyard of Riesling, Pinot Gris and Gewurztraminer. What a triumph. Drink 2016–2026.
Designation: Osterberg Grand Cru Clos du Zahnacker
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2009 Osterberg Grand Cru Clos du Zahnacker White (Alsace)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Green and herbal in character, this crisp wine just touches on a riper yellow fruit character. It will develop with fine straight fruit definition.
Name: Château Olivier 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. There is a bitter orange-marmalade disposition here. It gives a sense of dryness to the otherwise sweet and sour character of this balanced wine. It is perfumed and likely to age well.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Finely balanced, this shows great style and breeding. If it seems at first to be ready to drink now, what is behind, in the wood and structure, says otherwise. The fruit quality is straight, crisp and perfumed.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Round and rich, this is a full-bodied wine. It has plenty of sweet flavors that are cut by ample acidity. It also has weight and density. It's a luscious wine in the making.
Name: Château de Malle 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This is a ripe, strongly citrus and spice-dominated wine. The touches of wood are well judged to add richness without losing sight of the fruit.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: A blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon, Ribolla Gialla, Malvasia and Picolit, this stunning wine offers enticing scents of wildflower, citrus and ripe orchard fruit. The radiant palate delivers white peach, lemon zest, yellow apple and mineral while bright acidity provides impeccable balance. Drink through 2020.
Name: Jermann 2012 Vintage Tunina White (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Rich and smooth, this amber-colored wine is a blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon, Pinot Grigio and Riesling Italico. Fermented in amphorae and aged for six years in oak casks, it boasts a fascinating assortment of flavors, ranging from mature apricot to ginger. Its structure and velvety texture make it a perfect mediation wine. Drink through 2022.
Name: Gravner 2007 Bianco Breg White (Venezia Giulia)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Fine acidity cuts through this wine's rich structure and botrytis flavors. It is very crisp, clean and purely fruited. The lemon jelly flavor and bright acidity are delicious now.
Name: Château Laville 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This is a rich wine that has a generous full-bodied character. At the same time, the acidity is there, offering some beautiful spice and ginger. This is going to develop so well.
Name: Château Raymond-Lafon 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This is a light wine with fine acidity and a young texture that brings in both botrytis and gingery spice flavors. The wine is already delicious, but the tight texture will allow it to age well.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This second wine comes from both La Mission Haut-Brion and Haut-Brion white parcels. This is a fine and ripe while also showing an herbal character. Citrus and yellow fruits work in harmony.
Designation: La Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2015 La Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Beeswax, acacia and yellow stone fruit aromas mingle in the glass. The structured, delicious palate doles out tangerine, lime, yellow peach, lemon drop and a hint of almond. An energizing mineral note closes the tangy finish.
Name: Borgo del Tiglio 2013 Studio di Bianco White (Collio)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Freshness is the hallmark of this wine. Of course, there is sweetness, but at the same time, the lemon and bitter orange flavors are shot through by lively acidity. It is a perfumed wine that will age well over the medium-term.
Name: Château Lamothe Guignard 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: A blend of 51% Palomino and 49% Chenin Blanc, this is a pure and mineral-driven wine, with superb verve to the clean aromas and flavors of apple flesh, white peach, orange glossom, almond skin and minty fynbos. It's balanced and complex, with layered notes of roasted nuts, honeysuckle, toasted apple skin and sweet spice all mingling harmoniously. Delicious now, but will hold well through 2020.
Name: Sadie Family 2012 Skerpioen White (Swartland)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. The wine is smooth, rounded and hinting at wood while also suggesting tight herbal and citric characters. It is a wine that will develop slowly.
Name: Château Couhins-Lurton 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: A rather perfumed nose hints at the Gewurztraminer that colors this Riesling with rose petal and honeysuckle notes. The co-planted varieties in this vineyard make a smashing duo since they are almost polar opposites: structured, straight-laced Riesling with its fine spine of acidity benefits from the playfulness and charm of aromatic, fleshy Gewurztraminer which in turn is lit up by Riesling's freshness. Really, this is a case where you can have the best of both worlds.
Name: Biecher & Schaal 2014 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru White (Alsace)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. At first taste, this seems like an easy, open wine. The structure and the dry botrytis flavors emerge slowly from the generous texture. The end effect is a wine that will develop quickly and then mature gracefully.
Name: Château de Myrat 2015 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: This elegantly structured blend of Pinot Bianco, Friulano, Sauvignon and Ribolla Gialla delivers aromas that suggest white flower, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of tomato leaf. The fresh, balanced palate shows grapefruit, apricot, lemon drop and mineral alongside bright acidity.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2012 Col Disôre White (Collio)

Description: Aromas of fragrant white flower, peach, chopped herb and exotic fruit lead reveal themselves on this radiant blend of Chardonnay, Ribolla Gialla and Sauvignon. The structured, focused palate offers Golden Delicious apple, nectarine zest and mineral while crisp acidity provides the elegant framework.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2013 Bratinis White (Collio)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is ripe, with rich orange-marmalade flavors that are happily cut by bright acidity. It is a beautifully generous wine, with a sharp squirt of lemon at the end.
Name: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. The wine is big and ripe, with spicy undertones and piercing acidity that keeps everything fresh. It is opulent yet lively.
Name: Domaine de l'Alliance 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: It's rare to find a Sémillon in Portugal, let along the Alentejo. And yet the wine works beautifully. Wood aging has given it sophistication while the natural creamy texture of the grape is enhanced by the ripe yellow fruits that are lightly lifted by a herbal, citrus aftertaste. This wine could well age, so drink now or, better, keep until 2017.
Name: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Esporão Private Selection White White (Alentejano)

Description: Made with 80% Chardonnay and 20% Friulano, this amber-colored wine boasts more fruit richness than many other wines from the orange wine movement. Loaded with ripe apricot, candied citrus zest, dried herbs and crushed stone, this is brightened by lively acidity on the palate. A perfect introduction to the genre; Drink now–2016.
Name: Radikon 2012 Slatnik White (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Aromas of toast, candied nectarine zest and vanilla open on this blend of Pinot Bianco, Friulano, Sauvignon and Ribolla Gialla. The savory palate offers mature Golden Delicious apple, apricot and butterscotch alongside bright acidity.
Name: Primosic 2010 Klin White (Collio)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Crisp and herbal, this bright wine that has touches of ginger, as well as more tropical fruits. It is a very fine wine, fresh while rich.
Name: Château Cos d'Estournel 2015 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is crisp, herbal and full of green and citrus fruits. It is tangy and juicy at the end.
Name: Château Couhins 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Intensely floral on the nose, this is a blend of 70% Pinot Grigio grown in Carneros, 15% Traminer also grown in Carneros, and 15% Moscato giallo from Lodi, which the producer has previously employed in delightful wines of its own. Lilting and bright, it has substance behind the equal balance of fruit and spice, offering a taste of lemony ginger and pear.
Name: Uvaggio 2014 Zelo Bianco White (Carneros-Napa Valley)

Description: Made with Friulano, Pinot Bianco, Sauvignon, Malvasia and Ribolla Gialla, this structured white opens with enticing aromas of candied citrus zest, light oak, chopped herb and almond. The firm palate offers baked apple, nectarine, coconut, toast, vanilla and a confectionary note.
Name: Livio Felluga 2012 Abbazia di Rosazzo  (Rosazzo)

Description: Lush and toasty, this blend of 45% Chenin Blanc, 20% Grenache Blanc, 17% Roussanne, 9% Chardonnay and 9% Viognier is complex yet balanced. Scents of toasted apple, pear, beeswax, almond and brioche frame the nose, while the palate offers additional notes of clove-spiked orange and lemon custard. Ample acidity lifts the smooth mouthfeel and sweet-spiced finish. Drink now–2018.
Name: Fable Mountain 2012 Jackal Bird White (Western Cape)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine is almost dry in character, with some bitter edges. The weight of the palate gives the wine a sense of strength and power.
Name: Château Liot 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine shows the rich character of Sémillon, cut with attractive, herbal Sauvignon Blanc. It is lively, crisp and succulent.
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2015 Aile d'Argent Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Made with Friulano, Pinot Bianco and Sauvignon, this opens with aromas of pressed flower, ripe orchard fruit, nut and a whiff of citrus. The linear palate offers toasted oak, mature apricot and candied orange zest. It closes on a note of bitter almond.
Name: Livio Felluga 2012 Terre Alte  (Rosazzo)

Description: A blend of 70% Friulano, 15% Ribolla Gialla and 15% Malvasia, this is perfumed with scents suggesting yellow flower, apple, citrus fruit and hazelnut. The vibrant palate is loaded with verve and finesse, offering peach, Golden Delicious apple, sage, fennel and a hint of candied tangerine zest. A note of bitter almond closes the tangy finish.
Name: Edi Keber 2014 White (Collio)

Description: Grapefruit, toast, orchard fruit and crushed rock aromas all come together on this radiant wine. On the palate, crisp acidity supports yellow apple, almond, citrus zest and mineral.
Name: Fantinel 2013 Tenuta Sant'Elena Frontiere White (Collio)

Description: Scents of chamomile, tropical fruit and citrus zest lead the nose on this vibrant blend of Friulano, Chardonnay and Sauvignon. The structured, savory palate offers layers of yellow peach, candied lemon drop, nut and mineral alongside bright acidity that leaves a tangy finish.
Name: Collavini 2013 Broy Bianco White (Collio)

Description: Made with a blend of native grapes Ribolla Gialla, Malvasia and Friulano, this opens with scents of mature peach, baked apple, candied citrus zest and aromatic herb. The structured palate offers yellow apple, ripe apricot and toasted almond underscored by a touch of ginger. A mineral note closes the finish.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2009 Riserva White (Collio)

Description: Compelling scents of white spring flower, stone fruit and a whiff of nut weave throughout this blend of Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon and Pinot Grigio. The vibrant palate delivers yellow apple, orange zest, almond and mineral alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Zuani 2014 Vigne White (Collio)

Description: This Chenin Blanc-based white, with 13% Clairette Blanc and 7% Viognier, boasts a harmonious blend of fruit and floral tones throughout. Scents of underripe tropical fruit, green plum, apple and lime peel are kissed with hints of rose petal, ginger and honeysuckle, while the medium-weight palate boasts ripe flavors of green melon and fleshy pear. A hint of white pepper and minty fynbos lingers on the clean finish. Drink now–2019.
Name: Mullineux 2013 Old Vines White (Swartland)

Description: This structured blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon, Picolit and Moscato Giallo offers aromas of toasted oak, ginger and orchard fiuit. The elegant palate combines Golden Delicious apple, mature apricot, oak-driven spice and candied nectarine alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Livon 2013 Braide Alte White (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: A blend of Friulano, Malvasia and Ribolla Gialla, this opens with scents of Spanish broom, beeswax and honey. The elegantly structured palate offers yellow apple, pear, bitter almond and mineral alongside bright acidity. It's a nice combination of flavor and finesse.
Name: Castello di Buttrio 2013 Mon Blanc White (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This is a ripe and generous wine. It is opulent and full-bodied, with flavors or orange jenny, ginger and other baking spice.
Name: Clos Dady 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: There's a layered complexity to this interesting blend of 47% Viognier, 32% Chenin Blanc, 18% Roussanne and 3% Grenache Blanc, with a beautiful interplay between the fruity notes of citrus peel, tart melon, green apple and plum and the earthy tones of fynbos, almond skin and sweet baking spice. The plush texture is countered by ample acidity, leading into a clean finish that's laced with toasty accents. Drink now–2018.
Name: Fairview 2013 Nurok White (Paarl)

Description: This oxidized, woody white displays Sherry aromas of flor and peanut buttter, but little to no fruit. Crisp acidity corrals the palate, while barrel-driven flavors are front and center, and once again, fruit is hard to find. Overall, this is stylistically iconoclastic, but the execution is good. Drink through 2022.
Name: Honoratus 2008 Aurum Crianza White (Rioja)

Description: This organic bottling, made by the winery's former Winemaker Craig Hawkins (who now spearheads his own brand, Testalonga), is a blend of 54% Chenin Blanc, 31% Viognier and 15% Chardonnay. There's an immediately attractive richness to the nose, thanks to upfront notes of beeswax, honeysuckle, Asian pear, yellow apple and a touch of guava. The medium-weight mouthfeel is surprisingly direct and clean, with tart white fruit and pure citrus tones that carry through to the bright finish. Drink now–2018.
Name: Lammershoek 2013 LAM White (Swartland)

Description: This linear white offers aromas of chamomile flower, chopped herb and a whiff of citrus. On the palate, bright acidity supports lemon drop, thyme, almond and sage. An energizing mineral note closes the finish.
Name: La Rajade 2013 Caprizzi Riserva White (Collio)

Description: Alluring scents of orchard fruit, nut and lemon drop lead the nose on this blend of Pinot Bianco, Friulano and Malvasia. The bright palate shows chopped herb, yellow apple, herb and mineral alongside vibrant acidity. A hint of almond signals the finish.
Name: Ronco dei Tassi 2014 Fosarin White (Collio)

Description: Made with Chardonnay, Ribolla Gialla and Sauvignon, this opens with aromas of beeswax, acacia flower and yellow apple. The bright palate offers peach, pear, nectarine zest and mineral alongside vibrant acidity. It's racy but balanced.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2014 Bràtinis White (Collio)

Description: A blend of 48% Viognier, 41% Chenin Blanc and 11% Grenache Blanc, this medium-weight wine offers ripe fruit aromas and flavors of Anjou pear, peach and orange rind that are complemented by notes of fennel, mentholated fynbos and ginger. Medium acidity cuts through the rich mouthfeel, with a lasting kiss of toasted spice on the close. Drink now.
Name: Boekenhoutskloof 2014 The Wolftrap Viognier-Chenin Blanc-Grenache Blanc White (Western Cape)

Description: Baked vanilla entirely dominates the nose, underneath lurks a citric, lemony freshness that pervades a rich, vanilla-scented and almost unctuous palate. This is an unusual blend of Pinot Gris and Riesling—perfuming the roundness of the former with the freshness of the latter.
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2014 Steinert Grand Cru White (Alsace)

Description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Sweet citrus flavors and spice are lifted by vibrant acidity. It is a ripe wine, reflecting the vintage, with its lively acidity and tight, mineral finish.
Name: Le Nardian 2015 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This deeply hued wine opens with aromas of toast, roasted coffee bean and butterscotch. The palate delivers lemon drop, baked Golden Delicious apple, custard, tangerine zest and vanilla while a walnut note closes the finish. Drink sooner rather than later.
Name: La Castellada 2009 Bianco della Castellada White (Collio)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: A ripe wine that shows strong flavors of Chenin Blanc in the blend. That gives a nutty character to the wine while there is also a delicious lively freshness. The wine is bursting with energy, fresh and fruity finishing with tight acidity.
Name: Bouvet-Ladubay NV Excellence Brut Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Crémant de Loire)

Description: This blend of 50% Friulano, 25% Sauvignon and 25% Malvasia opens with aromas of apple, crushed rock, chamomile flower and a whiff of tomato vine. The tense, tangy palate offers white peach, citrus zest, fennel and mineral. An almond note accents the finish.
Name: Bracco 2013 La Mont-Brach White (Collio)

Description: Buoyantly tropical, this fragrant Riesling and Müller-Thurgau blend bursts from the glass with sweet, succulent mango, pineapple and melon flavors. Off dry in style, it's concentrated and juicy yet elegantly structured. The finish is full of kick and liveliness. Drink now through 2017.
Name: Karl Josef 2014 Piesporter Michelsberg White (Mosel)

Description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This wine is ripe and full of sugar that is just mitigated by the drier botrytis flavors. It is fresh, with a toffee aftertaste and a pleasant profile that's easy to enjoy now.
Name: Château Filhot 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: Made with Malvasia, Ribolla Gialla and Friulano, this offers aromas of toast, oak, white flower and almond. The linear palate delivers lemon drop, vanilla and Golden Delicious apple accompanied by bright acidity.
Name: Muzic 2014 White (Collio)

Description: Beeswax, yellow apple skin and acacia aromas lead the nose. The linear palate shows Kaiser pear, citrus zest, almond, toast and vanilla. A honeyed mineral note closes the finish.
Name: Marco Felluga 2013 Molamatta White (Collio)

Description: This wine offers aromas of pineapple, melon and rose petal. It is soft on the palate, with flavors of pear, toasted pineapple and Turkish delight. The finish is marked by a touch of bright kiwi flavor and lingering florals.
Name: Segal's 2014 Fusion White (Galilee)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: A blend of Pinot Bianco, Chardonnay and Picolit, this offers muted scents of wildflower, toasted oak and orchard fruit. The palate offers oak-driven vanilla, butterscotch, candied nectarine and yellow apple skin.
Name: Livio Felluga 2013 Illivio White (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an unusual commingling of mostly Rhone varieties, a mix of 75% Viognier, 12% Roussanne and 12% Marsanne, with the addition of 3% Sémillon. Honeycomb and Nilla wafer rise from the nose before a medium-bodied swirl of sour lemon, grapefruit and yuzu give it tartness on the finish.
Name: Martin Ray 2014 The Tower White (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This opens with aromas that recall white almond, walnut and graphite. Made with 50% Friulano, 40% Chardonnay and 10% Sauvignon, the svelte palate offers yellow apple skin, grapefruit, almond and mineral. A hint of lemon drop backs up the finish.
Name: Ronco Blanchis 2013 White (Collio)

Description: Made with a blend of Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon and Pinot Grigio, this opens with aromas of toasted oak and vanilla. The lean palate offers yellow apple skin, pineapple and mineral alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Zuani 2013 Riserva White (Collio)

Description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. This wine is more dry than sweet, with a big dose of dry botrytis. Bright acidity and lemon zest give the wine freshness, finishing clean.
Name: Château de Veyres 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Made with Friulano, Chardonnay and Sauvignon, this offers scents of wildflower, beeswax and ripe orchard fruit. The structured palate offers bitter almond, yellow apple skin, acacia honey and mineral. It still has fresh acidity but drink soon to capture the remaining fruit richness.
Name: Castello di Buttrio 2011 Torre Butria Riserva White (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Citrusy aromas of lemon and grapefruit show a leesy side note. This blend of 50% Verdejo, 30% Viura and 20% Sauvignon Blanc is pithy and citric on the palate, with flavors of lemon, green apple and orange peel that carry onto a lasting, healthy finish.
Name: Naia 2014 Las Brisas White (Rueda)

Description: Melon, peach and tropical fruit aromas share the bouquet on this Malvasia-Xarello blend. A crisp, citrusy palate is lean, while tangerine, lime and melon flavors finish bright, with a moderate level of stony minerality.
Name: Torelló 2014 Malvarel-lo White (Penedès)

Description: Aromas of white flower, crushed herb, fennel and cut grass emerge on this vibrant white. The bright palate shows citrus zest, mint and mineral alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Fiegl 2013 Leopold White (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: A blend of Friulano and Ribolla Gialla, this opens with aromas of citrus, peach and almond. The bright palate offers yellow apple, lime and mineral alongside bright acidity. A bitter almond note closes the finish.
Name: La Tunella 2014 Biancosesto White (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: This white has aromas of hay, adhesive bandage and crushed rock along with a vegetal note. The lean palate shows grapefruit, bitter almond and medicinal herb alongside racy acidity.
Name: Tenuta di Angoris 2013 White (Collio)

Description: A bouquet of melon, peach and lemon zest sets the stage for flavors of pink grapefruit, lemon-lime sorbet and lemon curd. It is bright and refreshing on the palate, and the finish is surprisingly cool for an otherwise zippy wine.
Name: Pelter 2013 Matar Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Galilee)

Description: Basic citrus aromas lean towards grapefruit. This blend of 70% Godello with Treixadura and Albariño feels fresh and snappy, with bracing acidity. Briny flavors of white grapefruit and tangerine finish fresh and cleansing. Drink immediately.
Name: Peza do Rei 2014 White (Ribeira Sacra)

Description: Aromas of peach pit are neutral except for some oily notes. This multigrape blend feels plump, oily and propped up by solid acidity. Pithy flavors of grapefruit and melon are slightly bitter on the finish.
Name: Huguet de Can Feixes 2014 Blanc Selecció White (Penedès)

Description: Grapefruit and other citrus aromas are zesty but standard. That's also how the palate comes across: citric and juicy, but average. Flavors of orange and tangerine finish fresh but continue the one-note theme.
Name: La Gitana 2014 Rosa Nautica White (Rioja)

Description: A mostly neutral bouquet shows mild notes of almond and apple, but little more. Flavorwise, this delivers modest almond and papaya flavors in front of a wan, nutty tasting finish.
Name: Vega Sindoa 2014 Viura-Chardonnay White (Navarra)

Description: Citrus and floral aromas are mild. This blend of Viura and Chardonnay feels round and chunky, but hardly stocky. Bland flavors of orange and grapefruit fall off on the finish.
Name: Las Valles 2014 Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Leesy, yeasty aromas include saline but not much fruit. This is chunky but soft and low in acidity. Briny, pickled citrus flavors finish similarly.
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2014 Protocolo White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Like certain Rieslings, this smells a lot like gasoline. In the mouth, this Chardonnay-Xarello blend is narrow and scouring. Bitter, nutty flavors of generic white fruits finish waxy.
Name: Albet I Noya 2013 Petit Albet White (Penedès)

Description: Aromatically, this is pretty bad. It smells unclean and dirty. A shearing, cutting palate is high in acid, while sour, pickled flavors of citrus and apple finish briny.
Name: Ochoa 2014 Viura-Chardonnay White (Navarra)

Description: Vague melon aromas are strange at best and offputting at worst. This blend of 70% Chardonnay and 30% Moscatel is watery and suggestive of cantaloupe juice. Funky, mushy white-fruit flavors are tough to wade through.
Name: Bodegas San Valero 2014 Particular White (Cariñena)

Description: The production is tiny, yet the potential of this wine is enormous, with its tight, textured structure that is still so young. It is opulent and generous while still keeping a tight rein on its emotions. A steely core is surrounded by fruit that has hints of apricots as well as citrus. This will be a very fine wine but it needs many years, so wait until 2022.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2013  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This is finely structured, a tense wine with great fruits and an intense texture. It's tight while bursting with fruit. The structure is complex, dense and very mineral in character. It is a wine that will need many years, so drink from 2022. The production is tiny, and what is not fit for this wine goes into the Dillon Clarté wine.
Name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2013  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This is a beautiful wine, fresh with acidity and structured with a mineral texture. Layers of creamy citrus and white fruit flavors go along with touches of wood aging that are well integrated. It's a wine to drink for its freshness soon, although it will also benefit from several years aging. It will be best from 2018.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2013  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This wine is concentrated, dense and has superb acidity and fresh white fruits. Crisp apples, pears and spice from the wood aging are all there. Made with 90% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Sémillon, this is a wine for the long haul, so, if you can, wait until 2020 before drinking. Bonnet family owners are in the mix; Michel Rolland consults.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2013  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This ripe and rich wine balances its wood-aging flavors with its ripe tropical fruits. Pineapple, apricots and delicious acidity are all present. It will be a rich and delicious wine, but needs time, so drink from 2020. The first harvest at this château was in 1252. The property is now owned by Bernard Magrez, a wine, art, culture and gastronomy patron.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2013  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Fresh citrus and tangy orange give this perfumed wine both fruitiness and a tight, mineral texture. It has enough structure to age; drink from 2018. This bottling is a blend of second-level white grapes from two Domaine Dillon properties: Château Haut-Brion and Château La Mission Haut-Brion, both in Pessac-Léognan.
Name: Domaine Clarence Dillon 2013 La Clarté de Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: This fresh, crisp wine hovers attractively between crisp, herbal Sauvignon and riper yellow fruits. Touches of wood adds richness to this already-drinkable wine. Drink now or better, from 2017.
Name: Château Margaux 2013 Pavillon Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Lifted, fragrant notes of honeyed, botrytised passion fruit swirl on the nose. The palate is of an intense sweetness cut by a razor-sharp freshness of candied lemon peel and lemon confit. These extremes of sweet and tart create a compelling tension that is played out in ever-recurring waves. There is a wonderful purity to this. It is luscious now but will age slowly and beautifully. Drink now and over the coming decade.
Name: Neumeister 2013 Saziani Trockenbeerenauslese White (Südoststeiermark)

Description: Still tight and closed up, this wine has potential, offering ripe citrus and white fruits and nervy, tangy texture. Concentrated and dense, it's a wine for the long term; drink from 2020. Olivier is a large medieval hunting estate that, since the 19th century, has belonged to the Bethmann family. The 148 acres of vines and forests are managed environmentally.
Name: Château Olivier 2013  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A very creamy nose hovers over a herb-spiced apple palate, the nutty oak flavors are still obvious and will take a little time to become subdued, but the fruity, savory core of this wine is built to last and presents an unusual but dependable, friendly and durable counterpoint to all manner of foods. Don't miss this individualistic treat which was fermented on its skins.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2013 Gemischter Satz Herr Bernhardt White (Niederösterreich)

Description: The normally so rich Rosengartl comes in a much more slender body for the 2014 vintage, with zesty relish even. Here and there are glimpses of opulence, in the shadows of pleasantly bitter honeycomb that also contributes to a beautifully defined, linear texture on the midpalate. The finish is whistle-clean. Bravo.
Name: Wieninger 2014 Rosengartl Gemischter Satz White (Vienna)

Description: Ripe and tropical, this full-bodied wine conveys mango, quince and ripe white peach that accompany a rich texture. It's going to develop relatively quickly, so drink from 2018. Winemaker Stephan Carrier returned from Napa to take over winemaking after Irish businessman Lochlann Quinn bought the property in 2001. A new winery and barrel cellar opened in 2011. Hubert de Boüard of Château Angelus consults with Carrier. Fieuzal's newsletter is an accurate report on harvests.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2013  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Strong herbal aromas continue to the palate, with green fruits plus a tangy acidity that is fresh and hints of more tropical fruits to come. It's a rich wine that has great potential, so drink from 2019. This is one of several properties owned by Bordeaux vigneron André Lurton.
Name: Château Couhins-Lurton 2013  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This wine is all herbal fruits, with spice from the wood-aging and lively acidity. It has considerable potential, full of its nervy texture, minerality and tight acidity. Wait at least into 2020. Tristan and Loïc Kressmann now run the family estate.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2013  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This wood-aged wine, one of the château's top white cuvées, needs to age.
