There is a delicious steely edge as well as great acidity at the end. The wine is a blend from vineyards planted with 60% Sauvignon blanc, 30% Sémillon and 10% Muscadelle. The estate has been in the Le Grix de la Salle family for 100 years.
Name: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Zestiness pervades nose and palate: this is so citric and fresh that grapefruit peel is the chief marker. This typical Thermenregion blend of its two indigenous white grapes, Zierfandler and Rotgipfler, shows briskness throughout and will deliver welcome, clean-cut refreshment on a hot day. Drink soon.
Name: Gebeshuber 2014 Klassik White (Thermenregion)

Description: Bright, crisp and fruity, this is a classic white Bordeaux. It is fresh with just a touch of herbaceousness, followed by a riper orange and green plum character. The aftertaste brings in spice as well as fruity acidity. Produced by Crus et Domaines de France.
Name: Château Fonfroide 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Muscadelle blend is rounded and ripe, with yellow fruit flavors to go with the fresher acidity. It shows the ripe, tropical side of the Sauvignon Blanc—rich and full in the mouth. Drink from early 2016.
Name: Château Borie de Noaillan 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Ripe green and white fruits give a fresh while warm character to this wine. An herbaceous element brings in a more tangy character. It is fresh at the end, very fruity while still young. Drink from late 2015. Produced by Grands Chais de France.
Name: Mademoiselle Comédie 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Very slight hints of fresh pear peel on nose and palate are joined by fresh lemon concentration on the palate. Chardonnay in the blend provides midpalate texture and with a bit of air there also are notions of riper, jucier yellow pear. Not a showy but rather subtle and light-bodied. Will work on its own or as a versatile accompaniment on the table.
Name: Höpler 2014 Pannonica White (Burgenland)

Description: Full of acidity, this is also a really fruity 100% Sauvignon Blanc. Great citrus and green apple flavors go with a mineral edge and a final fresh, crisp aftertaste. Drink from late 2015.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine is crisp and packed with both acidity and lively citrus fruits, balanced between fruit and freshness. It makes a good apéritif wine, light and very much in balance. The mostly red-wine property, owned by Régis and Hervé Grandeau, sits on a slope above the Right Bank of the Garonne River only four miles from Bordeaux city.
Name: Château Lauduc 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Steel and nervy mineralogy are the hallmarks of this wine at this stage. It's still waiting for the fruit to develop, but expect crisp citrus and succulent apples. The aftertaste, tensely fresh now, should soften as the wine develops. This 90% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Sémillon blend comes from the estate's small vineyard on the slope near Cadillac.
Name: Château Boisson 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The Queyren family's 100 years in the wine business makes good use of its Entre-Deux-Mers' vineyard of 80% Sauvignon Blanc and 20% Sémillon. This is a wine with some wood aging, giving spice and ripe yellow fruits in balance. A strong line of acidity cuts through this warmer, toasty character to leave an aftertaste of fresh citrus.
Name: Château Pilet 2014 Les Hauts de Massonne  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc (65%) and Sémillon comes from Sagemoor, Boushey and Klipsun vineyards. It starts out barrel-forward with aromas of char and toast followed by citrus oil, spice and herbs. The concentration of the tropical fruit flavors is light and elegant but shows pleasing nuances and a good sense of balance.
Name: DeLille 2013 Chaleur Estate White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Ripe and fruity, this wine brings out apricot and pear flavors. It is rounded, full of fruit as well as balanced acidity. It is ready to drink but will be better from late 2015. The vineyard, about two-thirds old-vine Sémillon and one-third Sauvignon Blanc, tends to be harvested during cool mornings.
Name: Chateau Haut Rian 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a soft wine, ripe with lime and grapefruit flavors that are sweetened with juicy red apple. It's tangy as well, laced with orange zest and filled with steely acidity. It should age a few months, so drink from late 2015.
Name: Château la France 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Tight and tangy, this is the epitome of an herbaceous wine. Packed with fruit, it is just emerging into a rounder, fuller future, conveying great acidity along with hints of richer yellow and white fruits. Drink from early 2016.
Name: Chateau les Tuilleries 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is half Viognier with the rest Grenache Blanc and Roussanne. It offers aromas of almond, lees and peach. It's unctuous in feel but lighter in style with a touch of bitterness that distracts.
Name: Goose Ridge 2013 Estate Bottled GRV White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: As its name, boisé, suggests this is a wood-aged white. That gives the wine richness and definite tastiness while keeping plenty of room for the freshest green and citrus fruits and crisp sliced apple. It should be kept a few months, so drink from 2016.
Name: Maison Bouey 2014 Maison Blanche Boisé  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: With green plum and crisp citrus, this is a deliciously fruity wine. A touch of spice accompanies attractive acidity and a fragrant, perfumed aftertaste. Drink from early 2016. This family estate of oenologue, consultant and Bordeaux university wine professor Denis Dubourdieu produces white wines from 87% Sauvignon Blanc and 13% Sémillon vineyards. He is in the process of abandoning chemicals in the vineyards.
Name: Château Reynon 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: There is an unusually high (40%) proportion of Sémillon in the blend, which offers the possibility of aging. Although this wine is fresh, lemony and tightly herbaceous now, it will become more rich and the flavors will deepen. Drink from the end of 2016.
Name: Château les Pasquets 2014  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This perfumed wine discloses hints of apricots and white peaches as well as ripe lime juice. It is balanced, fruity with a good touch of minerality to give texture. The aftertaste is all about fresh fruits that will soften over the next few months. Produced by the Ducourt family, first in Bordeaux in 1858 and now one of the largest independent producers in the region. Philippe Ducourt handles the vineyards and Jérémy Ducourt makes this wine.
Name: Château Larroque 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a spicy wine, but it is more about ripe fruits, apricot and peach as well as a twist of lemon. The aftertaste is fresh and fruity. The Queyren family's 100 years in the wine business makes good use of its Entre-Deux-Mers' vineyard of 80% Sauvignon Blanc and 20% Sémillon.
Name: Château Pilet 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Still young, this wine is showing intense herbaceous characteristics that need to soften. Plenty of fruit between the texture needs to fill out. Hints of apples, pears and quince are all there. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Roquefort 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Crisp green apple and lime zest aromas form the entry of this unidentified blend, which tends toward richer, creamier layers of vanilla in flavor and texture. The finish is both full-figured and floral.
Name: Eponymous 2013 Proprietary White (Carneros)

Description: This wine is smooth while keeping all of its fresh wits about it. Citrus, red apple and quince flavors give both spice and ripe fruits. With its lively, tangy aftertaste, it does need to broaden out, so drink from 2016.
Name: Château de l'Aubrade 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Very crisp and fruity, this is a light, bright and refreshing wine, with a tangy edge that gives texture. Apples and a strong citrus character promise a wine that will round out over the next few months. Drink from late 2015.
Name: Château Guichot 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This steely, tangy wine has a strongly mineral character—tight, taut and crisp. Green fruits, citrus and a grassy character dominate. It is ready to drink. This is an unusual 75% Sémillion and 25% Sauvignon Blanc blend that tends to round out the taste.
Name: Château Anniche 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Muscadelle and Sémillon is round, full and softly textured. White fruits, spice and fresh acidity are already well integrated. The end is tangy with lemon zest flavors. Drink now. The estate has been in the Forcato family since 1950.
Name: Château Lary 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A nose of pear, honeydew melon and freshly-starched linens sets the stage for soft pear and melon flavors that are overpowered by intense minty notes. There is a burst of fresh citrus on the finish, but there is a lingering sense of cotton on the palate throughout each sip.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2013 Hermon White (Galilee)

Description: Bright with fruit, this is a crisp and fresh wine. Acidity gives a strongly citrus character while allowing the potential of riper fruit and delicious pear juice flavors. It's a wine for apéritif, light and deliciously poised. It is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Sauvignon Gris from the Xavier Milhade family, now in its fourth and fifth generations on the estate.
Name: Château Recougne 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A tight, steely and fresh wine, this is dominated by grapefruit, citrus and nervy acidity. A strongly herbaceous character gives a fruity, crisp aftertaste. The blend is Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillion and Muscadelle.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2014 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Simple but solid apple and nectarine aromas are straight forward. This feels round and easy, without much acid-based cut. Flavors of melon, mango and nectarine finish short, with a note of apple.
Name: Esperanza 2014 Estate Grown & Bottled Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: This wine is still young, crisp and needs time to bring out its fruit. It has lively acidity, to be sure, with hints of the citrus and white currant flavors that are to come. Give this wine until 2016.
Name: Château de l'Enclos 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This tradition-bucking blend of 61% Chenin Blanc, 31% Viognier and 8% Roussanne offers soft aromas of sweet apple blossoms and peach, with a hint of barrel smoke. The palate offers a similar blend of peaches, pears and apples, warmed up with some oak influence.
Name: Vinum 2013 White Elephant White (California)

Description: This herbaceous wine has fresh acidity and crisp, lively texture. Citrus and green apples are given a warmer character by spice and vanilla flavors. The wine is ripe and full in the mouth.
Name: Château Mezain 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Intense with acidity and young fruitiness, this wine needs some time. The potential of the white and citrus fruit is there, with an herbaceous character that needs to soften. Drink from late 2015.
Name: Château Buisson-Redon 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Seven different varieties make up this blend with Riesling (34%), Chardonnay (18%), Gewürztraminer (16%) and Viognier (13%) taking the lead. Aromas of flowers, mandarin orange and citrus are followed by moderately sweet stone-fruit flavors that providing easy drinking pleasure.
Name: Waterbrook 2013 Mélange White Varietal Blend White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This delicious, fruity wine is full of acidity and crisp fruit. Light, bright and dominated by green and citrus fruits, it is ready to drink now.
Name: Château Vircoulon 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Fruity and juicy, this is an attractive blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc, giving a tight, mineral-driven wine. With its pink grapefruit and crisp green apple fruits, it is young and can age, although not for long. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Grand Jean 2014  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This fragrant, spicy wine is soft and rounded. It is still developing to give a wine that will be warm and full. It misses something of the essential fruitiness.
Name: Château Au Grand Paris 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This crisp, lemon-flavored wine has a ripe, full character. It is rich with apples, apricots and delicious acidity at the end.
Name: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Briny citrus, feline notes and pithy scents send this Merseguera-led blend toward a pulpy, citrusy palate. Grapefruit and pithy, lightly bitter flavors finish citric, with little change from the wine's primary flavors.
Name: Volver 2014 Tarima Blanco White (Alicante)

Description: Very fresh and crisp, this is a wine to drink soon. It has great acidity, bright and lively with green fruit flavors and some mandarin zest to give softness at the end.
Name: Château du Claouset 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine is fresh without being too herbaceous. Sauvignon Blanc controls crispness with flavors of almonds, citrus and quince. The tangy, steely aftertaste will soften from the end of 2015.
Name: Château Taussin 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This perfumed wine conveys attractive balance between its fruit and fresher acidity. A fresh, crisp texture still needs time to settle in. Drink from the end of 2015.
Name: Château Haut Mouleyre 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Generic peach and apple aromas are light and easy. This blend of Merseguera and Macabeo feels pulpy and citrusy, while pithy flavors of peach and orange finish fresh, but with limited complexity.
Name: Bocopa 2014 Alcanta White (Alicante)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In this near-equal split between the two varieties, both show themselves on the aromas and flavors of overripe pear, peach and flowers, with the alcohol evident throughout.
Name: J. Bookwalter 2013 Couplet Conner-Lee Chardonnay-Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Crisp and very fruity, this offers bright and intense acidity. There is a light, tangy texture and a bright, poised aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château Timberlay 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: With its little seasoning of Muscadelle in the blend, this is an attractively perfumed wine. It has bright acidity, plenty of herbaceous flavors and a final pear and crisp apple aftertaste. Drink from the end of 2015.
Name: Château Maison Noble 2014  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Tight and packed with acidity, this is a very fruity wine dominated by herbaceous Sauvignon flavors that need to soften. It seems one-dimensional, just herbaceous and citrus.
Name: Producta Vignobles 2014 Mission Saint-Vincent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Totally fresh, crisp and with great acidity, this wine is all abut fruit. Citrus and crisp green apple dominate. The end conveys a bright, tight, mineral texture.
Name: Clos des Moiselles 2014 Le Bord'eaux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This wine is herbaceous, crisp and lively. Tangy acidity envelops the citrus and green apple flavors, while the aftertaste is all about the tight, steely acidity.
Name: Château des Antonins 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine is lightly herbaceous, with a crisp while creamy texture that emphasizes perfumed green fruits and refreshing acidity. It is light, fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Ginestet 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: With a light tan color and yeasty, briny aromas of vanilla and nectarine, this blend of Macabeo (Viura) and the obscure Merseguera grape delivers a wet, simple palate with citric and malic acid. Pithy citrus flavors of grapefruit and tangerine finish long for a basic, unoaked wine.
Name: Bocopa 2014 Conde de Alicante White (Alicante)

Description: Dusty, jumbled aromas of fleshy melon and stone fruits are not terribly defined. This has a soft mouthfeel and flavors of papaya, peach and bitter citrus pith. Drink immediately; contains 10% Viura.
Name: Emina 2014 Rueda Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: This is a perfumed wine, fresh with floral character. An attractive crisp edge makes it ready to drink now.
Name: Château la Caderie 2014 Esprit  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Lightly herbaceous, this is a fresh, obviously youthful wine. It is only lightly textured, the main character coming from yellow fruits and pear juice flavors. Drink now, although it will age and improve until 2016.
Name: Château Moulin de Vignolle 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Light and fruity, this is a crisp, fresh wine. Hints of red apples and yellow fruits are cut with lemon zest. The wine is perfumed and ready to drink.
Name: Château Grand Jean 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Very fruity, this is a crisp, lemon-scented and flavored wine, with grassy, herbaceous character from the green Sauvignon Blanc in the blend. The aftertaste is tight with some bitterness.
Name: Château de Parenchère 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A soft, simple wine without great character, this is soft, gently fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Château Haut Bessac 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Juicy fruit aromas lead to a palate conveying tangy flavors and mandarin zest. This is a fruity wine that is not quite balanced, and likely to remain with fruit and texture out of kilter.
Name: Château de Lardiley 2014 Prestige  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Riesling and Muscat with a pinch of Gewürztraminer, this wine offers vibrant aromas of orange peel, fresh flowers, spice and jasmine that don't entirely meld. It drinks dry with light concentration and a slightly bitter finish.
Name: Kennedy Shah 2013 Auntie Meredith's Picnic Blend White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Pickled and briny smelling up front, this semisweet wine doesn't open well. A cloying, low-acid palate is another strike against it, while flavors of candied apple, canned peaches and vanilla finish sticky.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2014 Satinela Semi Dulce Malvasia-Viura (Rioja)

Description: This sweet, honeyed wine has a rich, unctuous character. It is perfumed, full of sweet orange marmalade and spice. The acidity keeps it together and gives final freshness. This is a wine to drink by itself rather than with food.
Name: Domaine Rotier 2012 Renaissance Vendanges Tardives White (Gaillac)

Description: This powerful and rich wine wants to be sweet but is bone dry. Hints of honey accompany opulent ripe peach and spiced pear flavors. The balance of the acidity is crisp and refreshing. Drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine Cauhapé 2013 Sève d'Automne  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Jim Clendenen may be the only West Coast vintner making this blend of 50% Pinot Gris, 40% Pinot Blanc and 10% Aligoté, but more should copy. Aromas of musk melon, orange rose petals, crushed chalk and candied peaches lead into a palate powered by sea salt-laced nectarines, ripe red apples and honeydew, all tied together with proper acidity.
Name: Au Bon Climat 2012 Hildegard White (Santa Maria Valley)

Description: This wood-aged wine is an impressive blend of Loin de l'Oeil and Sauvignon Blanc. The result is a wine that is rich, spicy, layered with creamy wood while preserving an intense freshness. From a stony vineyard, it has some of minerality that comes from the soil. It is a wine to age; drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine Rotier 2013 Renaissance White (Gaillac)

Description: Like all Jurançon, this wine brings together great richness and great freshness. The honey and peach fruits are laced with acidity to give the wine poise, while hints of dry botrytis promise aging. This is a ripe, full wine that should be drunk from 2017.
Name: Château Jolys 2012  Jurançon
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This has the classic lightness of sweet Jurançon, with balance between the honeyed character and brilliant acidity. This is sweet, but so poised and crisp at the same time. Apricot and dried raisins are blended with lemon juice. The wine is still young; drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine Nigri 2013 Toute une Histoire  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Dominated by the local Loin de l'Oeil grape, this wood-aged wine has flavors of pears, spice and attractive, light vanilla. Acidity and a delicious, tasty structure give complexity to this wine that could certainly age. Drink now, although it will be better from 2016.
Name: Domaine Rotier 2012 Renaissance White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: Pacherenc du Vic-Bilh, covering the same area as Madiran, blends the two white grapes stars of the southwest, Petit and Gros Manseng. Here they give a dry wine that's yearning to be sweet, with its honey and aromatic peach and currant flavors. Drink now for its crisp while rich character.
Name: Château d'Aydie 2013 Odé d'Aydie  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: The quest behind the name of this wine is to make Jurançon wines better know. Cauhapé is well placed to do this, and this lightly wood-aged wine is a good point to start. It is rich, full in the mouth with a hint of toast that supports the quince and apricot fruit flavors. Drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine Cauhapé 2014 Quest by Cauhapé  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Vino da Tavola, Italy Other, Italy
Description: This unusual blend of 50% Viognier and 50% Grechetto opens with aromas of white spring flower, ripe stone fruit, flint and a whiff of pine sap. The linear palate delivers layers of white peach, juicy pear, green apple, spice and minerality brightened by fresh acidity. It finishes on a note of white almond. Hold a few years for complexity. Drink through 2020.
Name: Tenuta di Fiorano 2012 Fiorano Bianco White (Vino da Tavola)

Description: Sea salt and fresh white flowers lead the nose of this light, aromatic white. On the palate, the wine is focused and fresh, with a swash of sea salt and clean, brisk fruit on the finish. Pair with grilled seafood and salads.
Name: Claudia Papayianni 2013 Ex'arnon Sauvignon Blanc-Assyrtiko White (Chalkidiki)

Description: This rich and ripe wine is full of apricot and almond flavors. It is beautifully textured with a strongly mineral character as well as an orange-zest flavor and tangy, spicy aftertaste. The wine should age, so drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine Nigri 2013 Pierre de Lune  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Harvested at the end of October, this gently sweet wine has hints of botrytis along with ripe apricot and honey flavors. It is shot through with delicious acidity that gives the wine a great lift and final freshness.
Name: Domaine Cauhapé 2013 Ballet d'Octobre  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Here's a fresh, savory white made from Trebbiano and Sémillon grapes. It opens with aromas of pineapple, exotic fruit and white wildflowers that carry over to the linear palate alongside Mediterranean herb, yellow peach and lemon zest. Tangy acidity provides balance and generates a crisp, clean finish.
Name: I Giusti e Zanza 2014 Memorino White (Toscana)

Description: This blend of Roditis and Moscofilero offers floral, flirty aromas and a palate that's both fresh and layered. Flavors of lemon, violet and orange are rounded but balanced by lively acidity.
Name: Skouras 2013 Zoe White (Peloponnese)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier (CSV). From estate vineyards in the Cahors region, it is a young wine, still developing its potentially aromatic character, fragrant acidity and rich pineapple and red apple flavors. Hold this wine and drink from late 2016.
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2014 CSV White (Côtes du Lot)

Description: This wine is a conversation starter, with its nose of mandarin orange, lemon peel and vanilla. On the palate, white flowers, citrus and lush tropical fruits mingle well. Pair with salmon and poultry.
Name: Hatzimichalis 2011 Kapnias White (Atalanti Valley)

Appellation: Terrazze Retiche di Sondrio, Lombardy, Italy
Description: Aromas of vanilla, oak, white flower, hay and pear lead the nose of this blend of 30% Sauvignon, 30% Chardonnay, 30% Incrocio Manzoni and 10% Nebbiolo. The unusual palate offers citrus, Alpine herbs, dried apple, candied lemon, a hint of tropical fruit and a coffee note that lingers on the close. The rich flavors are brightened by racy acidity.
Name: Nino Negri 2013 Ca' Brione White (Terrazze Retiche di Sondrio)

Description: This exotic white blend starts with citrus and floral aromas and offers a palate of soft lemon curd, orange and white fruit. Rich but with a cutting finish, it's a good food wine for bigger seafood flavors.
Name: Zacharias 2013 Ambelos Phos Roditis-Moschofilero White (Peloponnese)

Description: This is a sweet, honeyed wine, rich with apricot fruit flavors and fresh with balancing acidity. It's fruity, mineral and generous, a great wine for fruit desserts.
Name: Domaine Rotier 2012 Les Gravels White (Gaillac)

Description: Blended from 75% Sauvignon Blanc and 25% Sémillon and aged in a portion of new French oak, this dessert wine is rich and sweet, imparting a raisiny, brioche-like personality atop soft, seductive layers of ripe mouthfeel. This would pair well with pungent blue cheeses.
Name: Envy 2011 White (California)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: In this intriguing blend, the herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc dominates the smoother Chardonnay. The wine is all about crispness and freshness with a strongly aromatic component. Acidity and a touch of minerality come through at the end.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2014 Côté Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This vivacious white is a beach pour with class. Fresh lemon zest and floral aromas and a combination of white fruit, minerals and citrus on the palate are lively and light, but the wine has some weight behind it.
Name: Domaine Gioulis 2013 Sofos The Wise One Moschofilero-Chardonnay White (Peloponnese)

Description: This soft wine is dominated by tropical fruits as well as fresher pear and apple. It is ripe, brightened by citrus acidity that still needs to integrate. It will be attractive to drink by the end of 2015.
Name: L'Enclos des Braves 2014 Les Gourmands White (Gaillac)

Description: With its 50% Sémillon, this ripe wine has the potential to be rich. It has a perfumed, fruity character at this stage, emphasizing flowery fruits along with citrus. As it develops, it will fill out comfortably. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2014 Cuvée des Conti White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: A late-harvest wine from 40-year-old vines, this is balanced with a totally refreshing touch of acidity and lemon curd. It is light and fruity, just hinting at honey and apricots. The aftertaste has a great lift of acidity.
Name: Château de Rhodes 2011 Vendanges Tardives White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Vino da Tavola, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Spanish broom, jasmine, peach and apple aromas lead the nose of this charming white that hails from an estate located just outside of Rome. The juicy palate delivers Golden Delicious apple, tropical fruit and a hint of mineral. It finishes on an apple note.
Name: Tenuta di Fiorano 2011 Fioranello Bianco White (Vino da Tavola)

Description: While this wine has an attractive honey character, it is only lightly sweet. It's more about acidity balanced with richness and a wonderful orange-zest character that gives a lift as well as bright aftertaste. The wine needs until 2016 to get its full act together.
Name: Domaine Nigri 2013 Pas de Deux  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Intensely acid in its youth, this bone-dry wine needs a few months. For now, it is tight and steely, very fresh and aromatic, but requires time to open out and broaden. Drink from the end of 2015.
Name: Domaine Cauhapé 2014 Chant des Vignes  (Jurançon Sec)

Appellation: Côtes du Marmandais, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a ripe, perfumed blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sauvignon Gris. It is smooth and creamy in texture, with rich apricot and pear flavors. Spice comes from five months wood aging. It is ready to drink.
Name: Cave du Marmandais 2014 Château la Bastide White (Côtes du Marmandais)

Description: White peach, tropical fruit and citrus typify this curvy white punctuated by fragrant Viognier. The rounded fruit is buoyed by Assyrtiko's brisk acidity.
Name: Claudia Papayianni 2013 Claudia Viognier-Assyrtiko White (Chalkidiki)

Description: Opulent pear, apple and floral aromas are followed by a fresh but fleshy array of tropical fruit in this easy drinking blend. Oak aging adds complexity but minerality keeps the wine poised. Pair with smoked salmon and poultry.
Name: Claudia Papayianni 2013 White (Chalkidiki)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This curious blend of 61% Riesling and 39% Sauvignon Blanc manages to succeed, with lime rinds, limestone and wafts of gasoline intriguing the nose. There's not much acidity on the palate, but it does offer a chalky grip along with limeade flavors.
Name: Skyline Wines 2013 Artisan White (Central Coast)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The two signature white grapes of Côtes de Gascogne give a wine flavored with tropical fruit and honey. It is delicate, ripe and just off dry. The wine is ready to drink although it will be better at the end of 2015.
Name: Domaine Uby 2014 No. 4 Gros & Petit Manseng White (Côtes de Gascogne)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: A fruity, crisp and herbaceous blend of Loin de l'oeil and Mauzac, this lively wine also shows some richness. Full of green and citrus fruits, it is finished with a light minerality and acidity. Drink from 2015.
Name: Domaine des Terrisses 2014 Terrisses Sec White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This wine combines the best of Chenin Blanc, with its nutty, terroir-driven character, and the round ripeness of Chardonnay. It is fruity and fresh with a smooth texture that is lifted by final acidity.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2014 Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Gros Manseng takes the lead in this ripe and full wine with a fragrant floral character as well as great fruitiness. It's fresh while also having a creamy, smooth character. It is ready to drink, but will be better from the end of 2015.
Name: Domaine Chiroulet 2014 Terres Blanches White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Apple, orange and pear aromas lead this distinctive white blend. On the palate, the wine has an appealing balance of chalkiness paired with exotic fruits. The finish offers complexity with a wash of lively acidity.
Name: Hatzimichalis 2012 Lefkos White (Atalanti Valley)

Description: Even though the wine is dry, there are hints of the honey that's typical of the sweeter Jurançon. The honey contrasts with the bone-dry core and white fruit flavors that revel in both acidity and youthful structure. Drink this ripe and fruity wine from 2016.
Name: Château de Jurque 2013 Fantaisie  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Produced from vines around the showpiece medieval château of Monbazillac, this is a lightly honeyed, fresh and orange marmalade-flavored wine. It has botrytis to give the proper dry core along with a rich feel that is just cut with acidity. It's delicious now and will get better. Drink now, or wait until 2016.
Name: Producta Vignobles 2010 Château Monbazillac  (Monbazillac)

Description: The Notios blend offers aromas and flavors of pert lemon, sea salt and spice, with an attractive acid balance. Focused and fresh but with some complexity, it's a god expression of Greek terroir and style.
Name: Gaia Wines 2013 Notios White (Peloponnese)

Description: Complex floral and citric aromas lead this sophisticated white blend. Flavors of fresh tropical fruit, lemon and sea salt are balanced and appealing. A great everyday pour.
Name: Elios 2013 Mediterranean White (Peloponnese)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Because of the cool Atlantic climate, the Gascogne region is home to many bright, crisp wines. This is fruity, fresh and utterly crisp while also having some hints of melon and peach flavors. A touch of attractive minerality gives the wine texture. Drink now.
Name: Vignobles 46N118 2013 Blanc 32 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: There is an attractive herbaceous character to this wine, yet it also has a softer, ripe and broad creamy side. Acidity keeps it all fruity and fresh. This 50-50 organic blend is ready to drink. Winemaker/owner Jean Labérenne, an opera fan, attributes his Presto wine to Mozart's Don Giovanni.
Name: Domaine Seailles 2014 Presto Sauvignon Blanc-Sauvignon Gris (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This smooth, creamy textured wine combines bright acidity with ripe apricot and pear flavors. It is already attractive in its freshness while also having a rounder character. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Uby 2014 No. 3 Colombard-Ugni Blanc Colombard-Ugni Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This deliciously fruity wine is all about citrus, pear and crisp apple. Lively and ready to drink, it will improve through 2016 as the intense acidity softens.
Name: Domaine Uby 2014 Les Tortues Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: From one of the largest private vineyards in France (2,300 acres), this wine epitomizes the light and fresh style that comes from Gascony in the hidden southwest of France. It is fruity, citrus-crisp with a touch of honey from the Gros Manseng in the blend. Drink now.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2014 Classic White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: There's more than just fancy packaging to distinguish this limited edition from its partner Colombelle L'Original. It is, if anything, even more herbaceous and certainly more intense, while showing some richness at the end.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2014 Colombelle Edition Limitée White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A fresh, lightly honeyed blend of Gros Manseng and Sauvignon Blanc, this is a fragrant, fruity wine with a twist of lemon and herbaceous acidity. It is light, touched by yellow fruits and with an orange tang at the end.
Name: François Lurton 2012 MJ Janeil White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Ripe and rounded, this is a smooth wine given richness from the Gros Manseng in the blend. Citrus vies with pear and apricot, cut with intense acidity. It is fresh and textured with a steely character at the end. Wait to drink until the end of 2015.
Name: Domaine du Rey 2014 4 Cépages White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: From sandy soils close to the Atlantic, this fresh, crisp wine almost has a salty character in its tangy texture and acidity. It is certainly crisp, light and very refreshing, with lemon and lime flavors and a bright, lively aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Laudet 2014 Laballe Sables Fauves White (Landes)

Appellation: Terrazze Retiche di Sondrio, Lombardy, Italy
Description: An unusual blend of Chardonnay, Incrocio Manzoni and red Nebbiolo and Rossola grapes, this charming white opens with aromas of Alpine violets and fragrant red berries. The bright palate delivers juicy tropical fruit and apple alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Nera 2013 La Novella White (Terrazze Retiche di Sondrio)

Description: An attractively perfumed wine that adds Muscadelle to the blend. That gives a spicy, bright character as well as fragrant acidity to accompany the lime and peppered pear fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Vignerons de Buzet 2013 Château Loustalet White (Buzet)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This totally young, herbaceous wine is packed with fruitiness. Crisp lemon and a dash of grapefruit accent this local blend of Colombard, Ugni Blanc and Sauvignon Blanc. It's bright, ready to drink now.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2014 Colombelle L'Original White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: There is no indication on the bottle what this blend might be. Regardless of composition, it's a generic, solid wine with melon and vanilla cookie aromas backed by a round, citrusy mouthfeel. Flavors of briny citrus and white grapefruit finish decently.
Name: Paso a Paso 2013 Made With Organic Grapes White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: This blend of 55% Sémillon and 45% Sauvignon Blanc offers aromas of fresh-cut apple and pear with an undercurrent of grapefruit and lime. Light and ephemeral, the finish leans savory in a big way, a taste of salinity lingering.
Name: St. Supéry 2013 Virtú Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Every Gascon white grape seems to have ended up in this ripe, soft blend. It offers plenty of cool-climate acidity, with lemon and pink grapefruit. It also has a steely, more mineral bite, with a more honeyed, perfumed aftertaste.
Name: Laudet 2014 Le Moulin en Gascogne White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Green apples and citrus flavors dominate this fresh, fruity wine with its finishing acidity. It's light, bright and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Millet 2014 Colombard-Ugni Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This fruity, aromatic wine is fresh and crisp. It has a strongly herbaceous, citrus character and an intensely perfumed backdrop. Drink now.
Name: Vignerons de Buzet 2013 Baron d'Ardeuil Vieilles Vignes White (Buzet)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This green, intensely herbaceous wine comes from Sauvignon Blanc and Colombard vines growing on sandy soil. It is full of lemon and grapefruit flavors that give the wine a tight, almost steely texture. It should be drunk from the end of 2015.
Name: Domaine de Ballade 2014 Ballade Blanc White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Fresh and fruity, this is perfumed, herbaceous and crisp. A strong citrus character is balanced by hints of peach and pineapple. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine du Rey 2014 Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Melon, banana and bath oil aromas announce a layered, citrusy palate, with simple flavors of orange and white pepper. The finish is citric in flavor but not overly sharp in feel.
Name: La Playa 2014 Estate Series Viognier-Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Aromas of peach pit, dried almond skins and white pineapple are on the raw side, while the palate on this Viognier-heavy blend is waxy yet citric. Flavors of white grapefruit and lemon are pithy, and finish with bitter almond flavors.
Name: Estampa 2013 Estate Viognier-Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Pickled, briny aromas lead to a palate defined only by pithy citrus fruit. This tastes mostly of bitter citrus, while the finish brings herbacious tones.
Name: Estampa 2014 Fina Reserva Ensamblaje Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Viognier White (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: A blend of 60% Trebbiano Toscano and 40% Malvasia del Chianti, this opulent dessert wine opens with intense aromas of dry almond biscuit, dried apricot and a whiff of maple syrup that carry over to the rich palate along with cream caramel and candied nectarine. The intense flavors are balanced by fresh acidity and lingering finish.
Name: Volpaia 2008  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of Pinot Grigio, Tocai Friuliano and Pinot Blanc from three different vineyards made by winemaker Doug Margerum shows brilliantly juicy aromas of pressed pear, dried apples, apple blossoms and cantaloupe. Poached pears and boiled apples come with the sip, which allures with just a touch of sugariness.
Name: Cent'Anni 2012 Bianco White (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: A nonvintage blend, the Evolution is as clever as it gets. This 18th edition (the edition numbers serve a similar function to a vintage date) melds several different grapes into an aromatic, lushly detailed whole. Stone and tropical fruits abound, loading the palate with flavors of peaches, cream and lemon meringue. It's thoroughly delicious without a hint of wood.
Name: Sokol Blosser NV Evolution White (America)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with 80% Malvasia-Trebbiano and 20% Sangiovese, this amber-colored nectar reveals aromas of dried stone fruit, hazelnut and a whiff of clove. The rich but balanced palate delivers mature apricot, toasted hazelnut and citrus zest brightened by just enough fresh acidity. Pair this with classic Tuscan almond cookies. Wine Warehouse, Polaner Selections.
Name: Felsina 2004  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with 80% Malvasia-Trebbiano and 20% Sangiovese, this classic Tuscan dessert wine conveys aromas of pastry and nut. The palate delivers chestnut honey, dried apricot, citrus zest and a smooth, lingering finish. Imported by Wine Warehouse, Polaner Selections.
Name: Felsina 2005  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

Description: A lick of vanilla hovers over the nose, creating an unusual waxy, rich impression that becomes far more focused on the linear, taut palate. This is rounded but streamlined, with slender citrus fruit that shares the limelight with earthier notes.
Name: Uwe Schiefer 2013 Weisser Schiefer White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Structured and savory, this opens with heady aromas of yellow flower, nut and dried stone fruit. On the concentrated but poised palate, notes of nutmeg and ginger accent a core of mature peach, baked apple and juicy citrus. Bright acidity energizes the rich flavors.
Name: Tenuta Le Calcinaie 2011 Vigna ai Sassi Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: White summer blossom and fresh green pear create a superlight, superfresh opening. The palate continues in the same vein: ultralight as befits the 2014 vintage, but with an aromatic, spicy, peppery edge. It makes for a perfect, light summer apéritif.
Name: Tinhof 2014 White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with a blend of 50% Trebbiano and 50% Malvasia, this delivers aromas of Tuscan almond cookies, citrus and dried apricot. The concentrated palate offers layers of candied nectarine zest, fig and toasted almond. Pair it with seasoned cheeses or cantucci.
Name: Castello di Monsanto 2005 La Chimera  (Vin Santo del Chianti Classico)

Description: Very pure notes of conference pear charm on the nose and palate, which is taut and slender. A citric verve makes for liveliness. With some air, subtler notes of pepper appear alongside gossamer-like phenolics. Typical for the 2014 vintage this is light but also clean with subtle, earthy spice. No fewer than 17 co-planted varieties from an old vineyard go into this. Savor that pepper.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2014 Dorflagen Gemischter Satz White (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made with botrytized Grechetto and Trebbiano grapes, this conveys subtle aromas of peach and saffron. On the dense palate, sweet almond adds interest to the core of dried apricot and sticky honey.
Name: Barberani 2012 Calcaia Muffa Nobile  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Description: A 50-50 blend of Trebbiano and Malvasia, this showcases aromas of maple syrup, dried stone fruit and walnut. The rich palate delivers dried apricot, chestnut honey and almond alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Lornano 2006  Vin Santo del Chianti Classico

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Chamomile, straw and dried fruit aromas take shape in the glass. The structured palate offers mature apple, baked peach and citrus while flinty mineral adds depth. Fresh acidity brightens the concentrated flavors.
Name: Tenuta Le Calcinaie 2010 Vigna ai Sassi Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Apricot and savory herb aromas lead the nose on this sophisticated white. The palate shows a core of concentrated yellow peach and pear accented with a light note of fennel. Fresh acidity adds brightness and makes for a pristine finish.
Name: Castello di Corbara 2013 Podere Il Caio  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This well-structured white boasts an alluring bouquet that recalls beeswax, acacia flower and stone fruit. The polished palate offers juicy yellow peach, green apple and a honey note.
Name: Palazzone 2012 Campo del Guardiano  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: Green apple, flint and apricot are some of the aromas of this elegant, medium-bodied white. The smooth palate offers layers of juicy white peach, Mediterranean herb and mineral alongside refreshing acidity.
Name: Decugnano dei Barbi 2013 Il Bianco  (Orvieto Classico)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's the barrel notes of toast, vanilla and spice that make the first impression on this blend of Dionysus Sauvignon Blanc (64%) and Bacchus Semillon, followed by caramel and fig. The tropical fruit flavors are rich and creamy in feel and linger on the finish.
Name: Cloudlift Cellars 2013 Updraft White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This elegant, fragrant expression of Orvieto delivers heady aromas of tropical fruit, apricot and citrus. The linear palate doles out juicy peach, pineapple and lemon zest accented with a hint of aromatic herb. Vibrant acidity provides the framework.
Name: Castello della Sala 2014 San Giovanni  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: The textured skin of russet apples and Williams pear set the aromatic stage, while the palate follows with a taut but textured earthiness that destines this wine for the table. Lemony freshness shoots down the middle and guarantees lots of refreshment.
Name: Wieninger 2014 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This crisp wine discloses aromas of green apple and almond. The round palate offers juicy white peach and ripe Bartlett pear accented by a nutty finish. Moderate acidity gives it a clean finish.
Name: Barberani 2013 Castagnolo  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: Aromas of stone fruit, wildflower and Bartlett pear come together in the glass. The savory palate doles out juicy green apple, creamy white peach and aromatic herb, while fresh acidity and a light mineral vein give it a clean, crisp finish.
Name: Decugnano dei Barbi 2013 Villa Barbi  (Orvieto Classico)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This barrel fermented blend of equal parts Sauvignon Blanc and Semillon shows aromas and flavors of guava, kiwi, green tea and lees. It's full, sweet and viscous in feel, finishing a bit short.
Name: Auclair 2014 96 Cedars White Wine Artz Vineyard White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This structured white opens with aromas of tropical fruit and sweet baking spice. The round palate offers mature peach, baked apple, toast and oak-driven spice. The finish closes with butterscotch and bitter nut.
Name: Barberani 2012 Luigi e Giovanna  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: One of the first 2014s available, this obscure yet successful blend of 71% Grenache Blanc and 29% Albariño invites the nose with vanilla-laced apple custard, orange blossom and baking soda aromas. It's bright on the tight and pithy palate, with bouncy apple cider flavors as well as poached pear and kaffir lime.
Name: Lone Madrone 2014 La Mezcla White (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A bold proportion of aromatic Muscat Ottonel lends a distinctly perfumy, floral tone to this dry white blend. It's fairly poised though, balancing exuberant perfume with pristine lychee and grapefruit flavors, as well as a dash of exotic spice.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing 2013 42 North White (Finger Lakes)

Description: Innovative and luminous, this 50-50 blend of Vermentino and Verdicchio shows heady aromas of tropical fruit and white flower. Vibrant acidity balances juicy pear, peach and a citrusy note before the crisp, clean finish.
Name: Falesco 2014 Vitiano White (Umbria)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Enticing aromas suggest white spring flower and peach. The bright palate offers nectarine zest, crunchy Granny Smith apple and wild herb alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Palazzone 2014 Terre Vineate  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: This lively white features aromas of tropical fruit, citrus and white flower. The bright, round palate doles out fresh peach, juicy pineapple and crisp apple alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Principe Pallavicini 2014 Poggio Verde  (Frascati Superiore)

Description: The nose does not give away much, but the palate is a spray of fresh citrus zest. This is light, taut and refreshing. Drink soon.
Name: Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2014 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Crisp and polished, this opens with heady aromas of hawthorne and stone fruit. The vibrant palate offers white peach, passion fruit and citrus alongside bright acidity and a light mineral note.
Name: Castello Montauto 2014  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Description: Aromas of toast, walnut and dried orchard fruit lead the nose on this blend of 40% Vermentino, 40% Sauvignon and 20% Chardonnay. The palate offers yellow apple skin, oak extract, butterscotch and toasted almond but it's shy on fruit richness.
Name: Campo alla Sughera 2013 Achenio White (Bolgheri)

Description: This vibrant white unfolds with fragrances of white spring flower, hay, earth, green apple and tropical fruit that all carry over to the palate. Crisp acidity brightens the juicy fruit flavors.
Name: Argillae 2013  Orvieto

Description: Made with organically grown fruit, this structured white has a shy nose at first but aromas of pear, flint and dried herb eventually take shape in the glass. The linear palate offers lemon zest, yellow apple and a mineral note alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Sergio Mottura 2013 Tracugnano  (Orvieto)

Description: A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Bianco, this has a delicate fragrance of white flower and orchard fruit. The vibrant palate offers yellow apple, citrus and a touch of mineral while crisp acidity provides the framework.
Name: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2013 White (Pomino)

Description: Made with 70% Vermentino and 30% Viognier, this opens with aromas of beeswax, white spring flowers and apricot. The juicy palate offers ripe yellow peach, succulent citrus and candied lemon.
Name: Batzella 2012 Mezzodì White (Toscana)

Description: This blend of Chardonnay, Sémillon and Roussanne brings notes of lees, honeycomb and dried apricot. It's medium bodied and creamy in feel, bringing plenty of appeal and going down easy with abundant lees flavors.
Name: BBQ Wine Company NV Oink! White (America)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Citrus blossom and honeydew aromas contrast against bramble and earth tones on this pert blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Blanc and Pinot Gris. Dry in style and delicately framed, it's a refreshing, light-footed quaffer.
Name: Heron Hill 2013 Eclipse White (New York)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Bright and linear, this offers a delicate fragrance that recalls citrus blossom. The lively palate displays lemon zest and a touch of bitter almond alongside racy acidity.
Name: Cecchi 2014  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pleasant but then rather persistent oak aromas occupy the nose on this wine, with lemon rinds and lime juice hiding beneath. The palate is also quite reliant on the oak, offering smoked vanilla beans, pear juice and a touch of citrus peel bitterness, but it's really a very plush white wine.
Name: Westerly 2013 Fletcher's White (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: A blend of Petit Manseng and Muscat, this wine is overtly floral and fruity. Sweet lily and white rose aromas pervade an exotic palate of lychee and orange oil. While easy to enjoy on its own, this would make a fun pairing with Thai curries.
Name: Early Mountain 2014 Block Eleven White (Virginia)

Description: Aromas of peach and a whiff of aromatic herb lead the nose while the bright palate offers stone fruit and green apple. Lively acidity gives it a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Sergio Mottura 2013 Secco  (Orvieto)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Tropical fruit and peach aromas take center stage on this bright wine. The round, friendly palate doles out white peach, green apple and passion fruit alongside lively acidity.
Name: Cantina Altarocca 2014 Arcosesto  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This pleasant white offers delicate aromas of citrus blossom and orchard fruit. The easygoing palate has green apple and peach alongside bright acidity. It would work well for everyday occasions or informal parties.
Name: Bigi 2014 Secco  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: Aromas of peach and apple lead the nose on this easy-drinking white. The palate is rather lean but still manages to deliver flavors that recall green pear and unripe stone fruit alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Barbi 2014 Secco  (Orvieto Classico)

Description: This nonvintage blend seems to be showing some age with its pale salmon color displaying some bricking. It brings notes of strawberry, cherry and herbs. It's a solid easy drinker that drinks best at room temperature.
Name: BBQ Wine Company 2013 Oink! White (America)

Description: This off-dry version of Orvieto offers fragrances of ripe pear and stone fruit. On the easygoing palate, hints of bitter almond accent yellow peach and green apple. It's simple but well made.
Name: Barbi 2014 Abboccato  (Orvieto Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas of tropical fruit, apricot and a whiff of honey. The informal palate displays mature yellow apple and bitter walnut.
Name: Barbi 2014 Archè  (Orvieto Classico)

Description: Intense floral aromas of acacia flower and jasmine lead the nose on this informal wine. The palate is rather lean, but offers notes of citrus zest and green pear alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Principe Pallavicini 2014  Frascati

Description: Here's a bright, easygoing white that opens with a light peach scent. It's simple but well made, with delicate pear and apple flavors.
Name: Tenuta Vitalonga 2014 Elcione  (Orvieto)

Description: A Sauvignon Blanc-based blend, this opens with a pretty bouquet of white flowers before it becomes quite thick and rich on the palate.
Name: Sterling 2013 Winemaker's Select White (Napa Valley)

Description: Made from vines that are between 30 and 60 years old, this radiant white opens with aromas that recall white spring flower, mint and pear. The elegant, linear palate delivers concentrated flavors of juicy apple, creamy pear and zesty citrus, with firm acidity. The lingering finish closes on a mineral note.
Name: Pieropan 2012 Calvarino  (Soave Classico)

Description: One of the best sparkling wines produced in Saumur, this is textured, nervy and crisp, full of both fruit and secondary flavors. Touches of wood from the first fermentation in barrel give complexity and spice to the fruitiness. A yeasty, toasty aftertaste shows the wine's sophistication. Drink now.
Name: Bouvet-Ladubay 2010 Trésor Brut  (Saumur)

Description: Herbal aromas of cut grass, bell pepper and tomato vine mingle with suggestions of ripe pineapple and stone fruit. A 50-50 blend of Chardonnay and Sauvignon, the rich palate delivers baked Golden Delicious apple, mature apricot, tangerine zest and candied lemon drop. A mineral note closes the lingering finish.
Name: Vie di Romans 2012 Dut'Un White (Venezia Giulia)

Description: The ripe combination of Chenin and Chardonnay gives this always-delicious wine its richness and creamy texture. It is ripe, full-bodied with melon and peach flavors as well as crisper acidity. This limited-production wine is smooth and rich at the end. Drink now.
Name: Bouvet-Ladubay 2012 Saphir Brut Vintage  (Saumur)

Description: Fragrances recall honeysuckle, jasmine and citrus zest. The juicy palate offers creamy green apple, Bartlett pear and nectarine alongside zesty acidity. A note of white almond signals the close.
Name: Pieropan 2013  Soave Classico

Description: Linear and vibrant, this opens with an enticing fragrance of hawthorn and black locust. The juicy palate offers creamy white peach, tart green apple and citrus alongside an energizing mineral vein. It's well balanced, with zesty acidity.
Name: Cantina del Castello 2013 Pressoni  (Soave Classico)

Description: Beeswax and lanolin aromas are textbook Garnacha Blanca. This also feels waxy and grabby, with friction on the palate. Nutty, oaky, toasted white-fruit flavors suggest peach and papaya, while the finish is long, nutty and complex.
Name: Portal del Montsant 2010 Santbru White (Montsant)

Description: A blend of Malvasia Istriana, Friulano and Riesling Renano, this delineated white delivers tangerine zest, yellow peach, green pear and ginger drop sensations. Lively acidity gives it a crisp, refreshing finish.
Name: Vie di Romans 2012 Flors di Uis White (Friuli Isonzo)

Description: Waxy, honeyed aromas of melon and white flowers lead to a plump, leesy, creamy but balanced palate full of bready notes, stone-fruit flavors and vanilla. Another wave of leesy vanilla, melon, tropical fruit and cream takes over the finish. This contains Viognier, Garnacha Blanca and Chenin Blanc, a small portion of which was barrel fermented.
Name: Clos Figueras 2013 Font de la Figuera White (Priorat)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: With a high proportion of Chardonnay, this is a ripe, full-bodied and lightly toasty wine. It's rich in the mouth and rounded with the crisp green acidity playing a good supporting role. This bottle shows some maturity, giving a complex aftertaste.
Name: Bouvet-Ladubay NV Excellence Brut Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Crémant de Loire)

Description: Made mostly with Chardonnay and aged in barriques, this full-bodied white leads with aromas of white spring flower, beeswax, honey and toasted oak. The vibrant palate offers mature Golden Delicious apple, dried apricot, lemon drop, vanilla and candied ginger. Firm acidity provides freshness and balance.
Name: Elena Walch 2012 Beyond the Clouds White (Alto Adige)

Description: Oaky aromas of almond, vanilla and peach settle on a palate with grip and acidity. Flavors of toasted almond, baked apple and briny apricot finish with forward acidity. This is a blend of Garnacha Blanca and Macabeo, but it's the white Garnacha that sticks out.
Name: Mas Blanch I Jové 2013 Saó Blanc White (Costers del Segre)

Description: Aromas of pear, pressed white flower, exotic fruit and hints of toasted oak lead the nose. The round palate offers nectarine zest, apricot, dried herb and vanilla alongside soft but refreshing acidity.
Name: Marco Felluga 2012 Molamatta White (Collio)

Description: This is already tan in color and showing some signs of premature aging. Aromas of white gumdrop, peach, nutmeg and wood resin set up a full, woody, resiny palate that matches the bouquet. Savory, oaky flavors of dried stone fruits—apricot in particular—finish long, nutty, savory and woody.
Name: Clos Mogador 2012 Nelin White (Priorat)

Description: Made predominantly with Chardonnay and partly fermented in oak, this elegant wine unfurls with aromas of chamomile flower, Golden Delicious apple, Mediterranean herb, honey and a whiff of toast. The vibrant palate offers white grapefruit, crisp apple, toasted hazelnut and lemon drop. It's well balanced, with bright acidity.
Name: Tenute Lunelli 2013 Villa Margon White (Trentino)

Description: A, unusual blend of Pinot Grigio, Gewürztraminer and Riesling, this wine delivers sensations of pressed white rose petal, pineapple, pink grapefruit, crystalized ginger, bitter walnut and a balsamic note. Fresh acidity gives it a clean finish.
Name: Lis Neris 2010 Confini White (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Pretty aromas of stone fruit and yellow flower come together in the glass. The vertical palate delivers dried peach, yellow apple, nectarine zest and a flinty note balanced by bright acidity.
Name: Bolla 2013 Tufaie  (Soave Classico Superiore)

Description: Perfumy in lemon, lime and grapefruit, this blend of 80% Sauvignon Blanc and 20% Sémillon was barrel-fermented. Light in weight and heat, it offers an extreme bite of squeezed lemon on the palate, as well as a persistence of grapefruit rind. It begs for seafood.
Name: Vellum 2013 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Napa Valley)

Description: Made with Pinot Grigio, Chardonnay and Sauvignon, this leads with subtle aromas of celery, mature yellow apple, vanilla and toast. The palate offers pink grapefruit, toasted oak, lemon drop, celery, and butterscotch. It's still has fresh acidity but the fruit richness has started drying out so drink soon.
Name: Lis Neris 2011 Lis White (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Dusty notes and beeswax aromas dominate this wine, which is 90% Garnacha Blanca and the rest Pedro Xímenez. Tight and grabby, with staunch acidity, this tastes of white pepper, grass and waxy stone fruits. Briny notes and citric acidity on the finish are offset by tropical accents of papaya and melon.
Name: Mas Igneus 2012 Barranc dels Closos White (Priorat)

Appellation: Val di Neto, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of green apple and Bartlett pear lead the nose on this attractive blend of 90% Chardonnay and 10% Sauvignon. The creamy palate offers juicy white peach and tangerine brightened by fresh acidity.
Name: Librandi 2013 Critone White (Val di Neto)

Description: Floral scents of peach blossom, broom and a whiff of pear mingle in the glass. On the bright palate, toasted almond and aromatic herb give interest to the core of Golden Delicious apple and citrus. It's refreshing and balanced with vibrant acidity.
Name: Guerrieri Rizzardi 2013  Soave Classico

Description: Aromas of hawthorn, acacia flower and stone fruit take shape in the glass. The linear palate offers crisp apple, juicy pear and bitter almond alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Cantina di Soave 2013 Rocca Sveva Castelcerino  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of toast, wood, hazelnut and coffee take shape in the glass. The palate is rather lean, offering lemon zest, mature yellow apple and dried apricot alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Monte Tondo 2012 Casette Foscarin  (Soave Classico)

Description: Cidery apple and stone-fruit aromas are fresh and basic. This blend includes Chardonnay, Macabeo and Parellada, and it's a lively number with spritz and citric acidity. Orange and tangerine flavors remain zesty and snappy on the finish.
Name: Huguet de Can Feixes 2013 Blanc Selecció White (Penedès)

Description: Waxy, cheesy, resiny aromas rest heavily atop baked apple and vanilla scents. This is round and easy, maybe even soft, with flavors of toasty oak, vanilla extract, mixed nuts and wood grain. As a whole, the wine is very much oak-driven.
Name: Alta Alella 2013 Lanius White (Alella)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Very perfumed, this lightly sweet and poised wine is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng. It has cool acidity as well as wonderfully fragrant fruitiness. The texture gives the wine the potential to age, so drink now and until 2017.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2013 Villa Chambre d'Amour White (Vin de France)

Description: Aromas recall white spring flower, citrus and a hint of herb. The fresh palate offers nectarine and lemon zest alongside brisk acidity that leaves a clean finish.
Name: Livio Felluga 2013 Vertigo Bianco White (Delle Venezie)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Half-and-half Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay gives a sparkling wine that is both fresh and creamy. Attractive apple and almond flavors are lifted by bright acidity and a tight, very crisp aftertaste. The bottling seems a little young, so drink from 2016.
Name: Alexandre Monmousseau NV Vigneau Brut Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A typical Gers blend of Colombard, Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng from South West France, this is a spicy, fruity and elegantly light wine. It is fresh, crisp with grapefruit and pear juice flavors and ready to drink.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2013 Villa Grand Cap White (Vin de France)

Description: Aromas of passion fruit and banana lead the nose. The simple palate offers tropical fruit and unripe apple alongside racy acidity.
Name: Villa Canestrari 2014 Vigne di Sande  (Soave)

Description: Creamy vanilla and spritzy acidity surround a ripe core of baked apple and pear in this white. Full-bodied and touched by oak, it finishes clean and concentrated.
Name: Jack Nicklaus Wines 2012 Private Reserve White (Napa Valley)

Description: Pretty aromas of Bartlett pear and a floral note lead the nose on this easy-drinking wine. The simple, refreshing palate offers lemon zest and apple alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Bolla 2013 Retro  (Soave Classico)

Description: Lime and lychee aromas are pure Muscat, although this contains Macabeo as well. This wine is stony and light, without much body or depth. Lychee, lime and seltzer flavors finish with a flowery note of gardenia and a hint of lychee.
Name: La Vida al Camp 2013 Perfum White (Penedès)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A half-dozen (unnamed) grapes split the blend here; aromatically it shows flashes of both Viognier and Muscat. Off dry and generic, it does best when well chilled.
Name: Reustle 2013 Matrix White (Umpqua Valley)

Description: This fresh, light wine is based around 80% Chenin Blanc. It is soft with gentle apple and lemon flavors that give it an attractive lift as well as enhancing the nervy texture. It lacks in concentration, however it makes for a delicious, fruity apéritif.
Name: Bouvet-Ladubay NV Signature Brut Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Vin Mousseux)

Description: Tropical fruit and powdered sugar aromas are imprecise This blend is round and chunky in the mouth, with underripe nectarine and orange flavors. A pithy, briny finish shows a touch of peach flavor.
Name: Campo Lindo 2013 Blanco Macabeo-Chardonnay White (Catalunya)

Description: With a nose like lemon-lime soda and a lean, acidic palate, this tastes of sour citrus mixed with some yeast and banana.
Designation: Clos de Torribas Blanc de Blancs
Name: Pinord 2013 Clos de Torribas Blanc de Blancs White (Penedès)

Description: This is a rich, complex wine, full of dry botrytis that is surrounded by ripe honey. Spice, white peach and green plum jelly give complexity and variety. The acidity at the end is beautiful. The wine is already enticing but will need many years to develop fully. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Climens 2011  Barsac

Description: This wine encompasses all the star qualities of white Bordeaux. Lemon and grapefruit tones are balanced by ripe yellow fruit and spicy toastiness. Everything is in harmony in this wine that is sure to age well. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Well balanced, this gorgeous ripe wine is packed full of fresh yellow fruits, ripe oranges and lemon. The fruit counterpoints the generous, dense structure, offering the dry core of botrytis. Acidity gives a line of freshness at the end. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Coutet 2011  Barsac

Description: Layers of complex botrytis give this wine an immensely aromatic character. It is sumptuous and generous, ripe and full-bodied. The essential acidity comes through the dry structure of botrytis and sweet honey. The fruit is only just beginning to show and the wine is obviously very young. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Rieussec 2011  Sauternes

Description: This unusual blend combines old-vine Sémillon from the Monte Rosso Vineyard with Muscadelle and Palomino. Voluptuous on the nose, the wine is restrained on the palate, with inviting layers of licorice, beeswax and stone fruit. Exotic and long lasting, it's an intriguing wine.
Name: Carlisle 2012 The Derivative White (Sonoma County)

Description: The first impression is of the dry botrytis that has infused the wine. Then comes the acidity and crisp lemon flavor. Gradually, ripe marmalade and fragrant honey come out along with acidity. It's a fascinating, complex wine worthy of a wait. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Guiraud 2011  Sauternes

Description: Dry and spicy with layers of sweet, textured honey, this is a complex, structured wine. It has acidity, with pineapple and ripe apple flavors that are laced together with wildflower honey. The inner core is firm and dry. The wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2011  Sauternes

Description: This is a silky wine, crisp with citrus but so beautifully touched by wood aging and riper pear and apricot flavors. Even though it's already in balance, it still has many years to go until all that wonderful fruit is fully integrated by the judicious wood aging and acidity. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Spicy and dry, this ripe wine is as much about structure as sweetness at this stage. It is dense, packed with acidity and fragrant acacia and wildflower honey. As it opens up, it brings out orange zest and perfumed acidity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2011  Sauternes

Description: Sumptuous, ripe and very full on the palate, this wine is dense and packed with notes of botrytis that give a strong sense of structure. This well-balanced wine shows potential to age, offering rich acacia honey and beautiful final acidity. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2011  Sauternes

Description: Very fresh and strongly fruity, with just the right amount of dry botrytis, this is already approachable. However that botrytis does promise aging, with peach and ripe orange flavors pushing forward. Drink this attractive wine from 2019.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2011  Sauternes

Description: This wine is already balanced, rich and structured. Acidity, honey and yellow fruits are well integrated. At the same time, aging potential is there with the dry core, firm texture and the strong final acidity. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Filhot 2011  Sauternes

Description: With its strong initial impression of dryness, this is obviously a structured wine. It is dense, rich and concentrated with fine tannins, spice and a strong orange-zest character. Refreshing acidity gives a lift to this ripe, full wine. Drink from 2019.
Name: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2011  Sauternes

Description: Aromas of green-plum jelly and a touch of toast set out a wine that is spicy as well as fresh. Bitter orange marmalade flavors are laced with lime acidity, lying over a firm, tense structure with a mineral edge. It will develop well, but don't drink before 2020.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2011  Barsac

Description: This wine is intensely sweet, with delicious fresh acidity as well as orange and lemon flavors. Although approachable, it has a dry, structured and dense core, suggesting potential richness as well as longevity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Nairac 2011  Barsac

Description: Dense and concentrated, this wine is still balancing the fruit, the structure and the sweetness. Acidity shoots through the dry core, bringing with it lemon zest and pineapple flavors. It has great potential, full in the mouth and ripe at the end. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2011  Sauternes

Description: Smoky, floral aromas are immediately enticing. They follow through to a wine that is rich and dry rather than obviously sweet. It has great swathes of botrytis and acidity, accompanied by yellow fruits and ripe citrus. Drink this structured wine from 2020.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2012  Barsac

Description: Laced with acidity, this is a complex, structured wine with great freshness as well as a dry core of botrytis. It has a rich potential, closed at the moment but holding dense texture and balance between lemon and honey. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Malle 2011  Sauternes

Description: This wine has yeasty aromas and a light character that brings out springy acidity before the dry botrytis. It is still forming itself around the dry core, waiting to become generous and rich. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château d'Arche 2011  Sauternes

Description: Just touched by wood, this second white wine from both Haut-Brion and La Mission Haut-Brion is tangy, just hinting at herbaceousness. It has plenty of acidity, crisp citrus and pear flavors with a touch of spice from the wood aging. The wine is developing fast, drink from 2017.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2012 La Clarté de Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: A full-bodied, boldly flavored and robustly built wine, this starts with Bosc pear and white peach aromas. It then shows similar generous fruit flavors shaded by vanilla and hint of bitter almond. Well backed by acidity and a little alcohol heat, it should pair well with flavorful and protein-packed meals. Made with 78% Marsanne, plus Chardonnay and Viognier. Best now through 2018.
Name: Alder Springs 2012 Row Five White Cuvée White (Mendocino)

Description: This wine shows sulfur on the nose, but that will blow off in a few months. The palate is soft and closed up, just hinting at acidity and ripe yellow fruits. Honey comes at the back. It needs many years to express itself. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Lamothe Despujols 2011  Sauternes

Description: This wine has a dry structure with a spicy bite of acidity that keeps freshness and a buoyant background. Marmalade and bitter orange flavors are to the fore, giving fruit while the dry texture promises aging. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Lamothe Guignard 2011  Sauternes

Description: This energized white wine has a German accent. Aromas recall honey, honeysuckle, tart apple and pineapple, and the flavors are like orange zest—tart, crisp and slightly bitter in a good way. This blend of Kerner, Gewürztraminer, Riesling and Bacchus grapes should be brilliant with rich shellfish. It was barrel-fermented in 60% new oak, which one can't so much taste as feel subtly.
Name: Borra 2012 Markus Nimmo White (California)

Description: A unique personality reveals itself through the subtle but exotic aromas, rich texture and vivid but not overripe fruit flavors. It tastes and feels substantial and full bodied. Vivid acidity buoys up everything and helps the finish linger. A blend of Roussanne, Marsanne, Viognier and Picpoul Blanc, it tastes like it will improve with age. Best now through 2018.
Name: Alder Springs 2013 Apex 39 White (Mendocino)

Description: Already well balanced between botrytis and fresh fruits, this structured wine could develop quickly. The acidity, pineapple and apricot flavors are up front along with a dry structure with great potential. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château de Myrat 2011  Sauternes

Description: Touches of toast from the wood aging give a spicy character. The toast brings out acidity at this stage rather than sweetness, with lemon and lime flavors dominant over the honey and botrytis in the background. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Broustet 2011  Barsac

Description: This wine is almost dry initially. Then sweeter yellow stone fruits come through along with bitter marmalade and pineapple acidity. They make for a wine that is fresh while structured and promising good aging.
Name: Château Romer du Hayot 2011  Sauternes

Description: From 30-year old Trebbiano, Malvasia and Vermentino vines, this savory white reveals aromas of white flower, ripe peach, tropical fruit, citrus peel and ginger that carry over to the palate. Juicy and concentrated flavors are energized by mineral notes balanced by crisp acidity.
Name: Podere San Cristoforo 2012 Luminoso White (Maremma Toscana)

Description: The initial impression of this wine is almost dry. That comes from the dense structure as well as the complex interplay between botrytis and acidity. Yellow fruits and bitter oranges show well, giving both acidity and final sweetness. Drink from 2018
Name: Château Caillou 2011  Barsac

Description: A blend of Trebbiano, Malvasia and Vermentino, this attractive white opens with aromas of white flower and pear. The vibrant, chiseled palate offers white peach, nectarine and mineral alongside crisp acidity that gives a clean, vertical finish.
Name: Podere San Cristoforo 2013 Luminoso White (Maremma Toscana)

Description: This is a wood-aged wine beautifully perfumed with acidity and tight spice. Peaches and apricots shine from the glass along with almonds, nutmeg and acidity. It's rich and weighty, needing to age a little longer. Drink from 2016.
Name: Le Nardian 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wood-aged wine achieves a good balance between the toast and the bright citrus fruits. It's ripe, full of fruitiness and with a crisp texture that contrasts with the smoky backdrop. The aftertaste suggests the wine will benefit from another year's aging, so drink from 2016.
Name: Château Lamothe de Haux 2012 Valentine par Valentine Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This Catalonian white is 98% Garnatxa Blanca (with a few drops of Viognier), and it's light on the nose, with mild apple, melon and pear aromas. A mix of melony weight and lime-like acidity leads to a ripe flavor profile with banana, honeydew and powdered sugar notes. A dab of honey and a touch of sweet almond work the finish on this easygoing quaffer.
Name: Celler Bàrbara Forés 2013 Blanc White (Terra Alta)
