Description: A blend of Vermentino, Viognier and Petit Manseng, this charming white opens with aromas of Spanish broom, Mediterranean brush, beeswax and apricot. The palate delivers lychee, mature yellow peach and candied nectarine while a ginger note adds a bit of depth.
Name: Donna Olimpia 1898 2011 White (Bolgheri)

Description: Aromas of beeswax, mature stone fruit and yellow flower lead the nose on this blend of 85% Vermentino, 10% Viognier and 5% Petit Manseng. The ripe palate offers dried apricot, candied citrus and ginger drop alongside soft acidity.
Name: Donna Olimpia 1898 2012 White (Bolgheri)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend has a slightly meaty, chicken-broth aroma from the Sémillon, and toasty, buttery flavors from the Chardonnay, followed by a lingering finish. It is medium bodied, silky, smooth and elegant.
Name: Fenestra 2013 Semonnay White (Livermore Valley)

Description: Cadillac faces Barsac and Sauternes across the Garonne river and shares the same autumn conditions that give the noble rot in the sweet wines. This wine offsets sweetness with a fresh, lemon marmalade crispness to give a well-balanced, ready-to-drink wine.
Name: Château Lamothe de Haux 2009 Château Manos Réserve du Château  (Cadillac)

Description: Waxy, dusty aromas of stone fruits and honey are typical of Garnatxa Blanca, although this contains 30% Viognier as well. A citrusy, direct palate with cutting acidity sets up lemon, tangerine and green-apple flavors. Only on the finish does this taste mildly yeasty and slightly buttery.
Name: Edetària 2013 Via Edetana White (Terra Alta)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Perfume and spice mark this intensely fruity, blossomy blend. Intense grapefruit and lemon flavors are invigorating and racy on the palate, accented by a lingering mineral finish.
Name: Goose Watch 2013 Gewürztraminer-Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Description: This blend of Alder Ridge Roussanne (68%) and Antoine Creek Viognier offers notes of pear, apricot and flowers. It's elegant in style with a lightly viscous feel.
Name: Waters 2013 Prelude White (Washington)

Description: Spice, wood and acidity make an attractive combination in this wine that comes from a chalky corner of the Mouton-Rothschild estate. It's ripe, full of yellow fruits and with a salty edge and crisp, fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2012 Aile d'Argent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This wine is all fruit, crisp and with plenty of herbaceousness. A smoother character comes from the Sémillon in the blend that also gives richness. The wood aging shows only lightly, leaving fruitiness at the end.
Name: Château Haut Selve 2013  Graves

Description: A blend of 60% Vermentino and 40% Viognier, this presents a delicate fragrance of honeysuckle and stone fruit. The bright palate offers creamy white peach and tangerine, with a candied ginger note on the close.
Name: Giorgio Meletti Cavallari 2013 Borgeri White (Bolgheri)

Description: This opens with a pretty floral fragrance of acacia, Spanish broom and chamomile. The palate doles out white peach and tangerine zest alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Campo al Mare 2013 White (Bolgheri)

Description: This Riesling, Muscat and Viognier blend marries the best of each and provides a lot of value. Aromas suggest apricot, white flowers, orange peel and freshly baked biscuits. It drinks full bodied and dry, but with sweet fruit flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: Huston 2012 Chicken Dinner White

Description: Subdued is a good way to describe this light-bodied white made from Chardonnay, Chenin Blanc and Gewürztraminer. It has subtle aromas of honey and flowers, fresh but quiet peach flavors and a soft texture.
Name: Kitchen Sink NV White (California)

Description: Strongly aromatic, this wood-aged wine is perfumed with both toast and smokiness. The palate has fruit, but the acidity both from that fruit and the wood dominates, suggesting the wine needs to age. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château de Portets 2013  Graves

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend of 41% Chardonnay, 26% Marsanne, 18% Roussanne and 15% Viognier shows notes of grilled sweet corn on the cob and Golden Delicious apple. It's broad in feel but seems to only have one trick to show.
Name: Patterson 2013 Mélange Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend of 50% Viognier, 19% Chardonnay, 19% Sauvignon Blanc and 12% Pinot Gris offers notes of pear and flowers. It's broad and creamy in feel with stone fruit flavors on the finish.
Name: Genoa 2013 Springline Super Tuscan-style White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh apple aromas and lively citrus flavors make a good combination in this light-bodied, tangy-textured wine. It tastes slightly rounded with sweetness, but comes off clean, crisp and appetizing. The two main components are Sémillon and Chardonnay, with dashes of Sauvignon Blanc and Orange Muscat.
Name: Murrieta's Well 2013 The Whip White (Livermore Valley)

Description: Tropical, floral aromas are modest but enchanting. Plump and balanced on the palate, this blend tastes a bit yeasty and creamy, with green banana and herbal infusions. A floral finish shows a touch of bitterness.
Name: Alfredo Roca 2014 Roca Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Mendoza)

Description: Light wood aging sets the scene for this crisp and herbaceous wine. Citrus fruits give a juicy character and contrast with the mineral texture coming from the stony vineyard. It's a fresh wine to drink now.
Name: Château de Perligues 2013  Graves

Description: Lightly fruity in aroma and flavor, this has a very smooth, soft texture and just a hint of citric crispness for balance. It is medium bodied, clean and fresh.
Name: Cambridge & Sunset 2013 White (California)

Description: This unusual blend made from Verdelho, Pinot Gris and Pinot Blanc grapes is dry, reasonably fruity and smooth in texture. It starts with canteloupe aromas, goes to golden apple flavors and leaves an earthy touch of walnut on the finish.
Name: Las Positas 2013 Verdigris White (California)

Description: Some Sémillon in the blend gives this wine richness as well as a proper youthful crispness. It's bright, fresh and lively, almost too young to drink. Best to wait until summer 2015.
Name: Château Lamothe de Haux 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Despite the label indication that this wine is Sauvignon Blanc, it does in fact have 20% Sémillon. That addition fills out the wine while retaining the natural herbaceous character with its grassy texture and strongly citrus flavors. Drink now.
Name: Château des Tourtes 2013  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: This nicely fruity, fresh wine presents a blend of apple, floral and slightly sweet flavors wrapped in a pleasing texture. Medium bodied, it tastes like a colorful fruit bowl concentrated into one glass.
Name: Fenestra NV True White Lot 2 White (California)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Full in flavor and body, this sturdy wine based on Viognier, Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Gris with a dash of Chardonnay has crisp acidity to keep it lively. It smells like pears and honeydew melon and tastes dry but generous and a little buttery, and finishes clean.
Name: Novy 2013 Four Mile Creek White (North Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of six different varieties with Chardonnay (35%) and Marsanne (19%) taking the lead, this medium-sweet wine suggests tangerine, sweet corn and crème fraîche, with some of the aromas and flavors seeming to tussle.
Name: Patterson 2013 Fordbidden White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Herbaceous, crisp and fruity, this fresh wine has citrus, juicy apple and a hint of yellow fruits as well as bright acidity. It's totally ready to drink.
Name: Pezat 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a totally herbaceous wine with no messing around. It has fresh acidity, crisp green fruitiness and lively acidity. Just a touch of wood gives a more sophisticated edge. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château de Callac 2013 Prestige  (Graves)

Description: Peach and powdered sugar aromas are first up, followed by a round palate with oily weight but also zesty acidity. Racy citrus and nectarine flavors finish full and chunky, with a pithy note.
Name: Zuccardi 2014 Serie A Chardonnay-Viognier (Uco Valley)

Description: This delicate but lively wine has bright minty, leafy, lime and rose petal aromas, plus juicy grapefruit flavors. It is light to medium bodied, fresh, aromatic, slightly sweet and easy to enjoy.
Name: Kitchen Sink NV White (California)

Description: This has an apple-cider aroma, red-apple flavors and a rounded texture. Medium-bodied, it is soft, tastes mellow and almost sleepy in personality.
Name: Peirano 2011 The Other White (Lodi)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: With very neutral aromas and flavors, this medium-bodied and reasonably crisp wine will be fine for everyday meals. Made from 60% Chardonnay and 40% Viognier, it is quiet and subdued. .
Name: Avelina 2012 Ringer White (North Coast)

Description: 97–99. Barrel Sample. Apricot tones with lively acidity give this rich wine a vein of freshness. Pear and white peach notes offer weight, while a lime backbone brings levity. There is a richness from the botrytis that is lifted by this wines delicious freshness.
Name: Château d'Yquem 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 96–98. Barrel Sample. Aromatic with the a note of wildflower honey, the palate brings white fruit flavors and rich botrytis power. The midpalate is densely concentrated with fruit tones, yet lightened by a vein of acidity.
Name: Château Coutet 2014 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. It takes time for this wine to reveal itself, eventually showing power and grace, with great concentration and contrasting freshness. From stone fruit to tropical fruit, an entire range of flavors appear on the rich palate, creating an opulent wine balanced by fresh acidity.
Name: Château Rabaud-Promis 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. This wine shows great concentration, with rich honey and botrytis tones, leading to ripe apricot and peach. It's opulent and powerful character completely takes hold of the palate, yet by the end, lively acidity kicks in.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. The wine shows intensity and concentration, offering ripe yellow fruits and honeyed sweetness tempered by boytritis. Initially, it seems to be all sweetness, then that essential acidity creeps in with the wonderful freshness of squeezed lemon.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. Piled with richness and weight, this wine is ripe with honey flavors. The opulence is balanced by a line of acidity and brings the wine to a fine conclusion showing beautiful freshness and intensity.
Name: Château Rieussec 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Showing wonderful concentration of fine honey and botrytis, this is a forward wine. Fine acidity frames layers of marmalade, tangerine and lime tones. This will develop slowly and richly.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. While the texture is rich, the flavors are muted at this stage. It does have an opulent character that will develop to give ripe yellow fruit tones. Rich in nature, a vein of acidity runs under all this concentration. It will need time to develop and will age slowly.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2014 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Lime and ripe pear tones are made richer by the yellow fruits that power out of this wine. Showing nice weight and freshness, this wine will be powerful and hugely concentrated.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This is a very concentrated wine that is full of ripe fruit tones. Generous in texture, opulent yellow fruit flavors are balanced by bright acidity that slowly develops. The end is both crisp and very sumptuous.
Name: Château Lamothe Guignard 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Fresh lime tones bring a touch of bitterness to this otherwise ripe and opulent wine. Lively lime intensity on the palate adds considerable freshness to the very sweet yellow fruits and crisp pear that pervade. It is going to be a very fine, concentrated and intense wine.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. A touch of vanilla on the nose leads to a full palate of rich honey and ripe yellow fruits. A lively acidity brings a crisp counterbalance to this weight, offering a bright citrus verve.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2014 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. With an lime element, this wine is as fresh and fragrant on the nose. Deliciously fruity with ripe yellow fruits on the palate, an intense acidity brings a vein of freshness on the finish.
Name: Château Guiraud 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: In keeping with his practice of making vineyard, rather than varietal wines, Marcel Deiss blends this wine from different members of the Pinot family. It has a strongly dry spice element as well as fresher fruit and a touch of pears. Complex, it needs to age several years, so drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2012 Mambourg Grand Cru White (Alsace)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Opulent honey notes dominate the flavor of this super-rich wine. A dry core of botrytis gives an almost mineral character to the wine. Full bodied, a blend of apricot and crisp pear notes are generous and concentrated.
Name: Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This is a complete wine that continues the success of Pavillon Blanc in recent years. It has great acidity that partners with ripe green fruits. All this acidity and freshness are given a twist of minerality at the end.
Designation: Pavillon Blanc du Château Margaux Barrel Sample
Name: Château Margaux 2014 Pavillon Blanc du Château Margaux Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine has weight as well as a strong fresh line of acidity, which cuts right through the rich botrytis and honey character. It's intense, with lemon, bitter marmalade and orange peel flavors.
Name: Château d'Arche 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine is very fresh, brimming with lime and grapefruit flavors. Then, slowly, layers of rich yellow fruits begin to unfold. The botrytis is in the texture rather than the taste. It still needs time to fully integrate.
Name: Château Filhot 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This is a full, concentrated wine. Intense citrusy acidity supports the full-bodied texture. It will become rich in layers of honey and botrytis with time; for now, the freshness dominates, finishing bright and crisp.
Name: Château Nairac 2014 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This is a fresh wine, packed with crisp acidity and flavors of bitter marmalade and lime . At the same time, there is a concentrated undertow that gives the wine both weight and potential. You can feel the botrytis in the texture, though it does not overwhelm the wine.
Name: Château Broustet 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine is dense and full, packed with rich honey flavors and botrytis accents. It is certainly opulent and ripe, while the acidity creeps in slowly at the end.
Name: Château Caillou 2014 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This is ripe and packed with fresh peach and apricot flavors. The texture has some tension from a powerful streak of botrytis, while the fresh finish is fruity and mouthwatering.
Name: Château de Malle 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: Very pretty aromas suggest lychee, Spanish broom, Mediterranean brush and a balsamic sensation. The linear palate delivers nectarine, creamy green apple and savory herb while edgy acidity generates a crisp, clean finish. It closes on an energized mineral note.
Name: Barone di Villagrande 2013 Bianco Superiore  (Etna)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This wine is fresh and full of lemon acidity. It is intense in citrus notes, with a tight texture and a crisp yet bitter note of orange marmalade. The botrytis and bright fruit flavors are both there, coming together slowly.
Name: Château Romer du Hayot 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This is rich and full in the mouth, with honeyed marmalade and orange zest flavors that are embedded in rich yellow fruits and botrytis tones. It's a well-composed wine that has weight and density.
Name: Château de Myrat 2014 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: Delicate, attractive aromas of chamomile, pear and brimstone lead the nose on this graceful wine. The linear palate delivers green apple, juicy pear, savory herb and mineral alongside fresh acidity. It's linear, vertical and elegant. Hold for complexity. Drink 2015–2020.
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2013 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: A creamy concoction of estate-grown 57% Sauvignon Blanc and 43% Sauvignon Gris, this silky wine offers a high-toned sense of effervescence. Pear and lime rise to the fore giving an intriguing edge, teased in balanced acidity.
Name: Chimney Rock 2012 Elevage Blanc Sauvignon Blanc-Sauvignon Gris (Napa Valley)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This has plenty of freshness, with typical Sauvignon Blanc-based acidity and green fruit notes. It also has a strong streak of minerality and subtle richness that lends balance to the palate.
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2014 Aile d'Argent Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Intense butterscotch and toast aromas dominate. This barrel-fermented Viura is round, full and not at all flabby or shaky despite being very ripe. Flavors of melon and apple are sweet and oaky, while the finish is long, structured and nutty, creamy and buttery in flavor. Just 100 cases of this highly individual white were made. Drink through 2017.
Name: Finca Allende 2012 Martires White (Rioja)

Description: Made with Carricante and 5% Riesling planted at high altitudes on the slopes of Mount Etna, this vibrant, mineral-driven wine opens with intense aromas of white flower, tropical fruit and stone fruit. The linear palate doles out juicy white peach, tart green apple, mineral and mint alongside bright acidity. It's elegant and balanced, with a citrusy finish.
Name: Planeta 2013 Eruzione 1614 White (Sicilia)

Description: A surprisingly fragrant nose recalls peach blossom, hay, Spanish broom and apple. Racy acidity balances the creamy pear, white peach and dried herb flavors, while an energizing mineral note closes the  lingering finish.
Name: Tenuta di Fessina 2013 Erse Bianco  (Etna)

Description: A blend of 70% Carricante and 30% Catarratto, this elegant white features aromas of acacia flower, broom, crushed rock and crunchy white fruit. The focused, linear palate delivers juicy green apple, citrus and a mineral vein alongside brisk acidity that gives it a pristine finish.
Name: Graci 2013 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. There is just a streak of herbaceousness here, but the core of this wine boasts ripe yellow-fruit notes and a touch of spice from the wood aging.
Name: Château Cos d'Estournel 2014 Cos d'Estournel Blanc Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. A rare white from the vineyards of Saint-Émilion, this is fresh and delicately perfumed. It is crisp in spiced pear and sliced apple flavors that are supported by intense acidity.
Name: Château Monbousquet 2014 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: With an extra 10 months en tirage, this blend of Pinot Noir (58%) and Chardonnay is light copper-colored, with appealing notes of strawberries and cream. It has tart, racy green apple-like acids with mineral notes lingering on the finish.
Name: Syncline NV Scintillation Celilo Vineyard Brut White (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: romas recall peach blossom, pear and chamomile. On the palate, notes of dried herb and a touch of vanilla accent juicy apple and white peach. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors that follow through to the mineral close. Drink through 2018.
Name: Al-Cantàra 2013 Luci Luci Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Made with 100% native grape Carricante, this offers delicate aromas of honeysuckle, broom, brimstone and a note of stone fruit. The vertical palate offers green apple, citrus peel, mineral and rosemary, while aging in casks adds a layer of complexity. It's impeccably balanced with bright acidity.
Name: Graci 2012 Arcurìa Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Intriguing aromas of Spanish broom, hay, mature pear and dried Mediterranean herb carry over to the palate along with green apple and dill. It's balanced and fresh, with a mineral-driven finish.
Name: Wiegner 2012 Elisena White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made from 60% Inzolia and 40% Catarratto, this thoroughly enjoyable wine delivers aromas of Mediterranean brush and citrus. The tangy sensations carry over to the palate with a blast of nectarine and lemon zest alongside savory saline flavors. Bright acidity gives a crisp finish.
Name: Hauner 2013 Salina White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Butterscotch, candle wax, stone fruit and leesy, dusty aromas introduce this blend of 90% Viura and 10% Malvasia that features a ripe yet balanced mouthfeel. Banana, walnut and vanilla are the key flavors in this barrel-rich Rioja that is nutty in style and long on the finish.
Designation: Finca La Reñana Seleccíon Elaborado en Roble Blanco
Name: Luis Alegre 2012 Finca La Reñana Seleccíon Elaborado en Roble Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: Dusty, nutty aromas of baked apple are mature and pretty. This blend of 90% Viura and 10% Malvasia feels healthy, round and whole, with balancing acidity. Peach, melon and baked apple flavors finish long and secure. For a four-year-old white Rioja, this is in fine shape. Drink through 2016.
Name: Finca Allende 2011 Malvasia-Viura (Rioja)

Description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. The aromatic Muscadelle is the success story of this fruity wine. The ripe yellow-fruit notes are generous, with a twist of lemon acidity on the finish.
Name: Le Nardian 2014 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A blend of 70% Carricante, 15%, Catarratto and 15% Grillo this offers aromas of dried Spanish broom, candied lemon peel and a hint of butterscotch. The ripe palate offers mature apple, candied ginger and mineral, with a note of bitter almond on the close. Made without added sulfites.
Name: Emmi Veruccia 2013 Quantico Bianco  (Etna)

Description: If you like Txakoli's high acidity and spritzy feel, then this is one of the best on the market. Waxy aromas of honeyed apple, warm radiator dust and cider are complex and pure. In the mouth, malic acidity rules, while flavors of nectarine, green apple and stony minerals finish long and pure.
Name: Txomín Etxaníz 2013 Getaria White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: Made mostly with red grape Nerello Mascalese vinified as a white wine, this conveys a pretty fragrance of wild flower, dried herb and hay. The round palate offers tropical fruit, McIntosh apple, flinty mineral and rosemary alongside energizing acidity.
Name: Terrazze dell'Etna 2012 Ciuri  (Etna)

Description: Packaged in bottles sporting a colorful, phantasmagorical label, this blend of Carricante and Grecanico opens with a lovely fragrance of white and yellow spring flower, juicy white tree fruit and savory herb. The vibrant palate offers creamy apple and pear, citrus mineral and a note of candied ginger.
Name: Al-Cantàra 2013 Occhi di Ciumi Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Delicate but inviting aromas suggest Spanish broom, stone fruit and lychee. The palate is round but vibrant, boasting juicy white peach, creamy green apple, energizing mineral and a citrus note.
Name: Cantine Russo 2013 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. The acidity is the strongest element in this wine. It is fresh and lively, with crisp pear and citrus notes. The botrytis element is less obvious, resulting in a wine that is fruity and fresh.
Name: Château Romer 2014 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: Made from a blend of various aromatic grapes, this smooth dessert wine delivers dry apricot, candied tangerine, hazelnut and Mediterranean herb flavors. It has a lingering, polished finish.
Name: Feudo Arancio 2010 Hekate White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This pale apricot-colored semidry wine is a blend of Cabernet Franc and Sauvignon Blanc. Aromas of butterscotch and nectarine get the taste buds prepared for flavors of butterscotch, peach, rose petal and nutmeg. It is a gently sweet wine that is not at all cloying, with nicely balanced acidity.
Name: Tulip Winery 2013 White Franc White (Judean Hills)

Description: Aromas of dried yellow flower, lemon zest, pear and a balsamic note lead the nose on this blend of Carricante and 20% Catarratto. The linear palate delivers mature yellow apple, citrus and a  vein of mineral.
Name: Antichi Vinai 1877 2013 Petralava Bianco  (Etna)

Description: A blend of Gewürztraminer and Sauvignon Blanc, this presents a bouquet of melon and grapefruit. Bold spice flavors, in particular clove, anise and spearmint, are nicely contrasted against flavors of lemon and lime. It offers a harmonious balance of baking spices and citrus notes backed by a strong vein of acidity.
Name: Tulip Winery 2013 White Tulip White (Galilee)

Description: Aromas suggest oregano, thyme and eucalyptus with a balsamic note. The palate offers citrus peel, anisette, mature pear, lemon drop and hints of petrol and menthol.
Name: Scilio 2012 1815 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: A delicate floral fragrance of white flower, pear, citrus, hay and a hint of beeswax and Mediterranean herb lead the nose. The palate is polished and bright, showing green apple, citrus and mineral alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Nicosia 2013 Fondo Filara Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of Spanish broom, acacia and white tree fruit take shape in the glass. On the palate, crisp acidity balances mature golden apple, pear, mineral and dried Mediterranean herb.
Name: Masseria Setteporte 2013 N'ettaro Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of oak, dill, lemon drop and mature apple lead the nose. The palate offers up toasted notes, vanilla, butterscotch, candied ginger, yellow apple and mineral alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Girolamo Russo 2013 Nerina Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Dusty and leesy on the nose, this blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca smells of peach pits and oak. Creamy on the palate, this is a touch flat but not flabby. Banana, melon, vanilla and pecan flavors end with a barrel-heavy mix of vanilla and butter.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2012 Organza White (Rioja)

Description: Toast, hay, pear, light ginger and savory herb aromas take shape in the glass. The linear palate offers tart green apple, citrus, brimstone and a smoky note, while crisp acidity adds freshness.
Name: Costantino 2013 DeAetna Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Pretty aromas of lychee, Spanish broom, white tree fruit and a whiff of aromatic herb take shape in the glass. The juicy palate offers Bartlett pear, green apple, citrus and a clean mineral finish.
Name: Tornatore 2013 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: An attractive blend of Viognier and Chardonnay, this is smooth and perfumed, while also keeping enough acidity for freshness. The wine is all about the fruit, with the aromatic Viognier given a sophisticated edge by the ripe Chardonnay. Drink from 2015.
Name: Quinta do Pinto 2013 Viognier-Chardonnay (Lisboa)

Description: The unusual but inviting medley of aromas include Mediterranean herb, sea salt, oregano, citrus and dried yellow flower. On the round palate, a saline note backs mature pear, creamy yellow apple and nectarine zest. It closes on a buttery note.
Name: I Custodi 2012 Ante Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Made with organic farming and production methods, this conveys delicate, pretty aromas of yellow flower, juicy peach and mineral that all carry over to the palate, along with apple and a ginger note. It's elegant and fresh with bright acidity. Drink through 2018.
Name: Vivera 2013 Altrove White (Sicilia)

Description: This offers aromas of honeydew melon and vanilla. On the palate, gentle flavors of nutmeg, cinnamon and eucalyptus predominate over a bright burst of citrus. Tannins are a tad bold for a relatively delicate white wine, but they are tempered by baking spice flavors that wash across the tongue and notes of tangerine on the back palate.
Name: Dalton 2013 Alma Semillon-Viognier-Pinot Gris White (Galilee)

Description: Clean, peachy aromas set up a light, minerally, citrusy body. Flavors of gooseberry, lime and lemon hold steady and double up on gooseberry on the finish. Overall, this is round, minerally and elegant, but also slightly sour and edgy.
Name: Gorka Izagirre 2013 White (Bizkaiko Txakolina)

Description: Pear, apple and nectarine aromas are mild and pleasant. This is 75% Merseguera with Viognier and Malvasia, grapes that are common in the Levante even though this carries a generic “Spain” designation. Layered yet fresh in feel, with apple and nectarine flavors, this offers moderate oily weight and pithy bitterness on the finish. Unusual and unknown for the most part, this wine has good character.
Name: Mustiguillo 2013 Mestizaje Merseguera-Malvasía-Viognier White (Spain)

Description: Subdued aromas of Spanish broom and brimstone float from the glass. The vertical palate offers yellow apple, citrus zest and mineral alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Contrada Santo Spirito di Passopisciaro 2012 Animalucente Bianco  (Etna)

Description: A blend of Grillo, Catarratto and Inzolia, this vibrant wine opens with delicate aromas of white flower, tropical fruit and a hint of beeswax. On the palate, creamy white peach is energized by nectarine zest and crisp acidity.
Name: Spadafora 2013 Don Pietro White (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sleek yet strong aromas of canned peach, white flowers and banana-lemon custard characterize this blend of Viognier, Riesling, Sauvignon Blanc, Chardonnay and Pinot Gris from both Monterey and Paso Robles. Fleshy tropical notes of banana and mango rule the palate, with marzipan and vanilla-laced smoke too. A bitter citrus rind tension holds throughout.
Name: San Antonio 2012 Heritage Blanc White (Central Coast)

Description: Made with organically grown grapes, this opens with aromas of white flower, citrus and tropical fruit. The juicy palate doles out nectarine, exotic fruit, dried apricot and a hint of vanilla alongside racy acidity.
Name: Feudo di Santa Tresa 2013 Rina Ianca White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Dusty, leesy aromas of vanilla bean, banana and saline set up a snappy palate with flavors of citrus, papaya and nut skins. On the finish, this blend of Chardonnay and Viura offers easy flavors of papaya, melon and almond. Despite being barrel fermented, this is decidedly not oaky.
Name: Tandem 2013 Inmácula White (Navarra)

Description: This blend of Carricante and 20% Catarratto features aromas of dried chamomile flower, Spanish broom and acacia. The bright palate delivers citrus, raw pear, mineral and almond.
Name: Firriato 2013 Cavanera Ripa di Scorciavacca Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Aromas include tropical fruit, broom, brimstone and dried herb. The palate isn't overly expressive, offering unripened apple, citrus and dried sage alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Nicosia 2013 Vulkà Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Since first hitting the market in 2011, this blend of Merseguera, Viura and Moscatel has been improving. This vintage marks a high point. Aromas of apple and peach are followed by a textured palate, while flavors of apple and citrus are mild. The finish is bouncy, weighty and straightforward in flavor.
Name: Volver 2013 Tarima Blanco White (Alicante)

Description: Delicate aromas recall white flower and citrus. The palate offers passion fruit, lime and white peach with a hint of mineral alongside bright acidity.
Name: Baglio di Pianetto 2007 Ficiligno White (Sicilia)

Description: Yeasty, dusty aromas of mango, lychee and other tropical fruits set up a plump, round palate with vanilla, tropical fruit and caramel flavors. The yeasty, oaky theme carries onto the finish, which is loaded with banana and melon. This is 80% Chardonnay and 20% Viognier.
Name: Cueva de las Manos 2013 Reserve White (Mendoza)

Description: Pretty aromas of yellow flower and stone fruit lead the nose. The bright palate offers yellow apple, apricot, vanilla and delicate notes of lightly toasted oak alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Stemmari 2013 Dalila White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Dusty smelling and a touch dilute on the nose, this Viura-Chardonnay blend displays aromas of green apple, citrus and vanilla. The palate is juicy, citric and clean, with tangerine, lemon peel and white grapefruit flavors. This is an ideal quaffing wine.
Name: Las Valles 2013 Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)

Description: Waxy stone-fruit aromas come with a shot of butterscotch but also a whiff of chemical cleanser. In the mouth, this blend of Viura and Malvasia is full-bodied and braced by sharp acidity. Flavors of walnut, baked peach and citrus peel finish with nutty notes and angular acidity. At six years of age, this is showing some gaps in its fiber.
Name: Casado Morales 2009 Reserva White (Rioja)

Description: While this is largely neutral-smelling, it's flush in the mouth, with pithy citrus and green apple flavors. Lasting and steady on the finish, this blend of Chardonnay and Muscat is juicy and alert after initial dull aromas. Maritime Wine Trading Collective, Vintage Wines Inc.
Name: Bodegas San Valero 2013 Particular White (Cariñena)

Description: A blend of Carricante and Catarratto, this straightforward wine conveys delicate aromas of Spanish broom and acacia flower. The bright palate offers yellow apple, chamomile and a mineral note alongside brisk acidity. Enjoy soon.
Name: Murgo 2013 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: A blend of Inzolia, Catarratto and Grillo, this opens with delicate aromas of Spanish broom and citrus. The vibrant, easy-drinking palate offers nectarine, lime and a saline note alongside zesty acidity for a refreshing finish.
Name: Colosi 2013 Bianco White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: High-toned acidity glares a lemon-lime spotlight onto tart stone fruit and fresh herb tones in this blend. Dry and delicate in body, it's on the austere side, but vibrant and refreshing.
Name: Weegmüller 2012 Cuvee Fleur Gewürztraminer-Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: Tropical fruit and citrus lead the nose on this lively white. The palate offers passion fruit, nectarine zest and white peach alongside crisp acidity that gives a clean finish.
Name: Barone Montalto 2013 Grillo-Sauvignon White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Fermented entirely in stainless steel this unusual combination of 75% Sauvignon Blanc and 25% Chenin Blanc is clean, crisp and straightforward in lemon zest. With wet stone on the midpalate, it finishes quick.
Name: CULT 2013 Sauvignon Blanc-Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Stalky, flat scents vie for attention with brighter citrus aromas on a bland nose. This Txakoli feels round but not too lively. Flavors of lettuce, green bean, green apple and tangerine finish with a hint of lime.
Name: Ulacia 2013 White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: This unusual white from the southeast corner of Spain smells cidery, with stone-fruit notes and a hint of mustard seed. The palate is juicy but doesn't offer shape or structure. Flavors of peach, mango and celery finish mild, with modest acidity.
Name: Bodegas Luzón 2013 Luzón Blanco White (Jumilla)

Description: This simple wine offers aromas of citrus, dried chamomile and a whiff of hay. The easy palate offers nectarine and lemon zest alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Feudi del Pisciotto 2013 Baglio del Sole White (Sicilia)

Description: A 50-50 blend of Insolia and Catarratto, this offers pretty aromas of white and yellow spring flowers. The fresh, informal palate delivers citrus peel and raw white peach alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Feudo Disisa 2013 Chara White (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Aromas of lemon chiffon, white flowers, lychee and lime are forward and attractive. A zesty, citric feel accompanies refreshing tangerine, nectarine and lime flavors. Tangy and edgy on the finish, this blend of Muscat and Chardonnay is snappy from front to back.
Name: Los Dos 2013 Muscat-Chardonnay White (Campo de Borja)

Description: Hailing from the hot plains of Extremadura, this is tawny in color, with odd aromas of honey, carrot juice and peach pit. The mouthfeel is flat, wide and heavy, while slightly bitter stone-fruit flavors finish chunky. Overall this is unfamiliar both in aromas and flavors.
Name: Antier 2012 Vintage White (Extremadura)

Description: This Viura-Chardonnay blend smells odd, as if musky cologne was blended with body oil. The palate seems caught between heavy and racy, while flavors of candied white fruits, apple and pear come with residual sugar and a sketchy foundation.
Name: Bodegas Paniza 2013 Agostón Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)

Description: Oxidized, yeasty aromas are not fresh. On the palate, this is spritzy, but oxidation creates a yeasty, bready blanket on top of basic pear and papaya. It finishes flat.
Name: Zudugarai 2013 White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: 97–99. Barrel Sample. This is a superb, very rich wine, full of great swathes of peaches and apricots. Powerful and round, it is still cut by the most beautiful acidity. The texture is tight, nervy and crisp while never losing its richness and opulence. This magnificent wine will age for decades.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. This is a finely fruity wine—all tangy acidity, crisp lemon and stone fruit. The wood aging shows in the notes of toast and burnt spice. It should all integrate well as it develops into a seriously ageworthy wine.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. This is a gorgeous wine, so rich and generous. At the same time, it has a direct purity of fruitiness, with a tense structure and crisp apple and lemon notes that give a nervous edge to the wine. It will be a wine to age for a seriously long time.
Name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. There are strong wood flavors in this wine, but there's also ripe fruit and ample acidity. It is an impressive wine that is balanced, rich and likely to age well.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Spice, fruit and a rich texture combine to give this wine a wonderful balance and style. As it develops, it is going to have moderate weight and serious intensity.
Name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This is a deliciously fruity wine that has fine poise between richness and ripe peach and red apple flavors. The tangy texture gives the wine extra complexity. It should age well, although it will also be attractive soon.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This is a richly fruity wine, with notes of green apple, plum and citrus as well as bright acidity on the finish. The weight and richness combined with ample acidity lend the promise of graceful development and aging.
Name: Château Picque Caillou 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This is a ripe, full wine that combines spice from wood aging with rich yellow- and white-fruit tones. It is textured, tight and nervy, and should develop nicely.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This is a rich wine, with notes of pineapple and peach that are balanced by a tight texture and attractive minerality. The wood aging just shows through, lending a spicy accent to the vibrant finish.
Name: Château de France 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Light and floral, this subtle dessert wine is made from Scheurebe grapes, more often found in Austria than California. It provides this wine with fresh apricot and honey on the palate, lingering yet low enough in alcohol and power to be enjoyed as either apéritif or digestif, its sweetness greatly restrained.
Name: Joseph Phelps 2013 Eisrébe White (Napa Valley)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This is a very fine wine, with intense acidity, green edges and smoky fruit flavors. It is complex and tightly textured, promising good aging potential.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Juicily ripe yellow Mirabelle plums have an edge of white pepper and smoky highlights that add deeper dimension. Gorgeously peppery arugula and watercress join on the palate, yet there is something incredibly fruity and round about this. While there is green savoriness, the wine itself is ripe, juicy and yellow-fruited.
Name: Wieninger 2013 Rosengartl White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This is a beautiful tropical fruit and spice-flavored wine. It has an exotic, ripe feel to it that is already attractive. The tight, mineral texture promises good aging.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Mellow, ripe Comice pear on the nose leads into a soft, expressive yet light-bodied palate that has slight spritz, subtle, pear-scented flavors and a mellowing earthiness surrounded by overtones of dandelion and jasmine. At the center there is acidic verve. This is very elegant and very balanced.
Name: Weingut Christ 2013 Bisamberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This is a truly herbaceous wine, although it also has fine sliced apple and white peach flavors. The combination, along with the ample acidity and minerality, results in a fine, balanced wine.
Name: Château la Louvière 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Spice and vanilla aromas lead to a wine that certainly shows considerable wood. The rich yellow-fruit tones give the wine ample weight and ripeness. This is a wine that will be slow to develop.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: The scent of freshly cut, green Conference pears plays subtly around the nose while the palate is more definite. Mouth-coating phenolic structure is countered by fresh acidity and warm alcohol. This still needs time to come into its own but promises an intriguing flavor bases of beeswax, fruit and earth.
Name: Wieninger 2013 Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This standout blend of Sémillon (60%) and Sauvignon Blanc dazzles with notes of fig, pineapple, kiwi and herbs. It's richly flavored, with a creamy texture and a supremely long finish.
Designation: Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2013 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Tight, nervy and textured, this wine is still masking its fruit with upfront toast flavors. It does, however, have great richness at the end that promises good things to come.
Name: Château Haut-Bergey 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Intensely herbaceous, this is a crisp wine that shines in fresh fruit notes. It has a bright acidity, with forward citrus and grapefruit flavors. The texture is light and fruity.
Name: Château la Garde 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is soft, full and rounded. It has yellow fruit notes and bright acidity that gives ample lift to the full-bodied character of the wine.
Name: Château Olivier 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc (60%) and Sémillon—all from Klipsun Vineyard—saw only eight months of neutral French barrel aging. It brings a pleasing assortment of fig, herbs, tropical fruit and corn silk notes with a broad, creamy texture and a drawn-out finish.
Name: Fidelitas 2013 Optu White (Red Mountain)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This fruity wine is driven by lemon and orange zest notes on the nose and palate. It is so fresh, crisp and tightly wrought, with beautiful acidity and a crisp. lively finish.
Designation: Le Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2014 Le Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Rich and fruity, this wine is open and generous. It has poise, with intense fruitiness and a tight, tangy texture. The acidity and lemon zest flavors at the end give a real lift.
Name: Château Ferrande 2014 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: Dry Jurançon has all the richness and hints of honey of its sweet partner. The two Manseng grapes give apricot, white peach and a full, ripe character that is cut by the typical acidity of these mountain vineyards. The wine, with its zesty aftertaste and delicious tension between fresh and rich, is ready to drink.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2012 Cami Salié  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This attractively tangy wine is also showing its wood aging flavors, with a streak of vanilla. It is tight and nervy, with green fruit flavors and a taut, mineral texture. It needs time to develop and harmonize.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Earthy yeastiness combined with soft lemon freshness creates a very savory wine. While the palate has umami-like spice, it also has a linear lick of clean lemon acid. The two work in contrast and will show their best with a mixed cheese platter.
Name: Dürnberg 2013 Ortolan Cuvée Prestive White (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: This blend of Petit Manseng and Petit Courbu is dry, although the Petit Manseng gives its characteristic hints of honey even here. It is floral, fragrant, rich and balanced. Acidity cuts through the richness to give shape and allow the texture to fill out. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Alain Brumont 2010 Château Montus Blanc  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Description: Melon, yellow apple, yeast and celery swirl on nose and palate, creating a savory, spicy vortex. Nuances of watercress and something even more savory, like lovage, lurk in fruity ripeness. Take time over this lovely, original wine and it will reveal almost all its secrets. The length is wonderful and apple-scented.
Name: Wieninger 2013 Bisamberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: A late-harvest blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Chardonnay and Sémillon from a good year for botrytis, this is dark gold in color. It offers sweet, lush and satisfying swaths of dried apple and orange that linger on the palate, finished with a drop of honey.
Name: Kunde 2011 Sweet Leslie Late Harvest White (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Dark golden in color, with a taste of caramel-toffee apple, this is the winery's classically produced late-harvest blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Riesling and Gewürztraminer. Recalling toasted caramel corn, fig and orange, the aromas are intense and the palate balanced.
Name: Grgich Hills 2012 Violetta Late Harvest White (Napa Valley)

Description: Grassy and pungent, this Sémillon-Sauvignon Blanc blend shows excellent structure and vivid fruit character. The grapefruit and pineapple flavors are accented with diesel highlights and a whiff of barrel toast.
Name: Black Hills 2013 Alibi Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Okanagan Valley)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Intense acidity and herbaceous notes are the hallmarks of this tight, green fruited wine. The Sauvignon Blanc—crisp and fresh—shines right through.
Name: Château Rahoul 2014 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Ripe apple flavors are pervaded by yeasty richness. The palate is more slender than the nose at first suggests and is made more lively by tight, spritzy acidity. Yeasty notes give an added earthiness and beautifully long finish.
Name: Weingut Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2013 Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This white blend is subtle, not overtly fruity, but has a complexity in the aroma that leads to an intriguing white peach and almond flavor, a rich mouthfeel and lingering finish. It's made from 62% Viognier, plus Muscat Canelli, Marsanne and Roussanne.
Name: Naggiar 2013 White Oleander White (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Distinctively greenish in tinge, this blend of Sauvignon Blanc (72%) and Sémillon is aromatic with notes of melon, kiwi and pineapple. It's creamy in feel, with fresh fig and tropical flavors.
Name: Cadaretta 2013 SBS White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The aromatic lift of spring blossom, honeysuckle and citrus zest characterizes this light, zesty, fruity and easy-drinking wine. The extended, zippy lemon finish adds real refreshment. Drinks as soon as there is a sunny day, this is not one for keeping.
Name: Dürnberg 2013 Falko Cool Climate Cuvée White (Niederösterreich)

Description: A second-label for Black Hills Estate Winery, this little gem overdelivers in every regard. Exceptionally fragrant, it's a mélange of floral, spice, mint and citrus aromas, cascading into a fruit-driven palate. Lemon, lime, apricot and papaya combine to provide a lush and vibrant set of flavors. Drink up while the freshness is in full force.
Name: Cellar Hand 2013 Free Run White (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: The white wine appellation of Pacherenc du Vic-Bilh covers the same area as the red Madiran. This dry wine, a blend of Petit Courbu and Petit Manseng is fat, full in the mouth with a smooth texture and rich acidity. It is ready to drink.
Name: Alain Brumont 2010 Les Jardins de Bouscassé  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Description: The gold capsule Oldfield Series wines occupy a sort of reserve tier. This is principally a blend of Chardonnay, Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc, with a splash of Viognier and Muscat adding aromatic highlights. Snappy citrus fruit and a light dusting of cinnamon makes this well-crafted wine a versatile, refreshing option for a variety of seafood and salad entrées.
Name: Tinhorn Creek 2013 Oldfield Series 2Bench White (Okanagan Valley)

Description: Oak-aged Sauvignon Blanc and Muscadelle give a full, rounded wine that may have lost some of its herbaceous character while gaining richness and full fruitiness. A hint of toast is just an adjunct to this mineral and fruit flavored wine. Drink now or until 2018.
Name: Château K 2013 White (Bergerac Sec)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Full-flavored and assertive, this has vivid herbal and citrus flavors that pop in the aromas and continue on the palate. It's full bodied, tangy, and mouth-filling, great for creamy pasta dishes and seafood.
Name: Novy 2013 White (North Coast)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Zesty and fragrant with notes of grapefruit and citrus blossom, this is an endlessly quaffable white with wide appeal. Juicy and fresh with a focused edge of acidity, it finishes briskly with just a touch of minerality.
Name: Macari 2013 Dos Aguas White (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This white blend offers tropical guava and fig amid thick, creamy layers and floral aromas.
Name: War Horse 2013 White (Napa Valley)

Description: 86–88. Barrel Sample. Confected, candy aromas lead to flavors of canned pineapple and an edgy texture of sweet, citrusy acidity. Its future is uncertain.
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2014 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: Pretty aromas of white spring flower, sage and apple lead the nose on this blend of 90% Fiano and 10% Chardonnay. The palate offers green apple, nectarine and lime alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Tommasi 2013 Masseria Surani Arthemis White (Puglia)

Description: This contains only 10% skinless Carmenère, so in essence it's Sauvignon Blanc. Peach and melon aromas are straightforward and mildly grassy. A fresh mouthfeel and simple flavors of tangerine, lime and grapefruit finish slightly pithy but steady.
Name: Tricky Rabbit 2014 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc-Carménère White (Maule Valley)

Description: This white blend of Gros Manseng and Petit Courbu, both local grapes for Saint-Mont, produces a ripe, floral wine with touches of honey. It is refreshing as well, with lime juice acidity that sails right through to the end.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2013 Hat Trick  (Saint-Mont)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Gascony was the birthplace of the Alexandre Dumas hero, D'Artagnan. This blended wine comes from vineyards around his childhood home. It has a wave of apples, oranges and zest fruitiness, with a crisp, fresh aftertaste.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2013 Terres d'Artagnan Cuvée Excellence White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: A big wine that is full-bodied, ripe, juicy with some green flavors and flashes of toast. Possibly over the top, it is still enjoyable in its broad way. It will be better in 2016.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2013 White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Chenin Blanc and Sémillon, it tastes like green apples sprinkled with herbs and white pepper, on a smooth texture with fairly full body. An appealing intensity lingers on the finish.
Name: Truth 2013 Cuvee de Fume White (California)

Description: This blend of 70% Chenin Blanc and 30% Sauvignon Blanc is clean, direct and easy to like. Aromas and flavors of orange pith, firm pear, melon rind and green plum abound. It's balanced and refreshing, with a bright, mouthwatering finish. Enjoy now.
Name: Beau Joubert 2013 Oak Lane Chenin Blanc-Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A blend of Colombard and Ugni Blanc, this crisp, light wine is as fresh as a daisy. Fruity and aromatic, it offers citrus and melon flavors. The fruit explodes in the mouth, leaving a light, bright aftertaste.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2013 Colombelle L'Originel White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Streaks of sweet cream and caramel accent delicate peach and apricot tones in this Chardonnay-dominant ice-style wine. Plush and yielding, it may come off a bit confected, but it's appealing nonetheless.
Name: Macari 2010 Block E White (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Brisk and bright, this straightforward white blend offers fresh apple and pear flavors accented with a streak of grapefruit acidity. It's dry in style with an easy, quaffable character.
Name: Baiting Hollow Farm Vineyard 2011 White Satin White (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This eclectic white blend is savory, with notes of pressed apples and nuts marked by a streak of high-intensity acidity. Dry and medium bodied, it's a straightforward wine at a reasonable price.
Name: Pumphouse 2012 White (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Honey blossom and grassy aromas are all right, but struggle to offer much fruit. An oily, full palate is home to honeyed flavors of peach, nectarine and melon. Bitterness is a major player on a chunky finish. The blend is 45% Riesling, 43% Chardonnay and 12% Viognier.
Name: Anakena 2013 Ona Special Reserve Riesling-Chardonnay-Viognier White (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Hints of popcorn and buttered toast accent flavors of pressed apple and pear on this easygoing semisweet Cayuga. It's delicate in frame, finishing with a bright burst of lemon-candy acidity.
Name: Palaia Vineyards NV Pearl White (New York)

Description: This blend of 10% skinless Carmenère and SB is almost entirely neutral on the nose, then soft on the palate. Flavors of honey and generic citrus fruits finish with amped-up pyrazines and bitterness.
Name: Oveja Negra 2013 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc-Carmenère White (Maule Valley)

Description: This is a vegetal, underripe wine, albeit one with a fresh palate. The nose, flavor profile and finish are decidedly green and pyrazinic. Made from 94% Sauvignon Blanc with Chardonnay and Viognier.
Name: Estampa 2013 Assemblage Reserve White (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pineapple and lemon cream pie converge on this viscous, deep-yellow blend of Chardonnay and Roussanne, made by urban winemaker Matthias Pippig on Santa Barbara's Eastside. There is an emergent acidity on the palate, powered by nectarine, but it's nicely dense and rich.
Name: Sanguis 2011 Out of Line White (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier is quite pale in color, with aromas of ripe pear and squeezed lemon. It's bright and lively on the palate, with cold crushed apples and pear blossoms bringing lots of life to the wine.
Name: Galante 2013 Wagon Wheel White (Carmel Valley)

Description: A delicious blend of Pinot Bianco, Chardonnay and Sauvignon, this delivers flavors of juicy Golden Delicious apple, lemon drop, nectarine and candied ginger. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy palate.
Name: Cantina Terlano 2011 Nova Domus Riserva White (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A blend of near-equal parts Viognier, Marsanne and Roussanne, this is aromatic with notes of corn on the cob, dried apricot and tangerine. The palate is full-bodied with sweet apricot flavors and a smoky finish (20% new French oak).
Name: Cowhorn 2013 Spiral 36 White (Applegate Valley)

Description: This wine combines 78% Sauvignon Blanc with 22% Viognier, an unusual mix that works well here. Gamy and creamy, it's a fuller style of wine with balanced acidity and a lingering mouthful of sweet white peach.
Name: Round Pond 2013 Proprietary White (Rutherford)

Description: Time in bottle has done nice things for this white, a blend of 85% Sauvignon Blanc (half of it fermented in oak) and 15% Sémillon. Caramel and vanilla dominate on the nose, with the palate crisp in fresh-squeezed lemon and tart apple, especially on the finish. The oak influence shows in positive ways, adding depth and creaminess to the texture.
Name: Greyscale 2011 Cuvée Blanc Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Napa Valley)

Description: Crystal-clear aromas of green apples and minerals come with a slight dash of oak. This is barrel-fermented Viura (with 10% Malvasia), but there's nothing woody or overtly barrel-dominated about the wine, which is tight and citric on the tongue, with tangerine, green apple and nectarine flavors that finish racy and tart.
Name: Muga 2013 Barrel Fermented White (Rioja)

Description: Made with 60% Gewurtztraminer and 40% Moscato Giallo, this dessert wine opens with aromas of dried white rose petal, stone fruit and pineapple. The palate delivers dried apricot, glazed orange zest and cinnamon alongside fresh acidity that carries through to the finish.
Name: Cantina Produttori Cortaccia 2012 Dolce Bianco Aruna White (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this secret blend is clean and tight, not showy at all, with just a touch of papaya and honey. It expands greatly on the palate with banana and melon, but wipes up quick with a fresh burst of acidity.
Name: Le Vigne 2013 Bianco White (Paso Robles)

Description: Made with Manzoni Bianco and Glera grapes, this opens with subdued aromas of acacia honey and mature stone fruit. The sweet palate delivers ripe yellow peach, candied ginger and toasted pine nuts.
Name: Case Paolin 2009 Soér Passito White (Veneto)

Description: A little wood aging has subdued the fruitiness of this wine while bringing out a rich character with touches of pineapple and honey as well as crisper lemon flavors. It's a wine in progress and will be better from 2016.
Name: Château de Sours 2012 La Source  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A richness in texture and and a lingering finish make this subtly flavored wine stand out. Fresh apple notes combine with floral tones in the aroma, and continue through the finish. The overall impression is of smoothness and full body.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2013 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Clarksburg)

Description: Fleshy aromas of melon and apple fold in a few crumbs of vanilla cookie. This Viura feels healthy and balanced, with white-fruit flavors accented by tropical notes and green herbs. On the finish, lettuce and lime flavors hold steady. Drink now.
Name: Vallobera 2013 Javier San Pedro White (Rioja)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This adventurous blend of 50% Sauvignon Blanc, 28% Viognier and 22% Grenache Blanc excites the nose with cut grass and lime zest. But it's most enthralling once sipped, boasting a lively acidity that wakes up the palate with green but not too tart apple flavors.
Name: ONX 2013 Field Day White (Paso Robles)

Description: Yellow fruits and a light touch of wood give this wine from the Haut-Médoc estate of Château Magnol richness and a fruity character. A more textured edge brings a crisper note to the party. Drink from 2015.
Name: Château Magnol 2013 Les Charmes de Magnol  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Powdery notes, bath oil and white-fruit aromas make for a fragrant nose. This is solid on the palate, with citric acidity and a slight oiliness to the feel. Flowery nectarine and orange flavors set up a weighty but fresh finish. Drink now.
Name: Terra do Castelo 2013 Selección White (Ribeiro)

Description: Floral, whitefruit aromas are mild on the nose. Citrus, melon and tropical fruit flavors ride on a balanced palate showing brightness without being sharp or scouring. The weighty finish of this Verdejo, Viura, and Sauvignon Blanc blend shows presence but isn't too heavy.
Name: Naia 2013 Las Brisas White (Rueda)

Description: Yellow in color, with floral and white fruit aromas, this wine is a touch blocky on the palate but overall is fine in terms of feel and balance. Flavors of nectarine and tropical fruit finish a bit oily and heavy.
Name: Terras Gauda 2013 O Rosal White (Rías Baixas)

Description: Peach and melon aromas with dustings of minerals reflect the Ribeiro region's cool-climate terroir. This is a good, honest white blend, with melon and mango notes driving the palate. Lime and mineral tones bring balance to the moderate residual sugar.
Name: Viña Costeira 2013 First One White (Ribeiro)

Description: An equal partnership between Chardonnay and Viognier, this wine is brisk and slightly austere, the nose floral in geranium and the fruit profile of apple, pear and pineapple light and subtle.
Name: Spann Vineyards 2012 Yin-Yang Chardonnay-Viognier (Sonoma County)

Description: While somewhat neutral on the nose, a modicum of citric acid creates zing on the palate. Flavors of almond skin, unripe banana, citrus and dry melon finish juicy but without much intensity. Drink now.
Name: Terra do Castelo 2012 Sensación White (Ribeiro)

Description: The blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon has produced an attractive, fruity wine that's young and fresh. Light and bright, with delicious final acidity, its structure suggests it could age; drink from the end of 2015.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2013 Passeport  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Dusty aromas of unripe melon and apple are pyrazinic. A bit of spritz greets you on the palate, while flavors of green citrus run heavy and pithy.
Name: Telmo Rodríguez 2013 Basa White (Rueda)

Description: Oily matchstick aromas are gritty and stalky. On the palate, this shows proper acidity and good overall feel. Flavors of lime, grapefruit and persimmon show mildly bitter pyrazines, while the finish is citric and controlled by a lime character.
Name: Bodegas Muriel 2013 Vendimia Seleccionada Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: Extremely oaky and resiny, this offers aromas of wood grain, resin, vanilla and sawdust that crowd out any fruit that might seek to escape. The palate feels heavy and resiny, with flavors of wood, vanilla and coconut, but again almost no fruit. This is 70% Chardonnay and 30% Sémillon.
Name: Bressia 2011 Lágrima Canela White (Mendoza)

Description: Very aromatic, this is a grassy, herbaceous and crisp wine. It is bright with lemon acidity, a light mineral texture and a lively aftertaste. It's ready to drink.
Name: Château de Crain 2012  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Citrus and herbaceousness dominate this light and fresh wine. It has crisp lime flavors, yellow fruits and perfumed acidity. Drink now, although it will be better in 2016.
Name: Château de Sours 2013 La Fleur d'Amélie  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This textured, mineral wine also has fresh and crisp Sauvignon herbaceous flavors. It is bright and lively, still on the young side and waiting for the Sémillon in the blend to show through. Drink from the end of 2015.
Name: Château de Sours 2013 La Source  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Strong grassy aromas and flavors come with an almost sweet feel in the mouth in this medium-bodied, rather soft-texured white wine. It's blended from Viognier, Chardonnay and French Colombard, and it's hard to say which one it resembles most.
Name: Hey Mambo 2013 White (California)

Description: This is soft, hinting at a sweeter side with its smooth texture and touch of honey. It's an attractive wine, ready to drink now.
Name: Caves de Rauzan 2013 Augey  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Fresh and herbaceous, this is a light, attractively fruity wine. It has bright acidity, green fruit and citrus flavors and is totally ready to drink.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2013 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Sweaty, pinched aromas are more alarming than inviting. The palate of this three-grape blend follows the nose and is angular and sharp. Flavors of green fruit and sour white grapefruit finish with borderline scouring acidity.
Name: Vivanco 2013 Viura-Malvasía-Tempranillo Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: Dusty tropical fruit aromas are scratchy and rough on the nose. Lemon-lime and powdered sugar flavors are not cloying due to vital acidity, while the finish is pithy and bitter at first, then sugary sweet.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2013 Satinela Medium Sweet White (Rioja)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This blend looks slightly more brassy than golden, smells like dried apples and tastes rather lean and almost chalky. It comes off as nervy and fully mature.
Name: Naggiar 2011 La Contessa Sylvana White (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Yellow in color, with less-than-fresh aromas, this past-its-prime white is made mostly from the rare Caiño Blanco grape. Flavors of pineapple, persimmon and white fruit finish briny and disjointed.
Name: Terras Gauda 2011 La Mar White (Rías Baixas)

Description: Sensuous aromas of honeycomb, canned peache and apricot drives the nose. It's full bodied, with flavors of honey and grilled pineapple, and balanced by bright acidity.
Name: Disznókö 2002 Aszú 6 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

Description: Light amber color, the bouquet is carried by aromas of honeycomb and caramelized apricot. It's well balanced on the palate, with flavors of honey and yellow stone fruit.
Name: Disznókö 2006 Aszú 5 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

Description: From one of the many recent exceptional years in Sauternes, this ripe, unctuous wine has balanced the rich honeyed fruit and the drier edge of botrytis. It's full in the mouth, with Seville orange and a light touch of ginger. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Raymond-Lafon 2011  Sauternes

Appellation: Vino da Tavola, Italy Other, Italy
Description: This cloudy, amber-colored wine isn't for the faint of heart. Made from ancient Grecanico, Carricante and Catarratto vines on the slopes of Mt. Etna and aged in terra cotta amphorae, it's mineral-driven with intense flint, smoke, nectarine, citrus, ginger, white pepper and balsamic sensations supported by an acidic backbone. Boasting great depth and complexity, it evolves continuously in the glass.
Name: Frank Cornelissen 2012 Munjebel Bianco 9 White (Vino da Tavola)

Description: Made from young vines, this is the second wine of Suduiraut. It has young, honeyed character, with a ripe, opulent texture that lays bitter orange fruits over drier noble rot flavors. It is so delicious now, but will be better from 2017.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2010 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Distinctive and generous, this white Rhône-style wine is made from Sierra Foothills grapes by a seasoned Napa winemaker. It tastes like vanilla, hazelnuts and pears, has a creamy texture, feels layered with fruit and spice notes, and has good acidity balanced by richness of flavor.
Name: Elyse 2012 L'Ingenue Naggiar Vineyard White (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh-squeezed apple juice, grapefruit spritzer and nearly sweet cherry aromas sit atop minerality on the nose of this blend of 46% Viognier, 19% Verdelho, 19% Vermentino and 16% Sauvignon Blanc. There's a lot of tart acidity, with a lingering apple flavor.
Name: Vina Robles 2013 White4 White (Paso Robles)

Description: The bouquet of this wine shows condensed fruit notes of green apple and lemon pith, with a slight nuance of vanilla on the nose. Full bodied and creamy on the palate, it exhibits balanced acidity on the finish.
Name: Château d'Auvernier 2012 White (Neuchâtel)

Description: This soft wine shows a rounded character. It's balanced, with acidity giving a supporting freshness and texture to the full, rich creaminess. Full in the mouth and dense, it could age further. Drink from 2015.
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2012 Vieilles Vignes White (Alsace)

Description: This amber colored, orange-style wine has aromas of canned peaches and apricots on the nose, while fresh stone fruits seem to dominate the full bodied palate. The finish is creamy and lingers on.
Name: Batič 2009 Angel Grande Cuvée Rezerva White (Vipavska Dolina)

Description: A wine that is, unusually for Bordeaux, dominated by Sémillon. That gives a creamy, ripe and still muted character and demands another few years aging. The acidity and fresh citrus fruits are filled out with melon and ripe pear flavors. Drink this wine from 2016.
Name: Château Plaisance 2012 Cuvée Alix  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Rich aromas like Anjou pears and rose petals combine with generous ripe pear and vanilla flavors. It feels full-bodied but is light in alcohol and has a soothing texture. Good acidity balances the ripeness and the finish lingers.
Name: Rock Wall 2012 Rock Hound White (California)

Description: Intensely herbaceous, this is a crisp, lemon and grapefruit-driven wine. Bright and fruity, it has a touch of minerality to keep it structured. Drink now.
Name: Château les Arromans 2013  Entre-Deux-Mers

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded aromas of melon, lemon, apple and a touch of passionfruit frame the nose on this blend of 70% Viognier, 20% Grenache Noir and 10% Chardonnay. Good acidity wraps flavors of honeydew, guava and smoked nectarine drizzled in honey.
Name: Clos La Chance 2013 Hadley's Cuvée Estate White (Central Coast)

Description: Pretty aromas recall Golden Delicious apples and white peach. The bright palate delivers apricot, pear and lemon zest accented with a ginger note, while crisp acidity leaves the mouth feeling clean and refreshed.
Name: Scambia 2012 Freschetto  (Orvieto)

Description: This rounded wine offers ripe pineapple and citrus flavors. It's rich with attractive fruitiness and a broad, generous texture. It's fruity with a more textured side that promises aging for a few years.
Name: Château les Clauzots 2013  Graves

Description: With a touch of wood aging, this is a spicy wine while still fruity. Graperfruit and pineapple combine with the toast to give an aromatic wine that needs holding until 2016 before drinking.
Name: Cheval Quancard 2013 Cuvée Clémence  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: This white blend, simple and fruity, is a perfect apéritif wine. It's light with a good mix of citrus and floral flavors, plus crisp apple and white flower aromas. Drink this now.
Name: Hugel 2013 Gentil Hugel White (Alsace)

Description: A perfumed wine, this is laden with spice as well as soft acidity. White fruits, a touch of lychee and plenty of freshness make for an attractive, ripe wine that will be ready to drink from 2016.
Name: Biecher & Schaal 2013 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru White (Alsace)

Description: This ripe wine has a touch of wood. Honey also makes its presence felt, although the wine is dry. The effect is a wine that's full, smooth and with a rich aftertaste.
Name: Clarendelle 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is an aromatic wine, perfumed with ripe peaches as well as the citrus associated with Sauvignon Blanc. It's light, spicy and very fruity. Drink now.
Name: Château de Fontenille 2013  Entre-Deux-Mers

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Juicy, ripe peach and blossom notes perfume this full bodied blend of Chardonnay, Riesling and Pinot Blanc. It's moderately concentrated, with delicate flavors of fresh stone fruit, pear and toast, but enlivened by a streak of sunny lemon acidity. Finishes briskly.
Name: Glenora 2013 Signature White (Finger Lakes)

Description: While this wine has a crisp herbaceous edge, it is gently rounded and given a warmer character from the apricot and pear flavors. The aftertaste brings out a brighter, crisper finish.
Name: Château La Mothe du Barry 2013  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Named after the current Ducourt generation's grandfather, this is a rich, lightly sweet wine, typical of an older style of white Bordeaux. It is however clean, fresh and shows plenty of crisp fruit. Drink now..
Name: VIgnobles Ducourt 2013 Le Blanc de Monsieur Henri  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a soft wine, with a touch of sweetness that comes from the spicy character and fresh red currant fruitiness. Sliced apples and a touch of nutmeg combine well to give a light, fruity wine that's ready to drink.
Name: Clément Klur 2012 Gentil de Katz White (Alsace)

Description: Melon and peach aromas lead the way to underripe tones of apple, melon and peach on the palate. Slightly static in nature, this wine does not evolve much on the palate until a burst of bitter almond on the finish. Fine Terroir Selections, Misa Imports.
Name: Ixsir 2012 Altitudes White (Lebanon)

Description: Fresh and herbaceous, this is a crisp, young wine. Citrus fruit and bright acidity are given roundness by the high proportion of Sémillon in the blend.
Name: Château Nicot 2013  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: In its blue bottle that makes it look more like a fancy water, Double Impact is a blend of Pinot Gris and Riesling. It is just off dry, offering attractive citrus and apple fruits, and showing a light touch of acidity. It is ready to drink.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2011 Double Impact White (Alsace)

Description: Tones of tart apple, hazelnut and almond paste carry the nose and the palate of this wine. While a pleasant sipper, the fruit and oak flavors do not coalesce completely, and a bit more nuance is desired.
Name: Diren 2012 Karmen Selection White (Turkey)

Description: Fresh and floral, this is a soft and ripe wine. With lemon and lime flavors tempered by apricots and pears, it offers a delicious fruit salad of flavors. The aftertaste is rich and juicy.
Name: Château Briot 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Intensely herbaceous, this is almost too fruity and crisp for its own good. It's dominated by juicy citrus fruits, gooseberries and forward acidity. Drink from 2015.
Name: Château Larroque 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Fresh and citrus crisp, this is a Sauvignon-dominated herbaceous wine. It has a light structure and a texture that brings out vivid lemon zest. Not for aging, drink now.
Name: Château de Beauregard-Ducourt 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Spicy and fruity, this is a bright, fresh wine with a light touch of sweetness. Gentil is a category that blends any number of the Alsace varieties together. It's aromatic, crisp at the end while keeping softness. Drink now.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2012 Pfaff Gentil White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Tightly herbaceous, this light and crisp wine is all citrus and gooseberries, with a tangy lemon zest texture. Drink now.
Name: Château Rousset-Caillau 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: An intensely youthful herbaceous character is at work here. The wine is full of gooseberry, lemon and pink grapefruit flavors, laced with some orange zest. It's very fresh and probably too young, so wait until late 2015.
Name: Château La Rose du Pin 2013  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This light wine feels bubbly in the mouth and slightly sweet. It has mild pear and apple flavors, a soft texture and short finish. Could be a good one to use as a substitute for Moscato.
Name: Barefoot Refresh NV White (California)

Description: Although the wine is described as moelleux (sweet), it is only just off dry. It's a curious wine, neither one thing nor another, retaining the herbaceous character of a Sauvignon-based wine while almost adding a spoonful of sugar.
Name: Château la Hargue 2013 Moelleux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A blend of 65% Chardonnay, 20% Nebbiolo and 15% Pinot Nero, this delivers ripe pear, golden apple, citrus and hazelnut aromas that carry on to the palate. It's sophisticated and elegant, with radiant acidity.
Name: Rizzi NV Metodo Classico Extra Brut White (Vino Spumante)

Description: This well-crafted blend includes Gewürztraminer, Riesling, Pinot Gris, Pinot Blanc and Muscat. The aromatic varieties dominate, pushing spicy notes front and center. They're followed by brightly fruity flavors of peach, melon and light tropical highlights, all rounded off with a smidgen of residual sugar. Quite delightful and perfect for an apéritif or spicy Asian fare.
Name: Jezebel 2013 Blanc White (Oregon)
