Description: Fresh and crisp, this is a blend of Pinot Blanc, Chardonnay and Auxerrois. It has a bright aromatic character, citrus and apple flavors and a fruity aftertaste.
Name: Domaine Vincent Stoeffler NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Pinot Blanc-Chardonnay (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Melon, peach and vanilla aromas don't display much oak while coming across clean and ripe. This feels juicy, with orange, tangerine and nectarine flavors. The finish is spunky and acidic but not overly deep or complex. This is 95% Viura and 5% Malvasia.
Name: Valserrano 2013 Blanco Fermentado En Barrica White (Rioja)

Description: A blend of native grapes Durello (90%) and Garganega (10%) and made with no dosage, this opens with aromas of roasted hazelnut, lemon zest and yellow apple peel that carry over to the tangy, bone-dry palate. It has crisp acidity and finishes on a note of toasted walnut.
Name: Ca' Rugate 2010 Amedeo Pas Dosé Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Bright, fruity and deliciously crisp with a creamy mousse, this is a citrus and apple flavored wine. It has a bone-dry character with a mineral and lemon zest texture. It's ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Jean-Luc Mader NV Brut Pinot Blanc-Chardonnay (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Popcorn, toast and apple aromas are woody and spicy. This feels racy and acidic, with oaky overtones. Briny flavors of spiced melon and apple are woody and finish with barrel flavors. Overall, this is oaky but offers good body and balance.
Name: Baigorri 2012 Cask Fermented White (Rioja)

Description: Made with 95% Chardonnay and 5% Pinot Noir, this opens with aromas of toasted walnut, yellow apple skin and a whiff of liqueur. The palate delivers lemon peel and a hint of honey alongside vigorous bubbles.
Name: Cordero di Montezemolo NV Montezemolo Brut White (Vino Spumante)

Description: This gold-tinted, oak-topped, barrel-fermented blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha displays notes of lacquer, candle wax and peach pit. The palate is juicy, with malic acid in the lead. Flavors of tart lemon and white peach turn wheaty and flat on the finish, with oxidized notes of vanilla and corn.
Name: Castillo Clavijo 2011 Fermentado en Barrica Viura-Malvasia-Garnacha Blanca White (Rioja)

Description: Mild apple, pear and almond aromas give way to a plump but bland palate. Melon and papaya flavors are fair, while the finish is clean but light. This Verdejo-SB blend is a straightforward quaffer.
Designation: Mundo de Yuntero Bio Verdejo-Sauvignon Blanc
Name: Yuntero 2013 Mundo de Yuntero Bio Verdejo-Sauvignon Blanc White (La Mancha)

Description: Melon, papaya and other chunky white-fruit aromas come in front of a peachy, basic palate. Flavors of peach, apple and papaya are melony and round, as is the finish on this fresh but generic white. Drink immediately.
Name: Marqués de Castilla 2013 Cristo de la Vega Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (La Mancha)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Lime, melon and citrus aromas are basic but clean. The palate is pulpy in feel, while pithy flavors of white grapefruit and generic citrus fruits finish with a mild note of papaya.
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2013 Protocolo White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Tropical-fruit aromas highlight the Moscatel in this blend. The palate is plump and melony in feel, with melon, peach and lychee flavors. The finish is soft and doesn't show a lot of acidity or cut.
Name: Epilogo 2013 Sauvignon Blanc-Moscatel White (La Mancha)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Tropical fruit and citrus aromas aren't bad, but the palate is heavy. The flavor profile only offers soap and grassy white-fruit flavors, while a light, flowery finish falls flat.
Name: Felix Solis 2012 Flirty Bird White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Dark fir honey, baked and sugar-glazed apricots, cinnamon and bitter orange peel—this is a small cosmos of aromatic sweetness hitting a warm, deep and comforting note of immense richness and incredible length. Delicious now and for years to come.
Name: Kracher 2011 Grande Cuvée Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 6 White (Burgenland)

Description: Rich, nutty toastiness softens this tightrope walk between fruit-induced opulence and precise acidity. Slowly, notions of vanilla, Mirabelle plum, dried fruit, apricots and orange peel shine through. A beautifully layered, mature and nearly poetic TBA.
Name: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2002 TBA White (Burgenland)

Description: Vanilla and banana jelly, manuka honey and muscovado sugar—layer upon layer of fruity sweetness with tropical overtones of pineapple is revealed on the luscious palate. Such liveliness is engendered here with a seemingly endless finish. A total triumph.
Name: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2006 TBA White (Burgenland)

Description: A deliberately oxidized style makes for an immensely intriguing wine that falls between the usual Austrian categories—but then we need wines that defy neat boxes. Aromas of toasted cashew nuts and dried orange peel segue into a dryish, citrus-scented palate, with a central, thick slick of salted caramel and racy acidity. The longer you taste, the more facets appear, even as the palate fades into notions of salty, candied mandarin zest. Unusual and uncategorisable, but unforgettable. Despite being called Apéritif, it might be best with cheese and tapas.
Name: Tinhof NV Apéritif White (Burgenland)

Description: Wonderfully heady notes of berries preserved in spirit, with vague hints of dried apple slices, strike a sonorous note, with a seemingly more grown-up sweetness, tempered by almost autumnal flavors of cinnamon. A rounded but totally precise body speaks of purity, which is only highlighted by glimpses of very ripe, yellow Mirabelle plums. A very elegant BA.
Name: Heidi Schröck 2013 Beerenauslese Selektion White (Burgenland)

Description: Candied apricots, blossom honey and notions of orange zest take turns in dazzling the nose and palate, while musky botrytis lends a rounded note to the mouthfeel, melding all together into sweet BA harmony. Simply lovely, now or in future years.
Name: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2012 Beerenauslese Exquisit White (Burgenland)

Description: Smelling this is like sticking your nose into a basket of supremely ripe yellow plums and greengages. Despite all the ripeness and sweetness, there is something deliciously tempered and fresh here, too. The acidity from Furmint works a treat. The palate hits with the full force of concentrated yellow plum. This is for those who like it ultrasweet; the oak-aging is supremely well-handled.
Designation: Ruster Ausbruch Auf den Flügeln der Morgenröte
Name: Heidi Schröck 2012 Ruster Ausbruch Auf den Flügeln der Morgenröte White (Burgenland)

Description: A sheen of lifted lemon oil surrounds this BA, whose palate oscillates between feisty, candied lemon peel and more hazy notions of passion fruit. There is something elixir-like about its immense precision and perfect balance.
Name: Kracher 2011 Beerenauslese Cuvée White (Burgenland)

Description: Rich, musky honey and dark molasses lifted by orange freshness combine to make a sumptuous palate pervaded by fresh, pungent and welcome acidity. A play of dark and light, of dried and fresh fruit, with a wonderfully sonorous, musky finish. Lovely now but will cellar for years.
Name: Feiler-Artinger 2008 Ruster Ausbruch Pinot Cuvée White (Burgenland)

Description: In the oxidative style that is so special to the Jura, this blend of Chardonnay and Savagnin is distinctive. With almond, apricot and yeast flavors, it is dry, a food wine although also, like a fino Sherry, good as an apéritif.
Name: Domaine Rolet Père et Fils 2007 Tradition White (Arbois)

Description: Rich and mellow apricot confit, with an edge of patisserie, vanilla and honeyed lusciousness, flesh out the bouquet and palate. Not supersweet, but therefore all the more versatile. Lovely and long.
Name: Kracher NV Trockenbeerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: Each year, this parcel of Muscadelle is chosen to make a separate wine. This new vintage shows delicious acidity and fresh fruits, as well as a good amount of wood aging. It's full-bodied, spicy and ripe, with pineapple and mango fruits coming through strongly. Drink from 2015.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2012 Parcelle Le Jeanneton no ZB100 White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: This wine offers great richness, spice and complexity. The blend of Gros Manseng and Camaralet is unusual and gives the spice, ripe white fruits and a strong structure. The full aftertaste is packed with fruitiness, finishing with tight acidity.
Name: Domaine Cauhapé 2013 Chant de Vignes  (Jurançon Sec)

Description: This is a blend mainly of the local Loin de l'Oeil with a touch of Sauvignon. Together they give a rich, while balanced wine, allowing acidity to keep the luscious peach, pear and honey flavors crisp and fragrant. Drink now, but the wine will age well.
Name: Domaine Rotier 2011 Les Gravels White (Gaillac Doux)

Description: Citrus-edged sweetness is far more apparent on the palate than the nose, but here it delivers wonderful hints of lemon oil and candied zest, cut through by lively acidity against hints of tropical mango. A wonderfully toned BA, this will pair well with both cheese and dessert.
Name: Domäne Wachau 2013 Terrrassen Beerenauslese White (Wachau)

Description: What an incredibly pure lift of apricots—like apricot jam, spread on the freshest, lightest, most fragrant brioche. This is very sweet but also very seductive. Serve this with rich, apricot-scented baked goods and you'll have a match made in heaven.
Designation: Old Vienna Composition T.B.A. Grand Cuvée
Name: Hafner 2011 Old Vienna Composition T.B.A. Grand Cuvée White (Austria)

Description: This superrich wine has been seriously wood aged to give a ripe and full-bodied, rounded texture. With intense toast, apricot and white fruits, it has great aging potential. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2012 Moulin des Dames White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: A blend of white Bordeaux and local Gers grapes, this is a smooth, medium sweet wine. With three years of aging, it has become mature, rich in smoky flavors as well as dried apricot and bitter oranges. Acidity keeps everything in line. It's ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Gensac 2011 Quadrille White (Gers)

Description: The nose, fragrant with confit apricot, merely hints at the contrasting richness to come—manuka honey shot through with lively citrus sharpness that tempers the intense, concentrated sweetness. There is a topnote of honeydew melon, but the interest is much more on the palate than the nose.
Name: Muenzenrieder 2012 Cuvee Eiswein White (Burgenland)

Description: This is the freshest of the sweet wine produced by Henri Ramonteau at Cauhapé. It is a lively, fruity wine, full of refreshing acidity as well as pineapple, apricot and honey flavors. The end shows a touch of spice. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Cauhapé 2012 Ballet d'Octobre  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Pinot Grigio and Chardonnay with splashes of Gewürztraminer and Viognier, this has notes of apple, pear and melon. It drinks close to dry with fresh, clean fruit flavors and well-balanced acidity.
Name: Tsillan 2013 Estate Sempre Amore White (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A wine that is so fresh, with its blend of aromatic Gros and Petit Manseng and good acidity. Honey and a light hand on wood are added to peach and mango flavors to give a sweet, delicate, ready-to-drink wine.
Name: Domaine d'Arton 2010 Victoire White (Côtes de Gascogne)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lively and full-bodied, the blend includes Chardonnay, Marsanne, Roussanne and Pinot Gris. Citrus fruits fill the mouth, with a streak of honey and appealing roundness. This is a great wine to just drink and enjoy, without too much contemplation.
Name: Kontos 2013 Gossamer White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A blend of 70% Sauvignon and 30% Chardonnay that's fermented and aged in barriques, this opens with wood-driven aromas of toast, oak and butterscotch. Oak also takes center stage on the palate, with apricot and lemon zest in the background.
Name: Le Macchiole 2012 Paleo Bianco White (Toscana)

Description: With superripe fruits (almost like a Late Harvest), this blend of Sauvignon Gris, Sémillon, Petit Manseng and Petit Courbu is a honeyed, sweet while also fruity wine. It's full of ripe fruitiness, with touches of apricots and just enough balancing acidity. Drink from 2015.
Name: Domaine de Gensac 2012 Quadrille White (Gers)

Description: Dominated by ripe Sémillon, this is a rich wine. It has a touch of herbaceousness, but the yellow fruits, pears and stroke of lemon give a full-bodied, rounded feel. Wood aging adds further to the satisfying flavors.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2013 Cuvée des Conti White (Bergerac Sec)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Three-quarters Viognier with the balance Pinot Gris, it's moderately aromatic with notes of honeysuckle, peach and barrel spices. It drinks off dry (8g/L residual sugar), with lovely acidity pulling it together.
Name: Gunder 2012 White Wine Viognier-Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Blossoms and tangerines perfume this elegantly composed blend of Chardonnay, Viognier and Sauvignon Blanc. It's rich and creamy on the palate, with concentrated flavors of apple and quince, but finishes with a gorgeous sheen of salty oyster shells.
Name: Bedell 2012 Gallery White (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Colombard and Sauvignon Blanc often compete for the herbaceous stakes. Here, though, there is an added element of warmth, with ripe yellow fruits and just a touch of honey. It makes for a delicious, ready-to-drink wine.
Name: Domaine d'Arton 2013 Les Hauts d'Arton Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Gorgeously perfumed, this blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Viognier, Chardonnay and Riesling poses bigger and bolder than it's delicate frame suggests. Blossom and peach tones are opulent on the palate, but it's refreshingly brisk and lemony with a steely, lean finish.
Name: Bedell 2012 Taste White (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Intensely fruity, this delicious, ripe wine explodes with fresh acidity and fragrant fruitiness. Apricots, lemon and juicy apples give a fruit salad of flavors. Drink through 2015.
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2013 Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Bordeaux-style white blend is 60% Sauvignon Blanc and 40% Sémillon. It carries a hint of sweetness, possibly some residual sugar above threshhold level. Flavors of butter cookie accompany simple, light yellow fruits.
Name: Auclair 2013 96 Cedars White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Soft and creamy, this is a bright, apple and pear fruity wine. It's light and very fresh, layering acidity and a citrus burst at the end. Drink now.
Name: Sacha Lichine 2013 SLS Blend No. 5 White (Vin de France)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's a candied tone on this honeyed white blend (predominantly Grüner Veltliner)that extends from nose to palate. It's sunny pineapple and peach flavors are indeed tasty, but can seem a bit confected in style.
Name: One Woman 2011 Tribute White (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: The wine is ripe, rich with full apricot and red apple fruits. It shows a creamy wood-laden character that is spicy and toasty. It's very ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Gensac 2010 Pirouette White (Gers)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This bright and fruity wine, with its typical and delicious local blend of Colombard and Sauvignon Blanc, is full of citrus and grapefruit flavors. It's a light wine, all fruit with just a light texture of steeliness. Drink now.
Name: Château d'Aydie 2013 Aramis Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: A light and fruity wine that's been spoiled by a touch of sulfur. Aside from that bitter edge, the wine shows attractive apple and citrus flavors.
Name: Domaine la Croix des Marchands 2012 Fraîcheur Perlé White (Gaillac)

Description: Aromas of banana and ham are yeasty. This has a soft, powdery mouthfeel and flavors of cured meats. The finish is bland and abrupt.
Name: Undurraga 2013 U Estate Grown Chardonnay-Riesling White (Central Valley)

Description: Fresh wood dominates this powerful, rich wine. It's developing its fruitiness well, bringing out tropical flavors. A ripe full-blooded, no-holds-barred density suggests a fine future. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A richly rounded wine, impressively dense and powerful. Its ripe tropical and green fruits are integrating well with the toast from wood aging to give great swathes of complex fruit and structure. This is a wine for the long haul. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A dense, wood-aged wine, it brings richness, intense fruit and acidity together. It's complex and concentrated, powerfully structured and full of yellow fruits as well as lemon juice, edged with toast. It's a wine for aging, so drink from 2018.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This is pure fruitiness but with a tense, tight structure underneath.The fresh exterior is all citrus fruits and acidity, while behind lies a texture that demands aging. It's impressive, rich and worth waiting for. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: The wine is beautifully balanced, poised between ripe yellow fruits and a tight, taut acidity and minerality. It shows roundness initially, then offers a long-term prospect of intense fruit and a strong structure. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Closed and tight, this dense wine is slow to develop. It has great weight, richness, powerful green and white fruits that are coming through the complex texture. It needs to age. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Olivier 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Pure Sauvignon, this is a tropical fruit flavored wine. It's bright and fruity while also showing a dense texture of grapefruit and steely minerality. The combination makes for an intense wine that's likely to need time, so drink from 2017.
Name: Château la Louvière 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Rich and full-bodied, it's full of tropical fruits that dominate the ripe texture. Hints of wood are there as well as the natural crisp acidity of Sauvignon Blanc. It needs time to develop and bring out all its ripe flavors. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château de France 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Ripe, creamy and powerful, it's full of tropical fruits, apricots and peaches, all firmly supported by rich wood flavors. It makes a strong statement of broad fruits and a generous texture while also offering a chance to age. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Well balanced, it's round while also fruity. A mineral character pushes the crisp green fruits forward, while the background brings out toast, ripe fruits and a full aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Brown 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Wood aromas show strongly and lead on to the toasty palate that's rich and complex while not losing sight of its citrus character. It is juicy, with ripe yellow fruits and dense texture. This needs serious aging, so wait to enjoy until 2017.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Steely and tight, it has intense acidity, a dense texture and powerful green apple and grapefruit flavors. The wine is still finding its way, suggesting considerable potential for long-term aging. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Well-balanced, ripe and toasty, it has all the elements in the right place. It's rich, packed with spice, apricot and red apple fruits given a creamy texture by the wood aging. The wine could benefit by waiting until 2015, although it's delicious now.
Name: Château Bois de Rolland 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Beautifully tight, fresh and crisp, it offers refreshing green fruits, fresh acidity and an intense, herbaceous aftertaste. It's structured and its steely texture promises a good aging. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Couhins 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: While displaying strong herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc flavors, the wine is also rich with fruitiness, offering a delicious series of green fruits followed by pineapple and tropical flavors. It's a wine that's right up front, crisp and bright at the end.
Name: Château la Garde 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Generously ripe and creamy, it has layers of wood giving way to a beautiful, smooth texture. It's dense and complex, although a crisper citrus element gives a fresher side to this broad, rich wine. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Haut-Bergey 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This is a fruity wine, fresh and herbaceous. Bright crisp apples and citrus flavors are tightened by a steely texture that comes through strongly. It should develop and fill out, so drink from 2016.
Name: Château Couhins-Lurton 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Rich and full, this is a concentrated and well-balanced wine. It has a good mix of herbaceousness, fresh citrus and pineapple, all intense and fruity. It could age a few months, so wait until 2015.
Name: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2013 Made From Organically Grown Grapes  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Full-bodied herbaceousness is the hallmark of this ripe wine. It offers great acidity while also having rich yellow and grapefruit fruits. Dense with fruits and acidity while also structured, this is a wine to age for a few years. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château de Rochemorin 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Toasty aromas give a strongly spicy character. They also bring out a ripe side to the wine, rounded and rich, full of wood and warm fruit flavors. It needs time to develop its full potential, so wait until 2016.
Name: Cheval Quancard 2013 Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from 75% Sauvignon Blanc and 25% Sémillon, this has fresh peach and light green apple aromas, peachy flavors touched with almond and white pepper, a lush rounded texture and a lingering finish.
Name: Shared Notes 2012 Les Lecons Des Maitres White (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A very delicate shade of pale yellow, this 50% Sauvignon Blanc, 30% Pinot Gris and 20% Riesling blend offers a refreshing aroma somewhere between passionfruit, pineapple and apple juice. Tart green apple and lime tang emerge once sipped.
Name: Brander 2013 Cuvée Natalie White (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This is a wine with a serious side, its fruitiness balanced by a firm steely texture. Apples and lime flavors are lined out with minerality, with a chalky character as well as intense acidity. It's a wine to keep for a few months, so drink in 2015.
Name: Château Boisson 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Tight acidity characterizes this wine. It's fresh, touched by some toastiness and minerality. The dominant character is the fresh herbaceous character that brings out sliced apple and chive flavors. Attractive now, it will be even better in 2016.
Name: Château Cantelys 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Virtú is the winery's white blend, this vintage partnering 56% Sémillon with 44% Sauvignon Blanc. The combination is explosive, briny and flowery in the best ways, a taste of apple and fresh-squeezed lime vibrant on the palate, followed by savory herb and a nuanced taste of toasty oak. The aroma conveys a sense of fresh salt air.
Name: St. Supéry 2012 Virtú Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

Description: Made by Domaine de Chevalier for an order of nuns, this ripe and rich wine keeps a beautiful sense of proportion. Already delicious, it has touches of wood as well as quince and green plum fruits. Drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine de la Solitude 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Sure to please any wine-geek, this orange wine is a blend of seven grapes including Sauvignon Blanc, Vermentino, Riesling Italica, Glera, Fruilano, Pinot Gris and Pinot Blanc. It's aged for three years in large wooden vats and has aromas of dried nectarine, dried peach, apricot and freshly ground black pepper that lead to luscious flavors of apricot nectar and honeycomb.
Name: Roxanich 2008 Ines in White (Istria)

Description: This Slovenian wine is golden straw colored, with aromas of white flowers and freshly cut honeycomb. It is round and opulent, with flavors of apple and peach and just a touch of saline minerality.
Name: Kabaj 2010 Luisa White (Goriska Brda)

Description: While it has no wood aging, the wine discloses attractive caramel and vanilla flavor. Although it has plenty of herbaceousness, it also offers richer apricot and quince flavors that bring out a warmer side. Almonds and acidity come together well at the end.
Name: Château Saint-Genès 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A round and ripe wine, it's full of rich fruits and with spice from light wood aging. It's dense and developing layers of creaminess and tropical fruits. Give it time to reach its potential, so drink from 2015.
Name: Château Penin 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Fresh and very crisp, it's dominated by herbaceous flavors and tight acidity. Light hints of toast are brought out by the bright fruitiness. It's developing well, lively and aromatic at the end.
Name: Château Gazin Rocquencourt 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: While the aromas are all about herbaceous fruit, a light touch of wood gives the wine a richer edge. Very fruity still and still young, it needs a few months to fully integrate the toastiness.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2013 Héritage  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc that is smoothed out with some Chardonnay, this is ripe and full in the mouth despite its light, poised character. Citrus fruits, a firm structure and floral aromas give a wine that is attractive now, but which will age at least through 2015.
Name: Benoît Daridan 2013 Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Cheverny)

Description: A well-balanced ripe wine, fresh with attractive green plum and sliced apricot flavors. The texture is smooth and soft, rounded while not losing sight of a fresher, crisper character. Attractive now, it will be even better in 2015.
Name: Château de Rouillac 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A crisp and green wine that's full-bodied and rich. It has lively acidity, concentrated apple and lemon flavors and a ripe texture. It could well age for a few months, so drink from 2015.
Name: Château Fonfroide 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a very aromatic, intensely fruity white wine that is also rounded and generous. Full-bodied, it offers rich tropical fruits such as mango and pineapple, and is ready to drink now.
Name: Château Haut Lagrange 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Mint and sage aromas give an instant herbal character. That's balanced by citrus fruits that cut through the texture to give great freshness and intense acidity. Drink from 2015.
Name: Château Roquefort 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This fresh and fruity sparkling wine is crisp with apple skin and apricot flavors. Ripe and full in the mouth , it has a lightly creamy mousse. The blend of Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay gives delicious fruitiness and tight final acidity.
Name: Musset-Roullier NV Noctambule Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Crémant de Loire)

Description: While the wine is rich, it's also very crisp and fruity. Tight acidity and a chalky, steely texture are balanced by ripe apples and pink grapefruit. It's a wine for drinking this year, bright and fruity.
Name: Château Chaubinet 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: An aromatic wine, it has a rounded texture, a spicy character and only light acidity. Very forward and fruity, it's going to be ready to drink by 2015.
Name: Château de Cruzeau 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: It balances a crisp texture against ripe fruitiness. Finely structured, it's very fresh with herbaceous fruits and lively acidity. Drink from 2015.
Name: Château le Sartre 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A tight and herbaceous wine that is crisp, mineral and fresh. It shows a great potential for fruitiness, with natural juicy acidity as well as a bright, aromatic aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Ferran 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Fruity and attractive now, it features touches of lime, spicy underlay and tight crispness. It's ready to drink, very fresh and fragrant.
Name: Château Thieuley 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This Croatian white is a blend of Debit, Pošip, Marastina, Pinot Grigio and Chardonnay. It has heady aromas of dried fruits, fresh peaches and buttered toast. There are great flavors of fresh stone fruits and black figs in the midpalate, and a pleasantly astringent finish.
Name: Bibich 2011 Riserva R5 White (North Dalmatia)

Description: At this stage, the wine is closed, just hinting at its rich, fruity future. It has good acidity and a touch of bitter almonds, but the real fruitiness is still to come. Wait until 2015.
Name: Château Roc de Minvielle 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: White currants and fresh apricots dominate this fruity, fragrant wine. Bright acidity is enveloped by the generous texture and touch of toast. This rich wine is ready to drink.
Name: Clos Marsalette 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: The wine is rich, showing toast as well as apricot and peach flavors. It's full-blown, right up front with fruitiness and rounded texture. Drink now.
Name: Château Lafargue 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Crisp and deliciously fruity, this is lively and bright. Acidity points up the lime and grapefruit flavors, leaving a fresh, juicy aftertaste. Drink now for maximum pleasure.
Name: Château Mezain 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Crisp and herbaceous, it has a riper background of yellow fruit fleshiness. It's bright and likely to soften and round out into 2015.
Name: Closerie du Bailli 2013 Tradition  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Like a tropical vacation in a bottle. It smells like kiwi fruit and lime, tastes like ripe green apples, and finishes with that kiwi again. This blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Muscat and Riesling is fresh, smooth, medium bodied, ever so slightly sweet and easy to enjoy.
Name: The Messenger NV White Wine Number One Lot 314 White (California)

Description: It offers weight and richness as well a more nuanced herb and green fruit character. Depth of flavor shows ripeness, while a crisp, tight aftertaste suggests it could age.
Name: Château Goumin 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Lychee and melon aromas are proper for Torrontés. And while this has Viognier and Chardonnay in the blend, it's Torrontés that dominates via a spritzy, citrusy mouthfeel and flavors of lychee, nectarine and citrus fruits. A fresh, lively but simple finish confirms the wine's refreshment potential.
Name: Trivento 2013 Amado Sur Torrontés-Viognier-Chardonnay White (Mendoza)

Description: This herbaceous wine is fresh, steely and crisp. Bright acidity cuts strongly through the lively texture, giving apples, lemon and pink grapefruit. Developing fast, it is ready to drink.
Name: Château Lafont Menaut 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: The wine is soft, rounded, showing light acidity and fresh fruit. Melons and pears dominate the ripe flavors, with a touch of almonds and rich aftertaste.
Name: Château de la Vieille Tour 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine shows a tropical fruit character, with apricots and mangos laced by more citrus and lime acidity. It's rich, warm and round, although at the back a steely tautness provides balance.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2013 Intense  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: The wine is tight and nervy, very fresh, crisp and citrus dominated. It delivers a cool feel and delicious acidity that brings out a light character, as well as a bone-dry, mineral aftertaste.
Name: Schröder & Schÿler 2013 Chartron la Fleur  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: With its green, herbal aromas, this wine could come from New Zealand. It's crisp with intense gooseberry and packed with citrus and green apple flavors. Drink now.
Name: Château Bonnet 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Two bottles were tasted; the first sour and disjointed, the second, considerably better, with tart lemon and green apple fruit and some pretty orange-peel highlights. It's finished with a screwcap so a bad cork is not an issue, but watch out for bottle variation.
Name: Treos 2012 Stolen Kisses White (Willamette Valley)

Description: White currant aromas give an exotic character that is confirmed by the spice and ripe apricot flavors. Acidity is bright and fresh while the aftertaste moves the wine more to a warmer character.
Name: Château la Freynelle 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is tight, crisp and herbaceous, dominated by Sauvignon Blanc. A mineral character gives a firm texture. It needs to age a few months, so drink from 2015.
Name: Maison Malet Roquefort 2013 Léo de la Gaffelière  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Strongly herbaceous, it's also packed with gooseberry and grapefruit flavors. It's a sharp as a knife, very crisp and deliciously fresh, with a distinctly mineral aftertaste.
Name: Château Luchey-Halde 2012  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Intensely herbaceous, this is a crisp, green, herbal wine. It's fragrant, textured and conveys a bright acidity. Gooseberry, lime and apple flavors are very tight and concentrated.
Name: Château Pierrail 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The earthy intensity of herbaceous Sauvignon leaps out of the glass, giving a wine that's concentrated with citrus and green herbs. It's crisp at the end, with a hint of thyme that gives a peppery aftertaste.
Name: Château Timberlay 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Ginger, lemongrass and herbaceous aromas precede a zesty, citric palate with sharp acidity. This hints at sour lemon and grapefruit flavors while bringing in sweeter lime and melon notes. A cleansing, citric finish is tart to sour. 85% Torrontés and 15% Riesling.
Name: Amalaya 2013 Torrontés-Riesling White (Salta)

Description: This is a creamy textured wine, its round character pointed up by a citrus edge that brings out fruit and a mineral character. All these elements make for a balanced wine that's ready to drink.
Name: Vignobles Boissonneau 2013 Vinum Terra  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a ripe, fruity wine, its herbaceous citrus character well blended with full melon and green apple flavors. Already attractive wine, it's full of crisp acidity and lively fruitiness.
Name: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is Chardonnay with small amounts of Pinot Grigio and Viognier. The nose is nutty, oily and low on fruit. In the mouth, it's racy and citrusy in character. Flavors of orange, papaya and passion fruit are basic, while the finish is fresh and juicy, with tart flavors.
Name: Trivento 2013 Amado Sur Chardonnay-Pinot Grigio-Viognier White (Mendoza)

Description: A bright, light and fruity wine that's already delicious to drink. With lemon and green apple fruit, it also has acidity that cuts through the aftertaste.
Name: Chai de Bordes 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This herbaceous, classically fruity wine is given a push by a touch of spice. It's bright, light, and fresh, with a green aftertaste. It's ready to drink.
Name: Château Borie de Noaillan 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Fruity, and crisp, it has citrus flavors balanced by an intense herbal character. It's fresh and juicy; the acidity gives a bright, lively aftertaste.
Name: Château de Parenchère 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The wine is attractively fruity, its crispness balanced by round apple and pear flavors that give richness. It has a creamy texture, concentrated acidity and a finish that brings out lemon and lime.
Name: Château Buisson-Redon 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: The nutty aromas of Chenin Blanc dominate this fresh and apple fruity wine. It has crisp acidity, a lively and light texture and light, dancing aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Musset-Roullier 2013 Les Blanches Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Val de Loire)

Description: Fresh and lightly fruity, this is a crisp and fragrant wine. With great acidity and a touch of herbaceousness, it's ready to drink.
Name: Maison Malet Roquefort 2013 L'Instant Bordeaux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Toasted almond aromas follow through to give this wine a creamy, nutty character. There's vanilla, soft acidity and a final thrust of acidity.
Name: Château des Tourtes 2013 Le Duo  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A wine that is bright, fruity and light in character. The crisp apples and juicy lemon flavors are brightly lit by acidity and a hint of a more steely texture. Drink now.
Name: Château Lauduc 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine is all about fruitiness, its crisp texture merely an aid to the lively acidity and herbaceous character. Cool and fresh, it delivers a bright aftertaste of lime juiciness.
Name: Château Fayau 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Fruity and fresh, it's full of grapefruit, lime and green apple flavors. It is crisp and ready to drink.
Name: Château Lamothe de Haux 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The wine is fruity, crisp and herbaceous. Everything is in place for an attractive, ready-to-drink wine, all fruit and with only a light texture.
Name: Schröder & Schÿler 2013 La Croix Barton  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A mix of toast and mint aromas lead to a wine that has a split personality between herbal flavors and spicy toast. It doesn't work, its fruit forgotten in the middle.
Name: Château Roquefort 2013 Roquefortissime  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A touch of sulfur spoils this wine, subduing the citrus fruit and the mineral texture. This should blow off, so wait and drink in 2015.
Name: Château Magondeau 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A blend of 90% Carricante, 10% Catarratto and Minnella, this delicious golden-colored wine seamlessly weaves together sensations of lemon drop, nectarine, dried apricot, ginger and cinnamon alongside bright acidity. It's a sophisticated wine boasting depth and complexity.
Name: Biondi 2012 Chianta  (Etna)

Description: Winemaker: Duncan Savage. This is a balanced, well-integrated selection that shows the potential to age beautifully. Bold and flavorful, it offers aromas of red apple, peach, honeydew rind, white flower and fynbos. The medium-weight palate shows notes of baked apple, toasted brioche and orange rind, finishing long and savory. Attractive now, but should evolve well through 2018.
Name: Cape Point Vineyards 2013 Cape Winemakers Guild CWG Reserve Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Cape Point)

Description: Winemaker: Johan Malan. This is a stunning selection that is poised to age remarkably well, thanks to superb balance and layers of flavor. It opens with notes of honeydew, white peach, Asian pear and orange blossom, accented by hints of sweet spice and almond skin. The palate boasts a rich, full texture and medium acidity, with final notes of wood-grilled apple, toasted almond and honeysuckle that linger long. Drink now–2018.
Designation: Cape Winemakers Guild The Red Ox White Roussanne-Chenin Blanc
Name: Simonsig 2013 Cape Winemakers Guild The Red Ox White Roussanne-Chenin Blanc White (Stellenbosch)

Description: Spanish Broom, lemon blossom, pear, nectarine, candied citrus, Mediterranean herbs and intense mineral sensations are all woven together, lifted by bright acidity. Made with Carricante and Catarratto, this is already delicious now, but will develop complexity over the next few years.
Name: Graci 2012 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Ciro Biondi's blend of 90% Carricante and 10% Catarratto and Minnella is a stunning expression of Etna. It pens with beautiful floral aromas of Spanish Broom and orange blossom. The palate delivers concentrated lemon-lime, apple, pear, white peach, intense mineral and Mediterranean herbs. The creamy fruit is perfectly balanced by crisp acidity.
Name: Biondi 2013 Outis Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Orange blossom, nectarine, lemon drop, ripe yellow peach and candied tangerine peel take center stage on this delicious blend of Inzolia, Catarratto and Grillo. The juicy fruit palate is accented by clove, mineral and seaside salinity, all balanced by bright acidity.
Name: Hauner 2012 Carlo Hauner White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This intriguing combination of Pinot Grigio (70%) holds smaller traces of Traminer and Moscato Giallo. The nose is powerfully led by the Moscato, so floral and spicy in jasmine and briny seaside that it almost suggests Vermentino. Textured and light, it offers strong flavors of pear and a long, crisp finish.
Name: Uvaggio 2013 Zelo Bianco White (Napa-Carneros)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Honeycrisp apples come to mind at first sip, along with dollops of peach, lemongrass and caramel. The mouthfeel is fresh and flavorful, with excellent texture and length.
Name: Buty 2012 62% Sémillon-21% Sauvignon-17% Muscadelle White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: It's uncommon to find Grenache Noir in a white blend, but it's a tasty experiment nonetheless. Well rounded and evenly presented, the nose of lemon and honeysuckle is prominent but delicate. The slightly oily palate comes alive with vanilla, pear candy, peach and bubblegum, finishing with a brush of acidity.
Name: Clos La Chance 2013 Hadley's Cuvee White (Central Coast)

Description: Here's a refreshing and savory blend of Catarratto, Pinot Bianco, Sauvignon and Traminer. It's loaded with succulent white peach, juicy pineapple and citrus zest. Crisp acidity gives this a clean, quenching finish.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2013 Leone d'Almerita White (Sicilia)

Description: This off-dry blend of Riesling, Chenin Blanc, Pinot Gris and Muscat shows the last grape first and foremost. The Muscat shines and shimmers with scents of orange blossoms and sweet, lively fruit. The wine is aromatic as promised, delicate and tilting toward the floral, though with good, solid fruit structure.
Name: Eufloria 2013 Aromatic Blend White (Washington)

Description: This inviting blend of 60% Falanghina and 40% Biancolella has lovely aromas of jasmine, Spanish broom and citrus. The palate doles out ripe tropical fruit, green apple, nectarine and lemon zest flavors, balanced by just the right amount of fresh acidity.
Name: Marisa Cuomo 2012 Furore Bianco White (Costa d'Amalfi)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Half Pinot Gris, 38% Viognier, and with a bit of Roussanne, it rocks with well-ripened cucumber, melon and pear fruit flavors. There's nothing heavy-handed, but it shows good concentration.
Name: Airfield Estates 2013 Flygirl White (Yakima Valley)

Description: Made from a blend of Inzolia, Grecanico, Catarratto and Chardonnay, this bright, refreshing wine is great for summer sipping. It offers juicy white peach, tart green apple, lemon zest and grapefruit sensations that slide easily across the palate.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2013 Regaleali Bianco White (Sicilia)

Description: Here's a refreshing white made from a blend Catarratto and other white varieties that opens with delicate aromas of grapefruit and citrus blossom. The straightforward palate offers juicy white peach and Bartlett pear, with just a hint of sea salt on the close.
Name: Donnafugata 2013 Anthilia White (Sicilia)

Description: A blend of 50% Grillo and 50% Inzolia, this offers tropical fruit and floral aromas. The palate offers lively acidity and flavors of white peach, citrus zest and pineapple.
Name: Baglio del Cristo di Campobello 2013 Adènzia White (Sicilia)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Sémillon-Sauvignon Blanc blend hits the nose with near-petrol scents, and then slides into a slightly sour orange juice zone. On the palate, that citrusy intrigue continues into a lime zest finish. It's a vibrant, refreshing sipper, though it leans on tingling acidity more than overall balance. Serve with cacio e pepe pasta, raw oysters, or anything needing a lemony boost.
Name: Barrack 2012 Happy Canyon Vineyards Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Made from a blend of Fiano, Traminer and Malvasia, this opens with aromas of white flower and stone fruit. The fresh palate offers yellow peach, apricot and citrus notes alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Basilisco 2012 Sophia White (Basilicata)

Description: A blend of Grillo, Chardonnay, Inzolia and Catarratto in equal parts, this vibrant and enjoyable wine opens with aromas of stone fruit, citrus and pineapple. The juicy palate delivers white peach, yellow apple and a hint of almond alongside bright acidity.
Name: Baglio del Cristo di Campobello 2013 C'D'C' White (Sicilia)

Description: Made from a blend of organically farmed Chardonnay, Grillo and 5% Viognier, this opens with delicate aromas of honeysuckle and stone fruit. The bright palate offers white peach, golden apple and a hint of citrus alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Di Giovanna 2013 Gerbino Bianco White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Here's a pretty blend of 50% Inzolia and 50% Viognier that has aromas of honeysuckle, hay and aromatic herbs. The palate offers yellow peach and golden apple accented by hints of sage and thyme.
Name: Cottanera 2013 Barbazzale Bianco White (Sicilia)

Description: A blend of Insolia and Chardonnay, this wine opens with subdued aromas of yellow spring flowers and pear. The round, straightforward palate offers golden apple, white peach and lemon zest alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Duca di Salaparuta 2013 Calanica White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Floral aromas are airy and fun. This is lean, bright and high in acid. Flavors of stony lime and white pineapple finish minerally and fresh, with a light, long, acid-driven finish.
Designation: Blanc de Pacs Organic Farming Parellada-Xarello-Macabeu
Name: Parés Baltà 2013 Blanc de Pacs Organic Farming Parellada-Xarello-Macabeu White (Penedès)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A kitchen sink blend of white grapes, it comes together with interesting if slightly disjointed effects. There is honey and slight buttercream on the nose (likely from the Chardonnay lead). Once sipped, lush fruit comes to the fore, characterized by caramelized pear (probably the Viognier). On top of that, there is tangy acidity and slight tarriness.
Name: Quadrant 2011 Gold White (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Sémillon (79%) and Sauvignon Blanc (21%) it conveys abundant notes of fig, herbs and spice. It's full bodied, with the fruit flavors seeming almost sweet without the acid to stand them up.
Name: Cave B 2012 Cuvée Blanc White (Ancient Lakes)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Mild, innocuous aromas of white fruits are pleasant but undefined. This feels round and benefits from acidic lift, while flavors of orange and nectarine finish in a friendly manner. This is mostly Viura with some Verdejo and Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Hedonismo 2012 Blanco White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Vi de la Terra Mallorca, Spanish Islands, Spain
Description: This funky white from the island of Mallorca is 50% Premsal and 50% Callet, and if you've never heard of those grapes you're not alone. The nose is a bit harsh and strange, while the palate is on the flat side. Flavors of ham, pithy citrus and nectarine finish jumbled. This is more of a unique oddity than great white wine.
Name: Ànima Negra 2013 Quíbia Falanis White (Vi de la Terra Mallorca)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This quaffable white blend opens with minerally vitamin-like aromas along with touches of peach pit and apple. The palate is good in a generic way, while apple, pear, melon and mild spice flavors finish exactly the same.
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2012 Protocolo White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Made from a blend of native grapes Insolia and Grecanico, this is a light-bodied but refreshing wine that recalls lemon zest, peach and green apple. Fresh acidity gives it a clean, bright finish. Pair this with vegetarian appetizers.
Name: Corvo 2013 Bianco White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Floral aromas and tropical scents are a touch heavy and oily. This blend of Viura and Chardonnay is citrusy in the mouth, with little variation on that theme. Tangerine, orange and tart nectarine flavors finish bright and juicy.
Name: Ochoa 2013 Estate Bottled Viura-Chardonnay White (Navarra)

Description: Slightly nutty aromas are not terribly exciting, but in the mouth this is better; it's fresh, with a proper acid-to-body ratio. Flavors of dry apple and nectarine finish mildly bitter, with a distinct note of almond skins. This is 75% Viura and 25% Chardonnay.
Name: Vega Sindoa 2013 Viura-Chardonnay White (Navarra)

Description: With a tan tint and aromas of banana, undefined stone fruits and slight chemical, this is not all that inviting. The palate is on the flat side, while pithy flavors of melon and citrus finish with a bitter note of almond skins.
Name: Vega Sindoa 2012 Viura-Chardonnay (Navarra)

Description: Chemical notes sit atop aromas of peach pit and green banana. This is narrow in the mouth, with mealy melon and tropical fruit flavors. A peachy finish lacks finesse and more.
Name: Las Valles 2012 Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)

Description: This blend of 71% Chardonnay, 23% Viognier and 6% Sauvignon Blanc offers good concentration and ample richness, with pure yet powerful aromas and flavors of wood-grilled apple, peach pit, beeswax and yellow melon rind. Accents of toasted challah and pressed yellow flowers add depth to the bouquet, while finishing touches of orange oil and sweet spice unfold on the round, lush finish. Drink now–2018.
Name: Gérard Bertrand 2011 Cigalus White (Aude Hauterive)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Made from a blend of Ribolla Gialla and Malvasia Istriana, this rich but finessed wine conveys delicate aromas of hawthorne, stone fruit and slate. The succulent palate delivers apricot, tangerine and lime accented with mineral and bitter almond. An unusual, compelling wine.
Name: Scubla 2012 Speziale Bianco White (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Description: Alluring aromas suggest hawthorne, stone fruit, dried hay, flint and almond. The savory palate delivers white peach, yellow apple, lemon drop and nectarine accented with sage and mineral notes. The fruit richness is brightened by crisp acidity.
Name: Livio Felluga 2011 Abbazia di Rosazzo  (Rosazzo)

Description: Winemaker Michael McCay considers this white a field blend, listing Vermentino, Verdelho, Muscat and an improbable dollop of Pinot Noir as the varieties. Together they equate to deliciousness, a light, stainless-fermented statement of pineapple and guava, the Vermentino's salty head rearing just slightly.
Name: McCay Cellars 2012 Tres Blanc White (Lodi)

Description: This full-bodied and savory blend of Chardonnay, Ribolla Gialla and Sauvignon opens with lovely aromas of hawthorne, apple and stone fruit. The vibrant palate delivers yellow peach, nectarine, Golden Delicious apple and candied citrus alongside bright acidity.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2011 Bratinis White (Collio)

Appellation: Alto Adige Terlano, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: A blend of 60% Pinot Bianco, 30% Chardonnay and 10% Sauvignon, this elegant wine opens with mature yellow apple, Bartlett pear and citrus that all continue on to the palate. The creamy flavors are brightened by crisp acidity.
Name: Manincor 2012 Rèserve della Contessa White (Alto Adige Terlano)

Description: A blend Friulano (fermented in oak) and Pinot Bianco and Sauvignon (fermented in steel tanks), this has aromas of white fragrant flowers, subtle oak, toast and exotic fruit. The rich palate offers pear, apple, candied citrus, vanilla and butterscotch.
Name: Livio Felluga 2011 Terre Alte  (Rosazzo)

Description: Creamy pear and aloe vera act like a cooling cushion for fresh, zesty acidity. This is lively, tight and not for faint hearts, but totally rewarding with its uncompromising refreshment.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2013 Wiener Gemischter Satz White (Vienna)

Description: This blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon and Pinot Grigio opens with intense aromas of lemon blossom, pear, apple and flint. The linear palate delivers succulent white peach, green apple and lemon-lime alongside bright acidity.
Name: Zuani 2011 Vigne White (Collio)

Description: Another of Borra's inventive blends, this one brings together 60% Kerner, 20% Riesling and 20% Gewürztraminer. It opens aromatically with full-blown Riesling petrol. From there, the midweight texture turns to floral notes, grapefruit and herbs, along with minerality.
Name: Borra 2012 Intuition Field Blend White (Lodi)

Description: Winemaker Markus Niggli is making remarkable whites from unusual, hard-to-find grapes, in this case a blend of 50% Kerner, 25% Riesling and 25% Bacchus. This slight, seductive white dances in acidity that's got an electric mouthfeel, with a bouquet of citrus and herbs that you'll be thinking about a long time.
Name: Borra 2013 Artist Series White (Lodi)

Description: Lovage, ripe pear and a yeasty undertone speak separately before uniting into a mellow, food-friendly, concentrated but streamlined white. There is lots of subtly spiced midpalate interest to linger over. This cries out for food, especially soft cheeses.
Name: Lenikus 2013 Wiener Gemischter Satz White (Vienna)

Description: This polished blend of 80% Pinot Bianco and 20% Chardonnay features aromas of Golden Delicious apple, peach, passion fruit and vanilla that carry over to the palate along with lemon drop. Aging partly in barrels gives it structure, while fresh acidity generates a crisp, clean finish.
Name: Niedermayr Josef 2011 Terlaner Hof zu Pramol White (Alto Adige)

Description: Green pear and flinty smoke announce a clean, mineral and linear palate. Slender and poised, it wins you over with a softer, textural core. It refreshes and soothes in equal measure and echoes with satisfying length.
Name: Weingut Christ 2013 Wiener Gemischter Satz White (Vienna)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: A 50-50 blend of native grapes Friulano and Ribolla Gialla that is fermented in large casks, this full-bodied wine opens with aromas of white flower and acacia. The linear palate delivers mature pear and yellow apple accented with bitter almond.
Name: La Tunella 2012 Biancosesto White (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Made with a unique blend of Wanderbara, Vernaza, Veltliner Rosato and Nosiola in equal parts, it has a fragrance of white flower, beeswax and white tree fruit. The round palate offers mature pear, yellow apple and clove alongside bright acidity.
Name: Casata Monfort 2011 Blanc de Sers White (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: The scent of ripe, red-cheeked apples perfumes this tight and linear offering. It refreshes with almost spritzy lemon peel and comes across as a zippy but concentrated summer wine.
Name: Ingrid Groiss 2013 Gemischter Satz White (Niederösterreich)

Description: Restrained ripeness does not make this an obvious wine, but it comes towards you if you spend time with it. Notions of yellow pear and Golden Delicious apple partner with an herbal twist and refreshing citrus acidity.
Name: Tinhof 2013 Blanc White (Burgenland)

Description: Restrained yet ripe nuttiness with spikes of lemon zest characterize this slender, refreshing white. It is made from a typically Viennese field blend of 11 different white grape varieties—guaranteed to show its true and arresting colors with richer food.
Name: Wieninger 2013 Wiener Gemischter Satz White (Vienna)

Description: Enticing notes of honeysuckle and ripe peachiness make for an aromatic summer white with an uncomplicated but inviting presence. Guaranteed to put a smile on your face with its aromatic freshness and light body.
Name: Hillinger 2013 Small Hill White (Burgenland)

Description: Minerally lime and peach-pit aromas set up a crisp, stony, elegant palate with lees-based flavors of vanilla that are softly matched by melon and papaya. Fresh and not too demanding, it's made from 70% Garnatxa Blanca and 30% Macabeo (Viura).
Name: Jaspi 2012 Blanc White (Terra Alta)

Description: Honeyed, botrytis aromas come with notes of peach, nectarine and cinnamon. This is lifted but a touch sticky on the palate, with flavors of honey, spice and white pepper. All these flavors carry onto the finish, which quickly loses its steam.
Designation: Toro de Piedra Late Harvest Grand Reserve
Name: Viña Requingua 2012 Toro de Piedra Late Harvest Grand Reserve Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Curicó Valley)

Description: A blend of Friulano, Malvasia, Pinot Grigio, Sauvignon and Ribolla Gialla, it has aromas of hawthorne, stone fruit, pear and almond. The palate offers green apple, yellow peach, bitter almond and a hint of menthol alongside bright acidity.
Name: Mario Schiopetto 2012 Blanc des Rosis White (Venezia Giulia)

Description: A blend of Pinot Bianco, Friulano, Sauvignon and Ribolla Gialla, this structured but elegant wine offers Golden apple, dried apricot, citrus and subtle oak along with a hint of butterscotch.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2011 Col Disôre White (Collio)

Description: Green pear peel mixed with ripe but tart yellow apples—think Cox Orange Pippin—comes across with a disarming purity. Spritz enlivens the slender, light body and makes for perfect refreshment.
Name: Tement 2013 Temento White (Südsteiermark)

Description: A blend of Pinot Bianco, Friulano and Ribolla Gialla, this structured wine discloses aromas of white fragrant flowers and exotic fruit. The round palate offers yellow apple, pear, almond and vanilla with  a hint of toast.
Name: Marco Felluga 2011 Molamatta White (Collio)

Description: This rich blend of 60% Chardonnay, 22% Sauvignon, Pinot Bianco and Gewürztraminer is loaded with apricot, peach, pear, lemon drop and pineapple sensations. The only downside is that you can notice the alcohol, which throws it off balance.
Name: Tramin 2012 Stoan White (Alto Adige)

Description: Prickly citrus aromas are jumpy and a touch sulfuric. This feels leesy, creamy and fat in the mouth, with creamy, tropical flavors of melon and papaya. Bitter flavors of almond and citrus pith vie with lees-based vanilla notes on a round, plump finish.
Name: Celler Bàrbara Forés 2012 Blanc White (Terra Alta)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Sémillon-Sauvignon Blanc blend hits the nose with near-petrol scents, and then slides into a slightly sour-orange zone. On the palate, that citrusy intrigue continues into a lime zest finish. It's a vibrant, refreshing sipper, though it leans on tingling acidity more than overall balance.
Name: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2012 White (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: A blend of Pinot Bianco, Chardonnay and Picolit that's fermented and aged in small French casks, this opens with aromas of toast, apple, bread crumb and oak. The aromas carry over to the palate along with butterscotch and butter.
Name: Livio Felluga 2011 Illivio White (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Made from a blend of 65% Pinot Bianco, 25% Friulano, 10% Riesling Renano and aged in barriques, this opens with aromas of oak, toast and lemon zest. These carry over to the palate along with vanilla, apple and butterscotch. The hefty presence of alcohol throws this wine off balance.
Name: Scubla 2011 Pomedes White (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Description: Earthy notes of wild mushrooms, soy sauce and citrus peel make for an unusual nose on this blend of indigenous and rare Austrian varieties Rotgipfler and Zierfandler. Friendly, ripe and rounded yellow and red apples play on the palate of this unusual but very versatile wine.
Name: Johanneshof Reinisch 2013 Gumpoldskirchner Tradition White (Thermenregion)

Description: The Chardonnay and Alvarinho complement each other well, the one bringing a rounded texture, the other adding a fresh and mineral character. Together, they produce a refreshing, ripe wine that has attractive citrus and yellow fruits. Drink from 2015.
Name: DFJ Vinhos 2013 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Made without added sulfites, this blend of 70% Sauvignon, 10% Chardonnay, 10% Nosiola and 10% Goldtraminer has aromas of dried apricot, earth, honey and walnut. The palate offers dried golden apple and lemon drop. Although it still has lively acidity, enjoy soon for fresh fruit flavors.
Name: Pisoni 2012 Armonia Bianco White (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Minerally apple aromas are dusty and yeasty, but straightforward. This feels juicy and a touch plump, with nectarine, citrus and green herb flavors that carry through to the finish.
Name: Emina 2013 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: Oak dominates this blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon and Pinot Grigio. Aromas of toasted wood, butterscotch, lemon zest and walnut carry over to the palate alongside yellow apple.
Name: Zuani 2011 Riserva White (Collio)

Description: A blend of 50% Friulano and 50% Chardonnay, this offers toasted oak, lemon zest, yellow apple and buttery sensations accompanied by zesty acidity. It has more oak-driven flavors than fruit richness and it ends on a note of bitter walnut.
Name: Mario Schiopetto 2010 Bianco White (Venezia Giulia)

Description: This is an intriguing combination of 59% Chenin Blanc, 25% Roussanne and 16% Viognier from a range of California regions, including Clarksburg, Santa Barbara and Sonoma County. Barrel-fermented and given some time in used French oak, it offers a tasty mélange of fig, guava and vanilla custard, a viscous mouthfeel and a crisp, complex finish.
Name: Vinum Cellars 2012 White Elephant White (California)

Description: Generic white-fruit aromas of peach and apple are slightly pithy. This feels good but innocuous, while flavors of apple and stone fruits lose some of their snap and directness on a tropical-tasting finish.
Name: Esperanza 2013 Estate Grown & Bottled Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Appellation: Vi de la Terra Mallorca, Spanish Islands, Spain
Description: This white blend from Mallorca is melony up front and, like an island wine is prone to show, saline is all over the nose. In the mouth, this is melony but not too soft, with flavors of papaya, banana and honeydew. A smooth, creamy finish says drink this soon.
Name: Ànima Negra 2012 Quíbia Falanis White (Vi de la Terra Mallorca)

Description: Lemon and apple lend shape to this clean and uncomplicated white that boasts a little spice on the midpalate.
Name: Neumeister 2013 Gemischter Satz White (Südoststeiermark)

Description: Disclosing soft citrus and a balanced palate without any hard edges, it's honest and unpretentious.
Name: Sattlerhof 2013 Vom Sand White (Südsteiermark)

Description: The Other blends 65% Chardonnay with 25% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Viognier. The result is a full-bodied, oak-influenced white offering fig, vanilla custard and honey amidst a sweet core that threatens to overwhelm.
Name: Peirano 2011 The Other White (Lodi)

Description: Freshness and slight aromatics play against an earthy, phenolic palate.
Name: Gebeshuber 2013 Querfeldein White (Thermenregion)

Description: In this very basic wine, applesauce aromas are followed by a plump, somewhat citrusy feeling palate. Flavors of nectarine are good and clean, while the finish is solid.
Name: Volver 2012 Tarima White (Alicante)

Description: Melon, peach and vanilla-cookie aromas are simple and easy. This is plump in feel but bland on the tongue. Flavors of stone fruits are modest, while the finish lumbers along and lingers with a touch of peach.
Name: deAlto Amo 2011 Blanco Viura-Chardonnay (Rioja)

Description: White-flower aromas and little more define the nose on this bland wine from hot Jumilla. A flabby mouthfeel sets up green banana and pyrazine-based flavors. Papaya is the only discernible flavor note on an otherwise soft and creamy finish.
Name: Bodegas Luzón 2012 Luzón Blanco White (Jumilla)

Description: Light apple-blossom aromas are harmless. In the mouth, this Chardonnay-based blend is flat and buttery in feel, with baked apple and peach flavors before a flat finish.
Name: Drassanes 2012 White (Valencia)

Description: The wine has sweetness as well as a sugar-water character. It is fruity, but has a concocted, artificial aftertaste.
Name: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2013 Late Harvest Gewürztraminer-Riesling (Tejo)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Chunky aromas are lacking in fruit. The palate feels pithy and citric, while pyrazines and bland citrus drive the flavor profile on this Verdejo-Viura blend that's past its prime.
Name: Pedro Escudero 2012 Fuente Milano Verdejo-Viura (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: A pleasant, tropical-flavored “house white,” it hints at banana and pineapple flavors and is soft and easy in texture. The winery blended 52% Chardonnay grapes with the aromatic Symphony variety and a few others.
Name: Crushed 2011 White (California)

Description: This yellow-colored blend is weird and wooly, with aromas of blowsy apricot and herbs. A pulpy, melony palate is creamy and odd in feel, with nectarine and chunky peach flavors that turn rubbery on the finish.
Name: Angosto 2011 Blanco White (Valencia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Modeled on a white Bordeaux, this is a lovely, lightly toasty blend of two-thirds Sauvignon Blanc and one-third Sémillon. The pretty fruit mixes candied lemon, peach and pear with streaks of butterscotch and a suggestion of hazelnuts.
Name: DeLille 2012 Chaleur Estate Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Viognier is half the blend, with the rest Roussanne and Riesling, yielding a delightfully aromatic, lightly honeyed wine, with a lush array of ripe fruits. Apricot, papaya, pineapple and banana are all here, with supporting acidity. Overall, this is one of the most delicious and unique white wines in Washington.
Name: Brian Carter 2012 Oriana White (Yakima Valley)

Description: Made with 70% Carricante and 30% Catarratto, this elegant wine features aromas of tree fruit and white peach. The focused palate delivers tart green apple, citrus and mineral accented with savory Mediterranean herbs alongside crisp acidity. It closes on an almond note.
Name: Destro 2012 Isolanuda  (Etna)

Description: Refreshing from the first whiff of green apple, fuchsia, and almond blossom, it has flavors of peach, eucalyptus, green apple, and white flowers. Harmonious tannins persist to the bright note of the vanilla custard and orange zest finish, undercut by strong minerality.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2012 Hermon White (Galilee)

Appellation: Isola dei Nuraghi, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This blend of Nasco and Vermentino from Sardinia leads with heady floral aromas of honeysuckle and spring flowers. The palate delivers rich white peach, melon and tangerine peel. Crisp, refreshing acidity reins in the lush flavors, lending a polished feel.
Name: Argiolas 2012 Iselis White (Isola dei Nuraghi)

Description: A blend of Viognier, Roussanne, Chardonnay, Chenin Blanc and Sémillon, this leads with bright aromas of fresh red apple, peach, tangerine and beeswax. Round and lush, the palate feels opulent and attractive, but with ample acidity to balance. Notes of ripe quince, baking spice and toast linger on the finish.
Name: Avondale 2011 Cyclus White (Paarl)

Description: From a parcel in the Osterberg Grand Cru vineyard, this is a blend of Riesling, Pinot Gris and Gewurztraminer. The spice dominates although it is cut through by Riesling acidity. It's not quite integrated, showing youthful exuberance that needs to settle down. Drink from 2016.
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2010 Clos du Zahnacker White (Alsace)

Description: This starts off sweet and unctuous, with scents of superripe nectarine and apricot that flood the bouquet, followed by hints of baking spice, lightly toasted nuts and honey. The full, round texture is balanced by refreshing acidity that carries through to the long, bright finish. Drink now–2016.
Name: Fleur Du Cap 2010 Noble Late Harvest Bergkelder Selection White (Stellenbosch)

Description: This is a round and full blend, with forward scents of apple skin, ripe nectarine, orange Creamsicle and toasted almond. The richness carries through to the creamy palate, with flavors of caramel-drizzled peach pie and toast on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Bizoe 2011 Henrietta Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Roughly half stainless-fermented Sauvignon Blanc and half barrel-fermented Sémillon, this has noticeable sweetness that puts a sugary edge on the flavors. Pineapple and Meyer lemon fruits are round and full-bodied. This should be chilled to cut down some of the sugary flavors.
Name: Covington 2012 Klipsun Vineyard Blanc Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: With minerally, clean aromas of lemon-lime and seashell, this is ready for summer sipping. A tangy, citric palate offers pure orange, tangerine and lime flavors, with mango thrown in for moderate sweetness. A citrusy, cleansing palate is exactly as it should be.
Name: Pedro Escudero 2013 Fuente Milano Verdejo-Viura (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: This barrel fermented and aged blend of Fiano and Greco opens with attractive floral aromas that recall Spanish broom and acacia with a whiff of beeswax. The austere palate offers green pear, citrus and mineral alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2012 Campanaro White (Irpinia)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made from a blend of Coda di Volpe and Falanghina, this has aromas of lemon zest, pine forest and Mediterranean herbs. The fresh, linear palate offers lemon-lime, nectarine and mineral alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2012 Bianco White (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A blend of native grapes Caprettone, Greco and Falanghina, this wine has aromas that recall wild flowers and mature stone fruit with a hint of Mediterranean herbs. The round, juicy palate delivers ripe peach and apricot accented with notes of sage and thyme.
Name: Cantine Astroni 2012 Cratere Bianco White (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This blend of native grapes (80% Caprettone and 20% Catalanesca) conveys delicate fragrances of Spanish broom and white fragrant flowers. The vibrant palate offers apple, citrus and peach accented with notes of Mediterranean herbs. Vinity Wine, Panebianco.
Name: Cantine Olivella 2012 Lacrimabianco White (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Description: This blend of 60% Malvasia delle Lipari, 30% Carricante and 10% other native grapes features aromas of subtle oak, coconut and hints of exotic fruit. The round palate delivers sweet nectarine, peach and juicy tropical fruit accented with Mediterranean herbs.
Name: Tenuta di Castellaro 2011 Pomice White (Sicilia)

Description: Made with native grapes Ripoli, Fenile and Ginestra, this concentrated, lumbering wine opens with aromas of oak, citrus and dried apricot. The dense palate offers oak extract, candied lemon, toast, and dried stone fruit. It finishes on a sugary sweet note of rock candy and butterscotch.
Name: Marisa Cuomo 2011 Fiorduva Furore Bianco White (Costa d'Amalfi)

Description: A blend of 80% Grillo and 20% Viognier, this conveys heady aromas of fragrant white flowers, exotic fruit and apricot. The palate delivers rich yellow peach, mango and citrus with a hint of sweet vanilla.
Name: Stemmari 2012 Dalila White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: A blend of Grillo, Cataratto and Chardonnay, this opens with aromas of tropical fruit and apricot. The rich palate is loaded with golden apple and yellow peach flavors that are accented by notes of vanilla and lemon drop.
Name: Tenuta Rapitalà 2013 Piano Maltese White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Rubber band, almond skin and dry citrus aromas feed into a tight, raw, rubbery feeling palate with a low fruit quotient and more brine and bitterness than expected. This is quite dry, salty and pithy but also fresh and lively on the finish. Drink immediately.
Name: Telmo Rodríguez 2011 Sierras de Málaga Blanco White (Málaga)

Description: This blend of native white grapes Fiano, Greco and Falanghina is aged for six to eight months in barriques. Aromas of tropical fruit, coconut, oak and apple carry over to the palate.
Name: I Capitani 2013 Faius White (Irpinia)

Description: This blend of 50% Falanghina, 30% Biancolella and 20% other grapes opens with pretty aromas of white flower and beeswax with a hint of exotic fruit. The juicy palate offers Bartlett pear, grapefruit and nectarine alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Giuseppe Apicella 2012 Tramonti Bianco White (Costa d'Amalfi)

Description: It boasts zesty lemon, white peach and exotic fruit flavors. The juicy fruit palate is restrained by crisp acidity. Sip this as an apéritif or pair it with light appetizers.
Name: Spadafora 2013 Alhambra Bianco White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made from a blend of Falanghina, Biancolella and Pepella, it conveys aromas of honeysuckle, chamomile and exotic fruit punctuated with sage and mint. The linear palate offers citrus, grapefruit and pineapple alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Tenuta San Francesco 2012 PerEva White (Costa d'Amalfi)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A blend of Falanghina and Coda di Volpe, this offers aromas that recall pineapple, banana and jasmine. The juicy, simple palate offers pear, white peach and a hint of flint alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Sorrentino 2012 Vigna Lapillo White (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Description: A blend of 70% Insolia and 30% Chardonnay, this easy-drinking wine has apple, peach, pear and citrus sensations. The round, juicy palate is one-dimensional but easy to enjoy.
Name: Cusumano 2013 Angimbè White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: A blend of Grecanico, Chardonnay, Viognier and Fiano, this opens with a fragrance of honeysuckle, stone fruit and citrus. The juicy palate offers lemon zest, nectarine and white pear alongside bright acidity.
Name: Planeta 2013 La Segreta Bianco White (Sicilia)

Description: Made with a blend of 85% Falanghina and 15% Pallagrello Bianco, this opens with citrus, graphite and stone fruit aromas. The linear palate offers white peach, yellow grapefruit, lemon zest and mineral alongside lively acidity.
Name: Poderi Foglia 2012 Conca Bianco White (Galluccio)

Description: This blend of Biancolella and Forastera opens with subtle aromas of white spring flower and tree fruit. The rather lean palate offers crisp yellow apple, mineral and Bartlett pear alongside prominent acidity.
Name: Casa D'Ambra 2012 Biancolella White (Ischia)

Description: Made from a 50-50 blend of Chardonnay and Viognier, it features aromas of yellow peach, apricot and a hint of baked bread. The palate is less expressive however, with a thick honey-like consistency but not much flavor.
Name: Gurra di Mare 2011 Tirsat White (Sicilia)

Appellation: Colli di Salerno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made from a blend of 70% Fiano, 20% Moscato and 10% Malvasia, this offers aromas of tropical fruit and citrus. The subtle, simple palate presents peach, pineapple and pink grapefruit alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Casa di Baal 2012 White (Colli di Salerno)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This cheeky blend of Chardonnay and Bordeaux-inspired Sauvignon Blanc is delicately framed. Fresh and fruity, it discloses apple and lemon notes accented with hints of smoke and savory nuts.
Name: Raphael 2012 Chardeaux White (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Made from Moscato d'Alessandria and Albanello grapes, this wine's intense honeysuckle and jasmine aromas recall air freshener. The palate is muddled, with the same overly sweet floral sensations alongside smoky mineral and a bitter, nutty finish.
Name: Occhipinti 2012 SP68 Bianco White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This off-dry wine is fresh, light and fruity. Bright pear and quince flavors are given a boost by great acidity, spice and a light touch of mineral texture. Drink now.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2012 One White (Alsace)

Description: A blend of 60% Fiano and 40% Inzolia, it delivers fruity aromas of pineapple, green melon and peach. The simple palate is rather lean, with notes of green apple and citrus alongside racy acidity.
Name: Cantine Gulino 2013 Fania White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made from organically farmed grapes, this blend of 70% Grillo and 30% Sauvignon has a subtle nose of citrus and stone fruit. The palate offers restrained lemon-lime notes but not much fruit richness. You'll also notice evident alcohol sensations on the close.
Name: Di Giovanna 2012 Helios Bianco White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made from organically farmed Fiano, Malvasia and Trebbiano grapes, this begins with aromas of oak and coconut. The lean palate offers zesty grapefruit, mineral, oak and smoky elements but it lacks fruit richness.
Name: Casebianche 2012 Iscadoro White (Paestum)

Description: Banana, doughy pastry and flowery notes define the nose on this oily blend of Garnacha Blanca and other white grapes. This feels chunky and grabby but also citrusy; flavors of orange and melon finish heavy, with a bracing shot of citric acid.
