Name: Clos Pons 2012 Sisquella White (Costers del Segre)

Description: This blend of Muscat and Gewurztraminer is all spiciness. It has peach freshness as well with just a touch of honey. It's immediately attractive.
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2011 Andante White (Alsace)

Description: Intense tutti fruity aromas recall grape-flavored chewing gum. The palate is less expressive but muddled, offering sensations of thyme and rock candy that finish abruptly.
Name: Destro 2012 Nausìca White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made with organically grown Catarratto and Pinot Grigio grapes, this offers intense honeysuckle aromas that recall room freshener. The lean, simple palate offers tart green apple and a hint of citrus.
Name: Tresa 2013 Purato White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: A blend of 60% Viognier, 25% Sauvignon Blanc and 15% Chardonnay, this has aromas of yellow peach and flax seed. Flavors of ripe peach, apricot and vanilla continue into the cooling finish, which lacks brightness and is a little too chewy for its own good.
Name: Ixsir 2012 Grande Reserve White (Lebanon)

Description: Opening aromas recall delicate white spring flowers. The simple, one-dimensional palate isn't very expressive but offers subtle citrus and stone fruit alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Feudi del Pisciotto 2012 Baglio del Sole White (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Heavy white-fruit aromas have an almost “canned” quality. This is more like citrus juice than defined white wine, with hugely ripe tropical and citrus flavors culminating in creamy weight. This is 80% Godello and 20% Doña Blanca.
Name: Godelia 2012 Godello-Doña Blanca White (Bierzo)

Description: This blend of 70% Sauvignon Blanc and 30% Semillon is lean and racy. Grassy, lemony notes on the nose include a touch of pickled jalapeño, while an acidic laser beam of citrus creases the palate, leaving behind a puckery, austere impression.
Name: Man O' War 2012 Gravestone Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Waiheke Island)

Description: This sweet wine preserves the delicate balance between sweet fruits and light, aerial acidity that is the hallmark of Jurançon. The wine is honeyed, full of ripe yellow fruits while it is also shot through with freshness and a lively acidity. It should be aged, so don't drink before 2016.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2010 Foehn  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This Soave with pedigree and class proves the potential of this denomination. White peach, citrus, pear, honeydew melon and mineral sensations take center stage. The rich flavors are brightened by crisp acidity that gives a linear, elegant character. It has nice length and ends on an almond note.
Name: Pieropan 2011 Calvarino  (Soave Classico)

Description: This intriguing blend combines the structure of Chardonnay with the crushed tomato vine and cantaloupe aromatics of Sauvignon. The rich palate delivers a lovely depth of ripe apple, creamy lemon, and melon flavors, layered with hints of exotic fruit and spice.
Name: Vie di Romans 2010 Dut'Un White (Venezia Giulia)

Description: A ripe, wood-aged wine, it's richly smoky and fruity at the same time. The blend brings out honey, ripe apricots and peach. Acidity cuts through at the end to give a final, delicious lift. Drink now, but best wait until 2015.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2011 Cami Salié  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This smooth, richly textured wine offers concentrated sensations of exotic fruit, apricot, smoky mineral, golden apple, hazelnut and a hint of honey. The palate is brightened by crisp acidity that gives a crisp finish. This will develop more complexity over the next few years. Drink now–2017.
Name: Franz Haas 2011 Manna White (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Although the wine is dry, it has a wonderfully aromatic, honeyed character. That follows through to the rich, full palate, giving a wine that tastes of dried apricots and quince. Full-bodied, it should be drunk in a year.
Name: Domaine Nigri 2012 Pierre de Lune  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: It opens with a floral fragrance of Spanish broom, jasmine and chamomile. The juicy palate delivers citrus, pineapple and almond alongside crisp acidity that lends a clean, refreshing close.
Name: La Cappuccina 2012 Fontego  (Soave)

Description: This wine shows more character and finesse than most other Italian whites in this price range. Subtle aromas of apples, peach and mineral carry over to the bright, savory palate along with citrus notes and crisp acidity. It has nice length and leaves the mouth feeling clean and fresh.
Name: Pieropan 2012  Soave Classico

Description: This medium-bodied wine has attractive aromas of yellow peach, pear and tropical fruit. The concentrated palate offers ripe pear, golden apple, papaya and pineapple with a note of bitter almond on the finish.
Name: Cesari 2012 Cento Filari  (Lugana)

Description: It opens with aromas of white spring flowers, Red Delicious apples, Bartlett pear and a hint of Mediterranean herbs. All carry over to the palate along with lemon. Vibrant acidity gives a crisp, refreshing finish.
Name: Cantina di Soave 2012 Rocca Sveva Castelcerino  (Soave Classico Superiore)

Description: This is a smooth, ripe wine, just hinting at wood. Honey and lemon flavors are cut by tight, mineral acidity. It's perfumed from the Muscadelle in the blend, giving a rich wine that is developing fast. Drink from 2015.
Name: Le Nardian 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A round, pleasant, 50-50 blend of Pinot Blanc and Mélon de Bourgogne (Muscadet), this is front-loaded with citrus, apple and pear fruit, nicely balanced with just enough acidity. Drink to while it's young and fresh.
Name: Grochau 2012 Pearl White (Willamette Valley)

Description: Both herbal and tropical in character, this wine presents a fascinating mix between cool and warm climate grapes from the same region. The mineral, tight texture holds these two disparate flavors together to give a balanced wine that is ready to drink.
Name: Fiuza 2011 Premium Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Tejo)

Description: A blend of 60% Pinot Bianco, 30% Chardonnay and 10% Sauvignon, this reveals a fragrance of white flowers and tree fruit. The juicy palate delivers white peach, yellow apple and a mineral note alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Cantina Terlano 2013 Terlaner Classico White (Alto Adige)

Description: Intense aromas of peach, honeydew melon and almonds carry over to the round palate along with juicy green apples. It has nice weight and personality. The acidity generates a crisp finish.
Name: Coffele 2013 Ca' Visco  (Soave Classico)

Description: A blend of 60% Pinot Bianco, 30% Chardonnay and 10% Sauvignon, it conveys aromas of oak, lemon drop and candied fruits. The round palate offers intense but fleeting sensations of Golden Delicous apples and butterscotch. This is already accessible so drink soon.
Name: Cantina Terlano 2011 Nova Domus Riserva White (Alto Adige)

Description: This wine, from remote Basque vineyards in the Pyrénées mountains, is a blend of Petit and Gros Manseng and Petit Courbu. It is very aromatic, with fascinating smoky, white fruits and honeyed mix of flavors. There is a textured character, tangy as well as ripe. Drink now.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2012 Euskal Egun White (Irrouléguy)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A blend of half Sémillon and half Chardonnay, this is an aromatic, fully fleshed-out wine that veers into richness without going too far. Swirling in layers of concentrated pear and lemon, it provides a long, substantial finish, ending in balanced acidity.
Name: Murrieta's Well 2012 Los Tesoros de Joaquin Chardonnay-Semillon (Livermore Valley)

Description: It starts with a light fragrance of spring flowers and pear. The bright palate offers white peach and citrus notes alongside crisp acidity that leaves a clean finish.
Name: Bolla 2012 Tufaie  (Soave Classico Superiore)

Description: A classic, herbaceous white Bordeaux, it adds a twist with orange zest and toasty flavors. The wood aging has rounded out and softened the naturally bright character of the wine to give weight and richness. Drink now.
Name: Cheval Quancard 2012 Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Floral aromas of white spring flowers partner hints of pear and stone fruit. The juicy palate offers white peach, apple and green melon alongside a mineral note and fresh acidity.
Name: Cantina del Castello 2013 Castello  (Soave Classico)

Description: With delicate aromas of yellow flowers and notes of exotic fruit, this is a classic, bright Soave. The juicy palate offers subtle peach, apples and honeydew melon and a hint of almond alongside fresh acidity. Sip as an apéritif or pair with light first courses and appetizers.
Name: Villa Canestrari 2013 Vigne di Sande  (Soave)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: A blend of 80% Chardonnay and 20% Pinot Bianco, this has sensations of yellow apples, beeswax, citrus and mineral. It's simple but well made and would work well with lightly seasoned fish or pasta dishes topped with vegetable sauces.
Name: Pisoni 2012 San Siro Bianco White (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: This opens with intense floral aromas and a whiff of candied citrus. The slightly sweet palate offers lemon drops, exotic fruit and notes of honey and almond.
Name: Cantina del Castello 2011 Carniga  (Soave Classico)

Description: A very attractive wine that has ripe yellow fruits that are cut by acidity and citrus flavors. The texture is soft, rounded and lightly creamy. It's can age a few months, so wait until the end of 2014.
Name: Château Ducasse 2012  Graves

Description: Oak extract dominates the nose on this wine together with aromas of Golden Delicous apple and lemon zest. The palate offers lemon, oak, vanilla and clove, but it lacks the fruit richness needed to support the oak.
Name: Elena Walch 2011 Beyond the Clouds White (Alto Adige)

Description: This wine is light, with touches of honey and dried fruit. Oranges, marmalade and dried sultanas are balanced by the acidity of this already attractive Sauternes. Drink now, but better from 2016.
Name: Cheval Quancard 2011 Lafleur Mallet  (Sauternes)

Description: Subtle floral aromas and whiffs of tropical fruit lead to a lean palate that offers peach, papaya and mango alongside bright acidity. Pair it with lightly seasoned seafood dishes.
Name: Villa Canestrari 2012 Auge  (Soave Superiore)

Description: Aromas of pear, yellow apples and pineapple carry over to the palate along with a banana note. The juicy palate is balanced by bright acidity, making this perfect for everyday fare from lightly seasoned fish to pasta topped with tomato sauce.
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2012 K White (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A light-drinking, high-acid white that's crisp with layers of floral-laced citrus and herb. An enjoyable sipping wine or one that'll pair easily with fresh seafood.
Name: Monte Volpe 2012 Sesso White (Mendocino County)

Description: This is a lightly creamy, fruity wine. With touches of citrus, bitter orange and a good burst of acidity, it is balanced, ripe and ready to drink.
Name: Château de Janicon 2011  Graves

Description: A soft, lightly tropical wine with attractive acidity and grapefruit as well as pineapple flavors. It is crisp, very fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: An herbaceous, catty wine, packed with gooseberry and grapefruit flavors. It is all crisp, fresh fruit and tight texture. It needs a few months to lose its shocking acidity.
Name: Petite Sirène 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a typically light and fruity wine from Gascony. It has light, fresh apple flavors, a green crisp streak and just a touch of spice. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Pajot 2012 Les Quatre Cépages White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This one-dimensional wine has muted aromas that recall tropical fruit. The palate doesn't give much away either, revealing subtle citrus and pear notes alongside racy acidity.
Name: Tinazzi 2013 Ca' de' Rocchi  (Lugana)

Description: A light and easy Soave, it offers delicate sensations of stone fruit and citrus alongside bright acidity. It would work well with spaghetti topped with mussels or vegetables.
Name: Bolla 2012  Soave Classico

Description: Initially subdued, the fresh-fruited ripeness of yellow Mirabelle plums and almost an aloe-vera-like scent lead the way, on the palate there is a streamlined but nonetheless nutty,almost smoky, rounded richness with a pleasing lick of freshness. Hazelnuts, wet pebbles and yeasty lees provide an additional dimension to this concentrated, sophisticated wine. This has mileage and will develop over the coming five years.
Name: Wieninger 2012 Bisamberg Alte Reben White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: While the wine has the natural herbaceousness of Sauvignon Blanc, it also has weight, minerality and a tight, nervy texture. Great fruit flavors are developing, but will take time. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Margaux 2011 Pavillon Blanc de Margaux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Many things happen here at once: there are rose petals, clear blossom honey, ripe yellow pears, bitter orange, roasted hazelnuts and green tea—unlikely companions that unite surprisingly well in this complex, nutty and layered wine with pleasing concentration and length.The wonderful seam of acidity lifts everything onto a different plane.
Name: Weingut Christ 2012 Bisamberg Alte Reben White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Ripe yellow pears and blossom honey notes can be teased out of this subtle wine by lots of swirling.The palate tingles with citrus freshness and a phenolic richness that has an intriguing but very pleasant hint of bitterness and some glimpses of star-anise and a lasting finish.
Name: Wieninger 2012 Rosengartl Alte Reben White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: High-toned notes of freshly-cut hay-meadows, mossy undergrowth and ripe pears provide a complex background for this rounded yet toned harmony of allspice, pear and hazelnut. A winning combination that calls for food.
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2012 Zierfandler Rotgipfler White (Thermenregion)

Description: The harmony of this field blend is astonishing: Delicious notes of ripe Amalfi lemons, mixed with some lanolin introduce this streamlined, sleek but concentrated wine, toned slenderness and grace make one almost forget about that central heft of pleasantly bitter phenolics. An athlete in a flowing, flattering and silky summer dress.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2012 Weissenkirchner Zwerithaler Smaragd White (Wachau)

Description: A rich, wood-aged wine, its high proportion of Sémillon gives it a full and creamy character. Apples mingle with white plums, spicy quince and fresh rhubarb. Already delicious, it should age. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Brown 2011  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Fresh, ripe, green grapes and white summer blossom promise refreshment that the palate promptly delivers, a streamlined, concentrated but still rich wine with a layered, textured midpalate and notions of green apple, Amalfi lemon peel and green walnuts: simply delicious.
Name: Weingut Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2012 Nussberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Half Viognier and half Roussanne, sourced from the Gamache vineyard. This is by far the best vintage of Liquidity to date. It's a thick, weighty wine, brimming with notes of toast, honey, caramel and loaded with tropical fruits. It's rich and substantial but never tiring.
Name: Market Vineyards 2012 Liquidity White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With a good proportion of Sémillon in the blend, this is a rich, smooth, already rounded wine. It displays ripe peach, melon and vanilla flavors as well as a more herbaceous character. The aftertaste is soft, creamy and touched by wood.
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2011 Aile d'Argent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: While closed on the nose, the palate reveals a spicy spray of white pepper, freshness and a surprisingly robust and concentrated midpalate that very much calls out for food.
Name: Lenikus 2012 Der Bisamberg White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: Fresh, crisp, green pears and a savoury hint of lovage promise a sleek version of the Gemischter Satz—racy acidity delivers but that characteristic, firm midpalate stands its ground and makes this a versatile all-rounder, always with that enticing hint of lovage.
Name: Weingut Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2012 White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: A subtle but intriguing perfume of honeysuckle and peach seduces on the nose while the palate is smooth with an almost oily mouth-feel boasting edges of mandarin peel and almond paste with just a touch of residual sugar?? This Alsace-lookalike will complement washed-rind cheeses and aromatic Asian foods perfectly.
Name: Lenikus 2012 Erinnerungsarten White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: 2011 was a great year for Sauternes and this second wine of Rieussec shows great botrytis weight and richness as well as a floral and fruity character. Bitter orange marmalade and honey give this still-youthful wine its sweeter and fruitier side. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Rieussec 2011 Carmes de Rieussec  (Sauternes)

Description: The subtle nose merely hints at ripe pears and bitter fir honey, the palate shows off with a yellow-fruited ripeness, edged by green pear peel and pithy phenolics that keep the fruitiness in check with wonderful balance and concentration.
Name: Tinhof 2012 White (Leithaberg)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: This Viognier-based blend with Sauvignon Musque opens in pretty floral aromas and flavors deep in honeysuckle and peach. Structured and soft, it has some weight midpalate that keeps it lifted through the long finish. Enjoy chilled on a porch overlooking a sunset with cracked crab.
Name: Vindemia 2012 Reggatta de Blanc White (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A quirky blend of six wildly-different white grapes, this has some sweet fruit, some bitter phenolics, and a noticeable honeyed character, suggesting that there was some botrytis in the mix. Rich and loaded with flavors of lemon curd, apricot and ripe peaches, it's a creative, interesting wine, worth exploring at this price.
Name: Patterson 2012 Forbidden White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The wine has a creamy character with weight and richness, if without a strong sensation of acidity. It is opulent with hints of the wood aging. Peach, pear and honey flavors show through at the end.
Name: Château Cos d'Estournel 2011 Cos d'Estournel Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: The sweet wine appellation of Cérons is just next door to Barsac. This 2005, now mature, shows the possibilities of these wines. It still has the botrytis, but it also has a rich texture that is rounding, losing its initial sweetness and gaining complexity. Drink now, or age until 2020.
Name: Château de Cérons 2005  Cérons

Description: In this strongly wood-aged wine, the spice and toast is as important as the fruit. As the wine matures over the next two to three years, the ripe apricot and pineapple fruit flavors will come through more vividly. Drink from 2015.
Name: Château de la Vieille Chapelle 2012 Les Grands Blancs  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: David Ramey is the consulting winemaker for this wine, a blend of 46% Pinot Grigio, 33% Sauvignon Blanc and 21% Gewürztraminer. Smooth and crisp, the Sauvignon Blanc's qualities are prominent, the wine a tempting mix of apricot, honey and lemon meringue.
Name: Brassfield 2012 Serenity White (High Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: A great value white, rich and thick in baked apple, mouth-filling and juicy. With aspects of Chardonnay and Viognier, the wine is textured, balanced and long-lasting on the finish.
Name: Novy 2012 Four Mile Creek White (North Coast)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This wine blends 40% Pinot Blanc, 32% Pinot Gris and 28% Riesling to nice effect, producing a crisp, balanced wine soft in lemon and pear notes. With toned acidity, it's a long-lasting quaff ready for shellfish or oysters plucked right out of the bay.
Name: Horse & Plow 2012 Farmstead White (North Coast)

Description: The herbaceousness comes from both the Sauvignon and Sémillon in the blend. The Sémillon also gives a full texture as well as potential richness. With attractive citrus acidity, this is a very drinkable wine that can age.
Name: Château Tanesse 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: On the ripe side of herbaceous, this is a full and rounded wine. It has citrus flavors along with richer tropical fruits, a mineral edge and delicious, juicy acidity. The wine can be drunk now, but will be better after 2015.
Name: Château Ducasse 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Citrus and apple flavors bring out freshness. A dry white, it conveys a smooth texture, lively acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Schröder & Schÿler 2012 Chartron la Fleur  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: From Livermore-based Fenestra, this blend includes Verdelho, Riesling, Chardonnay, Sémillon and Pinot Gris, swirling them into a medium-boded, balanced wine resplendent in peach and pear. With some heft on the finish, it ends satisfyingly clean.
Name: Fenestra NV True White Lot 1 White (California)

Description: A very herbal wine, it's also light and fruity. With crisp gooseberry, currants and an attractive perfumed fruitiness, it needs to develop for a few months. Wait until the end of 2014.
Name: Château de Cérons 2012  Graves

Description: A ripe, citrus and grassy wine that blends a good dollop of Sémillon with the Sauvignon Blanc. It's full and fresh, cut with citrus and very fruity. Drink now and until 2019.
Name: Château de Marsan 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Flavored with pear and apricot, this wine is soft and ripe. The crisp texture comes from the tangy orange zest and acidity. Light and fresh, the wine should be ready by late 2014.
Name: Château Graville-Lacoste 2012  Graves

Description: Apple and stone-fruit aromas are basic, mild and good. This is creamy in the mouth, with green-apple acidity providing edge and cut. Flavors of apple, green herbs and nectarine finish smooth.
Name: Paso a Paso 2012 Made with Organic Grapes White (La Mancha)

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromatically there's a tussle going on in this blend of Viognier (59%), Riesling (26%) and Roussanne with the notes of flowers, jasmine tea, and pear each vying for attention. The apricot flavors, however, seem much more in harmony in this off-dry wine with nicely balanced acidity that helps it go down easy.
Name: Kyra 2012 Opal White (Ancient Lakes)

Description: Crisp and refreshing, this blend of 85% Chenin Blanc and 15% Viognier is high in acidity with a creamy midpalate. Guava is most notable flavor, followed by kiwi and honey. Oysters would be a good call.
Name: Vinum 2012 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Clarksburg)

Description: This is a funky style of barrel-fermented Viura (with Malvasia) that's oaky and savory on the nose, with a cheesy quality. The mouthfeel is creamy and resiny, while flavors of aged peach, melon, raw wood and sunken minerality finish long.
Designation: Cueva del Monge Blanco Fermentado en Barrica
Name: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2010 Cueva del Monge Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)

Description: Gold in color and heavy on the nose, this Catalonian white blend is woody but also smells mealy and a touch sweaty. The palate is round and plump, while flavors of banana and oak finish resiny before shifting toward bitterness.
Name: Cristiari 2012 White (Costers del Segre)

Description: Apricot and nectarine notes rise up from the bouquet. This is juicy but bland, with melon and green-herb flavors. A soft finish renders this barely refreshing, and normally that's what Las Brisas is known for. The blend is Verdejo, Viura and Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Naia 2012 Las Brisas White (Rueda)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This unusual blend of white grape varieties (everything from Sauvignon Blanc to Gewürztraminer) is a bit savory on the nose and palate with flavors of pressed apple and caramel. It's bold in alcohol, but a bit demure in flavor concentration and finishes with a hint of green, reedy notes.
Name: Jamesport NV Cinq White (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: While perfumed on the nose with aromas of rose petal and peach, a vein of green lingers throughout this blend of Muscat and Malvasia. It's dry and medium bodied in style, but delicately concentrated with soft, yielding acidity.
Name: Palmer 2011 Aromatico White (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. A magnificently rich, rounded wine, packed with pineapple, apricot and crisp apple flavors. Citrus acidity gives freshness, and the wood aging will smooth the tight acidity with time. Impressive and complex, this is a white wine that needs to age.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This is a richly styled white, with great acidity as well as apricot and white peach fruits. The wine is shot through with grapefruit, lemon and a steely mineral texture.
Name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Here's a wine that shows swathes of warm fruits, with a rich structure that is cut by great acidity.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Fragrant, fruity, ripe and spicy, this is an impressive wine. The wood balances the fruitiness, giving a sense of structure, while crisp acidity gives the wine a fine lift at the end.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Warm, ripe and rich, this is a wine with weight, complexity and bright acidity. It's a rounded wine, with some strong wood flavors and a creamy texture that carries through to the finish.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Full and ripe, this is a fine wine. It has rich fruit notes of apricot and kiwi, with fresh acidity on the finish. The wood aging gently brushes the aftertaste.
Name: Château Picque Caillou 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Tight and mineral, this is a strongly herbaceous wine. It is taut, nervy and very fresh, while also having a rich underlying character. It needs to age.
Name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Complex and rich, this wine is fully textured, with ripe fruit flavors and balanced acidity. There is a touch of ginger, giving the wine extra complexity.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. An explosion of fruit on the nose gives this wine a wonderfully fresh character and tropical fruitiness. The wine is bright and full of dense pineapple and apricot flavors, with ample final acidity.
Designation: Pavillon Blanc de Chateau Margaux Barrel Sample
Name: Château Margaux 2013 Pavillon Blanc de Chateau Margaux Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A brilliant deep-gold color in the glass, this alluring Tokaji draws you in with heady aromas of dried pear, honeyed apricot and candied orange peel, then delivers in a big way with full-bodied roundness and flavors of dried apricot, pear compote and vanilla custard. Complex and extremely elegant, it has great balance of sweetness and acidity.
Name: Disznókö 2007 Aszú 5 Puttonyos Tokaji (Tokaj)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine is warm and ripe, with a fine balanced between the crisp acidity and tense citrus-fruit flavors. It shows the delicious tension of the vintage and will likely age well.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. An herbaceous wine, this also shows ample fruit character, touched by wood and spice. It boasts great richness on the palate, fine acidity and a dense, full texture. This will age well.
Name: Château Olivier 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Aromas of butterscotch, honeyed apricot, beeswax and honeysuckle transfer seamlessly onto the palate and are joined by flavors of sweet golden raisins and vanilla caramel. There's nice balance between sweetness and acidity, and a delightful touch of creaminess graces the finish.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2007 Szt. Tamás Aszú 6 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This rich, full-bodied wine also boasts ample freshness and acidity. Flavors of pineapple and fresh apricot broaden the texture, followed by a rounded aftertaste.
Name: Château Rahoul 2013 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Tight and currently herbaceous, this is a crisp, fruity wine that hints at the richness to come. It is full and concentrated in the mouth, with a mineral texture.
Name: Château la Louvière 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. A rich and rounded wine, this shines with pineapple and citrus flavors. It is full-bodied and likely to age well, with a mineral texture.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Opulent and elegant, this brilliant deep-gold Tokaji has aromas of vanilla caramel, crème brûlée and candied apricot. On the palate, crisp acidity clears the path for flavors of preserved apricot and candied apple. It's full and round in the mouth, and delightful on its own or served with cheese.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2007 Betsek Aszú 6 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Crisp and bright, this is a tightly textured wine that is full of delicious citrus fruits, layered with intense minerality. It will need to age.
Name: Château de France 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Richly fruity, this wine has a fine balance between its warm character and the natural freshness of the year. It's ripe, with swathes of citrus and crisp apple flavors, followed by a mineral texture at the end.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Grapefruit leads the nose and mouth of this wine, with a lovely fruity character and delicious acidity. It's racy, fresh and crisp, with a finish that pops.
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2013 Aile d'Argent Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is soft and rounded, while also suggesting potential richness. The fruits come through slowly, supported by a strong mineral character. It needs time.
Name: Château Haut-Bergey 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Aromas of butterscotch, apricot preserves and vanilla caramel lead to flavors of quince preserves and apricot tart. Round in the mouth, it shows excellent structure and delights with refreshing acidity on the finish.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2008 5 Puttonyos Aszú  (Tokaji)

Appellation: Côtes du Jura, France Other, France
Description: With age, this 2002 has become fascinating, still showing sweetness while also offering dried fruits, prunes, figs and spice. A nutty character suggests the wine can still age for many years.
Name: Château d'Arlay 2002 Vin de Paille White (Côtes du Jura)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. A second wine made from Haut-Brion fruit and its sister, La Mission Haut-Brion, vineyards. It is a rounded wine, with tropical fruit and pineapple flavors, as well as tight, mineral acidity.
Designation: La Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2013 La Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Appellation: Côtes du Jura, France Other, France
Description: A wine that is totally oxidative, nutty, Sherry-like with a fine balance between acidity and intense smokiness. It is ready to drink, a real wine of character.
Name: Domaine Berthet-Bondet 2009 Tradition White (Côtes du Jura)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine is fresh, mineral, smoky and fruity, with intense acidity that produces the freshest, crispest texture, somewhere between tropical and herbaceous.
Name: Château Cos d'Estournel 2013 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Here's a fruity, fresh and fragrant wine that has a strongly herbaceous character. It's crisp and bright at the end.
Name: Château Ferrande 2013 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Appellation: Côtes du Jura, France Other, France
Description: Although the wine is mature, it also has freshness that comes through strongly as aromatic and yellow-fruit driven. The acidity is intense, full of character while fruitiness continues right to the end.
Name: Château d'Arlay 2008 White (Côtes du Jura)

Description: Offering great bang for the buck, this late-harvest selection leads with seductive aromas of caramelized apricot and baked apple. It has flavors of freshly baked pear, apple tart and honeycomb, with a creamy mouthfeel and balanced acidity that lifts the palate.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2010 Mád Cuvée Late Harvest Tokaji (Hungary)

Description: A smooth and round wine, with citrus flavors that have been tamed by yellow fruit and melon flavors. That gives the wine richness as well as a fresh and crisp aftertaste. Drink until 2018.
Name: Benoît Daridan 2012 Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Cheverny)

Description: Aromas of citrus and rose petal lead to flavors of lemon-lime sorbet, pear and Turkish delight. Very soft tannins brush across the side palate, followed by a bright and refreshing close. Mevushal.
Name: Recanati 2012 Yasmin White Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc Chardonnay-Sauvignon (Galilee)

Description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This crisp, fresh and fruity wine is dominated by pink grapefruit notes, just touched by apricot. Wood flavors show at the end.
Name: Le Nardian 2013 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. This wine is not showing its fruitiness. It has some attractive bright acidity and hints of grapefruit, finishing with a crisp texture.
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2013 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This delightful, off-dry white is a blend of Pinot Gris, Gewürztraminer, Müller Thurgau, Sauvignon Blanc and Riesling,  perfectly matched to deliver crisp, fruity aromatics and flavors of apples, oranges and pears. It's a terrific anytime quaffer.
Name: Oak Knoll NV Toasted Cow White Vintners Blend White (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A full-bodied white blend composed largely of Chardonnay with smaller percentages of Gewürztraminer, Sauvignon Blanc, Orange Muscat, Viognier, Pinot Blanc, Sémillon and Muscat Canelli. The aromas and flavors lean tropical, ensconced in crisp vanilla and lemon-lime. A versatile wine for a myriad of foods. Rich seafood dishes will work particularly well.
Name: Murrieta's Well 2012 The Whip White (Livermore Valley)

Description: Enticing, with notes of candle wax, spice and zesty lemon, this off-dry blend of Müller-Thurgau and Riesling is deeply concentrated with white peach and apricot flavors. It's weighty and rich in feel, with streaks of mineral that add delicate complexity to the finish.
Name: Karl Josef 2011 Piesporter Michelsberg Qualitätswein White (Mosel)

Description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sauvignon Gris, this is an attractive, fruity wine, with a light perfume and citrus notes. It is attractive, balanced and ready to drink.
Name: Château Monbousquet 2013 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: The intense grassiness of the Sauvignon Blanc is just lightly smoothed out by Chardonnay. The result is a strongly aromatic wine with green fruits and lemon juice that are given some richness with a pear skin texture. Drink now–2018.
Name: Benoît Daridan 2012 Tradition Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Cheverny)

Description: This white blend is composed of 60% Chardonnay, 20% Sauvignon Blanc, 10% Riesling and 10% Gewürztraminer. It has aromas of lemon, mint and white peach, with flavors of green apple and white peach.
Name: Bulgariana 2012 White (Thracian Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Jura, France Other, France
Description: This wine has a mix of honey, sweet cherry fruit and fresh acidity. It is fruity while also sweet, giving concentration and richness at the end.
Name: Domaine Berthet-Bondet 2008 Vin de Paille White (Côtes du Jura)

Appellation: Côtes du Jura, France Other, France
Description: Structured and ripe, this wine achieves balance between sweetness and fruit. It shows ripe cherries and apricots that contrast with a fresh aftertaste.
Name: Frédéric Lornet 2006 Vin de Paille White (Côtes du Jura)

Description: 86–88. Barrel Sample. Get past the barnyard character and the wine shows fine fruits and some richness. It has good weight, finishing with a tight texture.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2013 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Light, tropical aromas are mellow and reflect the 15% Riesling that helps out the wine's core of Torrontés. A tangy mouthfeel is citrusy and fresh, while flavors of lime, lychee and tangerine finish lively, clean and not bitter.
Name: Amalaya 2012 Torrontés-Riesling White (Calchaquí Valley)

Description: This white blend has aromas of rose petal, lemon zest, candied orange rind and a touch of honeysuckle. It has pleasant floral accents on the palate, as well as flavors of Granny Smith apples and ripe pears.
Name: Črnko 2012 Jarenincan White (Štajerska)

Description: This mélange of mostly Viognier and Chardonnay also holds smaller percentages of Sauvignon Blanc, Symphony and Muscat. Incognito spent no time in oak. With a lively taste of orange blossom, it could almost be mistaken for Gewürztraminer because of its distinct mixture of floral and spice.
Name: Michael David 2012 Incognito White (Lodi)

Description: This wine has flavors of Cavaillon melon, star fruit, kiwi and jasmine, with a pronounced woody taste. There is a burst of brightness on the finish alongside a hint of menthol.
Name: Ouled Thaleb 2012 White (Zenata)

Description: Lemon, lime and straw aromas are fresh but also a little stalky. Spritz and then an oily afternote define the feel, while flavors of white fruits taste pithy and a touch green and herbaceous.
Name: Telmo Rodríguez 2012 Basa White (Rueda)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fenestra's proprietary blend of 59% Chardonnay and 41% Sémillon, this is a wine perfumed in gardenia that has a bite of oaky barrel amid barely ripe apple that finishes quick.
Name: Fenestra 2012 Semonnay Chardonnay-Semillon (Livermore Valley)

Description: 96–98. Barrel Sample. The beautifully aromatic, honeyed scent leads into flavors of bitter orange and honey, along with extreme freshness. Notes of white peach and Rocha pear give richness to a wine that is not huge, but wonderfully balanced.
Name: Château d'Yquem 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Here is a powerful, full-bodied wine that brings out the rich botrytis flavors of the year while also presenting bright, crisp acidity. The wine is concentrated, tight and fresh at the end.
Name: Château Rieussec 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. A rich wine, full of power and intense flavor. It is concentrated and dense, resulting in a taste that is not so much sweet as very rich and textured.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Complex and ripe, this has an opulent, full character that is balanced by fresh acidity. It's a very fine wine, on the tight edge between crispness and richness.
Name: Château Coutet 2013 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Full and rich, this is a powerful wine. It's packed with botrytis-driven flavors of wild honey and peach, balanced by tight acidity. For long-term aging.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Very honeyed, this is a rich, unctuous wine, with ripe orange and bitter marmalade flavors. It is densely structured, as the drier botrytis element comes through slowly.
Name: Château Lamothe Guignard 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. A rich, complete wine, this has beautiful acidity as well as the most intense botrytis character. It's a wine with long-term aging potential, ripe and already full in the mouth.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. Full-bodied and ripe, with flavors of spice, ginger and honey, this wine is already delicious. The full texture, acidity and dry botrytis structure promise aging potential.
Name: Château de Malle 2013 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This rich wine is still developing its spice, ginger and complex fruits. The acidity is pronounced, with a fresh character that balances the full botrytis flavors.
Name: Château Guiraud 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This wine has intense acidity, with a tangy orange character that expresses citrus fruitiness alongside a ripe peach-apricot flavor. The aging potential is certainly there.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel Sample. This wine is rich and full while still having a tight structure. It shows a fine streak of acidity that shoots through the honey and gingered marmalade flavors. A fine wine with potential.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2013 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: Developing a golden color, this is already a beautifully mature wine with some sweetness and ripe flavors of yellow fruits and lemon. There's also a touch of honey and spice to this blend of Pinot Gris and Riesling. It's ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2007 Rotenberg White (Alsace)

Description: This wine is made from a mix of 13 different grape varieties in a field blend. It's a totally terroir driven wine, full of mineral and gritty textures in its youth. Behind this structure is a wild range of flavors—spice, apples, pears and apricots—waiting to show through. It needs to age, so drink from 2016.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2011 White (Alsace)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. At this point in time, the wine is unfocussed. It has weight, a complex structure and attractive acidity, but the fruit is in hiding—it is there but not yet expressive. A wine for cellaring.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This is a complex wine that pops with acidity, followed by an intense botrytis character and a firm, dry structure. It's as much about richness as sweetness. The finish is delicious, with ample acidity.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2013 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Showing freshness as much as richness, this is a honey-and-lemon flavored wine. While it does have weight, the acidity cuts the texture, keeping the richness in balance. For long-term aging.
Name: Château Romer 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Big, ripe and full-bodied, this is already a delicious wine, with peach, orange and pink grapefruit flavors as well as an intense botrytis character. An almost shocking streak of acidity and freshness comes through at the end.
Name: Château de Fargues 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Very tightly textured, this wine is closed, only slowly revealing its power and complexity. The acidity is strongly present, offering freshness at the end.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Densely textured and rich, this is a concentrated wine. With its complex botrytis character and fresh acidity, it is a wine for long-term aging.
Name: Château Caillou 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine is very ripe and rich, with great concentration that comes through the dry, complex texture. There is power that is balanced by tight, bright acidity and citrus fruits.
Name: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine shows high acidity that is compensated by the rich texture. It is clearly a wine in evolution, showing citrus acidity while the potential richness of the wine is still to come.
Name: Château Nairac 2013 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Full and ripe, this is a powerful wine that has plump bitter orange and citrus flavors. The palate is balanced by a fine botrytis character, lending the promise of good aging potential.
Name: Château Broustet 2013 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: A blend of Riesling, Pinot Gris, Gewurztraminer and Muscat, this is a wine that fascinates. Both fresh and rich, this wine combines strongly perfumed notes with a pure, steely texture. It is drinkable now, although it will be better in three years' time. Glass stopper
Name: Domaine Pfister 2010 Cuvée 8 White (Alsace)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This wine is rich and full-bodied. It's packed with citrus, honey and powerful, dry botrytis flavors. A complex wine that has medium-term potential.
Name: Château d'Arche 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This wine has a light, fresh touch, attractively fruity and crisp. The acidity is currently dominant, with the sweetness slow to show strongly; wait for the core of botrytis flavors to give the wine weight.
Name: Château de Myrat 2013 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Full and rich, this is a dense wine that also has ample lift to its flavor. It has fresh acidity that is currently showing strongly.
Name: Château Filhot 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is tight, with a nervy acidity that cuts through the rich, sweet character. It's not a heavy wine, and offers a delicate, fruity aftertaste.
Name: Château Rabaud-Promis 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Updraft is two thirds Sauvignon Blanc and one third Semillon, barrel-fermented. Full-bodied and fleshy, it's bursting with ripe yellow fruits, along with apricot and papaya. On the tropical edge, but focused and lightly toasty, as you'd find in a Bordeaux.
Name: Cloudlift Cellars 2012 Updraft White Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Alpilles, Provence, France
Description: This is a full-bodied and rich wine with touches of vanilla and toast from wood aging that are integrated into flavors of ripe apricot, lime and herbs. Drink now, and until 2019.
Name: Mas de la Dame 2010 Coin Caché White (Vin de Pays des Alpilles)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This sample has some barnyard character, but tasting through that, it is possible to find a ripe wine, with some nervy acidity and notes of honey.
Name: Château Romer du Hayot 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine is light, fruity and fresh without great sweetness. It is bright, crisp and just touched by honey.
Name: Château Suau 2013 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. The richness of this full-bodied wine is masked by the soft texture. It is still unfocussed, giving acidity and dry botrytis character. The weight suggests finer things to come.
Name: Château Lamothe 2013 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: While the nose is muted, on the palate there are hints of Golden Delicious apples, fir honey and a pleasing bitter almond edge. This is a white wine made with food in mind, its pronounced midpalate will pair well with cheeses or creamy pasta. If you are looking for texture rather than primary fruit, this is your wine.
Name: T.P.O. 2012 In den Rothen White (Wiener Gemischter Satz)

Description: No specific blend is listed on this delicious wine—in the past it's been Chardonnay, Pinot Gris and Sémillon. Luscious, ripe fruit flavors of grapefruit, melon and loads of fresh pear combine to show a wonderfully fresh and tasty white wine. The acids lift up the brightness, and this round and fruity style is a can't miss proposition.
Name: 14 Hands 2012 Hot To Trot White (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cadaretta's production of this popular blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon seems to have tripled in this vintage, and the wine has lost some of its depth. It's crisp and edgy, with spicy highlights around light flavors of celery, pepper, jicama, cucumber and lemon.
Name: Cadaretta 2012 sbs Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This white blend of Vermentino, Moscato Giallo, Fiano and Pinot Grigio is elegant and austere with notes of lemon and grass. Herbal and fresh, it shines with Vermentino's distinct personality. This is a unique white blend from Mendocino with Italian roots that's definitely worth trying.
Name: Monte Volpe 2012 Nube Bianco White (Potter Valley)

Description: Lemon zest, lime and melon aromas lead this elegant white blend. Zesty citrus and lush melon on the palate offers a refined character that is nonetheless fine for everyday enjoyment. The finish is expressive and slightly floral.
Name: Estate Biblia Chora 2011 Ovilos White (Pangeon)

Description: There is an attractive smoky character to this round and warm wine. Perfumes from the Gewurztraminer in the blend are combined with delicious fresh citrus and apple flavors. It's a young wine, to be drunk young.
Name: Clément Klur 2011 Gentil de Katz White (Alsace)

Appellation: Les Baux de Provence, Provence, France
Description: This is a fruity and fresh wine with a warm, herbal feel characteristic of Provence. The palate boasts apricot and delicate citrus flavors with a hint of minerality. It has a fresh, perfumed aftertaste.
Name: Domaine de la Vallongue 2012 Garrigues White (Les Baux de Provence)

Appellation: Les Baux de Provence, Provence, France
Description: This citrus flavored wine is fruity and crisp with bright acidity and just a hint of herbal character. The wine is light, bright and ready to drink.
Name: Mas de la Dame 2012 La Stèle White (Les Baux de Provence)

Description: This Assyrtiko, Sauvignon Blanc blend offers a zesty, poppy Sauvignon Blanc nose with pineapple, fresh peach and a mineral spin on the palate. Balanced acidity keeps it steady. Likeable and enjoyable, but not intellectual.
Name: Oenogenesis 2011 En Oeno... Sauvignon Blanc-Assyrtiko White (Macedonia)

Description: An attractive blend in which Pinot Blanc seems to dominate, this wine is delicately creamy in texture with lively acidity and ripe apple and pear flavors. This is a wine to drink now.
Name: Dirler-Cadé 2011 Edelzwicker Réserve White (Alsace)

Description: A nose of fresh-cut flowers, tropical fruit and melon leads this barrel-fermented white blend . On the palate, the wine has a lovely floral character but lacks some of the minerality that gives Greek whites their lively touch. Pair with fish or cheeses.
Designation: Les Dons de Dionysos Barrel Fermented Assyrtiko-Athiri
Name: A. Parparoussis 2008 Les Dons de Dionysos Barrel Fermented Assyrtiko-Athiri White (Achaia)

Description: Candied lemon and lush tropical fruits start this Assyrtiko, Athiri blend from an established producer in northern Greece. Fresh, fun and slightly sweet on the palate, the wine has a softer, more feminine touch than many Greek whites. Great with lighter fare like salads and grilled seafood.
Designation: Metoxi Chromitsa X Single Vineyard Assyrtico-Athiri-Sauvignon Blanc
Name: Tsantali 2011 Metoxi Chromitsa X Single Vineyard Assyrtico-Athiri-Sauvignon Blanc White (Agioritikos)

Description: Here's a bright and easy-drinking wine made from Trebbiano, Passerina and Pecorino grapes. It has sensations of acacia flower, lemon and peach alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: Collevite 2012 White (Falerio)

Description: This is a blend of Pinot Gris and Riesling that melds the spice of the former with the steeliness of the latter. The result is a wine with lively acidity, touches of pepper and a crisp, light-hearted aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2012 Black Tie White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: As its name suggests, this wine is meant to go with shellfish. Light and fruity, it's perfect background wine to highlight a variety of foods. Fresh acidity, citrus and delicate apple notes are enjoyable.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2012 Crustacés White (Alsace)

Description: Just off dry, this is a smooth, attractively fruity wine that has a light touch of perfume. The acidity keeps the freshness level up, producing a wine that's easy to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Wolfberger 2011 Edelzwicker White (Alsace)

Description: This blend of Trebbiano, Pecorino and Chardonnay grapes offers everyday drinking pleasure. Simple but well made, this has floral, pear, apple and citrus sensations, along with crisp acidity.
Name: Saladini Pilastri 2012 White (Falerio)

Description: Not quite dry, this is a creamy apple-flavored wine. It is fresh, fruity and immediately attractive, with a light, fragrant aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Willm 2012 Gentil White (Alsace)

Description: Oaky aromas have a lacquer-like scent that dissipates into sawdust if given time. This is plump and melony in feel, with a resiny note to the texture. Fully ripe white-fruit flavors revolve around mealy melon, and there's an oxidized note to the finish.
Name: Anakena 2012 Ona Special Reserve Chardonnay-Viognier-Riesling White (Leyda Valley)

Description: This is a simple, soft wine which has some sweetness as well as easy fruit. There is some perfume and a spicy edge as well as rounded orange flavor. Drink now.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2011 Gentil White (Alsace)

Description: Oily, gritty, almost nutty aromas open this blend of 85% Viognier and 15% Chardonnay. The palate is plump, weighty and melony in texture, with honeyed flavors of banana and tropical fruits. A soft, dense, thick finish is par for the course.
Name: Estampa 2012 Estate Viognier-Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

Description: This is an easy, light and fragrant wine that seems destined to accompany fish. It has a touch of spice from the Pinot Gris and Sylvaner in the blend, along with a creamy, light aftertaste.
Name: Cave de Hunawihr 2011 Sushi Sélection White (Alsace)

Description: Neutral aromas of dusty apple and peach are o.k. at best. Like most 2012 white wines from Chile, this seems heat-affected; the body is plump and heavy, while melon and citrus flavors finish soft and mealy.
Name: Oveja Negra 2012 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc-Carmenère White (Maule Valley)

Description: Aromas of canned pear and peach are not fresh. This is syrupy in the mouth, with a bland mix of vanilla and melon flavors. Oxidized on the finish.
Name: Oveja Negra 2012 Reserva Chardonnay-Viognier (Maule Valley)

Description: Kracher always produces a blend in his range of TBAs. This is a hugely rich wine that's densely textured and with opulent fruit. Flavors of sweet oranges, honey and lemon juice makes up this impressively appealing wine. It does need to age, though, so drink from 2017.
Designation: Novelle Vague Nummer 6 Grande Cuvée Trockenbeerenauslese
Name: Kracher 2010 Novelle Vague Nummer 6 Grande Cuvée Trockenbeerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: This is a gorgeously ripe, opulent wine that shows a rich fruit-salad ripeness, as well as darker notes of botrytis. The wine is full and very ripe with flavors of honey, fennel and lemon, with sweetness balanced by acidity. This is a wine that could be drunk soon but will age magnificently. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2010  Sauternes

Description: Full and very rich, this is an opulent style of wine. It has a ripe, tropical fruit feel to it, offering power as well as fresh acidity. Pineapples and lychees give fruitiness, perfume and spice. The aftertaste, with its liquorous character, is gloriously warm and concentated. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Climens 2010  Barsac

Description: Dense and opulent, this is a fine, ripe wine. There is great weight here, along with flavors of nutmeg and white peach. Acidity and a firm, youthful texture all promise aging. Drink this wine from 2017.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2010  Sauternes

Description: This is a very spicy wine with weight, great depth of flavor and concentration. Fine acidity cuts through the core, balancing sweetness and adding freshness to flavors of wild thyme-honey and orange marmalade. Drink the wine from 2017.
Name: Château Coutet 2010  Barsac

Description: This wine is firm and powerful while also showing sweetness. It's textured and structured, with a zesty, tangy character that also brings out minerality. The palate is ripe with flavors of honey and lemon zest. The wine does need aging. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2010  Sauternes

Description: Very textured, this is a complex wine. There is a strong sense of minerality here, along with flavors of ripe apricots, peaches and grapes. The texture is zesty and tangy, showing some taut, nervy acidity. This is a wine for serious aging so don't drink before 2017.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2010  Sauternes

Description: This wine is sourced from a field blend of old vines grown on steep slopes behind Weissenkirchen. It has a very crisp character that's tight and mineral in style. Aromatic, spicy, herbal and perfumed, it needs time to open up and is still very young. Drink from 2016. Screwcap. Artisanal Cellars, Select Wines.
Name: Tegernseerhof 2011 Weissenkirchner Zwerithaler Smaragd White (Wachau)

Description: This wine is still very closed, and not yet showing its rich potential. That doesn't detract from its fine, botrytis texture, core of acidity and dried apricot flavors. It's a wine that needs to come out of its shell, so don't drink before 2018.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2010  Sauternes

Description: There is as much intense acidity in this wine as sweetness. Opulent yet fresh in character, the wine is developing into a full-bodied wine with powerful richness and promises long-term aging. Drink from 2017.
Name: Kracher 2010 Beerenauslese Cuvée White (Burgenland)

Description: There is just a touch of wood in this rich and concentrated wine. It brings out the smoothness of the Chardonnay in the blend and adds notes of spice. It's a full, ripe that's still elegant and fresh from crisp acidity on the finish. Age this wine, and drink after 2015. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2012 Ortolan Cuvée Prestige White (Niederösterreich)

Description: A fine balance between sweetness, acidity and astringency drives this wine forward. Acidity lifts the palate and adds freshness, and botrytis adds a drying astringency. Pineapples, prunes and apricots all add their fruity notes to this rich wine. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Nairac 2010  Barsac

Description: This is a classic Eiswein that is so finely poised between intense sweetness and an ethereal lemon freshness. The palate is a delicate fairy's dance of honey, orange zest and acidity. Age this wine and drink from 2017.
Name: Kracher 2011 Eiswein Cuvée White (Burgenland)

Description: There is a wonderful balance to this wine. It has ripe tropical fruit flavors that are spiced with ginger and lemon zest. At the same time, there is a fine structure with a botrytis core and freshness from pineapple acidity. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Guiraud 2010  Sauternes

Description: Big, ripe and fruity, this is a concentrated, juicy wine. It highlights richness, intense green plum and tangy orange flavors, as well as a feeling of opulence. Concentrated and dense in texture, it needs a year to age.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2012 Intense  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Apricots and smooth honey come through strongly in this beautiful wine. It has a rich, mellifluous texture, and accents of sweet spice are lifted by a shot of lemon zest. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Filhot 2010  Sauternes

Description: Smooth and rounded, this is a fine wood-aged wine. It has weight, layers of ripe green and white fruits, and an opulent texture. Spice shows strongly along with the fruit to yield a concentrated and dense wine. Drink from 2015.
Name: Château Penin 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a serious wine showing textured fruit and vanilla flavors. There's concentration and richness, but it also retains freshness. There is a strong mineral edge to this full-bodied, dense wine. Drink from 2016.
Name: Maison Sichel 2012 Sirius  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: While it is certainly rich, this wine has a drying core of botrytis that dominates at the moment. There's remarkable weight and concentration on the palate, but brisk lemon flavors add vibrancy and cut. It is obviously a wine to age, so don't drink before 2018.
Name: Château de Malle 2010  Sauternes

Description: Dense and textured, this is a powerful, complex wine. It's layered with honey and botrytis, and a concentrated fruitiness with flavors of apricots and creamed pears. There is a great sense of freshness on the finish.
Name: Château de Myrat 2010  Barsac

Description: Fresh lemon and gooseberry flavors lend an herbaceous edge to this fruity but tightly textured wine. It has richness and density, but it's a wine that is both refreshing and serious. Keep for a year before drinking.
Name: Château Argadens 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This small bottle, enough for two glasses, reveals another great wine from Kracher. It is both superrich and beautifully balanced. The wine has opulent apricot, orange marmalade and honey flavors already finely integrated. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Kracher NV Trockenbeerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: More toasty than fruity at this stage, this is a finely made wine with vanilla flavors that dominate the ripe tropical fruits underneath. Give it a year and the wine will balance out richly and smoothly.
Name: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a light, fresh and spicy wine that offers both a fine texture and a sense of freshness. Fragrant and fruity, the palate boasts pear flavors spiced with ginger. There is a fine touch of acidity and orange zest that gives the wine further complexity. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2010  Barsac

Description: Citrus and herb characteristics show strongly in this full-bodied wine. They are enhanced by light wood flavors that smooth out the acidity. The result is a full, rich wine that could age. Drink from 2015.
Name: Château Maison Noble 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Rose gold in color, this is the first in the series of 12 TBAs from Kracher. It is light and fresh, and spicy as well as sweet. There is a perfumed character along with a touch of tannin framing the rich, honeyed texture. It needs some aging—although not much—so drink from 2015.
Name: Kracher 2010 Nouvelle Vague Nummer 1 Trockenbeerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: Complex and rich, this is an impressive, concentrated wine. It has great acidity that balances flavors of ripe white fruits and apple skins, and lends a tight, taut texture. The wine should be aged for at least six months before drinking.
Name: Chateau Haut Rian 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Swathes of botrytis reveal themselves seductively on this sweet wine. It is rich in flavors, but still vibrant with acidity. Fine balance and intense flavors of apricots, honey and spice give it potential to age well. Drink from 2015.
Name: Château du Seuil 2012  Cérons

Description: Made from grapes that have been exposed to muffa nobile or botrytis, this lovely dessert wine boasts sensations of candied fruit, dried apricot, almond and ripe yellow peach. The rich flavors are balanced with freshness, making it an ideal meditation wine to sip after dinner or pair it with seasoned cheeses.
Name: Marchesi Antinori 2008 Muffato della Sala White (Umbria)

Description: There is an earthy, animal element to this wine that adds complexity to ripe fruit flavors. Currently, it's a wine that is all potential, sweet and dense with a finish of intense acidity. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2010  Sauternes

Description: Rounded and rich, this is already a delicious wine. It has great fruitiness combined with a fine, tight texture. There is a crisp edge that contrasts with the depth of flavor and warm, ripe feel. Drink now, or, better yet, keep for a year. Scewcap.
Name: Vignobles Dubergé 2012 Esprit de Saint Sulpice  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a perfumed wine with soft acidity and flavors of ripe apricot, nutmeg and spiced apple. It's full of character and the aftertaste retains the freshness of the vintage.
Name: Château la Croix de Roche 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Here's a dessert nectar from central Italy made from botrytized grapes. It offers notes of dried apricot, honey, saffron, sage and a hint of maple syrup. Pair this with sharp, seasoned cheeses.
Name: Barberani 2010 Calcaia Noble Rot  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: There is a strongly herbaceous, almost cat-like character in this wine that hints at New Zealand. At the same time, the weight and structure is all Bordeaux. It's a wine from a good white-wine vintage showing touches of wood as well as intense fruitiness. Drink from 2015.
Name: Château du Seuil 2012  Graves

Description: This blend of Pinot Blanc, Chardonnay and Grüner Veltliner is full bodied and rich. It has a creamy character that shows peach flavors. It could age another year. Screwcap.
Name: Esterházy 2011 Cuvée Blanc White (Leithaberg)

Description: Smooth and creamy, this wine wears its wood aging easily. The toast is present, ready to complement flavors of ripe apricot and creamed pear. There's an attractive tang of bitter orange on the finish that adds both weight and aging potential. Drink from 2015.
Name: Château Turcaud 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Crisp at the start, this is a wine that's full of potential. Its acidity and light toast come together to promise richness that's always balanced by a brighter character. Age for a year before drinking.
Name: Château Valandraud 2012 Virginie de Valandraud  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Made from equal parts Trebbiano and Sémillon and aged in oak, this is a gorgeous white wine, with a heady fragrance of yellow flowers, cut grass and honey. The palate offers layers of creamy lemon  pastry, apple, banana and a hint of spice. The well-integrated oak gives complexity while the crisp finish makes it so drinkable.
Name: I Giusti e Zanza 2012 Nemorino Bianco White (Toscana)

Description: Made primarily from Chardonnay, with 10% Grechetto, Antinori's flagship white opens with aromas of oak, toast and vanilla. The palate offers apple, tropical fruit and citrus flavors, with hints of oak and bitter almond. This also shows cellaring potential, and will develop complexity with more bottle age.
Name: Marchesi Antinori 2011 Cervaro della Sala White (Umbria)

Description: Soft and smooth, this is a wine that is still developing its full potential. The fruit is subdued but should burst into richness in the next six months with apricot and spice flavors that show strongly.
Name: Château Thieuley 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: While this is a creamy wine, the palate has soft acidity as well. Apples, ripe pears and just a squeeze of lemon juice are all attractively combined to give a warm, and rich wine.
Name: Château Loiseau 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: There is fine acidity here as well as the extra richness from wood aging. The wine has weight, spice and fresh apricot and quince flavors. It is a wine for aging for a couple of years, so drink from 2015.
Name: Château Fonréaud 2012 Le Cygne de Fonreaud  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a wine with ripe fruit that tastes rich and generous. Pear and apricot flavors are full in the mouth and warm. Age this attractive wine for a year.
Name: Château Queyssard 2012 Cuvée Dorianne  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: With spice, a touch of toast and ripe fruits, this is an attractive, tangy wine. It has apricot and peach flavors as well as a full, rich texture. The wine should age a year before drinking.
Name: Château Rauzan Despagne 2012 Grand Vin  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a rounded and creamy wine that's deliciously full bodied and ripe. It has apricot, white peach and spice flavors that add complexity. Acidity gives a bright lift on the finish. Screwcap.
Name: Château Suau 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This beautiful expression offers intense aromas of stone fruit, hazelnut and exotic fruit. It boasts ripe white peach, pear and cantaloupe flavors, accented by herbs and minerals. The creamy texture is energized by crisp acidity.
Name: Palazzone 2012 Terre Vineate  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: The wine feels light and fresh in character with acidity, lemon and a gentle, sweet texture. It's attractive with a good bite of zest that adds structure and balance. A fresh aftertaste gives an extra lift.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2010  Sauternes

Description: This is a balanced, ripe wine full of apple and orange fruit, and with a fine, textured character. It has weight and caramel richness, and just a hint of wood. It should be aged before drinking, so wait until 2016.
Name: Château Faugères 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A textured wine, this is mineral and chalky in character with intense gooseberry and lime flavors. It feels tight, so it might need food to bring out its best. Ready to drink, but it's worth aging for six months.
Name: Château Haut Maginet 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Very herbaceous in character, this is a wine that has richness, intensity and the balance of a mineral texture and tight acidity. It's a wine that needs food with its structure and tangy aftertaste.
Name: Maison Malet Roquefort 2012 Léo de la Gaffelière  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Sherry-like in style with nutty aromas and flavors, this is a curious but delicious wine. It's a white-wine blend with a touch of brandy flavor. As its name suggests, this is a fine apéritif.
Name: Tinhof NV Aperitiv White (Burgenland)

Description: Dusty, dry aromas of apple and sea mist are appealing. This has a spritzy, soda-like feel and ripe flavors of papaya, lime and apple. There's a bit of sulfuric gaseousness to the finish, but the feel is fresh and tangy, and overall this is a nice Txakoli if you're into the style.
Name: Txomín Etxaníz 2012 Getaria White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: Here's a stunning expression of Umbria's storied white wine. It opens with aromas of melon, cantaloupe, and ripe peach that carry over to the palate, along with notes of citrus and tropical fruit. It has nice length and a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Decugnano dei Barbi 2012 Villa Barbi Bianco  (Orvieto Classico)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Here's an Orivieto with a distinct personality. It opens with enticing aromas of acacia flower and honey accompanied by rich flavors of yellow peach, tropical fruit, apricot, pear and herbs. It also has nice depth and just a hint of complexity.
Name: Palazzone 2011 Campo del Guardiano  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: Made from a blend of Traminer and Sauvignon Blanc, this lovely wine offers aromas of stone fruit, melon and a whiff of tomato vine. The elegant, linear palate delivers flavors of ripe peach, tangerine, lemon and a hint of lime.
Name: Fattoria Le Pupille 2012 Poggio Argentato White (Toscana)

Description: Herbaceous yet full and ripe, this wine is concentrated in both texture and fruitiness. It's rich with white currant and citrus flavors, but a brisk, grassy feel as well.
Name: Château du Cros 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a wine with a strong botrytis element that adds dryness to honey flavors. Intense acidity cuts through the ripe fruit flavors. It still needs to integrate, so don't drink before 2018.
Name: Château Broustet 2010  Sauternes

Description: Herbaceous, fruity and full bodied, this is a ripe grapefruit- and citrus-dominated wine. Rich and full bodied, it has a generous, forward style.
Name: Château de Parenchère 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Here's a charming blend that has lovely fragrances of jasmine and lily of the valley, with a hint of stone fruit. The delicious palate offers creamy white peach, pear and tropical fruit flavors that are energized by a vein of crisp acidity.
Name: Goretti 2012 Trebbiano-Grechetto White (Umbria)

Description: This is a fruity wine that combines a smooth initial texture with more intense herbaceousness on the finish. The creamy mouthfeel is contrasted with a textured character that lends good intensity. Drink in a year.
Name: Château la France 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Ripe in style, this is a full-bodied, creamy wine. It has fine acidity despite its rich texture and generous, warm feel. On the finish, the wine remains full and open in character.
Name: Château Latour-Laguens 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is an auslese with a fine line between dryness from botrytis and fresh fruitiness. It has a bitter marmalade character along with intense acidity, both of which suggest it will age. Drink from 2016.
Name: Kracher 2011 Auslese Cuvée White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of yellow flowers, tropical fruits and just a whiff of vanilla. The palate is round and juicy, with Golden Delicious apple and tropical fruit flavors. It has nice depth and length.
Name: Barberani 2010 Luigi e Giovanni  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: Tangy and fruity, this is a lively, bright wine that has added weight from light wood aging. Citrus and apple flavors show strong and bright to give a crisp, textured aftertaste.
Name: Château Ducla 2012 Experience  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Fruity and perfumed, this is an attractive, fresh wine. It has crisp acidity, along with an herbaceous touch accenting apple and lime-juice flavors. There is a textured, tangy aftertaste that adds bite to the finish.
Name: Château Haut Mondain 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Here's an updated expression of Umbria's most famous white that adds 40% Vermentino to 50% Grechetto and 10% Trebbiano. It delivers an enticing fragrance of pineapple and stone fruit that carries through to the palate, along with apple and citrus flavors. It has a rich texture and crisp finish.
Name: Decugnano dei Barbi 2011 Decugnano Bianco  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: There is a perfumed, spicy quality to this wine, with hints of nutmeg and allspice. The wine is rich and full in the mouth, but with a great streak of contrasting acidity. It really needs to be aged for a year to bring out all its qualities.
Name: Château Hoste-Blanc 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a fruity, juicy wine that shows great tropical and citrus fruits. It is rich, but balanced with herbaceousness and fine, fresh acidity. It has a tangy texture that gives a good bite to the finish.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2012 Réserve Spéciale  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Costalupo is a fun blend of Trebbiano, Passerina and Chardonnay that offers fresh aromas of lemon zest, spice, ripe apple and pear flavors. It has a creamy texture and crisp acidity that would make a nice match for rich seafood dishes.
Name: Illuminati Dino 2012 Costalupo White (Controguerra)

Description: This opens with a pretty bouquet of yellow spring flowers and tropical fruit. The palate offers lingering pineapple, lemon zest and pear flavors that finish clean and refreshing. Pair this with light pastas or lightly seasoned seafood dishes.
Name: Argillae 2012  Orvieto

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This Grechetto-based wine opens with a pretty floral fragrance that recalls yellow- and white-spring flowers. The palate offers juicy peach, tropical fruit and citrus flavors, with a hint of thyme. Thanks to crisp acidity, it has a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Tenuta Le Velette 2012 Lunato  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: Initially tight in texture, this is a mineral wine that opens to reveal flavors of fruity, ripe peaches and orange zest. On the finish, the taut character returns to give a crisp, textured aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Château de la Vieille Tour 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a smooth and soft wine that shows its attractive fruitiness slowly. As it opens, apple, pear and lime flavors become prominent, yielding a wine that is rounded, fruity and fresh.
Name: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made from a blend of Grechetto, Procanico and other varieties, this charming wine from central Italy opens with aromas of tropical fruit, ripe yellow peach and a whiff of smoke. The palate offers flavors of pineapple, golden apple, and citrus, with a bitter almond note that unfolds on the finish.
Name: Barberani 2012 Castagnolo  (Orvieto Classico Superiore)

Description: This opens with a floral fragrance of honeysuckle and lavender, with hints of stone fruit and smoke. The palate offers flavors of white peach, citrus and dried apricot, with touches of butterscotch and oak on the close.
Name: Le Palaie 2012 Viognier de Le Palaie White (Toscana)

Description: Made from Grechetto, Procanico, Pinot Bianco and Voigner, this opens with an alluring fragrance of lemon zest, golden apple, tropical fruit and spice. The palate offers pineapple, creamy ripe peach and pear flavors that are energized by mineral notes.
Name: Marchesi Antinori 2012 San Giovanni della Sala White (Umbria)

Description: A mineral, textured wine, this is full of grassy gooseberry and grapefruit flavors. Fruit on the palate is accented with a chalky character and strong, very present acidity. Drink in six months.
Name: Château Bonnet 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This blend of Grechetto and Trebbiano Spoletino opens with a fragrance of tropical fruit and cantaloupe. The fresh but creamy palate offers rich flavors of green melon, pineapple and green apple, brightened by citrus notes and refreshing acidity.
Name: Perticaia 2012 White (Umbria)
