Description: Made from a blend of organically farmed Grechetto, Procanico and Sauvignon blanc, this charming single-vineyard selection offers up a floral fragrance of acacia flower accented aromatic herbs. The palate delivers ripe pear, mint and thyme flavors, with crisp acidity.
Name: Sergio Mottura 2012 Tragugnano  (Orvieto)

Description: Here's a blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Gewürztraminer from Tuscany that has a pretty fragrance of white and yellow flowers. The palate offers apple, tropical fruit and pear notes, along with a soft texture and fresh acidity.
Name: Livernano 2012 L'anima White (Toscana)

Description: Almond skins, apple essence and minerality drive the nose on this white from the Basque country. A zesty, slightly spritzy palate deals nectarine, apricot and green-apple flavors. The finish is clear and minerally, with crisp acidity.
Name: Gorka Izagirre 2012 White (Bizkaiko Txakolina)

Description: This charming, easy-drinking blend of Grechetto, Procanico, Malvasia and Verdello opens with a fragrance of yellow flower and spice. The palate offers flavors of tropical fruit, apple and lemon-lime, with a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: La Carraia 2012  Orvieto Classico

Description: Herbaceous in character, this is a tight and tangy wine with crisp, grassy fruitiness. It has a rich palate, but maintains a tight and nervy feel to it. Best kept for a year before drinking.
Name: Château Talbot 2012 Caillou Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a ripe wine with tropical fruit flavors that are cut with fine green acidity. There is a good texture with some nerviness as well as lively acidity on the finish. It's a style of wine that needs food.
Name: Château Tour d'Auron 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Freshness dominates this bright, fruity wine. There are apple, pear and apricot flavors with just the lightest touch of vanilla. At the end, the wine shows a great tangy character, full of lemon and grapefruit zest.
Name: Château La Rame 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is an intense wine that is full of fresh fruits, rich green plum and apricot flavors, as well as a creamed apple character. It is weighty and generous, while at the end, the wine offers a more tangy, tight aftertaste.
Name: Château Les Combes 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Coreno is a blend of Trebbiano and Malvasia grapes that hail from over fifty-year-old vines. It has aromas of stone fruit and pear, while the palate boasts flavors of peach, lemon cream, vanilla and well-integrated oak.
Name: Olivi 2012 Coreno White (Toscana)

Description: Tight and herbaceous, this is a very Sauvignon-oriented wine. It has the classic, intensely grassy feel, a tangy lemon texture and green acidity. It is very intense and concentrated.
Name: Château Gréteau Médeville 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Apple and mineral aromas are fresh yet simple in nature. This offers good body weight and healthy minerality. Flavors of almond skins, melon, papaya and citrus finish dry. Overall, this blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blancav is a solid white to drink as soon as possible.
Name: Fernández Gómez 2012 Selección Familia White (Rioja)

Description: This fruity, herbaceous wine is a classic Sauvignon Blanc. The texture is light and mineral and the palate boasts flavors of white fruit skins and lemon zest. Acidity on the finish keeps the freshness going long.
Name: Les Parcelles de Stéphane Derenoncourt 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This ripe wine is full of rich, fruity apricot and apple flavor. It is warm and generous, although its streak of acidity lends freshness on the finish.
Name: Les Portes de Bordeaux 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A blend of equal parts Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc, this opens with interesting aromas of tropical fruit, cinnamon and liqueur. The palate offers nearly overripe apple, citrus and pineapple, along with hints of baking spices.
Name: Salviano 2011 Salvino di Salviano White (Umbria)

Description: With great green plum, gooseberry and pink grapefruit flavors, this is a delicious fruit salad of a wine. It has lively acidity, a bright texture and an attractive tangy feel. It's ready for drinking now.
Name: Maison Sichel 2012 Les Hauts de Bel-Air  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Made from the same blend as the dry Orvieto, in this version fermentation is stopped before all the sugars are converted to alcohol. A moderately sweet wine, it boasts apricot, honey and almond notes, with just enough acidity to avoid a cloying finish. Pair it with cream cheeses or almond cookies.
Name: Bigi 2012 Amabile  (Orvieto Classico)

Description: Full in the mouth, this is a ripe, currant- and gooseberry-flavored wine. It has a bright, forward, fruity feel that makes it delicious to drink. Very refreshing in character. Screwcap.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2012 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This charming blend of Vermentino, Trebbiano and Grechetto opens with pretty aromas of white spring flowers, tropical fruit and peach. The palate offers apricot, pear and citrus flavors, ending with a refreshing finish.
Name: Lungarotti 2012 Torre di Giano White (Umbria)

Description: Very Sauvignon in style with marked acidity and a grassy character, this wine has flavors of pure green and crisp white fruits. Apples and quince are balanced by the light texture and fine acidity.
Name: Château Fonfroide 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This simple offering opens with aromas of stone fruit and toasted almond. The palate offers yellow peach, apricot and citrus, with a hint of flint on the close.
Name: Cantina Fratelli Pardi 2012 Colle di Giove  (Montefalco)

Description: Made from organically cultivated fruit, this delightful blend of Grechetto and Procanico opens with a white flower aroma. The linear palate delivers pear and apple flavors, with a crisp, clean and refreshing finish. Pair this with buffalo mozzarella or hors d'oeuvres.
Name: Sergio Mottura 2012  Orvieto

Description: This blend of Incrocio Manzoni, Trebbiano, Malvasia and Grechetto opens with tutti frutti aromas of ripe banana, pineapple and pear that carry over to the palate, along with mango. The savory palate also has a certain salinity that restrains the exuberant fruit.
Name: Cirulli 2011 Hedone Bianco White (Umbria)

Description: This is a perfumed wine that is crisp as well as light in texture. Lightly sweet, it has attractive orange zest, honey and citrus flavors that are balanced with poised acidity at the end. It's a lively wine that will make a good apéritif.
Name: Tinhof 2012 Muskat White (Burgenland)

Description: This opens with pretty aromas of wild white flowers and pear. The palate is light and fresh, with a core of yellow apple, Williams pear and tropical fruit, with a crisp, quenching finish. Pair it with mild seafood dishes or light pastas.
Name: Ruffino 2012  Orvieto

Description: Here's a delightful and straightforward wine that opens with a delicate fragrance of white spring flowers. The palate offers notes of tropical fruit, lemon zest and a hint of clove. It has a clean, quenching finish.
Name: Salviano 2012 Salviano  (Orvieto Classico)

Description: A blend of 80% Verdicchio, Viognier and Sauvignon Blanc, this has a delicate floral fragrance of white flowers and beeswax. The palate offers lemon-lime, pear and citrus flavors, along with sharp acidity.
Name: Olivi 2012 Orhora White (Toscana)

Description: Crisp and fruity, this is a wine that hides nothing. It is all upfront, fresh fruit backed with lively acidity. It's a wine that sings brightly and effortlessly.
Name: Château Lauduc 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This feels lifted and spritzy, with friendly, soft apple aromas and flavors of lime, apple and pineapple that are almost juice-like. The finish mirrors the palate, tasting ripe yet feeling zesty, with faint hints of chalky mineral.
Name: Zudugarai 2012 White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: Made from Chardonnay and Viognier, this wine opens with peach and apricot aromas that carry over to the palate alongside notes of lemon peel and honey. While it opens strong, it finishes abruptly.
Name: Diadema 2012 D'Amare White (Toscana)

Description: This wine is crisp with acidity but rounded on the palate with concentrated pink-grapefruit flavors. It has a rich, fruity, juicy aftertaste.
Name: Château Ballan-Larquette 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Grassy and herbal, this wine is crisp, tight and mineral. It's delicate and bright in character, and ready for drinking now.
Name: Château Pierrail 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Very nutty aromas introduce this smooth and creamy wine. It has a rich feel that's fruity and ripe with flavors of spice, vanilla and caramel, as well as red apple. Ready to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Château la Freynelle 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Juicy and fruity, this is a wine with fine acidity, crisp green fruits and a tight texture. Easy to drink already, it has a tangy character that gives the wine an extra bite at the end.
Name: Château Loumelat 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This fragrant and fruity wine is crisp and fresh. It has a perfumed character, soft apple acidity and a crisp texture. It's a wine for apéritifs that's light and ready to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Tinhof 2012 Tinhof Blanc White (Burgenland)

Description: Here's a simple but well-made and enjoyable expression of Umbria's classic white wine. Made from a blend of Procanico, Grechetto, Verdello, Malvasia and Drupeggio, this has a pretty floral bouquet that recalls white flowers. The palate delivers white peach and pear flavors, and finishes crisp.
Name: Bigi 2012 Secco  (Orvieto Classico)

Description: There is a light toast aroma to this ripe, fruity wine, but the juicy feel is underlined by wood aging. Ripe, with a touch of sweetness at the end, it is ready to drink.
Name: Château Bel Air Perponcher 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a spicy wine that shows rich fruit along with nutmeg and cinnamon flavors. Baked apple and ripe pear underly the spice, while acidity on the finish accentuates a fresh aftertaste.
Name: Château Grand Jean 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: On the herbaceous side, this is a full bodied but grassy wine with hints of green undergrowth and a cat-like character. It has a modern, forward fruitiness that's very new world in style. Drink now.
Name: Château Roquefort 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Full, rounded, attractively fruity, this wine is light in texture. It is juicy and without great complexity, but with a generous, ripe feel. Screwcap.
Name: Château Recougne 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a wine with simple fruit-juice flavors. It's ripe, but has attractive acidity. Overall, it's very fruity and ready to drink.
Name: Michel Lynch 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Txakoli is a fragile wine, and this 2011 is already past its prime, as evidenced by a gold color and soft body. In between, there are modest apple and peach aromas along with a spiced-cider flavor. This remains long on the finish but is losing steam in terms of color, freshness and flavors.
Name: Gorka Izagirre 2011 White (Bizkaiko Txakolina)

Description: Bright and breezy, this is a simple, fruity wine with just a touch of sweetness. It has a crisp, lively feel to it but is open and forward. The aftertaste is light and fresh.
Name: Caves de Rauzan 2012 Augey  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This creamy wine is very soft, smooth and light in feel. Acidity is well integrated into the ripe apricot and peach flavors, with just a touch of white currants and spice on the finish.
Name: Les Vignerons d'Alliance Bourg 2012 Prince de Tabourg  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a classic Sauvignon with just an extra amount of creamy texture. The wine is light, fruity and fragrant, and finishes with an easy-drinking acidity. For drinking immediately.
Name: Château Trocard 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The first thing on the nose that registers is a vegetal quality, particularly asparagus and bean aromas. The palate is well cut and crisp in feel, while green notes drive the flavor profile.
Name: Ulacia 2012 White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: Peach and apple aromas are modest. The palate is juicy and citric in feel, while flavors of melon, apple and nectarine finish tangy, with a citrusy taste.
Name: Bodegas Tobía 2012 Viña Tobía White (Rioja)

Description: Light, bright and fruity, this wine is full of citrus acidity and a ripe, herbaceous character. Lively and fresh, it is a Sauvignon-dominated wine.
Name: Univitis 2012 Grand Théatre  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A fruity, open wine, this has bright acidity, crisp green fruits, a touch of lemon and a light texture. Ready to drink.
Name: Jean Médeville et Fils 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine opens with tertiary aromas of damp earth and mineral, along with notes of brown-banana peel and beeswax. The palate shows a loss of fruit richness and oxidation.
Name: Barberani 2012 VINOSO VIni NO SOlfiti  (Orvieto Classico)

Description: This is a very feline wine with tight citrus and gooseberry fruits that are almost too intense for its own good.
Name: Château des Gravières 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Light and fruity, this is a wine that has some sweetness, a gentle series of white fruits, acidity and lemon zest at the end. Screwcap.
Name: Barton & Guestier NV Partager White

Description: Thin in character, this is a pleasant wine without much style. Light and ready to be drunk immediately.
Name: Château le Noble 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is an impressive white made from the native Garnacha Blanca blended with Macabeu (Viura). It opens with waxy peach and almond aromas that flow into a creamy mouthfeel with perfect acidity. A buttery tasting flavor sits on top of baked peach and apple, while the finish is creamy, with a buttery feel and a note of popcorn. This should age well; drink through 2017.
Name: Trossos del Priorat 2011 Abracadabra White (Priorat)

Description: This property is flying below the radar...for now. This is yet another excellent wine from Clos Berenguer. The nose is full of butterscotch and oxidized aromas of fine Sherry. The palate has a big feel, purity and fine acidity, while flavors of smoke, toast and oxidized white fruits finish waxy, creamy, oaky and long. This Garnacha-heavy blend would go great with fish or lobster done in a butter sauce.
Name: Clos Berenguer del Molar 2007 Blanc de Botes White (Priorat)

Description: The local Loin de l'Oeil variety dominates this ripe, wood aged wine. It has yellow fruits, laced with pear softness and lime acidity. The wood gives a soupçon of vanilla and a sense that the finely made wine could age. Drink now and until 2017.
Name: Domaine Rotier 2011 Renaissance White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: A rich, dry wine that has a honeyed character as well apricot and green plum flavors. It has a juicy, full-feeling structure and a texture that shows some minerality. It's a delicious, powerful white wine, reveling in its richness. Drink now, but better wait until 2015.
Name: Château d'Aydie 2012 Odé d'Aydie  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Dark gold, almost chartreuse, this blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc has cider-like aromas at first and a slight effervescence. Balanced, it's interesting, a heady taste of apple and pear and almond that finishes clear and tight. It's a fine choice for fall and wintertime desserts but also as an apéritif.
Name: Miraflores 2010 Botricelli Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: Intense and richly sweet wine that never loses sight of its natural freshness. It has honey, peach and mango flavors that cut with lemon acidity to produce a well-balanced, perfumed wine. The aftertaste shows a youthful tanginess, so the wine is best aged and drunk after 2016.
Name: Château Jolys 2011  Jurançon

Description: At first, this smells so minerally it's like iodine or a container of vitamins. With airing, it opens to show white-fruit scents and rugged, sweaty notes. In the mouth, this is fresh and tightly wound, with minerality to the max. Flavors of vanilla, applesauce and toast finish with an echo of baked apple and vanilla. Drink now through 2018.
Name: Clos Mogador 2010 Nelin White (Priorat)

Description: Very rich and packed with yellow and tropical fruits, this is a complex, wood-aged wine. It has a strong toasty edge that gives burnt spice that is balanced by the rich fruitiness. Acidity follows, making an appearance in the fresh finish. Drink from 2014.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2011 Moulin des Dames White (Bergerac Sec)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sadly, just 150 cases were made of this excellent blend of 75% Chardonnay and 25% Viognier. Sexy and plump with tree fruits, kissed with butterscotch and propped up with deliciously juicy acids. This yum-fest shows excellent  concentration and length.
Name: JM Cellars 2012 Bramble Bump White Chardonnay-Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This inaugural barrel-fermented white blend is gold in color and toasty on the nose, with baked apple, a pinch of sweat and heavy raw-oak aromas. A resiny mouthfeel leads to a savory palate with more wood and corn flavor than fruit. The finish has a smooth feel and lasting oaky flavors.
Designation: Tres Viñas Blanco Reserva Viura-Malvasia-Garnacha Blanca
Name: Baron De Ley 2008 Tres Viñas Blanco Reserva Viura-Malvasia-Garnacha Blanca White (Rioja)

Description: Mostly neutral aromas include a note of peach and citrus, and a hint of butterscotch. The body is full and the textue is good, while the overall balance is on the money. Creamy flavors of vanilla, coconut cake, toffee and baked apple finish similarly, with some heat and burn.
Name: Mas Igneus 2011 Barranc dels Closos White (Priorat)

Description: Estate-grown Riesling from a new vineyard and resort on the shores of Lake Osoyoos near the Canadian border. It's off-dry, ripe and fruity, with accents of sweet tea, honeysuckle and a streak of vanilla. Katy Perry (of Tildio) is the winemaker.
Name: Veranda Beach 2012 Lakehouse White (Washington)

Description: From Friuli, here's a full-bodied white with character. Made from a blend of Malvasia Istriana, Friulano and Riesling, this delivers peach, apricot, mineral and citrus sensations. It has a smooth texture as well as depth and complexity.
Name: Vie di Romans 2011 Flors di Vis White (Friuli Isonzo)

Description: Savory whiffs of smoke and toasted nuts accentuate the Narince grape's bold, brawny side. This is unabashedly oaky, but bright lemon custard and floral notes ring true on the palate, and linger through a warm, vanilla-tinged finish.
Name: Vinkara 2010 Reserve Dry White (Ankara)

Description: Yellow fruits dominate this gently sweet wine. It's the balance between the sweetness and the acidity that scores, along with a light touch that keeps the wine fresh and fruity. It can be drunk, but should be aged and will be best after 2016.
Name: Château de Jurque 2011 Tendresse  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Chamomile and fresh herb notes lend breeziness to this pretty floral white wine. The palate is robust, concentrated with white grapefruit flavor, and tinged with a pleasantly astringent lime-pith finish.
Name: Castra Rubra 2011 Via Diagonalis White (Thracian Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Three quarters Sauvignon Blanc and the remaining Sémillon, this young and fresh wine has vivid citrus and grapefruit flavors leaning toward a hint of fresh cut pear. This is clean, crisp and leesy, with bracing acidity.
Name: Davenport Cellars 2012 Snowflake Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A delicately perfumed, full-feeling wine with bright spice and apricot and white peach fruits. It has hints of honey, almonds as well as crisp acidity that cuts through the natural ripeness of the wine. Drink from 2014.
Name: Château Jolys 2012  Jurançon Sec

Description: A crisp and fruity wine with herbal flavors, as well as riper apricot and quince flavors. It's a balanced wine, developing well, with great final acidity and a lively, crisp aftertaste. Drink now and until 2018.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2012 Cuvée des Conti White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: Hard oak on the nose creates a pinched, chemical sensation. Give this time and that goes away, leaving minerally apple and peach aromas. In the mouth, this is firm and intense, with peppery flavors, Sherry notes and almondy accents. A bitter finish with nut skins and dryness registers as complex.
Name: Francesc Sanchez Bas 2009 Blanc de Montsalvat White (Priorat)

Description: Fresh and fruity, a light feeling wine that has lively acidity as well as more weighty pear and apricot fruits. There's a touch of spice and pepper before the fine acidity kicks in again.
Name: Château de Jurque 2012 Fantaisie  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A kitchen sink-style blend that is half Riesling with the rest Pinot Gris, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, Viognier, and Muscat with all but a fraction (8%) aged in stainless steel. It's the definition of a crowd pleaser with bright notes of mandarin orange, peach and citrus peel, drinking toward medium-sweet (21 g/L residual sugar).
Name: Waterbrook 2012 Melange White Varietal Blend White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A typical blend from Gascogne, the wine has both acidity and fresh, young fruitiness. Herbaceous and citrus-laced with gooseberries, the wine is bright and light without losing any of its intensity. Drink now and over the next year. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine Guillaman 2012 Colombard-Ugni Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Dusty vanilla and melon aromas come across as lightly candied. This feels regular, with plumpness but nothing heavy to deal with. Flavors of pear and melon come with a green note, while the finish tastes like papaya.
Name: Bodegas Muriel 2012 Blanco Vendimia Seleccionada White (Rioja)

Description: This blend of white native grapes from Lazio has delicate, fruity aromas of pear and apple that carry over to the palate along with an almond note. Fresh and crisp, this makes a perfect apéritif, or pair it with lightly-seasoned dishes.
Name: Tenuta di Pietra Porzia 2012 Regillo  (Frascati Superiore)

Description: Savory apple and lemon notes are bright and brisk on this pleasant Croatian white wine. Hints of sweet corn and vanilla custard add richness to a delicately structured palate, along with a crisp lime acidity that adds zip to the finish.
Name: Saints Hills 2010 Nevina Vinograd Sv Ante White (Istria)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Pungent citrus aromas settle on grapefruit. This feels regular and tastes like grapefruit and citrus pith. A standard feeling finish is fresh, citrusy in flavor and mildly bitter.
Name: Storks' Tower 2012 Sauvignon Blanc-Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: Nutty, oaky aromas along with a gold-brown maderized color indicate a wine past its prime. In the mouth, there's not much fruit left but there is a whole lot of weight and resiny oak. Lead flavors of almond and walnut oil suggest Sherry more than Chardonnay.
Name: Bodegas Julián Chivite 2008 Coleccion 125 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Navarra)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Citrus and passion fruit aromas emphasize the SB over the Verdejo component, even though the blend is 70% Verdejo and 30% SB. A zesty, pithy feeling palate houses citrus peel and pithy flavors, while the finish tastes the same.
Name: Volteo 2012 Verdejo-Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Castilla La Mancha, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Punchy grapefruit aromas come with a touch of minerality. An oily yet spritzy feeling palate doesn't score many points, while the flavor profile is bitterness offset by pithy citrus flavors.
Name: Chapter Capítulo 8 2012 Sauvignon Blanc-Verdejo (Castilla La Mancha)

Description: This is basically Sauvignon Blanc (with 3% Viognier and Chardonnay). And it's a narrow version, with pungent, sweaty aromas and bitter-leaning flavors that suggest early harvesting in a hot year. A green, peppery finish lacks roundness and full ripeness.
Name: Estampa 2012 Reserve Assemblage Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Viognier White (Casablanca Valley)

Description: Air freshner and lychee are the most identifiable aromas. The palate feels fresh and light, which, given the wine's fleshy, tropical flavors, is a compliment. An oily, bitter finish is similar to marginal Torrontés from Argentina.
Name: Ochoa 2012 Viura-Chardonnay White (Navarra)

Appellation: Sierra Pelona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: A sweet, high-fueled blend of Chardonnay, Muscat Blanc and old-vine Trebbiano from a newly approved appellation called the Sierra Pelona Valley, north of Los Angeles, this wine has peach and lemon peel hiding behind a lathering of oak.
Name: Reyes NV White Delight White (Sierra Pelona Valley)

Appellation: Vin Santo di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This delicious and spicy dessert wine from Montepulciano offers a fragrance of dried apricots, honey, spice and walnut. The palate delivers orange peel, ripe peach, walnut, cinnamon and maple syrup notes with a hint of lemon drop. This isn't sticky sweet, and has a fresh quality that gives it great energy.
Name: Bindella 2008 Dolce Sinfonia  (Vin Santo di Montepulciano)

Description: Honeyed, tropical fruit aromas are showing strongly in this smooth, lightly toasty dry wine. Rich and rounded, it shows both the fresh fruit of the vintage and also the concentration of the white wines. It should be aged, but can be drunk now. Drink until 2020.
Name: Château de la Brède 2011 Cuvée Montesquieu  (Graves)

Description: This rich sparkling wine from northern Italy offers a layered fragrance of apple, nut and just-baked bread. The palate is smooth and creamy but weightless, with delicate and crisp bubbles.
Name: Lorenz Martini 2008 Riserva Comitissa Brut White (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This rich dessert nectar from Tuscany is made from a blend of Trebbiano and Malvasia grapes. It delivers typical Vin Santo aromas and flavors of maple syrup, dried apricot and candied oranges. Dense and sweet, it's a perfect match for traditional cantucci biscuits or to sip on its own after dinner.
Name: Fattoria di Grignano 2005  Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina

Appellation: Vin de Pays Var, Provence, France
Description: This is a full, ripe wine, with elegant impressions of toast. Robust notes of melon and peach show strongly, giving a rich, warm feel that is brightened with acidity. Drink now through 2017.
Name: Château Routas 2011 Coquelicot Viognier-Chardonnay (Vin de Pays Var)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A blend of three grapes, this unusual ice wine merges bright fruit and floral components of Vidal Blanc and Muscat with the smoky, gamy tones of the hybrid grape Marechal Foch. It's intense with honey and apple flavor, but spiked with distinct whiffs of smoke and potpourri. Balanced with bright, orange acidity, it finishes with a hint of lemon-pith astringency.
Designation: Fiori Delle Stelle Ice Wine Block 1 Vidal Blanc-Golden Muscat-Marechal Foch
Name: Casa Larga 2010 Fiori Delle Stelle Ice Wine Block 1 Vidal Blanc-Golden Muscat-Marechal Foch White (Finger Lakes)

Description: Here's a wood-aged wine, with peach and pineapple flavors and a rich, round mouthfeel. It has a lighter side, with ample, crisp acidity and the poise of the white wines of 2012. You could drink it now, but better to wait until 2014.
Name: Château Haut Selve 2012  Graves

Description: A well-balanced wine that both shows an herbaceous character and a ripe, full flavor that brings in yellow fruits and green plums. It has a well-judged hint of spice from wood aging to give extra richness. Drink from 2013.
Name: Château Magnol 2012 Les Charmes de Magnol  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This full bodied, fruity wine exhibits Chenin's characteristically chalky edge. The wine is tight, fresh and crisp—a great dry apéritif wine—offering just a touch of bitterness on the finish. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine des Baumard 2009 La Calèche Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Vin de France)

Description: Yellow and white fruit aromas leap from the glass in this youthful, fruity wine. It has an herbaceous, grassier element, plus concentration and a delicious, refreshing character. It will soften and round out over the next year.
Name: Château Roquetaillade la Grange 2012  Graves

Description: A full-bodied, ripe wine that has lively acidity along with fresh pear and crisp apple flavors. There's just a touch of sweetness to bring out the richness of the wine. Age this wine for another six months before drinking.
Name: DFJ Vinhos 2012 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)

Description: With a dominance of Sémillon, this is a white wine with some weight. It has good acidity, lemongrass and citrus flavors along with a hint of more tropical elements. The finish, full of crisp fruit, shows some aging potential. Drink until 2019.
Name: Château d'Uza 2012  Graves

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A sweet blend of Gros Manseng and Sauvignon Blanc, this wine boasts smooth, attractively honeyed fruit, along with a penetrating burst of acidity. Pineapple, peach and apple flavors blend well together, making this wine a great apéritif.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2012 Villa Chambre d'Amour White (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Colombard, Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng are an easy, refreshing blend in this wine from Gascony. It's fragrant, lively and packed with apple and pink grapefruit. Fruity, fresh and ready to drink.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2012 Villa Grand Cap White (Vin de France)

Description: Crisp, fruity, full of apple and citrus flavors, this is a tightly-coiled, fresh wine. Clean and fragrant, it's a all ready to drink a straight line of fruit and freshness.
Name: Château Tuilerie Pagès 2012  Entre-Deux-Mers

Appellation: Vin de Pays Var, Provence, France
Description: This is an aromatic wine, with confectionary and fresh fruit notes. This wine's crisp acidity makes it easy to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Château Routas 2011 Sanglier Blanc Viognier-Chardonnay (Vin de Pays Var)

Description: A bright, citrus flavored wine thart is very crisp and fruity. There is a wonderful shock of acidity that brings out freshness and the herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc flavors. Drink now.
Name: Château Carignan 2012 L'Orangerie de Carignan  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A very herbaceous, fish-friendly wine that wins with its lemon and pink grapefruit flavors. It's aromatic and light, with the fruitiness right up front. Screwcap.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2012 The Pairing Collection Salmon & Trout  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Melony aromas rate as generic and get lost along the way. This feels soft and on the verge of flabby. Flavors of cantaloupe, papaya and mango finish chunky, sweet and not that convincing.
Name: Undurraga 2012 U Estate Grown White (Central Valley)

Description: With a touch of wood, this is a smoky, rich wine. It has weight and spice from the wood with intense honey all kept together by the acidity. A gorgeous, opulent wine, it's still young. Drink from 2018.
Designation: Ruster Ausbruch On the Wings of Dawn
Name: Heidi Schröck 2011 Ruster Ausbruch On the Wings of Dawn White (Burgenland)

Description: This is a honeyed wine, with a strong showing of ginger marmalade and bright acidity. It's full in the mouth and layered with acidity and lush, unctuous flavors. It shows great aging potential; drink from 2015.
Name: Steindorfer 2010 Beerenauslese Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Burgenland)

Description: Beautifully balanced wine, rich while layered with acidity and pure pear flavors. Honey creeps in, offering a more opulent side while leaving a touch of spice from the Gelber Muskateller in the blend.
Name: Feiler-Artinger 2010 Ruster Ausbruch White (Burgenland)

Description: A fascinating blend of Sämling, Traminer and Grüner Veltliner brings out a mix of spiciness and tight acidity. It is very crisp and fresh, the sweetness well balanced by acidity. Drink from 2015.
Name: Zantho 2011 Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: A very sweet wine that still manages to keep a dry element to it. It has as power, richness and great concentration, a smooth texture and final acidity. All in all, a wine that demands attention and aging.
Name: Esterházy 2009 Trockenbeerenaulese White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This little gem is sourced entirely from the Klipsun Vineyard, and it's the sort of wine that will wake up the sleepiest palate. A mass of fig, honeycomb, lemon rind and pith, it has wonderful focus, balance, length and concentration.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2012 Klipsun Vineyard Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

Description: A full and rounded wine finely balanced between freshness and sweetness. The texture is full in the mouth with honey and tropical fruits lightly sprinkled with spice. The end brings out the richness of the blend.
Name: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2011 Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: 2011 is another excellent vintage for this unique and aromatic blend from Brian Carter. The mix is 51% Viognier, 35% Roussanne and 14% Riesling, and it offers a riot of scents and flavors; a rotating Ferris wheel with lemon skin, beeswax, orange peel, tangerine, succulent lime and ripe pear. It's flat out luxurious, long and lissome.
Name: Brian Carter 2011 Oriana White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend in this new vintage remains three quarters Sauvignon Blanc and one quarter Sémillon, but amps up the alcohol a notch from the 2011 version. It's a lightly toasty, very flavorful wine, adroitly mixing slightly bitter skin flavors, citrus pith and flesh, and a tangy core of grapefruit and pineapple. The length and detail are impressive.
Name: Lauren Ashton Cellars 2012 Cuvée Méline Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Fragrant, perfumed and fruity, the wine is balanced in acidity and sweetness. Apricots, pears, a touch of honey and a soft texture all follow through to make a wine that is harmonious and still very fresh. Drink from 2014.
Name: Umathum 2009 Auslese White (Burgenland)

Description: A delicate, light and fruity wine that also has an ethereal orange and lightly honeyed character. Apricot, pineapple and hints of mango all show in this ripe wine, just bright enough with acidity.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2009 Foehn  (Jurançon)

Description: Dry spice is fighting with rich, smooth Chardonnay to give a wine that is unbalanced at the moment. It is full, fragrant, still young so the dried almond edge should melt into the more honeyed character. Drink from 2017.
Name: Umathum 2011 Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: A blend of Grenache Gris and Macabeu, this is a lush, creamy wine, with forward aromas and flavors of lemon custard, grilled red apple and vanilla. Full and toasty, the full palate is loaded with rich, toasty flavors that carry through to the long, spicy finish, but are kept in check by medium acidity. Delicious now, but has the stuffing to hold well through 2015.
Designation: Mas Janeil Le Traou de l'Ouille
Name: François Lurton 2011 Mas Janeil Le Traou de l'Ouille White (Côtes du Roussillon)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is mostly Sémillon, with Sauvignon Blanc filling in the rest. It's one of the rare white wines from the Walla Walla AVA, graceful, full-bodied and tasting of fig and green banana. Just recently bottled, it still carries a bit of yeast in the nose and in the finish. Give it another few months to pull itself together.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2012 Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Luminesce Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: his blend has a spicy character, balanced with acidity and a ripe, full honeyed character. On the dry side, it has richness, pepper and a deep texture that demands aging. Drink from 2017.
Name: Heidi Schröck 2010 Ruster Ausbruch White (Burgenland)

Description: For a Beerenauslese this is more rich than sweet. It is very spicy and dry at the core with peppered pear flavors. It's powerful and concentrated, needing aging. Drink from 2017.
Name: Tinhof 2010 Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: Austrians seem challenged to produce exotic blends. This wine with Riesling, Furmint and Sauvignon Blanc together, is an intriguing example. It is as rich, powerful and full-bodied. It is opulent in texture, and now mature.
Name: Schandl 2006 Ruster Ausbruch White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A great, all-purpose white blend, this is half Pinot gris, a third Viognier and the rest, a mix of Sémillon and Marsanne. Piercing flavors of pineapple, grapefruit and lemon peel shoot through the firm mid-palate. The skin flavors add a pleasantly light frame of bitter citrus around the finish.
Name: Airfield Estates 2012 Flygirl White (Yakima Valley)

Description: Made from Friulano, Pinot Grigio, Sauvignon, Malvasia and Ribolla Gialla, this blend represents the major white varieties in Friuli. It offers aromas of Spanish broom and lemon drop, with apricot and mineral flavors that finish long and clean.
Name: Mario Schiopetto 2011 Blanc des Rosis White (Collio)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The acidity here is certainly the Chenin Blanc, but with the richness of Chardonnay in the mix, the wine has a full character, softly ripe, apples and pears dominant. It has a crisper feel at the end, bright and lively and ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2012 Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The Gros Manseng, one of Gascony's two star white grapes (along with Petit Manseng), gives richness and delicious apricot flavors to this full and rounded wine. The acidity comes with the crisp, fruity Sauvignon Blanc. To drink now and until 2014.
Name: Domaine Chiroulet 2012 Terres Blanches White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Very floral, fragrant wine, its acidity a foil for the ripe tropical and white fruits. There is a definite mineral texture here, with just a hint of sweetness that will make this wine great with Asian food. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2012 Côté Chardonnay-Sauvignon (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Two thirds Chardonnay, and one third a Viognier/Roussanne blend, this young wine has a definitely spritzy mouthfeel and a yeasty finish. The fruit flavors are fresh and lively, suggesting lemon and pineapple, with finishing hints of honeycomb.
Name: Patterson 2012 Mélange Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Here's an enjoyable Soave from one of the Veneto's most renowned Amarone producers. It shows a pretty fragrance of white spring flowers and melon while the palate boasts juicy cantaloup and pear. It finishes fresh and crisp.
Name: Allegrini 2012  Soave

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Combine two herbaceous grapes in a cool climate and you get this crisply fresh, and certainly herbaceous wine. It is bright and fruity with an undertow of lemon and orange zest giving a more textured character.
Name: Villa Dria 2012 Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Picking the grapes at night gives extra freshness to what is a rich wine. The acidity is very present, with ripe yellow fruits and pineapple. Fruity, textured and needing a year to age.
Designation: Le Sec du Clos Vin de Lune
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2012 Le Sec du Clos Vin de Lune Viognier-Chardonnay (Comté Tolosan)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Beautifully fruity wine, bright, citrus and yellow fruit dominated. Packed with crisp acidity, light floral flavors and a steely texture. It's for drinking now. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2012 Classic White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This blended white from Friuli has pretty white flower and exotic fruit aromas. It has pineapple, pear and banana peel flavors, although it finishes a bit short.
Name: Maculan 2012 Pino & Toi White (Veneto)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The typical Côtes de Gascogne blend of Colombard and Sauvignon Blanc, this is crisp, brightly herbaceous, hinting at peach as well as lime juice. It is fresh, clean and deliciously fruity.
Name: Rieutort 2012 Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Light, herbaceous wine, very fruity, full of greengage and gooseberry flavors. It's tight, fresh and crisp, ready to drink.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2012 Pigmentum Blanc Ugni Blanc-Colombard (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sourced principally from the excellent Artz vineyard on Red Mountain, this blend of 78% Sauvignon Blanc and 22% Sémillon is ripe and lush, almost to the point of tasting sweet. No residual sugar was listed, but in terms of flavor, it's hard to ignore. If you like that richness, there is a creamy, milk-and-honey flavor, along with toasty notes.
Name: Michael Florentino 2012 Mistura Blanco Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Red Mountain)

Description: Soft in style, with warm peach and pear flavors. There is a touch of herbaceousness and crisp acidity, but these are rounded out by an attractive fragrance. Ready to drink in six months.
Name: Château Bélingard 2012 White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: Dominated by Sylvaner but with some fragrant Muscat also in the blend, this is a perfumed wine, fresh while soft. It's delicate, balanced, cut neatly with acidity. A great apéritif wine.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2011 White (Alsace)

Description: This blend of Loin de l'Oeil and Sauvignon Blanc gives a crisp, lightly textured wine, floral in character with flavors of white peach and plum. Ready to drink.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2012 Gouleyant White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This simple, rich white wine features a cheesecake graphic on the label, hence the name. The blend is a mix of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, Riesling and Gewürztraminer. Fine for sipping cold if you're in the mood for a more luscious white.
Name: Calendar Girl 2011 Buxom Blonde White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Aromas of bath oil, candle wax and lychee set up a chunky palate with tropical flavors of lychee and melon. This blend of Torrontés and Chardonnay is round, plump and just acidic enough to hold its own.
Name: Trapiche 2012 Extravaganza White (Mendoza)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Dominated by intensely herbaceous Colombard, this is a light, fresh and aromatic wine. Acidity combines with a fruit drop character that suggests some sweetness in the blend. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine de Maubet 2012 Blanc Sec White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: A blend of Riesling, Pinot Gris and Gewurztraminer from a small vineyard. The result is a wine that is hugely rich and spicy but with a great fresh line of acidity to balance the peach and green plum fruits. It is ready to drink.
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2009 Clos du Zahnacker White (Alsace)

Description: A deliciously fruity Crémant, full of crisp apples, lively acidity and bright tones. There is a touch of peppery spicy to add extra interest. Full of life, this is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Vincent Stoeffler NV Brut Pinot Blanc-Chardonnay (Crémant d'Alsace)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: In keeping with the winery's commitment to exploring some less-traveled wine roads, this is a coferment of 75% Pinot Noir and 25% Chardonnay. Soft, delicate and aromatic, with a pale rose color, it is definitely not in the mainstream of Oregon Pinots. Nonetheless, it's very well crafted, aromatic and delivers plenty of flavor and depth.
Name: ENSO 2011 Bieze Vineyard The Prince Pinot-Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Very ripe yellow fruits make this a generous, dense, rich wine. A light touch of wood and acidity balance the super-rich character of the wine. Maybe it's all too much—too opulent—but then again, it is delicious.
Name: Quinta do Pinto 2011 Viognier-Chardonnay (Lisboa)

Description: Standard white-fruit and salinic aromas offer hints of apple and flower blossom. The mouthfeel is more round and full than most Basque wines, while the flavors are a blend of melon and peach. This is quiet and not overly flavorful on the finish, with a hint of seltzer and minerality.
Name: Itsas Mendi 2011 No. 7 White (Bizkaiko Txakolina)

Description: A blend of Riesling and Gewurztraminer, this wine is both spicy and sweet with intense acidity. There is great concentration here and a rich texture. The wine needs aging for its spice and fruit elements to come together.
Name: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2012 Late Harvest White (Tejo)

Description: Labeled Pinot d'Alsace to indicate it's a blend dominated by Pinot Blanc, it's ripe and very fruity with its pear and peach fruit flavors prominent. It has weight, spice, richness and a rounded, full texture. Not a wine for aging, but enjoyable over the next two to three years.
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2010 Métiss White (Alsace)

Description: Two complementary grapes produce this ripe wine that's full of citrus flavors and balanced with pear and peach. It's rounded and rich in its texture, with a touch of honey to go with the lemon acidity on the finish.
Name: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)

Description: A blend of Muscat, Riesling and Pinot Gris, this is a ripe, perfumed wine, attractively fresh while showing a more exotic character. It's fruity, forward, fragrant and ready to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: René Sparr 2011 One White (Alsace)

Description: A classic Alsace dry white wine, this is soft and spicy, with apple and pear fruit and a light layering of citrus. Gentle, very open and friendly, a great apéritif wine.
Name: Cave Freudenreich 2012 Edelzwicker White (Alsace)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Half Viognier with the rest equal parts Marsanne and Roussanne, this is aromatic with notes of pear, apples and apricot with surprisingly tart fruit flavors. The warmth of the vintage shows with the alcohol bleeding through, especially on the finish.
Name: Cliff Creek 2012 MRV White (Southern Oregon)

Description: A yellow color and a buttery, waxy nose suggest a wine on the decline. However, there's spritz to the mouthfeel, where you get flavors of blanched almond and baked apple. A nutty, weighty finish is the final act.
Name: Domaine Jean Bousquet 2012 Reserve Chardonnay-Pinot Gris (Tupungato)

Description: Resiny oak aromas control the nose on this awkward, heavy white blend. There's some citric acidity to maintain a sense of vitality, but salty flavors of nectarine and orange are O.K. at best.
Name: Cueva de las Manos 2011 Reserve White (Mendoza)

Description: A beautiful wine: the subtle wood aging points up the rich pear and apricot fruit. It has richness and a fine balance between fruit, structure and the elegant acidity that lifts the wine. It's still young and will be best after at least 4–5 years of aging.
Name: Château de France 2011  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Old vines from the Bisamberg Vineyard have produced a rich, beautifully ripe wine. Its white and yellow fruit flavors give richness, concentration and a great spicy character. With its density, structure and intense acidity, it's likely to age well over 3–5 years. Glass stopper.
Name: Wieninger 2012 Nussberg Alte Reben Gemischter Satz White (Vienna)

Description: From vineyards overlooking the city of Vienna, this is a field blend of old varieties. It is crisp and spicy with an exotic ginger note along with its fruitiness, and fresh acidity. It's not for aging but will improve over the next year. Screwcap.
Name: Wieninger 2012 Gemischter Satz White (Vienna)

Description: This rare white wine from a vineyard in Saint-Emilion is produced by Gérard Perse of Château Pavie. Now mature, this ripe, bitter-almond and spice flavored wine shows a touch of scorched wood. As a contrast, there is a rich, almost buttery character that gives the wine a full texture. Ready to drink.
Name: Château Monbousquet 2004  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend of Chardonnay, Viognier, Roussanne and Orange Muscat shows extra ripeness in 2012, reflected in both the higher alcohol and the noticeable sweetness. It's fragrant and expressive, with sweet orange peel and candied grapefruit dominating, along with slices of pineapple and apricot. The sweetness makes it a bit of a challenge with food.
Name: Kontos 2012 Gossamer White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Pinot Gris and Gewürztraminer, it's vibrantly aromatic with notes of spice, white grapefruit, and lychee. The concrete tank aging provides a sense of freshness while Celilo Vineyard's electric acidity beautifully balances out the residual sugar (16.3 g/L).
Name: Cor Cellars 2012 Alba Celilo Vineyard Pinot Gris-Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: Despite its relatively low alcohol level, this comes across as reasonably mouthfilling and rich. Smoky notes from barrel fermentation emerge with air, accenting white nectarine and citrus fruit. It's one of the few blends of this type to show the textural interest of a good white Graves.
Name: Cullen 2011 Cullen Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: This concentrated, ripe wine boasts apricot flavors and great balancing acidity. It's pure in feeling with a tangy, mineral structure and focused fruit and acidity giving freshness. Screwcap.
Name: Gebeshuber 2011 Reserve White (Thermenregion)

Description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay, this richly honeyed, still very young wine has all the weight and richness of sweet wines from the southern end of Lake Neusiedl. It is packed with ripe yellow fruits, layered with intense honey and has just an edge of dryness from the noble rot. It's worth aging over 4–6 years.
Name: Steindorfer 2010 Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Burgenland)

Description: This wine shows an intriguing touch of flinty, fumé character as well as ample melon and fig fruit. It's reasonably full bodied and textured for a wine of its ilk.
Name: Cape Mentelle 2012 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Crisp and bright in lemon and apple, Atrea also has a honeyed richness to it, especially on the finish. A blend of almost equal Roussanne and Viognier, the latter comes from Lolonis's very old, dry-farmed vines. Refreshing, this wine is begging for spicy food.
Name: Atrea 2012 The Choir White (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From one of Steven Kent's favorite Livermore Valley vineyards, Ghielmetti, this vintage of Lola is 65% Sauvignon Blanc and 35% Sémillon, the SB picked first off the vineyard; the Sémillon last of the whites. Whole-cluster pressed, it is briny, with a marine-like influence of savory and steely characteristics. Rich, but not too rich, it's freshened by notes of lemon and lime.
Name: Steven Kent 2012 Lola Ghielmetti Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Livermore Valley)

Description: Aged in wood, this wine has richness and weight even though it loses some of the fruitiness of the Zierfandler and Rotgipfler grapes that make up the blend. It is smooth, rounded, and just hinting at a more tangy character. A wine like this needs another year to fully integrate. Screwcap.
Name: Gebeshuber 2011 Grosse Reserve White (Thermenregion)

Description: Borra winemaker Markus Niggli, a Swiss native, has gone back to his roots for this innovative blend of 85% Kerner and 15% Riesling, proving that some of the best experimentation in California is happening in places like Lodi right now. Full of lively acidity, this wine is crisp, soft, sparkling with lime, apple, lychee and kiwi, easy to enjoy on a summer's day or any other day.
Name: Borra 2012 Artist Series White (Lodi)

Description: A blend of 88% Sauvignon Blanc and 45% Chardonnay, this is bright and expressive, with forward aromas of white peach, yellow florals, fresh grass and sweet-orange citrus. Those notes carry through to the lively palate, with prickly acidity that keeps the finish crisp and clean.
Name: Flam 2012 Unoaked Blanc White (Judean Hills)

Description: Blending two local grapes, Zierfandler and Rotgipfler, this is a perfumed, intensely fruity wine. Apples and orange zest come together to give delicious acidity, bright flavors and a crisp aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Gebeshuber 2012 Klassik White (Thermenregion)

Description: Components of this wine see some time in oak, so there's a slightly smoky cast to the white peach and pineapple aromas. It's medium-bodied in the mouth and lushly textured, with a slightly warm, grapefruity finish. Drink now.
Name: Leeuwin Estate 2012 Siblings Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: A blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier (to add some southern spice), this is a soft, fruity wine with rich white fruits and attractive acidity. It's a wine that can be drunk soon, although it should age several years.
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2012 C.Sb.V. White (Vin de Pays du Lot)

Description: This is a soft, creamy wine with a texture that is dry while also rounded. White fruits, lemony acidity and a mineral edge are all consistent. The finish is full of acidity and a touch of bitterness.
Designation: Edition Gustav Klimt Blanc de Blancs Brut
Name: Szigeti 2009 Edition Gustav Klimt Blanc de Blancs Brut White (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: Fine acidity cuts through this richly fruity wine. Very pure and stylish, it's aromatic with notes of white flowers, citrus and white fruits. Lively in texture, this is a delicious wine already, but it will age well over 2–4 years. Screwcap.
Name: Hannes Reeh 2012 Weiss Heideboden White (Burgenland)

Description: Borra's Fusion is 90% Viognier and 10% Gewurztraminer and the two varieties bring out nice things in each other here, the floral aromas at the wine's opening evolving into a crisp, soft, creamy center on the mid-palate, a taste of citrus and honeydew standing out.
Name: Borra 2012 Fusion White (Lodi)

Description: Light and fruity, this is a delicious wine with no sides. It has green fruits, citrus, a touch of perfume and good acidity. From old vineyards with mixed plantings, this is a blend in the typical Viennese tradition. Screwcap.
Name: Cobenzl 2012 Gemischter Satz Classic White (Vienna)

Description: This blend shows decent weight and texture, along with elegant aromas and flavors of scorched citrus peel and grapefruit. It's long and mouthwatering on the oak-free finish, making it a versatile food companion. The 2012 looks to be even better.
Name: Moss Wood 2011 Ribbon Vale Vineyards Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Margaret River)

Description: Rich and fruity, this wine shows warm white fruit and a touch of spice. The wine is soft, its currant and pink grapefruit flavors lifted by acidity but with a rounded finish.
Name: Château de Fontenille 2012  Entre-Deux-Mers

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine is a screaming deal, like biting into a rich bite of apple with melon overtones chased with lemon on the long finish. A blend of Arneis, Cortese, Pinot Grigio, Sauvignon Blanc, Chenin Blanc and Tocai Friulano, stock up for an Indian summer.
Name: Monte Volpe 2011 Primo Bianco White (Mendocino County)

Description: This blend of Chardonnay and Sauvignon delivers pretty floral and white-fruit aromas, while the long and linear palate shows restrained fruit flavors punctuated by pear and a hint of mineral.
Name: Pico Maccario 2012 Estrosa  (Monferrato Bianco)

Description: This starts off with promisingly vibrant aromas of passion fruit and pink grapefruit, but seems a bit weighty and thickly textured in the mouth. The fruit remains the bold centerpiece, while the finish shows some alcoholic warmth.
Name: Plantagenet 2011 Hazard Hill Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Western Australia)

Description: Although this includes only 3% Viognier, it's apparent from the musky hints of gingery spice on the nose. Ginger, nasturtium and melon flavors round out an expansive mouthfeel. It's odd—especially in a lineup of more traditional Sem-Sauvs—but not unpleasant. Drink now.
Name: Skuttlebutt 2012 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is the classic Gascon blend, also found as the base wine for Armagnac. It produces a light, bright, fruity, very crisp wine that has citrus, a touch of peach and green plum flavors. Drink this year.
Name: Domaine Uby 2012 Colombard-Ugni Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This fresh, fragrant wine is buoyed by citrus acidity and green apples. It's all fruit—light and bright—finishing with a tangy lemon-zest character. Screwcap.
Name: Strauss 2012 Strauss White White (Steiermark)

Description: This unusual blend of Riesling, Chardonnay and Viognier is toasty but also stalky smelling, with modest fruit aromas. The palate is plump and simple feeling, with chunky weight and salty flavors of roast corn and bland citrus. Oak and saline define the finish.
Name: Anakena 2011 Ona Special Reserve Riesling-Chardonnay-Viognier White (Leyda Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Hmm. A blend of 50% Sémillon from Amador County and 50% Viognier from El Dorado County that gives off much beyond a slight taste of Asian pear. Cloudy, it is also sharp and herbal.
Name: La Clarine Farm 2012 Nr. 2 White (Sierra Foothills)

Description: A mixture of vineyard sources from the Columbia Gorge and Willamette Valley, this (mostly) Pinot Blanc was aged five months in stainless steel. It's aromatic and expressive with notes of apple, spice and flowers. It's exquisitely balanced, with the residual sugar (1.9 g/L) playing perfectly off the electric acidit, and has a finish that just won't quit.
Name: Ross Andrew 2011 Meadow White (Washington-Oregon)

Description: An unusual blend of Semillon, Alvarinho and Sauvignon Blanc, all aimed at keeping freshness in the warm climate of Setúbal. This ripe, smooth wine is deliciously cut with acidity to give a lightly wood-aged wine that could age for another 2–3 years.
Name: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2011 Quinta da Bacalhôa Branco White (Península de Setúbal)

Description: This yellow-tinted blend of Friulano, Chardonnay, Viognier and Pinot Gris is classy and smoky on the nose, with no shortage of toasty oak. Core apple, melon and citrus flavors are rich and smooth, while this finishes round and full in body. Corte Friulano is really good for an oddball Argentine white blend.
Name: François Lurton 2011 Gran Lurton Corte Friulano White (Mendoza)

Description: Fragrant and floral, this mix of 85% Chenin Blanc and 15% Viognier is soft and light, in alcohol (12.5%) and texture. With flavors of white peach and a subtle tropical streak, with good minerality, it's a nice sipping wine or a good find with Asian food.
Name: Clarksburg Wine Company 2011 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Clarksburg)

Description: Like most good Baja whites, this is done in a crisp, fresh style and offers acidic cut on the palate. The flavors are pure citrus—mostly lemon, tangerine and pineapple. This tangy wine narrows on the finish. Drink with ceviche and raw shellfish.
Name: Hacienda La Lomita 2011 Espacio En Blanco Sauvignon Blanc-Chenin Blanc (Valle de Guadalupe)

Description: An aromatic blend of Viognier and Roussanne, with overripe pear, lavender and spice. Aged three months in French oak, the palate is full bodied and unctuous, with a bitter note on the finish.
Name: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2012 Vivacious Reserve Viognier-Roussane White

Description: This is a blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Moscato that's yeasty and oaky on the nose. The mouth is creamy and home to apple, vanilla and oxidized afterflavors. There's enough solid pear and melon involved to make it worthwhile, but you can't miss the mature nature of the wine.
Name: Vinicola Fraternidad 2011 Nuva White (Valle de Guadalupe)

Description: A blend of 85% Chenin Blanc and 15% Viognier, this white is part sweet and part sour, with honey and peach coming through a murky cloud of wood. Still, enjoy it with Asian food slathered in spice or as the first sip on a hot day.
Name: Vinum Cellars 2011 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Clarksburg)

Description: Essenz is the style of wine given to sick emperors as the ultimate medicine. It certainly has a life-giving character, the distillation of noble rot berries, honeyed and intensely texture. The wine has a pure feel, sustained by final acidity. Drink now or age for many years.
Name: Neumeister 2010 Saziani Essenz Trockenbeerenauslese White (Südoststeiermark)

Description: A blend of local grapes (Zierfandler and Rotgipfler) this is impressive. Rich, perfumed, its fragrant fruits a medley of mulberry, pear and spiced apple. The acidity cuts right through, giving a wine that is both very ripe, balanced and finely textured. Screwcap.
Name: Loimer 2011 Schell Mann in Gumpoldskirchen White (Thermenregion)

Description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sämling, this gold straw colored wine is about freshness and acidity as much as about sweetness. That gives this ageworthy wine a great delicacy and poise, balanced and fresh, the honey botrytis texture attractively layered through this delicious wine.
Name: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2009 Trockenbeerenauslese Essenz White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This white blend is two thirds Sémillon, one third Sauvignon Blanc. It has continued to improve from vintage to vintage, and this is the best yet. A Washington take on Bordeaux blanc, it's dry and fresh, with golden apple and sweet grain extending across the palate and on through a lingering, lightly peachy finish.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2011 Estate Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A welcome addition to the Bunchgrass lineup, this white Bordeaux-style blend is one third barrel-fermented Semillon, two thirds tank-fermented Sauvignon Blanc. The ripe and textural fruit still shows a lightly yeasty character, along with highlights of honey graham cracker.
Name: Bunchgrass 2011 Whispering Owl White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: From grapes picked in February 2012, this light, delicate wine is still young, still finding its balanced acidity and fruit. It has a soft, almost gentle fruit and honey character that hides the intense acidity. It needs several years' aging.
Name: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2011 Eiswein Exquisit White (Burgenland)

Description: Rich, tropical fruit flavors. It shows a light touch of wood aging to round and soften the intense and ripe fruits. With the complex fruits, the concentrated texture and the full-bodied character, this is a wine for aging over at least three years. Screwcap.
Name: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2010 Leithaberg Pinot Blanc-Chardonnay (Burgenland)

Description: Aromas are all of honey, while on the palate the honey balances with acidity, rhubarb and candied orange flavors giving a wine that is rich while still keeping lightness. For medium-term aging.
Name: Nittnaus Hans und Christine 2011 Beerenauslese Exquisit White (Burgenland)

Description: Sweet and dry, this is a wine that shows its botrytis fruit character right up front. That's paired with orange marmalade and honey to give richness. The finish is light and crisp with acidity.
Name: Höpler NV Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: With a touch of gooseberry and apricot, Amador Foothill's 75% Sauvignon Blanc-25% Semillon blend is clean and easy, with a touch of earthy oak on the finish. A great value for spring and summertime sipping.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2012 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: The nose on this blend of Gewurztraminer and Macabeo defines neutral; it's clean but shows little more than a whiff of apple. The palate is fresh and quick moving, with mild peach, pear, apple and melon flavors that culminate in a solid finish that's not very exciting but doesn't stray.
Name: Oliver Conti 2011 Treyu White (Empordà)

Description: Full in style, this is a lemon-scented, peach-flavored wine. It has some richness to it both from the ripe fruit and the textured acidity that gives a tight tang to the aftertaste. The needs to age for a year. Screwcap.
Name: Château La Rose du Pin 2012  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: A field blend that's an Austrian tradition. It's a delicious, precocious mouth full with its apple acidity and fresh pink grapefruit flavors. It's a pleasure to drink now as an aperitif wine. Screwcap.
Name: Neumeister 2011 Gemischter Satz White (Südoststeiermark)

Description: A bright, herbaceous and fresh wine, showing green fruits, lively acidity and and a steely edge that adds a fine texture.
Name: Château Rousset-Caillau 2011  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: A green, herbal wine, very crisp, still young with acidity, mineral acidity and a bright, lively aftertaste. The wine is tangy with citrus at the end. Keep for six months to a year. Screwcap.
Name: Château de Beauregard-Ducourt 2012  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Crisp, lightly herbaceous wine with a delicious creamy apple and pear character. This is finely balanced with a lively, crisp aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Château Briot 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Insania White is 90% Semillon, 10% Sauvignon Blanc, and made at Three Rivers for heavy metal rocker Geoff Tate. The 2011 is round and fruity, with flavors of fig, apple and pear. It's a forward, juicy wine, quite tasty, but without the edgy depths of the 2010.
Name: Geoff Tate 2011 Insania White Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This mature blend of Gewurztraminer, Sauvignon Blanc and Macabeo is oily, plump and fragrant, but also blocky, chunky and on its last legs of freshness. Flowery peach, melon and papaya flavors end short, with an oily mouthfeel.
Name: Oliver Conti 2009 White (Empordà)

Description: Rounded wine, showing ripe tropical flavors as well as a more citrus character. The wine is full, attractively textured with a buttery edge. Spice and green herbs come through to finish. Screwcap.
Name: Château Larroque 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Classic, open, herbaceous fruit flavors with attractive light acidity and a perfumed character from the Muscadelle in the blend. The wine is fruity, crisp citrus and lively final freshness. Screwcap.
Name: Château Tour de Bonnet 2012  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: A heavy gold color announces an oily, floral nose that suggests gardenias. The palate is quite oily in feel and very plump, with decent acidity and unique flavors of persimmon, spice and exotic fruits. This is oily and a bit clunky on the finish. Drink now.
Designation: Blanc de Pacs Organic Farming Parellada-Xarel-lo-Macabeu
Name: Parés Baltà 2011 Blanc de Pacs Organic Farming Parellada-Xarel-lo-Macabeu White (Penedès)

Description: The bouquet on this white blend almost goes in reverse, meaning it's so neutral that it seems to go backwards. In the mouth, the wine is fleshy and soft, with flabby flavors of banana, papaya and bland citrus. A sugary tasting finish with pear and banana is o.k. but cloying.
Name: Mas Igneus 2010 Barranc dels Closos White (Priorat)

Description: Young, herbaceous wine, very fruity and lightly perfumed. It is crisp and delicate, with its citrus and pineapple fruits already lively and fresh.
Name: Château Allégret 2012  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This three-grape white blend starts with oily aromas and weight before finding some minerality and white-fruit notes. The palate has citrusy kick and zing to bolster green apple and orange flavors. The finish is wide, a touch clumsy and citrusy in flavor, with tang and lasting freshness.
Name: Dinastía Vivanco 2012 Vivanco Viura-Malvasia-Tempranillo Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: A round and full flavored wine. It is soft with apple and pear flavors, lifted by a touch of lemon zest. There is some weight to this ripe, dry, finally crisp wine. Keep for a few more months.
Name: Château Fonfroide 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A simple, youthful white, perfumed and spicy as well as crisply fruity. From the Entre-deux-Mers region, it is cool, clean, laden with green plums and white currant flavors. For aging over the next few months.
Name: Château du Pin Franc 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: There's no denying this wine's stalky, oily aromas. In the mouth, this blend of Roussanne, Marsanne and Viognier is chunky, with flavors that follow suit: the palate is bitter, slightly oxidized and melony. For $40, not much is clicking here.
Name: Errazuriz 2011 The Blend Collection White (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: Mild, fleshy aromas of dusty white fruits lead to a clenched, acidic palate with citrus and nectarine flavors. The finish shows little deviation and nothing more than basic white-fruit flavors of citrus, peach and apple.
Name: Esperanza 2012 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: This blended white—a sweetish mix of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, Gewürztraminer and Riesling—has a honeyed character that suggests that at least some of the grapes may have been touched with botrytis. Regardless, look for that sugary, honeyed flavor to dominate.
Name: Kamiak 2011 Windust White (Washington)

Description: Still very young, this is a crisply fresh wine, all lemon zest and apple skin flavors. There is a young, green element here that needs to soften over the next few months. Screwcap.
Name: Château d'Haurets 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Lightly crisp and herbaceous, this is an attractively youthful and fruity wine. Lemon and crisp pear flavors dominate. Bright and aromatic, it's ready to drink.
Name: Château de Lagarde 2012 Les Hauts de Lagarde  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Blending Sémillon and Muscadelle, this is a rich, unctuous wine with a rich texture. Honey and apricot flavors are underlain with intense acidity that gives this superb wine a fine lift and elegance. It could certainly age, but is delicious now.
Name: Domaine l'Ancienne Cure 2009 L'Abbaye  (Monbazillac)

Description: Full and rounded, this is a rich wine with its perfumed and smooth character from the blend of Gros Manseng and Petit Courbu. There is a more delicate element that acts as a fine contrast to the otherwise ripe wine.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2011 L'Empreinte de Saint-Mont  (Saint-Mont)

Description: This is a deliciously ripe wine, aged in wood to give roundness to the blend of Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay. It is full bodied and rich in the mouth with orange and pineapple flavors giving a great lift to the mineral texture.
Name: Bouvet-Ladubay 2009 Trésor  (Saumur)

Description: A selection from the best parcels gives a rich, full-bodied and wood-aged white wine. With tropical fruit flavors laced with lemon zest, it's both concentrated and fresh. Impressive wine for aging over 2–3 years and definitely to be drunk with food.
Name: Château de la Jaubertie 2011 Mirabelle White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: The second of two sweet wines produced by Marc Labat at Rousse, this certainly has a honey character, with flavors of dry fruits, a dancing acidity and a fruity aftertaste. Great as an aperitif.
Name: Château de Rousse 2011 Cuvée Sélection  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: With petrol and peach-pit aromas, this is a tight blend of 70% Garnacha Blanca and 30% Macabeo (Viura). The palate is structured and healthy, while the flavors suggest banana, melon and papaya. It finishes crisp, chalky and lush, as if a dusting of powdered sugar were dropped in at the end.
Name: Jaspi 2011 Blanc White (Terra Alta)

Description: A tiny vineyard of less than half an acre produces this aromatic wine, its pear and citrus flavors cutting through the smooth texture. The wine has some weight while also showing a great freshness. It will be better in a year's time.
Name: Château K 2011 White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: A tight wine with notes of almond and green fruit that add tension to the structure. The acidity is dominant in this complex, textured wine. It could age beautifully over the next 2–3 years.
Name: Bouvet-Ladubay 2010 Saphir Brut Vintage  (Saumur)

Description: This easygoing white is just what most people will want to sip with tapas, appetizers or on its own. It's briny and citrusy on the palate, which is typical for Rueda, and the finish is lasting, with green-herb flavors, cutting acidity and elegance.
Name: Palma Real 2011 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: In a style that is reminiscent of neighboring Jurançon, Pacherenc produces fruity, fragrant and fresh sweet wines. There is a touch of honey and tropical fruit that balances the acidity and the crispness. A wine for pâtés as well as desserts.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2010 Château Arricau-Bordes  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Crémant de Loire is the Loire-wide sparkling wine appellation. This wine, with its blend of Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay, shows a crisp character, its acidity given brightness by lemon and green-plum fruit flavors. There's an attractive edge of minerality to add some tautness to the wine.
Name: Bouvet-Ladubay NV Brut Excellence Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Crémant de Loire)

Description: This was a cool vintage, but winemaker Ross Mickel lets the tart, somewhat green fruit flavors express themselves without any residual sugar. Mostly Pinot Blanc, with small amounts of Pinot Gris, Riesling and Gewurztraminer. It's finished at 12.6% alcohol, resulting in a mouth-puckering, citrusy wine with mixed flavors of grapefruit and lemon drop candy.
Name: Ross Andrew 2010 Meadow White (Washington-Oregon)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A blend of Müller-Thurgau, Muscat, and Riesling, this frizzante, off-dry (26 g/L residual sugar) wine is perfumed and broadly appealing with notes of pear, nectarine, orange peel, and honeysuckle.
Name: Season 2012 Transparency White Table Wine White (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: From the Armagnac region of south-west France, this is herbaceous, cool and crisp, a great aperitif white. It has green fruits, bright texture and lively acidity.
Name: Domaine de Lartigue 2012 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: Picked in November, the late harvest grapes make up this rich wine, with honey and ginger flavors along with light, dancing acidity that gives the wine great poise. Great with pâtés or terrines.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2011 Saint-Albert  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With a portion of proceeds going to Seattle University's general athletic fund, this Viognier with a dash of Roussanne (8%) has notes of canned pear and mandarin orange slices sprinkled with green tea. Fermented and aged in stainless steel, it is broad and textured with a streak of acidity stitching it all together.
Designation: Seattle U Redhawks White Wine Destiny Ridge Vineyard
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2012 Seattle U Redhawks White Wine Destiny Ridge Vineyard White (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A blend of Colombard and Ugni Blanc, this is a deliciously fruity, fragrant wine, just right for quaffing on a warm summer day. It is bright, fresh and herbaceous, grapefruit and orange juice easily combining. Screwcap.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2012 Colombelle L'Original White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: An aromatic blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon gives a soft, fruity wine. While it has lost its initial youthful freshness, it now has rounded out with pear and kiwi fruits with a touch of apricots. Drink now.
Name: Domaine la Hitaire 2010 Hors Saison White (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: A intensely fresh, aromatic blend of Gros Manseng, Arruliac and Petit Courbu that gives a vibrant character full of citrus, pineapple and green plum flavors. It is a delicious wine just exotic and worth keeping for a few more months.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2011 Les Vignes Retrouvées  (Saint-Mont)

Description: This blend of Verdejo and Viura deals floral aromas along with hints of honey, apple and peach. It's zesty enough in the mouth, with ripe peach and melon flavors, but it's not sweet. The texture on the finish holds up to scrutiny and the afterflavors are good. Drink now.
Name: Agricola Castellana 2011 Inspiración Pampano White (Rueda)

Description: Lemon, apple and cleanliness define the nose on this everyday white that's priced to sell. The mouth is racy and fresh, with peach, apple and citrus flavors that lead to a fairly long, clean and flavorful finish. Drink now.
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2011 White (Rueda)

Description: Dusty apple and mildly green aromas are good but nothing to get excited over. In the mouth, this is smooth and showing some signs of softening. Flavors of banana, apple and citrus end in a swirl of tropical flavors and pith. Drink immediately.
Name: Telmo Rodríguez 2011 Basa White (Rueda)

Description: Vanilla wafer, citrus and melon aromas are starting to break up and take on a mildly tired outlook. In the mouth, this Trexadura-led blend of six white grapes is fleshy, with pear, apple, peach and stalky bitterness for flavors. It's battling to hold on, so drink up or wait for the 2011.
