Name: Viña Mein 2010 Domillor Harvest Selection White (Ribeiro)

Appellation: Vin de Savoie, France Other, France
Description: A tight, crisp, apple and citrus flavored wine. It has a bright texture, with green fruitiness and a cool-climate feel. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Labbé 2011 Abymes White (Vin de Savoie)

Description: Bergerac's take on the Bordeaux white blend includes Muscadelle which gives a perfumed character, to add to the more herbaceous tones of the Sauvignon Blanc. Together, they produce a crisp, fruity and attractively approachable young white wine.
Name: Domaine l'Ancienne Cure 2011 L'Abbaye White (Bergerac Sec)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: An intensely herbaceous, totally drinkable white wine, deliciously fresh, crisp and packed with citrus and bright acidity. A great aperitif or seafood wine.
Name: Domaine San de Guilhem 2012 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This is pricey for what you get. It's a blend of 50% Riesling with 40% Albariño and 10% Sauvignon, and frankly it smells a bit oily and stalky, while the palate is soft and the flavors suggest underripe green melon and apple. On the finish, it's a bit green.
Name: Viña Alicia 2011 Tiara White (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Apple and grass notes turn stalky with hay and wheat aromas. It feels flabby, although there is some vital acidity keeping it alive.
Name: Telmo Rodríguez 2010 Basa White (Rueda)

Description: This is a great wine with its swathes of ripe fruit allied to a very structured character. It is concentrated with complex flavors that bring in wood, tropical fruits, apricots and a dense texture. Combined, these elements give the wine great style and aging potential.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2010  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A rich, ripe and finely balanced wine. Its acidity cuts through the full pear and apricot flavors to give a tight crispness. At this stage, it is all fruit and acidity, but it does have the potential for greatness with a more complex sense coming from the wood aging and the fine, tight texture.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2010  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Opulent and ripe, this is a powerful, wood-aged wine. It has a fine mix of tropical fruits, spice and vanilla. The richness is cut through with pink grapefruit to give a fine sense of poise and balance. Age for at least four years.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2010  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A fruity, ripe wine with lemon and pineapple flavors alongside a fine tang of citrus. It's beautifully marked with wood aging to give a rounded, rich mouthfeel. It also has the texture to mellow into a more nuanced wine in 4–5 years.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2010  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A delicate, classically textured white wine, this is a pure combination of apricot and lemon fruits with crisp, delicious acidity despite the wood aging. A great success in its restrained style, this should age well.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2010  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A fine combination of wood and ripe, tropical fruits lead to a crisp, fruity more herbaceous core. There is a great balance between this richness and citrus herbaceousness. It will certainly age several years.
Name: Château Margaux 2010 Pavillon Blanc de Château Margaux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This fresh and fruity wine offers touches of apricot and a depth of richness. It's beautifully bright and crisp, with lively acidity and a final lemon crispness on the close.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2010  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Smooth and rich, this is an opulent wine. It has ripe acidity and tropical fruit notes, while also crisp at the edges, like biting into a ripe pear. The wine, with its structured core, has good aging potential.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2010  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Pushing in the direction of freshness and herbaceousness, this is a tight, textured wine. The wine's grapefruit and lime flavors are balanced by touches of wood and spice. The final feel is soft, yet brisk.
Name: Château Olivier 2010  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Since this is 100% Sauvignon Blanc, it is intensely crisp, with grapefruit flavors and bright acidity that lead into a lemongrass aftertaste. It's clean and fresh, and is likely to mature quickly.
Name: Château Couhins-Lurton 2010  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Full-bodied and rich, this is full of pineapple fruit flavors and woody spice. The ripeness is allied to an herbaceous character, with almonds giving spice. It will develop quickly into a delicious wine.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2010  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Citrusy, with its character bordering on herbaceous, this is a layered wine. Produced from a portion of the Mouton-Rothschild vineyard, it is rich and deliciously ready to drink, with bright acidity giving a fine lift to the finish.
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2010 Aile d'Argent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a lively wine, with faint touches of wood to give a smoother character. The wine is bright while having the necessary depth of flavor to promise good aging.
Name: Château Couhins 2010  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A creamy, wood-aged white that simultaneously emphasizes crisp Sauvignon Blanc fruit and minerality. Hints of pineapple and lemon go with a tight texture. A rich yet fresh wine that could age for a few years but can also be enjoyed now.
Name: Le Nardian 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This crystalline Galician blend is composed of 95% Godello and Albariño, and it gets going with mellow apple, peach and other white-fruit aromas. The palate has a tangy, citrusy outlook with corresponding flavors of lime, orange and tangerine. Things turn pithy and more chunky on the finish.
Name: Ponte da Boga 2011 Blanco de Blancos White (Ribeira Sacra)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: A bright, wood-aged wine, this is full of toast and yellow fruit notes framed by complex acidity. The wine has an ageworthy side as well, with the texture showing a mineral, nervy element on the finish.
Name: Château des Matards 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: Citrus, mango and animal cracker aromas are mild and easy to like. The palate on this white blend (led by 50% Verdejo) offers melon, apple, mango and a hint of spice, while the finish is clean, smooth and just racy enough. Drink now for max freshness.
Name: Naia 2011 Las Brisas White (Rueda)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This is unusual in that it's heavily oaked, as evidenced by aromas of varnish, hard spice and resin. The mouthfeel is fresh on top of resiny, while flavors of dry oak, spice and mild apple and citrus operate in the background. While this wine has depth of body and acidic lift, it's dominated by the barrel.
Name: Abadia Retuerta 2011 Le Domaine Blanco de Guarda White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: This Macabeo-Chardonnay blend is light on its feet, with minerally aromas of saline and peach. It's fresh but ordinary in the mouth, with apple and melon flavors in front of a dry, dusty finish. This will do the trick with basic appetizers.
Name: Bodegas 1898 2011 Ramón Roqueta Macabeo-Chardonnay (Catalunya)

Description: Light lemon-lime aromas open things up, alongside a light mineral note. The palate is clean and racy, with enough body to hold up to core flavors of lime, kiwi and green apple. A floral freshness carries the finish.
Name: Las Valles 2011 Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)

Description: The palate on this wine is clean, lemony and lean, with pithy citrus, apple and vanilla flavors. The best thing about the finish is that it doesn't fall apart.
Name: Vega Sindoa 2011 Viura-Chardonnay (Navarra)

Description: This blend of 90% Viura and 10% Malvasia gives off scents of saline and pool water along with apple, citrus and green herb notes. The palate is zesty and high in acid, leaving a clipped feel and flavors of lime, pineapple and green apple. It's nicely built but modest in its overall expression.
Name: Muga 2011 Barrel Fermented White (Rioja)

Appellation: Francs Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: This is a very herbaceous and crisp wine, with the Sauvignon Blanc characteristics cutting through the ripe texture. It's fruity, bright as a button and ready to drink now.
Name: Château les Charmes Godard 2010  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: Apple, lime, lemon and natural vanilla are the aromas one gets from this blended Catalonian white. The palate is bright along the edges, a bit soft and jumbled in the middle, and in terms of flavor the wine offers generic apple and lime in front of a fresh but fleshy finish. Drink immediately.
Name: Torres 2011 Sangre de Toro Viña Sol White (Catalunya)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Get beyond the yeasty aromas to reveal a fruity, creamy textured wine. It has ripe yellow fruits, an herbaceous element and a smooth, full mouthfeel.
Name: Château des Tourtes 2010  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Prickly, briny citrus aromas announce a juicy, acidic wine that dances on the palate while delivering flavors of lime, briny apple and nettle. Things stay prickly and turn bitter on the back side. 50% each Verdejo and Viura.
Name: Pedro Escudero 2011 Fuente Milano Verdejo-Viura (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: There is not much action on the nose other than white-fruit aromas. The palate is fleshy in feel, with modest intensity and soft, maleable flavors of pear and apple. The finish is open-knit and soft in feel. 80% Macabeo and 20% Chardonnay.
Name: Bodegas 1898 2011 Campo Lindo Fresh Macabeo-Chardonnay (Catalunya)

Description: Aromatically, this blend of Macabeo, Muscat and Chardonnay gets off to a decent start by showing honeysuckle, lemon verbena and minerality. But in the mouth it's sharp and narrow, with blazing acids that turn peach and nectarine flavors towards sour. Simply put, there's not enough body here for the wine to rate higher.
Name: Masia Puigmoltó 2011 Emendis Trio Varietal Macabeo-Chardonnay-Muscat White (Penedès)

Description: This Chardonnay-Viognier-Riesling blend is soft, simple and herbaceous. Good for sipping; the lemony flavor would work well with light fish.
Name: Clearwater Canyon 2011 Lochsa White (Idaho)

Description: Initially, there are hints of sulfur, but once those blow off, the wine reveals a crisp, fresh and grassy character with tight acidity and lemon and grapefruit flavors. Not for aging, so drink over the next year.
Name: Château Tertre de Launay 2011  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: There's something likable about this aged, Sherry-style Rioja. Don't let the maderized tint turn you off; the wine has character, including rancio, toffee and saline aromas and flavors. If you like Sherry, give this a shot.
Designation: Cueva del Monge Blanco Fermentado en Barrica
Name: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2007 Cueva del Monge Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This blend of 70% Viura with Verdejo and Sauvigon Blanc smells a lot like Bartlett pear juice. In the mouth, it's fleshy and dilute, with briny grapefruit and a pithy tasting finish.
Name: Real Compañia de Vinos 2011 Blanco White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: The bouquet on this blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Noir is stuck in neutral, while flavors of citrus and lemon bend towards sour. The finish is briny and tangy.
Name: Bodega NQN 2011 Picada 15 White (Patagonia)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: After earning a number of Best Buys prior to this vintage, this $7 white blend is disappointing. The nose is strange and funky, while the palate feels hollow, with briny apple and pickled citrus flavors. 50% each Airen and Macabeo.
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2011 Protocolo White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Animal cracker aromas are sweet and the fruit on the nose is mealy on this Viura-Chardonnay blend. The palate is also deficient in that it's watery in feel, but there's some tangy lemon to the flavor profile.
Name: Ochoa 2011 Viura Chardonnay White (Navarra)

Description: 94–96. Barrel sample. This is a ripe, wonderful wine that's full of spice, pineapple and apricot with a green tang of herbaceous character. It's simply beautiful, with great style and a deceptively simple use of wood.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93–95. Barrel sample. Complex, rounded and full bodied, this wine is still reticent at the moment, hiding its rich fruit. As it develops, this will be impressive, with it's mineral texture over apricot fruits and layers of spice and wood.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Bursting with flower and tropical fruit aromas, the nose on this Tokaj is intoxicating. Luxurious and creamy on the palate, it offers penetrating honey and stone fruit flavors, intensified by prickles of sea salt, mineral and tea leaf astringency.
Name: Királyudvar 2007 Cuvée Ilona Tokaji (Tokaj)

Description: 93–95. Barrel sample. A gorgeous wine that's very opulent while also structured. It has richness and weight, and is remarkably dry at the core, but with surrounding delicious sweetness. It's likely to be a long-lived wine.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2012 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93–95. Barrel sample. With all its fruitiness and full, stylish character, this is a ripe wine with weight, richness, spice, lemon and tropical fruits. Opulent on the palate, it ends with an intensely fruity finish.
Name: Château la Louvière 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel sample. Rich and spicy and full of ginger flavors, this is a concentrated wine that is still coming together. The wine is very rich and full of dry botrytis—a fine wine for this difficult vintage.
Name: Château de Myrat 2012 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 92–94. Barrel sample. This wine is ripe and soft with hints of caramel, biscuit and vanilla, as well as full and ripe fruits. There's remarkable concentration and a smooth, soft texture with great acidity at the end.
Name: Château Filhot 2012 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel sample. This wine is delicious—proof positive of the continuing improvement of white wines from Château Margaux. Lively and fresh, it's accented with wood spice, apple and pear flavors. This vintage produced the smallest quantity of white wine ever made at Margaux.
Designation: Pavillon Blanc de Château Margaux Barrel Sample
Name: Château Margaux 2012 Pavillon Blanc de Château Margaux Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 92–94. Barrel sample. Spice and green-plum flavors meld beautifully in this wine that's already showing deliciously. It has a fine, mineral texture that makes it edgy and tight on the palate. Acidity cuts straight through the palate like a fine laser.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel sample. This very textured, steely wine is serious and complex. With significant richness, a mineral character and a fine depth of fruit, this is a wine meant for aging.
Name: Château de France 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel sample. This is a ripe and beautifully generous wine. It's expressive with spice, tropical fruits and a rounded structure that shows off its deliciously full, fruity character. Very generous.
Name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel sample. This is a big, rich, spicy wine, with a generous, warm character. The palate boasts significant weight with ripe pear and apricot flavors that finish with a touch of ginger and minerality.
Name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. This wine feels concentrated and densely structured with a great texture of spice, botrytis and acidity. It's a success for the vintage—full and richly structured—with fruit and dry botrytis well in balance.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2012 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92–94. Barrel sample. Bright, rich and fruity with a tropical pineapple and peach feel, this wine shows signs of wood aging while keeping its pure, fruity character. Ripe and full.
Name: Château Olivier 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92–94. Barrel sample. Warm, ripe, fruity and opulent, this wine has remarkable weight. Very rounded and rich on the palate, it boasts ripe apricot and dried peach flavor and a touch of pepper that reveals its alcohol.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91–93. Barrel sample. This is a ripe, full-bodied wine with rich apricot flavor accented with bright acidity and notes of ginger. A finely balanced wine that finishes on a lovely green-plum note.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91–93. Barrel sample. With no sweet Sauternes made at Suduiraut in 2012, this wine was produced along with a second-label sweet wine. While this is dry, there is a warm, almost honeyed character that comes from apricot and peach flavors. Deliciously ripe.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2012 S de Suduiraut Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 91–93. Barrel sample. Fragrant aromas mark this almost delicate wine. While it does have richness and a full textured character, it's the lively acidity and crispness that gives it great elegance.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2012 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: This has ebullient aromas of cherry blossom, grapefruit and yuzu peel. Structurally complex, this has concentrated flavors of sour plum and pink grapefruit. It's brisk with acidity, and there's a lavish minerality that lingers long on the finish.
Name: Movia 2007 Veliko White (Brda)

Description: 91–93. Barrel sample. This full bodied wine is soft and warm in style, yet exhibits some crisp, fresh fruitiness and minerality behind it's ripe, rich profile.
Name: Château Haut-Bergey 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91–93. Barrel sample. This citrus-inflected wine is full of ripe Sauvignon Blanc character. It's fresh in style, but shows richness and a mineral edge as well.
Name: Château Ferrande 2012 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: 91–93. Barrel sample. Powerful and intense, this is a wine that's full of sweet and honeyed flavors. It has great power and concentration, and is packed with smooth peach and dried apricot flavors.
Name: Château Broustet 2012 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 91–93. Barrel sample. Spice and ripe fruits meld together wonderfully in this delicious, fruity wine. It has an edge of acidity and hints of oak that add extra complexity.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91–93. Barrel sample. A ripe wine with great freshness at the same time. The palate is concentrated, attractively rich and ripe. It has weight and delicious tropical fruits with smooth dollops of honey.
Name: Château de Malle 2012 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 91–93. Barrel sample. A very ripe, spicy wine, this has a warm, rounded character highlighted by wood aging. It has a very full, Burgundian feel to it, with just a suggestion of Sauvignon acidity on the finish.
Name: Château Picque Caillou 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90–92. Barrel sample. This is a ripe, rounded wine with weight and a full mouthfeel. It's smooth on the palate with pear flavor accented with spice, ginger and soft acidity.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90–92. Barrel sample. This is an herbaceous, cool wine that shows fresh pear and lime flavor. It does have a sense of structure that gives density and texture on the finish.
Name: Château Rahoul 2012 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: 90–92. Barrel sample. This ripe and spicy wine is full of rich fruits. The palate is full bodied and dense, but edged with a fine texture. It finishes warm and opulent.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Hints of sweet pastry and rising bread entice on this refreshing, dry, yet honeyed sparkling wine made from Tokaj grape varieties. It's brisk on the palate, with a clean cut, but it has all of the waxy, floral qualities of a sweet Tokaj wine. Fantastic now, but it could be even more glorious with five more years in the cellar.
Name: Királyudvar 2009 Pezsgo Henye Brut Tokaji (Tokaj)

Description: 90–92. Barrel sample. This second white wine of Haut-Brion has herbaceous aromas, followed by spice, ginger and a touch of green fruits and orange zest.
Designation: Le Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2012 Le Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90–92. Barrel sample. A rich and smooth wine with delicious sweetness, great acidity and good balance. The wine has weight, orange marmalade and spice, and bright acidity on the finish.
Name: Château Guiraud 2012 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 90–92. Barrel sample. This is a rich wine with a dense texture and concentrated, opulent and ripe tropical and dried-fruit flavors. It misses some of that dry, botrytized character often found in Bordeaux, but it's just as much sweet as it is textured.
Name: Château Coutet 2012 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 90–92. Barrel sample. Herbaceous as well as rich, this wine is spicy and ripe in feel as a result of wood ageing. The palate boasts lemon, pear and apricot flavors, with a fine texture at the end.
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2012 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: 90–92. Barrel sample. Attractive and fruity, a wine that has soft texture with light touches of botrytis. It's warm and rich, with a fine final texture of dryness and acidity.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2012 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Meditazione bursts out of the glass with a musky, vanilla-spice character that permeates the nose and palate. Fermented in oak with extended skin contact, this is an amber-hued wine that has bold, tea-leaf-like tannins and a gorgeous acidic edge. It's a fascinating effort to be enjoyed over the course of a long, meditative evening.
Name: Channing Daughters 2009 Meditazione White (Long Island)

Description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. An herbaceous wine with lively acidity, green plum and grapefruit flavors. It's a Sauvignon Blanc driven wine, showing great freshness rounded out with a touch of tropical fruits.
Name: Château la Garde 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90–92. Barrel sample. With some sumptuous texture and fruits, this is a full and ripe wine. It has a ripe, rich character, and is quite forward and fruity.
Name: Château Romer 2012 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89–91. Barrel sample. The wine has good acidity with a spirited character. It's bright and full with tropical fruits that are rounded and fruity in character. The texture is soft—a gentle ramble around Sauternes—and likely to be an early-developing wine.
Name: Château Rabaud-Promis 2012 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89–91. Barrel sample. This is a delicious, spicy wine that glories in its peach and pear flavors. Opulent in style, the wine is ripe and rounded with just a twist of grapefruit acidity.
Name: Le Nardian 2012 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromatically intense, with notes of dried peach, orange cream and vanilla, this blend of Chardonnay, Gewürztraminer and Malvasia aims to push the envelope with its rich, almost-fluffy texture, and its penetrating red-berry, stone-fruit and citrus flavors. The grapes were crushed by foot, and skin contact was employed during fermentation. This is a decadent, unusual, oak-aged orange wine.
Name: Channing Daughters 2009 Envelope White (Long Island)

Description: 89–91. Barrel sample. Powerful and concentrated, this is a wine with incredible richness without great botrytis character. It's fruity with peach and orange-marmalade flavors showing lively acidity as well as a good structure.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2012 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89–91. Barrel sample. From the northern Médoc vineyard of Goulée, this spicy, cool wine has a touch of green as well as fresh fruit. It's textured with a salty, herbaceous feel.
Name: Château Cos d'Estournel 2012 Blanc d'Estournel Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Orange blossom, apricot and honey notes give the bouquet an opulent edge. On the palate, it's a wave of lush peach, apricot and honey flavors, finished with a delicate spice note. This will pair with everything from poultry to ethnic cuisine to fruit salad.
Name: Estate Biblia Chora 2010 Ovilos White (Pangeon)

Description: 88–90. Barrel sample. This is an herbaceous wine that's very crisp and citrusy. Pear and spice flavors add a warmer element, while the aftertaste has a mineral texture.
Name: Château Mouton Rothschild 2012 Aile d'Argent Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: There's a hint of violet perfume that permeates this dry yet honeyed wine. The palate is fruity, with abundant ripe cherry and grapefruit flavors, and layers of crushed chalk and stone lend a minerally complexity that builds on the midpalate.
Name: Château Musar 2011 Musar Jeune White (Bekaa Valley)

Description: 88–90. Barrel sample. There's ample and bright acidity on this attractive, fruity wine. It only has a hint of botrytis, yielding a palate that is lightly sweet and gently honeyed.
Name: Château Nairac 2012 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 88–90. Barrel sample. A full wine, on the dry side, showing its sweetness more through its richness. It has the character of a late-harvest wine, but it's structured and almost dry in character.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2012 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 88–90. Barrel sample. This wine is light, fruity and golden in color, with attractive acidity and soft hints of botrytis. The wine shows peach and ripe apricot flavors.
Name: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2012 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 88–90. Barrel sample. Hedgerow aromas and herbal flavors open a wine that is lightly fruity and soft in texture. There is only the lightest touch of botrytis evident.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2012 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 88–90. Barrel sample. Green, herbal aromas are dominant here. The wine has a crisp character, showing Sauvignon strongly. Finishes with a very green aftertaste.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: This white has a curvy character, with heady fruit and citrus aromas and an interplay of rich exotic fruit flavors and bright acidity. Balanced and original, this exhibits the fruit and mineral combination that Greek whites do so well.
Name: Estate Biblia Chora 2011 White (Pangeon)

Description: An alluring nose of citrus, pineapple and peach notes leads this elegant white. Fresh, flavorful and exotic, the wine offers citrus and lush fruit flavors, with a spin of acid for balance. This is very good on its own, but it will also pair well with poultry, grilled seafood or spicy dishes.
Name: Pavlidis 2011 Thema White (Drama)

Description: Intensely aromatic, this has scents of honey, caramel and dried savory herbs. It is a penetrating Tokaj that has a herbaceous tone. The palate is rich and creamy, and it offers characteristic flavors of tropical fruit, beeswax and flower, swathed by hints of lavender and sage.
Name: Château Hellha 2007 5 Puttonyos Aszú  (Tokaji)

Description: The Riesling and Gewürztraminer grapes used to make this Alsace-like blend were harvested late to allow for concentrated sweetness. It has a perfumed character and a steely edge of acidity. The finish hints at honey, and it has a crisp texture.
Name: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2011 Late Harvest White (Tejo)

Description: A nose of peach, spice and citrus notes leads this light and lively white made from Roditis and Sauvignon Blanc. Lean but likeable, it offers a lemon overtone on the palate and a fresh, spicy finish. Pair it with grilled seafood, Thai dishes or cold chicken salads.
Name: Estate Constantin Gofas 2011 Mythic River Sauvignon-Roditis White (Corinth)

Description: Floral, fresh and delicate fruit aromas are followed by rich citrus, white fruit and flower flavors. This is full bodied yet elegant, with a feminine edge. Pair it with Indian or Thai dishes.
Name: Gerovassiliou 2011 White (Epanomi)

Description: 86–88. Barrel sample. With a chemical aroma, this is a strange wine initially. It has some fruitiness, peach and spice flavors, but is soft with an almond and bitter aftertaste.
Name: Château Suau 2012 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: This off-dry, honeyed Tokaj wine has a penetrating minerality that extends from start to finish, with aromas of honeysuckle and fresh tangerine skin. Slightly dusty on the palate, it shows hints of dried herb and crushed stone, and it finishes on a delicate flower tone.
Name: Château Hellha 2002 3 Puttonyos Aszú  (Tokaji)

Description: There are dark veins of smoke and flint that highlight the rippling minerality in this fascinating Lebanese white. It's made in a deliberately oxididative style, and it offers a slight baked-apple flavor that slowly opens to reveal fresh citrus and honeysuckle notes. It's not for everyone, but it's a fascinating wine to enjoy over a long meal.
Name: Château Musar 2005 Gaston Hochar White (Bekaa Valley)

Description: A blend of 70% Gros Manseng and 30% Petit Manseng, this is a serious, full-bodied wine that's rich and concentrated. It has weight, ripe quince and green plum flavors, and strong herb and honey elements. It is ready to drink, although it should last up to a year.
Name: Domaine Cauhapé 2010 Sève d'Automne  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: A blend of Gros Manseng and Camarelet, this fruity effort is packed with flavors of apricot and peach, plus a rich, exotic mango twist. Delicious to drink now.
Name: Domaine Cauhapé 2011 Chante des Vignes  (Jurançon Sec)

Description: An opulent wine, this shows the beautiful, ripe fruit of 2010. Packed with apricot, white peach and white fig flavors, this full-bodied blend of Petit Manseng and Gros Manseng also has a honeyed touch.
Name: Château Jolys 2010 Cuvée Pauline  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: With richness and alcohol similar to some California Chardonnays, this is a far cry from the more elegant whites of the region. A blockbuster selection, this is packed with yellow fruit and herb flavors, showing fine concentration and depth of flavor. Ready to drink, but it will age for 3–4 years.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2010 Anthlogia de Conti White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: This blend of Petit Manseng and Gros Manseng shows fresh apricot fruit, with delicate acidity and nervy texture. It's not for aging, so drink it now.
Name: Domaine Bru-Baché 2005 Les Casterasses  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: The white wine at Montus is a blend of many of the local grapes, including the rare Petit Courbu. It has a herbaceous character that's broadened with toast and lively acidity. Finely perfumed and rich, it has an apple- and quince-flavored finish.
Name: Alain Brumont 2009 Château Montus Blanc  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Description: This is structured and textured, with white fruit flavors complemented by almond and mineral notes, along with some toast from having aged in wood. Concentrated and edgy, this needs to age for another two years.
Name: Domaine Rotier 2010 Renaissance White (Gaillac)

Description: This is a lightly sweet wine, with a soft hint of honey. It shows peach and mango flavors, along with a round texture from the superripe late-harvest grapes. The finish is fresh and crisp.
Name: Domaine Cauhapé 2010 Ballet d'Octobre  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This is a first-rate Oregon Pinot Gris made with fruit sourced from the Methven Vineyard. Crisp and steely, it's a mix of cucumber and honeydew melon fruit, with bracing acidity and excellent length.
Name: Eight Bells 2011 Ravenna White (Oregon)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A blend of 54% Pinot Noir and 46% Chardonnay, this sings a strawberry-tinged note on the palate. It's enveloped by flowery aromas of rose perfume. It's round and easy to drink, and the finish is quick but satisfying.
Name: Scharffenberger NV Brut Rosé Excellence Pinot-Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

Description: This wood-aged wine has richness, toastiness and a concentration of pink grapefruit and fresh kiwi flavors. It's full and it shows some herbaceousness. It needs to age for 3–4 years.
Designation: La Source du Château de Sours
Name: Château de Sours 2010 La Source du Château de Sours  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This attractive blend of 53% Sémillon and 47% Riesling offers a bouquet of petrol and apricot, while the palate is lively, with honeyed flavors of caramel, vanilla and apricot. It's a bit sticky on the finish, but overall this is an eye-opener. Drink now–2015.
Name: Santa Monica 2004 Late Harvest White (Rapel Valley)

Description: Exhibiting all the richness of the vintage, this is a round, ripe, spicy wine. It has a full, warm, creamy feel, with notes of almonds and ripe peaches. Only on the finish does the suggestion of white Bergerac's characteristic herbaceousness show.
Name: Château Thénac 2009 Fleur du Périgord White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: This is full of crisp, herbaceous flavors of apple, grapefruit and lime. It has weight and concentration, with some richness to its freshness. Acidity cuts through on the finish. Age this for 2–3 years.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2011 Cuvée des Contis White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: The intense herbaceous aroma is softened on the palate by the wine's lemon-curd flavor and smooth texture. Rich with intense fruitiness, this has notes of black currant and pink grapefruit, with bright acidity on the finish.
Name: Château Thénac 2011 Fleur du Périgord White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: This wine is named after a windmill on the Conti family property. It is rich, with a spicy new-wood flavor. While it has plenty of structure, the acidity is subdued.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2010 Moulin des Dames White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: This is a full-bodied, rich and fruity wine. It has a smooth texture that's embellished with flavors of apricots and green plums. The finish has a tangy, minerally edge.
Designation: Clos Triguedina Le Sec du Clos
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2010 Clos Triguedina Le Sec du Clos Chardonnay-Viognier (Comté Tolosan)

Description: This is herbaceous, but it also has a ripe yellow-fruit character. It is fresh and crisp, with a great depth of flavor. Its bright acidity and tight-textured finish make this a food wine.
Name: Château Laulerie 2010 Comtesse de Ségur  (Montravel)

Description: A crisp and fruity blend of the herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc and the creamy Loin de l'Oeil, this has apple and grapefruit flavors. It has a bright feel, with a hint of mineral on the finish.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2011 Château Baron White (Gaillac)

Description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Loin de l'Oeil, this is ripe, fruity and perfumed. It has an attractive floral character, with flavors of toast and hedgerow. It's ready to drink, but it could age.
Name: Domaine du Moulin 2010 Blanc Sec Vieilles Vignes White (Gaillac)

Description: This is a punchy wine that's fresh on the nose. The palate sports a viscous feel that's related to Viognier and Chardonnay, while the Sauvignon Blanc and Sauvignon Gris in the blend bring a citrus-like quality and an asparagus flavor.  The finish quickly loses steam.
Name: Casa Silva 2010 Quinta Generación White (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Smooth and rich, this 50-50 blend of Gros Manseng and Petit Manseng has ripe flavors of peach and kiwi that are layered with acidity and hints of herb and honey. It's fruity, but it also shows a mineral-driven structure.
Name: Château de Jurque 2011 Fantaisie  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: Using fruit sourced from vineyards close to Cahors, this is a rich, soft, tropical-fruit-flavored wine that shows how the Mediterranean influence reaches this inland area. It is rich, with notes of apricot, green plum and mango. Ready to drink.
Name: Château de Cénac 2011 Albatros Chardonnay-Viognier (Lot)

Description: The applesauce and tropical aromas are clean, and the palate feels tangy, with a cirtusy pop. Flavorwise, there's citrus pith, lime, papaya and banana notes that reflect both the soft Viognier and the zesty Sauvignon Blanc. Crisp and chalky on the finish.
Name: Junta 2011 Reserve Viognier-Sauvignon Blanc White (Curicó Valley)

Description: A creamed apple aroma is followed by a creamy palate. It has tight acidity that lends brightness and freshness, with a crisp, fruity finish.
Name: Château Jolys 2011  Jurançon Sec

Description: The Sauvignon Blanc in this three-grape blend dominates, creating aromas of canned peas and nettles. In the mouth, it's round, smooth and just citrusy enough, with a grassy flavor that's mixed with melon and peach notes. It feels round and solid on the finish. Additions of Chardonnay and Viognier fill out the blend.
Name: Estampa 2011 Reserve Assemblage Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Viognier White (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This is properly fresh and fruity, with delicious herb and ripe apricot notes. Light, refreshing and crisp, this is ready to drink.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2011 Pigmentum Ugni Blanc-Colombard (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Herbaceous and fruity, this has a textured character, with an orange zest note and a strong lemon juiciness. It's fresh and ready to drink, but it will likely age for a few years.
Name: Château Marac 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Notes of bitter almond and fresh citrus come together in this fruity selection. It's bright, crisp and lightly herbaceous, with a pineapple flavor. Ready to drink now.
Name: Château de Sours 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: White flower, lychee and apple aromas carry the mellow bouquet. The chunky-feeling palate bears powdery, sweet flavors of peach and melon, mixed with greener notes of grass and lime. The 80% Viognier component is typical of the warm climate: plump and oily, with a short finish. Chardonnay fills out the blend.
Name: Estampa 2011 Estate Viognier-Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Fruity and lightly herbaceous, this has fine textured acidity along with a pink grapefruit flavor. The wine is bright and easy, and it will be ready to drink in a few months.
Name: Château de Sours 2011 La Fleur d'Amélie  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A soft, honeyed wine, this has hints of botrytis, orange marmalade and a spicy touch. Ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine du Moulin-Pouzay 2010  Monbazillac

Description: Similar in style to a Côtes de Gascogne, this is a fruity, ripe and attractively light wine. The crisp, refreshing palate dances along.
Name: Baron d'Arignac 2011 White (Gers)

Description: Light, fruity and herbaceous, this has a crisp grapefruit flavor, laced with lemon. Soft and fresh, this is ready to drink now.
Name: Château Laulerie 2011 White (Bergerac Sec)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: After a sugary start, this thin and simple wine turns a bit sour. The blend is a mix of Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Deer Creek 2011 Bella's Sunshine White (Rogue Valley)

Description: The new-wood smokiness is an important element of this creamy-textured wine. The richness bares flavors of honey, botrytis, almond and orange peel. Ripe and age worthy, this wine's opulence is just beginning to show.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2009  Sauternes

Description: The superb palate boasts richness, with honey and orange zest notes. It shows fine balance between the flavors of orange jelly and the intense botrytis-driven notes. It has a light, delicate texture and acidity.
Name: Château Climens 2009  Barsac

Description: This closed, reticent wine promises to pack a rich, generous punch in the future. Its potential shows in the botrytis flavor and the touches of smoky wood and apricot jelly. With this leashed power, it promises to be a very fine wine.
Name: Château Rieussec 2009  Sauternes

Description: This is rich, exuding delicious sweetness, with a core of dense botrytis. An opulent, ripe apricot flavor accompanies the bittersweet orange and mirabelle fruit notes. The acidity, sweetness and concentration promise a great future for this wine.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2009  Sauternes

Description: A lemon zest flavor cuts through this delicate wine. It has lively sweetness and flavors of lemon curd and bitter orange that lace the note of honey. There is much more concentration to come in the future.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2009  Sauternes

Description: In this concentrated wine, an opulent botrytis character dominates. Notes of yellow and citrus fruits combine with a lemon-flavored honey accent to produce a wine that has both richness and intense acidity. It needs to age.
Name: Château Nairac 2009  Barsac

Description: This is a smoky, rich wine that shows evident wood aging. This feature adds weight, though the sweetness is currently muted. It is a wine with potential intensity; the fruit and acidity will emerge in several years.
Name: Château Guiraud 2009  Sauternes

Description: This powerful, rich wine is densely packed with sweetness and citrus flavors. Honey and lemon notes combine with a dry core of botrytis, offering intensity and a complex sweet-and-sour finish.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2009  Sauternes

Description: Dense and rich, this wine has concentrated flavors of botrytis and floral honey. The wine gives the impression of sweetness, with balancing acidity and a core of dryness. Weighty and dense, it's likely to age.
Name: Château Coutet 2009  Barsac

Description: Superbly ripe, this wine shows upfront botrytis and honey flavors. At its core, it bears opulence, with depth and concentration. The open character of the wine is shot through with lemon and orange zest flavors.
Name: Château de Malle 2009  Sauternes

Description: This is packed with botrytis, expressing richness rather than pure sweetness. With its citrus and apricot flavors, this is a complex wine, with the structure lending the palate weight.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2009  Sauternes

Description: Gold in color, this is a wine with notes of spice, rich fruit and honey, which are all surrounded by intense botrytis. This is a wine that has great aging potential, and its superripeness develops slowly on the palate.
Name: Château Lamothe Guignard 2009  Sauternes

Description: This wine is still very closed. That said, its promise is in the rich, weighty texture. It shows a ripe feel, with orange and lemon freshness. On the finish, the acidity is dominant.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2009  Sauternes

Description: Quite closed up, this wine has weight and intensity that will give concentration to the potentially ripe flavors of apricots, mandarin oranges and a twist of lemon zest. All of these flavors are integrated with the developing honeyed richness.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2009  Sauternes

Description: This ripe wine's delicious sweetness comes from the delicious honey, ripe apricot and mango flavors. Delicate acidity is balanced against these notes, giving the palate a citrusy edge.
Name: Château Filhot 2009  Sauternes

Description: Here's a rich wine that is developing slowly and surely. It holds back on the botrytis character, with a bitter orange note that gives a dry edge to the wine's sweetness. The finish shows acidity and a taut line of citrus.
Name: Château de Myrat 2009  Barsac

Description: At this stage, strong wood-influenced flavors dominate the fruit of this smooth-textured wine. It has the weight to stand up to the wood, so expect this wine to develop into a rich, creamy, lightly spicy wine in 2–3 years.
Name: Château Turcaud 2011 Cuvée Majeure  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This spicy wine is produced by the Mau family. It has an attractive cinnamon element, a touch of toast, and a concentrated texture that brings out a tropical fruit character. Rich and perfumed, this has a great note of ginger snap on the finish.
Name: Château Ducla 2011 Experience  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A fresh and aromatic bouquet sets off this light, dancing style of wine. It has acidity and a lemon curd flavor, proving to be sweet and citrusy at the same time. It's developing well.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2009  Barsac

Description: This features a light touch of acidity and a lemon note. It is still developing, with a ripe background of yellow fruit and orange jelly still to show. The finish shows the delicate side of the wine.
Name: Château Lamothe 2009  Sauternes

Description: This is a ripe, wood-aged wine, with its smooth texture softening the natural herbaceous exuberance of young Sauvignon and Sémillon. Juicy and laced with citrus and gooseberry notes, it also has a touch of toast that adds good richness and gravity. Age for 3–4 years for maximum effect.
Name: Château du Seuil 2010  Graves

Description: Kissed generously by spicy wood, this is a smooth, ripe wine. It has some concentrated apricot and peppered pear flavors, along with a rich, toasty finish. Age 2–3 years.
Name: Château Lestrille Capmartin 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Ripe and luscious, this is made almost entirely from Sémillon. Its rich texture is packed with flavors of honeyed apricots and sultanas. A hint of toast is fully absorbed into this intensely sweet wine, and the final citrusy edge adds a fine, contrasting point.
Designation: Château Latrezotte La Sauternes de Ma Fille
Name: Bernard Magrez 2010 Château Latrezotte La Sauternes de Ma Fille  (Sauternes)

Description: This is going to be a dense wine. It has a delicious touch, with a lemon-driven mouthfeel. It shows a fine balance of sweetness and freshness.
Name: Château Suau 2009  Barsac

Description: Rich and fruity, this has fine red-currant and quince fruit. It's full in the mouth, concentrated, perfumed and mineral driven. Worth aging a few months. Screwcap.
Name: Château des Gravières 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is attractive, ripe and perfumed, with white currant and quince flavors that accompany the smooth and round texture. There is a sense of toastiness from the vinification, which provides a spicy, rich finish.
Name: Château la Freynelle 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A fresh yet spicy wine, this is rich and toasty, showing a strongly zingy texture. With its notes of citrus, spiced apricot and its fresh acidity, this could age for several more months.
Name: Château de la Vieille Tour 2010 Heritage  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Caleb Foster keeps adding more and more Muscadelle to this blend, always with a keen sense of balance and proportion. This remains tight and tart, with a tangy mix of lemon, grapefruit and pineapple flavors. It's a precise, high-acid, highwire act from a cool vintage.
Name: Buty 2011 60% Sémillon-19% Sauvignon-21% Muscadelle White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With a tropical fruit aroma of pineapple juice and a touch of spice, this is an attractive, fragrant wine. It has good balancing acidity to accompany the fruitiness, making for an ultimately lively and crisp effort.
Name: Cheval Quancard 2011 Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Textured yet full bodied, this is a rich wine from a small 17-acre estate. The toast note shows strongly, but it's still in balance, resulting in yeast and croissant flavors as well as tropical fruits. For aging over the next 2–3 years.
Name: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2010 Cuvée Passion  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: With its smooth combination of toast and yellow fruit notes, this goes beyond the typical herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc character. It's a wine wine that is full and serious, deserving to be aged for at least three years.
Name: Château du Seuil 2011  Graves

Description: A rare white wine from Saint-Émilion vineyards, this is seriously wood-aged, showing mature toast and almond flavors, with a citrusy edge. It has weight and richness, gradually revealing peach and apricot notes while merely hinting at acidity.
Name: Château Fombrauge 2006 Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: With a rich mouthfeel, this is creamy, textured, concentrated and full of fruit. Ripe yellow fruits are well balanced with the citrus-driven character. It should age for another year.
Name: Château Lauduc 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Under control on the bouquet, this has pear and apple aromas. The wine feels round, juicy and pure, with oak, toast, lemon, apple and spice flavors. Barrel influence creates a peppery, dry and spicy finish, and overall this blend of Viura and Malvasia is on the money. Drink now.
Name: Finca Allende 2010 Allende White (Rioja)

Description: This fruity, wood-aged wine has plenty of potential. Its stone fruit flavors are full and rich, a contrast to the herbaceous edge. A smooth texture is just showing through. Keep for 2–3 years.
Name: Château Haut Selve 2011  Graves

Description: This is a full-bodied wine with a rich texture. It has a creamy character, along with flavors of almond, toast and ripe green plum. Worth aging a year.
Name: Château Hoste-Blanc 2011 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Smooth and creamy, this shows touches of wood aging and flavors of ripe apple and peach. The toast brings out an attractive spiciness, leaving a complex, fruity finish.
Name: Château Penin 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Ripe, spicy tropical fruits give this wine a rich feel. There is a touch of caramel along with pineapple and apricot flavors. It is full bodied and structured, with a finish that shows acidity and a streak of nutmeg.
Name: Château de Lugagnac 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Strong lime and lemon zest flavors dominate this attractive, zingy wine. It has a strong texture that brings out the acidity and citrus flavors. It remains bright and crisp on the finish.
Name: Château Haut Mondain 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This very herbaceous wine shows almond, toast and a rich texture. The wine has a creamy feel, ripe in the mouth while retaining grapefruit-driven freshness at the end.
Name: Château d'Argadens 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine is quiet on the nose, with light touches of toasty resin and butter. It's Burgundian in feel, with plump, fleshy fruit that accompanies resiny, spicy flavors of white fruit and citrus. Notes of wood and resin dominate the finish on this chunky, full-bodied Viura (with 8% Malvasia).
Name: Bodegas Palacio 2009 Cosme Palacio 1894 Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: Attractively fresh and herbaceous, this is a bright and fruity wine. It has flavors of red currant and grapefruit, plus a hint of gooseberry. Full and crisp, it's a wine to drink soon.
Name: Château Fayau 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Round and rich, this is packed with pear and apricot flavors, producing a full-bodied character. It has weight and a citrusy edge of acidity, with a soft, ripe finish.
Name: Château Lamothe de Haux 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Rich and round, this wine shows the natural herbaceous character of the Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon blend. Tamed by a warm, fat, generous feel, this has the density and structure to make it a great match for food.
Name: Château Larroque 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Catty and herbaceous, this wine is as crisp and fresh as can be. Bright and lively, it is close to resembling the New Zealand style.
Name: Château Lynch-Bages 2011 Blanc de Lynch Bages  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This rich, ripe and fruity wine features white fruits, a soft texture and balanced acidity. With the rounded texture, it feels warm, though the Sauvignon Blanc also provides the essential herbaceous edge. Age for a few months.
Name: Château les Arromans 2011  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This is a youthful, mineral-driven Sauvignon Blanc, with gooseberry and herb notes. The texture is still young and tight, and it needs a few more months to open generously, yet it's already showing an attractive, refreshing fruitiness.
Name: Château Beauregard-Ducourt 2011  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This full-bodied wine is richly endowed with flavors of red currants and green plums, with an orange-zest-like texture. It's all fruit, with a zingy feel. This would make for a great bright apéritif or food pairing wine.
Name: Château Roquefort 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This fine, oily-textured wine strikes a good balance between an herbaceous character and a firm, mineral texture. A touch of spice adds further interest on the finish.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2011  Graves

Description: Full bodied and rich, this has flavors of apple and lemon, with a warm and ripe feel that is balanced by a final mineral character. It needs several months to come together.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2011 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This round wine features flavors of tropical fruit and apricot, combined with a mineral-driven texture. It is rich yet it retains a good touch of brightness. Ready to drink, but worth aging for a few months.
Name: Château La Maroutine 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Soft and rich, this is a fruity and textured wine. It has strong pear and spice flavors that complement the edge of lemon zest. This combination results in a wine that is bright and fruity. Screwcap.
Name: Château Bel Air Perponcher 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is an attractive, relatively light Sauternes. It has a fine botrytis character that's already well integrated with the orange peel and honey flavors. Not for aging; ready to drink.
Name: Château Gravas 2010  Sauternes

Description: Deliciously crisp, this wine expresses herbaceous fruit, with weight and richness. Full of lime, gooseberry and grapefruit flavors, this is a taut wine that's likely to soften.
Name: Château la Grande Métaire 2011 Cuvée la Chapelle  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: Bright crisp, and light, this is a fruity, perfumed wine, with strong touches of grapefruit and gooseberry. It's a straightforward wine—all fruit and freshness.
Name: Château Montet 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Yellow fruit and honey aromas give this wine a fine, perfumed start. The palate is sweet, with an edge of boytrytis. Fragrant honey and peach flavors come with a line of acidity.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2010  Sauternes

Description: Bright and crisp, this is a fruity wine that's full of citrus and red currant flavors. It has a fine tangy texture that brings out the freshness. Ready to drink as a fine apéritif.
Name: Cheval Quancard 2011 Chai de Bordes  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This attractive, ripe, yellow- and white-fruited wine achieves a fine balance between acidity and full herbaceous-fruit flavors. It has a crisp texture and a touch of minerality. The finish is bright and lively.
Name: Château La Rose du Pin 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Richly herbaceous, this wine balances crisp fruit flavors with a creamy texture. Rounded, it shows ripe fruits as well as tight acidity. Age it for a few months.
Name: Château Ballan-Larquette 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a tasty blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Gris and Sémillon, with a delightful spice note and a crisply defined tree-fruit flavor. Notes of pear, apple, cinnamon and some tartness add up to a wine that is pleasurable on its own, and versatile enough for a wide variety of cheeses, seafoods and poultry.
Name: 14 Hands 2011 Hot To Trot White (Washington)

Description: Tight, crisp and mineral driven, this wine has citrus fruits and a steely texture, demonstrating that it needs to age for a year.
Name: Château de Bonhoste 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Very herbaceous and fruity, this has gooseberry, lime and pink grapefruit flavors. It's a light, bright and attractive, and it will be ready to drink in a few months.
Name: Château La Mothe du Barry 2011  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This mineral-driven and white-currant-flavored wine shows as much texture as fruitiness. In the future, it will show ripe yellow and pear notes, so age for a year.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Crisp, clean and fruity, this refreshing wine has an herb note that's restrained by ripe orange and green apple flavors. Bright and ready to drink.
Name: Château de Fontenille 2011  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Dusty apple and white peach aromas are basic and clean. The palate offers bright acids, citrus-driven fruit and whacks of oak-based cinnamon and resin, along with laser-like lemon notes. Mild on the finish, with flavors of vanilla and oak spice.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2010 Organza White (Rioja)

Description: Spicy wood aromas make this an attractive wine. It has nutmeg and pear flavors, livened by crisp acidity and a touch of herbaceousness.
Name: Cheval Quancard 2011 Cuvée Clémence  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: Although this wine is entering its late stages of freshness, the bouquet is nice and tropical smelling. The palate maintains its vitality, even if it's a bit oily in texture, while the flavors of lychee, melon and apple are good.
Name: Trivento 2011 Amado Sur White (Mendoza)

Description: Wobbly aromas of vanilla wafer and tropical fruit aren't fully convincing. The palate, however, crackles with a tangy lemon flavor, a vanilla infusion and a chalky- textured finish. Drink this blend of 70% Albariño and 15% each Treixadura and Loureira right away.
Name: Marqués de Vizhoja 2011 Señor da Folla Verde Albariño-Treixadura-Loureira White (Rías Baixas)

Description: In this soft wine, a herbaceous character evolves into ripe yellow- and white-fruit flavors. It's crisp and clean, yet it has a soft texture that's full and rich. It is not for aging and will be ready in six months. Screwcap.
Name: Château l'Avocat 2011  Graves

Description: This is a bright, citrus-laden wine, with a light texture that balances the tangy, nervy, minerally edge. This needs a few months to bring out the full fruit character.
Name: Chateau Couronneau 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This attractive, crisp wine is full of apple and lime flavors and laced with a soft pear character. It's very fruity and bright, showing some minerality in its texture. Clean and crisp on the finish.
Name: Château Timberlay 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A rich and ripe wine, this is full of herb and gooseberry flavors. The feel is cool, crisp, lightly perfumed and bright.
Name: Château la Verrière 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This soft wine feels fat and misses its fruitiness. It balances a food-friendly texture that brings out richness and weightiness. A wine that shows the sun.
Name: Château Coustaut la Grangeotte 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: An earthy, full-bodied wine, this has ripe peach and lime flavors. Sulfur unattractively makes a strong appearance; as the wine was just bottled, this feature may disappear in a few months.
Name: Château Tanesse 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine smells a bit soapy, with citrusy aromas. It feels level, solid and soft, with melon, sweet pear and candied papaya flavors. It finishes sweet, as if a teaspoon of powdered sugar were part of the equation. A friendly but simple white wine made of 85% Torrontés and 15% Riesling.
Name: Amalaya 2011 Esperanza por un Milagro Torrontés-Riesling White (Calchaquí Valley)

Description: This fruity wine is produced by négociant Solvex Woltner. It has a fine herbaceous touch that accompanies a creamy pear flavor and bright, tangy acidity. The texture is soft, finishing on a crisp note.
Name: Baron la Rose 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Talcum powder and apple aromas accompany a big whiff of resinous oak. On the palate, it's tropical in both feel and flavors, with plenty of weight and aggressive tastes of pineapple and mango. Feels a bit sticky and not quite precise, with a chunky finish.
Name: Finca Agostino 2010 Reserva Chardonnay-Viognier (Mendoza)

Description: Herbaceous in character, this also shows a creamy edge. Notes of ripe apples blend with touches of citrus fruits. A yeasty note spoils the purity of the fruit, but it's likely to disappear as the wine ages for a few months.
Name: Château des Perligues 2011  Graves

Description: In this lightly fruity wine, apples and citrus flavors come with a bright, crisp character. Ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Despagne 2011 Eclat  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Flowery and easygoing on the bouquet, this is taught, lemony and wiry on the palate. Flavors of gooseberry, lime and apple feature cleansing acids and a persistent, citrusy tang. A blend of 80% Xarel-lo and 20% Riesling.
Name: Terraprima 2011 Massís del Garraf White (Penedès)

Description: A crisp, bright and fruity wine, this has a perfumed character that highlights the edgy fruit texture and attractive acidity. Ready to drink now.
Name: Château de la Vieille Tour 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Once you get past the sulfur aroma, this wine shows some richness, offering a melon note that's cut through with lemony acidity. It's now ready to drink.
Name: Château Toumilon 2009  Graves

Description: This herbaceous wine has a steely edge to its citrus and apple flavors. Exuberant and fragrant, this has a crisp texture that jumps out of the glass.
Name: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Here's a soft, round wine with a caramel character. It feels heavy, expressing hints of apricot and mango. Screwcap.
Name: Château Recougne 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A very herbaceous character makes this wine seem rather thin. It's soft and lightweight, and the lemon zest character is mildly attractive. Ready to drink.
Name: Château de Virecourt 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This blend of 60% Xarel-lo and 40% Chardonnay deals notes of petrol, yeast and powdered sugar on the bouquet. It's acidic and citric in feel, with lime, tart apple and other green-leaning flavors. Feels watery and tangy on the finish.
Designation: Petit Albet Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay-Xarel-lo
Name: Albet I Noya 2011 Petit Albet Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay-Xarel-lo White (Penedès)

Description: This light and fruity effort has some crisp acidity and simple apple and pear flavors. Drink now.
Name: Château Thieuley 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This is a soft, rather unfocused, open-textured wine that shows apple and citrus flavors. It's ready to drink now.
Name: Château Briot 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Dominated by notes of tropical fruits and apricots rather than herb flavors, this is a soft and round wine. It is full on the palate and is ready to drink now.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Clean and fruity, this wine is full of ripe pineapple and pear flavors. It is laced with crisp citrusy acidity, which produces a light, forward, fresh feel.
Name: Château Marac 2011 Grande Tradition  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This soft, gentle, lightly juicy wine has a red currant flavor. It's perfumed and full on the palate, but it's missing great definition.
Name: Château de Bel 2011 Aux Plantes  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Soft and somewhat dilute, this wine is attractively crisp but does not show great character. It's a fine apéritif wine, light and gently fruity.
Name: Château de Parenchère 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This yeasty wine has a flat character that misses out on fruitiness. Clean, but dull.
Name: Château Belle Garde 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Almond candy and lacquer aromas create a corny scent on the nose. This wine feels flabby and soggy, with buttery oak and little to no fruit flavor. Finishes woody, with vanilla and spice. A blend of 60% Viura and 40% Chardonnay.
Name: Bodegas Escudero 2009 Becquer White (Rioja)

Description: An unattractive green-herb aroma is followed by a green-pepper- and dill-flavored palate.
Name: Maison Sichel 2010 Sirius  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Torrontés is not known for aging well in the bottle, and this one is almost past its prime. There's some tropicality left on the nose, but it mostly smells sweaty. Flabby on the palate, with an oily, bitter peach-pit flavor.
Name: Finca La Anita 2011 Tonada Torrontés-Chardonnay White (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Styled after the great white wines of Bordeaux, this is fresh and clean, with luscious mixed fruit flavors that emphasize apple and melon. A cooler vintage has produced a wine of low alcohol and real finesse, with a light dusting of toasty oak. Given its impeccable balance, it could be cellared for another 6–8 years.
Name: DeLille 2011 Chaleur Estate Blanc Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a delightfully curious, multifaceted wine that's penetrating with flavors of dried fig, black tea, honey and smoke. A savory wet clay note is interspersed with a note of sweet spice, plus tea-leaf tannins that linger long on the finish.
Name: Kabaj 2006 Amfora White (Goriska Brda)

Description: A blend of 13 different grape varieties, some rare, this is a delicious, honeyed wine, with rich baked apple flavor and crisp acidity, topped with a creamed spice note. Its pure line of citrus provides a lively finish.
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2010 White (Alsace)

Description: This is a blend of Malvasia, Ribolla and Welschriesling that balances flavors of fennel, smoked nut and black tea with delicate orange blossom and apple notes. Luscious, with a slightly waxy texture, it finishes on a sweet cream note.
Name: Sutor 2008 Burja White (Vipavska Dolina)

Description: Notes of burnt caramel, dried date, mocha and fresh savory herb like thyme and bay leaf complement the umami and rancio accents of mushroom and nut, creating a fantastic complexity to the nose and mouth of this aged Rivesaltes. Thick and viscous, it has a heavy character that's marked by prune, caramel sauce and roasted spice on the close.
Name: Laurent de Bescombes Singla 2003 Héritage du Temps White (Rivesaltes)

Description: This fascinating blend of biodynamically farmed Malvasia, Ribolla and Welschriesling balances savory smoke and toasted wood notes with sweet elements of apple, lemon and cream. Fermented with indigenous yeast, it's a richly textured wine with deep complexity.
Name: Burja 2009 Burja Bela White (Vipavska Dolina)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied blend of 65% Sauvignon Blanc and 35% Sémillon doesn't try to hide its Sémillon's boldness. Tasting of lemon, vanilla and ripe peach, this is a combinaton of feminine aromatics and masculine textures, making it exotically intriguing.
Name: Steven Kent 2011 Lola Ghielmetti Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Livermore Valley)

Description: Soft and ripe, smooth and creamy, this has a spicy element here the Pinot Gris in the blend, giving a piquancy to the white fruit flavor. It is warm, rounded and fragrant. Screwcap.
Name: Clément Klur 2011 Gentil de Katz White (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of half Viognier, plus Roussanne and Pinot Gris, this workman-like white wine is firm and tart. A mix of yellow fruit and plenty of fresh acidity make it a versatile pick for a variety of white meats and pastas.
Name: Gård 2011 Lawrence Vineyards Freyja White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Satinela has been on the upswing in recent years as it has become more complex. This vintage smells of lime, mineral and dusty apple. It feels fresh and right for the style, with Bartlett pear, lime and dry spice flavors.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2011 Satinela Medium-Sweet White (Rioja)

Description: This off-dry wine is aromatic and honeyed. It has enough richness to pair with sushi and soy sauce. Screwcap.
Name: Mittnacht Frères 2011 Cuvée Gyotaku White (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A tasty, sweet and sour blend of Chardonnay, Riesling, Viognier and Pinot Gris, this has bountiful fruit flavors of peach and pear. It's a big, forward, generous, though ultimately simple, white wine, with more than a touch of sweetness.
Name: Goose Ridge 2011 g3 White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is an unusual blend of Croatian and international white grapes that's floral and spiced with orange peel and clove note. It's also smoky and savory with tones of dried apple, toast and herb. This is medium bodied, with a slightly viscous richness on the palate.
Name: Bibich 2010 Riserva R5 White (North Dalmatia)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Two-thirds Pinot Gris, the rest a mix of Riesling and Gewürztraminer, this pleasant and fruity white wine can serve many purposes. It's full bodied and fresh, with ripe, round, tangy stone fruit flavor.
Name: Wapato Point Cellars 2011 Harmony White White (Lake Chelan)

Description: Dusty apple and mineral aromas are clean, but that's about it. The palate is lifted by blazing acids and spritz, while the flavor profile is all tangy lemon, tangerine and freshly picked green bean. Cleansing on the finish.
Name: Txomín Etxaníz 2011 Getaria White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: With some sweetness, this is a ripe and full-bodied wine. It tastes of honey as well as creamed pear and apricot, all gathered within a soft texture.
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2010 Vieilles Vignes White (Alsace)

Description: Apple and mineral aromas are solid and fresh but don't deliver much kick. This feels lively, with a mix of citrus flavors that are enhanced by grass and a pithy finish. It ends on a green note, with a hint of scallion and a cut of acidity.
Name: El Hada 2011 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: Peachy, crisp aromas are mild but standard. It feels puckery and tight, with some spritz. Flavors of tangerine, orange and lemon are tangy but not sour, while the finish is long and chalky in feel. Drink immediately.
Name: Arregi 2011 White (Getariako Txakolina)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend is 60% Sauvignon Blanc, but the finished wine is fairly well balanced between the two grapes. Apple and lime rind flavors dominate. It's tangy and sharp, with a quick finish.
Name: Stottle 2011 S3 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Yakima Valley)

Description: This is crisp, bright, and apple-flavored, it's a lively and fragrant blend of Muscat, Riesling and Pinot Gris. There is great acidity, plus a spicy, aromatic element and a crisp, floral finish. Screwcap.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2010 One White (Alsace)

Description: This has a soft texture and an attractive apple flavor, with light acidity. Bright and fruity, it's ready to drink, just hinting at pepper and spice on the finish. Screwcap.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2011 One White (Alsace)

Description: This is flat and lemony on the nose, with a hint of asparagus. It feels zesty and tastes of tart lemon-lime and green bean. Tangy but not edgy or razor-like on the finish. This is a classic cool-climate white with citrus and green elements running the show.
Name: Zudugarai 2011 White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: This scents of citrus peel and lime, with a plump, oily and round palate that features orange and banana flavors. A blend of 75% Chardonnay and 25% Viognier, it turns melony on the short finish.
Name: Zuccardi 2011 Serie A Chardonnay-Viognier (Mendoza)

Description: An oily popcorn aroma is neither fresh nor lively. The palate is wide and mouthfilling, with notes of bitter almond and creamy citrus. It's viscous on the finish, but there's not much flavor or character.
Name: Beldui 2011 Txakolina White (Spain)

Description: Aromas of white gum drop and funky yeast set up a slightly cloying palate, with a candied flavor of pear. It transitions to notes of banana, mango and powdered sugar on the finish. A blend of Malvasia and Viura.
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2011 Diamante Semi Dulce White (Rioja)

Description: Essencia is the rare free-run juice from botrytized Tokaji grapes, and if you've ever wondered what all the fuss is about, this bottle is as reasonably priced as it gets. It boasts an unctuously creamy palate that's full of delicious honey, tropical fruit and vanilla-caramel notes. It's flecked with a white flower tone, with striking acidity that lingers on the finish.
Name: Sauska 2003 Aszú Essencia Tokaji (Tokaj)

Description: Heady with notes of orange marmalade and lavender, this honeyed Tokaji is remarkably brisk. Its showstopping acidity shines through the layers of caramel and orange cream. Effortlessly long on the palate, it is not at all cloying.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2005 Betsek Aszú 6 Puttonyos Tokaji (Tokaj)

Description: Almost lacy on the palate, with a crisp, delicate structure, this effortlessly drinkable Tokaji is the perfect introduction to this genre of fine wine. Ebullient with scents of lime skin, white flower and waxy honeycomb, its sweet fig and caramel palate is cut with brisk, pineapple-driven acidity.
Name: Patricius 2006 Leonis Aszú 3 Puttonyos Tokaji (Tokaj)

Description: This is a field blend of Kerner, Gewürztraminer and Rieslaner, what winemaker Markus Niggli calls a “Swiss blend.” It opens with a great fleshy nose of pear and almond, showing off a strong foundation of acidity. It's perfectly dry, with a hint of sea-like saltiness.It almost tastes like Vermentino, but the musky lychee note screams Gewürztraminer.
Name: Borra 2011 Intuition Field Blend White White (Lodi)

Description: Dark herb aromas are a unique addition to classic characteristics of honeysuckle, caramel and fig on this unctuously rich Tokaji. It's intensely honeyed, with a creamy, custard-like mouthfeel, but it feels balanced thanks to bright acidity and a long, floral finish.
Name: Sauska 2003 Aszú 6 Puttonyos Tokaji (Tokaj)

Description: This is burnished gold in color, with strong aromas of honey, noble rot and exotic spice. It feels creamy and soft but not prostrate, with orange, clove, citrus peel, honey and nutmeg flavors. The finish turns more peppery but remains honeyed. Gewürztraminer's character is more pronounced on this wine than Semillón's.
Name: Casa Silva 2011 Late Harvest Semillón-Gewürztraminer White (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Stark and sharp at first, this blend of Roussanne, Marsanne, Viognier and ­Grenache Blanc is sophisticated, with notes of pear and stone fruit—such as apricot and white plum—that are accentuated by a figgy finish. With plenty of meat on its bones and a lush mouthfeel, it'll stand up to thick sauces and the richness of lobster and crab.
Name: Elyse 2010 L'Ingenue Naggiar Vineyard White (Sierra Foothills)

Description: A hefty dose of Muscat makes this Tokaji blend particularly flamboyant on the nose, with loads of sweet, waxy honeycomb and yellow flower aromas. It's a shade off-dry, but steely acidity and a tart tangerine flavor cut through the sweetness, leaving only a touch of honey on the finish.
Name: Chateau Dereszla 2011 Semi-Dry  (Tokaji)

Description: Another eclectic white from Borra, this blend is 91% Viognier and 9% Gewürztraminer. It's pungent with notes of apricot fuzz, grapefruit and honey, with a deft floral finish. A light, well-made and refreshing wine, this has sufficient acidity to pair with seafood
Name: Borra 2011 Fusion White Wine White (Lodi)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: While the 50% Chenin Blanc in this blend produces acidity and a tight apple flavor, the 50% Chardonnay rounds the wine out with warm peach and sweet pear. It is ripe and full in the mouth.
Name: Château Gaudrelle NV Vigneau Brut Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Crémant de Loire)

Description: This is a refreshing and somewhat complex wine, with layers of underripe peach, green fig and melon rind mixing with garrigue accents. There's a grassy accent to the palate, with a hint of lime pith on the solid finish.
Name: Château des Karantes 2010 La Clape Blanc White (Coteaux du Languedoc)

Description: Waxy lemon-skin and smoked nut flavors add dimension to the concentrated notes of orange, apple and white flower on this dry, full-bodied blend of Hárslevelu and Chardonnay. It is bold in structure, with a rich, round profile and a lusciously oaky finish.
Name: Sauska 2009 Cuvée 107 White (Tokaj)

Description: This 50-50 blend of Picpoul Blanc and Roussanne is ripe and fleshy, boasting round notes of melon, peach, pineapple and lemon custard. There's a soft, herbal accent of white flower and citrus zest that graces the lively finish. Drink now.
Name: Hecht & Bannier 2011 White (Languedoc)

Description: Brisk minerality and a hint of hazelnut add savory tones to this blend of indigenous Georgian Rkatsiteli and Chardonnay. It's dry and full-bodied, yet surprisingly sprightly, with bright acidity and delicate flavors of stone fruit and citrus rind.
Name: Telavi 2010 Marani Rkatsiteli-Chardonnay White (Kakheti)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A wisp of a white blend, this is mostly Chardonnay and Sémillon, with 9% Orange Muscat that comes through most powerfully and pleasantly on the nose. It's a light wine that's meant to be enjoyed chilled. With its ripe stone-fruit flavors and minerality, it's perfect for pairing with appetizers of all sorts.
Name: Murrieta's Well 2011 The Whip White Wine White (Livermore Valley)

Description: A delicate honeycomb flavor fringes pleasant apple and white flower notes on this dry, refreshing Tokaji blend. Lemony acidity adds structure and length to the finish. This is good introduction to Tokaji for those who prefer a dry style.
Name: Chateau Dereszla 2011 Dry  (Tokaji)

Description: Soft aromas of talcum and crushed white flower mingle with tropical notes of pineapple core and guava. Strong melon and pear flavors flood the palate, with a hint of grassy herbaceousness that opens up on the medium-length finish.
Name: Domaine Piquemal 2010 Les Terres Grillées White (Côtes du Roussillon)

Description: While aromatically subdued, this is a refreshing, easy-drinking white blend, with pleasant lemon and apple flavors. A hint of orange peel and a brisk, lime-accented acidity highlight the midpalate. Drink now.
Name: Telavi 2009 Marani Tsinandali White (Kakheti)

Description: Concentrated apple and pear flavors are flecked with notes of honey and tangerine skin on this dry blend of traditional Tokaji and international grapes. There's a trace vein of green, vegetal notes, but it's refreshing and easy drinking.
Name: Sauska 2010 Cuvée 113 White (Tokaj)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
