Description: Excellent texture and overall balance typify all of the wines from this exciting new producer. A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon, this brings a mix of melon, apple, herb and grass into play. Zippy, citrusy acids add zesty minerality as the wine rolls into a rocking finish, with just a hint of barrel toast.
Name: Lauren Ashton Cellars 2011 Cuvée Méline Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An aromatic blend of 46% Viognier, 37% Roussanne, 17% Riesling, this bears complex scents and flavors of oranges and apricots, which are joined by notes of grapefruit and melon, and complemented with juicy acidity. One-third was barrel fermented in neutral oak, and a portion was left on its lees for added texture.
Name: Brian Carter 2010 Oriana White (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of 75% Sauvignon Blanc and 25% Sémillon, this definitely reflects the cool 2011 vintage in its steely tension. The clean green-fruit flavors are well defined and highlighted with notes of grassy herbs and saline minerality.
Name: Cadaretta 2011 sbs Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: After a waxy opening, the bouquet unveils honey and peach aromas that are totally inviting. It feels thick but not cloying, and the honeyed flavors of banana, peach and dulce de leche are a prelude to the creamy, thick and deeply layered finish. Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Albariño make the blend.
Name: D.G. Viticultors NV Caligo Sweet White Wine White (Spain)

Description: This is soft and lush on the nose, with a slightly lacquer-like scent. The palate feels thick but nicely acidic, keeping it on an even keel. Flavors of honey, apricot and preserved papaya set up a fleshy, plump finish that brings it all home. A blend of 70% Sauvignon Blanc and 30% Chardonnay.
Name: D.G. Viticultors NV Petit Caligo Sweet White Wine White (Spain)

Description: This is open and likeable, with forward aromas of fresh red apple slices, white pineapple cores and green-melon rind. It's brisk and clean on the palate, with good cut and freshness to the fruity core. A touch of herbaceousness adds character to the lingering finish.
Name: Bradgate 2011 Sauvignon Blanc-Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: Bright, fresh and fruity, this is loaded with citrus—especially grapefruit—goodness. There are layers of pears and peaches, making this a big, fruity, mouth-filling wine.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2011 PGV White (Washington)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Notes of sweet pea blossoms, freesia and ripe stone fruits perfume this beautifully executed blend of Riesling and Gewürztraminer. Light on it's feet, with zippy acidity, it's a crisp, thirst-quenching white that finishes on a lavishly floral note.
Name: Goose Watch 2011 Gewürztraminer-Riesling (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A new wine from La Clarine Farm, this is a blend of 37% Sémillon, 32% Viognier and 31% Marsanne. Unusual to say the least, it bears an interesting melange of herbs, flowers, pears and honey, finishing light and inviting to drink. The minerality in particular shines through, making this easy to pair with a wide range of appetizers and seafood.
Name: La Clarine Farm 2011 White (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Apple and citrus aromas mingle on the nose, with hints of steely minerality and just-dried grass. The medium-weight mouthfeel boasts flavors of underripe stone fruit and lemon zest, shifting to riper orange and pear flavors as the finish evolves.
Name: Bon Cap 2011 The Ruins Chardonnay-Viognier (Eilandia)

Description: Rich fruit aromas of yellow apple flesh, mealy pear and banana lead the bouquet, with a hint of grapefruit pith in the background. The palate is tangier and more lifted than the nose suggests, with bright flavors of green plum and citrus juice.
Name: Cape View 2010 Combination Sauvignon Blanc-Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This spicy white blend mixes Viognier, Sémillon and Pinot Gris. Notes of green berries and other green fruits—notably banana—all have an herbal underpinning.
Name: Airfield Estates 2011 Flygirl White (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: This small-production, barrel-fermented blend of white Tempranillo and Sauvignon Blanc smells neutral and fresh except for some barrel notes. It has a mix of spice, toast, citrus, almond and melon flavors. It spreads out on the finish, tasting spicy and cidery.
Name: Finca Torremilanos 2010 Peñalba López Vino Blanco White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Clean, minerally and smells of tarragon, fresh bell pepper and lemony citrus. Feels lively, with pink grapefruit, passion fruit, lime and generic sweetness for flavors. A lip-smacking wine that's varietally accurate. 60% Verdejo and 40% SB.
Name: Volteo 2011 Verdejo-Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: This is quite grassy and herbaceous, with an almost perfumy quality to the bouquet. Fruity flavors of pineapple, mango and tangerine help to flesh out the medium-weight palate, ending clean and lifted. Drink now.
Name: Stellenbosch Hills 2011 Polkadraai Chenin Blanc-Sauvignon Blanc (Polkadraai Hills)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Crisp and likable, this smells stony and snappy, with spring pea, passion fruit and citrus aromas. It feels well cut, with green bean, grass and citrus flavors. While it hints at being vegetal, it maintains a consistent white-fruit and citrus profile.
Name: Storks' Tower 2011 Sauvignon Blanc-Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: Made from 70% Chardonnay and 30% Pinot Noir, this is clean yet nuanced, with subtle suggestions of strawberry hull and freshly picked herbs to the white peach and Key lime core. Medium weight, with a mouthwatering finish; drink now.
Name: Haute Cabrière 2010 Chardonnay-Pinot Noir White (Franschhoek)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This is a highly unusual, quirky blend of the Georgian Rkatsiteli and Moldovan Sereksiya grapes. Tonic and crisp, it offers robust peach and apple flavors on the attack, but fades a bit quickly on the midpalate. Straightforward but refreshing.
Name: McGregor 2011 Rkatsiteli-Sereksiya White (Finger Lakes)

Description: This smells a bit wayward and sulfuric, but it's juicy and acidic on the tongue, with lemony and oily, nutty flavors. It holds steady on the finish, which is lemony in character.
Name: Altozano 2010 Finca Constancia Verdejo-Sauvignon Blanc (Toledo)

Description: The two great white grapes of southwest France, Gros Manseg and Petit Manseng, are blended together to create this crisp, peach- and citrus-flavored wine. A spice note adds a more exotic edge, while the wine finishes with tight, tangy acidity.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2010 Cami Salié  (Jurançon Sec)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Description: This wood-aged wine shows equal notes of toasty spice and ripe fruit. On the palate, it's full and round, with pear and apricot flavors giving it richness. This is concentrated and worth aging for another 2–3 years.
Name: Château de la Jaubertie 2010 Mirabelle de la Jaubertie White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: Beautifully balanced and poised, this blends light, dancing acidity with rich, sweet botrytis fruit. It's fruity, with honey and orange flavors that are a delight to taste. It could be aged, but it is delicious now.
Name: Domaine Nigri 2010 Pas de Deux  (Jurançon)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Medium sweet in character, this is a round, ripe wine. Its flavors show apricot, bitter orange and tangerine that are spiced with just a touch of honey. Pair this with a pâté or a fruit dessert.
Name: Domaine Uby 2011 No. 4 White (Côtes de Gascogne)
Variety: Gros and Petit Manseng, White Blend

Appellation: Vin de Pays Var, Provence, France
Description: Smooth and rich, its creamy texture is rounded out with a toast note. Flavors of peppered apricot and green plum work well together to give a warm, concentrated wine that shows all of its ripe fruit up front.
Name: Château Routas 2010 Coquelicot Viognier-Chardonnay (Vin de Pays Var)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This is fresh and citrusy, with melony fruit and ample weight on the palate but also enough backbone to keep the flavors taut and focused. Drink it over the next year or so.
Name: LePlan-Vermeersch 2010 LePlan Classic White (Côtes du Rhône)

Description: Light and fruity, this has honey, spice and tangerine flavors. It is smooth, rounded and rich; age for 2–3 years.
Name: Château Bélingard 2009  Monbazillac

Description: The aromas of orange and mineral are uncomplicated and friendly. It feels pure and offers good flow, with apple, lime, mineral, white pepper and anise flavors. Fruity, dry and composed on the finish, this is great wine for patio sipping or pairing with seafood.
Name: Viña Costeira 2011 White (Ribeiro)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Fruity and crisp, this has fresh fruit with a herbal edge. It is bright with a green fruit character, finishing with a note of citrus.
Name: Domaine Uby 2011 No. 3 Ugni Blanc-Colombard (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Rich and concentrated, this has flavors of honey and vanilla wafer. It has a bite of ginger and orange marmalade. The acidity is subdued, suggesting a wine that will age quickly and mature in the next year.
Name: Domaine de Moulin-Pouzy 2009  Monbazillac

Description: The peach, pear and apple aromas get no interference from oak. The mouthfeel is friendly, while flavors of green melon, pear and spice work well together. It finishes sweet but with a touch of spice and vanilla.
Name: Monte Xanic 2011 Chenin-Colombard White (Valle de Guadalupe)

Description: This herbaceous wine has a green note, with layers of citrus fruits and an orange zest texture that lends a bright, fruity character.
Name: Château de Corbiac 2011 Cyrano de Bergerac White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: While it's golden in color, the wine isn't oaky or over the hill. Scents of buttercup, honeysuckle, baked apple and melon lead to a round, almost Burgundian-like mouthfeel. The flavors of melon, apple and peach are solid, and the finish is naturally creamy from the 50% Gewürztraminer in the blend—Macabeo comprises the other 50%.
Name: Bodegas Pirineos 2010 Selección Mesache Blanco Macabeo-Gewürztraminer (Somontano)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Celebrating 100 years of the domaine this year, Tariquet's range of wines begins with this classic white. This has a crisp fruitiness, with a floral character and flavors of green plum, pear and a hint of pineapple. It's delicious and ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2011 Classic White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Made from a typical Gascon blend of Colombard, Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng, this zesty wine is dry, herbaceous, fresh and crisp. Its full of citrus and green apple fruits, with a tangy finish. Screwcap.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2011 Villa Grand Cap White (Vin de France)

Appellation: Côtes de Montravel, Southwest France, France
Description: This is a lightly sweet wine that has perfumed apricot and orange fruits. Balanced with acidity, this would be just right as an apéritif.
Name: Château le Raz 2010 White (Côtes de Montravel)

Description: Neutral on the bouquet, this has clean, stony aromas that set up a surprisingly plump palate with melon and lychee flavors. It finishes a bit soft, but with more than acceptable acidity. It won't age for too long, but it sure tastes good now.
Name: Viñas Pijoan 2011 Silvana White (Valle de Guadalupe)

Description: This is a lightly sweet wine made from superripe Gros Manseng and Sauvignon Blanc. It has apricot, raisin and pineapple flavors along with some yeastiness. A fine apéritif wine.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2011 Villa Chambre d'Amour  (Jurançon)

Description: Here's a floral-smelling, light-style mix of Moscatel and Macabeo that will function best as a quaffing wine. It smells of acacia and orange blossom, showing modest weight and acidity, with citrus and tropical fruit flavors. The finish is short and light.
Name: Marqués de Caro 2011 Blanco White (Valencia)

Description: Aromas and peach, apple and a spot of hay make for a nice, clean and familiar bouquet. It feels fresh and easy, with tangerine, nectarine and spiced apple flavors. Crisp, solid and quick on the finish, this is clean overall.
Name: Unión Vinícola del Este NV Vega Medien Brut Macabeo-Chardonnay (Cava)

Description: Crisp and herbaceous, this has a citrus and green fruit character. Already drinkable, it is bright and fruity, finishing with a citrus tang.
Name: Château de la Jaubertie 2011 White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: White currant is the dominant flavor of this herbaceous, tangy wine. It also has notes of has green fruit and pink grapefruit, with a tight, zingy finish.
Name: Château le Raz 2010  Montravel

Description: This Lodi-grown blend of 65% Chardonnay, 25% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Viognier smells of marshmallow, coconut and bubble gum.
Name: Peirano 2009 The Other White (Lodi)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Spice and seemingly sweet grapefruit flavors give this light, lively and crisp wine an attractive fruity character. It dances easily on the palate, finishing with good tang.
Name: Vignobles Drieux 2011 Villa Dria Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Vin de Pays Var, Provence, France
Description: Earthy aromas lead to a palate that is full bodied, with notes of yeast and spice to go with the white fruit. It has attractive acidity and a tangy citrusy finish. Screwcap.
Name: Château Routas 2010 White (Vin de Pays Var)

Description: Aromatic and richly fruity, this has surprising weight that gives the palate a round and smooth quality. The acidity is there, although it is covered by the superrich fruit.
Name: Domaine de Moulin-Pouzy 2011 White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: Smooth and rounded, this has light acidity, with citrus and pear flavors and a crisp finish. It needs to age for a year longer to allow its textured character a chance to smooth out even more.
Name: Château Bélingard 2011 White (Bergerac Sec)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Fragrant, fresh and fruity, this light and bright wine offers an herbal character to go with its citrus and green apple fruits. It is lively and crisp—a fine apéritif. Screwcap.
Name: Cheval Quancard 2011 Domaine de Lamothe Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: This is nutty and minerally on the nose, and barely citric as far as fruit aromas go. On the palate, there's bitterness, with a grapefruit tang making up the flavor profile. A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay.
Name: Viñas de Garza 2011 Blanco del Rancho Mogorcito White (Valle de Guadalupe)

Description: The nose smells flat, with a scant scent of peach. It feels acidic and lacks body, with flavors of sour apple, dried papaya and bitter almond. A blend of 50% Macabeo and 50% Airen.
Designation: White Wine Made with Organic Grapes
Name: Vermador 2010 White Wine Made with Organic Grapes White (Alicante)

Description: An impeccable wine, this is so finely balanced between its rich fruits and structure. With its seamless character, it offers both fine acidity, green and white fruit and an undertow of wood aging. This is a wine for long-term aging.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2009  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This is a finely balanced wine, combining an herbaceous flavor with apricot and sweet pear. The whole is a delicious wine that brings together notes of toast and fresh fruit, with a firm, dry structure. For long-term aging.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2009  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Big, ripe and delicious, this is packed with spice and sweet apricot fruits. It's full and opulent, very much a wine of 2009, yet it retains its sense of balance and structure.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2009  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Full of tropical fruit flavors, this is rounded, ripe and very accessible. At the same time, its structure shows through in the tang of green apple skin, judicious wood aging and taut aftertaste.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2009  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Already delicious, this wine shows its wood aging with such finesse, while letting its elegant white-fruit flavor come through. It has an herbaceous edge, rounded out with a more ripe fruit character. This is meant for aging.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2009  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Full in the mouth, this is a rich wine with its yellow fruit and buried acidity. It is laden with wood and ripe fruit, and is dense and cushioned. A nutmeg flavor shows through slowly to add to the exotic, opulent aftertaste.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2009  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Rounded, but with just the right amount of herbaceousness to give a vivid fruity character. The wine is rich, sun-soaked while still retaining its sense of balance and elegance.
Name: Château Olivier 2009  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A ripe, spicy wine, this balances its rich tropical fruits with tense acidity and wood toast. It's full and rounded yet finely tangy and taut. With this structure, the wine should age over many years.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2009  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This is full and rounded initially, then the more textured notes of green fruit skin and wood spice come through. It has an attractively ripe feel while remaining structured. At the same time, the wine is developing fast and will be ready to drink in 3–4 years.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2009  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A food friendly wine, with its finely balanced herb and green tea flavors along with pear and red apple fruits. The wine is tangy, very Sauvignon in character, packed with a lime and pink grapefruit aftertaste.
Name: Château Couhins 2009  Pessac-Léognan

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an unusual blend of Viognier, Chardonnay, Roussanne and Orange Muscat—quite different from previous vintages. Crisp and penetrating, it's a mix of lime, melon and kiwi flavors that are etched with skin phenolics, putting some delicious bite into the finish.
Name: Kontos 2011 Gossamer White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: The Hamptons, Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A true field blend of Muscat, Pinot Grigio and Pinot Bianco, the Sylvanus is a profoundly aromatic, yet remarkably composed white wine. It's exuberant on the nose with lush flowers, tropical fruit and a whiff of exotic spice. The palate is dry, but lusciously concentrated with notes of orange peel and waxy flower that finish with a touch of saline and oyster shell.
Name: Channing Daughters 2010 Sylvanus White (The Hamptons, Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whispers of smoke and fresh herb are a counterpoint to the heady notes of white flower, sweet peach and melon on this gorgeous Bordeaux-style. It's elegantly composed, with a rich, creamy texture, a bristle of acidity and a crushed-stone minerality. This is undeniably a top pick from Long Island.
Name: Shinn Estate 2010 Haven Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Wood aging has given this a spicy feel. It's rich, full bodied and textured with a citrus tang. The texture is creamy, with pear and grapefruit notes. Age for another two years.
Name: Château Thieuley 2010 Cuvée Francis Courselle  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: There is a farmyard quality to the aromas, but the wine itself shows a finely structured character that offers a linear, herbaceous view. The wine has considerable aging potential, bringing out an enticing citrus character.
Name: Château Couhins-Lurton 2009  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Aromas of soft pear, peach, flower and citrus are followed by layers of tropical fruit, citrus and pear on the palate. It's round, viscous mouthfeel should enable it to stand up to robust poultry and seafood dishes.
Name: Lyrarakis 2011 Okto Dry White (Crete)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Bedell's aromatic white blend bursts from the glass with exuberant scents of spring blossoms, freshly cut herbs and juicy pink-grapefruit notes. The palate is ripe and fruity, but balanced by an intensely chalky minerality and vivacious lime-juice acidity. Drink now.
Name: Bedell 2010 Taste White White (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Spicy but delicate aromas are followed by lively flavors of white fruit and citrus in this distinctive white. Fragrant and fruity, but balanced with a clean, refreshing acidity, this white has a stylish character that should pair well with cheeses and fresh fish.
Name: Mercouri Estate 2011 Foloi Dry White (Peloponnese)

Description: Aromas of candied fruits, flowers and a perky citric edge give this white a fun and exotic feel. On the palate, soft flavors of lemon curd, orange marmalade, fresh fruit and spice are in balance and will appeal to fans of a slightly less-dry Greek white. Pretty and easy drinking.
Name: Skouras 2011 Roditis-Moscofilero White (Peloponnese)

Description: With its apricot and honey flavors, this is an attractive, fruity dessert wine. There is some dryness from botrytis to add complexity. At the end, the wine offers a delicious fruit salad finish.
Name: Château Suau 2009  Cadillac

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Using grapes sourced from Klipsun Vineyard, this is a roughly even Sauvignon Blanc–Sémillon blend. Flavors of sweet toast, lemon verbena and melon, with a hint of mint and a splash of orange soda are all in evidence. Nicely nuanced, this does not overreach, but rather zooms in on the details of aroma and flavor that keep it interesting.
Name: Covington 2011 Blanc Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Red Mountain)

Description: The blend is 55% Sauvignon Blanc, 40% Aligoté and 5% Viognier, much as in past vintages. It's a pretty, fruity and aromatic wine, just slightly sweet (1.5% residual sugar); and it hits the palate softly, with flavors of fresh grass, melon, citrus and honeysuckle.
Name: Nefarious 2010 Consequence White (Washington)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a nonvintage blend of Chenin Blanc and Sauvignon Blanc, with additions of Viognier and Muscat. Its Chenin-like nose is floral and rich, and its lychee, lime and kiwi flavors swirl about before coming to a refined, perfectly crisp finish.
Name: Testa Vineyards NV Simply White White (Mendocino County)

Description: A grassy, herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine, this has fresh grapefruit and lime flavors, with an orange zest and mineral edge. This is delicious and ready to drink now.
Name: Château Ducasse 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A rich wine that strikes a good balance among tropical fruits, acids and a dry botrytis core. It shows notes of spice and honey, with apricot juice acidity. This is ready to drink.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2009 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Sauternes)

Description: A blend of 50% Chardonnay, 25% Sauvignon Blanc and 25% Viognier, this wine needs time to really open up in the glass, and should not be served too cold, as some of the more nuanced aromas will be masked. Rich apple and peach fruit mingle with notes of white and yellow flowers and fresh-cut herbs. The texture is round and lush, but the finish is clean and lifted with a tart melon-rind accent.
Name: Recanati 2010 Special Reserve White White (Galilee)

Description: This is a tasty white for patio sipping and summer picnics. Fresh, lively aromas are softened with a lovely floral edge, followed by easy-going, refreshing flavors of lemon, nectarine and sea salt. It's a flirty wine that should pair well with fruit, fresh fish and salads.
Name: Nasiakos 2011 White (Mantinia)

Description: Notes of sea salt, perky citrus and a wave of ripe tropical fruit?combine to form an elegant white with a food-pairing advantage. On the palate, there is good body and a round fruit character that is nicely cut with a fresh finish. Pair with chicken, salmon and fruit.
Name: Domaine Sigalas 2011 Asirtiko Athiri White (Santorini)

Description: Wood aging has produced a well-rounded wine. It has a citrus flavor to go with the more tropical fruit, a good zing of acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now, or age over the next year.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2011 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Graves)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A lightly sparkling blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Gros Manseng, this is soft and just sweet. It is delicious, packed with apple, pear juice and tangy lime flavors. A great summer apéritif. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine Uby 2011 Uby 02 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Crisp and smooth, this has refreshing lemon and pear flavors. Dry, fruity and ready to drink, it is bright and crisp.
Name: Château Bellevue 2010  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This is an attractive mint- and pear-flavored wine with citrus acidity. There is a delicious refreshing orange character to this soft, light and very fresh wine.
Name: Domaine du Salvard 2010 Chardonnay-Sauvignon (Cheverny)

Description: This is an attractive herbaceous wine that's light and tangy. Its gooseberry character dominates, lending acidity and a lively, crisp finish. The wine's blue bottle is memorable.
Name: Château Tuilerie Pagès 2011  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This is a soft, crisp, lightly herbaceous wine. It has fruity peach and pear flavors that are touched with citrus. The fruit dances easily on the palate. Screwcap.
Name: Château Suau 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Fruity and herbaceous, this is full of pear, green apple and citrus flavors. It's easy and crisp, with the acidity giving an attractive final taste.
Name: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2011  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Notes of lemon rind, mineral and a spin of warming spice start this cheerful, easy-drinking white blend from the Cyclades. This is what Greek whites are all about: fresh, lively fruit and a clean finish?that pairs great with seafood.
Name: Argyros 2011 Atlantis Dry White White (Cyclades)

Description: Herbaceous and aromatic, this is a crisp, green-fruit- and citrus-flavored wine. Grapefruit and green apple dominate the texture with its zesty character. Not for aging.
Name: Château du Barrailh 2010 Cuvée Collection Prestige  (Graves)

Description: This is a wine that brings out a soft, tropical character allied to a citrus and a herbaceous element. It's open, attractive and soft, and it's ready to drink.
Name: Augey 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Always a good value, Recanati's Yasmin line is an easy-pleasing selection. Inviting aromas of freshly sliced peach, lychee and rose water lead seamlessly into flavors of green melon and lime on the palate. The finish is short, but clean and refreshing. Mevushal.
Name: Recanati 2011 Yasmin White (Shomron)

Description: Simple but satifisfying, this wine exhibits good fruit, pretty aromatics and a spicy kick. It's a little out of focus and lacks acidity, but overall, this is a pleasing everyday white.
Name: Dionysos 2010 Moschofilero-Moschato White (Peloponnese)

Description: Vanilla, orange marmalade and butterscotch aromas intrigue in this more voluptuous white. On the palate, flavors of butterscotch and orange peel are unique but the white could use a touch more balancing acidity. Overall though, this is a unique everyday wine.
Name: Methymnaeos 2010 Chidiriotiko Blanc de Noirs White (Lesbos)

Description: With a sweet, flowery nose, this blend of Viognier, Pinot Grigio, Malvasia and Gewürztraminer has plenty of acidity to balance out its subtle sweetness.
Name: St. Francis 2010 White Splash White (California)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is light, with a nose of fresh stone fruit—mostly peach—as well as melon. It's a delightful blend of 75% Sauvignon Blanc and 25% Sémillon that will appeal to Sémillon fans. iIts acidity is balanced and bracing; the finish is full of lemon flavor.
Name: Amador Foothill Winery 2011 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: A crisp, clean wine, with a gentle apple flavor and light acidity. It's a wine that is soft and round, with a spice note as well as a minerally tang on the finish.
Name: Hugel 2011 Gentil Hugel White (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This shows a darker shade than most young whites, almost a burnished gold. Soft and complex, with ripe, slightly confected fruit flavors, it's super smooth, with honeysuckle highlights around waxy stone fruits. Excellent length.
Name: Buty 2010 61% Sémillon/21% Sauvignon/18% Muscadelle White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is perfumed with crisp apple and light spice aromas. It's a delicate yet concentrated wine, with acidity that's tempered with pepper and a fresh finish. Screwcap.
Name: Wieninger 2011 Gemischter Satz White (Vienna)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Sémillon-Sauvignon Blanc blend is firm, powerful and polished. The fruit runs the gamut from citrus to melon to white peach, finishing with some youthful bite. Already a succulent, mouthfilling gem, but should improve for another five years.
Name: Insania 2010 White (Red Mountain)

Description: This dessert wine is a blend of 80% Semillon and 20% Sauvignon Blanc. Dark-golden in hue, it tastes like a fresh apricot tart glazed ever so slightly with sugar. Light drinking and very beautifully made, try enjoying this poured over vanilla ice cream.
Name: Miraflores 2008 Botricelli Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (California)

Description: This blend of 57% Chenin Blanc and 43% Viognier is opulent and forward. Rich scents of baked apple, clove-spiked orange, honeysuckle and hazelnut crisp dance on the nose and mouth, but the palate remains lifted with fresh acidity and a saline note. Accents of spice and toast remain through the long close. A gorgeous wine now, but it should age beautifully through 2015.
Name: Sijnn 2010 White Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Malgas)

Description: This Chenin-based blend—with 10% Clairette Blanc and 10% Viognier—offers great richness and a lush texture. Notes of beeswax and brioche add depth to the orange oil, pear, melon and honeysuckle aromas and flavors. The medium weight mouth offers a fresh lemony citrus and green plum tartness, keeping the palate clean and vibrant. Drink now–2014.
Name: Mullineux 2010 White (Swartland)

Description: This is an off-dry blend of Zierfandler, Rotgipfler and Neuburger—grapes local to the Thermenregion. This wine is now mature but certainly not old. It has mushroom and spice flavors that are lifted by currant acidity that still cuts through the wine.
Name: Kirchmayr 1983 Solist White (Thermenregion)

Description: Perfumed and spicy, this has fine acidity and a light texture. The wine is bright and crisp, with flavors of pears mingling with green apples. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2011 Cool Climate White (Niederösterreich)

Description: This is a complex, rounded wine. It's texture is soft, rich and creamy, layering acidity with ripe flavors of apple and pear. It could age for 1–2 years.
Name: Szigeti 2009 Edition Adele Blanc de Blancs White (Österreichischer Sekt)

Description: A blend of mostly Chenin Blanc, with 9% Chardonnay and 5% Viognier, this is a charming white with alluring notes of orange blossom and peony that mingle with the white peach and mango fruit. There's a nice vibrancy on the palate, with fresh tropical-fruit flavors that hang on to the finish.
Name: Thokozani 2010 Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay-Viognier White (Wellington)

Description: Stalky and grassy smelling, which is par for a Penedès white blend. There str also apple and lemon-lime notes on the nose. In the mouth, it's lively and spritzy in feel, with pineapple, lime and grassy flavors. Zesty, dry and minerally on the finish, this should pair well with seafood and paella.
Name: Huguet de Can Feixes 2010 Blanc Selecció White (Penedès)

Description: The melon and pineapple aromas are pure and carry a waxy edge. It feels simple and well comported, with green apple, pear and vanilla flavors. This is tasty, smooth, lively and classy; drink right away.
Name: Pradorey 2011 Verdejo-Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: An interesting blend of 80% Chenin Blanc and 20% Pinotage, this white is fresh and fruity, with an enticing mixture of citrusy flowers and small red berries. There's a touch of earthiness on the palate, with a nice smoothness its medium weight. So crisp and alive now; drink up.
Name: Beyerskloof 2011 Chenin Blanc-Pinotage White (Coastal Region)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of of 51% Chardonnay and 49% Semillon tastes big and ripe, mostly of pineapple, guava and very-ripe pear, with a rich vanilla finish.
Name: Fenestra 2010 Semonnay Chardonnay-Semillon (Livermore Valley)

Description: The lime, mineral and flower aromas are inviting. On the palate, light, powdery flavors of lime, kiwi and green melon take over. It tastes a little green on the finish, like tarragon, but overall it's fresh, dry and easy to drink. This is a blend of 40% Macabeo and 40% Parellada and 20% Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Clos Mont-Blanc 2011 Xipella White (Conca de Barberà)

Description: Ripe but basic on the nose, this has dusty apple and sweet, minerally notes that are not sugary. It feels a little blowsy, but there's ample acidic cut to frame the dry, flavors of melon, green banana and apple. This has a simple finish. A blend of 80% Xarello and 20% Riesling.
Name: Terraprima 2010 Massís del Garraf White (Penedès)

Description: This is a ripe, full-in-the-mouth wine. The creamed pear and citrus flavors are delicious. It has poise and an intense fruitiness. Drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Arndorfer 2011 Vorgeschmack White (Niederösterreich)

Description: A bit oily on the bouquet, this has slightly acrid notes of burnt hay and matchstick, with notes of apple and nectarine. It feels full and not edgy, with good acidity and limited flavors of baked apple and peach. A standard Penedès wine made from 80% Xarello, with Malvasia and Macabeo.
Name: Pardas 2010 Rupestris White (Penedès)

Description: Bright and attractively fruity, this has pear and green apple flavors, with a lemon zest tang. Drink over the next year. Screwcap.
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2011 Trie White White (Burgenland)

Description: As it smells blowsy, stalky and oily, this is probably already past its freshness point. It feels chunky and sort of flat, with mealy apple flavors leading to a honeyed finish that feels fleshy. This is a blend of 50% Viura, 40% Chardonnay and 10% Muscat.
Name: Campos de Luz 2010 Chardonnay-Viura-Muscat White (Cariñena)

Description: Hints of cooked apple and chalk dust contrast with a slightly confectionery sweetness on the palate of this simple, apple-y white blend. This is medium bodied, with a finish that verges on sugary.
Name: Three Fox NV Gatto Bianco Chardonnay-Viognier (Virginia)

Description: Apricot and lemon marmalade aromas open up on this smooth, unctuous wine. It has concentrated honey and rich botrytis flavors, with an intense texture and fruit quality. Ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine l'Ancienne Cure 2007 L'Abbaye  (Monbazillac)

Description: This smooth and creamy wood-aged wine brings a touch of spice to its rich and perfumed character. Ripe and rounded, this wine has apricot and sweet pear flavors.
Name: Domaine l'Ancienne Cure 2010 L'Extase White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: Marmalade, raisin and a hint of tropical fruit are balanced by the dry botrytis of this rich wine, which is based on the same grape varieties as Sauternes. It is elegant and ageworthy, but is also ready to drink now.
Name: Château K 2009 White (Saussignac)

Description: A wine that has all the freshness of the Gascony region while bursting with some extra weight of fruit. There is a fine citrus and apricot concentration, just a hint of toast and enticing fresh acidity.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2010 L'Empreinte de Saint-Mont Blanc  (Saint-Mont)

Description: A sweet wine that is packed with botrytis and also intense acidity. Honey, apricot and orange peel of the Riesling are blended with spicy Gewurztraminer, giving a taut, still young wine. Keep 3–4 years.
Name: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2010 Late Harvest White (Tejo)

Description: Full and wood-aged, this wine is smoothly textured. It's ripe and spicy, with apricot fruit and some minerality. Rich and worth aging for 2–3 years.
Name: Clos des Terrasses 2008 White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: A fat style of white wine, with wood and ripe peach and apricot flavors. Rounded, rich and ripe, it is full of southern warmth, tempered by enticing acidity.
Name: Domaine Vico 2010 Collection White (Corse)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A palate-pleasing, off-dry white, with a mix of peach and pear, some nice highlights of baking spices, and good texture through the finish.
Name: Oak Knoll NV Toasted Cow Vintners Blend White (Willamette Valley)

Description: It's impressive what a small addition of Sauvignon Gris and Muscadelle can do to a Sauvignon-Sémillon blend—it turns this into an exotic wine, with spice and lychee flavors.
Name: Domaine l'Ancienne Cure 2010 L'Abbaye White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: The name of the wine refers to the almost-unknown ancient varieties of vines that have been rediscovered by the Plaimont cooperative. The blend shows a perfumed mix of yellow fruit and citrus, with a tight tang of final acidity.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2010 Les Vignes Retrouvées  (Saint-Mont)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A blend of fruit from across the southwest yields a very fresh wine. It is crisp, textured, full of white fruit with an herbal edge. Drink now.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2010 Villa Grand Cap White (Vin de France)

Description: A wood-aged wine that feels weighty, soft and rich. It's spiced with a hint of cinnamon, and offers rounded apple and apricot flavors.
Name: Château K 2010 White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: Borra is having fun in Lodi experimenting with both red and white blends of varieties not usually put together —here, it's 89% Viognier and 11% Gewürztraminer—with worthwhile results. White Fusion starts with a severe lemony crispness, segues into oaky caramel and finishes bittersweet.
Name: Borra 2010 White Fusion White (Lodi)

Description: With its Sauvignon Blanc in the blend, this is an herbaceous tasting wine, with green apple, and hay aromas. It finishes bright and fresh; drink now.
Name: Clos des Terrasses 2011 Le Fruit Blanc White (Bergerac Sec)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A blend of Colombard and Ugni Blanc, this is crisp and lively. It has a wonderfully fruity tang, and is packed with flavors of citrus fruit and green apple juice. Screwcap.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2011 Colombelle L'Original Blanc White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: There is just a touch of wood here, adding spice to the warm tropical-fruit flavors. It's round, with hints of pepper and rich melon and peach.
Name: Henri Milan 2009 Le Grand Blanc White (Vin de France)

Description: An herbal, vegetal wine, its acidity is very citrusy and crisp. There is a bite of asparagus and bell pepper.
Name: Domaine Vico 2010 White (Corse)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Aromatic and crisp wine, with refreshing green and pineapple fruit flavors. This wine is as bright as a button; it's light, refreshing and ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine de Ménard 2009 Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Côtes de Duras, Southwest France, France
Description: Flavors of pear and kiwi balance together to give a crispness and roundness to this warm, fruity wine. There is an attractive touch of nutmeg for added complexity.
Name: Domaine les Riquets 2011 Amourette White (Côtes de Duras)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: “Sans Soufre Ajouté” means without added sulfur; the wine has a considerable sediment that needs time to settle. It is a wine full of ripe fruit and toasted popcorn. It has a round mouthfeel.
Name: Henri Milan 2010 Sans Soufre Ajouté White (Vin de France)

Description: Gold in color, with an oily, mealy nose that starts out with petrol and funk and settles if given time. Feels round, with good acidity and oak-led flavors of pithy citrus and melon that finish bitter and stalky. Roughly one-third each of Viognier, Riesling and Chardonnay.
Name: Anakena 2010 Ona Viognier-Riesling-Chardonnay White (Chile)

Description: 95-97. Barrel sample. Showing new wood spice, this rich and full-bodied wine also has weighty fruit, with creamy and herbaceous qualities.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 95-97. Barrel sample. This wine shows sheer opulence; it's beautifully rich and ripe, powered by complex flavors of orange zest and superripe mango. It's fresh, showing this vintage's character.
Name: Château Rieussec 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 95-97. Barrel sample. A powerful wine that's full of wood and ripe tropical-fruit flavors. It also has an intensely mineral structure that powers the wine right through to the concentrated finish.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 95-97. Barrel sample. This wine is rich with flavors of tropical fruit and citrus, with judicious wood aging and fine concentration.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 95-97. Barrel sample. Opulent and finessed, this has great weight, and scents of ripe fruit and botrytis. Stylish flavors of yellow fruit, citrus and cinnamon combine with bright acidity on the rich palate.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 95-97. Barrel sample. A gorgeous wine that offers a firm, botrytis character, with aromas of spice, apple and orange zest. It's powerful and meant for long aging.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2011 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 95-97. Barrel sample. Rich, with intense flavors of botrytis, lemon and Seville orange peel. This wine has both freshness and sweetness, with a light touch.
Name: Château d'Yquem 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94-96. Barrel sample. Showing a judicious blend of new wood and ripe fruit, this is a wine that has a creamed-apple texture. It's full of bright grapefruit, sweet apple and green plum flavors.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94-96. Barrel sample. An intensely herbaceous wine, with delicious flavors of grapefruit, apricot juice and spice. The finish is lively and fruity, with mineral acidity.
Name: Château la Louvière 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94-96. Barrel sample. This is taut and tight, with so much spice and pepper from the high alcohol and wood aging. But it's the intensity of fruit that makes this wine such a blockbuster.
Name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94-96. Barrel sample. There is great freshness in this wine, which also has ample weight and complex, rich fruit. It's powered by acidity, remaining lively and bright, and is likely to age well.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94-96. Barrel Sample. An intense wine that is rich, rounded, dense and solid. Along with its weighty, ripe fruit, there are suggestions of acidity. Layered with botrytis flavors.
Name: Château Guiraud 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94-96. Barrel sample. This wine dances so easily on the palate, yet still has the weight and richness of the year. There is a delicacy here, followed by an even denser intensity. It charms now, but will surely age over many years.
Name: Château Rabaud-Promis 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Rich fruit flavors of spiced orange are layered into its structure. With a smooth texture and fine balance, it is opulent, crisp and dense. A wine for long-term aging.
Name: Château de Myrat 2011 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 93-95. Barrel sample. This is a crisp-textured wine, with a complex structure of rich, dense fruits, spice and wood. The wine is only just coming together, promising many years of aging ahead.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Very rich in botrytis, this is a dense, opulent wine that's charged and hugely ripe. The acidity is there in the background.
Name: Château Lamothe Guignard 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93-95. Barrel sample. A ripe, balanced wine, with a structure that's well-integrated into its rich, sweet fruit. It has an edge of spice and bitter-orange flavors to go with the opulent front texture.
Name: Château Caillou 2011 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 93-95. Barrel sample. A finely balanced wine, with a ripe mix of mango, apricot and pink grapefruit flavors. It has a fresh edge along with a rich, full character.
Name: Château de France 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93-95. Barrel sample. This wine has an intense herbaceous quality, with fruit and nutmeg flavors. It feels and tastes powerful, with alcoholic warmth and a taut and nervy character.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Very herbaceous in character, this is a wine that is packed with powerful acidity yet remains elegant in style. It has minerality and tight acidity, and should benefit from aging.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Spice and green apple flavors dominate the palate of this crisp yet creamy wine. It has a fine, dense texture, and the fruit comes through with great intensity. The wood is neatly in support.
Designation: Pavillon Blanc de Margaux Barrel Sample
Name: Château Margaux 2011 Pavillon Blanc de Margaux Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 93-95. Barrel sample. Spice from new wood and the superripe, botrytized fruit show strongly in this powerful, impressive wine. It has weight, structure and intensity. It will surely age for many years.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94. Barrel sample. A smooth, richly textured wine, with flavors of sweet orange and spice that combine with dark wood and pomegranate.
Name: Château Romer 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94. Barrel sample. A herbaceous wine that has ripe yellow-fruit flavors. It is rich and fruity, and layered with grapefruit and sweet peach notes. It finishes tight, with minerality.
Designation: La Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2011 La Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92-94. Barrel sample. This wine shows its crisp side immediately, followed by flavors of rich fruit. The wine has weight that lies underneath its deliciously fresh character, and there is a final note of spiced orange.
Name: Château Nairac 2011 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 92-94. Barrel sample. This wine has both weight and a light touch. Its weight is driven by the powerful botrytis character and ripe apricot fruit; its lightness comes from a straight line of intense acidity that cuts through the wine. It should age a long time.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94. Barrel sample. This wine is tight and taut, with minerality. Its fruit is heavily citrusy, with a character that cuts like steel through the nervy texture. This shows aging potential.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92-94. Barrel sample. An intensely powerful wine—so rich that it overwhelms with its weight. At the same time, there is a great core of fine acidity that cuts the richness well.
Name: Château de Malle 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94. Barrel sample. A smooth, mellifluous wine, with its intensity masked by tight acidity. It shows the weight of the vintage, and the power of the botrytis that's interspersed with flavors of orange zest and lime. It should age magnificently.
Name: Château Coutet 2011 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 92-94. Barrel sample. An impressive wine that has weight and intense botrytis notes. Its acidity gives a delicious lift to its powerful flavors of yellow fruits, tangerines and light wood spices.
Name: Château d'Arche 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94. Barrel sample. A smooth and rich wine that also shows depth of flavor. Wrapped in its tight texture are notes of peach and mango, bitter orange and lemon zest. It's a fine wine that should age for many years.
Name: Château de Fargues 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94. Barrel sample. Herbaceous aromas are followed by nutmeg and crisp fruit. This has the great ripe fruit of the year without the huge intensity; it's a wine that has subtlety as well as complexity.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2011 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 92-94. Barrel sample. Creamed fruit aromas are followed by a herbaceous quality. The wine has some richness and new-wood flavors; mouth-watering acidity marks the finish.
Name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92-94. Barrel sample. A big, fruity wine that manages to balance its ripe tropical-fruit flavors with notes of spice and grapefruit. It has weight and is still settling down. Concentrated and intense.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: This beautiful Semillon-dominant blend that shows great finesse, depth and power. Rich and opulent in every way, notes of baked red apple, lemon verbena, honey-drizzled peach and sweet orange oil flood the nose and mouth, while additional flavors of hazelnut cream, fig bread and soft sweet spice carry into the long finish. Round, but with enough acidic lift to keep it from being flabby. Drink now–2015.
Name: Bizoe 2010 Henrietta Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: 91-93. Barrel sample. Despite some reductive character on the nose, the fruit on the palate shows good weight and richness. It should become a rich, citrus-flavored wine.
Name: Château Rahoul 2011 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: 91-93. Barrel sample. A lively, bright wine that's not too weighty. It has notes of mineral and citrus, with attractive acidity and just the right amount of balancing weight.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91-93. Barrel sample. With a dominant austere minerality, this wine has weight but not the delicious fruitiness of the vintage. The finish is marked by a steely texture.
Name: Château Ferrande 2011 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: 91-93. Barrel sample. This wine shows white and yellow fruits with a note of spice. It's warm and rich, with mouthwatering acidity and a crisp lemon finish.
Name: Château la Garde 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91-93. Barrel sample. A beautifully-fresh wine, with its acidity cutting through the weight of its smooth fruit—like scissors cutting through velvet. Intense, with spice and acidity showing through on the finish.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91-93. Barrel sample. With great swathes of spice, this is a wine with fruit that's still emerging. It has weight and delicious intensity. With its layered structure of acidity and tannin, this is for long-term aging.
Name: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91-93. Barrel sample. Initially this is just a seductive effort; but then its intensity and structure emerge, creating a wine of great complexity. Its botrytis character adds considerable weight.
Name: Château Suau 2011 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 91-93. Barrel sample. A wine with weight and richness, there is considerable concentration, with citrus flavor and ripe fruit densely set in the background.
Name: Château Olivier 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Ebulliently floral on the nose, this decadently creamy Tokaji bursts with characteristic honey, peach preserve and dried fig sweetness. A streak of citrusy acidity adds balance, while subtle hints of caramelized sugar and tea leaves add twists to the long, honey-kissed finish.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2007 Red Label Aszú 5 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

Description: 90-92. Barrel sample. A herbaceous, fruity wine, with its acidity well integrated into the ripe, bright fruits. The wine is light, fresh and crisp, with an attractive lemon-curd note.
Name: Château Picque Caillou 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90-92. Barrel sample. This wine shows a powerful new-wood character, with a ripe, rich and very smooth texture lying underneath.
Name: Château Broustet 2011 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 90-92. Barrel sample. There are some reductive, meaty aromas on this barrel sample, but the palate still shows the fine potential of this wine. It has all the weight and richness of the vintage, with underlying crisp acidity.
Name: Château Filhot 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 90-92. Barrel sample. This is a light and fruity wine, with prominent wood. It has a crisp texture that's very bright, with some weight showing on the finish.
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2011 Barrel Sample  (Graves)

Description: For $20, this bargain basement Tokaji is pretty unbelievable. Abundantly floral and honeyed on the nose, it's deeply concentrated on the palate, with layers of luscious figs and peaches, accented by lanolin and beeswax. Creamy and unctuous on the tongue, yet clean and fresh on the finish, with orange-inflected acidity that lingers.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2009 Mád Cuvée Late Harvest  (Tokaji)

Description: 89-91. Barrel sample. This has a taut and very herbaceous character, with a crisp green-apple flavors and creamy feel.
Name: Château Cos d'Estournel 2011 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 89-91. Barrel sample. Ripe, smooth and creamy in texture, this wine has rich flavors of spice and green fruit.
Name: Le Nardian 2011 Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Two-thirds Chardonnay, 22% Viognier, and the rest Sauvignon Blanc—an unusual blend that works well. Medium gold and showing the color and scents of oak aging, this big-boned white runs the gamut from apple to pear to peach, soaked in Bourbon barrel flavors, with a rich, creamy finish.
Name: Robert O. Smasne 2008 Francis Reserve White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: 89-91. Barrel sample. An apple-fresh wine, with its richness coming through slowly. It has weight as well as a touch of marmalade spice and lemon acidity. With its light character, it's delicious.
Name: Château Lamothe 2011 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: A complex, kitchen-sink blend of 29% Chenin Blanc, 23% Roussanne, 11% Viognier, 11% Chardonnay, 10% Grenache Blanc, 5% Colombar, 5% Grenache Gris, 2% Sémillon, 2% Clairette and 1% Verdelho, there's a lot to be discovered in this wine. Melon, pear and sweet citrus lead the bouquet, with nuances of orange blossom and honeysuckle, while spicy flavors of baked apple, glazed canteloupe and lightly-mulled pear flood the palate. Round and forward, with a silky texture; give it time to open up now or hold another couple of years.
Name: A.A. Badenhorst Family Wines 2009 White (Coastal Region)

Description: 89-91. Barrel sample. This is a fruity wine that's packed with citrus flavor. With its light, bright and crisp mouthfeel, this is likely to develop quickly.
Name: Château Haut-Bergey 2011 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: A lovely blend of 77% Sauvignon Blanc and 23% Chenin Blanc, this light and lively wine is direct and focused, with good briskness to the green plum, fig and pear notes. A touch of floral character adds depth to the bouquet, while a lemon rind bitterness unfolds on the end.
Name: Bradgate 2010 Sauvignon Blanc-Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: This blend of 67% Viognier, 19% Chenin Blanc and 14% Grenache Blanc is crisp and tasty, with forward aromas of pear, hard peach, yellow florals and a touch of oak-driven spice. Roundly structured, with a lush texture and a nice, clean herbal characteristic to the close. Drink now.
Name: Boekenhoutskloof 2010 The Wolftrap Viognier-Chenin Blanc-Grenache Blanc White (Western Cape)

Description: Basic apple and straw aromas are not that intense but are, at the very least, open and clean. Feels easygoing and nice, with acidity giving it a lift. Tastes dry, with white pepper dust mixed with tropical fruit flavors. Turns more stalky and waxy on the finish.
Name: Alfredo Roca 2011 Roca Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay

Description: A dry blended wine, with attractive rich white fruits, pears and a citrus streak. The wine has a smooth texture, perfumed by lychee and with bright acidity to finish.
Name: Hugel 2010 Gentil Hugel White (Alsace)

Description: This 50-50 blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay is a light-bodied, crisply focused wine. Lime and green apple notes dominate.
Name: Tamburlaine 2009 Wine Lovers Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Orange)

Description: Floral and citrusy smelling, with a lightness of being. Feels equally lean and light in the mouth, with fresh, floral flavors revolving around lychee and lime. Tropical and basic on the finish, with an easygoing way about it.
Name: Aconga 2011 Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Mendoza)

Description: Exuberantly fragrant of ripe, tropical fruit and florals, this Romanian white blend veers towards confected, but it's pleasantly brisk and apple-y on the palate. A good apéritif for casual, weekday enjoyment.
Designation: Single Vineyard Selection Scurta Vineyard Viognier-Tamaioasa Romaneasca
Name: Cramele Halewood 2009 Single Vineyard Selection Scurta Vineyard Viognier-Tamaioasa Romaneasca White (Dealurile Munteniei)

Description: Apple-y on the nose and palate, with just a hint of dust and green leaves, this blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Feteasca Alba is refreshing, with striking acidity. Dry and medium bodied in style.
Name: SERVE 2010 Terra Romana Sauvignon Blanc-Feteasca Alba White (Dealu Mare)

Description: From the Suduiraut vineyard, this is a wine created to be drunk young. It has just the right amount of honey along with marmalade flavors. The texture is smooth, accessible and ready to drink. It combines opulence and freshness.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2009 Lions de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This white blend, modeled after Bordeaux, is two-thirds Sémillon, one-third Sauvignon Blanc. Pretty scents of sweet apricot, peach and melon lead into a midpalate that gathers both strength and concentration. Notes of citrus rind and dusty spices continue into a full and satisfying finish.
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2010 Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Luminesce White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Smells clean as a mountain stream, with apple, peach and mellow citric aromas. Shows medium intensity and controlled citrusy acids along with grapefruit, pineapple and passion fruit flavors that come largely from the 20% Sauvignon Blanc in the blend; the rest is 70% Chardonnay and 10% the local Picapoll grape. Interesting, and a very good Catalonian white wine to match with seafood.
Name: Masies d'Avinyo 2010 Abadal Chardonnay-Sauvignon Blanc-Picapoll White (Pla de Bages)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: Yorkville has been making this blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc (for this vintage it's 60% the first and 40% the latter), for many of its 25 years, and it achieves a nice balance, the Sémillon there for richness, texture and color, the SB for acidity and the wine's citrus and herb finish. Made from organic grapes.
Name: Yorkville Cellars 2010 Eleanor of Aquitaine White (Yorkville Highlands)

Description: Seems as though this medium-sweet Viura-Malvasia blend has gotten better in recent years as the winery has dialed down the sweetness and weight. Lately, this vintage included, Satinela has been fresh, cleanly made and easygoing, with sweet pear and peach flavors and not too much weight or residual sugar. Captures the essence of medium sweet.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2010 Satinela Medium-Sweet White (Rioja)

Description: Feels sturdy and properly acidic, with melon, papaya and apple flavors running alongside almondy bitterness. Simple and quick on the finish; 60% Xarel-lo and 40% Chardonnay.
Designation: Petit Albet Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay-Xarel-lo
Name: Albet I Noya 2010 Petit Albet Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay-Xarel-lo White (Penedès)

Description: A fresh and easy-drinking white made from Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay, the Blanc boasts scents of soft talcum powder, pink peony and orange blossom against a gooseberry and white strawberry fruit backbone. Zippy and prickly in the mouth with a mouthwatering, grassy finish.
Name: Flam 2010 Unoaked Blanc White (Judean Hills)

Description: A blend of Gewürz and Riesling with a splash of icewine added to the mix, Pillitteri's Fusion is bright on the nose and palate with freshly pressed apple and Meyer lemon undertones. Waxy lemon peel and lanolin notes on the midpalate add an extra layer of dimension.
Name: Pillitteri 2009 Fusion Gewürztraminer-Riesling (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A blend of just over one-third Riesling, Atwater's Riewürz boasts a steely precision that cuts through all of Gewürztraminer's ebullient floral and juicy fruit characteristics. Semidry on the palate, with deliciously concentrated pomelo flavors, it finishes on a zesty, candied orange-peel note.
Name: Atwater 2009 Riewürz White (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A white Bordeaux-style blend, crisp and edgy, with green fruit flavors sporting a citrusy kick. Young, tight and tart, it shows its alcohol on the angular finish.
Name: Cloudlift Cellars 2010 Updraft White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Murrieta's blend of 31% Sauvignon Blanc, 27% Viognier, 15% Sémillon, 11% Pinot Blanc, 8% Orange Muscat and 8% Muscat Canellii is well-made and likable, medium-thick and somewhat sweet in style with citrus and almond accents. Delightfully quaffable.
Name: Murrieta's Well 2010 The Whip White Wine White (Livermore Valley)

Description: Very herbaceous, Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine. It has gooseberry flavors that are rounded out with pea and green bean tastes. A wine that can be drunk young and with seafood. Screwcap.
Name: Château Briot 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Moscato aromas leap from the glass, taking the form of shampoo, lychee and jasmine. Feels light but choppy, with dilute lychee and green melon flavors. Not too sticky or cloying.
Name: J. Garcia Carrion 2010 Opera Prima Sweet White White (La Mancha)

Description: Unusual aromas of creamed corn and exotic notes are too unfamiliar to register properly. It's thick but not entirely cloying, with powdered sugar and dried mango flavors. Weird stuff that probably won't find too many takers.
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2010 Viña Albina Semi Dulce White (Rioja)

Description: Strained from front to back. The nose smells pickled and funky, while the palate is boring in feel and tastes candied but also a lot like brine or caper juice. Sweet on the finish.
Name: Torito Bravo NV Sweet Chardonnay-Moscato White (Spain)

Description: With the heart-stopping acidity and intensity of an ice wine, this is an orange marmalade- and honey-flavored wine. It has a poised freshness to go with that great fruit flavor, delicious to drink now but sure to age.
Name: Esterházy 2009 Cuvée Eiswein White (Burgenland)

Description: Showing apricot and honey flavors with a refreshing dash of lemon acidity, this is an intensely sweet and rich wine. The texture is smooth, mellifluous, the dryness of botrytis providing just the right contrast. For aging over many years.
Name: Esterházy 2009 Cuvée Trockenbeerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: As much rich as sweet, this is a honey- and dry botrytis-flavored wine, with tropical mango flavors complementing lemon acidity. It's a complex, intense wine, textured and ageworthy. Screwcap.
Name: Esterházy 2009 Cuvée Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: So rich that it is almost sweet. The yellow fruits give considerable ripeness to this intense, spicy wine. With its smooth, oily texture and its layers of wood, it is almost too much.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2009 Moulin des Dames White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: A wine that balances considerable sweetness against the most exhilarating freshness. It has honey, yellow fruits, orange peel alongside touches of greener plums and herbs. A great aperitif wine.
Name: Château de Jurque 2009 Tendresse  (Jurançon)

Description: This Sauvignon Blanc and Roditis blend shows how successful the combination of indigenous and international varieties can be. Enticing aromas of peach, melon and a touch of apple are followed by a vibrant balance of flavors—fresh flowers, summer fruits and spice. Minerality keeps the wine dancing on the palate. Great on its own or paired with fish, salads, cheeses.
Name: Estate Constantin Gofas 2010 Mythic River Sauvignon-Roditis White (Corinth)

Description: The nose on this white appeals from the get-go. Elegant waves of lemon, orange blossom and peach aromas are followed by a balanced but luxurious blend of pear, peach and white flowers on the palate. Big but pretty.
Name: Elios 2009 Mediterranean White White (Peloponnese)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The blend of Colombard, Gros Manseng and Sauvignon Blanc gives a light mineral character. The wine is very fresh, very crisp and finely layered, with a depth of herbaceous and green fruit flavors. Screwcap.
Name: Haut Marin 2010 Cuvée Marine White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: A very aromatic wine, smoothly textured. Flavors of yellow fruits are spiced up by vanilla from the wood aging. The acidity is light, and almost lost in this rich wine.
Name: Domaine Rotier 2009 Renaissance Sec White (Gaillac)

Description: The dominance of young Sémillon in the blend gives considerable herbaceousness. The wine has a fresh, grassy character, its acidity offering freshness within the full texture.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2010 Cuvée des Conti White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: A herbal wine, its sweetness just an element in a series of crisp, fresh flavors. The wine has weight and concentration, with a tangy texture of lemon zest and exotic fruits.
Name: Château Jolys 2009  Jurançon

Description: Emphasizing the herbaceous nature of Gros Manseng, this is a ripe, full and fruity wine. The flavors of fresh citrus combine with herbs and broad beans to give a wine with some weight, although with taut final acidity.
Name: Château Jolys 2010  Jurançon Sec

Description: At first you might think it's too oaky, because the nose is heavily influenced by barrel toast and vanilla. But as it unfolds complexity rises up, as do melon and peach scents. Feels plump and oily, with powdery peach flavors. Finishes honeyed and creamy, with good acidity. Sauvignon Vert with Pinot Grigio, Chardonnay and Torrontés.
Name: François Lurton 2010 Gran Lurton Corte Friulano White (Mendoza)

Description: Fleshy peach, spice and citrus lead on this fresh, fun white from Cyprus, which displays good balance of refreshing summer fruit and minerals with an underpinning of honeyed softness. Versatile and easygoing, this will pair well with grilled fish and poultry.
Name: Chrysorroyiatissa 2010 Ayios Andronicos White (Pafos)

Description: This interesting Chenin-based blend, also made with 15% Sauvignon Blanc and 8% Semillon, offers attractive notes of soft toast, orange rind and wood-grilled apples drizzled with honey. It's medium weight and round in the mouth, but balanced with a clean but nutty finish.
Name: Nabygelegen 2010 Lady Anna White (Wellington)

Description: White melon rind and key lime citrus abound in the bouquet of this intricate white blend made from 40% Rhine Riesling, 33% Viognier, 13% Sauvignon Blanc, 11% Chenin Blanc and 3% Chardonnay. The mouth is ripe and full of tropical fruit flavors, with sweet but zippy pineapple acidity lingering after swallow.
Name: Bouchard Finlayson 2010 Blanc de Mer White (Western Cape)

Description: An herbaceous blend of Gros and Petit Manseng, very dry, crisp and green. It has gooseberry and green bean flavors. Ready to drink now.
Name: Château de Jurque 2010 Fantasie  (Jurançon Sec)

Description: A fresh and white-fruited wine. It has the crispest acidity along with open melon and peach fruits, moving to a soft, ripe aftertaste. A great apéritif wine.
Name: Domaine de la Sanglière 2010 Signature White (Côtes de Provence)

Description: A richly opulent blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon. It is rich, almost too rich due to its low acidity, but with some attractive melon, green plum and peach fruits. The spice from wood adds interest.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2010 White (Bergerac Sec)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Deliciously herbaceous wine, with the freshest green fruit flavors, plus lemon and grapefruit. The Colombard adds a little spice to give it a final burst of freshness.
Name: Domaine de Ballade 2010 White (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: You can smell a hint of ginger spice in the bouquet of this wine, presumably from the splash of Gewürz in this Chenin- and Chardonnay-dominant blend. Otherwise, notes of yellow peach, toasted brioche and ripe melon abound, with a good acidic lift to the close to keep things fresh.
Name: Push Me to the Floor 2010 White (Coastal Region)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: As fresh as possible, this herb- and orange-flavored wine is crisp, driven by its fruit and acidity, finishing with a burst of fruit juice. It is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine la Salette 2010 White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: A classic go-to, this blend offers great freshness and ripe fruit flavors at a terrific price. Green melon, red apple, ripe citrus and a touch of floral character all unfold in the nose and mouth, ending with a crisp and mouthwatering finish.
Name: Goats do Roam Wine Co. 2010 White White (Western Cape)

Description: Subtle lemon spice and minerals on the nose lead into flavors of fresh lemon and orange, flowers and a touch of honeyed spice. The finish is spicy with a touch of bitter orange rind. A pretty wine with a refreshing character.
Name: Hatzidakis Winery 2010 White (Santorini)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A wine that shows plenty of herbaceous character, very fresh and crisp. There is an attractive lemon zest tang along with apricot and melon. Screwcap.
Name: Haut Marin 2010 Colombard/Ugni Blanc White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Vibrant and fresh citrus aromas lead on this white blend from Greece. Lemon zest, orange marmalade and spice flavors on the palate are simple but good. Pair with grilled sardines, mussels, or a fresh salad.
Name: Hatzimichalis 2009 Domaine Hatzimichalis Kapnias White (Atalanti Valley)

Description: Neutral on the nose except for some generic white fruit aromas and saline. Feels tight, linear and driving, with modest apple and vanilla flavors. Turns more barrel-driven and creamy on the finish. Not stellar at this price.
Name: Bressia 2009 Lágrima Canela White (Mendoza)

Description: This white blend of Malagousia and Moscholfilero starts with aromas of bright citrus, tropical fruit and a hint of musky spice. On the palate, it's a creamy blend of tropical fruit and peach, though slightly clumsy. The wine finishes with a spicy spin.
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2010 Oenodea White (Drama)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A wine that is dominated by the perfumed Colombard, leaving the more herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc to one side. It is soft with just a light lemon zest edge. Screwcap.
Name: Haut Marin 2010 Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Aromas of talc, citrus and flowers start this Muscat, but are somewhat strange. The flavors of flowers, lemon and tropical fruit are appealing, but overall, the wine lacks unity and focus.
Name: Petros Honas 2010 Phelonoe White (Lemnos)

Description: This blend of Savatiano and Roditis is very popular in Greece and perhaps a bit too exotic for mainstream palates, but it's easy drinking and priced well. Aromas of citrus and melon are followed by peach and honeydew melon flavors. Simple but friendly.
Name: Achaia Clauss NV Demestica White White (Greece)

Description: A tropical- fruited wine, full of toast and apricot and melon fruits. It is deliciously ripe and soft with the acidity lost in the richness. It is opulent and already a pleasure to drink.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2009  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This is the first vintage of a wine that used to be called Laville Haut-Brion. It is ripe and opulent with exotic fruits and generosity, very open, very rich. Pineapple, yellow fruits and toast are all present.
Name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2009  Pessac-Léognan

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This new vintage of Chaleur Estate Blanc is still quite young and tight. It shows the toasty scents of pretty new oak, set in an elegant frame of mixed fruits. Cucumber, apple, citrus and melon flavors emerge, suggesting an overall lighter style from a cooler vintage. Graceful and polished.
Name: DeLille 2010 Chaleur Estate Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bergevin Lane's Calico White never fails to please. The 2010 is one-third Chardonnay, the rest a mix of Viognier, Roussanne and Marsanne. Dry and silky, with subtle stone fruit flavors and authoritative grip, this nicely balanced wine has exceptional length for its modest price.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2010 Calico White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The one-third of Sémillon in this wine gives it a feeling of weight and richness. It has a touch of spice from new wood, flavors of ripe pear and pink grapefruit and a full, rounded mouthfeel.
Name: Château Villa Bel Air 2010  Graves

Description: It's pricey for a Margaret River Sauv-Sem blend, but the pedigree of the wine shows in its refined crispness and tight, citrusy finish. On the palate, fig and melon flavors are tinged with a mixture of graphite and cedar. Drink now–2015, possibly longer.
Name: Cullen 2010 Cullen Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: Ripe, full-bodied white Graves, its flavors coming from tropical fruit, rich and complex. Good wood underscores the yellow fruit flavors and ripeness. Ready to drink, but could also age 2–3 years.
Name: Château Haut-Peyrous 2009  Graves

Description: A limited-production white from just outside Saint-Èmilion. It has a Burgundian richness with mango, apricot and kiwi fruits, spiced further with the wood aging. The acidity knifes right through the wine to keep all these flavors fresh and crisp.
Name: Le Nardian 2009  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A rich wine from a fine Sauternes year. It has honey, sweet orange marmalade and just enough freshness. At the same time, there is enough botrytis to give a good dry edge. With its weight and bit of spice, it could age.
Name: Château Gravas 2009  Sauternes

Description: The high proportion of Sémillon in the blend gives the wine an extra richness. That rounds out the more herbaceous character and brings in ripe peach and kiwi flavors. It's already a lively, drinkable wine, but should only improve over another few months.
Name: Château l'Avocat 2010  Graves

Description: Slightly sweet smelling, with butterscotch and salinic notes to the soft, somewhat bland nose. Feels fleshy, with modest acidity and creamy flavors of apple, banana and melon. Mellow late, with a creamy, vanilla-tinged finish. Viura and Malvasia.
Name: Finca Allende 2009 Allende White (Rioja)

Description: Soft apple- and honey-flavored wine that has dry botrytis and a spiced texture. With flavors of lemon curd and peach, it is more in a light Barsac style, fruity as well as sweet.
Name: Château Hallet 2009  Sauternes

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: A smooth, wood-aged wine that has a rich texture, layers of toast and nutmeg from the wood and peach fruits. The wood needs time to integrate, but already shows that this is going to be a rich wine.
Name: Château Bertinerie 2009 Cru Réserve  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Very herbal Sauvignon Blanc, crisp and tangy, with flavors of lime and green apple skins. Fresh as well as structured, with a final zest of acidity.
Name: Château les Arromans 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Attractive white Bordeaux blend, much better than the red from the same estate. It has a delicious ripe fruit character with pineapple, lime and kiwi flavors and final acidity.
Name: Château Grand Jean 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Mild and appealing on the nose, with just enough citrus to convince you that it's Sauvignon Blanc. Solid and not at all spritzy or wild feeling, with gooseberry, lime and passion fruit flavors. Finishes pithy but true, with lasting citrus and green herb notes.
Name: Oveja Negra 2011 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc-Carmenère White (Maule Valley)

Description: Roughly half and half Pinot Gris and Viognier, the 2010 PGV offers clean, fresh, right out of the vat apple and pear fruit flavors. Nicely textured and done in a straight-ahead, drink-now style, this also has just a hint of sweetness to round out the finish.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2010 PGV White (Washington)

Description: This wine's flamboyant aromas of passion fruit and cut grass are unfortunately not quite matched on the palate, where the flavors are more restrained. It's medium in body and rather lean, with a crisp, fully dry finish. The blend is 69% Sauvignon Blanc, 31% Semillon.
Name: Leeuwin Estate 2010 Siblings Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)
