Description: An attractive herbaceous wine, its acidity with a strong citrus element. Asparagus, pineapple and green plums all give a bright, fresh character.
Name: Château de Fontenille 2010  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: This intensely fruity wine has richness, yellow fruit flavors and a touch of spice and citrus zest. Its soft aftertaste that makes it immediately attractive.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2010 Sélection Prestige  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Dominated by grapefruit and pineapple flavors, this is very fresh and herbaceous. The wine is crisp and clean, with acidity at the end. Drink over the next year.
Name: Château Lauretan 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This pleasant, medium-bodied blend of 70% Sauvignon Blanc and 30% Semillon features ample flavors of passion fruit and pink grapefruit. It's not complex, but over the next year or so it will wash down seafood just fine.
Name: Plantagenet 2010 Hazard Hill Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Western Australia)

Description: A simple, fresh white with citrus fruit, a touch of wood and some pineapple sweetness. It is rounded and herbaceous, ready to drink.
Name: De Mour 2008 Prince Rubis  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Perfumed, chunky and almondy on the nose. Feels full and oily but also a bit juicy, with driving, penetrating orange and grapefruit flavors. Offers proper weight and spicy citrus flavors on the finish. Drink immediately as it's losing freshness and turning yellow.
Name: Volteo 2010 Verdejo-Viognier-Sauvignon Blanc White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: A gently sweet wine with apricot and honey flavors over some dryness. The wine is relatively light-bodied which allows it to be a good apéritif style as well as a partner with fruit desserts.
Name: Cheval Quancard 2010  Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: A simple quaffer with lime, pineapple and minerally aromas. It's light and easygoing, with a dilute feel and tropical flavors of mango, lime and apple. Lasting and fairly juicy on the finish.
Name: Bodegas Muriel 2010 Blanco Vendimia Seleccionada White (Rioja)

Description: Crisply fruity, herbaceous and citric, with lemon zest and fine pineapple. The wine's acidity should soften in a year.
Name: Château Tanesse 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Attractively balanced wine, its apple and pear acidity giving a very fruity character. There is a burst of lemon zest for extreme freshness with some grassy herbal character right at the end.
Name: Château Julian 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A soft, fruity wine with an attractive citrus character. There's also an herbaceous quality and hints of green apple.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2011 The Pairing Collection Salmon & Trout  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: White currants and grapefruit dominate this wine. It could be drunk now but will certainly improve for the next two years when the fruit will be more in balance and the acidity better integrated.
Name: Château Duc d'Arnauton 2010  Graves

Description: Flowery and blowsy smelling, with notes of ham, gardenia and honey, all of which are textbook for Viognier. Feels racy, with just enough smoothness to the body. Green apple, pineapple and lettuce flavors finish short and minerally.
Name: Tamaya 2010 VCS White (Limarí Valley)

Description: Oily and melony smelling and after that it's pretty much your average, innocuous white wine. Feels like orange juice on the palate and tastes like orange and tangerine. Cleansing, fresh enough and easy to drink.
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2010 White (Rueda)

Description: Fleshy, soft and honeyed on the nose, with spiced pear aromas. Feels sort of flabby, with soft acids and meaty, mustardy flavors of white fruits that finish blowsy. Flowery and fluffy now, but it seems to be fading.
Name: Oveja Negra 2010 Reserva Chardonnay-Viognier (Maule Valley)

Description: Soft, fruity wine, very smooth, its pear and green plum flavors integrated into acidity along with a light touch of sweetness. Ready to drink.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2010 Réserve Spéciale  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Peach aromas open a smooth wine. It has acidity certainly but also some good melon and pear ripeness. There is an herbaceous edge that cuts through the finish.
Name: Château Dame Jane 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Briny and stemmy smelling, which adds up to pickled. Feels juicy and scouring, with lime, citrus peel and bitterness on the flavor profile. Pithy and bitter on the finish.
Name: Estampa 2010 Estate Viognier-Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This nonvintage 54% Pinot Noir-46% Chardonnay sparkler is as good as ever, a beautiful peach color with peach and strawberry aromas and flavors that are not too overpowering, not too subtle, just right. The creamy mousse, medium body and bright acidity make it a stunner with food. Bring on the goat cheese fritters or tempura.
Name: Scharffenberger NV Brut Rose Pinot-Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An intriguing blend—half Viognier, the rest a mix of Chardonnay, Sémillon and Grenache Blanc. It could easily turn generic, but does not; instead it is a snappy mouthful of stone fruits, spice, and refreshing acidity, well-defined and precise.
Name: Kontos 2010 LeeVeLooLee Gossamer White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: When caught fresh, this is one of the Txakoli region's best wines. It comes on hard, clacky and tight as a box of nails, with citrus and minerally aromas. The palate is crisp and tight, with apple, lime, kiwi and spritz. Long, clean and refreshing.
Name: Txomín Etxaníz 2010 Getaria White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: This three-grape blend of Xarello, Muscat and Gewürztraminer is floral and inviting, with melony aromas. The palate is light but has stuffing and creamy edges. Tastes flowery, with green melon, lychee, honey and clover. Smooth, tasty and different.
Name: Temps de Flors 2010 White (Penedès)

Description: Gold in color and loaded with heavily toasted, resiny barrel aromas. The palate is lush and Burgundian, with lemon, baked apple, woodspice and white pepper flavors. Toasty and well structured for a barrel-fermented Spanish white.
Name: Coto de Gomariz 2009 Colleita Seleccionada White (Ribeiro)
Domaine Marcel Deiss 2004 Altenberg de Bergheim Grand Cru White (Alsace)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: A creamy blend of 70% Sémillon and 30% Sauvignon Blanc from a longstanding producer of dozens of wines in the Yorkville Highlands appellation in Mendocino. The wine is rich and layered, tasting of lime and crème brûlée.
Name: Yorkville Cellars 2009 Eleanor of Aquitaine White (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Horse & Plow continues to impress with its moderately priced wines that taste great. Harvester is a blend of 38% Pinot Gris, 34% Riesling and 28% Chardonnay that's austere aromatically and deep golden in color, woody and tasting of tart green apple, unearthed mushrooms with a lemony finish.
Name: Horse & Plow 2010 Harvester White White (North Coast)

Description: This is a perennial winner among well-priced Spanish whites. The nose is clean, light and suggests apple blossom and buttercup. The palate has a good, tight, regular feel and honest flavors of green fruits and melon. Pleasant at every checkpoint.
Name: Viña Costeira 2010 White (Ribeiro)

Description: This blend of Vermentino (45%), Grenache Blanc (40%) and Roussanne (15%) is aged in a combination of oak and stainless steel, resulting in a round, mouthfilling wine that nevertheless remains crisp and easy to drink. Hints of smoke and marshmallow serve to accent the ripe melon, pineapple and honey flavors. Drink now.
Name: Marrenon 2009 Doria White (Luberon)

Description: A taut wine, laced with acidity, citrus fruits and green apples. It's textured, mineral and steely in character, with perfumed Williams pears to add sweetness.
Name: Tinhof 2008 Leithaberg Weiss White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Clean, minerally and subtle on the nose, with apple notes. The palate is crisp and honest, with normal, likable apple and citrus flavors. Just fleshy enough on the finish, with good length and acidity.
Name: Real Compañia de Vinos 2010 Blanco White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Apple blossoms and sweetpea notes accent fleshy sweet melon and roasted hazelnut flavors on this unctuous, full-bodied Hungarian dry white. Brisk lemony acidity and a bitter lemon pith note add balance and verve on the finish.
Name: Sauska 2009 Cuvée 113 White (Tokaj)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A 60/40 Sauvignon Blanc/Sémillon blend, done in the Bordeaux style. Fermented in neutral oak, aged sur lie, and left in the barrels for another half year, the wine is lightly toasty with steely fruit flavors and a firm, solid mouthfeel.
Name: Saviah 2010 Star Meadows White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This non-vintage blend of Sémillon, Chardonnay, Gewurztraminer, Pinot Gris, and Sylvaner does not simply turn generic. Off-dry and nicely balanced, it captures some special nuance of each component grape – flower, clay, stone fruit and bracing acidity.
Name: David Hill NV Farmhouse White White (America)

Description: A little wheaty and bready on the nose, with mild pear accents. The palate is round, simple and slightly oily in texture, with peach and melon flavors. Finishes solid, with white pepper notes and pith.
Name: Coto de Gomariz 2010 Blanco White (Ribeiro)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A blend of 55% Chenin Blanc and 45% Viognier, with the Chenin strongly represented. This wine unveils caramel popcorn and oak-influenced pear-vanilla, its layers of texture workable with a wide range of food.
Name: Shenandoah 2010 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Amador County)

Description: Soft, warm and rounded wine, this is open and generous. The fruit is rich enough to miss some balancing acidity, although the wine has a rich, yellow fruit character.
Name: Tinhof 2009 White (Leithaberg)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Coming from Gros Manseng and Sauvignon Blanc grown in Gascony, this is light, just a hint of sweetness and refreshing acidity. Yellow fruit and pineapple flavors dominate this great aperitif wine.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2010 Villa Chambre d'Amour White (Vin de France)

Description: Here's a Txakoli that's devoid of spritz and bubbles. It's a classic dry white table wine with zest and minerality along with flavors of melon, green apple and lime. Limited in scope but good if you like a tangy, tart, acid-rich white.
Name: Txorierri 2010 Uixar White (Bizkaiko Txakolina)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Produced mainly from grapes grown in Gascony, this fruity, herbaceous wine with its pure line of citrus is ready-to-drink, light, just crying out for fish or shellfish.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2010 Villa Beaurivage White (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vi de la Terra Mallorca, Spanish Islands, Spain
Description: Peachy and waxy on the nose, with floral notes. The palate is tight, acidic and drawing, with citrus, apple and other basic flavors. Turns drier and tighter the more it airs. Finishes semibitter. A blend of Premsal and Callet, two Mallorcan grapes.
Name: Ànima Negra 2010 Quíbia White (Vi de la Terra Mallorca)

Appellation: Vin de Pays Var, Provence, France
Description: With a strong toast element, this is perhaps too woody, not fruity enough. There is a burnt character that smothers the fruit, although the texture suggests some roundness.
Name: Château Routas 2009 Coquelicot Viognier-Chardonnay (Vin de Pays Var)

Appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: The 20% Viognier doesn't seem to make much of impression, as the wine lacks that variety's often flamboyant aromatics. Instead, it delivers modest lime and grapefruit flavors, medium body and a crisp, abbreviated finish.
Name: Château de la Tuilerie 2009 Viognier-Grenache Blanc (Costières de Nîmes)

Description: Oily apple and peach aromas show no glaring faults. Round and citrusy in the mouth, with tropical melon and banana flavors offset by grapefruit zest. A bit rough and acidic. Sauvignon, Chardonnay and Viognier.
Name: Tacama 2010 Blanco de Blancos White (Ica)

Description: Applesauce aromas are sweet and dusty. Then in the mouth it's weighty and cloys, with candied white fruit flavors, vanilla and a sugary aftertaste. Hints of lemon and proper acidity give it some quality.
Name: Tacama 2010 Semi-Seco Blanco White (Ica)

Description: Apple and citrus aromas struggle to hold it together. Citrusy acids control the palate, yielding grapefruit, orange and pithy flavors. Feels unruly. Sauvignon, Sémillon, Chenin Blanc and Viognier.
Name: Tacama 2010 Gran Blanco White (Ica)

Description: Floral and honeyed smelling at first, with suggestions of Moscatel. Lime and gardenia aromas settle in afterward, leading to a flat, bland, sweet palate with lime-like flavors. Gets worse and weaker as it airs out, ultimately ending in chaos.
Name: Bodegas Virgen del Águila 2009 Seis Circles Viura-Chardonnay (Cariñena)

Description: This full-bodied wine with its spice and creamed pear fruit flavors, feels rich and smooth. Structured and textured, the balanced acidity shows through well, giving a warm, off-dry aftertaste.
Name: Domaine Seilly 2008 Vin de Pistolet d'Obernai White (Alsace)

Description: Just what is says on the label: this is a bone-dry, mineral and steel wine with citrus flavors. It is full of vivid acidity that bursts in the mouth. There is just a hint of bitterness at the end.
Name: Domaine Léon Boesch 2008 Brut Zéro White (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: A blend of Pinot Gris and Riesling, this is a full, rich wine, the flavors of the two varieties showing through as spice and steel. There is also plenty of white fruit flavor and citrus acidity on the finish. Screwcap.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2008 Black Tie White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Sweet and viscous, this blend of Chardonnay, Sémillon, Moscato and Viognier is forward in fruit flavors, mostly tropical and stone fruit. The Viognier sweetness doesn't linger too long on the finish and it would be very sippable stone cold on a hot day.
Name: un4seen 2010 White Blend White (California)

Description: This blended wine is as rich as so many others produced by Olivier Humbrecht. It also has a delicious, delicate line of acidity and pear juice flavors that suggest an attractive off-dry apéritif style.
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2009 Zind White (Alsace)

Description: This unusual blend of Silvaner and Traminer shows a distinctly earthy edge to its grapefruit and melon flavors and a pronounced tart tang that balances its ripe plumpness on the palate. Drink now.
Name: Castell 2009 Trautberg Trocken Silvaner-Traminer (Franken)

Description: Dominated by Sylvaner, this blend also brings out the attractive perfumes of Muscat to give a softly spicy wine, very light and fruity. Fine acidity gives the whole wine a lift.
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2009 White (Alsace)

Description: Crustacés means shellfish. Does the wine go with shellfish? Yes, with its fine, light, just steely acidity, a perfumed character and its bright, clean finish.
Name: Dopff & Irion 2010 Crustacés White (Alsace)

Description: A Gentil is a blended wine, and this wine brings together Gewürztraminer, Pinot Gris, Riesling, Sylvaner and Pinot Blanc. The result is an harmonious whole, soft with good acidity, a touch of spice and ripe peach and white currant fruit.
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2009 Pfaff Gentil White (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Gently soft wine, with a creamy character. There are light white and citrus fruit flavors, hints of green herbs and just the right amount of acidity.
Name: Wolfberger 2010 Edelzwicker White (Alsace)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The best sbs yet, this riveting and succulent blend of 75% Sauvignon Blanc and 25% Sémillon is a spicy, tangy, racy wine with thrilling flavors across the full spectrum. From nettle to gooseberry, citrus and grapefruit, it has a lush texture and bracing minerality that persist through a long, intense finish.
Name: Cadaretta 2010 sbs Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine seems a bit sweaty at first, but with a little aeration it becomes more toasty and citrusy. Hints of honey and tangerine mark the palate, but with its modest alcohol and crisp acidity, it never seems heavy at all. Try as an apéritif or with seafood.
Name: Cullen 2009 Ephraim Clarke Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: Mouthfilling and round, filled with ripe pineapple and passion fruit flavors. There are some sweaty and mealy notes balanced by hints of stone fruit, which all act to build complexity and interest. Potent and long on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Cape Mentelle 2010 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A Riesling, Pinot Gris, Gewürztraminer, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier blend, with aromas that are most reminiscent of Viognier and Gewürz with that mix of crisp citrus and bright, floral fruit. Packed with tasty fruit flavor of melon, apricot and peach, this lingers gracefully through the finish.
Name: Waterbrook 2010 Mélange Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Herbaceous, crisp wine with green notes leading to grapefruit and lemon zest flavors. The wine is clear as a bell, with its fruit deliciously forward.
Name: Château Haut Selve 2010  Graves

Description: Packed with great Sauvignon Blanc herbal flavors, this is a delicious wine, at the cool end of the spectrum of white wine. Grapefruit and lemon juice are enlivened by a grassy texture and crisp, fresh acidity.
Name: Dourthe 2010 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Hunter Valley, New South Wales, Australia
Description: Most Hunter Valley Semillons are unblended, but this one adds Sauvignon Blanc for increased aromatics. It's lemony and fresh, with some leafy notes on the nose, then crisp and citrusy without being severe on the palate. The mouthwatering finish lingers nicely.
Name: Hungerford Hill 2010 Fishcage Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Hunter Valley)

Description: A natural type of blended white with vanilla, powdered sugar, peach, pear and citrus on the bouquet. The palate is fresh and zesty, with apple, citrus and peach flavors, and no oak, resin or toast foisted into the glass. Nicely focused throughout, with a good mouthfeel. Chardonnay with 15% each of Sauvignon Blanc and Torrontés.
Name: La Posta 2010 Cocina Blanco White (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe and herbaceous, there is a great zing to this wine. It has crisp grapefruit and lemon flavors, pushing through the green apple skin texture. A real seafood wine.
Name: Château de Beauregard-Ducourt 2010  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Attractive wine, boasting a good balance between herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc and a more perfumed character from Muscadelle. It has a creamy character along with intense acidity, leaving a fresh taste in the mouth.
Name: Château de Parenchère 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Ripe, fruity wine, pushing at the tropical fruit end of the spectrum. The flavors are creamy, touched by wood, and deliciously ripe. Age for a year.
Name: Château le Bonnat 2010  Graves

Description: This is a plump, slightly creamy-textured blend of approximately 60% Sauvignon Blanc and 40% Semillon. Lime, melon and white pepper notes mark the nose and palate, while the finish is crisp. Drink it over the next six months or so.
Name: James Oatley 2009 Tic Tok Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Western Australia)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Melon and almond skin aromas lead to pithy citrus on what amounts to a pretty good bouquet. Round, citrusy and fresh in the mouth, with orange, passion fruit and tropical leanings. Solid and well shaped for a $7 quaffer. 70% Airen and 30% Macabeo.
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2010 Protocolo Blanco White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Soft, ripe, cleanly made wine. It has some of the herbaceous character of many white Bordeaux, but toned down and given warmth by a sweetly perfumed aftertaste.
Name: Château Bonnet 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A relatively small-production offering from Michael David at 3,600 cases, this white wine blend is quaffable, full-bodied and slightly sweet.
Name: Incognito 2010 White (Lodi)

Description: Billed as a dessert wine, this is in fact more of an apéritif wine, with its botrytis sweetness muted by a soft, open character. It has ripe apricot flavors, hints of honey and a tang of orange peel.
Name: Château Suau 2009 500 ml  (Cadillac)

Description: An unusual blend of Viura, Chardonnay and Moscatel with unusual aromas of mustard seed, gardenia and oily lemon extract. The palate is chunky and round, with soft, floral green fruit flavors. Mellow and smooth, with somewhat low acidity on the finish.
Name: Ochoa 2010 Viura-Chardonnay (Navarra)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A simple, five-grape blend. Perfectly sound sipping white, clean and short.
Name: Goose Ridge 2009 g3 White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Soft, open wine, with some attractive perfumed character as well as light acidity. It is somewhat unfocused, missing structure. Screwcap.
Name: Château Suau 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Muddled apple and spice aromas are o.k. and improve with familiarity. The palate runs narrow and tight, with sharp acidity and stalky flavors of lemon, green apple and lime. Finishes fresh and cutting, with controlled pithiness. 70% Chardonnay and 30% SB.
Name: Benegas 2010 Clara Benegas Chardonnay-Sauvignon (Mendoza)

Description: Sulphuric at first, with citrus and air freshener aromas. The palate has a certain roundness and fleshy quality, while the flavors are sweet, melony and a little oily. Some almond-skin bitterness rises up late, most likely reflecting the 25% Viognier in the blend.
Name: Zuccardi 2010 Serie A Chardonnay-Viognier (Mendoza)

Description: A blended wine, so rich with flavors of toffee, apples and honey, given a lift with intense acidity. The wine has enormous concentration, a smooth and beautiful texture. Age for many years.
Designation: Nouvelle Vague Grande Cuvée Nummer 6 Trockenbeerenauslese
Name: Kracher 2008 Nouvelle Vague Grande Cuvée Nummer 6 Trockenbeerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: Despite the light alcohol, the wine feels full, with a complex array of green and white fruit flavors, certainly crisp, but also with a tangy structure, ripe fruits and final rounded, warm acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Dürnberg 2010 Cool Climate White (Niederösterreich)

Description: Shows stalky hay on the nose along with apple and lemon drop. The palate is crisp, focused and elegant, with driving acidity and bright flavors of apple, lemon and nectarine. As a barrel fermented wine, it's lightly woody as it finishes long and strong. 90% Viura with Malvasia.
Name: Muga 2010 Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: Waxy white fruit aromas of peach and apple are a touch baked, with vanilla peeking through. The palate is smooth and offers good mouthfeel, while the flavors of lemon, apple and hay are good and finish buttery and creamy. Made by Finca Allende; 70% Viura and 30% Malvasia.
Name: Finca Nueva 2009 Fermentado en Barrica Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: A bit resiny and hard at first, with apple and a lot of oak on a compact, somewhat neutral nose. It's a heavy wine in the mouth, with oak on top of lemon, apple and green banana flavors. Finishes resiny, with odd spice notes. Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca is the mix.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2009 Organza White (Rioja)

Description: Apple, toast and a hint of mineral on the nose precede a chunky, almost chubby palate with candied flavors of melon and apple. Turns creamier the longer it sits, with baked notes and a slight stickiness. 70% Viura and 30% Malvasia.
Name: Remírez de Ganuza 2009 Erre Punto Barrel Fermented Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: A different breed in that it's semisweet and kind of sticky. The nose breathes odd spice and resiny aromas along with banana and cream. The palate is solid but soft, with mango, melon and sugary peach flavors. Has just enough spice to remain fresh.
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2010 Diamante Semi Sweet Malvasia-Viura White (Rioja)

Description: Starts out with pineapple, dusty mineral and stemmy aromas. Melony and soft in the mouth, with honeydew and nectarine flavors. Finishes soft, standard and a little mealy. 70% Verdejo with 30% Viura.
Name: Esperanza 2010 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: Gritty and hard on the nose. The palate is spritzy in feel and tastes vegetal and bitter. Briney on the finish. Just not that good. 70% Chardonnay and 30% Moscatel.
Name: Bodegas Fontana 2010 Mesta White (Uclés)

Description: Exotic aromas of coconut, honey and spice start this unique wine from Sigalas. On the palate, waves of lemon, coconut and vanilla are balanced by acidity and spice. Delicious, and unfolding on the tongue, it has its own distinct personality, with a faraway flair.
Name: Domaine Sigalas 2004 VinSanto White (Santorini)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This popular white blend shows really well in this new vintage. Half Viognier and the rest a Chardonnay-Sauvignon-Sémillon mix, it maintains its focus and offers layered fruits annotated with fresh herbs and light pepper. Thoroughly delicious and drinking beautifully.
Name: JM Cellars 2010 Bramble Bump White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This assertive blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Assyrtico and Sémillon offers an appealing nose of melon, lemon and peach, with a rounded blend of melon and citrus flavors. Fresh acidity and spice give it lift. Delightful and versatile, this is a delicious go-to wine for summer.
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2010 Amethystos White (Drama)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: For anyone who wants to walk the walk of low-alcohol wines, this is a place to start, a 12.5% alcohol blend of Sémillon, Sauvignon Blanc, Viognier, Muscat Canelli, Gewürztraminer and Orange Muscat all grown in the Livermore Valley. This wine has inviting notes of toffee, vanilla and caramel and will make a welcome companion at any backyard barbecue or casual dinner party.
Name: Murrieta's Well 2009 The Whip White (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Viognier, Roussanne and Grüner Veltliner mix pleasantly in this newest edition of Syncline's popular Subduction white. Tasted shortly after bottling, it was delightful, though perhaps not yet at its peak. Spicy and aromatic, with melon, herb and lemongrass, and just a whiff of white pepper.
Name: Syncline 2010 Subduction White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: All stainless fermented, mostly Chardonnay, this makes a serious play for a place on the $12 white wine shelf. Clean, crisp, stylish and focused, it brings green apple and melon fruit up against a firm border of skin tannins––citrus rind and such. Zippy and fresh.
Name: Script & Seal 2009 White Blend White (Washington)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Zippy flavors of melon and new-mowed grass, nicely integrated and loaded with the sort of spicy herbs that might have come fresh from the garden. Note the relatively low alcohol, making this a perfect summer sipping wine.
Name: Brian Carter 2009 Oriana White (Yakima Valley)

Description: This fuller-bodied white blend offers pineapple, kiwi and citrus on the nose, and a blend of full fruit and acidity on the palate. A balanced, easygoing white that is perfect for everyday poultry, vegetable and fish meals.
Name: Domaine Sigalas 2010 Asirtiko Athiri White (Santorini)

Description: Pristine on the nose and palate with soft white peach, Meyer lemon and green floral notes, this crisp white is the perfect apéritif or seafood pairing. While fairly full in body, its puckery lemon and tangerine flavors and clean, minerally finish make this an elegant pick.
Name: Telavi 2008 Marani Kondoli Vineyards Mtsvane-Kisi White (Kakheti)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This pleasant blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Chardonnay and Riesling has the flesh, the fruit and the bracing acidity to be a fine summer sipper. Peaches and herb (not the singing duo!) dominate, with a fresh, fleshy finish.
Name: Saint Laurent 2008 Lucky White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Smoky and rich with a swirl of petrol, dried apple and smoked nut skin flavors on the nose and palate, this is a dry, full-bodied white blend that's intentionally savory in style. Pleasantly pithy in the midpalate with hints of sun-dried hay and orange peel.
Name: Château Musar 2009 Musar Jeune White (Bekaa Valley)

Description: Toasty aromas are followed by flavors of fresh white fruit and nuts on the palate. The wine has a leaner character than one might expect from the nose but is fresh, clean and appealing. A nice everyday white.
Name: Dimitra 2010 Geromilos Farms White (Messinia)

Description: This white blend offers bright aromas and flavors of grapefruit, pear and green apple. There's also an interesting floral note here as well which balances the leaner fruits. The wine finishes crisp with a minerally lime spin. Pair with raw oysters, grilled fish or chicken.
Name: Hatzimichalis 2009 Estate Hatzimichalis Veriki White (Atalanti Valley)

Description: Curious on the nose with hints of orange peels, resin and a dusty, floral aroma, the 2004 Gaston Horchar shows a subdued fruit and floral quality that's faded from the 2003. Flickers of orange and fresh apple brighten a palate that's yeasty and warm like fino sherry. Round and rich with an umami-laden finish.
Name: Château Musar 2004 Gaston Hochar White (Bekaa Valley)

Description: Smooth and citrusy on the nose, with grapefruit and minerally aromas. The palate is medium in weight, with good acidity and pithy green fruit and grapefruit flavors. Brings bite and a dusting of green chile spice on the finish.
Name: Oveja Negra 2010 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc-Carmenére White (Maule Valley)

Description: This wine has a feminine touch, with its floral, aromatic nose and delicate flavors of flowers, citrus and melon. Pretty and quiet, it will pair well with more subdued fare such a fruit, salads and mild cheeses.
Name: Lyrarakis 2010 Okto Dry White Wine White (Crete)

Description: Rich with roasted hazelnuts and a high-toned citrus aroma, this Lebanese white is deliberately oxidized to produce a dry, savory wine that's intriguing on the nose and palate. While glimmers of poached pear and lemon peek through, fruit is clearly secondary to the layers of nutty, yeasty, oily flavors that dominate the palate.
Name: Château Musar 2003 Gaston Hochar White (Bekaa Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Creamy, delicious flavors of pear tart lead this intense, focused, balanced sweet wine. The blend includes Sémillon, Sylvaner and Pinot Gris, from estate vineyards, and the alcohol reaches 12.5%—fairly high for a dessert wine, but indicative of the overall concentration and ripeness.
Name: David Hill 2009 Sweet Simplicity White (Willamette Valley)

Description: Produced from the Clos Mireille, within sight of the Mediterranean, this fresh-faced wine shows peach and citrus flavors rounded by ripeness, although with an attractive tangy aftertaste.
Name: Domaines Ott 2009 Clos Mireille Blanc de Blancs White (Côtes de Provence)

Description: With only 15 cases imported, this might be a hard find but certainly worth the trouble. A blend of 70% Sémillon and 30% Sauvignon Blanc, ripe red apple flesh and pear aromas and flavors are jazzed up with sweet spice and soft buttered toast accents. Round and full but not overly heavy thanks to lifting tropical fruit-like acidity.
Name: Bizoe 2009 Henrietta Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: Offers tropical, stony aromas in front of a crystalline palate that's citrusy as well as peachy, with lychee and melon flavors as well. Finishes springy and bright, with green citrus zest and nothing compromising. 60% Torrontés and 40% Chardonnay.
Name: Finca La Anita 2010 Tonada Torrontés-Chardonnay White (Mendoza)

Description: This blend of 38% Sauvignon Blanc, 44% Sémillon and 13% Viognier is ripe but balanced with brisk acidity and lively citrus flavors against the tropical fruit and melon backbone. Prickly grapefruit flavors dominate the mouthwatering finish. Drink now.
Name: Edgebaston 2010 The Honey Pot White (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Vin de Pays de la Méditerranée, France Other, France
Description: Clean and approachable with soft brioche and toasted hazelnut character among the bright peach, pear and white floral notes. Full but clean; drink now.
Name: Marrenon 2009 Private Gallery Chardonnay-Viognier (Vin de Pays de la Méditerranée)
Region: Vin de Pays de la Méditerranée

Description: Floral and light on the nose, with lemon blossom and peach notes. The palate has a fresh feel courtesy of proper acidity, while the apple and pineapple flavors are nice. Finishes tropical, with good jump and bounce.
Name: Bodega NQN 2010 Picada 15 White (Neuquén)

Description: Fresh grass, vibrant citrus and tart gooseberry fill the nose and mouth, making this an approachable and clean white perfect for pairing with lighter chicken and fish dishes. 70% Chenin Blanc and 30% Sauvignon Blanc; drink now.
Name: Stellenbosch Hills 2010 Polkadraai Chenin Blanc-Sauvignon Blanc (Polkadraai Hills)

Description: With 2,000 cases imported, here's a value white composed of 80% Chenin Blanc and 20% Sauvignon Blanc. Green apple flesh and orange rind are lifted by notes of crushed yellow flowers, while green plum flavors flesh out the medium-weight mouth. Drink now.
Name: Beau Joubert 2010 Oak Lane Chenin Blanc-Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Consistent year after year, this blend of 67% Sauvignon Blanc and 33% Sémillon is modeled after top-flight white Bordeaux. Deep gold, toasty and scented with olive oil, walnuts and loam, it hits the palate full-on with a rainbow of flavors: citrus, stone and tropical fruits, all accented with toast, oil and nuts from barrel aging. Riveting, delicious  and unique.
Name: DeLille 2009 Chaleur Estate Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A “Wow” type of blended white from one of the modern pioneers of Priorato. Nelin is quite spectacular as it delivers layered, dry aromas and equally impressive melon, honey and peachy flavors. Smooth, silky and stylish, with cerebral as well as base-level appeal. In perfect condition now. Hard not to love this classy wine.
Name: Clos Mogador 2008 Nelin White (Priorat)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 90% Viognier and 10% Roussanne. It opens with precisely cut layers of lime, lemon, Satsuma orange and grapefruit rind, beautifully rendered and underscored with a racy minerality. A wine in perfect balance, vivid and penetrating, it could accompany a wide range of foods, much as a top-of-the-line unoaked Chardonnay, but with more complexity.
Name: Doyenne 2009 Métier Blanc White (Red Mountain)

Description: The iconoclastic Emilio Rojo produces this five-grape blend from terraced vineyards located in inland Galicia. The wine is lush, rich and shows barrel characteristics and depth. The nose is toasty and alluring, but the real play comes in the mouth, which is healthy as an ox, with layered flavors of baked apple, tropical fruits and honey. Long on the finish, with an appealing texture and fine acidity. In perfect condition now; drink through 2013.
Name: Emilio Rojo 2009 Blanco White (Ribeiro)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The 2009 vintage blend is 41% Marsanne, 42% Grenache Blanc, 10% Picpoul and 7% Roussanne. Complex, rich and dense, it wraps its stone and tropical fruit flavors in layers of caramel, nougat, marshmallow and spice. Still quite young, with plenty of years of life ahead.
Name: McCrea 2009 Boushey Vineyard Sirocco Blanc White (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: With touches of honeycomb and Granny Smith apple, this delightfully lush blend of 51% Chardonnay and 49% Sémillon  from Livermore, partially barrel fermented in oak, is a creamy, medium-bodied white wine that would pair magically with shellfish or a warm goat cheese salad. A real steal at the price, too, and a fun bottle to expose to friends.
Name: Fenestra 2009 Semmonay Chardonnay-Semillon (Livermore Valley)

Description: Pretty on the nose and floral. The color is burnished gold, conveying richness and ripeness. Very creamy and sweet tasting, reflective of the 85% Viognier at the wine's core. Transitions from plump melon and peach flavors to vanilla and spice on the finish. Excellent body and acidity make for a deep wine. Contains 15% white Grenache and Chenin Blanc.
Name: Clos Figueras 2009 Font de la Figuera White White (Priorat)

Description: Heavy, oily and well oaked, but also elegant, elevated and something out of the ordinary. This is barrel-fermented Viura at a high quality level; it's smooth, creamy and lifted but also acid-rich and lemony, with notes of toast, vanilla, melon and wood resin. A potentially fine wine to drink now with baked or sautéed fish.
Name: Bodegas Palacio 2008 Cosme Palacio 1894 Blanco White (Rioja)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Marsanne, Chardonnay and Roussanne, this is bright, fruity, with an emphasis on the rind rather than the flesh of citrus and stone fruits. A streak of vanilla runs through the core, and the finish has some stiff, tannic edges. Well-crafted, and a superb food wine.
Name: Maison Bleue 2009 Jaja White (Yakima Valley)

Description: Unlike TG's Abadía de San Campio Albariño, this wine also features Loureira and Caiño Blanco, and it's more interesting in the long run. Aromas of mango and pineapple are sweet and pungent, while the palate is round, leesy and plump, with green melon, apple, vanilla and creamy notes. Fleshy on the finish, but with good acidity. Will accompany shellfish of all sorts.
Name: Terras Gauda 2010 O Rosal White (Rías Baixas)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: A seriously supple and creamy wine with character throughout. The nose is loaded with garrigue perfumes of thyme and bay leaves among the clean red apple and white melon aromas. Toast and soft spice mingle on the palate, with a soft honeyed flavor enduring through the long finish.
Name: Gérard Bertrand 2009 Cigalus White (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Description: A richly, aromatic wine, with honey and lemon aromas announcing a richly textured wine. Spice, dried apricots and honey mingle with acidity in this gloriously rich wine.
Name: Höpler 2008 Trockenbeerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: A fine bottle, roughly half Pinot Gris, half Gewürztraminer, from the Celilo vineyard. The PG is 25 years old; it's a blend that works really well in vintages where the vineyard gets sufficient heat, and 2009 was just about perfect. Partially barrel fermented, it sends up scents and flavors of citrus—lime and orange—with a pleasing roundness from roughly one percent residual sugar.
Name: Cor Cellars 2009 Alba Cor White White (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: Floral fragrances from the Gewürztraminer come with honey and leesy aromas. The mouthfeel is creamy and oily, and next up is a melony flavor profile and a smooth finish. Mild on the acidity, so it's in top form now. An exotic, intriguing blend of Gewürz and Macabeo with character; 1,100 cases made.
Name: Oliver Conti 2009 Treyu White (Empordà)

Description: Clean, minerally and smooth, with nothing more than crispness and apple to the nose. The palate is easygoing, while the flavors of peach, pear and apple are boosted by minerality and good acidity. A highly likable, drinkable wine that shows that Galician quality extends beyond Albariño and Rías Baixas. Made from 70% Godello with Treixadura and Albariño. Drink now.
Name: Peza do Rei 2009 White (Ribeira Sacra)

Description: Easy, chiseled and refreshing stuff from Catalonia that's 50% Macabeo and 50% Sauvignon Blanc, by no means a common combo in Spain. Aromas of lime are clean, while the palate locks in on orange and grapefruit flavors with perfect acidity. Delightful salad and appetizer wine.
Name: Castell del Remei 2010 Blanc Planell White (Costers del Segre)

Description: Hailing from a 3-acre old-vines vineyard, this fully oaked Rioja blend is toasty to the max but hits with intensity, acidity and depth on the palate. Burgundian in many ways, but with more sweetness and honey than the French model. Mouthfilling and very rich, with buttery baked apple, pecan and toasty, warm flavors.
Name: Bodegas El Indiano 2009 El Brozal Single Vineyard White (Rioja)

Description: Expensive for what is ultimately a crisp, clean but limited white wine from the Basque country. The palate is juicy due to high acidity, while the flavors of lemon and green apple are tight. Finishes firm and driving, with a touch of cidery sweetness.
Name: Itsas Mendi 2009 No. 7 White (Bizkaiko Txakolina)

Description: Gold in color, then oaky and resiny, with a strong barrel element, honey and baked fruit on the nose. Full, sticky and catchy in the mouth, with resin, toast and baked apple and peach flavors. A unique style of mature, barrel-aged Viura. Not for everyone.
Name: Marqués de Murrieta 2006 Capellanía Reserva White (Rioja)

Description: Neutral and clean, with green banana and apple aromas. The palate is fleshy but maintains its vivacity along with apple, peach and pithy, bitter flavors. It's lush for a Verdejo-Viura blend, with a finish that goes on and on.
Name: Cantarranas 2009 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: White fruits, flower blossom and a touch of brine work the nose, which is followed by flush, semisweet apple, gooseberry and lime flavors. More sweet than outright tangy, but still citrusy and zesty. Holds form on the crisp finish. 60% Verdejo and 40% Viura.
Name: Pablo del Villar 2010 Ipsum Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Hard to complain about a fresh, basic white wine like this. It's juicy and pleasant, with melon, citrus and nice acidity. The finish is fresh and lasting, and overall it's pure and fairly full-bodied for basic Verdejo-Viura.
Name: Pedro Escudero 2010 Fuente Milano Verdejo-Viura (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Summer elegance in a glass, Glenora's Signature White is another great quaffer for those long summer days. Pretty on the nose with bouquets of white florals and a hint of lanolin, this dry, medium-bodied wine bursts with fresh grapefruit and pommelo flavors. Gentle acidity and minerality make this a refreshing sip that ends with a kick of grapefruit pith bitterness.
Name: Glenora 2009 Signature White White (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Elegance in a nutshell, the Wölffer Classic White smells subtly of honeyed lemons and pears, touched with a hint of lanolin. Dry and full bodied with a mouth-quenching grapefruit palate, it's accented by minerality and brisk lemon-lime acidity. The finish is quite long and ends on a pleasantly bitter lime pith note.
Name: Wölffer 2009 Classic White White (Long Island)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Lemon-lime and soft white floral scents mark this crisp, vibrant New York white blend from Bouké. Dry and light bodied with a palate that bursts with juicy white grapefruits and a lemony acidity, it's a refreshing sipper for the hottest days of summer.
Name: Bouké 2009 White (New York)

Description: A kitchen sink blend of six different grape varieties, this is a clean and fruit-forward white with prominent notes of ripe tropical fruit and sweet clementine citrus. Light and easy-drinking, pair with grilled fish or chicken.
Name: Domaines Paul Mas 2010 ClaudeVal Blanc White (Pays d'Oc)

Description: Yellow in color, with a peachy, baked set of aromas. The palate hits with a blast of acidity but not much else, while the flavors are brash and lean toward green apple and green plum. Rounder and softer on the finish, but also short.
Name: Huguet de Can Feixes 2009 Blanc Selecció White (Penedès)

Description: Opens with generic white-fruit aromas that are fresh and flowery but not specific. The palate is round, a bit spritzy in feel, and minerally, with lime and melon flavors. A basic white wine but for $10 that's the ticket.
Name: El Circulo 2010 Blanco White (Rioja)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Intensely aromatic with loads of white florals, ripe apricots and honey scents, the Luckystone White would be perfect as a summer apéritif. Dry, but with just a touch of sweet peach and tangerine sweetness, this full-bodied wine boasts a brisk citrus acidity and a pleasantly long finish that ends on an elegant floral note.
Name: Sheldrake Point 2009 Luckystone White White (Finger Lakes)

Description: Generic smelling, with simple melon and citrus aromas. The palate has the right level of tang and acidity, which uplifts apple, nectarine and gooseberry flavors. Tight on the finish, with lock-down acids. Very zesty stuff; a mix of Sauvignon Blanc and Verdejo.
Name: Pradorey 2010 Bl8 Birlocho Verdejo-Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)

Description: Citrus aromas mix with hints of honey and apple. The palate is short but offers good freshness. Crisp and lean in terms of flavors, with notes of orange and lemon-lime. Citrusy and minerally on the finish. Verdejo with 30% Viura.
Name: Viña Cimbrón 2009 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Bursting with tropical fruit on the nose and palate, this dry, medium-bodied blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay is unabashedly fun. With so much guava, mango and pineapple flavor, and something reminiscent of a lime and coconut cocktail, it's admittedly a bit confected but would be hard to resist at a summer barbecue or picnic at the beach.
Name: Imagine Moore 2009 Gratitude White Table Wine White (Finger Lakes)

Description: A wonderfully friendly wine, with great acidity and a light perfume. Flavors of spiced pear, nutmeg segue to a delicious light, fresh finale. Screwcap.
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2010 Trie White White (Burgenland)

Description: A Lambrusco-like petillant that's neutral and dry as a bone on the nose except for a pinch of green. The palate has a fine, controlled spritz and lemon-lime flavors. Crisp, citrusy and refreshing, and fairly well executed.
Name: Cavas del Ampurdán NV Blanc Pescador White (Spain)

Description: Maybe it's already late in this wine's lifespan but the nose has a corny, overly mature set of aromas that fail to convey freshness. The mouth is more zesty and citrusy, with round flavors of orange, tangerine and dry melon. A basic wine without a lot of complexity or finish.
Name: Do Ferreiro 2009 Rebisaca White (Rías Baixas)

Description: A basic white wine for salads and patio sipping. The nose is neutral except for some apple blossom, while the palate is sheer, lean and features apple, lemon and a slight bitterness. Crisp, healthy but highly regular.
Name: Bodegas Campante 2009 Viña Reboreda White (Ribeiro)

Description: Crisp apple, peach and minerally aromas are basic. The palate is round, wet and honest, with snappy but capped flavors of apple and citrus. Finishes with regular feel and clarity, but with limited depth of flavor.
Name: Angosto 2009 White (Valencia)

Description: Smells good and clean, and in the mouth it's fairly smooth. Snappy apple and lime flavors ride on a wave of acidity, while the finish is basic and firm. Nothing exciting but this blend of Verdejo and Viura is steady and gets the job done.
Name: Marqués de la Concordia 2009 Vega de la Reina White (Rueda)

Description: Still not sure what the secret is behind this nonvintage white blend, but my sample was fresh, floral, soft and welcoming. It showed a fleshy but healthy feel and pineapple and green plum flavors. Fresh and sweet on the finish, with enough acidity to work with food. As good as this wine gets.
Name: René Barbier NV Mediterranean White White (Catalunya)

Description: Like a liquid fruit salad, this blend offers assertive notes of ripe peach, mango, melon and banana to the medium- weight mouth. The finish is short but clean.
Name: Domaine de Coussergues 2010 Chardonnay-Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Description: A blended wine, with a dominance of Sylvaner and Muscat. It is very perfumed, soft and spicy. The acidity lies easily under the lychee and soft white fruits. Screwcap.
Name: Pierre Sparr 2007 Alsace One White (Alsace)

Description: Don't know what the motivation is behind a barrel-aged Sauvignon Blanc-Gewürtztraminer blend, but whatever it is, it has resulted in a spicy, sweet wine with a soft structure and strange oak-based flavors of cinnamon and candy. Odd and questionable for the price. A novelty with only 83 cases made.
Name: Oliver Conti 2008 White (Empordà)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Subtle on the nose with hints of tangerine and lanolin, this dry, full-bodied white blend is savory in style with hints of orange peel and lemon and a slightly viscous, oily feel. It's a bit lacking in intensity in the midpalate, but the citrus rind astringency on the finish is nice.
Name: Palmer 2007 Select Reserve White (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Vin de Pays de L'Herault, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: The nose offers wafts of buttered toast, red apple skin and orange rind while the mouth presents more oaky apple core and sweet spice flavors. Drink now.
Name: Chateau Capion 2009 Fiona White (Vin de Pays de L'Herault)

Description: Sweet and soda-like up front, with a balanced palate of soft bubbles and lime, kiwi and bitter green flavors. Foams up a bit on the back palate and finish, which is lime-tinged but bitter. Good for a sweet Moscato-styled wine but with some flaws.
Name: Cavas del Ampurdán NV Cresta Azul White (Spain)

Description: Not bad for a $10 blend of Chardonnay and Moscato. The nose is mostly neutral except for basic peach and white grape aromas. The palate is a bit thin and chalky, but at least it's clean and offers decent flavors of lemon and papaya.
Name: Torito Bravo 2009 White (Cariñena)

Description: With pleasant scents of white florals, ripe stone fruit and toasted nuts, the dry, full-bodied Stratus White balances fresh apple and pear flavors with warm, nutty notes and a nicely integrated oak treatment. Easygoing but refreshing and balanced. Drink now.
Name: Stratus 2006 White Wine White (Niagara Peninsula)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Sultry on the nose with scents of smoke, toast and savory, cooked apples, this is a dry, full-bodied white blend made from 70% Chardonnay. The smoky, appley palate is good, but could use a burst of acidity to add vibrancy to the midpalate.
Name: Waters Crest 2009 Campania Bianco White (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Chunky and soft on the nose, with maderized papaya aromas. The palate is acidic, with racy, sharp apple and citrus flavors. Edgy on the finish, and struggles all the way to achieve balance.
Name: Casa de la Reina 2010 Semi Sweet Malvasia-Viura (Rioja)

Description: While it starts off rather earthy and savory on the nose, on the palate, this off-dry, full-bodied white blend is surprisingly fruity and floral with a host of tropical fruit flavors. It's a bit of a mismatch, but good for casual entertaining. Drink now.
Name: Chaddsford 2009 Spring Wine White (Pennsylvania)

Description: Savory in style, there are pleasant notes of nuts and lemons on this dry, medium bodied white blend. It's a brisk wine, but hindered by something vaguely industrial on the nose and palate, reminiscent of Band-aids.
Name: Chaddsford 2009 Proprietors Reserve White Wine White (Pennsylvania)

Description: If simple, sweet and pretty is what you're looking for, you may find Riverboat White's Smooth Sweet White a perfect match. Perfumed on the nose with a spray of white florals and tropical fruit, it's unabashedly syrupy with loads of confectionery sugar and lemon drops on the palate.
Name: Les Bourgeois NV Riverboat White Smooth Sweet White White (Missouri)

Description: Feral and past its prime. The palate is sharp as nails and clamps, while flavors of sour apple and raw citrus aren't what you'd call friendly. A weird, sour wine made from Macabeo and Parellada.
Name: Flama Roja 2009 Macabeu-Parellada White (Tarragona)

Description: 96-98. Stunningly rich in character, a wine with great power to go with its acidity and sweetness. It is dense, powerful and concentrated powered by honey and by spice from the wood. The finish has dried apricots, very aromatic.
Name: Château d'Yquem 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 95-97  Richly textured, with an opulent feel, concentrated, the fruit buried in the dense flavors. It makes for a big, powerful wine, looking to a long future.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 95-97  The white of Château Haut-Brion is the first growth of white wines . From this great white wine year, this is a perfectly rounded wine, almost sweet, while the herbaceous element, gives ripe white plums fruits. The toast is so subtle in the aftertaste.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94-96 Structured firm, very spicy, while also showing fresh pineapple acidity. Concentrated and packed with botrytis.
Name: Château Rieussec 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94-96 Big, concentrated botrytis flavors, layering the honey with the rich dried fruits. This is a powerhouse of a wine, densely structured.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94-96 On the dry side, emphasizing the power of the botrytis, this is a concentrated wine, very rich and dense. For the long-term.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94-96 Rich in character, suffused with the freshest acidity, structure and spice. It is so concentrated, likely to age for many years
Name: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94-96 Concentrated, chunky, the richness just a part of the huge power. It's a wine of considerable density, very liquorous.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 94-96 Full, and powerful, the wine has weight, an almost Burgundian richness, although never losing sight of the herbaceous edge of Sauvignon Blanc. Packed with power, still food friendly.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93-95 Densely structured wine, full of honey, cinnamon, and sweetness. The acidity gives just the right counterpoint.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93-95 A rich wine, full-bodied in character, the acidity hiding behind the ripe fruits. Concentrated and structured, the spice coming through to dominate.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93-95 Full textured wine, with acidity well integrated into the ripe, open structure. The wine has weight, while preserving its freshness. The lime acidity and spice push through to the final taste.
Name: Château la Louvière 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93-95 A rich wine, full in the mouth while also offering great herbaceous flavors. Dense grapefruit flavors run through the complex texture. A wine to age.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93-95 Powerfully rich wine, very concentrated, rich, with a great balance between acidity and honey and apricot flavors. Finely rich.
Name: Château Coutet 2010 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 93-95 A ripe, balanced wine, the acidity casting a light over the rich apricot, mango and apple juice flavors. Spiced with wood, never excessive.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93-95 Textured, structured wine, with good freshness and acidity. Dominated by an herbaceous character, it is richness as well as great final acidity.
Name: Château Olivier 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92-94 A gorgeously ripe wine, full of tropical fruit flavors. All this opulence is tempered with spice, grapefruit and lime flavors. A finely structured and textured wine.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92-94 Very rich in character. The sweetness is there, but masked by the firm structure, the almost tannic texture. Great concentration.
Name: Château Rabaud-Promis 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94 Powerful and rich wine, full of ripe pineapple and peach flavors. The wine is smooth, toasty, concentrated. Immense ripe fruit.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92-94 A closed up wine, although all the elements are there, promising great final balance, richness and power.
Name: Château Guiraud 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94 Herbaceous style of wine, a Bordeaux white wine classic style, with crisp grassy Sauvignon Blanc flavors, elegant, not heavy.
Name: Château de France 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92-94 Full of toasty flavors, this is a structured, wood and ripe fruit dominated wine. It has weight, while also feeling fresh. Great final spice and pear flavors.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92-94 Great acidity here, the wine has freshness as well as dried apricot and peach flavors, very honeyed. Excellent acidity to finish.
Name: Château de Malle 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94 Hugely aromatic, a wine that manages to combine freshness, lightness and density. It is deliciously fresh, then offering a fine, ripe dried fruit aftertaste.
Name: Château de Myrat 2010 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 91-93 Firm and closed up, a structured wine that shows ripe tropical fruits, laced with pink grapefruit. Rich, concentrated, powerful.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91-93 Full-bodied wine, with toast and a strong citrus and herbaceous character. The wine is open, soft, generous, finishing with a very spicy character.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91-93 The wine feels full, ripe, weighty. More power than elegance, it shows ripe pear and grapefruit juice flavors. Very dense aftertaste.
Name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91-93 Fresh, bright in style, a spice cake of flavors while keeping taut fruit and final acidity. The texture, though, promises good ageing.
Name: Château Nairac 2010 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 91-93 Attractive, fresh wine, with a delicious delicacy as well as the perfumed acidity. There is a tasty pear juice and spice combination to finish.
Name: Château Lamothe Guignard 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91-93 Fresh, citrus and spicy pear flavors, a wine laced with acidity, a crisp texture and elegant bright aftertaste.
Name: Château Haut-Bergey 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91-93 Rich more than dry, the palate a very spicy character, the texture full, unctuous, but more than just sweet.
Name: Château d'Arche 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 90-92 The wine has rich citrus and pear flavors, with weight, an oily texture and balanced wood spice to finish. Well structured.
Name: Château Rahoul 2010 Barrel sample  (Graves)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: A field blend ice wine—don't see that very often—it's full-bodied, almost lush, and packed with mixed slightly candied fruits—tropical, stone fruits and citrus. Concentrated and poised, it balances on fresh acidity. Just a hint of plastic in the back of the finish.
Designation: Underwood Mountain Vineyards 55% Riesling/45% Gewurztraminer Ice Wine
Name: Viento 2009 Underwood Mountain Vineyards 55% Riesling/45% Gewurztraminer Ice Wine Gewürztraminer-Riesling (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: 90-92 Attractive floral perfumes, a wine that is soft initially then shows a fine herbaceous edge. Crisp, textured with hints of wood.
Name: Château Brown 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90-92 A wine that shows acidity, a tension between fruit and richness, delicately structured, very aromatic. The texture shows potential richness.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2010 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 90-92 Concentrated, structure, a wine that pushes power and density. The year's acidity adds the necessary freshness. Impressive.
Name: Château Broustet 2010 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 90-92 Structured, ripe wine, full of tight botrytis character and acidity. The wine is spicy, complex, rich.
Name: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89-91 Both freshness and richness are well combined in this elegant Sauternes. What it misses in weight, it gains in honey and apricot flavors.
Name: Château Raymond-Lafon 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89-91 Herbaceous and fresh, the wine has a grassy character with a citrus edge, spice and grapefruit. It is lively and refreshing.
Name: Le Nardian 2010 Barrel sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: . A delightfully intriguing “White Burgundy” blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Blanc and Pinot Meunier, the last an unexpected surprise, the fruit sourced from both the Sangiacomo and Yountmill vineyards. The wine is light and yet lush, with an inviting nose of sweet apricot and apple pie, and a roundness to the mouthfeel. This would pair nicely with a buttery halibut but also stand well on its own as an apéritif.
Name: Imagery 2009 White Burgundy White (North Coast)

Description: Wood-aged wine that brings out layers of toast over the ripe peach and grapefruit fruit flavors. It is rich, full-in-the-mouth, spice and fruit given a good lift from acidity.
Name: Château Haut Bertinerie 2009  Côtes de Bordeaux

Description: 89-91 Very aromatic, sweet wine, the palate suffused with acidity as well as dried apricots, fresh in character, the spicy element adding to the structure of the wine.
Name: Château de Fargues 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89-91 Richly liquorous wine, beautifully concentrated, with acidity balancing with the rich, honeyed fruit. Showing its attractive side already.
Name: Château Caillou 2010 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 88-90 A definite mineral character here, with a wine that boasts a taut structure, pushing beyond the metallic edge of the fruit.
Name: Château Romer 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 88-90 Delicious fruit, with pear and apricot laced with acidity and spice. The wine feels relatively light, very fresh, already delicious.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2010 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 88-90 Great acidity runs through what is also a richly concentrated wine. It has weight, density, always with this bright acidity.
Name: Château Picque Caillou 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Zippy citrus, lemon and a touch of tropical fruit on the nose and palate characterize this stylish white blend. A spin of sea salt minerality keeps the whole package light on the tongue. A balanced, elegant white that will pair well with grilled fish, fruit, poultry.
Name: Estate Biblia Chora 2009 White (Pangeon)

Description: 88-90 Spicy, toasty fresh citrus wine. It's light, crisp, with bright final acidity.
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2010 Barrel sample  (Graves)

Description: Michael David makes this white wine, a blend of mostly Viognier and Chardonnay, with smaller amounts of Malvasia Bianca, Roussanne, Sauvignon Blanc and Symphony, steel-tank fermented and aged, a deliciously bright and perfumed, light-drinking, golden wine with a tropical fruit nose and ripe peach and melon as it goes down.
Name: Incognito 2009 White Wine Blend White (Lodi)

Description: 87-89 Lacking richness, the wine has acidity, some sweetness, but misses definition and density.
Name: Château Lamothe 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 87-89 Soft wine, its acidity light. Pineapple and green apple flavors, with hints of wood.
Name: Château Ferrande 2010 Barrel sample  (Graves)

Description: 87-89 The wine tastes light, with a hard edged mineral character, the richness still a distance away.
Name: Château Filhot 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 87-89 A wine that is all structure, with very little fruit. It has a hard, metallic edge.
Name: Château Suau 2010 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: Still very herbaceous, this Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine is ripe, full of melon and peach flavors, with an attractive zesty character. There's enough structure for 2–3 years' aging.
Name: Château Bertinerie 2008 Cru Réserve  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: An interesting wine, this blend offers a complex nose of ripe whole lychee and fresh pressed apple aromas countered by glimmers of beeswax and rose florals. More red apple unfolds in the round mouth, with a touch of sweet lime oil freshening up the finish.
Name: Solms-Delta 2009 Amalie Viognier-Grenache Blanc (Western Cape)

Description: With its layers of wood, the wine has weight. Herbaceous characters are mixed with ripe pear flavors. There is a good, tight final texture.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2010 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Graves)

Description: A crisp, clean, fruity wine, tangy and lemony. This is a really attractive wine, a classic of its kind. Screwcap.
Name: Château Bonnet 2008  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A lightly perfumed white Bordeaux, with warm ripe fruit, soft acidity an an herbaceous edge. Grapefruit and gooseberry flavors are laced with a more honeyed character.
Name: Château Sainte Marie 2009 Vieilles Vignes  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Fresh, crisp, herbaceous, and with an attractive perfumed character, this is a great value from southwest France. Acidity finishes this fine apéritif wine. Screwcap.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2010 Colombelle White (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Dominated by herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc, this cool wine is a great alternative New Zealand Sauvignon. It has nettle and gooseberry flavors with an attractive poise and fresh acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine de Ballade 2009 Sauvignon Blanc/Colombard Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: The exotic, slightly sweaty nose of this Sémillon-Assyrtiko blend mean it's going to stand out, and the rich, creamy tropical fruit flavors on the palate confirm it. A little heavy and slightly showy, the wine still has a great texture and an appealing spicy wood finish.
Name: Estate Biblia Chora 2009 Ovilos White (Pangeon)

Description: A blend of 48% Chenin Blanc, 41% Chardonnay and 11% Viognier, this is an interesting white with slightly oxidized but rich notes of honeycomb, toasted hazelnut and baked apple thoughout. Medium weight with a touch of heat coming through on the long finish.
Name: Lammershoek 2008 Roulette Blanc White (Swartland)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A very perfumed wine, with white flower aromas, flavors of herbs and spice. It has weight as well as acidity, a tangy structured edge. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine de Pajot 2009 Les Quatre Cépages White (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: A blend of typical Gascon grapes gives a lemon and citrus wine, very fresh, tangy. There is plenty of acidity and an attractive lightness. Screwcap.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2009 Villa Beaurivage White (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France, Loire Valley, France
Description: With its few years' aging, the wine exhibits a Chenin Blanc nutty quality backed by the greater weight of Chardonnay. Full-bodied, ready to drink. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine des Baumard 2006 La Calèche Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France)
Region: Vin de Pays du Jardin de la France

Description: Composed of 40% Viognier, 39% Chenin Blanc and 21% Grenache Blanc, there's an attractive round richness to this wine. A toasty character spices up the fresh pear, melon and orange rind flavors, with a nutty accent lingering on the finish.
Name: Boekenhoutskloof 2009 The Wolftrap White (Franschhoek)

Description: Ripe botrytis, honey and peaches make for an attractive, open, ready-to-drink sweet wine. The acidity keeps the richness in check.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2008  Sauternes

Description: Just touched by honey and with a light spritz, this is a crisp, lemon and lime zest-flavored wine. It has great acidity with a yeasty character.
Name: Pierre Boniface 2009 Les Rocailles White (Apremont)

Description: Fresh as well as ripe, with layers of toast, creamy pear and red apple flavors. Attractively spicy, ready to drink.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2009  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Peach, banana, citrus and white flower aromas are followed by refreshing citrus and spice flavors in this assertive white. A racy minerality and spicy finish give the wine great food-pairing versatility, but it's a good summer sipper on its own.
Name: Skouras 2010 Roditis Moscofilero White (Peloponnese)

Description: This barrel-fermented Athiri-Assyrtiko blend starts with a wave of spice, mint and citrus aromas, leading into flavors of sea salt, lemon and spice. Though not entirely balanced, it's versatile; pair with meat, fish or cheese.
Designation: Les Dons de Dionysos Barrel Fermented
Name: A. Parparoussis 2007 Les Dons de Dionysos Barrel Fermented White (Achaia)

Description: This 65% Chenin Blanc - 35% Sauvignon Blanc blend is clean and fresh with flavors of green grass, hard nectarine and a touch of orange rind in the round mouth. Drink now.
Name: Post House 2008 Blueish White Chenin Blanc-Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: The wine is still very young, revealing sweetness rather than the botrytis complexity of previous vintages. Honey, peach and pineapple flavors offer fruitiness.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2009 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Sauternes)

Description: Big and gold, with aromas of corn, sweat and vegetal white fruits. This is soft, dull and rich stuff, with an oaky, dry palate of apricot and papaya. Seems over the hill already and it's not yet two years old. 88% Chard and 12% Viognier.
Name: Miguel Torres 2009 Cordillera Reserva Privada Barrel Fermented Chardonnay-Viognier (Chile)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fragrant with cut grass, peavine and sweet hay, leading into light fruit flavors of apple and pear. There are suggestions of sliced orange, and the creamy, textural mouthfeel derived from nine months of aging on the lees.
Name: Buty 2009 Sémillon/Sauvignon/Muscadelle White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Pretty lavender and violet notes shaded with wax and lanolin scent this delicious, honey-coated wine. Decadently rich with a sunny, bright acidity and elegant tones of tangerine, black tea and heather, it's lip-smackingly good through its long, smooth finish.
Name: Tokaj Classic 2000 Aszú 6 Puttonyos - 500 ml Tokaji (Tokaj)

Description: Orange peel, honey and spice notes linger over a bouquet of hyacinth and freesias. So beautifully structured, it's as if each sip unleashes a wave of sweet amber honey that undulates on the palate amidst flashes of golden marmalade and a vibrant citrus acidity.
Name: Tokaj Classic 1999 Aszú 6 Puttonyos - 500 ml Tokaji (Tokaj)

Description: Just one whiff of this wine reveals an intoxicating perfume of wildflower honey marked with zesty, fresh orange peel. An intensely concentrated honey elixir, it ripples persistently on the palate with a brilliant spray of Meyer lemon juice and a rich, vanilla cream note.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2006 Red Label Aszú 5 Puttonyos - 500 ml  (Tokaji)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A white Bordeaux blend, handsome and richly accented with scents of toast and honey, the lemon drop fruit flavors are framed with lively acids. Quite delicious, beautifully balanced and despite its youth drinking quite well.
Name: Fidelitas 2009 Optu White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The White Mullet is an innovative blend of 70% Riesling, 11% Viognier, 10% Chenin Blanc and 9% Sauvignon Blanc. The result is fragrant with hints of orange zest and pineapple, and moderately mouthfilling without ever seeming overly soft. Simultaneously crisp, luscious and long on the finish, it's a solid value.
Name: Pikes 2009 The White Mullet White (Clare Valley)

Description: Bursting with zesty tangerine peel aromas and a gentle clover honey sweetness, the Mád Cuvée Late Harvest reflects a lighter style of Tokaji, but with a freshness and delicacy that's ethereal.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2008 Mád Cuvée Late Harvest  (Tokaji)

Description: A lightly perfumed wine, from a blend with a dominance of Sauvignon Blanc. Citrus, almonds and piercing acidity combine to give a bright, light, very dry wine.
Name: Domaine de Salvard 2008 Delailie White (Cheverny)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A white blend made from Riesling, Albariño and Savagnin. It lacks specificity on the nose while offering up floral, citrusy aromas. In the mouth, it's plump and soft, with sweet melon, spice and a honeyed finish that also shows pith and mild bitterness. Interesting but a little heavy, sweet and amorphous.
Name: Viña Alicia 2010 Tiara White (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Round and lemony on the nose, with apple and minerality. The palate is juicy and fresh, with dry, angular pineapple and lemon flavors. Short and acidic in the mouth, but fresh and clean throughout. This is Basque white wine, take it or leave it.
Name: Gorka Izagirre 2009 White (Bizkaiko Txakolina)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Laurent Miquel has built a solid reputation making clean wines at a superb value, and this one doesn't disappoint. Fresh and lively notes of sweet pea and honeysuckle mingle with ripe tropical fruit and clementine citrus. Drink now.
Name: Laurent Miquel 2010 Père et Fils Chardonnay-Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Description: Rich with butter, cream and caramel popcorn, this Croatian blend of Malvasia and Chardonnay with a hefty dose of new French oak is luscious both on the nose and palate. Savory in style with hints of salted butter, it's an interesting example of Croatian wine made in a decidedly international style.
Name: Saints Hills 2009 Nevina White (Istria)

Description: An unusual blend of 37% Verdelho, 32% Viognier and 31% Sémillon, this is a fragrant yet not overbearing white, with rather simple grapefruity flavors and a round, ample feel on the palate despite carrying a modest alcohol level of 12%.
Name: Heartland 2009 Stickleback White White (South Australia)

Description: Whets the whistle with floral aromas of jasmine, talcum powder and banana. The palate is juicy, tight and citrusy in feel, with lime and kiwi flavors. A light wine for fresh foods and simple summer settings.
Name: Torres 2010 Sangre de Toro White (Catalunya)

Description: Smells both nutty and warm as well as citric and sharp. The palate keeps that pace; it's citrusy and cidery in feel, with orange, banana and spice flavors. Finishes quick and a little heavy. 70% Chardonnay and 30% Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Benegas 2009 Clara Benegas Chardonnay-Sauvignon (Mendoza)

Description: A “layered” blend of five different varieties, this starts off a bit floral and lemony, then develops some earthier notes to go along with the modest citrus flavors. Finishes short. Sémillon (37%), Muscat (20.5%), Gewürztraminer (19.5%), Pinot Gris (19%) and Chardonnay (4%).
Name: Peter Lehmann 2010 Layers White (Adelaide)

Description: Smells sweet and artificial, with chemical notes and overwrought vanilla. Juicy in the mouth, with flesh and freshness. But the flavors are oaky, so much so that the wine's citrus and apple quality is masked. Finishes with grapefruit and bitterness. Weird and all over the map.
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2008 Don Nicanor Chardonnay-Viognier (Mendoza)

Description: High-toned apples and pears and a grassy, herbal note scent this unique blend of Croatian and international grape varieties. Deep gold in color, it's a savory wine with a bruised apple palate, but an interesting pick for everyday.
Name: Bibich 2008 Riserva R5 White (North Dalmatia)

Description: Smells a bit acrid, with aromas of peach pit and chemical. The palate is short on structure and offers punch-like sweetness in the mango/papaya field of play. Very juicy but not tasting or smelling very defined.
Name: Callia 2009 Alta Chardonnay-Torrontes White (Tulum Valley)

Description: Gold in color and about as overoaked as a white wine can be. This blend of Viognier, Chardonnay and Riesling is all resin and barrel spice. It actually offers some sophistication in terms of mouthfeel, but overall it's grossly out of balance and brutally dominated by oak-based aromas and flavors.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2009 Gala 3 White (Maipú)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Tan like cream soda, with a weird, faded bouquet of banana pudding and resiny oak. Soft and weakly structured except for lasting acidity, while it tastes like fermented apples and finishes on bitter walnut. A strange bird made from Sauvignon Blanc and white Tempranillo.
Name: Finca Torremilanos 2008 Peñalba López White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: A superb wine. Oily textured, very rich, its fruit ripe. Pear, honey and yellow fruits are allid with taut acidity and light hints of wood. Likely to age over many years.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2008  Pessac-Léognan
