Name: TorresManur 2008 Pindal Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: Quite sweaty, oily and hard, almost like an underdeveloped Verdejo or Sauvignon Blanc. The palate is also on the bitter, oily, pithy side, with only a little grapefruit and orange working their way through.
Name: Coto de Gomariz 2008 White (Ribeiro)

Description: A perfumed wine, the blend an esoteric collection of grapes that include Weissburgunder, Welchriesling and Furmint. The wine is concentrated and rich, its spice and peach flavors intense and powerful. There's a ginger bite, with the acidity just a touch to finish.
Name: Heidi Schröck 2007 Ried Vogelsang White (Burgenland)

Description: A blend of Weissburgunder and Neuburger, this offers soft, open, generous fruit, creamed apples and a hint of spice. The wine has an attractive, warm series of flavors that roll richly around the mouth. A few months' aging would bring out even more flavor. Screwcap.
Name: Tinhof 2008 Leithaberg Weiss White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Vin de Pays de L'Herault, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: An interesting blend of 50% Chardonnay, 40% Roussanne and 10% Sauvignon Blanc, this is a lively and very aromatic white with scents of pretty pink florals like sweet pea and roses, ripe peach, mango and melon. The same carries through to the palate, which shows great roundness in the middle without being too flabby. The finish is clean but lengthy. Delish.
Name: Chateau Capion 2008 1 C White (Vin de Pays de L'Herault)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: The Le Mas, or “little farm,” is 80% Sauv Blanc with 15% Viognier and 5% Vermentino. There's a nice chalky note to the bouquet along with hints of sweet pea, lavender and stone fruit that continue through to the finish. A different, more nuanced style of Languedoc white.
Importer: Clos Du Val Wine/Goelet Wine Estates
Name: Domaine de Nizas 2008 Le Mas White (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Another great value from Arrogant Frog, this Viognier-Chard blend is fresh and delicious with flavors of rich wood-grilled apple, yellow florals, peach and toast. Medium weight and well balanced with a long finish. Drink now.
Name: Arrogant Frog 2008 Lily Pad White Chardonnay-Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Description: A fresh style of wine, with an attractive edge of softness followed by the brightest fresh acidity. A simple, crisp, clean wine to drink now. Screwcap.
Name: Manfred Tement 2009 Green Grün White (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Aromas of yellow flowers and soft sweet spice take time to appear on the bouquet of this Grenache-based white. Round and flabby, with notes of melon, celery and nectarine in the mouth. The finish is medium with hints of toast.
Name: Mas de Lavail 2007 Le Sud White (Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes

Description: The name Gemischter Satz means a field blend of grapes, often old and rare varieties, an Austrian tradition. The wine is light, fresh and crisp, with just a slight prickle on the tongue. There is a creamy character, lying well with the spicy element. Screwcap.
Name: Pratsch 2008 Gemischter Satz White (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Soft red apple, white peach and delicate white florals unfold in the nose, while toastier notes of baked apple and brioche appear in the mouth. Round and full, there's not a lot of complexity here but it's straightforward, satisfying and quite easy to drink.
Name: Domaines Paul Mas 2008 Vignes de Nicole Chardonnay-Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A delicious and refreshing white made with 70% Muscat Ottonel, 15% Chardonnay and 15% Viognier. Very aromatic on the nose with notes of sweet pea florals, lilac, lychee, ripe pear and fresh orange slices. The palate is medium weight but vibrant, with more ripe tropical fruit unfolding in the mouth and on the finish. A different but excellent option as an apéritif to pair with spicy appetizers.
Name: Lamoreaux Landing NV 42 NORTH Estate Bottled White (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Fresh and vibrant on the nose with green citrus, peach and sweet pink florals. The soft fruit is nicely balanced, ending with a simple, clean finish.
Name: Addict Wines 2007 Voyou Chardonnay-Grenache Blanc White (Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes

Description: A big, rich wine, showing its gorgeous fruit easily. But with a core of dryness, the ripest apricots touched by caramel, it should age well over many years. There is intense power here, still hidden by the youth of the wine, but with final concentration.
Name: Château Climens 2007  Barsac

Description: Powered by dry botrytis, this is a wine with immense potential. It has weight, complexity and richness, all under the cloak of botrytis. To leaven the power, there is acidity, but this is certainly for aging.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2007  Sauternes

Description: A gold-colored wine. The palate has intense freshness as well as ripe apricot and orange zest flavors. The acidity cuts through the intense richness, leaving a wine that needs time to fully integrate, and then many more years to mature.
Name: Château Guiraud 2007  Sauternes

Description: A beautifully ripe wine, layered with the richest fruit, the acidity offering a bright moment within the richness. Botrytis is there, like a hard core for the pillow of ripe apricots, lychees, spice and fine freshness.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2007  Sauternes

Description: Packed with botrytis, this is a wine whose sweetness is suppressed by richness. Flavors of bitter oranges and white figs go with the intense core of botrytis, followed by a touch of bright acidity. This is a wine whose journey is just beginning.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2007  Sauternes

Description: A beautifully ripe wine, layering all the dense botrytis of the vintage with freshest acidity. It has weight, the texture of grainy honey, ripe yellow fruits, mango and orange zest. Impressive and certainly for aging.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2007  Sauternes

Description: Light gold color, but a wine with depth and balance. There is lovely acidity here, a wine that offers fresh fruits, apricot juice and deep layers of botrytis.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2007  Sauternes

Description: The aromas are intensely sweet, full of orange marmalade and honey. The palate goes more for spice, with oranges and brown sugar allied to fresh fruits, apricots and lychees. The final flavors are delicious and enticing.
Name: Château Coutet 2007  Barsac

Description: A wine that is bright with the freshest orange and lemon flavors, followed by liquid honey and fine apricots. It is perhaps light, but it is certainly delicious.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2007  Sauternes

Description: Intensely rich in character, touched lightly by new wood, the acidity crispening the ripe orange and sweet peach skin texture. This is a gorgeous, opulent wine.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2007  Barsac

Description: The color is light on this wine, which is really only just beginning to show richness. The botrytis dominates, with a fat, oily texture needing many years of aging. There is a lovely ripe orange marmalade flavor on the finish.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2007  Barsac

Description: There are big flavors of botrytis here, giving a wine with power and concentration. The texture is muscular, tightness surrounding botrytis and layering with pineapple acidity and apricots.
Name: Château Rabaud-Promis 2007  Sauternes

Description: A fascinating—and unusual—blend of Sauvignon Gris and Sémillon, this wine is full of ripe, seriously opulent fruit, with peach and mango dominant. It is fleshed out with intense perfumes, rich fruit skins and kiwi fruit freshness.
Name: Bernard Magrez 2006 Château Haut Mouleyre  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Deep gold in color, a big, generous and opulent wine. It has rich yellow and tropical fruits and layers of botrytis, emphasizing power. Luckily, the acidity is also there to freshen the finish.
Name: Château Lamothe Guignard 2007  Sauternes

Description: A full, liquorous wine, with ripe mango and apricot flavors set against a backdrop of honey, dry botrytis and dense texture. The wine is now ready and maturing well. Drink over the next year.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2005 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Sauternes)

Description: A tight wine, its sweet fruit rolling around between the texture of pear skins. There is freshness here, the acidity and the dry botrytis taking away from any huge sweetness.
Name: Château d'Arche 2007  Sauternes

Description: Very balanced wine, with the acidity well integrated into the ripe botrytis and firm texture. The wine has a poise to it, a lightness of touch, but will also age well.
Name: Château de Malle 2007  Sauternes

Description: Made at the Sauternes classed growth Château Guiraud, this is part of a worldwide range of wines under the Oriel brand. As it matures, its marmalade flavors are mellowing, giving a rich nut and honey wine, with bursts of acidity and the potential for another few years' aging.
Name: Oriel 2004 Ondine  (Sauternes)

Description: Mostly Pinot Blanc, this is an excellent bottle, succulent and juicy, just 12.6% alcohol, which puts it in the European camp. Mouthfilling citrus mixing lime, lemon, pineapple, orange and a bit of candied apricot all contribute to this tasty wine.
Name: Ross Andrew 2008 Meadow White (Oregon)

Description: The fruit is really ripe, botrytised, quite tight in character, the layers of tangerine and orange juice wedged into a dry core. This will need many years.
Name: Château Filhot 2007  Sauternes

Description: Fresh gold color, with definite honeyed aromas of botrytis followed by sweet honey and spice flavors and the freshest acidity, but stopping surprisingly short.
Name: Château de Myrat 2007  Barsac

Description: Smooth and soft, with an attractive perfumed character layered with wood toast, pear and peach flavors and lively acidity. This is finely balanced, still young, worth aging another year.
Name: Château Haut Selve 2008  Graves

Description: This is white Bordeaux at its freshest, bursting with herbaceous flavors, very grassy. It does have some weight of green plum flesh and a creamy texture. Delicious.
Name: Château de Fontenille 2009  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Vintage 2007 was a big success in Sauternes, and this wine gives a good indication of the richness both of the yellow peach and apricot fruits and the drier botrytis. Ample, full and finely balanced.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2007  Sauternes

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Young and yeasty, this six-variety blend captures the floral spice of Gewürztraminer, and mixes in some grassy herb, gooseberry and melon as well. An interesting, light, dry white wine perfect for spring.
Name: Anne Amie 2008 Cuvée A Amrita White Wine White (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is more on the fresh side, with a bright citric component adding a crisp character to the botrytis richness. The texture is tight, apple and pear skin cutting through the sweetness.
Name: Château Nairac 2007  Barsac

Description: Highly aromatic wine, with upfront herbaceous fruits that could give New Zealand Sauvignons a run for their money. What gives it an extra element is a creamy applesauce flavor that smooths the wine and makes it richer.
Name: Dourthe 2008 La Grande Cuvée  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: The dominance of Sémillon in the blend gives a ripe, creamy character, hinting at honey as well as yellow fruits. The herbaceous element is there but is tamed by the richness.
Name: Château le Bonnat 2008  Graves

Description: A ripe, gentle wine, with some sweet fruits touched by honey. The texture has apple skins as well as creaminess. The finale is soft, full in the mouth.
Name: Château du Pin Franc 2008  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A wine that seems dilute, the texture light, while the fruit is reluctant to show much. There is a hollow center here, leaving a wine that is simply pleasant.
Name: Château Romer du Hayot 2007  Sauternes

Description: A rich style, already creamy in texture, showing the ripe fruit of 2009. It has a soft texture, with balancing grapefruit but more with sweeter fruits.
Name: Yvon Mau 2009 Château Ducla  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: Some Barbier wines, depending on when you catch them, are fresh, pleasant and overdeliver. Others are dull and dead. This one falls into the first category with its melon, apple and Asian pear aromas and flavors. It's lithe, light in body and clean. Good as it gets for $6.
Name: René Barbier NV Mediterranean White White (Catalunya)

Description: A light, crisp, grassy wine, with the freshest grapefruit acidity and a texture of tight apple skins.
Name: Château Grand Jean 2008  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Light, floral and almondy, with hints of pear, apple and buttercup on the nose. More creamy and soft than acidic, with pear and vanilla flavors. The finish holds steady for a while, and overall the wine is likable. 75% Viura and 25% Chardonnay.
Name: Vega Sindoa 2008 White (Navarra)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dry and not all that fruity up front, with a blast of oak. The palate shows weight and bold acidity, which pumps up the lemon, apple and pineapple flavors. A bit sour, scouring and sharp, but also cleansing and fresh. Blunt white wine.
Name: Storks' Tower 2008 Cuesta Del Aire Sauvignon Blanc-Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A barrel-heavy blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Verdejo? That's what this is, so expect popcorn and bland white fruit along with plenty of acidity. On one hand, it's an angular, sour wine that makes you wonder; on the other hand, it blends toast, butter, baked apple and lemon into a nutty whole that's not bad. Has both merits and faults.
Name: Storks' Tower 2008 Tríptico Verdejo-Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: Very fresh grassy aromas mark this Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine. It has the crispest of lemon zest, grapefruit and apricot, the whole wine tight, mineral and fruity.
Name: Château de Rouquette 2008  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Neutral, clean, good white wine for the money. The nose features green apple and lemon, and the low-octane body shows brine, citrus fruit flavors and pithy notes. White grapefruit and orange flavors carry the simple finish to a good ending.
Name: Bodegas Fontana 2008 Mesta Macabeo-Moscatel (Uclés)

Description: Soft, open fruit flavors are of pear and peach, shot through with acidity. The texture is dense, but there is also an attractive limpidity to the wine.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2008  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra Contraviesa Alpujarra, Andalucia, Spain
Description: Ripe apple and nutty aromas suggest some light oak, while the palate is wet at first and then more drawn and dry as it moves along. Flavors of apple and spice are mildly alluring, while the finish is chunky and broad. Made from the uncommon Vijiriega grape and hails from Granada.
Name: Dominio Buenavista 2008 Veleta Vijiriega White (Vino de la Tierra Contraviesa Alpujarra)
Region: Vino de la Tierra Contraviesa Alpujarra

Appellation: Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: For $7 this white blend from central Spain does about as well as can be hoped for. Transparent in color, with aromas of children's vitamin and apple, it's nothing special but it is wet, drinkable and tasty. Flavors of green apple and citrus lead to a dry, quick finish.
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2008 Protocolo White (Tierra de Castilla)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: A bit jumbled early on, and then more open and minerally. The palate is chunky but hollow, with melon and green fruit flavors. Finishes with a touch of citrus and a soft, quick fade. Bland but easy to drink.
Name: Storks' Tower 2008 Sauvignon Blanc-Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Same score as the prior year, and pretty much the same wine. It's dusty and slightly burnt in aromas and flavors, with banana, peach and pithy bitterness extending onto the finish. Mouthfeel is the best part; otherwise it struggles to make the cut.
Name: Spanish Vines 2008 Sauvignon Blanc-Macabeo White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Banana and green herb aromas make for a challenging nose. The palate has verve and acidity but its flavors of dull white fruits, melon and peach are jumbled. A clumsy mishmash of a wine; 80% Macabeo (Viura) and 20% Chardonnay.
Name: Quo 2008 Macabeo-Chardonnay White (Campo de Borja)

Description: Soft pear and apricot flavors over acidity make this initially attractive. Then an awkward toffee apple element creeps in, and leaves a wine that is mushy and soft.
Name: Château de Lagarde 2008 L de Lagarde  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Aromas of mealy melon, pineapple juice and warm radiator dust do nothing to distinguish this Viura-led white. The palate is clipped and tangy, with citrus flavors leading to a pithy, orange-peel finish.
Name: No Time 2008 Viura-Chardonnay White (Navarra)

Description: Hard and oily smelling, with an acrid overtone. The palate is grating and tastes of bitter, pithy citrus, while the finish is equally bitter, with grapefruit pith lasting too long. Expensive for what you get.
Name: Viñas del Vero 2008 Clarión White (Somontano)

Description: Initially soft, with almond cream texture, this wine then comes in with some steely acidity, a tight texture, stony almost. The fruit is green apple and lychee, crisp but with some weight behind it.
Name: Domaine le Portail 2008 Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Cheverny)

Description: It is easy to be seduced by the opulence of this wine. But underneath the ripe surface, there is a complex wine, full of tight, structured yellow fruits, spice from wood and acidity bursting to get out. It needs at least another four years for its real grandeur to be apparent.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A ripe wine, with a delicious citrus and pear character, sweet fruits and an edge of spice. Pineapple acidity gives both richness and freshness. The wine has both balance and final acidity.
Name: Château Laville Haut-Brion 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A subtly wood aged wine, the white fruit flavor giving an extra dimension with a touch of honey. It has all the direct, delicious fruit of 2007, the wine then rounded out with nutmeg and soft acidity.
Name: Château Magneau 2007 Cuvée Julien  (Graves)

Description: This refreshing, lively wine starts with a nose of citrus--grapefruit, lemon--and on the palate offers crisp but complex citrus flavors. Balanced and elegant, with a delicate touch. A great seafood sip.
Name: Mercouri Estate 2008 Kallisto White (Ilias)

Description: Rich and round, this is a smooth, creamy wine, its fresh peach fruit flavors touched by lime acidity and sweet apples. There is an attractive light perfume from the Muscadelle in the blend.
Name: Château Magneau 2007  Graves

Description: Fresh, fruity and flirty, this white offers vanilla, fresh fruit and minerals on the nose and on the palate, a lovely balance of citrus, spice and flowers. Vibrant and layered, with a minerally, cheerful finish.
Name: Gentilini 2008 Aspro Classic White (Cephalonia)

Description: Having never tried this Viura-Malvasia blend before, we say it's nicely done. The nose rings of baked apple and deftly applied oak, while the palate is fresh but also deep and textured. Flavors of apple and pear are accented by vanilla and toast, and overall it's composed and shows character. Drink now through 2012. Only 250 cases made.
Name: Cosme Palacio y Hermanos 2007 1894 White (Rioja)

Description: This unfolding white offers lemon and oaky spice on the nose and palate, with rounded, silky flavors and a spicy finish. A bit bigger and richer, it can handle bigger dishes—think lobster, oysters, cream dishes.
Name: Hatzi Michalis 2008 Laas White (Atalanti Valley)

Appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Importer Bobby Kacher has a seemingly limitless portfolio of bargains from the south of France, and this one boasts an intriguing nose of pear, honey and star anise. It's more focused and crisp than many wines from this region, turning citrusy on the finish. Drink now-2012.
Name: Domaine de la Petite Cassagne 2008 White (Costières de Nîmes)

Description: Lemon, orange and spice start this intriguing white from Biblio Chora. On the palate, it has richness, but the crisp citrus character keeps it balanced and clean. An elegant but robust wine with lingering character.
Name: Estate Biblia Chora 2007 Ovilos White (Pangeon)

Description: A sophisticated, delicate nose of fresh flowers, peach, lemon and spice leads this attractive wine from Greece. On the palate, crisp flavors of lemon, minerals and spice dominate. Refreshing and clean, it will pair well with Asian food, seafood, salads.
Name: Hatzi Michalis 2008 Veriki White (Atalanti Valley)

Description: A lovely, aromatic nose of flowers, fresh white fruits and citrus leads this delicate white. Crisp acidity and a touch of richness give the wine both complexity and a food-friendly edge. Pair with richer seafood dishes or enjoy this one alone.
Name: Tsantali 2008 Kanenas Maronia Vineyards White (Ismarikos)

Description: One of three properties owned by the Ardurats family of Château Magneau, this is a light, all-fruit wine, its fresh structure soft and open. The pear flavors go along with lime zest and juicy herbaceous acidity.
Name: Chateau Coustaut 2007  Graves

Description: This wine has a touch of weight on the nose and palate—a result of the Viognier and Roditis in the blend. Fresh flowers and citrus on the nose lead into minerals, spice and exotic fruit on the palate. The wine is medium-bodied but maintains acidity.
Name: Mercouri Estate 2008 Folói White (Pisatis)

Description: A lush, aromatic nose signals the Moschofilero in this Roditis/ Moschofilero blend, and on the palate, the wine is fruity, approachable and fresh. The fruit is balanced by the typical Greek minerality and dry, crisp backbone. Pair with seafood dishes, poultry and Asian cuisine.
Name: Gaia Wines 2008 Notios White White (Peloponnese)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Just like the '07, this is a blend of 60% Grenache Bl;anc, 20% Marsanne and 20% Roussanne, featuring ripe melon and peach fruit wrapped around an underlying minerality. It's full and broad, yet manages to be refreshing despite its weightiness.
Name: Vignobles Boudinaud 2008 Côté Jardin White (Côtes du Rhône)

Description: Lemon and lime aromas are followed by citrus, pineapple and a spin of white pepper in this balanced, refreshing Santorini white. Delicate but full of personality.
Name: Argyros 2008 Atlantis White (Santorini)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This pleasing quaffer blends five white grapes, capturing the floral top notes of Riesling and Gewürztraminer, the herbal spice of Sauvignon Blanc and the tangy fruit of Pinot Gris and Chardonnay. Hellfire is the second label of Phelps Creek.
Name: Hellfire 2007 White Wine White (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: This crisp, citric white offers fresh fruit and lemon aromas and a round but spicy flavor profile. Made of the native variety Athiri, it's a stylish but approachable wine for myriad palates. Pair with grilled poultry, fresh fish.
Name: Emery 2008 Rhodos White (Greece)

Description: This complex and exotic white offers aromas and flavors of lemon citrus as well as pears, melon and passionfruit. Refreshing and spicy, it has weight but is extremely food friendly. Pair with grilled fish, salads.
Name: Tsantali 2008 Metoxi X White (Mount Athos)

Description: A deliciously fresh and lively Kosher white blend of 70% Sauvignon Blanc, 20% Riesling and 10% Colombard, offering vibrant aromas and flavors of ripe tropical fruit, key lime and a touch of fresh cut grass. Well balanced with subtle sweetness and crisp acidity.
Name: Recanati 2008 Yasmin Kosher White White (Shomron)

Description: This fun, fruity white starts with aromas of pear, melon and flowers and leads into an easy-drinking array of refreshing white fruits and spice. A great go-to white that's not overly fussy and will pair well with spicy ethnic cuisine and poultry.
Name: Vatistas 2007 Kidonitsa White (Monemvasia)

Description: A nice little wine for easy times. The light citrus aromas lean toward grapefruit, while the fresh, mild palate features apple and tangerine flavors but very little sharpness. Zesty enough on the finish, with a lasting taste of passion fruit.
Name: Bodegas Copaboca 2008 Verdejo-Sauvignon Blanc White (Rueda)

Appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: The blend is 60% Roussanne, 40% Marsanne, apparently barrel-fermented and aged, as the toast, smoke and coffee elements dominate the nose and palate. There's enough fruit concentration to support the oak in a honeyed, mealy way that shows off the wine's breadth and texture. Drink now.
Name: Château Grande Cassagne 2007 Cassanus White (Costières de Nîmes)

Description: With some weight behind it, this is a rounded wine, lightly flavored with apricot and lemon and a tang of bitter orange zest. The acidity is soft, an easy element in the texture.
Name: Château Guirauton 2007  Graves

Description: The nose shows buttered popcorn, toast and baked apple, while the palate is tangy and tastes of tart white fruits, green apple and toast. Has good flow and a cleansing feel to it. Not bad for an oaky blend of Viura and Chardonnay.
Name: Bodegas Escudero 2008 Becquer Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: Fresh lemon gives this wine lift, while oaky spice gives it curve. A balance of fresh and layered, the wine has a weight and spicy finish that gives it extra character. Pair with richer dishes or go simple and do sushi, salads.
Name: Hatzi Michalis 2007 Kapnias White (Atalanti Valley)

Description: Neutral for the most part, with a slight citric pungency. Tastes like apple, spice and dried papaya, and the feel is round as opposed to zesty or angular. Lasting on the back end, with a final note of grapefruit.
Name: Emina 2008 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: Vanilla and a lot of oak blend with baked apple on the nose, while the palate is grabby and resiny, with drawn, oak-heavy flavors of baked apple and vanilla. For a winery that rarely misses with its red wines, this is one that's o.k. but probably not worth the money.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2007 Organza White (Rioja)

Description: Pithy, heavy and chunky, with waxy fruit mixed with oak. The wine has a pretty good mouthfeel and balance, but it just doesn't do much in terms of aromatics or in the flavor category. Decent for a barrel fermented Viura but nothing to write home about.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2007 Barrel Fermented White White (Rioja)

Description: An oddball of an eiswein. Bizarre earthy, brothy notes combine with honeyed sweetness to make for an "interesting" tasting experience.
Name: Rudolf Müller 2008 Eiswein White (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Beautifully floral, fragrant and evocative, with lush and complex aromas of honeycomb, cracker and citrus, carrying into the mouth with rich, bright, detailed flavors. Stone and mineral elements are woven throughout, and the barrel fermentation adds hints of toast.
Name: Buty 2008 Sémillon-Sauvignon-Muscadelle Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Among McCrea's Rhône-inspired white wines, this is the most complete and complex. It's rich and dense, with honeycomb, lychee, lemon rind, pineapple and lots of stone—lovely and lingering. It seems to gain strength as it rolls through a sensational finish.
Name: McCrea 2008 Boushey Vineyard Sirocco Blanc White (Yakima Valley)

Description: This is a gorgeous wine, the ripe fruit of the year giving weight, the dry botrytis giving intensity. Ginger, sweet orange and a big burst of citrus all balance so well.
Name: Domaine l'Ancienne Cure 2003 L'Extase  (Monbazillac)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Winemaker Bill Owen (the ‘O' in O•S) has a knack for making white wines from red wine vineyards. This pungent, ripe, stylish Sauvignon Blanc/Sémillon blend is a fine example. The fruit flavors are thick and juicy— pineapple, golden apple, citrus—and the herbaceous nature of the grape has been transmuted into a sweet grassy streak, supported with mouth-searing acids. It's a roller-coaster ride, and delicious all along the way.
Name: O•S Winery 2007 Klipsun Vineyard S White White (Red Mountain)

Description: This is the lighter of two sweet wines from Ancienne Cure, but this is still pretty intense. It has great sweet marmalade and orange zest flavors, as much sweet as botrytized. Soft, round and opulent.
Name: Domaine l'Ancienne Cure 2006 L'Abbaye  (Monbazillac)

Description: Almond paste aromas and an attractive entry for a full-bodied wine that keeps freshness through bright pear and apricot juice flavors and a touch of spicy wood. The acidity shows slowly, but then brings in a wonderful series of citrus flavors.
Name: Domaine Rotier 2008 Renaissance White (Gaillac)

Description: A beautifully balanced Monbazillac, giving attention to orange marmalade flavors, while resting securely on botrytis. The wine is generous but firm, with final acidity. A wine for aging.
Name: Château Bélingard 2007  Monbazillac

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Chardonnay/Roussanne/Viognier blend is brisk and deep, loaded with minerality and fresh citrus rind flavors. Vivid acidity adds depth and persistence, with white peach, pear and fig fruit.
Name: Syncline 2008 Subduction White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With flavors of the freshest pears, green herbs and perfumed white currants, this is a deliciously enticing wine. The acidity is bright, crisp, but it is attractively filled out with ripe fruits and a wonderful herbal character.
Name: Château Jolys 2008 Sec  (Jurançon Sec)

Description: Wood and spice layer over fruit that has a creamy, Chardonnay-like character. There is herbaceousness, but the rich yellow fruits and exuberant nutmeg and pepper from the alcohol are dominant here. At this young stage, it needs to calm down.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2008 Moulin des Dames White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: A vivid, refreshing blend of 57% Viognier and 43% Pinot Gris seems to bring out the best of both. Viognier's floral, orange and peach scents and flavors are supported by hints of honeysuckle and pear from the Pinot Gris. There is a little spritz to liven up the mouthfeel.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2008 PGV White Wine White (Washington)

Appellation: Pacherenc du Vic Bilh, Southwest France, France
Description: A bright, breezy, fruity wine, wearing its fresh fruit and acidity easily. Grapefruit and other citrus fruits burst out of the glass, finishing with an apple skin structure.
Name: Domaine Berthoumieu 2008 Vieilles Vignes Sec  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: About three quarters Sauvignon Blanc, with Chardonnay and a splash of Marsanne filling out the blend. A lush effort, with a vivacious mix of pineapple, pear, and green and yellow apples. All stainless fermented, clean and refreshing.
Name: Hedges 2008 CMS White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: While there is some botrytis here, this wine is not heavily into that style. Rather it shows freshness, with its white currant and grapefruit acidity and delicate perfume. There is a fine core of sweet apple skin tannins to finish.
Name: Château Jolys 2008  Jurançon

Description: Vanilla, honey, citrus and spice aromas lead this luscious white blend from Bellingham. On the palate, vanilla, lemon and creamy white fruit all mingle in a round, integrated character, but are spun with spice. A pretty, appealing white with something for everyone.
Name: Bellingham 2008 Fair Maiden White (Franschhoek)

Description: A round wine, the flavors initially created by soft textures. Then the wine shows as more concentrated, the acidity bursting out of white fruits, an intense citrus character and an herbaceous texture. The final taste is perfumed and ripe.
Name: Château de Jurque 2008 Sec  (Jurançon Sec)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Young, bright, sharply defined, this brings berry and cranberry fruit in a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and a splash of Syrah. Hints of pepper and herb suggest this as a companion to, say, lamb sausage. Then, as the wine opens in the glass, cherry candy comes on strong. Very pretty.
Name: Hedges 2008 CMS Red White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A very nice blended white with melon and powdered sugar aromas. The palate is ripe and bouncy, with body and flavors of apricot, orange and lime. Dry and brushing up against complex on the finish. Shows more Viognier than Chardonnay. More than solid for the money. Imported by Ecovalley Quality Wine Group and National Refrescos Import Company, LLC.
Name: Tamaya 2008 Reserva Chardonnay-Viognier (Limarí Valley)

Description: Dominated by Sémillon, this is a rich, oily textured wine, full on and ripe. The wine has great flavors of apples, thyme, peppers, finishing with soft acidity.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2008 Cuvée des Contis White (Bergerac Sec)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend of Viognier, Roussanne, Chardonnay and Marsanne starts with strong scents of toast, then hits the mouth with concentrated orange peel, orange candy and other tropical candy flavors. The mouthfeel is substantial, with evident tannins, and a soft, juicy finish. Definitely a drink-now wine, with some burn in the finish.
Name: Airfield Estates 2008 Lightning White White (Yakima Valley)

Description: The second property owned by the Latrille family of Château Jolys, Jurque has produced a fruity wine, lightly sweet, emphasizing a fruit salad of flavors, with fresh acidity as dominant as sweetness. A delicious apéritif style of wine.
Name: Château de Jurque 2008 Tendresse de Jurque  (Jurançon)

Description: This approachable, fruity quaff starts with crisp citrus and tropical fruit on the nose, leading into fresh, fun, fruity flavors backed by a lively, minerally kick. Some spice on the finish gives it extra oomph. Not terribly complex, but definitely exciting.
Name: Westerland 2008 Celebration White (Coastal Region)

Description: Honeysuckle, spice and lime on the nose lead into juicy flavors of citrus and pineapple on the palate. A balanced combination of spicy oak, minerals and fresh fruit, the wine is both fun and unfolding. The Chenin Blanc and Viognier both have a prominent place here, but neither overpowers.
Name: Miles Mossop 2007 Saskia White (Coastal Region)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: As crisp as can be, with lemon and the greenest of apples, with a layer of taut fruit skins. Bright and breezy. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2008 Classic Ugni Blanc-Colombard (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A good pair with the Colombard and Ugni Blanc blend from the same producer, this is a tight, bright, very crisp wine. There is no missing the acidity, but the wine has a freshness that is infectious. Drink as a great apéritif. Screwcap.
Name: Haut Marin 2008 Cuvée Marine White (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: Floral aromas with a touch of citrus lead in this assertive white blend. The flavors‚Äîvanilla, fresh fruit, spice, are wrapped in a wave of smooth oak. Honey and spice add character. An elegant wine good for pairing with salad and poultry dishes.
Name: Deetlefs 2008 Stonecross Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Western Cape)

Description: Brown in color, but not oxidized. The nose offers soupy apricot and fat citrus aromas, while the palate is smooth and orangey, with zest, lemon peel, apricot and honey flavors. Long and thick on the finish, with a brown-sugar residue. Drink now through 2011.
Name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2008 Late Harvest Viognier-Sauvignon Blanc White (Colchagua Valley)

Description: With three years' age, this is developing into an attractive lemon and honey style of wine, with a core of dry botrytis. It could age another two years.
Name: Yvon Mau 2006 Seigneurs de Monbazillac  (Monbazillac)

Description: A soft, easy, floral blend of Viognier, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc. Banana, tangerine, pineapple and pithy dry flavors meet on the palate and finish, creating a fruity, likable, quaffable whole. Drink chilled. Imported by Ecovalley Quality Wine Group and National Refrescos Import Company, LLC.
Name: Tamaya 2008 VCS White (Limarí Valley)

Description: An intensely herbaceous wine, its very fresh acidity a part of the juicy currants, gooseberry and grapefruit flavors. It is light, fresh, a fine apéritif wine.
Name: Château Bélingard 2008 White (Bergerac Sec)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Very fresh, crisp and green, packed with the crispest apples and lime zest. The Colombard adds a perfume of warm apricot skins, while the acidity and weight come from the Ugni Blanc.
Name: Château d'Aydie 2008 Aramis Ugni Blanc-Colombard (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: Pears, apples and cream work well together in this friendly dry white. It has a weight, ripeness, but the acidity gives a lift. The finish is soft and full in the mouth.
Name: Yvon Mau 2008 Seigneurs de Bergerac White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: If you are looking for wild flavors, then this wine is for you. It is dry, but smells sweet, with lychee, green candy and aromatic spices. It's a wine with a terrific character, needing cheeses and rich fish dishes to bring out its full potential.
Name: Domaine des Terrisses 2006 Terre Originelle White (Gaillac)

Description: Layers of spicy wood add to the smooth, creamy character of this wine. It has vivid acidity lifted by green fruit skins and flavors of pineapple and grapefruit. There is a final perfume from the Muscadelle in the blend.
Name: Château les Tours des Verdots 2008 White (Bergerac Sec)

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Comté Tolosan, Southwest France, France
Description: Only red wine can be made under the Cahors appellation, hence the Vin de Pays moniker for this white from Jean-Luc Baldès. It is rich, creamy, touched by apricots and ripe quince. It finishes softly, warmly, rather than crisply.
Designation: Clos Triguedina Le Sec du Clos
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2008 Clos Triguedina Le Sec du Clos Chardonnay-Viognier (Vin de Pays du Comté Tolosan)
Region: Vin de Pays du Comté Tolosan

Description: A clean, almost oceanic opening is fresh and citrusy as it should be, while the palate shows pulse, balance and a little scour to go with orange, grapefruit and other citrusy flavors. Pithy and biting late, with ample fruit throughout.
Name: Esperanza 2008 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

Description: A rounded wine, offering pear flavors brightened by soft acidity. The wine has an attractive edge of toast to fill out the fruit.
Name: Domaine des Terrisses 2008 White (Gaillac)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: The crispest acidity, bright apricot and green plums. This is a light, fresh, instant quaffing wine, a delicious apéritif style with a character that's as bright as a button. Screwcap.
Name: Haut Marin 2008 Colombard/Sauvignon Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: Big aromas of pineapple, citrus and flowers lead on this Chardonnay/Pinot Grigio blend. On the palate, lemon, ripe fruit and honey flavors are sweet and somewhat aggressive. A fun wine to pair with cheeses, dessert.
Name: Good Harbor 2007 Manitou Chardonnay-Pinot Gris (Leelanau Peninsula)

Description: 96-98 Barrel sample. Impressively balanced, with the fruit rich, intense with a golden glow. The acidity is as important as the freshness, giving a delicious lift to the core of dry, concentrated botrytis. Obviously a great wine for long-term aging in a great Sauternes year.
Name: Château d'Yquem 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 95-97 Barrel sample. Deliciously concentrated fruit, which shows considerable power and ripeness. Yellow fruits, spice from new wood and richness are already combining well. And just as a reminder that this has Sauvignon Blanc in the blend, there is a touch of fresh herbaceousness at the end.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94-96 Barrel sample. A wine that opens slowly. Then the concentration and rich fruit come through. It gives a smooth texture over layers of toast, but never losing sight of freshness.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94—96 Barrel sample. The white wine from Haut-Brion is always one of the stars of the Pessac-Léognan whites, and this great white year is no exception. It's the fruit that leads, and behind this the structure follows. The wood is an essential adjunct to the fruit, a spice and toast touch to the recipe.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94-96 Barrel sample. With its lively fruit and fine, ripe,oily Sémillon texture, this is a fragrant, citrus flavored wine. White peach tastes are edged by pink grapefruit. The aftertaste is very fresh, very mineral.
Name: Château Laville Haut-Brion 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 94—96 Barrel sample. This is the rich wine of the vintage. With its intensen fruit, piles of spice, but excellent balance, this promises flavors of baked apples and intense dried fruits. The botrytis layer is discreet, a hint rather than overpowering.
Name: Château d'Yquem 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93—95 Barrel sample. A beautiful wine, full of white fruits, citric character and concentrated structured fruit. Great green fruits give a freshness to the wine, which is fleshed out with spice from the wood.
Name: Château Laville Haut-Brion 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93—95 Barrel sample. Domaine de Chevalier's white has a reputation for long aging, and that's the case with 2006. It is the structure that does it, very firm, almost tannic. But the fruit is also a star, ripe, dense, with green plum flavors and touches of spice. Give this at least 10 years.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 93-95 Barrel sample. The ripe fruits go straight to the heart of this powerful, orange peel and citrus wine. There are yellow fruits, balanced with fresh acidity. The ensemble is rich, but balanced.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2008 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 93-95 Barrel sample. A powerful wine, its botrytis character dominant. But there are complex flavors underneath, the fruits ripe, impressively concentrated.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 93—95 Barrel sample. A very intense, ripe wine, packed with botrytis. It has great ripe flavors, plenty of apricots and dense, full fruit. At the top.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94 Barrel sample. Rich rather than sweet, this is stuffed full of botrytis. The wine is powered through with this dusty texture, rolling richly but catching the dried fruit character.
Name: Château Rieussec 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94 Barrel sample. Firm, richly structured, powered through with botrytis, a dried apricot and peach character, which is tight, the acidity compensating with a great vivid character.
Name: Château Guiraud 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94 Barrel sample. Smooth, the wood almost dominant but finally integrating well with the ripe yellow fruits. It is rich, creamy, with some toastiness, but well balanced.
Name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92-94 Barrel sample. Rich and creamy, showing ripe Sauvignon fruits, hinting at tropical. The fruit is certainly ripe, full in the mouth, but has preserved a good, tight structure and freshness
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 92-94 Barrel sample. Sweet, with a toffee element, the fruit ripe, full of bitter orange flavors, a richly fine wine, concentrated and tight. The aftertaste is rich, with great wafts of fruit.
Name: Château Rabaud-Promis 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92—94 Barrel sample. A fat, full wine, this is rich, intense, concentrated. Great layers of botrytis and apricot flavors give it attraction and power.—R.V.
Name: Château Rieussec 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94 Barrel sample. With its big, almost dry core of botrytis, this is going to be an intense wine - many years from now. For the present, the acidity gives it some freshness, while it remains concentrated.
Name: Château Suau 2008 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 92-94 Barrel sample. Like many of the Sauternes in 2008, this is dominated by huge, concentrated botrytis. The fruits are dried, with orange peel coming through as a final, fresh lift.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94 Barrel sample. With its gold color, this announces richness. The texture is rich, a wine that rounds in the mouth, giving sweetness, tropical flavors and big, ripe fruit. Only to finish, does the acidity arrive.
Name: Château de Myrat 2008 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 92-94 Barrel sample. An impressive wine. It shows just the right balance of dry botrytis and sweet fruit, bringing a firm structure as well as ripe bitter orange marmalade flavors.
Name: Château Filhot 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92-94 Barrel sample. A full in the mouth wine, its botrytis a big, rich character among the super-rich fruit. There is power here, intensity of flavor, a dense, concentrated wine.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92—94 Barrel sample. There is big, and serious botrytis here. With its powerful structure, its dry botrytis, here's a wine that will certainly need aging. Very powerful, intense.
Name: Château Lamothe Guignard 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 92—94 Barrel sample. Beautifully balanced, this wine shows freshness and richness in equal measure. The acidity gives the sweet apricot, dried fruit and honeyed flavors an vibrancy as well as power.
Name: Château de Malle 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91—93 Barrel sample. A classic in a great white year. Even though the wine is full and generous, it also has vibrant green fruits and lively acidity. It's going to be delicious, already shows a great future.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91-93 Barrel sample. On the dry side, this is powerful textured, a firm ripe wine that has big botrytis flavors, a very dry core. Obviously a wine for aging.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91—93 Barrel sample. Intense and rich, with powerful honey flavors. This is a wine that will impress by its power, but will probably also age well.
Name: Château Filhot 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91—93 Barrel sample. Delicate wine, very restrained, showing great fruit, balanced botrytis and some spice. Elegant.
Name: Château Coutet 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 91-93 Barrel sample. Dry, concentrated, a powerful wine with great swathes of dry botrytis cutting through the fruit. A wine that, at this stage, shows power and density.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2008 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From the In The Rocks vineyard, this Rhône white is two thirds Marsanne and one third Viognier, whole cluster fermented in neutral barrels, with no fining or filtering. It's richly textural, aromatic, scented and flavored with lemon verbena, peach, caramel and marzipan. Big and luscious in every way, this is a wine to enjoy while it's in the bloom of youth.
Name: Reynvaan Family Vineyards 2007 Queen's Road White White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: 91—93 Barrel sample. Very caramel flavored wine, rather loose and open, hiding the acidity, but gaining in some excellent botrytis flavors.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91—93 Barrel sample. Excellent spicy wine, lots of sweet fruits, baked apple and caramel. A rich, intense wine, but balanced with a waft of crisp acidity.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91-93 Barrel sample. Rich, generous, opulent, this shows big swathes of intense fruit and orange marmalade. The dried fruits shine here in this powerful, sweet wine.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91—93 Barrel sample. A finely balanced wine, bringing its great green, herbaceous fruits together with spice and wood. It's not complex, but is certainly delicious.
Name: Château la Louvière 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 91—93 Barrel sample. A rich, concentrated wine, all apricot and tropical fruit flavors along with intense botrytis.  An impressive, balanced wine.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 91—93 Barrel sample. This is crisp, lively and ripe, but also shows some excellent botrytis, honey and quince flavors. There is a hint of lychee in the spiciness.
Name: Château de Fargues 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 91-93 Barrel sample. Lively acidity in a wine that is fresh despite its rich yellow fruits. There is a wood element, but it goes well with the apricot juice and pink grapefruit character.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90—92 Barrel sample. Dry botrytis is the theme here, with richness rather than sweetness. Somewhere under all that dryness is acidity and flavors of sweet pears, but these are a long way off.
Name: Château Suau 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 90—92 Barsac. Spicy with new wood, this wine is very smooth, ripe, crème brulée flavor, a lively, fresh wine, delicious already.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 90—92 Barrel sample. Go to this wine for freshness, crispness. It tastes like a Loire Sauvignon Blanc in its freshness, but adds to that with some toast.
Name: Château Latour-Martillac 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90-92 Barrel sample. A rich, toffee aroma introduces a wine which is definitely sweet, with caramel and baked apple flavors. It is ripe, freshened by acidity, but generally richly sweet.
Name: Château Caillou 2008 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 90—92 Barrel sample. Initially severe, the structure then opens out and gives a delicious tension between ripe fruit and that structure. This will age.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Forward, fresh wine, that has some good intensity as well. There is a creamy, ripe character under the freshness, hints of attractive wood.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90—92 Barrel sample. Fresh, rich, with attractive acidity and crisp, green apple and cream flavors. Well balanced, this wine shows excellent botrytis and sweetness properly together.
Name: Château de Myrat 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 90-92 Barrel sample. A ripe style, rich, rounded, with a dense concentration. A ripe, full-bodied, almost Burgundian style.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Lively, fresh fruit here, with a light lemon bite along with the dry botrytis element. The wine has  great vivacity, deliciously crisp to finish.
Name: Château de Malle 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Big, rich botrytis character from the first aromas right through the palate. The wine is rich in orange marmalade, intense and concentrated.
Name: Château de Fargues 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 90—92 Barrel sample. Touched by citrus and grapefruit, this is also a structured wine, dry, crisp, showing wood under the green fruits.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90—92 Barrel sample. This is one of the best Pavillon Blancs for years, a sign of the quality of the Sauvignon Blanc in 2006. It combines tropical richness and denseness (it is 15% alcohol) with pink grapefruit acidity – a great mix which works well here.
Designation: Pavillon Blanc de Château Margau Barrel sample
Name: Château Margaux 2006 Pavillon Blanc de Château Margau Barrel sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Fresh and soft, just hinting at toast, ripe yellow fruits, only lightly touched by citrus. It is pure, vivid, but warm.
Designation: Pavillon Blanc de Château Margaux Barrel sample
Name: Château Margaux 2008 Pavillon Blanc de Château Margaux Barrel sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 90-92 Barrel sample. In the rich style, its herbaceous character covered with a powerfu, creamy rich layer. It has good purity as well, lively and fresh to finish.
Name: Château Olivier 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 90—92 Barrel sample. Fresh, but rich, this is an impressive wine, showing dry flavors along with sweetness in depth. This is powerful.
Name: Château Romer 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 90—92 Barrel sample. This wine, like many, is rich in its dry botrytis, which dominates the fruit. There are also white peaches, and some sweet grape flavors.
Name: Château Romer du Hayot 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 89—91 Barrel sample. A delicious ripe wine, balanced with some fresh, crisp fruit. There are excellent fruit flavors and some lively acidity. The whole is packaged in a covering of light botrytis.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89—91 Barrel sample. Layers of richness here, underpinned by fresh acidity. The dense botrytis is very dominant, leaving the green pear and peach flavors as second rans.
Name: Château d'Arche 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89-91 Barrel sample. A great, fresh fruity wine, packed with grapefruit and lime, topped by yellow fruits, the finish with a waft of acidity. A well-structured, but eminently fruity wine.
Name: Le Nardian 2008 Barrel sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Finely structured, showing a peach skin texture which lifts the rich botrytis character. The wine is dominated by that botrytis, a firm, fine character.
Name: Château Lamothe Despujols 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Rich and powerful, this has big, full flavors. It has an oily texture, suggesting high alcohol, the wood element balanced. The aftertaste has a spicy element.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 89-91 Barrel sample. A big, rounded character, this is relatively soft, toasty almost, the fruit open, generous but unfocussed. It offers richness with a final tang of dryness.
Name: Château Coutet 2008 Barrel Sample  (Barsac)

Description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Very ripe, gold character wine, the fruit rich, almost toffee, ripe, sweet. The wine has a nectar quality, but the acidity gives it a final fresh lift.
Name: Château Romer du Hayot 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89—91 Barrel sample. Very rich fruit, very ripe, sweet wine tempered with botrytis dryness. Great full flavors of candied fruits and quince.
Name: Château Caillou 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Very Sauvignon aromas, lovely fresh herbaceous character. The wine has a fine freshness to it, light, with fruity grapefruit and lime flavors.
Name: Château Rahoul 2008 Barrel sample  (Graves)

Description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Smooth, opulent, powerful, this is big in yellow fruits, mango, banana, with a rich, intense texture. Not exactly sweet, more super rich.
Name: Château Lamothe Guignard 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 89-91 Barrel sample. A firm dry wine, its character dominated by its dense structure. The fruit is just one of the many elements in this concentrated wine.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Tensely structured, showing dry botrytis above everything else. There is big concentration here, while the wine only just shows final freshness.
Name: Château Broustet 2008 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 88—90 Barrel sample. Sweet, soft, ripe, full of very soft fruit flavors. The ripeness of the year seems to have overtaken the wine.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 88-90 Barrel sample. A light style, moving into delicate citrus and crisp fruits. It shows a lively palate, with a tight, dry core of botrytis.
Name: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2008 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 88—90 Barrel sample. Very sweet, ripe, rounded, with almost tropical richness, layered with lychees and spice.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 88—90 Barrel sample. Soft, open, the wood giving roundness to a spicy, rich wine. It will develop quickly.
Name: Château de France 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 88-90 Barrel sample. The wood is the dominant character here, the fruit hinting at herbacousness, but forced behind all that toast.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 88—90 Barrel sample. Great acidity here, which freshens up the ripe peach and apricot flavors, balanced with kiwi fruit crispness. Excellent, lively, perfumed wine.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 87—89 Barrel sample. Soft and round, this seems to have more spice than fruit. Its roundness is more Chardonnay than Sauvignon Blanc or Semillon, hardly in the style of Pessac-Léognan.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: 87—89 Barrel sample. There's plenty of botrytis here, giving a wine with a great fresh burst of acidity along with the sweetness.
Name: Château Guiraud 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 87—89 Barrel sample. This is about acidity. The wine is fresh, with its sweetness layered around the fresh white pears and citrus acidity.
Name: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 87-89 Barrel sample. Firm, ripe, densely structured, giving what is almost a meal in itself. The texture is dry, also rich, powerful.
Name: Château d'Arche 2008 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 87—89 Barrel sample. In the herbaceous style, this wine is all about crisp grapefruit and lime. There's a stucture there, but it is lost in the crisp fruit.
Name: Château Haut-Bergey 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This budget bottle comes on full-throttle, a little toasty, round and ripe with sweet apple and pineapple fruit. There is about 1% residual sugar, still plenty dry for a wide range of food, such as autumn squash or pumpkin seasoned with baking spices.
Name: Kamiak 2008 Windust White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Three quarters Chardonnay, the rest Viognier, this pleasant white wine shows how compatible these two grapes can be. The Viognier spices up the Chardonnay, which contributes apples and butter, along with some hints of sweet candied lemons. Nice winemaking here.
Name: Tildio 2007 Ideale White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: 86—88 Barrel sample. Very pink grapefruit, with attractive acidity, simple fresh fruit, touched lightly by wood.
Name: Château Rahoul 2006 Barrel sample  (Graves)

Description: 86—88 Barrel sample. Light, fresh and crisp, this wine is on the fresher side of the Sauternes flavor scale. It is very poised, elegant, but doesn't have the power.
Name: Château Nairac 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 86-88 Barrel sample. Intriguing wine which brings richness along with fresh, lemon acidity. It takes on a character of a lemon candy, perhaps confected. It is not yet properly integrated.
Name: Château Nairac 2008 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 86—88 Barrel sample. Rich, concentrated, but with some sugar water element, this is mitigated by its impressive fresh acidity.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 86—88 Barrel sample. Very honeyed, apricot and an emphatic burst of botrytis. Through the wine, there is a streak of acidity, but the core is hollow, missing real depth of flavor.
Name: Château Broustet 2006 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

Description: 86—88 Barrel sample. Rich, tropical fruits in this full-bodied wine. It has some freshness and citrus, but it is too soft.
Name: Château Ferrande 2006 Barrel sample  (Graves)

Description: 86—88 Barrel sample. Full-bodied, spicy, with soft, ripe flavors. There are some pleasant, open fruit characters, notably dried apricots, and some easy acidity.
Name: Château Rabaud-Promis 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

Description: 86-88 Barrel sample. A touch earthy, the Sauvignon character has given a rustic edge to the wine. It is fresh, definitely cool in style, the fruit showing some final freshness
Name: Château Bouscaut 2008 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: Pineapple and grapefruit aromas come with hints of thyme and caraway, while the racy but balanced palate has pickled melon, mustard seed and lime flavors. Plenty of citrus and green accents to the finish, and as a whole it works well.
Name: Agricola Castellana 2008 Pampano Inspiración White (Rueda)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Mostly Sauvignon Blanc, with 10% Sémillon, this lightly spritzy wine offers crisp citrus and melon fruit, with a tangy, lemony zip to the finish.
Name: Hogue 2008 Fumé Blanc Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: 85—87 Barrel sample. Soft, unfocussed, round wine. It has pleasant kiwi fruit flavors and light acidity.
Name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: This off-dry blend is nicely crafted and seamless, with abundant fruit and floral notes. It's off-dry, not sugary, and fresh enough with natural acidity to stand well with most seafood.
Name: Columbia Crest 2008 Two Vines Vineyard 10 White Wine White (Washington)

Description: 85—87 Barrel sample. Fat, full, heavy lacking the freshness of other whites from the year.
Name: Château Olivier 2006 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

Appellation: Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Soft, sweet and for the most part spineless, with baked apple aromas and fleshy nectarine and green melon flavors. As if missed, honey and banana enter the picture, adding even more chubby flavors and feel.
Name: Altozano 2008 Sauvignon Blanc-Verdejo (Tierra de Castilla)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Dilute and pickled, with similarly pickled citrus and melon flavors that lose direction along the way. Rather weak and mealy wine, with a strange profile that has to be due to the Malvasia/Viura marriage.
Name: Viña Salamanca 2008 Malvasia-Verdejo White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: This isn't sweet, but just so wonderfully rich. It's the concentration of botrytis that makes the wine. The texture is velvet, but with a spicy bite to it. Apricot, honey and marzipan all contribute to a wine that will age over decades.
Name: Château d'Yquem 2005  Sauternes

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Alexandria Nicole's Shepherds Mark is a Rhône blend of Roussanne, Marsanne and Viognier, sourced from the Destiny Ridge (estate) vineyard. Barrel fermented in neutral oak, it presents an inviting floral blossom nose, leading into a delicious mix of citrus, white peach, melon and light tropical fruits. It's rich but never tiring.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2008 Shepherds Mark White White (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: This fresh, aromatic white offers a nose both spicy and floral, with crisp citrus and floral flavors touched with minerals and salinity. A long, spicy finish adds to the exotic character. This is a conversation starter at the table, but widely likeable.
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2008 Amethystos White (Drama)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Calico White is one of the state's most popular white blends, and is moving step by step toward an all-Rhône effort, now 44% Viognier 37% Roussanne, and just 19% Chardonnay. Winemaker Steffan Jorgensen deftly blends vineyards and AVAs to craft a refreshing, lightly-oaked wine with lime, lemon, pale peach and quinine.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2008 Calico White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Floral, fresh and citric in the nose, this wine offers exuberant, lively flavors of white fruit and citrus. A minerally edge and clean character give it versatile food pairing appeal. A pretty and crisp sip for everyday enjoyment.
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2008 Oenodea Malagouzia-Moschato White (Drama)

Description: A blend of 50% Sauvignon Blanc and 50% Roditis, this refreshing white starts with aromas of citrus and peach, followed by crisp flavors of lemon backed by a lively acidity. Rich but clean. Pair with shellfish, meaty white fish.
Name: Estate Constantin Gofas 2008 Mythic River Sauvignon-Roditis White (Korinthia)

Description: Made from Xynisteri, a white Cypriot variety, this fresh, fruity wine is both easydrinking and food friendly. The nose offers citrus, flowers and melon, with like flavors that are both light and balanced. A terrific warm weather sip.
Name: Panayia 2008 Alina Medium Dry White Wine White (Cyprus)

Description: Cérons, next door to Sauternes, produces a lighter version of those dessert wines. This wine, with its characteristic honey sweetness, is edging toward toffee, the baked apple flavors already tamed by a few years aging. The core of botrytis dryness is now well integrated, suggesting the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons 2005  Cérons
Winery: Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons

Description: Fresh in color, this characteristic continues with the fresh, citrus and bright apricot palate. The honey and dry botrytis elements of Sauternes are there, but everything is fresh, a wine dancing in the mouth.
Name: Château Bastor Lamontagne 2005  Sauternes

Description: This lively Sauvignon Blanc/ Assyrtiko blend's grapefruit, citrus and melon character makes it a perfect hot weather choice. The flavors are clean, minerally and fresh. Balanced and simply good—it's an example of two varieties that are well suited for one another. Pair with seafood, salads.
Name: Texnh Oinoy 2008 Techni Alipias White White (Drama)

Description: This dry white offers aromatic flowers and citrus on the nose, followed by a spicy, earthy blend of fruit and acid. Crisp but with complexity, it will pair well with salads, seafood.
Name: Dionysos NV White Wine White (Greece)

Description: An alluring nose of apples, flowers and citrus lead this delicate white from Cyprus. Pretty, unfolding flavors of apple, flowers and citrus are backed by good acidity and a touch of spice.
Name: Chrysorroyiatissa 2008 Ayios Andronicos White (Cyprus)

Description: This white blend offers a full nose of vanilla and spice, followed by full-bodied flavors that are both fruity and spicy. Pair with salads, cheeses or sip alone on a hot day.
Name: Bovin 2007 Symphony White (Tikves)

Description: Citrus and cream on the nose and palate offer unfolding character in this exotic white from Transylvania. Spices keep the wine lively on the tongue. Rich but balanced.
Name: Terra Romana 2006 Milenium Alb White (Dealu Mare)

Description: Spicy, buttery aromas lead this lean-style white from Crete. Medium-bodied with a combination of citrus and spices, and a touch of flowers. Angular but interesting.
Name: Kourtaki 2007 Vin de Crete White (Crete)

Description: This Chardonnay, Viognier and Vermentino blend from Lebanon starts with aromas of candied allspice, flowers and toast. On the palate, the wine offers soft, subtle flavors of spice, flowers and vanilla. Unusual but approachable—pair with poultry, cheeses.
Name: Château Musar 2007 Cuvée Blanc White (Bekaa Valley)

Description: This Lebanese white starts with aromas of honey, peach and lemon, offering like flavors in a viscous blend on the palate. Some spice offers lift, but overall the wine has a richer character. A pretty, unfolding finish.
Name: Château Musar 2001 Gaston Hochar White (Bekaa Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Toasty and precise, it offers a wonderful panoply of pears, orange peel, hints of banana and tropical fruits, with a luscious, creamy midpalate. The finish lingers gracefully, adding details of spice.
Designation: Seven Hills Vineyard Luminesce White Wine
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2008 Seven Hills Vineyard Luminesce White Wine Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Aussie-style blend is 79% Sauvignon Blanc and 21% Sémillon. It's lush and bright, with fresh flavors of pineapple and grapefruit. Showing firm acids and nice nuances of tangerine, orange and lemon peel, it's very refreshing and textural. The finish adds spice and a bit of cinnamon.
Name: Cadaretta 2008 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: For the first time, Mark Ryan offers a Dissident White. It's 60% Viognier and 40% Chardonnay, from Stillwater Creek, Ciel du Cheval and Conner Lee fruit. Front loaded and ready to drink, it brings fresh, clean, somewhat delicate flavors of tree fruits.
Name: Mark Ryan 2007 The Dissident White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Riesling, Chenin blanc and Gewürztraminer, this is an all-purpose, pleasing white blend, aromatic and lightly phenolic, with apples and pears and a hint of spice. The residual sugar is just over one percent.
Name: Pacific Rim 2008 Autumus White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This barrel-aged white Rioja is as close to Burgundy as you're going to find in Spain. It has a lot of oak throughout, but with vanilla, spice, cinnamon and more it works. Apple, baked citrus and resin from the barrel make it complex and food-worthy, and if you were to serve this with grilled or baked fish you could leave the Montrachet for next time. Imported by Maisons Marques & Domaines USA.
Name: Marqués de Murrieta 2004 Capellanía White (Rioja)

Description: Never a bad buy and almost always a Best Buy, this Viura from Cáceres impresses via its clean, stony nose and pure nectarine, apple and citrus flavors. It isn't complex, but by the same token it isn't candied, artificial or phony. One of our perennial favorites among value-priced white wines. Imported by Vineyard Brands. Best Buy.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2008 White (Rioja)

Description: Dusty and floral on the nose, with tropical fruit aromas and a touch of nut oil. A blend of 60% Verdejo and 40% Viura that is wet, fresh and healthy. Tastes of fresh tropical fruits and finishes with good acidity and control. There's even a slight spritz to the mouthfeel. Imported by Testa Wines Of The World. Best Buy.
Name: Recorba 2008 White (Rueda)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Pungent and sweaty smelling, and even though it's 50% Verdejo and 50% Viura, it's the Verdejo that stands out. Fresh and flashy in the mouth, with lively lime, gooseberry and green apple flavors. And the finish is zesty and wet, with plenty of acidity and spritz. Imported by Grapes of Spain. Best Buy.
Name: Bodegas Escudero 2008 Fuente Milano Verdejo-Viura White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: An interesting white wine based on Chardonnay and Xarello. It's like Cava without the fizz, and the nose starts out dry and like Sherry before green apple and lime come into view. Tastes really dry and chalky, with mineral and apple at its core. Imported by Organic Vintners.
Name: Can Vendrell 2007 Chardonnay - Xarel-lo White (Penedès)

Description: The funky blue bottle aside, this is a good, lightweight, clean Viura that shouldn't steer anyone wrong. Nice pear and apple aromas are basic but welcoming, and the tangerine and green apple flavors are crisp and whet the whistle. Best for simple quaffing. Imported by Admiral Imports. Best Buy.
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2008 Rinsol White (Rioja)

Description: Not for everyone but not a bad sweet wine for desserts and cheeses. The nose is hard to describe but the palate and flavors are familiar: sweet applesauce and sugared pastry along with mango and candy. Decent acidity keeps it fresh and moving forward. Imported by Admiral Imports.
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2007 Diamante Semi-Sweet Malvasia-Viura White (Rioja)

Appellation: Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Pungent and sweaty like Verdejo, and definitely not Albariño as we know it. This Castillian white starts out strong and sweaty, like hockey gear left too long in the bag. But the flavors of pink grapefruit, kiwi and lime are good, and the feel is fleshy if a bit flat. Finishes pithy and citric. Imported by Frontier Wine Imports.
Name: Pardevalles 2008 Albarin White (Tierra de Castilla)

Description: An unusual blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Picapoll that hits with apple and melon aromas. The palate is soda-like, with zest, spritz and tangy lemon-lime and green apple flavors. Dry, pithy and a little strange in its flavor profile. Imported by Grapes of Spain.
Name: Masies d'Avinyo 2008 Abadal Blanc White (Pla de Bages)

Description: If basic Argentinean Torrontés is to your liking, so will this be. It's fresh and green on the nose, with melon and lychee aromas. Those fruits carry onto the palate, where lemon-lime and crystallized mango flavors are sweet but crisped up by snappy acidity. Serve chilled. Imported by Frontier Wine Imports.
Name: Ochoa 2008 Viura & Chardonnay White (Navarra)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Early match-stick aromas fade and give way to scents of white fruits and wisteria flower. The plump palate offers papaya, peach and nectarine flavors, while the finish dries out quickly, leaving a slight pithy bitterness. A little bland but still pretty good. Imported by W.J. Deutsch & Sons.
Name: Volteo 2008 Viura + Viognier + Sauvignon Blanc White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Neutral smelling, with a hint of pool water to the nose. The palate delivers a strange combination of mustard and white grapefruit, and the finish is pithy to the extreme and mildly bitter. The blend is the uncommon mix of Sauvignon Blanc and Macabeo (Viura). Imported by Spanish Vines, Inc.
Name: Spanish Vines 2007 Sauvignon Blanc - Macabeo White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: This attractive, summery white wine brings pleasing flavors of stone fruits, apples, hints of buttered toast and a thirst-quenching minerality.  Fine winemaking.
Name: Nefarious 2008 Consequence White Wine White (Washington)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of three quarters Chenin Blanc and one quarter Viognier, this fragrant and lively young white wine is loaded with pretty green and yellow fruits, nuances of citrus rind, and a textural freshness that keeps resonating through the finish.
Name: McKinley Springs 2007 Confluence White White (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A 60/40 blend of Roussanne and Viognier, this is sleek, textural and immaculately clean, with pleasing aromas of white peach and pear. Though it's made with Rhône grapes it has some of the toast and minerality of Bordeaux blanc; the accent is on freshness and skin flavors.
Name: Domaine Pierre Noire 2007 Blanc du Moulin White (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Fruity, floral and feminine, this cheerful white blends Sauvignon Blanc and Colombar. On the nose—lemon zest, minerals and tropical fruit—and on the palate, fruity but crisp citrus flavors are balanced by fresh acidity. Want a go-to summer white for everything from grilled seafood to Indian cuisine? Check this out.
Name: Rietvallei Estate Wine 2008 John B. Sauvignon Blanc-Colombar White (Robertson)

Description: Fresh, spicy and floral, this Rhône-style blend of Viognier, Crouchen Blanc, Chenin Blanc, Pinot Gris and Muscat offers a zing on the palate with complex waves of melon and tropical fruit. Fresh and expressive.
Name: Goats do Roam Wine Co. 2008 Goats do Roam White (Western Cape)

Description: This white Swartland blend of Grenache Blanc, Viognier, Rousanne and Chenin Blanc offers a rich combination of pear and flowers with a nutty spin. Lush but clean, it's a sophisticated food pairing wine or an indulgent sip on its own.
Name: Sequillo 2007 7 White (Swartland)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Crisp, clean Chardonnay from the Columbia Gorge is blended with 20% Viognier, adding citrus and grapefruit. It's lively and fresh, showing crisp minerality, a lick of lime skin and a pat of butter to finish.
Name: Domaine Pierre Noire 2007 Deux White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Clean, crisp, no-nonense and neither Viognier nor Chardonnay in style. What it is is a lightly tropical, drink-me-now white wine with mango, banana and apple flavors. It drives it home on the palate and finish, and if well chilled it'll go well with seafood, salad or Asian foods.
Name: Oveja Negra 2008 Chardonnay-Viognier (Central Valley)
