Description: With its mélange of Verdelho, Viognier, Grenache Blanc, Rousanne and Chenin Blanc, this layered white offers something for most palates. On the nose, citrus, flowers and tropical fruit lead, followed by flavors of soft but vibrant fruit balanced with a citric, minerally zing. Complex but refreshing.
Name: Bellingham 2007 Fair Maiden White (Coastal Region)

Description: This blend of Chenin, Chardonnay and Viognier starts with an assertive nose of minerals and spice, leading into a balanced, smooth blend that is both fresh and elegant. Curvy apricot is laced with a bracing acidity and the finish, minerally and clean, lingers. Pair with fresh grilled seafood.
Name: Black Rock 2007 White Blend White (Swartland)

Description: The Viognier in the wine is dominant on the nose and palate, but there's also a green-fruit quality. The feel is full and creamy, with polished edges. Flavors of papaya and generic white fruits are limited and peppery, while white pepper spices up the finish. Imported by Ecovalley Quality Wine Group and National Refrescos Import Company, LLC.
Name: Tamaya 2007 Reserva Viognier-Chardonnay White (Limarí Valley)

Description: Powdery apple and pear aromas lead to melon scents, while the flavors of white fruits, pineapple and banana are sweet and a touch salinic. This is a round, plump, drink-now wine that finishes quickly enough and is never rough or overly demanding.
Name: Estampa 2008 Viognier-Chardonnay White (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Grassy and sharp, with the acidic, gooseberry and pea vine character that New Zealand versions sometimes offer. But the aromas don't entirely bring the desired fruit follow-up, the wine falls out watery and thin, just not ripe enough.
Name: Airfield Estates 2008 Thunderbolt Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Yakima Valley)

Description: A decent attempt at a serious blended white wine, but age and other things aren't working in its favor. Lettuce and other green aromas draw down the nose, while the palate is creamsicle-like in texture and flavor. Some drying wood on the finish keeps it in check. Not improving, either. Imported by Ecovalley Quality Wine Group and National Refrescos Import Company, LLC.
Name: Tamaya 2006 Special Reserve White (Limarí Valley)

Description: Some grapes should not be forced together. This is a sweaty, aggressive white with citrus and grapefruit flavors and a bullish feel. Underwhelming despite being big in size.
Name: Estampa 2008 Reserve Assemblage Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay-Viognier White (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicy and detailed, layered with sweet grass and lemon meringue. Shows wonderful dry extract, dense and complex, with terrific midpalate concentration and exceptional length and viscosity. Focused and fragrant, it goes into the deep, bold flavors of the best Washington Sémillon.
Name: Buty 2007 70% Sémillon/26% Sauvignon/4% Muscadelle White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A deep, lush nose of honey, marmalade and lemon leads into fresh, bright fruit and acid undertones melded with luscious honey, orange peel and quince. A lingering finish spun with spice adds to the complex, elegant nature. Pair with cheeses, foie gras.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2005 Red Label Aszú 5 Puttonyos - 500 ml  (Tokaji)

Description: This crisper Tokaji wine starts with an alluring nose of lemon, orange peel and apple, followed by luscious pear, apple and honey on the palate. Balanced and touched with spice and acid, the wine is clean yet complex, and extremely elegant.
Name: Disznókö 2000 Aszú 5 Puttonyos - 500 ml  (Tokaji)

Description: A beautiful, aromatic nose of honey, orange, apricot and spice unfolds extravagantly in this elegant dessert wine. Poised tones of honey, citrus, caramel and vanilla are rich but clean on the palate, thanks to a good acidity. The wine ends with a tart grapefruit spin.
Name: Disznókö 2000 Aszú 6 Puttonyos - 500 ml  (Tokaji)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very spicy, with an intense bouquet of toast, seed and pungent herb. Rich and fruity in the mouth, it's a complex mix of melon, passion fruit, papaya, guava and sweet orange. The fruit salad rolls back into oaky, buttery flavors for a full-throttle finish. Another 15.5% effort from Airfield, but here the fruit can stand up to the barrels.
Name: Airfield Estates 2007 Lightning Chardonnay-Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Description: This fresh, spicy Tokaji starts with a nose of lemon and apricot, followed by flavors of delicate citrus, vanilla and spice. Viscous but clean, with a lingering nutty finish.
Name: Disznókö 2004 Aszú 4 Puttonyos Tokaji (Tokaj)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A floral, dusty nose, quickly leads into a burst of lime and orange. Broad, juicy and off-dry (1.3% residual sugar), its calling card is its great fruit flavor.
Name: Waterbrook 2007 Mélange Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This big, youthful wine starts with a nose of peaches, honey and pear. On the palate, a fruity but elegant combination of apricot, honey and lemon has a clean, bright character. Simple but appealing. Pair with fresh fruit, desserts.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2007 Áts Cuvée White (Hungary)

Description: Pretty good and solid for an uncommon blend, but the Chardonnay and Pinot Grigio thrown together results in nice buttercup aromas along with some apple pie and pear. The palate runs sweet but maintains its freshness, and the flavors of apple, pear, melon and powdered sugar come together. A novelty wine that shows the right signs.
Name: Domaine Jean Bousquet 2007 Reserva Chardonnay-Pinot Gris White (Tupungato)

Description: Mild, light aromas of apple, toast, mineral and petrol are solid before they evaporate, while the palate is easygoing and on target, with citrus and apple flavors. Without calling it overly exciting or complex, we like the mix of Chardonnay and Viognier because it's lively, fresh and perfectly drinkable.
Name: Zuccardi 2008 Serie A Chardonnay-Viognier (Mendoza)

Description: This Roditis-Sauvignon blend starts with a soft, floral nose of lemon and peach and leads into crisp but rich flavors of citrus and flowers. Simple but a good everyday white, especially with light meals.
Name: Estate Constantin Gofas 2007 Mythic River Sauvignon-Roditis White (Corinth)

Description: This white blend offers floral aromas and a medium-bodied array of honey, spice and citrus. Big enough to pair with richer seafood dishes.
Name: Protopapas 2005 Agioritikos Regional Dry White Wine White (Greece)

Description: At $7 a liter the price might be right, but that's about as far as we're willing to go in praising this boxed combo of Chardonnay with 10% Torrontés. The wine has mushy aromas of corn and hay, while the apple flavors are mealy and bring back some of the baked corn from the nose. Candied on the finish and flat.
Name: Alto Agrelo 2007 Chardonnay-Torrontés White (Mendoza)

Description: Gold in color and heavy, with melony aromas and citrusy, melony flavors that end fast and veer toward bitter. Quite heavy and seemingly on the fade; there aren't many reasons to go here, chief among them the weird blend of Chardonnay and Sémillon.
Name: Aconcagua 2006 Chardonnay-Semillon (Mendoza)

Description: Wonderfully aromatic, this sure-to-be legendary wine offers richness, ripeness, and pure yellow fruits, peaches and apricots, all alongside a structured strain of chalky minerality. It is a wine for long aging, the wood spice just becoming integrated, the fruit still in its first vibrancy. But even now, it fills the mouth with generous fruits, and a great finish of citrus.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This is rich, but the balance of the wine is excellent, the wood very much underneath the smooth, opulent apricot and pear fruits. There is spice, which adds a fine piquancy to the texture. The finish is vivid, still young, needing at least five years to age.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Finely balanced, this has plenty of weight, which shines with the fresh lemon, pear and sweet grapefruit flavors. There is some wood there, but just a hint to give texture. A big success from a fine white wine vintage, and worth aging for 3–4 years.
Name: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Rich and creamy, this wine has weight as well as the hallmark freshness of 2007. The yellow fruits and spicy pear flavors are smoothed out with spice, with some herbaceous elements and a fine waft of apple skin structure. Worth aging for 3–4 years. Screwcap.
Name: Château la Louvière 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A truly grassy aroma leads to a fresh, herbaceous and crisp wine. To top its crispness, it also has some weight, wood flavors and a creamy core with a white pear texture. It could benefit from aging, at least three years, to bring out the inherent richness of the wine.
Name: Château Haut-Bergey 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Fieuzal is showing style and promise under new director, Stephen Carrier, and this white is a good indicator. It has forward, ripe white fruits that are lifted with spicy wood and a great waft of herbaceous and citrus flavors. A delicious, rich and aromatic wine.
Name: Château de Fieuzal 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A pure Sauvignon Blanc, unusual in Pessac-Léognan, which normally also includes Sémillon. This is a purely fresh wine, but with a serious aging potential side to it. For now, the white fruits, currants and pears are delicious, with fresh structure and a touch of wood spice. Screwcap.
Name: Château Couhins-Lurton 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: The top white wine from Chantegrive, this is a smoothly wood-aged wine. However it doesn't lose sight of deliciously fresh, herbaceous fruits which come through crisply. That makes the resulting balance immediately appealing, acidity and spice coming together well. Worth aging for 2–3 years.
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2007 Cuvée Caroline  (Graves)

Description: One of the oldest vineyards in Bordeaux, founded by Pope Clément in the 14th century. This white is full, rich, packed with white fruits. It shows crispness, toast and spice, already well integrated.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Mont-Pérat is on slopes overlooking the Garonne river, offering great exposure. Maybe that's why this wine is so well balanced, its ripe fruits sliced open with acidity. The texture is smooth, given spice from judicious wood aging. This is a wine to drink this year.
Name: Château Mont-Pérat 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Thieuley's vineyard is on a ridge in the heart of Entre-deux-Mers. This top white cuvée, with its light wood aging, shows the wonderful freshness of the vintage while also giving some rich, full white fruits, spice and a smooth, creamy texture.
Name: Château Thieuley 2007 Cuvée Francis Courselle  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Owned by France's national agricultural research institute, this estate has been curiously underperforming until the last two vintages. This 2007, almost entirely Sauvignon Blanc, continues the improvement, a deliciously fresh, herbaceous wine, with a currant freshness on top of grapefruit and lime.
Name: Château Couhins 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Ripe, with a touch of honey as if the botrytis for the sweet wine landed on these grapes as well. This dry white has creamy wood, spice and apricot flavors, making a delicious ripe wine, even with a touch of sweetness to the finish.
Name: Château d'Yquem 2006 Ygrec  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: In its youth, this is intensely grassy, the grapefruit and green pepper flavors adding to the general crispness of the wine. It will be an attractive wine, full of pep, with a fine edge of minerality, spice and vivid white fruits.
Name: Château Ferrande 2008  Graves

Description: Owned by the Cathiard family of Château Smith Haut-Lafitte since 1994, the vineyard of Cantelys neighbors both Smith Haut-Lafitte and the Lurton-owned Rochemorin. The wine is rich, smooth, the wood well integrated, allowing fine wafts of herbaceous citrus and currant flavors to come out of the glass. It's ready to drink now, but could age over 2–3 years.
Name: Château Cantelys 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Chevalier's second white wine reflects some of the glory of the first. It has a Sauvignon-dominated flavor, certainly with herbaceousness. But the fruit is ripe, full in the mouth, a teasing combination of green fruits, kiwi fruit and wonderful juiciness. With its edge of minerality, it could age for 2–3 years.
Name: Domaine de Chevalier 2007 L'Esprit de Chevalier  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: The walled vineyard of Château de Cérons is a local landmark on the edge of a village better known for its sweet wines. This wood-aged, creamy dry white is deliciously balanced, showing apricot and spicy pear flavors alongside a light touch of toast. Ready to drink now.
Name: Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons 2006  Graves
Winery: Grand Enclos du Château de Cérons

Description: Another of the many Pessac-Léognan properties in the hands of the Lurton family, this up-and-coming estate is run by Laurent Cogombles, husband of Sophie Lurton. This white is fresh, straightforward, but with a great balance between herbaceous flavors and more weighty white fruits. It is the style of white that opens slowly, satisfyingly, and could even be decanted.
Name: Château Bouscaut 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Dominated by the grassy characters of Sauvignon Blanc, this is a tight wine, almost cool in its character. The fruit skin tannins are very apparent, giving the wine a crispness, layering acidity and a strong citrus element.
Name: Château Carbonnieux 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Great style here, a wine that sums up the white 2007 vintage's freshness well. On that is built a discreet structure of yellow fruits, pears, kiwi and spice from wood. Behind is the fresh herbaceous acidity of young Sémillon. Age for 2–3 years.
Name: Château Villa Bel Air 2007  Graves

Description: A leading estate in the southern Graves region, Chantegrive has produced a relatively rich 2007 white, its creamy texture given an edge by apple skin tannins, but still full, open, already generous to drink. There is a great layer of fresh pear juice, which blends well with lime acidity for a final burst of crispness.
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2007  Graves

Description: The Thomassin family, which runs this estate with its patriotic name, produces wines that need a while to deliver completely. This 2007 is typical, in that the wood is currently dominant, covering the fresh citrus and pineapple flavored fruits. It needs to balance out. Give it at least two years, preferably more.
Name: Château de France 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Sauvignon-dominant, this is a soft wine, which goes for a creamy, elegant character, just underlined by wood. There is acidity, but it is enveloped by the smooth texture, with green plums and white currants balancing a very fresh citric finish.
Name: Château Fonréaud 2007 Le Cygne  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Spicy new wood is obvious in the aroma of this smooth, polished, ripe white wine. It has richness, with its flavors of nutmeg, pears and fresh red apple acidity. The wine is worth aging for two years, to allow the fruit and wood to blend.
Name: Château la Garde 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Pure citrus aromas give this wine an immediate and attractive lift. It is supremely fresh, light and airy, its freshness highlighted by the lightly toasty wood. The texture gives more density, showing rich apple skins and pear spice, followed by a finish that again shows great acidity.
Name: Château Brown 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: This is a finely made wine, bringing out really concentrated herbaceous flavors, almost New Zealand in their intensity. It is fresh, green, grassy, ready to drink now.
Name: Château Reynon 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: From a parcel of vines in the Saint-Julien property of Château Lagrange, this wine is a fine, classically balanced white Bordeaux, with its herbaceous character tamed by a light touch of wood, and the edge of earthiness that seems characteristic of whites from the Médoc. The wine ends with vivid acidity and green fruits.
Name: Château Lagrange 2007 Les Arums de Lagrange  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This is a recent acquisition by the owners of neighboring Château Bouscaut, a separate estate and not a second wine. It has a very forward, herbaceous character, all grapefruit and sweet lemons. There is a pear and apple skin texture which gives a delicious bite to the acidity. Definitely a food wine.
Name: Château Lamothe Bouscaut 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Smooth and rich, this has a ripe, almost oily texture that gives unctuous white fruits flavors over the new wood. The wine shows spice and toast that complement and balance the light structure of pear skins with just a squeeze of citrus juice. This is the second white of Château Smith Haut-Lafitte.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2007 Les Hauts de Smith  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: A rich, smoky style of wine that revels in its high toast character as well as ripe yellow fruit flavors. It is certainly full in the mouth, a burst of ripeness followed by balancing acidity and a texture of red apple skins. It would be worth aging for another year.
Name: Château Hostens-Picant 2007 Cuvée des Demoiselles  (Sainte-Foy Bordeaux)

Description: An intense wine, this is certainly full-bodied, but has fruit weight and concentrated power to match. Beautiful yellow stone fruits—apricots, peaches—are super ripe, their richness allied to sweet acidity, pink grapefruit tones and a smooth, almost oily texture. The one downside is the alcoholic burn that shows through, an unfortunate end to an otherwise spectacular wine.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A smooth and velvet-textured wine, where the wood, while dominant, is also there to give an opulence to the ripe fruits. So pear and peach flavors go with spice and there is a fine, apple streak of acidity. With its final concentration of rich flavors this is developing well, giving a caramel and lime acidity finish.
Name: Château Bel Air Perponcher 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Light, fruity, elegant, a delicious wine that combines very fresh fruits with some softness, restraint almost. It shows green pea, kiwi and a tight, mineral streak of acidity. On top are crisp citrus and white currant flavors. Drink this summer or next.
Name: Château Rauzan Despagne 2008  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Formerly called Le Sillage, this second white wine from Château Malartic-Lagravière is a worthy partner to the top wine. It has a finely rich and balanced character, yellow fruits topped with a light citrus touch and spice from new wood. It should be ready to drink this summer, but will certainly benefit from a few more months' aging.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2007 La Réserve de Malartic  (Pessac-Léognan)

Description: You won't find much varietal character in this blend of Viognier, Riesling, Chardonnay, Verdelho and Semillon, but what you get is a medium-bodied white that should prove versatile at the table. Peach, pear and citrus aromas and flavors are carried by moderate weight and a slightly creamy texture.
Name: Shoofly 2007 Buzz Cut White (Adelaide)

Description: Aromatic and fruity, with a significant proportion of Muscadelle in the blend, this has yellow fruits, lychees, some grapefruit and a spicy element from new wood. It has definite weight, but without being heavy, the fresh fruit lifting all the flavors.
Name: Château Respide-Médeville 2007  Graves

Description: Soft and open in character, this wine shows spice, white peach and pear flavors. The wine has a dense, concentrated texture, with wood spice giving complexity. Faint tannins give it an edge, which suggests it could age another two years.
Name: Vieux Château Gaubert 2007  Graves

Description: This dry white shows softness and a light, creamy, gentle touch. The wine has apricot and fresh lime juice flavors, opening easily as it gets air to finish well-rounded but properly crisp.
Name: Château Bastor Lamontagne 2008 BL de Bastor-Lamontagne  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: From Lynch-Bages in Pauillac, this wine shows richness, white fruits and some herbaceousness. Currently, there is an earthy edge to the wine, slightly coarse, likely to benefit from two years' aging. It is definitely for food.
Name: Château Lynch-Bages 2007 Blanc de Lynch-Bages  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Powerful and rich, from superripe grapes, this wine follows a style in Bordeaux that seems to want to make white Burgundy. It is creamy, rounded, spicy from toast, with white fruits, only a touch of citrus, and a full, intense aftertaste.
Name: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Ripe, creamy and decidedly fruity, this has a big waft of herbaceous, citrus and green plum flavors that are all up front and delicious. The wood element gives spice, offering a base for the fruit and giving good balance, and a vibrant, clean aftertaste.
Name: Château du Seuil 2007  Graves

Description: Certainly with herbaceous character, this wine also has more depths of flavor than the simple fruity surface. There is a core of green fruit skin tannins giving the wine a fine structure. There are fine kiwi, even lychee spice, flavors and the wine ends fruity, fresh, yet rounded and concentrated.
Name: Château Bel Air Perponcher 2008 Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: With its ripe, yellow fruit flavors, this is a gentle, soft, open wine, which offers immediately pleasure. There is more: the spice from the wood and the pear skin and nutmeg element adding complexity. That suggests aging for 2–3 years, possibly more. But also enjoy now.
Name: Château de Cruzeau 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: It's almost two-thirds Riesling, which gives the wine its tight focus and strong mineral and citrus overtones, but there's also Sauvignon Blanc, Marsanne, Viognier and Chardonnay in the mix, giving it layers of fruity complexity. Awfully good for the price.
Name: D'Arenberg 2007 The Stump Jump White (McLaren Vale)

Description: Soft but with definite crisp flavors of grapefruit, lime and green plums, this is a finely structured, accessible white Bordeaux. The fruits are restrained, but balanced, giving a final burst of juicy freshness.
Name: Château Thieuley 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: The vast 300-acre estate of Château Bonnet in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers produces a deliciously reliable, good value wine every year. This brand-new 2008 shows some lively yellow fruits as well as a strong citrus element. It has vibrantly fresh, pure fruit and is ready to drink now, but can age for a year. Screwcap.
Name: Château Bonnet 2008  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Emphasizing the herbaceous side of white Bordeaux, despite its weight, this wine plays a fine line between richness and freshness. The power is there, almost too much initially with some alcohol burn. But then the crisp, green and white fruits come in, giving a poised, vibrant lift.
Name: Château Rauzan Despagne 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Made by the winemaking team of Château du Seuil, Château l'Avocat's white is a fresh, citrus and apples wine, given broadness by some barrel fermentation. There is a grassy character that comes through, giving a crisp, mouthwatering finish. Screwcap.
Name: Château l'Avocat 2006  Graves

Description: Hugely herbaceous, this appeals now for its currant, green plum, pink grapefruit and lime character. Otherwise, age for 2–3 years to soften the forward burst of freshness and bring out more subtle notes.
Name: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2008 Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: The Cazes family, which owns the Michel Lynch brand (as well as Château Lynch-Bages), also has vineyards in the Graves, and this well-rounded, spice- and pear-flavored wine draws on good vineyard contacts in that region. There is toast, along with citrus acidity and a fine, fruity finish.
Name: Michel Lynch 2007 Réserve  (Graves)

Description: From a biodynamic vineyard, this vivid wine reveals great character. The fruit is ripe, smooth, soft, illuminated by flashes of currants, green plums, a wonderful swathe of creaminess. It feels very complete, not intense, but open and ready to drink.
Name: Château Champ des Treilles 2007 Vin Passion  (Sainte-Foy Bordeaux)

Description: A delicious, creamy, fresh and light apéritif style of wine, white fruits just touched with spice and a soft, open, approachable texture. From an estate in the Entre-deux-Mers, this is great value Bordeaux.
Name: Château Penin 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: With a high proportion (20%) of the aromatic Muscadelle, this is a softly fresh wine, attractively perfumed and given a lift of acidity from Sauvignon Blanc. A great apéritif wine, ready to drink now.
Name: Barrière Frères 2007 Château Haut-Belian  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: This wine starts off a touch rubbery, so give it some air prior to serving if you can. The payoff is a pleasant mix of pear and citrus that's fairly broad on the palate yet balanced, and lengthy, too. This year's blend is 56% Chardonnay, 30% Sauvignon Blanc and 14% Verdelho.
Name: Henry's Drive Vignerons 2007 Pillar Box White White (South Australia)

Description: Definitely on the grassy, herbaceous side, this second white wine of Vieux Château Gaubert has freshness. But it is the intensity of its grapefruit, gooseberry and green kiwi flavors that are dominant, given an extra edge of some spice.
Name: Vieux Château Gaubert 2008 Benjamin  (Graves)

Description: Relatively full, and perfumed with grapes from the Muscat family, this is a perfect apéritif wine. It has a texture of pear skins, with kiwi fruit and a final finishing softness, lifted by very fresh, dry acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2008 Trie Weiss White (Burgenland)

Description: A soft, gentle-textured wine, that has ripe fruit, flavors of pears and white peach, lifted gently by spice and open, fresh acidity. Not a wine for aging, but delicious this summer.
Name: Château de Rochemorin 2007  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Imported by Bluewater Wine Company.
Name: Strait Jacket 2007 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Western Australia)

Description: A lightly crisp sparkling wine, given a delicious lift with citrus and mineral components. Floral and fruity, this is fine apéritif wine, just soft enough, an edge of nuts and yeast giving an extra dimension.
Name: Gratien et Meyer NV Brut  (Saumur)

Description: Soft, ripe, dominated by peaches, pears and a rounded, toasty character. The spice is dominant, giving the wine an exotic edge. The more rounded style gives concentration as well as a fine, finishing velvet texture.
Name: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: An intriguing blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Muscadelle, which highlights the herbaceous Sauvignon character and a more perfumed Muscadelle. The two give a fresh, citrus- and pineapple-flavored wine, lively, to be enjoyed young.
Name: Château Mont-Pérat 2008 Les Amants Mont-Pérat  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Kiwi fruit, white peaches and other yellow stone fruits give this wine a rich, full-in-the-mouth character. It has freshness as well, lifted by lime acidity, but—a product of the year—it is a warm, open wine that rolls satisfyingly around the mouth.
Name: Château Mayne du Cros 2005  Graves
Hay Shed Hill 2008 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: An intensely fresh, fruity young wine, in which the addition of Muscadelle tones down the grassy flavors of Sauvignon and Sémillon, rounds the wine out and gives an added perfume. A fine apéritif style for this summer.
Name: Despagne 2008 Molin  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: The branded wine made by the Château Haut-Brion winemaking team is named after Clarence Dillon, who bought the chateau in 1935. This white is soft, creamy, with yellow and white fruits. It is easy, cleanly fresh, ready to drink now.
Name: Clarendelle 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Name: Banrock Station 2007 Semillon-Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Less successful than the red Jacques Sans Souci, this nevertheless has some attractive fresh citrus and green plum flavors and bright fresh acidity. Simple fruits and a light green apple structure give it a good, crisp finish.
Name: Barrière Frères 2006 Jacques Sans Souci  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A soft, easy white Bordeaux. It is clean, citrusy, fresh, a line of grassiness showing through, and a fine apéritif style. The finale is crisp, tightened by acidity.
Name: Michel Lynch 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A fresh white currant-flavored wine, attractive with its acidity and fresh berry character. Dominated by Sauvignon Blanc, it has a grassy element, but there is also good intensity of sweet flavors.
Name: Barrière Frères 2007 Grand Bâteau  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A rich, alluring nose of peach, lychee and honey is followed by simple flavors of oranges, honey and spice. The wine finishes slightly bitter and short. Not terribly complex, but a good wine for summer sipping.
Name: Arizona Stronghold 2007 Tazi White (Cochise County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is 80% Chardonnay and 20% Gewürztraminer; sharp and sweet/sour, with considerable residual sugar masking some bitter phenolics.
Name: Namasté Vineyards 2007 Peace White Table Wine White (Willamette Valley)

Description: Imported by American Wine Distributors.
Name: Fonty's Pool 2008 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Pemberton)
Cullen 2007 Ephraim Clarke Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Description: This dry white starts with a pretty floral nose, leading into flavors of herb, lime and minerals. It needs more balance—lacking fruit—and complexity. Pair it with grilled fish, poultry to maximize its food- friendly character.
Name: Mount Pleasant Winery NV Villagio White (Augusta)

Description: This Chenin-based dessert wine has aromas of apricots, honey and citrus, and on the palate, a dancing acidity that balances its lush, honeyed tropical fruit and honey flavors. A lingering finish adds elegance. The wine is lush but lively.
Name: Kanu 2005 Kia-Ora Noble Late Harvest White (Stellenbosch)

Description: This blend of four grape varieties is on the dry side, with melon and citrus aromas and flavors. Riesling adds a slight petrol element, while the wine finishes with citrus, spice, verve and length.
Name: Leo 2007 Legere White (Pfalz)

Description: Sweet and soft, with ample melon and tangerine flavors combining in this medium-bodied blend that ends up seeming neither very Gewürz-like nor very Riesling-like.
Name: Knipser 2007 Spätlese Gewürztraminer-Riesling (Pfalz)

Description: This famed Hungarian dessert wine never disappoints. An elegant nose of honey, apricot, butterscotch and spice is followed by a luxuriant, mouth-coating wave of satiny honey and apricot flavors, balanced by citrusy acidity. Complex, perfectly poised, it's a wine with both pedigree and charm—delicious when sipped alone or paired with a mild Roquefort or fruit.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2000 Essencia  (Tokaji)

Description: This exuberant Tokaji starts with an enticing nose of orange peel, honey, flowers and toast, and explodes in the mouth with intense, delicious waves of lemon, orange and honey flavors. A perfect balance of acid and fruit keeps the wine fresh without losing its luscious appeal. A memorable wine loaded with personality and excitement.
Name: Royal Tokaji 1999 Mézes Mály Aszú 6 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

Description: A beautiful wine with unfolding aromas of orange peel, honey, vanilla and spice, with a viscous mélange of honey, spice and citrus on the palate. Elegant and flinty, with a luxurious finish.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2000 Betsek Aszú 6 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

Description: A ripe, toffee-dominated wine that has great richness, particularly from the creamy Chardonnay. Flavors of peaches, ripe pineapple and spicy caramel  are enlivened by some finishing acidity. Worth aging for 3–4 years.
Name: Sommer 2005 Welschriesling-Chardonnay Trockenbeerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend is 60/40 Sauvignon Blanc/Sémillon, finished bone dry with a subtle hint of toasty cracker. If it were put up against other Bordeaux blanc-style offerings it would fare quite well at this price; the winemaking is subtle and sound, the flavors tightly wound and the fruit ripe enough but not too ripe. Citrus, melon and pineapple are here, racy acids and that nice kiss of oak.
Name: Lost River 2007 Rainshadow White Wine White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A rare gem, this Sémillon-Sauvignon Blanc blend is sourced entirely from Red Mountain's Klipsun vineyard. Aged for 10 months in one-year-old French oak, it's a spicy wine with aromatics and flavors of botanicals such as mint and quinine. Fruit is sharp with flavors of grapefruit and white peach, and hints of toast and cracker.
Name: Balboa 2007 Mith White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This intriguing white blend starts with combined floral and citric aromas, followed by unfolding layers of toast, spice and vanilla. Serious but refreshing, it's a perfect wine for summer sipping and seafood dishes.
Name: Vinex Slavyantsi 2007 Leva Chardonnay-Dimiat-Muscat White (Rose Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Previously called Cuvée Le Blanc, this Rhone-style white blend is 62% Viognier, 26% Roussanne and 12% Marsanne. The wine is a bit dull, as if the fruit has already begun oxidizing. The finish falls off a cliff.
Name: Kana 2007 Masterpiece Reserve White Wine White (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This bottling changes dramatically from year to year; here it is 100% Riesling rather than a blended white. A little sweet and a little sweaty, it falls flat on the palate, leaving you wondering why a wine barely a year old is already entering old age. Drink up.
Name: Kana 2007 Katie Mae White Table Wine White (Yakima Valley)

Description: This white blend from Lebanon has a nose of almonds, herbs and spicy fruit, as well as an unusual oxidized quality. A spicy, nutty palate with an assertive finish. Unique, but hard to love.
Name: Château Musar 2000 Gaston Hochar White (Bekaa Valley)

Description: Nobody should mistake this idiosyncratic Basque white wine for a bargain. At $25, you had better like steely, almost sour-style whites to justify going here. But if you can find the pleasure in Txakoli, then this one is good. It has peach and nectarine aromas, which are backed by tangy lemon and pineapple flavors. Naturally sharp and cleansing on the finish, and thus good for seafood tapas and the like.
Name: Txomín Etxaníz 2007 White (Getariako Txakolina)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Lush, spicy aromas of apricot, honey and vanilla are followed by unfolding layers of the same in this elegant dessert wine. Luscious and pretty, with a slightly spicy finish. Pair with fresh fruit or sip alone.
Name: Waters Crest 2006 Night Watch Late Harvest Wine White (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: This white dessert wine offers aromas of honey and citrus, and flavors of apricot, honey and lemon. Full but balanced by acidic lift. A pretty wine that's not overly sweet.
Name: Eagle Crest NV Solar Flare White (Finger Lakes)

Description: With lime, citrus and other linear aromas, this is nothing if not fresh. The palate is scouring and spritzy, and swishing it across the tongue will create a sudsy mouthfeel. Amid that there are tangy lime and pear flavors, and then a cleansing finish. Best with anchovies and other sea-based appetizers. A Europvin, Christopher Cannan selection, Imported by multiple importers, including Michael Skurnik Wines.
Name: Ulacia 2007 White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: Despite showing forced sweetness, this Catalonian blend always delivers in its price category. There's dusty lemon-lime and powdered sugar aromas and flavors along with papaya and green melon. It's never going to be a sophisticated white but it does get the job done for $5.99. And because of that there will always be a market for René Barbier Mediterranean White.
Name: René Barbier NV Mediterranean White White (Catalunya)

Description: A little strange and unusual on the nose, with a mix of grass, citrus and corn-like aromas. The palate is wayward and slightly citrusy, with a hint of grapefruit and also some vegetal flavors. Pretty good mouthfeel and acidity keep it afloat, but overall it's not going to win over too many fans.
Name: Bodegas Campante 2007 Versatus White (Ribeiro)

Description: So this is what Chardonnay, Macabeo and Sauvignon Blanc amount to when thrown together. The Three, or “Las Tres” if you prefer, is grabby and mealy, with thick, unfocused citrus flavors and then apple skins and bitterness on the finish. Too strange to rate higher. Already fading.
Name: Chozas Carrascal 2006 Las Tres White (Utiel-Requena)

Description: Smells like canned fruit, and tastes like greens along with mealy pineapple. Falls apart on the finish. Not recommended but not lethal. Barely acceptable.
Name: Pinord 2007 Clos Torribas Blanc de Blancs White (Penedès)

Description: Beautiful aromas of orange zest are followed by gingerbread, caramel and crème brûlée flavors. This is a beautiful, rich, smoothly dense wine with a core of botrytis, spice and vivid fresh citrus acidity.
Name: Château Climens 2006  Barsac

Description: Wonderful, evocative orange marmalade and ginger flavors play around this rich wine. Its botrytis dryness doesn't detract from the intense sweetness, ripe apricots, spice and deliciously refreshing acidity. The richness is in the texture, but the ripeness is in the open, generous fruit.
Name: Château Rieussec 2006  Sauternes

Description: It is the poise, the elegance of Coutet that shows so well in this delicious wine. It is ripe, with layers of apricot and peach, lifted with spice and an over-arching sweet acidity that gives the wine a wonderful, heart-stopping lift.
Name: Château Coutet 2006  Barsac

Description: Sweet, rich orange marmalade flavors, maybe not as imposingly powerful as Guiraud can be, but still with a great inner tension between sweetness and dry botrytis, precede a delicious addition of lemon zest and a final burst of sweetness balanced with acidity.
Name: Château Guiraud 2006  Sauternes

Description: Kracher's Grande Cuvée is often the epitome of a vintage. This blend of Welschriesling and Chardonnay shows the structure of the year as well as its wonderful acidity. It is an exceptional wine, its botrytis so carefully fitted into the rich fruit. The lush, sweet orange flavor istamed by acidity, which provides a fitting lift to the finish.
Designation: Nouvelle Vague Grande Cuvée Nummer 7 Trockenbeerenauslese
Name: Kracher 2005 Nouvelle Vague Grande Cuvée Nummer 7 Trockenbeerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: Very opulent, the wine has a velvet, honeyed texture. This richness translates into the flavors, which are of yellow fruits, hinting at mango with lychee spice. Its density lingers, with freshness coming through at the end.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2006  Sauternes

Description: A rich ginger marmalade of a wine, with pear and spice syrup flavors. This is dense and textured, smooth and unctuous, but beautifully lifted by acidity. Impressive and ageworthy.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2006  Sauternes

Description: Dry botrytis dominates this wine at this stage in its development, a layer of firm concentration on top of the lychee, superripe pear and dried peaches. It is powerful, rich, very dense, needing aging for 10 years or more.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2006  Sauternes

Description: A firm, densely structured wine, with the sweetness turned as much into richness. The flavors are of Seville orange zest, the richness coming from honey and almonds, balanced with dry botrytis. An impressive wine that needs time for aging.
Name: Château de Fargues 2006  Sauternes

Description: A richly liquorous wine, ripe and packed with harmonious sweet textures. At the same time over the ripe structure there is a layer of lively lemon, spice and ginger, spiked with fresh tangerines. The end result is smooth, balanced and vibrant.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2006  Barsac

Description: This big, spicy wine shows the strides that have been made at Lamothe-Guignard over the last five years. The character of the wine is powerful, sweetness concentrated into a hugely rich texture, flavors of sweet peach and lychee showing through, all the time balanced.
Name: Château Lamothe Guignard 2006  Sauternes

Description: The wine starts lively, almost fresh. Only after a while in the mouth do you taste the intense richness underneath. The structure is of pear skins, with white fig and sweet dried apricot syrup. The botrytis, dry at the heart of the wine, gives the whole ensemble great balance.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2006  Sauternes

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Make no mistake—the model for this wine can be found among the classified growth white wines of Bordeaux. The barrel influences are many and varied, layering in a mix of smoke, caramel and cracker; and the fruit is supple and beautifully blended. White raisins, Asian pears, pineapple and peaches blend together gracefully, and the alcohol remains at a moderate 13.8%.
Name: Chaleur Estate 2007 Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A beautifully dense wine, concentrated and ripe. With its opulent style, packed with sweetness, this is dominated by its smooth, velvet texture, the botrytis packed behind. An impressive wine that is good to drink now, but should age well.
Name: Château de Malle 2006  Sauternes

Description: A lively, spicy wine that shows ginger and nutmeg character, followed by ripe white pears. Beneath this vivid character, the texture is smooth, honeyed, deliciously ripe.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2006  Barsac

Description: Currently a hard-edged wine that has tight structure and lacks sweetness. All the elements are there, the botrytis dryness, a racy vivid acidity, richness and balance. But they have yet to come together. Wait at least two years.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2006  Sauternes

Description: A wine that shows a new, improved direction for this chateau, neighbor of Château d'Yquem. It is impressively concentrated and full of dry botrytis, orange marmalade and sweet pear juice flavors.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2006  Sauternes

Description: Harvested in January 2007, this has the true purity and freshness of icewine. There is lightness and delicacy as the ripe apricot sweetness is pierced with floating acidity. There is a sweet, but fresh and clean finish.
Name: Hafner 2006 Cuvée Eiswein White (Burgenland)

Description: A light, balanced wine, with floating lemon acidity, freshness and intense orange and honey flavors. With its vibrant character, this is poised, likely to develop quickly, but be delicious all the way.
Name: Château Suau 2006  Barsac

Description: A wine that has taken the fruity route, with peach, sweet apple and honey flavors dominating. It is ripe and lush, although not hugely concentrated. It is already ready to drink, easy and friendly.
Name: Château Rabaud-Promis 2006  Sauternes

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The latest Métier is 100% Viognier, all from Ciel du Cheval on Red Mountain. The lack of Roussanne in the blend takes away some subtle level of complexity, and this wine, though ripe and extracted and quite seductive, seems a bit one-dimensional. It's a really, really good dimension however, with lush peachy fruit and generous dollops of vanilla cracker and toast.
Name: Doyenne 2007 Métier White White (Red Mountain)

Description: With its flavor that edges toward oxidative, this is the antithesis of easy, fruity white Bordeaux. That makes it an edgy, exciting wine, with spice, ginger and lychee flavors adding to the caramel wood over green plums.
Name: Le Nardian 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An excellent version of this wine, mixing together 39% Chardonnay, 31% Roussanne and 30% Viognier. It was half stainless and half barrel fermented, combined to deliver crisp, racy flavors of lemon cucumber, pineapple, citrus rind and a hint of pepper. Overall this is a very bright and nicely defined wine.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2007 Calico White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Classic Barsac that goes for delicacy and elegance. The flavors are apples and cream, light honey and a wonderful floral lift. Pure lines, fresh with acidity and lively peach flavors, suggest a wine that will develop quickly but very attractively.
Name: Château Nairac 2006  Barsac

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is almost two thirds Sauvignon Blanc, one third Chardonnay, and one percent Marsanne providing the ‘M' that completes the name. Fresh and fruity, pure and quaffable, this fragrant white wine is exactly what this state needs more of. Nothing wimpy about it, just great, lightly ripe flavors of citrus and stone fruits, without the crutch of oak.
Name: Hedges 2007 C.M.S. White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A finely structured and shaped wine, the Sauvignon Blanc dominating the blend, but offering more of its tropical fruit side than its herbaceous character. However, there is a good hint of balanced wood, lifting and giving extra richness.
Name: Château Brown 2006  Pessac-Léognan

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Sauvignon Blanc/Sémillon blend is all stainless steel fermented, but carries some lovely spice and toasty notes along with soft, broadly fruity flavors of melon and citrus.
Name: Kamiak 2007 White Wine White (Yakima Valley)

Description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Chenin Blanc and Garnacha Blanc is a good-to-go white with fruity, spicy aromas and creamy flavors of pineapple, pear and tropical fruit. A friendly midpalate and spicy finish give it dimension. Its versatile character is good for myriad foods—from creamy cheeses to fresh seafood. Or, sip it alone—it has enough going for it on it own.
Name: Allée Bleue 2008 Starlette Blanc White (Western Cape)

Description: Soft, sweet, with the flavors of currants and dried sultanas, this is a relatively delicate wine, not intensely rich. It has an edge of botrytis along with a noticeable mineral character, giving a fresh acidity to finish.
Name: Höpler NV Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: This is certainly a rich wine, the yellow peach flavors ripe and concentrated. But there is also a hard core where the botrytis dominates and makes for a tight character. It is missing charm.
Name: Château d'Arche 2006  Sauternes

Description: This Bradgate blend of Chenin and Sauvignon Blanc offers food-friendly aromas and flavors of lemon spice, pepper and slate. It's zippy but fruity, with a spicy character that will pair well with like foods—think Asian spice. The Chenin offers roundness, while the SB gives citric, clean flavors. A nice match.
Name: Bradgate 2008 Chenin Blanc - Sauvignon Blanc White (Stellenbosch)

Description: A minerally, grassy nose leads on this white blend of 51% Sauvignon Blanc, 25% Chenin and 23% Chardonnay. Intense flavors of honey, almond and spice blend well with a citric, zingy edge. Some tropical fruit curviness rounds the whole thing out. A unique and stylish sip.
Name: Nederburg 2008 Lyric White (Western Cape)

Description: An almost medicinal, tart wine that certainly has the dry texture of botrytis, but then shows more in the way of a herbal character.
Name: Château Caillou 2006  Sauternes

Description: An elegant, perfumed nose of white flowers and crisp fruit is followed by light, flirty flavors of honey, gooseberry and lemon. Soft and simple, the wine has a pretty quality and a good balance of fruit and acidity.
Name: Beau Joubert 2008 Oak Lane Chenin Blanc-Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

Description: A fruity, jubilant nose and flavors that marry spicy oak and curvy fruit make this a fun and versatile wine for the table. An easy-drinking white with some heft- think vanilla, honey, and a touch of citrus.
Name: Herding Cats 2008 Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Western Cape)

Description: Very spicy wine, with ginger and nutmeg dominating the full, rich structure. It is hard to discern the fruit for all this exotic character, although there is pear skin structure.
Name: Mayne d'Olivet 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: This wine is well balanced, rich and unctuous, the sweetness and denseness so carefully blended with acidity, orange zest and dry botrytis. It is a gorgeous, ripe wine, intense but retaining its freshness.
Name: Château Climens 2004  Barsac

Description: A fresh, delicious wine, the natural richness of the botrytis balanced beautifully with acidity. It is ripe but delicate, a style that floats over the sweet fruit.
Name: Château Coutet 2004  Barsac

Description: Like so many vintages of Suduiraut, this wine shows richness, even in the relatively delicate 2004. Ripe, sweet fruit flavors —dates, figs, pineapples and tangerines—dominate. This richness goes deep down, leaving a texture that is intense and concentrated.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2004  Sauternes

Description: For a 2004, this is big and rich, but that is to be expected from Guiraud. The fruit is magnificently ripe, with flavors of peach and tangerine syrup along with the core of botrytis and dark honey. The aftertaste is exotically spicy.
Name: Château Guiraud 2004  Sauternes

Description: Rich in the mouth, this is a smooth, unctuous wine, made even more attractive by its lemon and honey freshness. The dryness of botrytis comes through to the finish, with a delicious lifted acidity running right through the wine. It is rich, but balanced by that fine acidity.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2004  Sauternes

Description: A fine, complex wine that balances sweetness with fresh lemon and honey flavors on top of a core of dry botrytis and a tight structure. A wine for aging.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2004  Sauternes

Description: In the local language, the name means “old vines,” and this wine comes from a parcel of 60-year-old vines. This is impressive, rich and structured, with a wild range of toasty, smoky flavors as well as apricot, green plum and kumquat finished with an herbaceous edge. Needs aging.
Name: Lapeyre 2005 Vitatge Vielh  (Jurançon Sec)

Description: A powerful wine for the vintage, dominated by apples, almonds and dry honey, powered by fresh acidity through the balanced finish. The texture is dense, dryness overlaid with sweet tangerine and orange flavors.
Name: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2004  Sauternes

Description: On the dry side, this wine is marked by concentrated botrytis spiced with dark, smooth honey. There is a tense edge of lemon zest and structure here.
Name: Château Doisy-Védrines 2004  Sauternes

Description: An impressive wine with ripe fruit allied to sweetness, the structure showing light acidity of lemon zest and sweet peach jam flavors. The balance is impeccable.
Name: Château Lamothe Despujols 2004  Sauternes

Description: An intense, concentrated wine, opulently smooth, with rich peach and pineapple freshness sweetened by maple syrup and spice. It's deliciously rich, lingering for a long time in the mouth.
Name: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2004  Sauternes

Description: Fresh, light and delicate, a wine that floats its peach and nectarine flavors over the complex structure of dryness and pear skins, suggesting it will age.
Name: Château Suau 2004  Barsac

Description: This wine revels in the great lemon and apricot flavors of 2007. With just a touch of wood and spice to give extra structure, it dances crisply on the palate, good for apéritifs but also with food. This is a wine that is delicious, for its freshness, to drink now, but will certainly age over 2–3 years.
Name: Château Haut Selve 2007  Graves

Description: The dry botrytis flavors dominate this wine, the sweetness masked by tastes of almonds, honey and spice. The dryness continues right through to the end, leaving spice, marzipan and freshness over richness.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2004  Sauternes

Description: Although this is 50/50 Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc blend, the round, ripe texture and the ripe yellow fruits are all Sémillon. The balanced use of wood rounds out what is a big-hearted, fruity, spicy wine that moves in the direction of white Burgundy with its richness.
Name: Vieux Château Gaubert 2006  Graves

Description: The aromas of rich botrytis are instant and enticing on this sweet wine. It has much of the richness of Sauternes, but with an extra freshness that comes from pear and water melon fruit flavors. The layer of dry botrytis adds structure to what is a finely balanced wine.
Name: Château Puy-Servain 2004 Terrement White (Haut-Montravel)

Description: Rich, foursquare style with fruit that is firm but sweet. While it is not complex, its direct pear and apricot sweet jam flavors are delicious.
Name: Château de Myrat 2004  Barsac

Description: A smooth, velvet-textured wine with pure sweet orange flavors. There is a lightness and it feels somewhat hollow—the delicacy suggests something is missing. The main attraction here is the pure line of sweet fruit.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2004  Sauternes

Description: Weighty fruit, richly perfumed with pears and yellow fruits, stars in this structured offering, the spice flavors giving complexity to an already dense wine. The acidity shows the sweetness of the fruit, a finishing burst over the ripeness.
Name: Vieux Château Gaubert 2005 Benjamin  (Graves)

Description: This beautiful, historic château has produced a concentrated 2004, dark hued, dominated by botrytis and supported by a firm structure. The fruit flavors run from honeyed apple to lychees and give richness rather than freshness.
Name: Château de Malle 2004  Sauternes

Description: The second wine of Château Rieussec is faithful to the rich, opulent style of the grand vin. The marmalade and apricot flavors are full, forward and rich, given some piquancy by the honey and noble rot. It is still likely to age over 3–5 years, but in a half-bottle is ready to drink now.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2005 Château de Cosse  (Sauternes)

Description: Rich, intense and rounded, this is a smooth wine that shows a lemon and peach character. The Sémillon dominates, giving it weight, but carefully judged wood rounds it out, giving it extra depth and concentration.
Name: Château l'Avocat 2005  Graves

Description: Typically Nairac, this is elegant and delicate, with great freshness and acidity. While it is not hugely concentrated, it is beautifully ripe, an aperitif style rather than for dessert.
Name: Château Nairac 2004  Barsac

Description: There is an attractively piquant spice aroma from new wood on this soft, ripe wine. Along with the wood flavors, there are fresh pears, creamy Golden Delicious apples and a fine, arching structure of fresh tannins. Great, mouthwatering acidity marks the finish.
Name: Château Bertinerie 2007 Cru Réserve  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: There is such a surprising level of acidity in this wine that it seems unsure of where to go with its sweetness. The fruit flavors are lemon, peach and dry honey. While the wine is likely to age, it is already missing intensity.
Name: Château Rabaud-Promis 2004  Sauternes

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A delicious wine, the Chenin Blanc giving both mineral and spice flavors, contrasting with the richer Chardonnay. Apricot and sweet melon flavors are supported by a fine, surprisingly complex structure. Fresh currants mark the refreshing finish.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2007 Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: Full, firm white wine that gives good green fruit and pear flavors, lifted with spice from wood. The wine is round, while still retaining crispness from grassy acidity, and offers a good depth of plum skin structure and flavor.
Name: Château Puy-Servain 2007 Marjolaine  (Montravel)

Appellation: Premieres Côtes de Blaye, Bordeaux, France
Description: An herbaceous wine, smoothed out by spicy wood. The wine is balanced, the wood a delicious extra to pear and green plum-skin fruit flavors. Very perfumed, it demands fish with a sauce or scallops.
Name: Château Haut Bertinerie 2006  Premieres Côtes de Blaye

Description: Emphasizing richness rather than sweetness, here is a wine that is dominated by the dryness of botrytis. It has powerful, dark honey flavors allied to almonds and spice. The fruit, though, is less obvious.
Name: Château Lamothe Guignard 2004  Sauternes

Description: In cooler vintages like 2007, this white blend from Bodegas Naia excels. It gets going with pear, apple and light, leesy aromas in front of a citrusy palate that is a knock-off for varietal Sauvignon Blanc. Flavors of grapefruit, lime and gooseberry should be familiar, and the crisp fresh-lettuce finish is a winner. Good stuff for the money.
Name: Naia 2007 Las Brisas White (Rueda)

Description: Closed and tight, this wine takes a while to reveal its ripe pear and apricot flavors. It is rich, but keeps its freshness very much to the fore. Lemon zest and tangerine fruits give acidity, which is rounded out by a spicy, lightly toasty aftertaste.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2007 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Graves)

Description: A spicy, perfumed, soft wine. The hint of wood opens the wine and provides vanilla, lychee, ginger and artichoke flavors. The downside is a lack of freshness in a wine that feels quite fat.
Name: Domaine des Terrisses 2006 Blanc Sec Terre Originelle White (Gaillac)

Description: A blend of Loin de l'Oeil, Mauzac and Sauvignon Blanc, this needs the shot of acidity from the Sauvignon—it gives a real lift to the ripe apricot fruits. The wine is structured, quite tight with apple skin flavors, creating an appetizing, juicy finish.
Name: Domaine des Terrisses 2007 Grand Tradition White (Gaillac)

Description: Sweet pear perfumes announce a ripe style of white wine. It is on the soft side, its acidity well under the pear and melon flavors, aided by nutmeg and tangerines. The finish is juicy, ripe, always soft.
Name: Château le Bonnat 2006  Graves

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This intriguing blend of Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc works well, displaying richness as well as an intense herbaceousness. This is a lively wine, with its apple and pear flavors, topped with grapefruit acidity.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2007 Chardonnay-Sauvignon (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: A rare example of the sweet wines of Sainte-Foy, this is more semisweet than super sweet. As such, it has attractive apple and custard flavors in a creamy texture lifted by vanilla and lightened by fresh green plum acidity.
Name: Château le Pré de la Lande 2006  Sainte-Foy Bordeaux
Winery: Château le Pré de la Lande

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Lucid in the glass, and that's half the battle when you're talking about basic, everyday whites such as this Viura-Verdejo blend. The nose is light as air, with lemony accents. Meanwhile, the fresh but lean palate offers lime, pineapple and cleansing acidity. And that's more or less what you get.
Name: Rivera de Castilla 2007 Viura-Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: Firm and concentrated, this wine lacks fruit and freshness and has gone all-out for weight and richness. With its white pepper spice marking out the alcohol, it finishes unbalanced.
Name: Château Romer du Hayot 2004  Sauternes

Description: Fresh and lemony, this tastes light, crisp, the apple skin structure just a hint. While it is not a dense wine, the apricot edge makes it sweetly drinkable, freshened up with some citrus zest.
Name: Vieux Château Gaubert 2006 Benjamin  (Graves)

Description: Ripe, rich wine from a great Sauternes year. It has sweetness, but this is tempered with a fine layer of dry botrytis, dried fruits and nutmeg. The texture opens out to a fresh finish.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2005 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Sauternes)

Description: Aromas of fresh cantaloupe melon and apricots, are echoed in the flavors of this tropical fruit wine, which is ripe and full, with the acidity coming from nectarines and some toast.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2005 Château Paradis Casseuil  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Lean, with acidity but not high richness, this is a light, simple wine, the fruit flavors edging towards sweet apples.
Name: Château d'Arche 2004  Sauternes

Description: This is the entry-level sweet Jurançon from Bernard Larrieu and it is only lightly touched by botrytis. It is fresh, immediately ready to drink, with acidity and light honey giving a final lift.
Name: Lapeyre 2006  Jurançon

Description: The year is a fine one for white Bordeaux, and this vintage of white Mouton-Cadet takes good advantage of the fresh, herbaceous character, with an added citrus tang, and spiced up with some aromatic Muscadelle.
Name: Mouton-Cadet 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Dominated by Ugni Blanc, the grape also used in the local Armagnac brandy, this is a tight, crisp wine, green but not unpleasantly so. Its acidity comes from fresh apple flavors, touched with some good juiciness and a fine refreshing finish. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine du Tariquet 2007 Ugni Blanc-Colombard (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: If you want light, fresh wine, this fits the bill. It is crisp, with pear and spice flavors, just off-dry, but leaving lively acidity. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine la Hitaire 2007 Les Tours White (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: A grassy-flavored wine, dominated by Sauvignon Blanc. It is very herbaceous, definitely on the crisp side, the currants and green apple skin fruits dominating.
Name: Château Calabre 2007  Montravel

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon results in a fat, soft style of wine. It definitely needs food, where its apples and cream flavors will fit well. The finish is crisp and attractive. Screwcap.
Name: Domaine la Hitaire 2007 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Appellation: Premieres Côtes de Blaye, Bordeaux, France
Description: A heavily spicy wine from wood, giving a style that is well suited to Asian foods. The spice and vanilla come over much more strongly than the fruit, which is light, crisp, hinting at sweet pears.
Name: Château la Rose Bellevue 2007 Prestige  (Premieres Côtes de Blaye)

Description: Green fruits, grapefruit and a cut grass herbaceous character mark  this wine. The finish has some good juiciness, green plums coming through, always intense, but very fresh. Screwcap.
Name: Château La Rose du Pin 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Herbaceous wine, with grapefruit aromas and apple skin tannins. It's crisp, fresh, a proper summer white that takes advantage of the cool of the vintage.
Name: Château Darzac 2007 Réserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: A white currant-flavored wine with soft but fresh acidity, layered with just a touch of spice. The wine is fruity, juicy, an easy drink as an aperitif or with fish.
Name: Domaine de Ballade 2007 Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: Initially ripe and creamy, the wine tightens up with herbaceous, lemongrass flavors, only hinting at the richness. It needs another six months in bottle before drinking.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Ripe, sweet wine, flavored with sweet spices, pears and dried apricots. It has just a hint of botrytis, more of sweetness and attractive richness. There is light acidity, which gives a final lift.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2006  Sauternes

Description: An attractive, crisp, citrus-flavored wine, structured with green plum skins, giving fresh pleasure now and promising some softening over the next year.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2007 Réserve Spéciale  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: On the heavy side, this is clumsy and awkward—the botrytis doesn't seem to have melded with the fruit.
Name: Château Caillou 2004  Sauternes

Description: A tightly herbaceous wine initially, which opens out to give grassy, grapefruit and green plum skin flavors. Acids are high, but work to add freshness rather than overwhelm. There's a delicious fresh, currant and green fruit flavor on the finish.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Attractive lemon- and green apple-flavored white Bordeaux from the Fronsac region. It is crisp, benefiting from the freshness of 2007, with a light structure of orange zest. Screwcap.
Name: Château la Moulinière 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Intense, mineral and pink grapefruit-flavored wine, which is so intensely herbaceous that it shocks the taste buds. Screwcap.
Name: Château la Hargue 2007  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Soft and corny on the nose, with cream and mealy fruit notes. The palate is pure grapefruit and citrus, with no Chardonnay character or weight to speak of. And the finish is the same. Not awful, but makes you wonder what's the point?
Name: Finca la Celia 2007 Eagle's Rock Chardonnay-Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Description: This intriguing stickie is predominantly (94%) Chardonnay—an unusual choice for a botrytized wine. Dried apricot and ripe pear aromas lead the way, with the flavors leaning toward intensely honeyed apricot preserves. It's full-bodied, lush and candy-sweet, with a mouthcoating finish.
Name: D'Arenberg 2006 The Noble Chardonnay-Semillon (Adelaide)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend is 37% Marsanne, 33% Grenache Blanc, 20% Picpoul and 10% Roussanne. Among McCrea's Rhône-inspired white wines, this is the most complete and complex. The stony, textural underpinning adds a lot of depth while the fruit mixes citrus and melon with hints of just-ripe green banana and papaya. It's a juicy yet subtle wine, with aging potential over the next half decade or so.
Name: McCrea 2007 Boushey Vineyard Sirocco Blanc White (Yakima Valley)

Description: A unique dessert wine made from botrytized Sémillon that's then fortified and aged for an average of eight years in barrel, this is a dark, coffee-brown wine, with a hint of green to its rim. Aromas are slightly nutty and molasses-like, with raisiny, almost Muscat-like flavors. Full-bodied and rich, it finishes long and sticky.
Name: De Bortoli NV Black Noble White (Australia)

Description: Questionable value at $70, but this is very good and rather unique white Rioja. Remelluri uses a multitude of common and unheard-of grapes, and they hit it with a lot of oak. Still, amid the oily richness there's balance, acidity and excellent layering of grass, spice, apple, banana and lemon flavors. Big at 14.5%, but it will go really well with baked fish or lobster.
Name: Remelluri 2006 Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: There's an attractive maturity to this bottling of Cuvée Flamme, giving a wine that is certainly dry, but is also rich. The initial fruitiness has been replaced with almond, yeast and toast flavors, balanced with a final ripe burst of baked apple.
Name: Gratien et Meyer NV Cuvée Flamme Brut  (Saumur)

Description: With its rich fruit, this is an immediately attractive wine. It shows the ripeness of the year in Saumur, bringing together apricot and cantaloupe melon flavors, the acidity a necessary and balancing adjunct to the full-bodied texture. Drink now, or age for 2–3 years.
Name: Bouvet-Ladubay 2006 Saphir Brut Vintage  (Saumur)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An iconic wine for Barnard Griffin, this is blended with 16% Sémillon. Spicy, searingly tart (below 13% alcohol, high acid) and annotated with beeswax, lemon oil, hints of honey and tea. Fragrant and palate cleansing; this is a particularly fine oyster wine.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2007 Fumé Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Light yellow in color and slightly woody on the nose. This blend isn't overly oaked but it is plump, rich and textured. The palate features melon, lychee and spice flavors, while the back end is full and dry, with an ending blast of green melon. Drink now.
Name: Finca Allende 2006 Blanco White (Rioja)

Description: This flavorful white blend offers a spicy, floral nose and a delicious combination of robust fruit, honey and spice flavors. Still fresh and clean, it offers complexity that will lend it to pairings with poultry and intricate ethnic dishes.
Name: Palivou 2007 White Fox White (Corinth)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Smooth and creamy, this is a soft, ripe sparkling wine, its acidity at just the right level of crispness. A round the core of acidity, green plum and grapefruit flavors give freshness and some richness. A great food sparkler.
Name: Langlois-Chateau NV Brut White (Crémant de Loire)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A fresh, vibrant white wine that shows the touch and talent of winemaker Michael Haddox. It's a fine match of grapes, with bright (and co-fermented) flavors of cut pear and apple, a leesy, textural body, and a lingering finish that refreshes the palate without being tiring.
Name: The Winemaker's Loft 2007 Chardonnay-Pinot Gris White (Yakima Valley)

Description: A jubilant nose of lemon, tropical fruit and spice starts this appealing white blend. Fresh, zippy flavors of lemon and pineapple are buoyed by a tingling acidity, but the wine has complexity. Well made with great food pairing potential—think grilled seafood or Mediterranean chicken.
Name: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2007 Amethystos White (Drama)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: This big, ripe wine is now past its youth. That is bringing out the toast, yeast and walnut flavors. But the acidity is not far away, coming from the taut texture, and leaving a crisp fresh, raspberry-flavored aftertaste.
Name: Domaine des Baumard 2004 Tirage Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Crémant de Loire)

Description: This is the first vintage for this spicy tasting room white. It's lightly spritzy, crisp and bone dry, with white pepper and tart citrus skin. The four grapes in the blend—Pinot Blanc, Pinot Gris, Riesling and Gewürztraminer—complement each other without losing their individuality. Persistent and very refreshing this  is a quintessential summer wine.
Name: Ross Andrew 2007 Meadow White Wine White (Oregon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Mostly Sauvignon Blanc, with 10% Sémillon, this graceful wine opens with some sharp, grassy and grapefruity scents, then softens up a bit, with a textural middle that hints at sage, melon, smoke and herb. Huge improvement over the 2006.
Name: Hogue 2007 Fumé Blanc Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This native white (70% Roditis and 30% Batiki) blend offers a zippy but floral nose and flavors of lemon, oregano and flowers on the palate. Fresh acidity and rich fruit flavors add up to a delightful, approachable white with character. Pair with lighter seafood and poultry dishes.
Name: Dougos 2006 Methistanes White (Thessalikos)

Description: This white blend starts with a nose of toasted spice and lemon peel, leading into a fresh, citric character heavy in minerality. Clean and lively, it's a great choice for spicy dishes or drinking on a hot day.
Name: Antonopoulos 2005 Adoli Ghis White (Greece)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: About three quarters Sauvignon Blanc, lightly grassy and touched with sweet herb, this wine ramps up the flavors with the addition of the Sémillon, which brings more stone fruits into the midpalate. It's delicate enough to chill and drink with lighter sea foods and shellfish, but well-made and proportionate.
Name: Airfield Estates 2007 Thunderbolt Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Yakima Valley)

Description: This elegant Cypriot white from the monastery of Chrysorroyiatissa offers a blend of complexity and freshness. The clean, lush fruit and citrus flavors are balanced with fresh acidity and a touch of floral sweetness. An intriguing white with class.
Name: Chrysorroyiatissa 2007 Ayios Andronicos White (Cyprus)

Description: A big, rich wine, from a fine year in the Loire. The fruits are sweet, although the acidity and texture make this wine dry. Flavors of peach, pear and spice work well together here, giving a fine, ripe mouthful of creamy mousse.
Name: Gratien et Meyer 2005 Premium Millésimé Brut  (Saumur)

Description: An alluring floral and peach nose leads into fresh, citric flavors of lemon and orange in this elegant white. Dry and clean, it will pair well with seafood and herbed chicken.
Name: Nasiakos 2007 White (Mantinia)

Description: The bitter orange flavor of this white may turn some sippers off, but overall, the wine is fresh, friendly and tempered by food pairing. Dry and spicy, it's balanced by sweet pear and fresh fruit flavors.
Name: Achaia Clauss NV Sta. Helena White (Greece)

Description: This is the standard bearer of one of the top Saumur producers. It is pleasantly fresh and crisp, the white fruits showing well over the ripe, creamy texture. With its fine acidity, it leaves a crisp, mineral aftertaste.
Name: Bouvet-Ladubay NV Signature Brut White (Vin Mousseux)

Description: Crisp pear and red apple flavors are the initial attraction of this fresh sparkler. The candy shop acidity is a distraction, showing a concocted aftertaste.
Name: Marquis de la Tour NV Brut White (Vin Mousseux)

Description: Once you cut through an astringent edge, this becomes a simple, fresh, fruity wine dominated by white fruit. There is attractive acidity, the crisp apple flavors layered with spice.
Name: Bailly-Lapierre NV Brut de Charvis White (Vin Mousseux)

Description: A heavy nose of thyme and pine in the typical retsina style will either intrigue or deter drinkers of this affordable, traditional wine. Rustic and simple, the wine is refreshing when chilled and offers more of the minty, herbal, pine character that lovers of retsina covet. An affordable choice for warm weather enjoyment.
Name: Kourtaki NV Retsina of Attica White (Retsina)

Description: Creamy wine, flavored with pears, almonds and crisp acidity. The wine is taut and crisp at the same time. The aftertaste, otherwise fresh, is spoilt by a yeasty bitterness.
Name: Caves de Marsigny NV Saint-Meyland Brut White (Vin Mousseux)

Description: This popular, light-bodied white is a blend of native grapes, Roditis and Savatiano, and will appeal to fans of fresh but simple wines like Pinot Grigio. A nose of lemon citrus and flavors that are friendly and clean give it a summer-sipping quality. Easy to drink and good for seafood dishes.
Name: Achaia Clauss NV Demestica White White (Greece)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's about 75% Sauv Blanc, 25% Sémillon. Lush with bright, fresh flavors of pineapple and grapefruit, it also has good acids with nuances of tangerine, orange and lemon peel. It's refreshing and textural, the sort of white wine that demands shellfish and seafood. Especially good on the finish, which adds a bit of cinnamon.
Name: Cadaretta 2007 sbs Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Rulo's affordable white blend is 90% Sauvignon Blanc, 5% Viognier and 5% Chardonnay. It's a focused, intense wine; the fruit a gorgeous mix of citrus, rock, fresh herb and a little pepper. The flavors seem etched in stone; they cut through with beautiful natural acids. This is a style that is almost impossible to find in the U.S.—very European, but with a clean, expressive, fruit-driven core.
Name: Rulo 2006 Combine White Wine White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A blend of Chardonnay and Grüner Veltliner, this wine certainly shows Chardonnay richness, with yellow fruit, peach and apricot over a smooth softness. The element of Grüner lends some spice, while wood gives added richness. Hard not to drink now, but aging over 3–4 years would show its potential.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2005 Weisse Reserve Vom Schloss White (Niederösterreich)

Description: As close to a New World style of white wine as you're going to find in Spain has to be Chivite Colección 125. It's mostly Chardonnay, and with a nose of popcorn, butterscotch and baked white fruits, it somewhat resembles a fine effort from Burgundy or California. But this is Spanish, and the flavors of pineapple, lemon and walnuts are good and the feel is rich and serious. Drink now into 2009.
Name: Bodegas Julián Chivite 2005 Coleccion 125 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Navarra)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A new wine from Fidélitas, this Bordeaux blend includes 54% Sauvignon Blanc and 46% Sémillon. A classy effort, it cleanses the palate with refreshing acids and flavors of mineral and citrus skin. It lingers gracefully with vividly defined fruit flavors of white peach and pineapple.
Name: Fidelitas 2007 Optu White Wine White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: 70% Sémillon and 30% Sauvignon Blanc. The vineyard's new planting of Sauvignon Blanc definitely adds a racy, sculpted aspect to the plumper, more floral Sémillon. The blend works synergistically, so flavors express both the melon and pear foundation of the Sémillon, and the more herbal precision of the Sauvignon Blanc.
Designation: Seven Hills Vineyard Luminesce White Wine
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2007 Seven Hills Vineyard Luminesce White Wine White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: The style is unmistakeable, the freshness of the noble rot sweet wines of Rust gives a great burst of liveliness to the honey-drenched flavors of the baked apple fruits. It's tempting to drink this wine now, but it should age over many years.
Name: Wenzel 2005 Saz Ruster Ausbruch White (Burgenland)
