Description: Nominated for most interesting Best Buy in a long time, this oddball blend of Chardonnay and Viognier is from little-known San Juan Province in Argentina. Blended by the Australian Peter Bright, it's a full-bodied, barrel-aged wine that's seemingly oxidized but isn't. Yellow in color, with roundness, depth and waxy honey, apricot, pineapple and apple flavors. Not a perfect specimen, and definitely not for everyone. But we'd drink it again, and we'd expect to be challenged.
Name: Bodegas Peñaflor 2006 Elementos Chardonnay-Viognier (San Juan)

Description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Rolle and Ugni Blanc, this creamy wine packs a delicious fresh layer of crisp citrus and a soft underbelly of avocado smoothness. There is some green fruit skin structure, and a lively herbal element.
Name: Le Classique from the 3 Springs Vineyard 2006 White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
Winery: Le Classique from the 3 Springs Vineyard

Description: This lovely Chenin/Viognier blend offers delicious baked vanilla, lemon and citrus on the nose and mouthfilling, opulent flavors of spice, tropical fruit and lemon on the palate. A warm and sultry white with a long finish.
Name: Miles Mossop 2006 Saskia White (Coastal Region)

Description: While it also produces dry whites, the glory of Jurançon is the sweet wines. Made from Gros and Petit Manseng, this wine is sweet, but not heavily botrytised. Flavors of peaches dominate, with some honey, spice, light acidity. Probably best drunk as an apéritif, maybe with pâté or blue cheese.
Name: Château Jolys 2004 Cuvée Jean  (Jurançon)

Description: A mouth-filling sweetness is the hallmark of this wine. For its style, it is concentrated, honeyed, with rich fruits, the dry edge of noble rot a counter-balance to all the sweetness. The acidity is there, but is overwhelmed by all this richness.
Designation: Am Fusse des Berges Ruster Ausbruch
Name: Wenzel 2005 Am Fusse des Berges Ruster Ausbruch White (Burgenland)

Description: This unique white wine blend is 52% Viognier, 43% Pinot Gris and 5% Muscat Blanc, and the combination works quite well. The Pinot Gris anchors the middle, with plenty of flesh and fruit; the Viognier brings sliced orange and apricot flavors, while the Muscat piles on the pretty aromatics. It's full-bodied and loaded with fruit flavors that hold on through a lingering, lip-smacking finish.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2007 PGV White Wine White (Washington)

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Comté Tolosan, Southwest France, France
Description: A crisp wine with intriguing herbal and green fruit flavors that are edged with tannins, and a toasty, mineral finish. Delicious.
Name: Clos Triguedina NV Le Sec du Clos Chardonnay-Viognier (Vin de Pays du Comté Tolosan)
Region: Vin de Pays du Comté Tolosan

Description: A blend of 70% Semillon and 30% Sauvignon Blanc, Plantagenet's Hazard Hill white is fresh and grapefruity, with hints of melon to help round it out. Crisp acids and modest weight make it refreshing--it would be fine as an apéritif or with seafood. Drink now.
Name: Plantagenet 2007 Hazard Hill Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Western Australia)

Description: Creamy soft fruit, with the richness of 2005, hinting at some toast flavors. This wine is the second label from the Conti family, owners of Château Tour des Gendres, by far the best producer in Bergerac. It is a rounded, full wine, with fine, ripe white fruits, pears and nectarines, topped with light acidity.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2005 Tour des Gendres Le Classique White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: Waxy fruit aromas, a touch of smoky astringency and a hard nutty back end define the bouquet. The palate on this Chardonnay-led blend, however, is sweet and melony, with hints of peach. It's already showing signs of losing focus, which is par for the course with this wine. So drink now for best results.
Name: Bodegas Julián Chivite 2004 Coleccion 125 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Navarra)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend is 60% Viognier and 40% Roussanne; the wine is a rich golden color, with an equally rich and fruity mouthfeel. Flavors include lots of golden apple, hints of peach and light tropical. This is well-balanced, seamless and shows medium concentration.
Name: Zefina 2006 Serience White White (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: For the white in its Zette range, the team at Lagrézette has moved out of Cahors and gone further east. The wine has smooth, green fruit flavors, touched with apricot ripeness and a fine texture of pear skins to give spice. The aftertaste is mouthwatering acidity.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2007 Zette Blanc Chardonnay-Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)
Alkoomi 2007 White Label Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Frankland River)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a juicy, fruity white blend, with more than a hint of honeyed sweetness. Ripe fruit captures flavors of peach flesh and skin, along with tropical suggestions of guava and papaya. In short, this is not your typical, grassy, herbaceous style of Sauv Blanc/Sémillon. I'd serve it as an aperitif, well-chilled.
Name: Adamant Cellars 2007 Bliss White Wine White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: From the sweet white appellation of the Bergerac region, this is a full, botrytis-dominated wine, opulent, layered with dryness to balance the citrus and honey flavors. Maybe without complexity, but certainly with all the right botrytis wine characters.
Name: Clarendelle 2003 Amberwine  (Monbazillac)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Fragrant and floral, this is a deliciously easy wine, a blend of the local Gascon Colombard grape with Ugni Blanc. There are flavors of grapefruit, white fruits and a light, crisp green aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Producteurs Plaimont 2007 Colombelle White White (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: Quite leesy and funky, with meaty, oily aromas that are a departure from normal Albariño and are indicative of the 30% Treixadura and Loureiro that beef things up. Perfectly drinkable, and with a decent mouthfeel, but still it lacks the straightforward cleanliness of the really good wines from Galicia. Imported by Republic National Distributing Co.
Name: Marqués de Vizhoja 2007 Señor da Folla Verde White (Rías Baixas)

Description: This is a great year for whites in the area, and this wine shows all the freshness, the crisp white fruits and touch of kiwi. It is light, dancing, lively, but with a good concentration at the same time.
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2006 Cuvée des Conti White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: As in nearby Sauternes, 2005 produced some exceptionally rich botrytised wine in Monbazillac. This example from one of the leading Bergerac producers certainly shows plenty of richness, but it seems rather too sugary, showing toffee flavors and fatness. The acidity is missing.
Name: Château Bélingard 2005  Monbazillac

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: At Château d'Aydie, in Madiran, they celebrate their Gascon origins with this ultra-fresh, lighthearted blend of Ugni Blanc and Colombard. It is all about crisp green fruits, low alcohol and delicious acidity, topped with a lively structure to hold it all in place.
Name: Château d'Aydie 2006 Aramis Ugni Blanc-Colombard (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: A little heavy for such a young wine. Aromas of Golden Delicious apple, almonds and orange juice are a little chunky and obtuse for Verdejo, while the palate shows lime and orange flavors. Big size and forward flavors, but short on versatility and complexity.
Name: Marqués de Riscal 2007 White (Rueda)

Description: A little short and choppy, with citrus, almond and mineral aromas and flavors. Quite steely and sharp, with fresh but cutting lemon-lime and pineapple racing across the palate. Really zeroes in on the citrus but beyond that there isn't much to talk about.
Name: Verderol 2007 Spring in a Bottle White (Rueda)

Description: Light and flowery, with apple aromas. The body and palate are lean and a little stripped, but the apple flavors are clean and quaffable. This is like a waif model, or maybe a scarecrow. It is good on the surface but has very little meat on the bones.
Name: No Time 2007 Viura-Chardonnay White (Navarra)

Description: Dominated by Sauvignon Blanc, this totally fresh, crisp herbaceous wine is all about grapefruit, green herbs and a lime zest structure. Drink in the next few months, when all this lively fruit still jumps in the glass.
Name: Château Bélingard 2007 White (Bergerac Sec)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This pleasant, if generic blend of Gewürztraminer, Chardonnay, Pinot Gris and Pinot Noir is companion to the winery's red blend called Brimstone. Rich Cushman is the winemaker of both; the red is the better of the two. The white seems a bit aimless, with just a simple lemon/peach core and the barest hints of cinnamon to liven up the finish.
Name: Hellfire 2007 White Wine White (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: This 68% Semillon and 32% Sauvignon is intensely herbal on the nose, and the green character persists throughout, yet never veers into vegetal. It's cleanly made and medium-bodied, with a crisp finish.
Name: Juniper 2007 Crossing Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Margaret River)

Description: This 75-25 blend is pretty neutral in character; with effort, it's possible to suss out hints of fresh dill, bergamot and graphite. The wine just seems too restrained for its own good.
Name: Vasse River 2006 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Margaret River)

Description: Very flowery, this is a delicate wine, just broadened by spice and ripe pear flavors. But its flavors are indistinct, leaving just a pleasant, soft wine.
Name: Seigneurs de Bergerac 2006 White (Bergerac Sec)

Description: Love the label--a graphic representation of the owner's solo 1990 flight from Oz to England in a Tiger Moth--but the wine shows some unappetizing aromas of pickle juice and the fruit on the palate comes across as a bit sour and green.
Name: Edwards 2007 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Margaret River)

Description: Soft on the nose, with talcum and mushy apple aromas. Apple cider and kiwi work the palate, which is soft and shapeless. Finishes with a flash of juiciness but not a lot. Clean but too boring to stir interest.
Name: Ochoa 2007 Viura & Chardonnay White (Navarra)

Description: Forced together and not happily married is the only way to describe this dysfunctional coupling of sweet, tropical Torrontes and heavy, cloying Chardonnay. Too sweet for most palates, with a heavy dosage of melon, lychee and table sugar.
Name: Caligiore 2007 Grazioso Chardonnay-Torrontes White (Mendoza)

Description: This is the pinnacle of achievement from an outstanding dessert wine producer. A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc, it is an explosion of hugely rich, hugely sweet fruit, with brown sugar, raisins and tight acidity. This is an astonishingly rich wine, likely to age for at least 10 years.
Name: Feiler-Artinger 2005 Ruster Ausbruch Essenz Chardonnay Weissburgunder (Burgenland)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This single-vineyard blend includes Pinot Gris, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc Musque, from a one-acre site in the Columbia Gorge AVA. It's labeled as a field blend, which suggests that the grapes were co-fermented; the results are harmonious and quite appealing. The mix of crisp citrus and tart pear fruit is set against flinty acids that set up the taste buds for chèvre or light seafood.
Name: Viento 2006 Allegre Vineyard Verona White White (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: Citrusy and fresh, this low-alcohol (11.5%) blend of 80% Sémillon and 20% Sauvignon Blanc strikes the right chord as an apéritif or fish complement. It's lean, lemony and long, with hints of toast and paraffin adding a modicum of complexity.
Name: Longview 2006 Red Bucket Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)

Description: This Sémillon-dominated blend is made in an easy-to-drink, fruit-forward style, showcasing white peach, melon and fig flavors and a plump, round texture in the mouth. Imported by Margaret River Wines.
Name: Beach Head 2007 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Margaret River)

Description: Here's a fruit-packed white wine bursting with flavors of peach and pear. The blend of 62% Muscat and 38% Viognier works beautifully. If you want plenty of fruit, a bit of sweetness, but enough acid to support a food-friendly white wine, this is your bottle.
Name: Rock Point NV White Wine White (Oregon)

Description: This 57-43 blend piquantly shows off the varietal characters of both grape varieties in its combination of citrus and pepper notes. It's like a collision of lime and jalapeño, but the wine's modest intensity makes it more of a fender-bender than an ambulance call, and the finish fades a little too quickly.
Name: Leeuwin Estate 2005 Siblings Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: As the blend of 75% Chardonnay, 15% Viognier and 10% Sauvignon Blanc would suggest, this wine combines toasty complexity, fragrant curviness and clean acidity all in one. Overall, it's a more robust white that could handle richer dishes and as a solo sip, is substantial but not heavy. A good white for winter or summer enjoyment.
Name: Bedell 2006 Gallery White (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This Connecticut white starts out with a successful combination of yeasty baked vanilla aromas paired with some lemon citrus, then leads into clean, light flavors buoyed by a lively acidity. Refreshing and easy to drink, and priced fairly, this wine will pair well with broiled and grilled seafood dishes.
Name: Hopkins Vineyard 2006 Duet White (Western Connecticut Highlands)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: This lush white starts with a nose of apricot and honey and leads into tropical fruit flavors balanced by a good acidity. Indulgent but fresh, it's a fun wine that will pair well with spicy Thai or Indian cuisine.
Name: Bully Hill NV Ravat 51 White (New York)

Description: Lemon citrus, toast, white flowers—the lead on this wine is feminine and light and, as the name suggests, feels like a warm weather match. Flavors of like style are sweet and simple but balanced by some crispness and finesse. It's a pretty wine that offers simple, easy drinking enjoyment.
Name: Chaddsford 2007 Spring Wine White (Pennsylvania)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: A bit aggressive, with handsoap and citrus aromas. The palate is lean and clean, with lemon juice, grapefruit and lime flavors. Any way you look at it, this is an apéritif wine. Expect more from what amounts to a basic Viura and you're asking too much.
Name: Bodegas Eguren 2007 Reinares White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Flavors of Orange Muscat and honey on the nose, and lush fruit flavors of pineapple and orange on the palate, give this wine an assertive, exotic character. The tongue-coating texture and honeyed finish recommend it to dishes that can cut the weight—think spicy.
Name: Dos Cabezas 2006 White White (Cochise County)

Appellation: New York, New York Other, New York, US
Description: This is the kind of fun, flirty white that won't break the bank or your brain—it's simple and sippable. The nose offers pineapple, lemon and a touch of toast, while the fruit flavors are bright and appealing. Could use a touch of acidity but overall, the wine is balanced. A good everyday choice.
Name: Lucas Vineyards NV Miss Chevious Nautie III White (New York)

Description: This exotic white blend from Iowa offers aromas of orange and citrus with a minerally zip, and on the palate, is a bit on the sweet and curvy side. Not terribly inspired but still pretty, it will pair well with Asian cuisine.
Name: Jasper NV Black Road White (Iowa)

Description: Thick and pulpy on the palate, this white is fruity and simple, with pear, melon and citrus aromas and flavors. It's surprisingly heavy for such a low-alcohol (12.7%) wine.
Designation: Memsie Sauvignon Blanc Semillon Roussanne Chardonnay
Name: Water Wheel 2006 Memsie Sauvignon Blanc Semillon Roussanne Chardonnay White (Bendigo)

Description: This innovative blend of 60% Sémillon and 40% Marsanne doesn't show the hoped-for synergies. Hints of tar and rubber refuse to blow off completely, and the modest green apple and citrus flavors come across as lean and emaciated on the palate.
Name: Turkey Flat 2005 The Turk Semillon + Marsanne White (Barossa Valley)

Description: Like many New Zealand Sauvignon Blancs, this one carries a touch of red bell pepper, adding a slightly vegetal aspect to its pineapple and gooseberry fruit. Finishes admirably dry, with some chalky overtones.
Name: Northfield 2007 Frog Rock Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Waipara)

Description: Perplexing, given the superb performance of the 2005, but this wine is not on that level. There's a smoky note to this edition that brings hints of cured meat or beef bouillon to mind, adding a strange note to the herbal, citrusy flavors.
Name: Pegasus Bay 2006 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Waipara Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Designed to go with Japanese food, this simple wine should fit well with all manner of sushi and sashimi. It has light acidity, some crisp mango flavors and a green, taut aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Remy-Pannier 2007 Haiku Bridge White (Vin de Pays du Val de Loire)
Region: Vin de Pays du Val de Loire

Description: A sweet, plump, candied wine. Viognier (19%) is blended into Chardonnay and the result centers on tropical guava and white fruits like pear and peach. It gets heavier and flatter as it goes along.
Name: Botalcura 2006 El Delirio Reserve Chardonnay-Viognier (Central Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Brian Carter's unique white blend of Roussanne, Viognier and Riesling hits a high water mark with this exceptional 2006. The bouquet is a very pretty, sensuous mix of citrus blossom, lemon wax and tea, leading into a fleshy, luxurious mid-palate bursting with fruits. Citrus, stone fruits and ripe tropical mix together, yet retain a perfect balance through a long finish. There is even a surprise—a streak of white pepper—built into the back end.
Name: Brian Carter 2006 Oriana White Blend White (Yakima Valley)

Description: Delicately balanced wine, with its richness and honey pierced through with fresh, refreshing acidity. It is perfumed, a spring meadow after a shower, the honey so fresh, the richness so intense and at the same time so restrained. Glass stopper.
Name: Sattlerhof 2006 Trockenbeerenauslese White (Südsteiermark)

Description: Bründlmayer makes a particularly felicitous brut, crisp, yeasty, with very pure green and white fruits. It has an intense minerality, tight, structured and finishing with great waves of toast. The wine spends three years on its lees, which shows in its density of flavor.
Name: Bründlmayer 2005 Brut White (Austria)

Description: A true TBA, its very rich, toffee-flavored, intense sweetness overpowering the botrytis dryness initially. And then you feel the acidity, the apricot and peach flavors and the shot of lime. In its texture, it is a truly intense dessert wine. Age for 10 years.
Name: Schloss Halbturn 2004 Grand Vin White (Burgenland)

Description: A balanced blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay gives a rich wine, with mineral, pear and layered wood flavors. There is some herbaceousness, but the wood and creamy Chardonnay give broadness and richness.
Name: Schloss Halbturn 2005 Impérial Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Burgenland)

Description: A trio of elegant whites comprises this blend from the island of Santorini, and each lends a unique facet that is authentically Greek. On the nose, clean, friendly citrus flavors reign, with an appealing touch of sweet fruit, minerals and spice adding dimension. On the palate, the wine offers fresh but rounded flavors that linger  but leave it refreshed. Overall, an intriguing, food-friendly sip.
Name: Hatziyiannis 2006 White (Santorini)

Description: A blend of 5 grapes, this unctuous single-vineyard wine is balanced, the honey and lemon character giving a freshness to the richness. There's a touch of nutmeg to the acidity. Age for 5 years.
Name: Neumeister 2005 Saziani Beerenauslese White (Südoststeiermark)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This offers pleasant, lightly spicy flavors of Asian pear, crisp apple and even a hint of citrus. It does not have the concentration of the 2005 version, but it's a delightful bottle, perfect for summer sipping.
Name: Three Rivers 2006 Meritage White Wine White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 60/40 Sauvignon Blanc/Sémillon offers a beguiling mix of flavors ranging from pineapple to citrus and melon. Streaks of wheat cracker and honey add interest to the finish. Despite its youth, this is probably best enjoyed in the near term.
Name: Lost River 2006 Rainshadow White Wine White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A blend of two ancient white varieties—Assyrtiko and Asproudi—this wine offers clean, crisp aromas and flavors with a soft, fragrant roundness. Deep aromas and an unfolding, slightly sweet balance of flavors gives the wine a more opulent edge than many of its Greek white counterparts. Feminine and elegant.
Name: Vatistas 2006 Asproudi - Assyrtiko White (Lakonia)

Description: An attractive, perfumed blend of Chardonnay and Muscat grapes, very summery, fresh and crisp. There's lively acidity, quince and pear flavors and a vibrant fruity aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Gunter Triebaumer 2007 Trie White (Burgenland)

Description: The bone-dry, earthy minerality of Assyrtiko blends well with the crisp, fresh fruit flavors of Sauvignon Blanc in this white blend. Clean, simple flavors of citrus, spice and slate give the wine a quaffable, food-friendly edge.
Name: Tsantali 2006 Ambelonas at Agios Pavlos White (Halkidiki)

Description: Not an expressive Rueda but it sizzles. Despite being young and driving, it's more neutral in flavor and texture than the winery's Verdejo, which is excellent. This wine shows all citrus with light green accents, and with shrimp or Asian foods it'll do well.
Name: Valdelainos 2007 White (Rueda)

Description: This flirty white is a perfect beach or patio wine, with its clean floral aromas and flavors and pronounced acidity. Balanced body and a pretty finish give it extra elegance.
Name: Dougos 2006 Roditis - Assyrtiko White (Thessalikos)

Description: This semisweet blend of Malvasia and Viura is not everyday stuff, but if you have a taste for something sweet and different, give it a try. The nose is floral and waxy, while flavors of honey and ultraripe pineapple are heady and sugary. Not a drop-dead winner but unique and interesting.
Name: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2006 Diamante Semi-Sweet Malvasia-Viura White (Rioja)

Description: Cheerful, light white aromas of citrus—lemon and orange mainly—lead on this white blend from Patras. On the palate, it's refreshing but offers some depth in its lemon and orange muscat flavors. Simple but appealing, and at an excellent price.
Name: Achaia Clauss 2006 Demestica White (Patras)

Description: An almost forgotten variety from Greece, Kidonitsa is represented well in this stylish white. A nose of lemon, creamy oak and spicy anise leads, and on the tongue, a mouthcoating, round fruit profile is balanced with citric freshness. Deeper in flavor than many of the popular Greek whites, the wine would hold up well against richer dishes.
Name: Vatistas NV Kidonitsa White (Peloponnese)

Description: If you catch this wine young and properly chilled, it isn't that bad. It's very sweet and sugary, with candied melon, mango and citrus flavors. Then it gets more tropical on the finish, with ending notes of banana and mango. On the verge of tasting fake but not quite.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2007 Satinela Medium-Sweet White (Rioja)

Description: The Torrontes character shows on the nose, meaning there's detectable lychee and orange blossom scents. The dowside is that the palate is rather thick and honeyed but devoid of flavor. Seems to be fading into the night.
Name: Inca 2006 Torrontes-Chardonnay White (Calchaquí Valley)

Description: Mainly Rolle, this is a plump, melon- and peach-scented white that also features hints of almond and licorice. The fruit is almost honeyed at times, yet still retains a sense of freshness, with some chalky minerality on the finish.
Name: Clos Saint-Joseph 2005 Villars-sur-Var Blanc de Blancs White (Côtes de Provence)

Description: This intriguing white blends 65% Ugni Blanc, 25% Rolle (Vermentino) and 15% Sauvignon Blanc into a ripe, honeyed wine—a product of the warm vintage. Yet despite the ripeness and bold orange flavors, it remains dry, even showing some minerality on the finish.
Name: Château Revelette 2006 White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

Description: This is a very fresh and crisp blend of Rolle (70%) and Sémillon (30%). Citrusy aromas and flavors dominate, ending on notes of tangerine and grapefruit.
Name: Château du Galoupet 2007 White (Côtes de Provence)

Description: A blend of 70% Clairette, 15% Sémillon and 15% Rolle, this is a slightly nutty, almondy white with touches of honeyed richness and apricot. Turns a bit astringent on the finish.
Name: Château Calissanne 2006 Clos Victoire White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

Description: This is a light, slightly herbal blend of one-third each Rolle, Sémillon and Ugni Blanc. Very fresh and minerally, it would make a refreshing summer apéritif.
Name: Saint André de Figuière 2007 Valerie White (Côtes de Provence)

Description: The bulk of this luxury-cuvée white is fermented in new oak, and the barrel influence is obvious: toasty and nutty aromas and flavors dominate, although hints of melon, fig and orange provide body and nuance. It's a big, mouthfilling white, lusty and a bit warm on the finish.
Name: Mas de la Dame 2005 Coin Caché Blanc White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

Description: From a tiny estate in a tiny appellation, this is a rather austere example of Rolle (90%), with 10% Chardonnay as well. It's unusually crisp for a Provençal white, with crisp lime edges to the apple-scented fruit. Drink now.
Name: Château de Bellet 2006 Cuvée Baron G. White (Bellet)

Description: Starts off with hints of almonds and acacia blossoms, but this blend of Rolle and Ugni Blanc comes across as largely neutral on the palate. It's a fresh, slightly briny white made to partner seafood.
Name: Château de Pampelonne 2006 White (Côtes de Provence)

Description: Starts out neutral but soon it develops a dominant Viognier personality. It's got all the fruits in a fruit salad covered: green melon, cantaloupe, banana, mango and others come to the fore. Fresh and ready at this young stage, with upright structure and nothing cloying. Drink this year, preferably well chilled.
Name: Estampa 2007 Viognier-Chardonnay White (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Mainly (95%) Rolle, with a touch of Ugni Blanc, this is a plump, medium-bodied wine with modest mineral and pink grapefruit elements. Shows a touch of warmth on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Château de L'Aumerade 2007 Cuvée Sully White (Côtes de Provence)

Description: Very tight and coiled, the freshness of this wine acts as a counterweight to its intense, smoky, ripe fruit flavors. It is so balanced, yet still so young, this is a wine that needs at least 10 years to show its true richness and power.
Name: Château Haut-Brion 2005  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Typical of the huge power of Guiraud, this is one of the richest Sauternes in 2005. The wine is rich and intense, the dry edge of botrytis just dominating the sweetness. Flavors of honey, almonds and peaches give the wine extra complexity.
Name: Château Guiraud 2005  Sauternes

Description: Under the control of white wine wizard Denis Dubourdieu, this is one of the great wines of Barsac. It has intensity of sweetness, but just the right lightness, which gives it freshness as well as richness. This is a great wine in its early stages, and is certainly likely to age over many years.
Name: Château Doisy-Daëne 2005  Barsac

Description: Picked over a period of eight weeks, this wine shows the class and care resulting from such efforts. Citrus and white flower aromas lead to a wine that is not overtly rich, with subtle shades of botrytis and orange marmalade flavors. The acidity is vibrant, fresh, a great balance.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2005  Sauternes

Description: Extravagantly rich, this is dense and supersweet initially, just balanced with acidity. The botrytis dryness is really not here at this stage, but with its elegant creamy texture, wood flavors still very present. This is still at the very beginning of its development.
Name: Château la Tour Blanche 2005  Sauternes

Description: You get both apricots and honeyed botrytis aromas that are followed through by a dry core, very full-bodied with richness, the sweetness of the yellow jam fruits, apricots and mangoes gliding over the palate. Delicious, and certainly ageworthy.
Name: Château Rieussec 2005  Sauternes

Description: Surprisingly dry, this has richness rather than sweetness, and intense, powerful botrytis. The honey is intensely perfumed, along with baked apples and spice. Certainly a long-aging wine.
Name: Château Coutet 2005  Barsac

Description: Classic Sauternes, treading the fine line between sweetness and elegance. Initially, it seems to be dominated by the botrytis, but then sweet fruits also show, with ripe yellow fruits, honey and almonds, touched with citrus. As it develops, the wine will become richer and more intense.
Name: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2005  Sauternes

Description: Superrich, but it works because of its mouthwatering acidity. The white fruit flavors are verging on tropical, the spice and new wood are here, but finely judged. And then there is a delicious green, herbaceous finish, which makes the wine both rich and lively.
Name: Château Pape Clément 2004  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Citrus and tropical fruits dominate this rich wine, while the wood gives caramel. Full and mouthfilling, this is rounded, the acidity veering towards softness. The toast and white plum skins give structure to an open, generous wine.
Name: Château Laville Haut-Brion 2005  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Full-bodied, this wine shows really ripe, generous fruit flavors, touched by wood, very round and intense. As an indication of its immaturity, the wood comes through to dominate the fruit. Give it 2–3 years.
Name: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2005  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A great Pavillon Blanc, fine, rich and balanced. From its citrus opening to the final burst of crisp, ripe fruit, this shows the great style of white Bordeaux in 2006. Spice, honey, melon and toast all mingle harmoniously.
Name: Château Margaux 2006 Pavillon Blanc de Château Margaux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Intensely rich, very perfumed wine, full of apples and honey flavors. There is also fresh fruit, but the richness dominates, showing some dry botrytis flavors to finish.
Name: Château Climens 2005  Barsac

Description: While this wine is not powerful, it has elegance to go with the ripe fruit, fresh honey, lemon flavors and a core of dense dryness. With this vintage, Rayne Vigneau seems to be back where its vineyard, next to Yquem, suggests it should be.
Name: Château de Rayne Vigneau 2005  Sauternes

Description: Soft and generously ripe, the yellow and white fruits dominate this open wine. The structure comes from green plum flavors, leaving a crisp aftertaste.
Name: Château Malartic-Lagravière 2005  Pessac-Léognan

Description: A soft, generous wine, structured between white fruits and toast flavors. There is fresh acidity that lifts the fruit, and the vanilla tastes are just coming into balance with the rich, rounded texture. This has serious potential; age at least 4–5 years.
Name: Château Saint-Robert 2005 Cuvée Poncet-Deville  (Graves)

Description: This wine is about honey, white flowers and richness. The botrytis gives concentration, boosting the power but avoiding being cloying. There is some acidity, while the concentration and honeyed raisins remain at the end. This wine will obviously age well.
Name: Château Latrézotte 2005 Le Sauternes de Ma Fille  (Barsac)

Description: An intensely herbaceous wine, with grassy citrus fruit flavors and green, deliciously fresh acidity. To round it out, the wine has hints of tropical yellow fruits.
Name: Château Brown 2005  Pessac-Léognan

Description: Toasty, creamy, almost Burgundian in its richness, this wood and tropical fruit dominated wine is rich and full, but has also managed to preserve freshness. Alongside the acidity, there is concentration, and a lively twist of green herbs.
Name: Le Nardian 2005  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: There aren't many white vines in Saint-Emilion vineyards, but this rare wine has plenty of acid freshness, rounded by green plum and spice flavors. The toasty aftertaste gives a satisfying richness to this ready-to-drink wine.
Name: Château Fombrauge 2005  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Luscious apricot aromas, followed by light tropical fruit flavors, fresh acidity and green plum skin structure. There is a light layer of toast from oak aging. Ripe, relatively full-bodied, with a delicious, long toast and fruit aftertaste.
Name: Château Haut Selve 2005  Graves

Description: Everyone's favorite summer sipper is as good as ever in 2007. It's 50% Verdejo, 40% Viura and 10% Sauvignon Blanc, and all thrown together you get a ton of steely citrus and mineral aromas and flavors adding up to endless refreshment possibilities. Spritzy, zesty and a perennial bargain among aromatic whites.
Name: Telmo Rodríguez 2007 Basa White (Rueda)

Description: Very honeyed aromas are followed by a soft, open, very ripe wine. If it lacks crispness, it more than makes up for this with its rounded feel, gentle and with wood elements. Green plums finish it well.
Name: Château le Bonnat 2005  Graves

Description: Crisp, fresh wine, with rounded corners to soften the acidity. Flinty herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc is the main fruit flavor in this rich, soft wine.
Name: Château Thieuley 2005 Cuvée Francis Courselle  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A spicy, nutty wine, with fresh white fruits and some richness. A high proportion of the rare Sauvignon Gris gives this wine an attractive aromatic quince element, supported by judicious new wood.
Name: Chateau La Tour Carnet 2005  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: For the vintage, this is a relatively light wine, even though the botrytis gives some dryness. It is more about honey and sweetness at this stage, with a light, poised, fresh aftertaste.
Name: Château Nairac 2005  Barsac

Description: The Vineyard 10 series from Columbia Crest's budget Two Vines tier is off to a promising start with this off-dry blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and various unspecified aromatic varieties. Aromatic it is indeed, a beguiling mix of light floral notes, sweet citrus and fruit candy. Best of all, there is no detectable oak.
Name: Columbia Crest 2006 Two Vines Vineyard 10 White Wine White (Washington)

Description: Torres has been working on this blend of Xarello and Garnacha Blanca for a few years, and they seem to be on the right track. This vintage trumpets gardenia and incense-like aromas along with a Viognier-like palate of apricot, kumquat and honey blossom. It's a bigger-sized wine, but a balanced one. Still, it might be a touch sweet and banana-ish for some.
Name: Torres 2006 Nerola White (Catalunya)

Description: A highly perfumed wine, which shows high vanilla and wood flavors, while the sweetness remains much more delicate. A combination that needs time to settle down before becoming a light style of Sauternes.
Name: Château de Fargues 2005  Sauternes

Description: Full, rounded and creamy, this is a fine, green plum- and white berry-flavored wine that has some good depth as well as fine floral aromas. It is lively and fresh, but with some richness.
Name: Château Toumilon 2005  Graves

Description: A solid combination of Chenin's curvy, honeyed flavors and the clean crispness of Sauvignon Blanc. An affordable, dependable wine with a go-to personality for everyday enjoyment.
Designation: Oak Lane Chenin Blanc - Sauvignon Blanc
Name: Beau Joubert 2007 Oak Lane Chenin Blanc - Sauvignon Blanc White (Stellenbosch)

Description: A fresh, soft, citrus-flavored wine with freshness that comes from the green pear and lemon sharpness. Touches of wood round out a delicious, easy wine.
Name: Pezat 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Grassy herbal aromas offer a fresh, appealing start to this accessible Chenin/Sauvignon Blanc blend. On the palate, it's a mix of flinty and round fruit, and the finish is clean and lively. Simple, but good.
Name: Bradgate 2007 Chenin Blanc - Sauvignon Blanc White (Stellenbosch)

Description: This wine offers clean, minerally aromas and a palate of honey and apples. Pair with poultry or fresh seafood. Not overly elegant, but a good wine from a great producer.
Name: Slowine 2007 Chenin Blanc - Sauvignon Blanc White (Overberg)

Description: A strange bird for sure. The blend is 70% Chardonnay, 20% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Picapoll. In no way is it common, and truth be told it lags far behind the winery's usually excellent reds. But it does have a lot of kick, body and tropical fruit. And for a unique Spanish white, it may draw some interest because it's not poorly made.
Name: Masies d'Avinyo 2007 Abadal Blanc White (Pla de Bages)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Rich and smoky, this Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon blend delivers a nose suggesting golden raisins, ripe figs, white peaches and light streaks of butter, honey and caramel. The fruit and wood are balanced and the alcohol is a moderate 13.5%. Everything here is in proportion, layered, smooth and seductive. More than past vintages, this is a Chaleur blanc that seems destined to age and develop over the next decade or more.
Name: Chaleur Estate 2006 Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This Tokaji strikes the perfect balance of lush, creamy opulence and elegant, lively acidity. Honey, spice and lemon on the nose and in the mouth unfold triumphantly, offering a fresh but full character. On the palate, the wine is viscous and full, but with a strain of liveliness that gives it lift. Delicious and decadent.
Name: Patricius 2000 Aszú Bendecz Dúló 6 Puttonyos Tokaji (Tokaj)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This outstanding Walla Walla boutique has established a track record for consistent improvement, and the white wines are best of show. Once again this 2006 blend is smooth, round and richly endowed with mixed stone fruits. Lovely aromas build a dense cloud of complex fruit, toast and caramel scents around the glass; once in the mouth the full-bodied fruit takes hold with lychee, peach and stone fruits. Immaculate and persistent, this stunning wine just keeps on coming.
Name: Buty 2006 Sémillon-Sauvignon Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Lush, opulent aromas of tropical fruit, spice and honey lead this Tokaji from Hungary. On the palate, the wine is supple and unctuous without heaviness, coating the tongue with more pineapple, orange and honey and finishing off with a delicious, lingering finesse.
Name: Patricius 2000 Aszú 5 Puttonyos Tokaji (Tokaj)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A lightly pétillant ice wine. Harvested at almost 38 brix, it is not as dense and racy as the ice wines of British Columbia or eastern Canada, but it offers its own pleasures. Here are details of sweet straw, rice cracker, caramel and honey, nicely interwoven and persistent, and never turning cloying or sugary.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2006 Chenin Blanc Ice Wine White (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Métier White is a sleek, assertive and racy white wine that does not fall into the flavor ranks of most Washington Viognier, though that is 90% of the blend. The rest is Roussanne, which adds notes of Meyer lemon. The wine is clean and crisp, well-defined with flavors of citrus and green herb. It is built upon vibrant acids rather than barrel flavors, and in a blind tasting it might pass for a somewhat salty (rather than peppery) Grüner Veltliner.
Name: Doyenne 2006 Métier White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This Hungarian dessert wine has a light, elegant nose of citrus and flowers and on the palate offers deep, delicious flavors of honey, orange and citrus. Luxurious and unctuous, it feels slightly heavy on the tongue and could use a touch more acidity. Overall, though, it's a very compelling wine with great character.
Name: Patricius 2000 Aszú 6 Puttonyos Tokaji (Tokaj)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is fairly soft and sweet, with pleasant flavors of peaches and honey. It is a well-made late harvest Chenin, but simple. Compared with the complexity and the persistence of the Chenin Blanc ice wine, it seems quite simple, though perfectly sound.
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2006 Late Harvest Chenin Blanc White (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Opulent richness combines with an aromatic delicacy, with honey, orange and acacia. The freshness and acid-sweetness balance of Castelnau are already accessible.
Name: Château Suduiraut 2003 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

Description: Tropical aromas mixed with pear are just right, and overall this Treixadura-Godello-Torrontes blend is ripe and delicious. It's round but zesty, with pear, kiwi and honeydew flavors. It stays on message from front to back, and despite its size and ripeness it keeps everything in balance. Drink now.
Name: Finca Teira 2006 White (Ribeiro)

Description: A fresh, citrus-dominated wine, with really crisp, lively fruit. The floral aromas are followed by a zingy character and a white fruit aftertaste. Screwcap.
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2006  Graves

Description: Hugely liquorous wine, full of honey, superripe fruit, yellow peach and apricot flavors, along with orange marmalade. This is big, very densely flavored, richly textured. It could certainly age for 5–10 years.
Name: Château Haut Bergeron 2003  Sauternes

Description: A freshly herbaceous wine, a reminder of how crisp, grassy and refreshing white Bordeaux can be. This has a lively green and white fruit character, all vibrant acidity. Drink now.
Name: Château Bel Air Perponcher 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Plenty of botrytis here, packing the wine with its characteristic sweet/dry flavor, wild flower honey tastes and ripe apple flavors. Not a hugely rich Sauternes, this is finely in balance, leaving freshness as well as sweetness on the finish.
Name: Château Haut Bergeron 2004  Sauternes

Description: This grassy, very herbaceous wine is all crisp green fruits. Touched by a creamy texture under a layer of freshness, it shows some good weight and structure. There is light wood that rounds it all out.
Name: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2006 Héritage  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This Macabeo (Viura) blend is neutral on the nose but fairly big and bulky on the palate. Flavors of lemon-lime and banana are spritzy at first and then stickier late. The rest of the composition (Macabeo and Parellada) dictates that the flavors will be short; but what's on display is nice and creamy.
Name: Bodegas Concavins 2006 Proyecto Cu4tro Blanco White (Catalunya)

Description: Full, fat and fleshy, this wine has some weight, ripe fruit and green plum acidity. There's a light structure of fruit skins, giving a crisp aftertaste. Thirst-quenching acidity to finish.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2006 Mouton Cadet Réserve  (Graves)

Description: The winery has dialed back the time in oak for its barrel-fermented Viura to two months from five or six, and it's a decidedly less oaky wine than in years prior. Now it shows a controlled lees character along with lemon and apple flavors. Limited in what it offers, but made well.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2006 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)

Description: White raisin and touches of lettuce and celery give this multigrape blend some richness but also a bit of green character. The palate shows lemon, green apple and pineapple, and this lean quality is confirmed by the wine's modest 11% alcohol level. Drink now to catch it at its scouring, sorbet-like best.
Name: Bodegas Campante 2006 Versatus White (Ribeiro)

Appellation: Vi de la Terra Illes Balears, Spanish Islands, Spain
Description: Interesting and unique blends get bonus points, but in the long run this conglomeration of indigenous grapes from Mallorca is a touch too resiny and bland to really deserve a call out. But for soft melon and pithy flavors, and the fact that it's made from the obscure Prensal and Muscat, we like it well enough.
Name: Ànima Negra 2005 Quíbia White (Vi de la Terra Illes Balears)
Region: Vi de la Terra Illes Balears

Description: The nose offers up aromas of sweet pea, honeysuckle and fresh sliced peaches. Light to medium body and strong crisp acidity lead into a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Recanati 2006 Kosher Yasmin White White (Galilee)

Description: Take the bubbles out of Cava and this is pretty much what's left. The nose is light, with peach and banana aromas. Tangy flavors of orange and pineapple are lively but lacking, and the finish is ripe but simple. For flush flavors and just enough zap, this is good.
Name: Huguet de Can Feixes 2006 Can Feixes Blanc Selecció White (Penedès)

Description: Fresh peach and nectarine dominate the nose on this semisweet blend of Viura and Malvasia. The flavors are mostly melon and citrus, while the finishing touch is that of fruit cocktail. It's a touch sticky in the long run, but at least it isn't cloying or cooked.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2006 Satinela Medium-Sweet White (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of grass and herb are followed by fresh apple skin and green berry flavors. There is a definite edge of tannin, providing crisp freshness and a citric aftertaste.
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2006 Réserve Spéciale  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Round and soft, this has fresh, attractive fruit, flavors of white pears, candy and green herbs. Just a touch of sweetness in the acidity of the aftertaste.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2006 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Finely balanced, simple Sauternes with light apricot and honey flavors. With just a touch of botrytis dryness, the aftertaste is more sweet.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2004 Mouton Cadet Réserve  (Sauternes)

Description: Lightweight, with more dryness than richness, this wine is lightly sweet, hinting at botrytis, with apple and cream flavors touched by honey.
Name: Chais de Méribel 2003  Sauternes

Description: Curvy, full and luscious but underpinned with a fresh acidity that gives the wine balance, this white blend from Tulbagh Mountain has a creamy fruit and spice character that is both delicious and unique. The wine finishes with length but is clean. Could handle richer dishes but is still delicate enough to augment lighter fare.
Name: Tulbagh Mountain Vineyards 2006 TMV White White (Coastal Region)

Description: Fresh meets floral in this elegant blend. On the nose, there's perky citrus and delicate flowers. The flavors are an excellent balance of minerality and fruit, with a rich, round but delicate overall character that's intriguing and unfolds on the tongue. The finish is clean and cool. A versatile, sophisticated white.
Name: Sequillo 2006 White Wine White (Swartland)

Description: This medium-body blend of Sauvignon, Chenin Blanc and Semillon offers tropical fruit flavors on the nose and the palate, along with a strain of spicy, toasted oak. There's dimension but still a dry, clean character on the palate and finish. Pair with seafood dishes.
Name: Groote Post 2006 The Old Man's Blend White (Coastal Region)

Description: A Bordeaux-inspired blend of 66% Sauvignon Blanc, 24% Semillon and 10% Muscadelle, this wine's understated flavors might be an issue for some, but it offers a richly textured mouthfeel that resembles white Bordeaux. Subtle peach and spice flavors finish long, adding a mineral component.
Name: Mount Mary 2005 Triolet White (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the first release for McCrea's white Rhône blend, a mix of 38% Grenache Blanc, 34% Marsanne, 15% Picpoul and 13% Roussanne, recently planted by grower Dick Boushey from Tablas Creek Beaucastel cuttings. There's a little bit of toasted nut flavor, but only a small number of second year oak barrels were used. The blend of grapes delivers interesting and complex fruit flavors that work seamlessly together, evoking Satsuma orange, then tangerine, then apple, then apricot, then Asian pear. The oak notes recede quickly into the background, and the wine resonates through an extended finish.
Name: McCrea 2006 Boushey Vineyard Sirocco White (Yakima Valley)

Description: Anakena's top white blend is a horse of a different breed. It's tangy from the Riesling, fruity and floral from the Viognier, and held together in the middle by the Chardonnay. Overall it has good zest and balance, and it should be a fine match for Thai and other spicy foods.
Name: Anakena 2007 Ona Viognier-Riesling-Chardonnay White (Rapel Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is quite flavorful, with apples, pears and peaches equally in the mix. The fruit is front and center, and the wine has unusual polish for its price. It keeps coming on through a surprisingly long finish, with nicely structured skin and rind flavors wrapping up the finish.
Name: Kamiak Cellar 2006 Cellar Select White Wine White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a higher end effort than the name might imply. Ripe and spicy, it takes the floral and citrus rind qualities of Viognier, tosses in some tart green apple from Chardonnay, and puts in a splash of Gewürzt for spice. Fermented in neutral oak and aged seven months on the lees, it's got a good spine, firm acid, highlights of cinnamon toast and a finishing kiss of lemon curd.
Name: Smasne Cellars 2006 Bunk House White White (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays Vignobles de France, France Other, France
Description: A deliciously fragrant wine, with full-bodied, round peaches and melon combining with crisp green plums in a fruit salad of flavors.
Name: Chamarré 2007 Sélection Chardonnay Sauvignon Chardonnay-Sauvignon (Vin de Pays Vignobles de France)
Region: Vin de Pays Vignobles de France

Description: Firm but fresh aromas and flavors of spice, peach and flowers gives this blend a feminine flair, but overall this is crisp and dry. Unfolding but fun flavors coat the tongue but finish off clean, meaning the wine will pair well with everything from spicy Thai dishes to delicate fish offerings. A good price for a stylish wine.
Name: Goats do Roam Wine Co. 2006 Goats do Roam White (Western Cape)

Description: Dry, minerally and crisp citrus flavors give this well priced wine a simple but striking appeal. Waves of lemon and grapefruit are lifted by a snap of acidity that leaves the finish clean on the tongue.
Designation: Oak Lane Chenin Blanc Sauvignon Blanc
Name: Beau Joubert 2006 Oak Lane Chenin Blanc Sauvignon Blanc White (Stellenbosch)

Description: Peach, nectarine and green pear aromas and flavors dominate this ripe-styled Verdejo-Viura blend. Typical of Rueda, it's citrusy and a zesty, but there's enough warmth and heft so that you wouldn't call it steely or stark. Drink now.
Name: Bodegas Garci Grande 2006 Señorio de Garci Grande Verdejo-Viura White (Rueda)

Description: A little warmer and rounder than most. This waxy wine offers banana and melon on the nose, while the palate is just juicy and racy enough, with apple and citrus anchoring things. Finishes easy and will go well with salads and seafood.
Name: Vinos Sanz 2006 Montesol Clásico White (Rueda)

Description: Smooth on the nose, with vanilla and peach aromas. It's starting to fade but if you catch it soon you'll get apple, pineapple and some pithy character on both the palate and finish. Tastes wet and easy, and not at all complicated.
Name: Inspiración Pampano 2006 White (Rueda)

Description: Verdejo and Viura comprise this mineral- and pepper-tinged wine. The palate is clean but a touch blanced out and drying. Flavors of citrus, apple and banana transform into walnut and aging cider on the finish.
Name: Vacceos 2006 Verdejo-Viura White (Rueda)

Description: From the San Juan province, this lighter-framed blend offers a hint of mineral and honey on the nose, followed by racier orange and green melon flavors. As a whole the wine is perfectly clean but insipid. It's tangy, sheer and clean but lacks body and soul.
Name: Santos Beck 2005 Gran Chardonnay-Viognier (San Juan)

Description: A slightly earthy, spicy nose leads, followed up by good acidity and a touch of flowers. Pair with a cheese plate or enjoy on its own. Imported by Wine Emporium.
Name: Pillitteri 2004 Fusion Gewürztraminer-Riesling (Niagara Peninsula)

Description: Lightly tropical on the nose, yet nutty and fading on the palate. There's some dried fruit flavors and some acidity to keep it hopping. But in the grand scheme of things this doesn't come close to taking over center stage.
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2005 Santa Isabel Chardonnay-Viognier (Mendoza)

Description: A candied, floral nose and sweet flavors of honey and flowers make this wine simple, but it is enjoyable on a basic level. Flavors are well balanced and the finish is delicate. Good with salads or fish.
Name: Chaddsford 2006 Spring Wine White (Pennsylvania)

Description: Richness in a glass, this flows around the mouth, unctuous, velvety, a mouthful of honey. If the acidity is only just a hint, it doesn't matter, this is delicious now, and a seductive treat.
Name: Umathum 2006 Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is delicious, creamy and yeasty and loaded with citrus.  The midpalate expands into tropical fruit, vanilla bean and spice, and it's just flat-out delightful. Chill this one and try it out on any kind of food you can imagine; it just might work.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2006 Destiny Ridge Vineyard ‘Shepherd's Mark' White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Good, mineral and grass, fresh wine, full of herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc and young Sémillon. It's deliciously brushed by wood.
Name: Château Roquetaillade la Grange 2006  Graves

Description: An intensely herbal, thyme-flavored wine, with a creaminess that enhances the full, but still very fresh character. Sauvignon Blanc's green character dominates, but is tamed by the ripeness of the fruit.
Name: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2006 Réserve  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

Description: This is a classic white Bordeaux blend, half Sauvignon Blanc, half Sémillon. It enjoys the freshness of 2006, lifted pink grapefruit and citrus flavors, rounded with some wood, and freshened with delicious kiwi fruits.
Name: Château de Carolle 2006  Graves

Description: An elegant, full-bodied wine, showing the richness of 2005, but keeping the tropical fruit element in balance with the light toast and butter flavors. The acidity is harder to find, but it comes through with spice in a soft aftertaste.
Name: Château de Portets 2005  Graves

Description: A soft and fruity dessert wine, not overly sweet, but overflowing with peach and apricot flavors, underscored by orange and lime zest. Imported by USA Wine West.
Name: Primo Estate 2005 Joseph La Magia Botrytis Riesling-Traminer White (Eden Valley)

Description: Always one of the most reliable and successful white Bordeaux brands, dominated by Sauvignon Blanc. The 2005 is a rich, tropical fruit and white currant-flavored wine. There is some green plum, fresh acidity and a hint of wood. Great as an apéritif, it also works well with sushi.
Name: Dourthe 2006 Numéro 1  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A full style, rounded and soft, with fresh white pear and plum flavors. It has a perfumed character from the 20% Muscadelle in the blend, which gives it ripeness but diminishes the fresh acidity.
Name: Château Lamothe de Haux 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Peach pit, almond skin and other dry, waxy aromas carry the nose on this Macabeo-Xarello-Parellada blend. Flavors of lime and nettle are playful and acid-based, while the finish seems wet and fresh. Overall it is much like a cava without the bubbles.
Name: Juvé y Camps 2005 Ermita d'Espiells White (Penedès)

Description: Almonds and a strongly yeasty element are the main characters of this sparkling wine. It's full, but the fruit still has a texture to it, leaving good acidity to finish. Good value, enjoyable wine.
Name: Marquis de la Tour NV Brut White (Vin Mousseux)

Description: A great value white, with fresh grapefruit and crisp acidity. In a few months, the current raw edge will have softened, as the 60% Sémillon in the blend calms down. But it's still a great summer drink.
Name: Château Perron 2006  Graves

Description: A blend of Welschriesling and Scheurebe, this is a fresh and delicate wine that wears its sweetness easily. Some botrytis, some honey, but the acidity comes into play as does the pineapple flavor. Glass stopper.
Name: Zantho 2006 Beerenauslese White (Burgenland)

Description: Jané Ventura is known for its sparkling cavas, but this table wine from Xarello, Muscat and the obscure Subirat Parent grape is appealing because it doesn't bite off more than it can chew. There's no oak so what you get is lean, tranparent lemon and lime flavors and a ready mouthfeel. Interesting but not for everyone.
Name: Jané Ventura 2006 White (Penedès)

Description: This vintage seems lighter on its feet than previous versions, but it's still a strange, atypical wine made from Garnacha Blanca and other Priorato white varieties. The bouquet is heavy and dusty, while the palate is thick and woody, with white pepper, peach and melon notes. Pithy bitterness weighs down the finish. Unusual but stirs interest.
Name: Francesc Sanchez Bas 2005 Blanc de Montsalvat White (Priorat)

Description: Lightly perfumed, this white Bordeaux shows the fresh character of the 2006 vintage. The acidity is poised, lifted and goes well with the pink grapefruit flavors. Drink this summer.
Name: Mouton-Cadet 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: A really green, grassy wine that owes a lot to New Zealand. It is fresh, crisp, squeaky clean and a great aperitif wine.
Name: Yvecourt 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Light, fresh, slightly grassy but more in the white fruit flavor profile. It's soft, with a citrus twang to it, great to drink as an apéritif, leaving a soft, creamy aftertaste.
Name: Caves Fleury 2006 Sauvignon Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Perfumed yet rather rustic, this wine has aromatic white fruit flavors, touched with a yeasty, bready character. It's rounded, but misses on the freshness.
Name: Château Lestrille 2006  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: By the sheer fact that this wine costs $6 and never really goes up in price, it holds onto its tenuous value status via clean tropical aromas and mild flavors of lime, pineapple and citrus. It's a touch hot and burning on the finish, but finish isn't what you're banking on with a wine like this. Imported by Freixenet, USA.
Name: René Barbier NV Mediterranean White White (Catalunya)

Description: A soft, unfocused wine with some kiwi flavors, which is out of balance with the high, herbaceous acidity. It has a hard edge that looks likely to stay as it matures.
Name: Château Sansey 2006  Graves

Description: Honeysuckle, talcum powder, melon and tangerine all work the nose, while the palate comes at you sweet and almost sticky. Flavors of white fruits and canned peaches are good if that's your thing, while the finish teeters on cloying but manages to hold the line. For a sweet Parellada-Muscat wine it isn't bad. Imported by Altuve Foods and Beverage.
Name: Vallformosa 2006 Claudia White (Penedès)

Description: The average American wine drinker is probably not interested in a three-grape white blend from hot and dry Extremadura, Spain, but in case you are, this wine is neutral on the nose and lean on the palate. Flavors of green apple, pineapple and lemon are scouring and seem designed for fried seafood.
Name: Viña Santa Marina 2005 Alicena White (Extremadura)

Description: Made in Zitsa, the only area within Epirus, Greece entitled to an appellation, this sparkler is made with a traditional white wine variety called Debina. True to the grape, the wine has a lively acidity, good minerality and an overall attractive quality. It's a touch clunky and hard to embrace for a sparkling wine, though—and needs to be paired with food.
Name: Glinavos 2006 Primus White (Zitsa)

Description: Chardonnay, Muscadet and something known as Pansa Blanca comprise this Catalonian oddball, which is so severely oaked that you have no idea what the grapes might actually taste like. No, it's not badly made, meaning there's mouthfeel, acidity and stages to the wine. But the aromas, flavors and overall package are weird and confusing.
Name: Alta Alella 2005 Lanius White (Alella)

Description: Though this dessert wine is already excellent, it's quite exciting to imagine how good it will be as its delicate flavors mingle over time. Made by the Szepsy family, whose roots go centuries (perhaps 1,000 years) deep in Hungary, the wine starts with a dense, slightly musky but floral nose. On the tongue, apricot, honey and spice mingle in a rich, opulent union, buoyed by a sparkling acidity that keeps the wine light and pretty.
Name: Szepsy 2002 Aszú 6 Puttonyos Tokaji (Tokaj)

Description: This opulent wine, with its honeyed apricot and resiny flavors, is layered with wood and spice, giving it extra life. It also has a hint of mocha—an earthiness that adds weight but not heaviness to the overall character. Poised and pretty, but also substantial.
Name: Royal Tokaji 1996 Szt. Tamás Aszú 6 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

Description: This unique and delicious dessert wine from Hungary offers apricot and honey on the nose and palate, as well as an earthier element of tobacco and mocha. It's dense but delicate, too, with a weight and complexity that unfolds in the mouth.
Name: Royal Tokaji 1999 Szt. Tamás Aszú 6 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

Description: Elegant flavors of apricot and honey are light and delicate, with a lively acidity keeping the wine dancing on the palate. Though the wine shows intense depth of flavors, it's never heavy and has a clean, poised finish. From start to finish, the wine is balanced and refined, with a character that speaks of its unique terroir.
Name: Royal Tokaji 1996 Nyulászó Aszú 6 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

Description: Author Heidi Noble (Menus From An Orchard Table) and her husband Michael Dinn make Joie, and all four releases are beautifully executed. This unusual blend includes Riesling, Gewürz, Pinot Blanc, Kerner and Ehrenfelser, with a splash of unfermented grape juice “in the spirit of Edelzwicker.” It is intensely perfumed, oily and loaded with peach and citrus, with the acidity to offset the sweetness.
Name: Joie 2006 A Noble Blend White White (Okanagan Valley)

Description: From a small single vineyard called Birsalmas (Hungarian for quince), this fresh, delicate dessert wine offers elegant flavors of quince (naturally), honey and melon. It's lively acids keep it light on the palate—refreshing but indulgent.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2000 Birsalmás Aszú 5 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

Description: Honeyed apricot and orange peel on the nose and palate typify this elegant but playful botrytis wine. The wine's lively acidity gives it a bounce on the tongue, adding dimension to the citrus components and lending it more to food pairing with desserts or a cheese plate.
Name: Royal Tokaji 2003 Aszú 5 Puttonyos  (Tokaji)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Chardonnay, Sémillon, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier blend is a good, all-purpose white wine but lacks focus.
Name: Maryhill 2006 Winemaker's White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This tasting room blend is soft, fruity and quite light.
Name: Vin du Lac 2005 Les Amis Riesling-Muscat (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This shows considerable wood flavors, giving a smooth, creamy character, spiced with some toast and ripe, dense Sémillon. It's big, a definite food wine, showing great style and quality above its simple Bordeaux appellation station.
Name: Château Rauzan Despagne 2005  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Premieres Côtes de Blaye, Bordeaux, France
Description: Made from 100% Sauvignon Blanc old vines, this has been given a heavy dose of wood, including barrel fermentation and lees stirring. The result is a definite hit, rich and almost Burgundian in its wood flavors and concentration, but with just that hint of herbaceousness to remind you it is Sauvignon.
Name: Château Haut Bertinerie 2005  Premieres Côtes de Blaye

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a full and flavorful blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Gris. The Gris carries a bit of oiliness and balances out the grassier Sauvignon. I like the wine's weight and detail, and its flavors of mixed grain, light herb, citrus and acid. Somehow it strikes me as a good sushi wine, one that could even handle a bit of vinegar.
Name: Ash Hollow 2006 White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A big, hugely rich, wood-dominated wine, oozing power and ripe fruit. This is almost Chard-like in its buttery weight, but is the usual Bordeaux blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc. Those who like power, line up here.
Name: Château Mont-Pérat 2005  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is two-thirds Chardonnay, one-third Viognier, melded into a very crisp, leesy and refreshing wine. There's a nice orange peel aroma leading off; and once in the mouth the wine has a brisk insouciance that invites sip after sip.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2006 Calico White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A fresh, grassy, herbal wine, with great crisp acidity and intense Sauvignon Blanc flavors. It floats acidity and green flavors along with full, rich fruit. The Chantegrive estate is one of the most important in the southern Graves, an example of what can be done in the region, given investment. Screwcap.
Name: Château de Chantegrive 2005  Graves

Description: There is 8g/L of residual sugar, so some tasters might object to a hint of sweetness, but others will just find it helps to accentuate the wine's fruit-forward nature. Pear and fig flavors pick up some honeyed stone fruit notes on the palate but this is nicely balanced and easy to drink.
Name: St Hallett 2006 Poacher's Blend Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Barossa)

Description: The bouquet smells like spiked fruit cocktail, and in the long run what's wrong with that? The palate is open and fairly easy, with a touch of kick pushing citrus, tropical fruit and even some mineral notes. A more citrusy and fresh style of Viognier, with 15% Chardonnay.
Name: Estampa 2006 Viognier Chardonnay White (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Off dry with fresh flavors of pear, grapefruit and pineapple, this blend of seven grapes surely includes some Riesling, Gewürztraminer and Pinot Gris. The wine's lightly sweet finish keeps the alcohol at just 12%, and is off-set nicely with crisp acids.
Name: Airlie 2006 7 White (Willamette Valley)

Description: A white Graves, part of the Thomas Barton range, this has good, soft, creamy fresh fruit and flavors of green plums, some spice and a fresh, full character.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2005 Thomas Barton Reserve  (Graves)

Description: The white partner in the quartet of Clarendelle wines from the owners of Château Haut-Brion, this is a freshly perfumed wine, with light acidity and some rich, creamy fruit. There's just a touch of almonds and toastiness to add complexity.
Name: Clarendelle 2005  Bordeaux Blanc

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: With this Airen and Macabeo blend you'll get almondy aromas in front of apricot and peach flavors. It's a solid, fairly well-balanced wine that won't hurt your budget or your appetizers.
Name: Dominio de Eguren 2005 Protocolo Blanco White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: While not that distinct, there's nothing wrong with this plump blend of 70% Verdejo and 30% Viura. The wine offers standard green melon and apple flavors, with sweet grapefruit notes on the finish. Better in the near-term; drink well chilled.
Name: Hermanos Lurton 2006 White (Rueda)

Description: A soft, mango-flavored wine, with just a touch of citrus. There's some good acidity, a nice citrus touch and freshness. Drink now.
Name: Château Loudenne 2005  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Owned by the Mau family, this estate situated just above the Garonne river south of Bordeaux, is home to an exciting range of red wines. The white is more standard fare, full, soft, with green plum flavors, but given a lift to finish by a touch of wood.
Name: Château Ducla 2005  Entre-Deux-Mers

Description: Pleasantly sweet, this wine has all the right characteristics of Sauternes—even a touch of dry botrytis flavor—in miniature. There's not much depth of flavor, but it is certainly a good drink for desserts – or as the French would do it, with blue cheese.
Name: Barton & Guestier 2005 Thomas Barton Reserve  (Sauternes)

Description: Not a bad wine, with its almond skin and light pear character. But it's also starting to fade, and soon it'll be in flat-line status because the acidity is low and the remaining voltage minimal. Best immediately, or wait for the fresher 2006. It's 51% Viognier and 49% Chard.
Name: Estampa 2005 Estate White (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Don't expect a lot from this fruity but fading blend of Treixadura and Albariño. It offers heavy green plum and melon flavors, yet it's losing steam as it turns heavy and briny.
Name: Pazo Viladomar 2005 White (Rías Baixas)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Watery and thin, with only the barest hint of varietal character. This is as innocuous and dull a wine as you could ever hope to find.
Name: Hogue 2006 Fumé Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: It takes some getting used to if you're going to like this wine. First off, there's a wicked cat pee and green shot to the nose, both of which are classic Casablanca Sauvignon smells. But the citrus and other fruits that are there to offset the pungency don't really step up and do the job. So ultimately the wine has an awful lot of pickle, tart passion fruit and celery.
Name: Estampa 2006 Reserve Assemblage White (Casablanca Valley)

Description: This blend of Sau Blanc and Sémillon is somewhat yeasty, but there's an attractive herbaceous ribbon of flavor that goes through, and light green fruit tastes. The aftertaste is rather bitter, spoiling this simple wine.
Name: Ginestet 2005  Bordeaux Blanc

Description: Strange that a 2006 wine will already seem old, but thus is the bane of Somontano, a region striving for better wines but not always hitting the target. This Macabeo-Chardonnay blend goes heavy on the melon and apple character, and in the end it teeters on cider-like.
Name: Bodegas Pirineos 2006 Montesierra Chardonnay-Macabeo White (Somontano)

Description: A native Basque white that's way past its prime. Txakoli wines barely last a year and need to be attacked very young, and this '05 is pretty much DOA. It still has some character and perfume, but it's getting heavier and duller by the minute. Look for the 2006 or wait until the spring/summer for the 2007.
Name: Txomín Etxaníz 2005 White (Getariako Txakolina)

Description: Macabeo, Gewürz and Chardonnay all in one...and what's the point? The wine tastes of apricots and other chunky fruits. Basically it's unfamiliar stuff that doesn't strike a chord despite the fact that it seems reasonably well made.
Name: Bodegas Pirineos 2005 Mesache Blanco White (Somontano)

Description: Burning hay field, roasted corn and other over-the-hill aromas put this one on life support. The palate isn't much livelier; there's dry, bland citrus and more canned corn. Not a total mess but not very fresh or attractive.
Name: Bodegas Campante 2005 Viña Reboreda White (Ribeiro)

Description: The honey aromas from the dominant Chenin Blanc are enticing. The palate is fresh and soft, but rounded with melon and kiwi flavors. Delicious and full. Clos de la Briderie runs its vineyard biodynamically.
Name: Clos de la Briderie 2005 Vieilles Vignes Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Touraine Mesland)

Description: Soft, with fat flavors that fill out in the glass. This has a crisp edge to it, though, hinting at mineral, while keeping the ripe pear flavors. The aftertaste shows some of the characteristic Chenin Blanc nuttiness.
Name: Château Gaillard 2005 Chenin Blanc-Chardonnay (Touraine Mesland)

Appellation: Crémant de Loire, Loire Valley, France
Description: Château de Montguéret has made a fresh, piercing, crisp Chenin Blanc-based sparkling wine. Just a touch of almond and a backdrop of honey give roundness to this green wine.
Name: Château de Montguéret NV White (Crémant de Loire)

Description: Light fragrances of talcum powder and apricots lead off this mild-mannered blend, which runs easy and smooth before thinning out on the back palate and finish. But along the way there's good citrus and green-fruit flavors backed by adequate acidity. A good quaff for the price.
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2006 Santa Isabel Chardonnay-Viognier (Mendoza)

Description: Can't say that the heavy dose of oak on this wine is helping the cause. The nose is quite resiny and cloying, while the palate is creamy and full, but loaded with wood chip and vanilla flavors. As might be expected, even more oak flavor dominates the finish.
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2006 Don Nicanor Chardonnay-Viognier (Mendoza)

Description: With little to compare it to, it's hard to evaluate the correctness of this Semillon sweetie from Argentina. Let's just say that it's a weird wine that carries a vivid yellow color and aromas and flavors of honey, corn syrup and hominy.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2003 Famiglia Bianchi Late Harvest Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc

Description: Benjamin Romeo makes nothing but big, idiosyncratic wines. And some are big hits while others may not be your thing. This modern, round, polished blend is creamy and smooth but also loaded with almond, pear, citrus and toast flavors. Certainly there's a strong wood element, but it handles it with aplomb and oozes class. Drink as soon as possible. It won't age much past 2007. Only 25 cases made.
Name: Benjamin Romeo 2004 Qué Bonito Cacareaba White (Rioja)

Description: This is an easy, sweeter style of Viura that emits aromas of peaches and pears. The palate is lively enough but not exactly zesty, and the flavors run toward pink grapefruit and other citrus fruits; but think sweet, nice fruits—not sour ones. Has all the hallmarks of a good aperitif wine.
Name: Ostatu 2005 Cosecha White (Rioja)

Description: This semisweet white can come across likable or awful, depending on your mood and the shape of the bottle you're drinking. The sample we tried for this review was in perfect shape, and it showed tropical fruit and pineapple aromas in front of sugary mango and melon flavors.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2005 Satinela Medium-Sweet White (Rioja)

Description: Interesting and not that far off the mark. Normally Chardonnay and Viognier make for clumsy partners, but not so in this case. The nose has sweet acacia blossom aromas, and that's followed by a plump but largely anonymous palate that turns to apricots and honey on the finish. A little cloying but good in small doses.
Name: Oveja Negra 2006 Chardonnay-Viognier (Central Valley)

Description: We are big fans of most Sierra Cantabria wines, but this fading, overoaked white Rioja is more or less a dud. It's weighed down by heavy, unintegrated wood notes and the finish is like chewing an oak branch. It's hard to see the point. 250 cases made.
Name: Sierra Cantabria 2004 Organza White (Rioja)

Description: An unusual blend of Chardonnay, Grüner Veltliner and Riesling that works so well, it's not possible to detect which varietal gives which characteristic to this richly layered wine. Aged in wood, this is ripe and concentrated with flavors of spring herbs along side firm minerality.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2004 Weisse Reserve Vom Schloss White (Niederösterreich)

Description: Pittnauer's white blend of Chard, Grüner Veltliner and Sauvignon Blanc. Fresh and lightly citric with a touch of fresh white currants. It's soft and easy, with a crisp aftertaste.
Name: Gerhard Pittnauer 2005 Weisse Reben White (Neusiedlersee)

Description: This blend of Chenin Blanc, Chardonnay and Viognier is delicious, delicate and floral with notes of honey and a minerally, crisp acidity. It's soft but rich with a sweet, luscious character. The Scali family is dedicated to traditional farming and winemaking with little interference; that purity comes through in the glass.
Name: Scali 2005 Blanc White (Swartland)

Description: This refreshing, citric blend of Chenin, Viognier and Chardonnay is lush but light, with an underlying minerality that offers restraint and clarity. The nose and palate are full of tropical fruit, lemon and lime and flowers. A classic, infectious wine.
Name: Black Rock 2005 White (Swartland)

Description: Beautiful aromas lead on this white blend from venerable producer Vergelegen. The nose is spicy with a minerally edge. Though time will unfurl the complex flavors of the wine, it's currently exhibiting lovely layers of spicy sweet orange and peach, and the mouthfeel is substantial--coating the tongue but not heavy.  Wait until this wine has time to unwind . . . it will be worth it.
Name: Vergelegen 2004 Flagship White (Stellenbosch)

Description: Loosely based on the white wines of southern France, this wine—fresh and creamy blend of Viognier, Chenin Blanc, Chardonnay and Grenache Blanc, offers toast and spice with an interplay of fresh fruit giving an intense, lush character to the wine. Good natural acidity is an added bonus. The flavors are big but very pretty. Imported by European Cellars.
Name: Sadie Family 2005 Palladius White (Swartland)

Description: Lean, minerally, even a bit austere, this is the sort of crisp, mouthwatering drink that used to be more common in the Alsace section of retail shops.
