Appellation: Cerasuolo di Vittoria, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of cherry, berries and graham cracker; has red licorice and raspberry flavors, and a warm, balanced finish. This wine is well proportioned, with solid length, ample body and pleasant fruit.
Name: Romolo Buccellato 1999 Il Cigno Nero  (Cerasuolo di Vittoria)

Description: Mild toast aromas add a modern touch to this plump, viscous white that's built around a core of pear and lemon flavors. Seems as if it would be a good companion to oily Mediterranean fish dishes.
Name: Duca di Salaparuta 2001 Colomba Platino White (Sicilia)

Description: A wild blend of Grecanico, Chardonnay, Viognier, Sauvignon Blanc and Fiano, this is a crisp wine with a spicy character and rich tropical fruit.
Name: Planeta 2002 La Segreta White (Sicilia)

Description: Rich, thick with plenty of nutty notes balanced against melon and peach pit. Finish brings almond flavors to the fore.
Name: Cusumano 2002 Angimbé White (Sicilia)

Description: High-altitude vineyards in central Sicily yield a finely concentrated wine, with fruit aromas and crisp, green fruit.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2002 Leone d'Almerita White (Sicilia)

Description: This wine has smooth, creamy flavors with just a touch of toast. A floral, fruity blend of Inzolia and Catarratto grapes.
Name: Duca di Salaparuta 2002 Colomba Platino White (Sicilia)

Description: An interesting blend of Carricante and Albanello, with pungent, smoky aromas that also bear some resemblance to brie cheese mold. Flavors are reminiscent of apple, melon and pear.
Name: Gulfi 2000 Caricanti White (Sicilia)

Description: A blend of Ansonica and Catarratto, this wine has green, crisp, fresh fruit. But is not lightweight, powering fruit and creamy ripe flavors.
Name: Donnafugata 2002 Anthìlia White (Sicilia)

Description: Attractively fresh, perfumed wine with a light tropical fruit flavor giving crispness, acidity and a clean, elegant aftertaste.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2002 Regaleali Bianco White (Sicilia)

Description: The letter “j” in the name is pronounced as an “i”, but refers to the Arabic history of the estate. The wine is weighty and rich, but simple and neutral, with clean, fresh fruit flavors.
Name: Tenuta Rapitalà 2001 Casalj White (Sicilia)

Description: A nosing delivers pure oak extract and lemon custard, all of which is confirmed by the “barrel fermented” notation on the label. Why so much wood as been thrown at this wine is a question worth asking. Heavy toast flavors dominate the palate and wood resin seems to be all that's left at the end. Obtuse and oaky, yet still fresh and round in the mouth.
Name: Izadi 2001 White (Rioja)

Description: A blend of local grapes, Inzolia, Catarratto and Grecanico, this wine has clean fresh fruit, simple crisp apple flavors and light acidity at the end.
Name: Corvo 2002 Bianco White (Sicilia)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 77% Sémillon and 23% Sauvignon Blanc; a rich, oaky, barrel-fermented style with plenty of palate weight. The alcohol remains below 14%, so the wine is balanced and refreshing despite its size. Offers herbs, figs and melons, with a hint of clover.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2001 Charbonneau Blanc Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Flowery and fresh, with apricot, peach and nectarine on a nose that deals nothing but clear fruit and lots of class. The palate is perfect in its simplicity; there's neither too much oak nor too little. The flavor profile, meanwhile, is basic but delectable, and the finish is full of drive, peach essence, black licorice and cinnamon spice. A stately treat that treads lightly enough.
Name: Château La Nerthe 2001 Blanc White (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Fragrant for sure, with lovely floral and pine notes. The apple and pear fruit snaps and pops across your palate, dealing clean flavors and cleansing acids in abundance. The finish is compact, and thus everything is in its proper place. A nicely done wine with all parts melded and working in unison. In a word, it's complete. Best Buy.
Name: Perrin & Fils 2001 Reserve White (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Creamy and chunky on the nose, with ripe fruit aromas and notes of baked apples. Flavors of banana, toasted hazelnuts and citrus pith carry the palate, which leads into a finish that features peach, more citrus pith and some sweet butter. With plenty of drive, this is lively for certain, but it's also on the fat, plump side of things.
Name: Château de Beaucastel 2000 Coudoulet de Beaucastel White (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Côtes du Luberon, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Out of the blocks, there's some corn and butterscotch aromas that seem a bit off the mark. In the mouth, there's a creaminess that brings with it flavors of just-ripe cantaloupe and vanilla. The finish is creamy, smooth and soft, but at the same time it's flavorless and kind of dull. Vague notes of white pepper and apple round out the package.
Name: Château Val Joanis 2001 Estate Bottled White (Côtes du Luberon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Already a deep gold, with hints of brown and oxidative scents of hay and honey. The mix is 55% Roussanne, 10% Viognier and 35% Chardonnay.
Name: Austin Robaire 2001 Charmaine Angela White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Spicy, with raspberry and spearmint aromas. Shows cranberry and plum skin on the palate, which is lean and lacking in the texture category. Gets better with airing, but still shows some bitterness on the finish and not much in the middle.
Name: Val d'Orbieu 2001 Les Deux Rives Blanc White (Corbières)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: An odd mix of butterscotch, grapefruit and celery aromas doesn't prepare you for the sweet and chewy palate that's loaded with apple-like fruit and plenty of citrus and melon. Lacks refinement but is generous with the sugary fruit.
Name: Cote Tariquet 2001 White (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne

Description: Lean and lemony, this blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Gris and Müller-Thurgau displays a sharply focused, linear personality that would make it a fit partner with raw shellfish.
Name: Schubert 2000 Tribianco White (New Zealand)

Description: Grassy to the point of excess, this wine's lean, herbal flavors and lemony acids are tart and mouthpuckering.
Name: Woollaston 2001 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

Description: Floral and fresh, with a supercharged personality and plenty of sugary sweetness. On the plus side, it's racy and lithe, and that's despite being as candied as it is. But ask yourself, what's not to like about lemon-lime and apple? And when there's smoothness and palate feel thrown in, you wind up with a warm-weather winner.
Name: Parxet 2002 Marques de Alella Clasico White (Alella)

Description: Pine needle, lilac and some musk on the nose. Citrus is the driving force from then on. There's tangerine and some melon for flavor, and plenty or orange and passion fruit on the finish. A drink-now citrus ball that's full and flavorful.
Name: Torres 2002 Viña Sol White (Penedès)

Description: This funky white blend, now in its 6th rendition, carries no vintage or regional designation, but we know it's a blend of several white grapes grown mostly in Oregon. The nose is ripe and full of melon, while the spunky palate deals orange and lemon, but not in sour-ball fashion. The finish has some thickness and a slight sticky feel, but ample acidity throughout renders it a good, brisk drink.
Name: Sokol Blosser NV Evolution 6th Edition White (Oregon)

Description: Some caramel and candied fruit goes well with the flowery element on the bouquet. In the mouth, lime, peach and mineral run the show. After that comes a clean, light finish with just a hint of stone-fruit flavor. A good mouthfeel ensures that this will be a decent wine for trout caught during the summer.
Name: Montecillo 2002 White (Rioja)

Description: This wine, which takes the family name of Franz Haas's wife, is an extraordinary blend of 50% Riesling, 20% Chardonnay, 20% Traminer and 10% Sauvignon Blanc. And yet these disparate elements come together into a harmonious, ripe wine, with just a hint of toast from the barrel-fermented Chardonnay. It is powerful, rich and complex.
Name: Franz Haas 2001 Manna Bianco di Mitterberg White (Alto Adige)

Description: Not your grandmother's Soave, this is fully loaded, from its charming, fresh aromas of peaches and orange blossoms to its plump, fleshy flavors of stone fruits. And it's all backed by bracing acidity that keeps the ripe flavors lively right through the long, minerally finish. Editors' Choice.
Name: Pieropan 2001 Calvarino  (Soave Classico Superiore)

Description: From a single vineyard's old vines, here is a full, very rich wine, packed with flavors of almonds and ripe nuts. Layers of wood give it a toasty character, but never one that dominates the quality fruit.
Name: Gini 2001 Contrada Salavrenza Vecchie Vigne  (Soave Classico Superiore)

Description: Roberto Anselmi has quit the Soave DOC, but continues to make some of the best wines in the area. This is full of ripe and light acidity, aromas of spring flowers and fresh garden scents and a finish of aniseed and almonds.
Name: Anselmi 2001 Capitel Croce White (Delle Venezie)

Description: Full of the concentration lacking in so many Soaves, this single-vineyard wine is intense, with ripe toast and nut flavors. The fruit has a touch of honeyed botrytis, balanced with a light layer of acidity.
Name: Inama 2001 Vigneti di Foscarino  (Soave Classico Superiore)

Description: Shows a rich blend of citrus and stone fruits on the nose and on the palate, easily combining grapefruit, passion fruit and nectarines into a cohesive package. Finishes long, with tangy, lip-smacking acids that beg you to give this wine some time in the cellar. It's tasty now, but should be better in 2005.
Name: Jermann 2001 Vintage Tunina White (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Aromas of ripe pears and peaches jump out of the glass, and the flavors follow suit, bouncing across the palate in a display of stone fruits. It's relatively full bodied, but a garnish of grapefruit zest on the finish keeps it balanced and lively. Best Buy.
Name: Pieropan 2001  Soave Classico Superiore

Description: Elena Walch's fantasy wine is a blend of Chardonnay and four other varieties that she does not reveal. Eighteen months in oak give the wine a fine, toasty character and creamy fruit, but still leaves the hallmark Alto Adige crispness and freshness.
Name: Elena Walch 2001 Beyond the Clouds White (Alto Adige)

Description: This wine is the white partner to Masi's familiar Campfiorin. In this case, it is the 25% of Verduzzo grapes in the blend that have gone through the drying process known as passito. The 75% of Pinot Grigio adds spice, while the Verduzzo gives great richness and ripeness.
Name: Masi 2002 Masianco White (Delle Venezie)

Description: From a single vineyard, this exemplary Soave has great intensity and concentration, with flavors of peppers and ripe, green fruits. The wine's long fermentation wine gives it structure and great extraction of flavor.
Name: Gini 2001 La Froscà  (Soave Classico)

Description: This blend of 65% Chardonnay and 35% of the Soave grape Garganega is aged in French oak for 10 months. The result is rich, spicy and toasty, with soft vanilla flavors and concentrated green plum and almond flavors from the fruit.
Name: Bertani 2001 Le Lave White (Delle Venezie)

Description: Pieropan's La Rocca distinguishes itself from the Calvarino bottling by firmer structure and greater ageability. Tasted in spring 2003, this effort still has plenty of life left. Mimics Sauvignon a little in its gooseberry and red-currant flavors and grapefruity acidity.
Name: Pieropan 2000 La Rocca  (Soave Classico Superiore)

Description: This blend of Pinot Bianco, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Riesling starts off with barrel-fermented notes of butter and baked apples, then folds in tropical fruit flavors. But for all its buttery ripeness, it avoids going over the top, and finishes long, with lemony acids holding its components together.
Name: Masottina 1999 Vigneto Rizzardo White (Colli di Conegliano)

Appellation: Friuli Venezia Giulia, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: A blend of Tocai Friulano, Pinot Bianco, Sauvignon and Malvasia, this crisp, fresh wine has elegant, refreshing acidity, flavors of white currants and lychees and a soft, ripe aftertaste.
Name: Mario Schiopetto 2001 Blanc des Rosis White (Friuli Venezia Giulia)

Description: Offers soft, ripe fruit, powered with acidity and flavors of hazelnuts and ripe apples. A touch of caramel completes the wine's complexity.
Name: Inama 2001  Soave Classico Superiore

Description: This huge, ripe wine is packed with sweet fruit and a sense of structure. It is concentrated and intense and has good aging potential for the next four or five years.
Name: Anselmi 2002 San Vincenzo White (Delle Venezie)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Tocai Friulano and Ribolla Gialla give this wine attractive floral aromas and full flavors of tropical fruits (lychees?), while the Sauvignon Blanc in the blend provides grapefruity notes that perfectly balance the effusiveness of the other varieties.
Name: Le Due Terre 2000 Sacrisassi Bianco White (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Description: This single-vineyard wine blends 60% Pinot Bianco with 30% Chardonnay, plus smaller amounts of Sauvignon Blanc and Riesling. Complex flavors come from this blend and from the wood aging, giving a wine that is rich and ripe with acidity at the same time.
Name: J. Hofstatter 2002 Barthenau Vigna San Michele White (Alto Adige)

Description: A blend of Malvasia, Riesling and Tocai Friulano, the name of the wine means flowers of the grapes. It is a deliciously aromatic wine, spicy, perfumed, with flavors of honey and citrus. Light acidity at the end stops it being too over the top.
Name: Vie di Romans 2001 Flors di Uis White (Friuli Isonzo)

Description: A fresh, crisp style of Soave, brimming with green plum and light acidity. It has concentration and a light touch in equal measure.
Name: Gini 2002 Classico  (Soave)

Description: This blend of Chardonnay, Nosiola and Pinot Bianco offers up apples and cream on the nose, along with flavors of peach and citrus. It's a comfortable mix of fruit that finishes lively and fresh, making it a fine apéritif.
Name: La Vis 2001 Bianco dei Sorni White (Trentino)

Description: A fresh, tangy, vibrant wine that has ripe green plum and apple flavors alongside a layer of full, forward fruit.
Name: Zenato 2001 Vigneto Massoni White (Naoussa)

Description: A blend of grapes, so maybe it is not surprising that the aromas and flavors are a blend: melons, pears and limes, all presented with great freshness and verve alongside a rich texture. Editors' Choice.
Name: Cantina Terlano 2002 Terlano Classico White (Alto Adige)

Description: It's testament to this wine's balance that it remains so alive and fresh long after many other Biancos have faded. Intensely mineral aromas mix with notes of smoke and fresh apples; the flavors are earthy and hint at mineral oil. Long on the finish. Best Buy.
Name: Fratelli Zeni 2000 Vigne Alte  (Bianco di Custoza)

Description: This is the first vintage of this blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Grigio and Sauvignon Blanc, named after the 16th-century abbess Rylint Formentini. Peppery in character, with rich, complex fruit, it has citric flavors, along with a sense of structure and acidity.
Name: Conti Formentini 2001 Rylint White (Collio)

Description: This blended white combines Tocai Friulano (60%) with Pinot Bianco (25%) and Pinot Grigio (15%) in a tasty, corpulent wine well worth its modest price. Bold flavors of oranges, pink grapefruits and ripe cherries mingle in the mouth; the only quibble is that it finishes a little short.
Name: Maculan 2002 Pino & Toi White (Veneto)

Description: A soft, almond-flavored wine that has fresh, green and ripe fruit. The blend, with small amounts of Chardonnay and Trebbiano, gives a feeling of fullness and roundness and is already ready for drinking.
Name: Bertani 2002  Soave Classico Superiore

Description: An easy, full-flavored wine, with crisp, clean fruit, flavors of almonds and a touch of soft,ripeness.
Name: Masi 2002 Classico  (Soave)

Description: This wine from the shores of Lake Garda has fresh, attractively crisp fruit, and a touch of acidity over some broad, food-friendly fruit.
Name: Zenato 2002 San Benedetto  (Lugana)

Description: Toasty, buttery and spicy, this blend's aromas and flavors are heavily influenced by barrique. So if you are oak-averse, be warned. The lavish wood is adequately supported by a wine that has good weight and density but doesn't contribute much additional flavor.
Name: Jermann 2000 Capo Martino in Ruttaris White (Venezia Giulia)

Appellation: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: In general, we love Felluga's wines. So why the modest score on the winery's top white? One simple word: oak. With this wine's buttery, oaky aromas and flavors of peach, cinnamon and brown sugar, it could pass for a decent Chardonnay. But this blend of Tocai Friulano, Pinot Bianco and Sauvignon Blanc from a great producer should do so much more.
Name: Livio Felluga 2000 Terre Alte - Rosazzo Bianco White (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

Description: Buttery and richly oaked, with some apple and pear flavors underneath, this wine is okay—if you're okay with oaky wines. Finishes with a torrent of vanilla flavors.
Name: Astoria 2000 White (Colli di Conegliano)

Description: A 50-50 blend of Pinot Grigio and Sauvignon Blanc that's crisp and ripe, and offers a touch of spice. A lovely, fresh, green wine.
Name: Bertani 2002 Due Uve White (Delle Venezie)

Description: A pleasant, lemon-and-lime white, best with light fish dishes. Unlike most of its brethren, which are ready to go from the moment they're opened, this one has some burnt-matchstick aromas that need time and aeration to dissipate. Try decanting.
Name: Provenza 2001 White (Naoussa)

Description: A reasonably full-bodied Soave, with delicate aromas of acacia blossoms and limes giving way to sturdy pear flavors. The lemony finish will seem shrill to some, pleasantly cleansing to others.
Name: Bolla 2000 Tufaie  (Soave Classico Superiore)

Description: Much riper, fatter and fuller-bodied than most Luganas, this offering boasts grapefruit and passion fruit aromas nicely balanced by sweet pear and melon flavors. Finishes short.
Name: Tommasi 2001 Vigneto San Martino  (Lugana)

Description: This blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Bianco is dark-gold in color, with citrus and green apple aromas that get riper as the wine gradually warms in the glass, eventually developing peach overtones. Flavors are of buttered stone fruits. Drink up.
Name: Villa Sandi 2000 Marinali Bianco White (Marca Trevigiana)

Description: Tropically fruity and plump, with some banana and custard aromas and flavors--also some tapioca and vanilla. Finishes with a refreshing citrus edge.
Name: Anselmi 2001 San Vincenzo White (Veneto)

Description: An immediately attractive, quaffable wine with clean, fresh flavors. This is a light, fresh wine designed to go with summer foods.
Name: Zonin 2002 Classico  (Soave)

Description: This blend is very light in color and similarly shy on the nose, where it takes coaxing to find some citrus fruits and dried spices. Tastes like mixed citrus, but folds in a dash of cherry juice as well
Name: Luna Di Luna 2002 White (Veneto)

Description: A surprisingly poor showing from this normally reliable winery, the 2000 Classico, a blend of Pinot Bianco, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc, shows some lemony aromas, a plump, custardy mouthfeel and a tangy finish.
Name: Cantina Terlano 2000 Classico White (Alto Adige)

Description: Heavy and alcoholic in the mouth, with aromas of fresh corn husks and limes. Tastes simple, with hints of oranges, and finishes short.
Name: Furlan 2000 Cuvee Tai White (Friuli)

Description: A light spritz gives this wine some of the character of club soda and lime, with a slight brinyness to add interest.
Name: Quinta da Aveleda NV Casal Garcia White (Vinho Verde)

Description: Some faintly floral aromas and a hint of baking soda add interest to simple lemon-lime flavors. Turns watery on the finish.
Name: Soldo 2000  Soave

Description: Light, with simple pineapple flavors. Hints of green tea enliven the nose, while the finish is clean and citrusy.
Name: Bolla 2001  Soave

Description: The nose is barrel heavy, and it brings with it some mustard and cured-meat aromas that just don't cut it. This is a blend of Chardonnay, Viognier and Sauvignon Gris, but frankly, it doesn't taste like much more than oaky white wine, though the texture and overall acidity are fine.
Name: Casa Silva 2001 Quinta Generacion White (Colchagua Valley)
Tommasi 2001 Vigneto Le Volpare  (Soave Classico Superiore)

Description: Light and citrusy, blending limes with green herbs, and finishes on a chalky note. Might work well with herbed, pan-roasted trout or similar dishes.
Name: Tenuta Roveglia 2000 Vigne di Catullo  (Lugana)

Description: Some mint and licorice to the nose along with talcum powder render it unusual. The palate delivers a heavy load of sweet banana and papaya, but also a strong hint of green. The finish is on the sweet and thick side, and overall things seem a bit flat and unexciting. —M.S.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2002 Elsa Semillon-Chardonnay

Description: Bright yellow in color, with a heavy scoop of honey, cream and overripe tropical fruit to the nose. The flavors are dull and a little bit vegetal. Not flawed but not inspiring. Even worse, it tastes old. –M.S.
Name: Alta Vista 2000 Cosecha White (Mendoza)

Description: If this isn't one of the best bubblies in Spain, then what is? It gets no dosage, so what you taste is just the natural flavor of top-shelf Macabeo, Xarello and Parellada—aged four plus years on its yeast. The flavors are pure light citrus and tropical fruit along with some toast and cream. The finish is persistent, the mouthfeel ethereal. Editors' Choice. —M.S.
Name: Agustí Torelló 1997 Kripta Extra Brut White (Penedès)

Description: Firm, bone-dry and alluring, this elegant bubbly features a stylish mix of crisp green fruits and bracing stone and mineral flavors. Steely and citric in the mouth, it's tautly strung through a poised, well-balanced finish.
Name: Pierre Sparr NV Brut Réserve White (Alsace)

Description: The soft, attractive mildly yeasty nose leads into a pear-and-apple palate with shades of vanilla. The grapes for this wine come from vines that are at least 30 years old, and because of that there's richness and depth not offered by most other cavas. On the finish, sublime notes of melon and papaya are present. This could be Torelló's most elegant cava. —M.S.
Name: Agustí Torelló 1998 Gran Reserva Extra Brut White (Penedès)

Description: This reserve-level Prosecco strikes all the right chords. The nose is dry and, at first, chalky. With time it opens up nicely, leading to a palate full of orange, melon and other citrus. The sweet, sassy finish is just right. Overall it's quite a well-rounded wine that plays a merry tune. —M.S.
Name: Villa Sandi NV Cuvee Prosecco  (Prosecco di Valdobbiadene)

Description: Very toasty aromas, with scents of baked apples and honey. The wine seems slightly overdone, maybe a tad overripe. You get that from the mushroom and heavy apple flavors on the palate. And the finish is hot. However, with nothing terribly off, the wine is solid. —M.S.
Name: La Scolca NV Soldati LaScolca Brut  (Gavi)

Description: Peppy, even peppery, aromas get it going in a decidedly nonblowsy way. Apple fruit follows, but beyond some basic crisp, acid-driven flavor, there isn't much nuance. The finish is surprisingly smooth, while the mouthfeel and bead are active. Tasty and satisfying. —M.S.
Name: Castellblanch NV Extra Brut White (Cava)

Description: An initial look at the yellow color and faint bead isn't very encouraging, and frankly speaking, neither is the heavy vanilla and bread dough nose. But if you give it time and dig deep, there's a mature character, spiced pear and baked apples. Yes, it's ponderous and won't be for everyone. But you sort of get the idea that Parxet is trying for its own style. —M.S.
Name: Parxet NV Brut Reserva White (Cava)

Description: Clean, simple and fresh, with aromatic notes of vanilla and milk chocolate. The palate is dry like club soda, with white grapefruit and tangerine flavors fighting to rise upward. It's sort of bland, but also sort of good. Fine at cocktail parties. —M.S.
Name: Parxet NV Cuvee 21 - Brut White (Cava)

Description: This bubby isn't technically cava, but it tastes a lot like standard cava. It's heady and yeasty, with dusty popcorn and bread dough aromas. The lemony palate is on the thin side, as is the tight, lean finish. A decent palate prep or cleanser, depending on how you approach it. —M.S.
Name: Viña Carossa NV Brut White (Spain)

Description: The bouquet is rubbery and the palate quite sweet. It has a good feel to it, but the flavors are drastically sweet, which overrides the balance it offers. Definitely for fans of  sweet white wines. —M.S.
Name: Castellblanch NV Cristal - Semiseco White (Cava)

Description: To prove that white Bordeaux can age as well as white Burgundy, here comes André Lurton with his wood-aged Château Bonnet. It's a finely made wine, with well-judged wood and ripe, but crisp fruit. It's certainly young at the moment and will repay aging for five years.
Designation: Vinifie en Futs de Chene Entre deux Mers
Name: Château Bonnet 2001 Vinifie en Futs de Chene Entre deux Mers  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This has all the grassiness of the Sauvignon Blanc combined with the fatness of the Sémillon. It's a big, rich wine with hints of ripe herbs and kiwi fruit. It grabs your attention from the first toasty aromas to the crisp finish.
Name: Château Bel Air Perponcher 2000 Bordeaux Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A fresh, full-bodied wine that stays on its lees after fermentation to give it a creamy broadness to go with the layer of acidity and ripe, crisp fruit.
Name: Domaine de Courteillac 2001 Bordeaux Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A big, concentrated wine that is almost New World in its rich flavors, and ripe, toasty fruit. Bruno Baylet, whose family owns this property, has a love of experimenting with different woods, and it shows in the complexity of the flavors.
Name: Château l'Hoste-Blanc 2000 Bordeaux Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A delicious up-front style of wine, brimming with refreshing crisp, green fruit. Winemaker Francis Courselle believes the future of his part of Bordeaux (the Entre-deux-Mers) is in whites—and this easy wine proves the point.
Name: Château Thieuley 2001 Bordeaux Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: The more serious of Francis Courselle's whites is aged in wood. At the moment, the wood is too dominant, but it is still early days for this wine, which certainly needs aging. Richness combines with lemongrass flavors to suggest good fruit under the wood.
Name: Château Thieuley 2001 Cuvee Francis Courselle Bordeaux Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: With his almost half-and-half blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon, Scotsman Esme Johnstone has produced a ripe, modern, fruity wine, with a light touch of oak to round out the fruit and its balancing acidity.
Name: Château de Sours 2000 Bordeaux Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: Any shellfish would be a great partner to this wine. It is full of ripe, citrus aromas while the palate has freshness, crispness and a refreshing green aftertaste.
Name: Château de Seguin 2001 Cuvee Prestige 2000 Bordeaux Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This beautifully stuctured wine is a blend of Chardonnay and Weissburgunder. Sweet, but with great acidity and lovely ripe fruit flavors, it is the delicious quintessence of sweet wines, balancing honeyed flavors with dry botrytis.
Name: Feiler-Artinger 1999 Ruster Ausbruch Essenz White (Burgenland)

Description: A blend of Weissburgunder, Grauburgunder, Chardonnay and Neuburger produces high levels of fresh acidity that give the intense sweetness a lift. A poised, elegant wine with strong apricot flavors.
Name: Feiler-Artinger 1998 Ruster Ausbruch Pinot Cuvee White (Burgenland)

Description: Aromas of acidity and sweet fruits are immediately appealing. On the palate, there is a level of tension between tannins, sweetness and acidity that gives it great attraction. It lacks complexity, but is delicious.
Name: Helmut Lang 1999 Beerenauslese Samling 88 White (Neusiedlersee)

Description: A seductive nose of nectarine, quince and apricots. The mouthfeel is balanced, with high acidity and dried figs and plums.
Name: Samos 2000 Grand Cru Vin Doux Naturel White (Samos)

Description: A bouquet of flowers, rose petals and lavender with apricots and peaches. Slight effervescence on the palate with nut and orange-skin flavors. A light-bodied, clean wine that is excellent as an apéritif.
Name: Tselepos 2001 Moschofilero White (Mantinia)

Description: Made from Viura and Malvasia, this plump barrel-fermented white begins with refreshing, clean aromas of pear and apple. Similar flavors follow, and despite the barrel influence the oak flavor is nominal. The lengthy finish is lively but smooth. Its size, grip and balance are all just right.
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 2001 Antea White (Rioja)

Description: Here's a sweeter-style wine done well. It's 85% Moscatel; the remainder is Gewürztraminer. The aromas are hugely floral,   with warm honey nuances. Given the price, the fruit quality is exemplary, with clean flavors of citrus and lychee. The finish is surprisingly powerful and entirely fresh.
Name: Torres 2001 Vina Esmeralda White (Penedès)

Description: Light and simple, with indistinct aromas that carry a touch of honey. The wine is made from the Parellada grape, one of the components of Spanish cava. It features melon, apple and underripe banana flavors before a dry, smooth finish. It represents the epitome of a mellow and mild, but good white wine.
Name: Torres 2001 Vina Sol White (Penedès)

Description: This wine from Galicia blends together four different grapes, and the mix isn't exactly a bona fide hit. The aromas come across as being slightly artificial. Applesauce flavors come next, followed by a finish that's acidic but still like flat seltzer. This wine lacks freshness despite its youth.
Name: Emilio Rojo 2001 White (Ribeiro)

Description: There are intense aromas of vanilla and sweet fruits, while the palate is light and rather undefined, with some caramel flavors. It is opulently sweet, but one-dimensional.
Name: Helmut Lang 1997 Eiswein Cuvee White (Neusiedlersee)

Description: The FB stands for fermented in barrel, but everything about it is strange. The aromas are of wheat and creamed corn, while the flavors are at once citrusy and then, in the next moment, akin to pepper or chilies. The finish is slightly pickled and flat. This wine seems to have lost its verve, assuming it once had verve.
Name: Marqués del Puerto 2000 Cosecha 2000 White (Rioja)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 58% Viognier and 42% Chardonnay, making a crisp, clean, dynamic white with plenty of lime and citrus flavor. Delicious and refreshing, it's a perfect food wine.
Name: McCrea 2000 La Mer White (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This new Walla Walla winery premieres with a toasty, soft, barrel- fermented Bordeaux blanc blend that's 70% Sém, 30% Sauv Blanc. The fruit is ripe and packed with rich flavors, without being too fat and tropical. Its lightly herbal, grassy nuances combine with plenty of well-managed, pleasantly spicy, toasty oak.
Name: Buty 2000 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A dry style, tightly wound with hints of herb and spice. Simple, crisply rendered, and very fresh, with citrus-flavored fruit.
Name: Covey Run 2000 Semillon-Chardonnay (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend is 70% Pinot Gris and 30% Viognier. The Gris provides the fruit base, with pear/apple flavors; the Viognier adds some light lemon and citrus blossom accents. This is a big wine, bone dry.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2001 Pinot Gris-Viognier White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A mix of Sauvignon Blanc and Semillon. The two are blended and fermented together in barrels, from a vineyard east of Medford. The wine has pleasant herbal, grassy notes, and some very tart fruit.
Name: Siskiyou Vineyards 1999 La Cave Blanche White (Oregon)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Some nice toasty flavors underscore generic fruit. When all is said and done, it is a neutral, crisp white wine enlivened with a bit of spice and toast from the barrel aging. Still, a bit of veggie/canned pea flavor dampens the finish.
Name: Weisinger's of Ashland 1999 50% CH / 50% SEM Semillon-Chardonnay (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Name: Penfolds 2001 Rawson's Retreat Semillon-Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In this new vintage there is a bit more Sauvignon Blanc (69%) than usual; the rest is Sémillon. Rich, oaky and expansive, it is an oak and texture-driven style, with the fruit—clean, slightly herbaceous, spicy and tart—playing second fiddle. Which is no criticism, because the delicious, over-the-top flavors, with layer upon layer of creamy complexity, and the rich, buttery finish just beg for lobster in a cream or butter sauce. Who can argue with that? Editors' Choice.
Name: DeLille 2000 Chaleur Estate White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With its crisp fresh fruit and deliciously refreshing acidity, this wine from a small parcel of Condrieu owned by Domaine Gerin has a well-judged touch of wood, but is full of ripe white peach and spice flavors. When it has aged for a couple of years, it will be in peak condition.
Name: Domaine Jean-Michel Gerin 2000 La Loye  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Another stunning success for Hedges. This 52/48 blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay explodes from the glass with a heavenly bouquet of fresh, succulent pineapple/pear fruit. Intense and powerful, it continues with a gorgeous mouthfeel, creamy and bright, into a polished, rich finish. Best Buy.
Name: Hedges 2001 White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Named for the vineyard that sources the grapes, Woodward Canyon's Meritage white wine is 83% Semillon and 17% Sauvignon Blanc. Intensely aromatic, it smells of grass and herbs, tastes of citrus, apple, pineapple and apricot, and picks up texture and oak from barrel fermentation. Big, spicy, ripe and slightly hot, it's a no-holds-barred style for those who believe size counts.
Name: Woodward Canyon 2000 Charbonneau White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A roughly even (55/45) blend, this is a tasty, herbal style, with fresh gooseberry and lemon fruit. There's a nice kick to the mouthfeel and a vibrant, food-friendly finish. Best Buy.
Name: Washington Hills 2000 Semillon-Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A neutral white wine blend, from organically grown grapes. Simple and bland.
Name: Badger Mountain 2000 Seve White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This oddly packaged, nonvintage wine is a mongrel mix of nine different varietal grapes, and the result is a fragrant, citrus-flavored blend with all the appeal of a friendly new puppy. Juicy, lemony and bracing, it calls out for oysters, creamy pasta or anything in butter sauce. —P.G.
Name: Sokol Blosser NV Evolution - 5th Edition White (Oregon)

Description: This was one of the first attempts the Silvas made at a white blend (Chardonnay, Sauvignon Gris and Viognier), and it has some things going for it. The dry but pungent nose is intriguing, and the Sauvignon Gris is an unconventional Old World addition. Also, the full, creamy body makes it easy to drink. Overall, however, it's kind of nondescript. Expect more from the 2001 vintage.
Name: Casa Silva 2000 Quinta Generacion White (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend, 70/30, favors Sémillon over Chardonnay. A good thing, which makes for a distinctive, refreshing wine, not just a watered-down Chardonnay. There's a strong streak of fennel running through the clean, lemony fruit. Best enjoyed chilled, with shellfish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2000 Semillon-Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This low-alcohol (9%) Vinho Verde carries some obvious residual sugar, which in this case works well. Some lively upfront spritz is replaced by a respectable smoothness on the finish. And the acid structure is just right, as it keeps things tangy and lively. With a seafood salad at lunch, this would work perfectly.
Name: Vinhos Messias NV Santola White (Vinho Verde)

Description: Bical and Maria Gomes are the grapes. The aromas are floral, verging on Muscat- or Riesling-like. Flavors are green apple, pears, tropical fruit and tangerine, finishing spicy, with a hint of orange rind.
Name: Quinta d'Aguieira 2000 White (Beiras)

Description: Floral and pretty in the nose; this captures the spritzy Vinho Verde style to a tee. A lemony profile with vital acids makes this the right counterpart to crab, lobster or shrimp salad. It'll cut through the mayonnaise, augmenting the flavors of the sea.
Name: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia White (Vinho Verde)

Description: Pineapple and pear aromas lead into a ripe (for Vinho Verde) wine that at first seems a bit soft. Give it some time though, and a steely edge of lime-like acidity emerges, giving it just the requisite bite to cut through a plate of grilled sardines. A blend of Loureiro and Trajdura.
Name: Quinta da Aveleda 2000 Grinalda White (Vinho Verde)

Description: This is more or less a Douro Valley white made of Avessa and Chardonnay. It features some tangy fruit and a pleasant sweet almond core, but it seems to be losing its edge. At one moment it's fairly harmonious, but in the next moment it seems tired.
Name: Quinta de Covela 1999 Vinho Branco White (Portugal)

Description: Aromas of sweet vanilla, balanced by citrus. The palate is rich and creamy, but has delicious acidity underlying the strong new-wood flavors.
Name: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 1999 Montée de Tonnerre  (Chablis)

Description: Balanced wine, with a hint of wood just underlying and supporting the crisp, but creamy flavors and floral fruit. Spice and power at the end.
Name: Joseph Drouhin 1999 Marquis de Leguiche  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

Description: This tiny 5.6 acre white vineyard in the heart of the red wine village of Vougeot is owned entirely by the Boisset family's Domaine de la Vougeraie. The wine is deliciously ripe and open, with spice and nutmeg. There is a balancing touch of acidity, and sweet, almost tropical fruit. Smoky, spicy aftertaste.
Name: Domaine de la Vougeraie 1999 Le Clos Blanc de Vougeot  (Vougeot)

Description: Light and poised fruit, with a brightly perfumed aroma and a touch of fresh bread. There is a hint of grilled nuts along with fresh acidity and a fine structure.
Name: Louis Jadot 1998 Les Demoiselles  (Chevalier-Montrachet)

Description: Delicate but open wine, showing the soft but subtle side of Montagny. Flavors of almonds combine with a zesty edge and just a touch of honey. Delicious to drink now.
Name: Bouchard Père & Fils 1998 Premier Cru  (Montagny)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Muller-Thurgau can be a delight in Oregon, but it can also easily miss the mark. This spritzy, sweet wine seems to dance to its own drummer, and should probably be chilled and enjoyed as an aperitif rather than with a meal. It's clean, fresh and tastes of melon and pears.
Name: Henry Estate 2000 Muller Thurgau White (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A near 50/50 blend of Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc, this perennially popular wine is a perfect match for seafood, pasta, light cheeses and salads. It's an elegant, stylish wine, with clean, green apple flavors, a strong scent of lime, and a hint of pear. Gorgeous mouthfeel, with creamy, intense fruity, bright acids, and a polished, rich finish. Best Buy.
Name: Hedges 2000 White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: From a newly delimited region in Western Australia, this odd but likable blend offers aromas of hot candle wax, quince and pickled jalapeño peppers. Some pear fruit complements the spicy pepper notes. Finishes crisp.
Name: Killerby 1999 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Western Australia)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: The fresh peaches and pears tinged with citrus develop a slight bitterness on the finish that's something like the skin of an underripe peach. In this context, it's a pleasant flavor that gives structure and crispness to this bouncy, refreshing quaff.
Name: Baroncini 1999  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Hunter Valley, New South Wales, Australia
Description: Smells softer and rounder than it tastes, starting off with scents of pear, fig and melon that turn herbal and a bit medicinal on the palate. Finishes with palate-cleansing lemony acidity.
Name: Simon Gilbert 2000 Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Hunter Valley)

Description: Signs point to this wine being prematurely old, from its medium-straw color to its slightly varnishy aromas and tired, woody palate. Look for a more recent vintage, which may show more freshness and vitality.
Name: Tenuta Caparzo 1998 Le Crete White (Toscana)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a 60/40 blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon, barrel fermented in 100% new French oak and aged on the lees with occasional batonnage. This rich, expansive, elegant, bone-dry white wine has wonderful intensity and layer upon layer of subtle spice. Polished fruit, light herbs, a seamless mouthfeel and a creamy, structured finish make this wine just about perfect. It's built for medium term aging, but why wait?
Name: DeLille 1999 Chaleur Estate White Wine White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Charbonneau is Woodward Canyon's proprietary name for its white and red blended wines. The blanc is predominantly Sémillon, with 10% Sauvignon Blanc added to round it out. The nose is scented with freshly mown hay, spice and herbs. It has plenty of crisp fruit in the mouth, and a distinctive spiciness that begs to be paired with Thai food,  crab cakes or something with cilantro. Great food wine.
Name: Woodward Canyon 1999 Charbonneau Blanc White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This is a 50/50 blend, made in a fruity, forward style. It smells of green berries and pears, and has an edgy crispness that will set up nicely with food. The finish is a bit astringent, dusty, herbaceous, and suggests fresh spices and new-mown hay. The Chardonnay half of the equation adds some tart, green apple fruit.
Name: San Juan Vineyards 1999 Semillon-Chardonnay (Washington)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A kitchen-sink blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Blanc, Sauvignon Blanc and Gewürztraminer, this wine showcases a rich combination of tropical fruit, pear and pink grapefruit with grassy overtones and just a hint of toast.
Name: Palmer 1998 Select Reserve White (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: An intensely lemony wine that folds in some pear aromatics. Quite full on the palate and yet very fresh, clean and citrusy; tailor-made for the region's shellfish.
Name: Martha Clara 1999 Semillon-Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A blended white, but predominantly-you guessed it-Chardonnay.  The soft, sweet pear aromas and flavors are simple and clean, making this a decent quaffer on a hot summer day.
Name: Castello di Borghese NV Chardonette White (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: With a nose of spicy green herbs—notably tarragon—and flavors of lemon and pink grapefruit, this no-nonsense blend of 50% Sauvignon Blanc and 50% Sémillon goes down easy and clean. The crisp finish is a good palate-cleanser.
Name: Marquis de Chasse 1999 Reserve  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: This one comes from the Mouton branch of the Rothschilds. Showing its age a bit already, with mature apple and wood varnish aromas that perk up a bit on the palate, where they pick up some attractive lemon nuances.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 1998  Graves

Description: A famous old brand that seems to be living off past glory, this year's edition is quite neutral in aroma and flavor; you have to work to pick out some mild herb and citrus, but it does show a nice spicy, green-peppercorn character on the finish.
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 1999 Mouton Cadet  (Bordeaux Blanc)

Description: A white this age should be fresh and crisp; this one is a bit dull and shows only faint bitter lemon flavors on the finish to go with tired apple aromas.
Name: Seigneurs de Bergerac 1999 White (Bergerac)

Description: A 75-25 blend that showcases the exotic lychee and pear aromas of Gewürz, while the Riesling asserts itself on the finish in a rush of bracing lime-like acidity. A unique blend that offers plenty of food-pairing versatility.
Name: Miguel Torres 2000 Don Miguel Gewürztraminer-Riesling (Curicó Valley)

Description: Features citrus-flower and lime aromas. Lightweight, and with a slight spritz, this is a correct and refreshing Vinho Verde, with tart lime and quartz-mineral elements. A blend of 95% Alvarinho and 5% Trajadura.
Name: Quintas de Melgaço 1998 Torre de Menagem White (Vinho Verde)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend is about two-thirds Pinot Gris and one-third Viognier. Pretty orange-blossom scents lead it off, and it has good acid balance and lots of lemony fruit. Yet it still feels like two separate wines coming together. Spice and pear flavors open up in the glass with a little swirling.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 1999 Pinot Gris - Viognier White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Typical Loire aromas of grass, wet stone and grapefruit are marred a bit by sulfur, which could liberally be read as minerals. On the palate, it's lean and trim, yet lively. A light chalky sensation on the back end adds texture.
Name: Domaine des Berthiers 1998 Pouilly Fume  (Pouilly-Fumé)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This winning  blend is 70% Sémillon, the least appreciated of Washington white wines. It's a nice idea, taking the woolly, herbal Sémillon fruit and adding the broadstroke, friendly flavors of Chardonnay. The result is a user-friendly white wine that's a cut above generic versions of either grape.
Name: Columbia Crest 1998 White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Citrus fruits and figs are backed with a healthy dose of acidity in this somewhat tart offering.
Name: Covey Run 1998 White (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: The Aussies like to mix and match their white grapes: Here it's Sémillon, Sauvignon Blanc, and Chardonnay in descending amounts, and with great results. Pleasant and floral-smelling, with just a whiff of enticing mint or grass. In the mouth, it's the all-out fruit-bowl approach, with lime and peach most vivid. Juicy, clean, acidic and fresh. A perfect apéritif wine. Best Buy.
Name: Wirra Wirra 1999 Scrubby Rise White (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: An interesting mix is at work here: You get the Chardonnay body and pear flavors and some nuttiness from the 60% Sémillon. Quite a straight-ahead wine, with more neutrality than nuance; the flavor profile ultimately veers toward citrus and almond. Overall it's forward and clean-tasting, with enough creaminess to satisfy.
Name: McPherson Wine Company 1999 White (South Eastern Australia)

Description: An only-in-California blend of barrel-fermented and oak-aged Chenin Blanc, Viognier and Roussanne that features creamy vanilla accents over the melon-like fruit flavors. Plump and pretty, with some interesting spice notes as well.
Name: Vinum Cellars 1998 Pointe Blanc White (California)

Description: Honeysuckle, butter, and cream on a French-oak-driven nose. The palate is soft and round, with a defined lemon underbelly and more buttery oak. To mix Sémillon, Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay with this much oak and California style is commendable, even if the end result is a little strange. A pleasant, rewarding wine.
Name: Beringer 1997 Alluvium Blanc White (Knights Valley)

Description: A wine made entirely from Viura, it's got a soda-like leanness with touches of slate and stone topped off by distant citrus. Only a modicum of pineapple and lime can be found on the crisp, acidic palate. Finishes long and strong, with a bitter-almond and lime edge. Very fresh, though not very fruity
Name: Marqués de Cáceres 1999 White (Rioja)

Description: Solid and correct, with a buttery feel that's balanced off by crisp fruit and lively acids. In these days of so many marginal négociant wines, this one can hold its head high. Shows plenty of clean lemon and citrus flavor, glycerin and backbone.
Name: Jaffelin 1997  Meursault

Description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Pinot Blanc and Riesling is the winery's signature cuvée, and the unusual amalgam holds together well. Appley fruit and a good dose of citrus rind. Minerally and almost metallic, you can't beat the ripeness of fruit. Long on the finish, if ever so slightly tart.
Name: Cantina Terlano 1997 Classico White (Alto Adige)

Description: Clove and cinnamon predominate on the nose, giving a poached pear-baked apple impression. A bit alcoholic (16.3%) in the mouth. Unique and interesting; worth a try for curiosity's sake. Consists of 69% Montonico and 31% Orange Muscat, fortified and infused with orange peel, lemon peel, cinnamon and clove.
Name: Ca' del Solo NV Club Montonico White (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Some lactic/cheesy aromas mar the nose of this blend of botrytized Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc. The ripe-cheese notes persist on the palate and into the finish. Odd on its own, it might show better paired with roquefort, à la Sauternes.
Name: Topolos 1997 Dulce D'Oro White (Russian River Valley)

Description: At 87% Chenin and the rest Viognier, you will find bright, melony fruit that comes across sweet and sturdy. Chenin makes a fruitier, simpler alternative with its fuller body and texture, yet this one shows no oak influence. Crisp as a whistle, the Viognier provides aroma and a more intense fruit character. Refreshing at only 11.8% alcohol.
Name: Pine Ridge 1998 White (California)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Dry and minerally, yet a lot of depth for a crisp white. Viognier and Colombard team up with Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc, for a harmonious commingling of lavender, licorice and white peaches. Tastes sweet upfront, with more dry citrus and complexity on the back.
Name: Jepson 1998 Feliz Creek Cuvée White (Mendocino County)

Description: One of southern Italy's oldest white grapes comes bursting to life in this nutty, lemony, honey-tinged winner that's a little like Tocai Friulano at its best. It goes like your hand in a glove when served with grilled octopus over braised radicchio.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 1998 Falanghina White (Campania)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: A blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Blanc, Pinot Meunier and—most of all—toasty vanilla-tinged oak. Too bad, as the wine has a luscious mouthfeel and decent acidity. Under the wood are some nice orange and citrus flavors, partially redeeming it.
Name: Imagery 1997 White Burgundy White (North Coast)

Description: A step up from this producer's rather pedestrian Vaillons premier cru, this bottling offers pleasant but reserved aromas of slate and stone fruits. Some appley fruit pops on first impression, but then retreats, leaving an almondy, minerally finish. A nice enough wine that provokes more praise than complaints, but it's a bit tough to swallow at this hefty price.
Name: Albert Pic 1997 Grenouilles  (Chablis)

Description: From an 18th-century Chablis house now owned by Loire-based Ladoucette, this is a typically chalky, dry white highlighted by very clear but lean, lemony fruit. A little bread dough marks the nose along with notes of pineapple. A well-bred wine that's young and tight. Steely and full of grapefruit; fresh and simple at this point in time, it may improve with age.
Name: Albert Pic 1997 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

Description: All crispness and bitter almonds rolled into a coat of green-apple flavor. A slight green quality, too. Minerally and racy like Chablis should be, it is has a lean, mineral-tinged finish. Warms up after a while, but holds onto its flinty, somewhat ungenerous personality.
Name: Albert Pic 1997 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

Description: One of the better American-French hybrid blends on the market, this wine shows some apple aromas, melon and fig fruit, a slight almond character, and a long, spicy finish. A blend of Seyval, Vidal and Vignoles.
Name: Chaddsford 1997 Proprietors Reserve White (Pennsylvania)

Description: A crisp, fruity blend of Seyval, Vidal, Vignoles and Riesling. Made in an off-dry style, with an emphasis on simple apple and peach flavors. Serve well chilled as an aperitif or with light lunch in the garden.
Name: Chaddsford 1998 Spring Wine White (Pennsylvania)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Gold color. The floral and spicy nose shows quince and peach-pie notes. Syrupy sweet, with a slight metallic tang - like the canned peaches mom used to pack for school lunch. A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Gewürztraminer that doesn't quite come together on the palate.
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 1996 Finale White Dessert Wine White (North Fork of Long Island)
